I came back to review this because it reminds me of colognes I just got this year 2018, ADP Ginepro and Tom Ford Fougere Argent. How the hell did they discontinue this??? If you can find a sample or the original buy it you'll see what im talking about. Acqua Di parma masters of perfumery

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Cipresso di Toscana Acqua di Parma
review_content:
To me, as a women, Cipresso di Toscana feels like an olfactory equivalent of boyfriend jeans (which are no favorite of mine, but that's not the point I want to make).
This is unisex and has notes that are typically used in male fragrances. But they're blended into something smooth, light and slightly sweet that would never feel like I've doused myself in my boyfriend's cologne. It feels soothing and natural. So, it's easy to wear even for women who don't usually like masculine scents, but I could imagine that it also smells very nice on men.

This has nice aromatic notes. A coniferous opening, lavender, fresh herbs and spices. Later in the drydown it's a bit woody. I'm kind of surprised there is not a single sweeter note listed, maybe it's just my skin, but on me the base definitely smells a bit vanillic and warm besides the refreshing and herbal notes.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Cipresso di Toscana Acqua di Parma
review_content: This has NOTHING to do with Chanel Egoiste Plat. Please. Wonderful fragrance and It will be re-launched soon as per ADP sales associate. Good news !

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Cipresso di Toscana Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Perfect fresh and masculen scent. Its kind of chanel egoist platinum but Toscana is more natural. Cypress and levander top and bottom notes. There are not many examples similar scent like this. Therefore if you want to fresh and everyone likes, you can buy this absolutely. Longevity quite poor unfortunately.
If you want more longevity you selection must be chanel egoist platinum.


Scent: 9/10
Long: 6/10
Sillage: 7/10

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Cipresso di Toscana Acqua di Parma
review_content: This was my first Acqua di Parma, and still the only one I own a full bottle. I remember that first I wished it could be a bit less bold on aplication, but I don't mind it anymore, the scent isn't actually heavy in anyway. I like the green tone of it, feels natural to me and with a good balance of those green notes, which are of my liking. Unfortunatelly, has an average longevity, around 4 hs and then becomes essentially a skin scent. No doubt is the most masculine Blue Mediterraneo I know. Discontinued by now ":¬/.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Cipresso di Toscana Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I've tried the majority of the Blu Mediterraneo line by now, and so far there hasn't been a single one I didn't at least like. Cipresso di Toscana is no exception: it's great, very natural-smellig, more aromatic and herbal than woody, even a bit spicy as it dries down. Actually quite succesful in evoking a hot summer's day in a coniferous forest full of herbs!

There's only one problem, which isn't really a problem since it's been discontinued, more like a relief: it's not quite unisex enough for my taste. Of course there's no gender to smells, and I only really dislike uber-masculine fragrances with their macho in-your-face vibe, which this one definitely isn't guilty of: it's rather subtle, and very nice. But it is does lean more towards the clasically masculine, which means I think I'd appreciate this more on somebody else than on myself.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Cipresso di Toscana Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Smell 8/10
Longevity 2/10
Sillage 2/10
Overall 4/10

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Cipresso di Toscana Acqua di Parma
review_content: I recall this being very weak, but I wanted to give it a fair shake again. Initially, I'm getting a lot of coniferous notes, but it's been sweetened and tamed by the addition of fruity notes that seem all too reminiscent of men's designer fruit fragrances. Even a bit of the old dreaded melon is here, and our old friend the Curve ass-leather note, all over synthetic woods. This is very disappointing, and to me seems very uncharacteristic of a respected niche line like AdP (not that any of their others have impressed me very much!). As the base approaches, I'm presented with the same cheap cherry/wood scent as the new version of Dunhill, which to me just feels like an easy cop-out. The sweetness isn't strong, but it's too full of fruits and honey, and ends up being no better than what you'd find in a run-of-the-mill designer scent. It has a bit of the "moneyed" vibe that their Colonia Intensa has, and that helps a bit, but overall I just don't find it to be worth the niche price or the niche brand. Geir does it better, and stronger. Looks like I better move on to their Fig one!

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Cipresso di Toscana Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Having sprayed it first, it really smells masculine, but in a beautiful fresh just-out-of shower way. I detect pine, citrus and rosemary, and yes, perhaps the very first impression is shaving foam.H However, after just a few minutes it transforms into a cloud that can be described as aromatic awesomeness of herbs and salty seawater with a bit of a barber vibe.

Although pine and cypress are still there, they form the canvas instead of dominating. I detect lavender and rosemary, sage, perhaps a little coriander, but no cardamom or flowers. CdT is on the juicy side, I wouldn't say its a dry pine scent. and it is very aromatic, warm and smooth, hides under your skin and blends with your natural skin scent.

When its settles further, i detect more cypress as well as vetiver and patchouli base, so it does tick all the boxes for me. At the same time I admit, CdT leans more masculine. Stays close to the skin, but staying power is good for summer EdT,4 h aromatic bliss.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Cipresso di Toscana Acqua di Parma
review_content: Complex and simple at the same time. Beautifully composed mix of intoxicating cypress, citrus & dry herbs. This fragrance has natural, earthy feel to it. I think it is more on a masculine side though. Love it!

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Cipresso di Toscana Acqua di Parma
review_content: I heard it's discontinued. Really difficult to understand. What a pity.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Cipresso di Toscana Acqua di Parma
review_content: It's hard to believe that this has been discontinued. I saw a few bottles for sale about 6 months ago, and now I wish I had taken action and bought one then. This perfume reminds me of growing up in the late 80s and early 90s. I was still a boy, my olfactory receptors were brand new, and everything smelled interesting. I typically hate these sporty, soapy fragrances, but there's something special about this one. May the house of Acqua di Parma be destroyed for discontinuing it! Bastards!

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Cipresso di Toscana Acqua di Parma
review_content: Definitely on the masculine side of unisex. I think I'd like it on a man, but it's a little too coniferous for me.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Cipresso di Toscana Acqua di Parma
review_content:
This was my favourite in the Blu Mediterraneo line, but by the looks of it, it's discontinued?

Great, great summer scent.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Cipresso di Toscana Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Fantastic cypress smell with herbs. I've been grown up in a country where cypress is very common and indeed, the smell of this fragrance gives this smell of air passing through cypress.
I consider it a very nice and natural smelling perfume. The longevity is so and so according to others but i'm not in a position to determine this now. Definitely, a perfume for summer first and all year round for those who do not like heavy artilery perfumes.
I cant see a woman wearing this as the odour of cypress is more or less, masculine...and this is it! it is a masculine perfume for men that reminds pino sylvestre somehow but CDT is much more quality fragrance. These that wear pino sylvestre, should try this, it goes in the same way.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Cipresso di Toscana Acqua di Parma
review_content: This is one of my favorites. Complex, yet fresh, invigorating and a bit sporty. I have not seen it in the shelves anymore, the design of the bottles of the "blue line" has changed. Is this really discontinued? What a shame if it is!

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Cipresso di Toscana Acqua di Parma
review_content: CIPRESSO DI TOSCANA its the best one from the blu line !! a sophisticated an masculine cologne that goes perfect for the fall an winter seasons it makes you feel like your standing in the mountains of tuscany feeling the breeze of grapefruit notes blended with pine cypress an lavender this is a cologne that makes you stand out from the rest an will get you compliments,,one of the top ones in my list.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Cipresso di Toscana Acqua di Parma
review_content: Very sharp cypress/pine/conifer scent. Doesn't last very long, but if you love pine smells, then this is even pinier than Pino Silvestre. As for me, I'm very finicky about coniferous fragrances unless they're done a certain way, so this one doesn't really work for me. It's not terrible, though.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Cipresso di Toscana Acqua di Parma
review_content: I have heard that this is being discontinued. Please, someone, tell me this isn't true as it is one of my signature scents - or tell me where I can still get it!

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Cipresso di Toscana Acqua di Parma
review_content: I like this scent because it smells so natural and so real. It smells just like cypress trees, and if you really inhale deeply into your skin, you should be able to smell some soft florals and aromatics, but they are disguised so well that this easily passes as a unisex fragrance. My concern with it is that trees sometimes give off a faint scent that reminds me of body odor. Like I said, this fragrance smells very natural...maybe a tad too much for me...but I'm debating it and want to test it again.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Cipresso di Toscana Acqua di Parma
review_content: This is a nice citrusy scent that seems genuine. For me citrus isn't the right thing but this scent at least is really nice. It's not like a house cleaner or toilet spray but really like you expect a scent with cypress to smell.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Cipresso di Toscana Acqua di Parma
review_content: This does not smell very impressive in the bottle but amazing on. Like a freshly showered well-groomed man who has just brushed his teeth. It's classy, refined, complex, minty, and clean. Yum.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Cipresso di Toscana Acqua di Parma
review_content:
This is not one of the best Duchafour's creations but I like it anyway. The opening is tremendously green and crispy, in a very good way to my nose. Invigorating, fresh and almost intoxicating. It evolves right away into a very clean and tonic summer/day fragrance with basil, musc and pine. I live in Tuscany where we have Cypress as our regional Tree and I can say TC evocates perfectly the countryside landscapes of my region. I agree with some other reviewers who says it gets a bit "perfumery" in the drydown, but nothing disturbing or changing the idea I have about TC. A gentle, clean scent and a good alternative to anonimous aquas.

Rating: 7.5-8/10

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Cipresso di Toscana Acqua di Parma
review_content:
This is the least favourite of Acqua di Parma. I agree with sf2explus that it smells like shaving foam.
I think that its more suitable for men than women. It is not offensive and I am not dying to scrub it off, but it just doesn't get me excited.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Cipresso di Toscana Acqua di Parma
review_content:
When in search of a Summer scent, the contents of these sea-blue bottles seem to be just what you've been looking for.

I almost wrote off Cipresso di Toscana based upon the opening, which to my nose was a typical citrusy lemon and grapefruit fragrance with not much depth. However once settled, this fragrance transformed into something in which its beauty is difficult to describe.

The scent is warm, somewhat herbaceous, sweet, soothing and woodsy. The citruses vanish in a matter of seconds when applied to the skin, making way for a beautiful blend of lavender, pine, jasmine, cypress and patchouli.

Cipresso di Toscana is distinctively unisex, there is enough versatility for this to wear well on both men and women. Some say that this fragrance reminds them of nature and the Mediterranean. I've personally never ventured there, however I do feel as if this fragrance transports me to a picturesque island covered in pine trees, exotic flora and surrounded by clear, sparkling blue seas.

I find this fragrance to be very complex, hence the reason why I enjoy it so much. The absence of harsh citrus and strong fruity accords, places this fragrance in a unique category for a Summer scent.

This fragrance lasted a great while on my skin, and not for one second did I consider this fragrance too masculine for my tastes.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Cipresso di Toscana Acqua di Parma
review_content: I have the image of greek summer by smelling this stuff.Passing through the beautiful pine trees with the car and smelling the divine aromas coming from the forrest along with the beautiful sea breeze.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Cipresso di Toscana Acqua di Parma
review_content: Have read many reviews that complain about the longevity of the Blu Mediterraneo line (not here though)... and my own experience is that I keep forgetting I'm wearing it until I move and then the scent floats up and reminds me... gently, as though it had to catch up to me and nudge me. Makes me smile and lasts a good long while (the entire work day for me.)

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Cipresso di Toscana Acqua di Parma
review_content: Sea water..the first sensation at very first sprinkle is of sea water! I love how Acuqa di Parma has such natural tendencies ( in the only 2 that I have tested). Another enjoyeable facet of this perfume is that the florals are just enough, never too forward or sweet, and there are so many individually distinguishable notes-and so many perfectly blended and meshed combinations of scents here. I do love unisex perfumes, this one leans towards masculine. I think it is the lavender, sage, petit grain, all combining together, and then, the added zing of pine and sometimes cypress, that makes it so manly. However, the cardamon here is not so strong, neither the patchouli. The sillage is medium to high, the lasting power is long and excellent. (The spicy notes last forever during the dry down). Highly enjoyable, leafy, herbal, fresh, a bit of a voyage in a bottle.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Cipresso di Toscana Acqua di Parma
review_content: This is a fresh, herbal unisex fragrance and was gentler than I expected. The cypress scent is subtle, and while first, that disappointed me (love the in your face cypress of Tom Ford's new cypress), the lovely basil and trace of jasmine won me over. This would probably be a great shower gel too.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Cipresso di Toscana Acqua di Parma
review_content: This is very nice soft cologne. At first it's very like shaving foam kinda smell (more masculine) on me (Very nice and refreshing). But it changes fast and leaves aroma of definitely pines with some flowers and weeds. It makes me think of beach at first. Later it reminds me of park in a small city where cypresses grow. After 2 hours I can detect lavender pretty good. It's refreshing and calming. In dry down I also feel cypress (We have those around here, I remember I used to rub and smell it) there with pines. Lasting power is awesome for edt. Bottle color and look is absolutely one of my favs. I was craving to try those, but didn't know we had them in store. We have, but unfortunately only this one.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Cipresso di Toscana Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Green and fresh fragance in which I get the notes of pinetree, lavender, cypress, vetiver and cedar.
This is a good scent for women and men, but I think there is something traditionally masculine in it.
Given that I enjoy woody fragances a lot, I could wear it easily in spring and summer, but I don't decide it it's full bottle worthy or if I could pass with some samples.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Cipresso di Toscana Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Blue Mediterraneo collection from AdP is a collection where the ingredients are a combination between "essences and emotions, awaking a pleasant feeling of well-being."

Recently added to my collection, Cipresso di Toscana is a fragrance that is invigorating to the scenses.

This is a beautiful blend of green notes: clary sage, basil, pine w/floral notes of lavender & jasmine. As this fragrance warms down, the cypress, pine & cedar notes develope nicely.

If this is what the gentle rolling hills of Tuscany smell like, I will need to plan my next escape there (in time).

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Cipresso di Toscana Acqua di Parma
review_content:
To me this is the essence of nature, or at least a essence of the forrest. I have not had the luck to go to Toscana to smell the Cypress, but you can find some of these plants in the Norwegian flora too, that's why I think of the forrest (in summertime). With all aromas from treas and flowers floating in the air..

I would love to wear this one, but even more I would love to smell it on a man. Is a wonderful fragrance, with only natural notes.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Cipresso di Toscana Acqua di Parma
review_content: what a beautiful fragrance...at first spritz i thought definetly more of a masculine smell but then as it dried down a very comforting warm fragrance. quite lovely and sophisticated.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Cipresso di Toscana Acqua di Parma
review_content: When I put this fragrance on, my partner and I were trying to figure out what two fragrances this reminded us of. It is a perfect blend of Prada: Infusion d'Iris + Acqua Di Parma Colonia Absoluta. If I did not already own those two, this fragrance would be one I would be purchasing.

product_name: Colonia Sandalo Concentrée Acqua di Parma
review_content:
A cologne for the colder weather. It opens nicely with strong citrus, but that fades quickly to leave space for the sweeter cardamom, tonka and sandalwood. To me it smells like Morocco in winter.
It has decent projection. It's not safe for blindbuying because it's not your usual cologne. So sample before you buy.

product_name: Colonia Sandalo Concentrée Acqua di Parma
review_content:
My first impressions after wearing Colonia Sandalo Concentrée 5 or 6 times: I really like this. I find it to be a kind of upscale analogue to Dolce and Gabbana Pour Homme (current). It doesn't smell similar, exactly, but it achieves the same effect: clean but not boring, masculine but understated, fresh but warm, refined but unpretentious. In other words, it smells like an easy going man with unaffected good taste.

While suitable for formal occasions, I think you could wear this any time. This could be a great signature for a man who doesn't care too much about cologne. Might make an ideal father's day present.

Will update later.

product_name: Colonia Sandalo Concentrée Acqua di Parma
review_content: Full 100 ml bottle available at a reasonable price (negotiable). EU-based transactions preferred due to customs duties and shipping prices. DM me if you are interested.

product_name: Colonia Sandalo Concentrée Acqua di Parma
review_content:
This is not a perfume, this is THE perfume. If you want to smell manly, confident and extremely elegant , go for ACQUA DI PARMA SANDALO. I did also smell the OUD ( very close to sandalo but with an appealing oud undertone ) and QUERCIA (different direction). I am yet to try essenza which apparently is more fresh .
For me this is as versatile as any bleu fragrance, just regulate your sprays if you find it too strong for hot weather.
Italian elegance in a bottle .An easy 10/10 for me

product_name: Colonia Sandalo Concentrée Acqua di Parma
review_content: I have a full bottle 3.4 oz brown old bottle good price $ 100 phone # 806 200 3600

product_name: Colonia Sandalo Concentrée Acqua di Parma
review_content: really dry sandalwood (aka my favourite kind). relaxing bedtime type scent. perfect amount of spicy

product_name: Colonia Sandalo Concentrée Acqua di Parma
review_content: this is my most favourite keather scent ever. maked you want to put on luxury clothes and travel to somale imagined oriental palace, or at least to a private party in a beautiful palace. very intense and lovely

product_name: Colonia Sandalo Concentrée Acqua di Parma
review_content:
OG ADP Colonia amped up with some bold woody aromachemical(s) - read Iso E and what not. But it blends in very nicely, like ADP always do.
IMMHO, Sandalo is the best in the Concentrée line, hands down.

product_name: Colonia Sandalo Concentrée Acqua di Parma
review_content: 25-female. Creamy and warm and delicious and very unisex in my opinion. On my skin, nothing about it pulls super masculine. It's like a warm Woody vanilla hug. Crazy as it sounds (since so many people commented on the citrusy top), the Citrus is barely there for me but I don't mind at all because this Perfume is still deliciously edible. Absolutely adore this scent.

product_name: Colonia Sandalo Concentrée Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I tried this fragrance recently expecting a woody smell suitable for winter. I was shocked that what I got was a barbershop cologne which in my opinion, is more suitable for warmer weather.

This reminds me a lot of Chanel Egoiste Platinum, and I am surprised nobody has mentioned this. I owned CEP in the past, and I enjoyed the smell but sold it because I felt it smelled too chemical and even cloying in very hot days. Hence I am very happy I found AdP Sandalo which has a similar smell but higher quality ingredients which make it more natural and less cloying than CEP.

product_name: Colonia Sandalo Concentrée Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Smells very much like aftershave lotion or shaving cream, very refreshing/sparkling.
I like it much better than Lutens Santal Majuscule (this AdP is more about the bracing lavender & citrus).

You might also like Tous Man Les Colognes Concentrees (similar idea minus the sandalwood).

product_name: Colonia Sandalo Concentrée Acqua di Parma
review_content: I like the opening (10-15 minutes). From the very beginning to the end finest ingredients, that are far from synthetics, are obvious. Big up to that. Petitgrain and orange are there for a while at the beginning. Then comes the sharp as knife cardamom reminding me of frankincense. And it stays dominant all the way to the end. And the end is not near! More than 12 hours of longevity on this one. Fortunately no Tonka bean. Just a hint of lavender in the middle phase, and sandalwood in the base. But again this is all about CARDAMOM. I am not a fan of it. And I wish the lavender and sandalwood is more upfront. Anyway, I will finish my decant wearing only at the office because my wife thinks it is dated and she hates it. The barbershop smell is a bit too strong for her. Can be used all year round by 40 plus age group. Not for everyday wear, as it is a bit sharp.

product_name: Colonia Sandalo Concentrée Acqua di Parma
review_content: I would put this up there with Colonia Essenza, GIT, Masculin Pluriel etc, in terms of just smelling very handsome, smooth and classy.

product_name: Colonia Sandalo Concentrée Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Very luxurious. Has a warm, creamy, barbershop, sandalwood opener that dries down with the creaminess dampening and the sandalwood becoming quite lush. The kind of perfume I imagine would be worn after a long day skiing, after sitting in the woody sauna and shower getting squeaky clean, and then putting this on, ready for some apres ski with scotch in hand, warm knitwear on for dinner or bathrobe on in the lodge, fire crackling, ready for action with your partner. If worn in warmer weather, I imagine would easily be quite cloying if not lightly sprayed.

The opener is like a warm version of Creed's Himalaya. The Creed is more reserved, controlled, and changes into more of an airy, fruity note with some sandalwood lingering.

The counterpoint comparison would be Armaf's Sillage (SMW knock-off), which starts on a peppery, ginger, chemical note with some woodiness and sandalwood characteristics, so is an edgier, lower quality sandalwood alternative.

EDIT: My partner has smelt this a few times and scrunches up her nose each time and says it gives her a headache. The barbershop smell is a bit too strong for her.

product_name: Colonia Sandalo Concentrée Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I am so heartbroken. I knew I am going to love this juice. And then It won't work on my skin. Whole day I am spraying myself, and this is not what it should be.
On my skin:
Starts with the signature colonia citrus, I am very happy with this part. But it's only 1 minute or less.
The cardamom kicks in early and slightly strong to my like.
But as the lavender slowly comes to the surface its beautiful, my favourite part. I wish this opening would last longer. Still the cardamom won't weaken. And this citrusy, floral, spicey start reminds me of aftershaves with either menthol or mint in them (a grapefruit mint mix for me).
So, after this 20min show, there's a creamy sandalwood, nice. But the cardamom still disturbing me, and the whole thing just goes away too quick.

On clothes it's a completely different story:
The opening not obvious colonia citrus, not that bright. Perhaps it's already a mix with the lavender, that spice is there again, but not overhelming. This time it let the lavender win the show. Favourite part this is, everything going much slower, more bold. And the cardamom support the whole, nice. I am not only start tolerate cardamom, but I am in love how it's lift my beloved lavender.
The next twist after the summer night walk by the lavender field is that barbershop vibe. Yes here it is, but nothing of this sort on my skin, never happened. 😭 Someone mentioned PR PH the green bottle earlier, and I have to say: yes I am get that. But don't expect that strong similarity, just it makes some of us surely to remember one or two old school barbershop scents. But AdP style...
So much going on, what a game, and everything so smooth, well planned blend. Once, I think its going to turn to the creamy sandalwood scent on my jumper as well, but not yet. Little powdery at the moment, and the citruses almost fully disappeared. Like a nice full bodied red wine as you decant and once what it was harsh (citrus in this case) now turns into a fantastic creamy juice.
I am waited a good 40mins. I am expected the tonka going to tame the wood but the amber came along instead, and the cardamom toned back up a little again but not for long. At the end when you can't separate any of the notes, its a nice, light woody finish. (a very little like honey and tobacco/wood for me at the very end, must be the amber's trick)
A not too hot summer night for me, the wind brings some lavender from a little distance and I am watching the stars until I fall into a quality deep sleep.

I hope this grows on me once, because it is fantastic from start to finish.

Last/final sniff on my skin: Almost nothing, maybe faux leather, little reminds me of the green bottled jaguar.

The usual AdP longevity and silage, not much better -for me- than the colonia or blu M line.

product_name: Colonia Sandalo Concentrée Acqua di Parma
review_content:
This fragrance is an absolute masterpiece in my opinion. I own around 150 fragrances and this is my favorite, period. I've tried or own all of the 'brown bottle' line of Acqua di parma fragrances and, for me this is the best and most underrated of all. Oud is also a masterpiece and Ebano and Ambre are very good (leather is far too animalic and not to my taste) but this is the best.

The fragrance opens very citrus and aromatic, with bergamot, lemon and lavender dominating. This phase lasts about 20 mins.

The mid looses the citrus and focuses more on the lavendar, cardomom and the sandalwood coming through. The aromatics are quite spicy but very sophisticated. The Sandalwood gives the fragrance a woody back bone but does not smell like your typical 'creamy' sandalwood you get in Lebo Santal 33, Creed original Santal or even YSL La Nuit D'lomme EDP. I think the creaminess is hidden behind the lavender, but the overall impression is very sophisticated and alluring. This phase lasts for 3-4 hours

In the far dry down you are left with the lavender and sandalwood. I don't pick up any tonka really.

Performance from my bottles (I have 100ml bottle and a 180ml bottle, yes I like it that much) is excellent. Projects for around 2-3 hours with a lovely silliage before sitting close for a total of 6-8 hours (which is great for my skin which really sucks up fragrances). I think this is a more mature fragrance, I always get a lot of compliments from this one (I'm in my 30s). It's complex and sophisticated but still approachable and easy to wear. It's also very versatile and suitable for all seasons and occasions. I personally like to wear it for spring/summer/autumn 'dressed up' evening occasions.

If you want a sophisticated citrus/woody/aromatic fragrance with great performance and that will set you apart from everyone else wearing mainstream designers around you, this is an absolute gem.

product_name: Colonia Sandalo Concentrée Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Sandalo for me is all year around fragrance it opens with fresh side Bergamot, Lemon and Orange then start to get some Cardamon & Lavender the dry down id Sandalwood, Tonka bean, Amber

i see this scent is more for office or elegant dates

longevity is decent around 6 hours with good projection & sillage in first couple of hours

love Acqua Di Parma

product_name: Colonia Sandalo Concentrée Acqua di Parma
review_content:
A very likeable masculine sandalwood and lavender. Soft, clean, pleasant.

This reminds me a lot of aftershaves that your grandfather might have worn. It has a classic appeal, while still being likable for most people.

This does not necessarily smell dated, but I wouldn't recommend anyone under the age of 25 or so wear this.

product_name: Colonia Sandalo Concentrée Acqua di Parma
review_content: Sandalwood, cardamom and bergamot mix. It's quite light and airy, not dense and thick, i think it would be suitable for spring and fall, it's blended very well to my nose, i just don't think it's groundbreaking or dare i say special enough to justify the niche price. 7/10 for me

product_name: Colonia Sandalo Concentrée Acqua di Parma
review_content:
slpfrsly - great review. I'd just like to thank you as I ordered a 180 bottle (at a crazy low price) and am looking forward to discovering this fragrance' nuances as we hang out for long time.

If I'll have to add something to what you wrote after I get to know this, I will update this comment.

product_name: Colonia Sandalo Concentrée Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Yes i think this is one of the better perfumes that hits the theme of Sandal. Its opens fresh and in that way it is really a Italian kind of perfume. The citric note is there and typical for Aqua di parma that Lavender note .
Petit grain and Sandal come in the end.
I still prefer Serge Lutens on Sandal but this one is second best.
It is a sophisticated perfume and nicely balanced.
The woody so typical for Sandal comes in the end.

product_name: Colonia Sandalo Concentrée Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Got this one for Christmas and I really like it!
I like to use it after my morning shave personally as, to my nose it has a sort of classy "barbershop" vibe with a refreshing opening.

Though not the same, it's reminiscent of YSL Rive Gauche pour Homme. Like an expensive men's grooming product scent. Clean, fresh, creamy, and smooth.

Feels like it could also be a versatile performer..in the workplace, for dinner out, summer or winter ect.

Has the citruses in the opening and then I get the lavender and sandalwood coming through, really well blended.Very nice indeed.

product_name: Colonia Sandalo Concentrée Acqua di Parma
review_content:
This is beautiful. The sandalwood is prominent here, though you can definitely detect a nice bergamot note on the opening, which gradually fades in about an hour. That's when the creaminess of the sandalwood comes out.
It's a very relaxing scent: brings my memory back to a time I was happy and stress-free. I personally like to wear this for myself rather than for compliments. This is what I'd normally call a "zen fragrance".
Overall, it's very reminiscent of Indian scents.
This can be easily worn in summer months, though I feel this is more of a fall scent.

Performance: 8/10
Overall score: 9/10

product_name: Colonia Sandalo Concentrée Acqua di Parma
review_content: The only sandalwood i can wear in summers .. awesome performance and a compliment getter .

product_name: Colonia Sandalo Concentrée Acqua di Parma
review_content: others have done a brilliant job of dissecting AdP's Sandalo so all i'll add is that this feels unisex to me. a loud assortment of realistic fresh elements with equally authentic heavy hitters. beautifully blended. highly concentrated, extremely long wearing. absolutely worth every penny for a full bottle if this is your kind of fragrance.

product_name: Colonia Sandalo Concentrée Acqua di Parma
review_content: It’s a good blend. Nothing ground breaking or something you should go out and buy. It’s just spice and sandalwood.

product_name: Colonia Sandalo Concentrée Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Tested it on paper: A nice take on sandalwood. Very vanillic and creamy, with a hint of spice, but kept on the masculine side.

That said it's not groundbreaking imo, and since it hasn't hit discounters yet, there are better scent around for the price it currently retails for (i.e. Dyptique Tam Dao EDP, which costs half the price online: a little more unisex than AdP Sandalo, but still, it's my favourite sandalwood as of today).

Will definitely reconsider it when it will be on sale at online discounters/ebay.

Spring/Fall days, 30+


Edit: tested it on skin.
On skin it is less round, much fresher and sharper. I have to be honest: I am not sure the cardamom/lavender/sandalwood trio works well here. Fact is that this fragrance is centered on cardamom, with strong lavender support - the sandalwood note only shows up in the base and doesn;t smell very natural (is it? or is there no sandalwood at all, but only creamy vanilla, sold as sandalwood? who knows).
It is so sharp, that in the drydown, it seems that there is a some ambergris, and results being similar to Guerlain Encens Mythique (an aldehydic ambergris centered fragrance) that I am testing simultaneously on the other arm. Projection is moderate (good in the opening).

At the point, I can say that Colonia Sandalo should have been marketed unisex. (I would even say that results in being the unisex version of Colonia Ambra, despite the listed notes are very different). The comparison with Aesop Marrakech Intense and Floris Santal are spot on, since both of these are cardamom-centric, not sandalwood-centric. No similarities whatsoever with the great LV Sandalo.
Will do the job for who looks for a modern barbershop fragrance, even if a bit boring and unoriginal to my nose, and the name 'Sandalo' is definitely misleading. A pass for me, and should I decide to get a clean/fresh sandalwood fragrance, I will go with Tam Dao EDP (that despite the cedar, is rounder than Colonia Sandalo). For great sandalwood notes though, I will go directly with LV Sandalo, MPG Santal Noble and Profvmvm Santalum.

product_name: Colonia Sandalo Concentrée Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Acqua di Parma Colonia Sandalo is another solid entry from the darker bottle line, formerly known as Colonia Intensas. It follows in the tradition of Colonia Oud and Colonia Leather before it as being an interesting albeit not too divsive entry, a blend of the "eau de cologne" concept mastered via the now-antique original Colonia as well as a mix of various other notes.

In the case of Sandalo, the blend is overall a bit lighter and fresh than in Oud or Leather, just based on the nature of the signature of note. The fragrance consists of the predictable ensemble of citruses, paired with spunky additives like lavender, cardamom, and petitgrain, with a predictable base of sandalwood and amber (and allegedly tonka bean, though I don't get much of this, myself).

The fragrance is refreshing and invigorating without being too loud, and somehow comforting without being too boring. It's palpably versatile, wearable day or night, winter or summer.

It's a decent performer but probably not quite as good as Leather or Oud, but still satisfactory. Like the others, retail pricing ($260 for 100ml at Neiman Marcus) feels like a tough sell for a relatively safe offering, but it'll no doubt become cheaper on the secondary market (i.e. FragranceNet) with time.

7 out of 10

product_name: Colonia Sandalo Concentrée Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Acqua di Parma’s Sandalo is very nice indeed with deliciously smooth and almost ‘sweet’ sandalwood notes - reminiscent of Comme des Garçons ‘Concrete’ - given a fresh relève by the citrus accord then warmth by a touch of aromatics.

I sprayed a tester on the back of my hand and on the walk home all I could smell was this fragrance - excellent performance and even 9 hours later and several hand washes it smells as if I applied half an hour ago but just without the projection. After the 11 hour mark Sandalo begins to fade and after 12 hours I can smell a faint remnant but the real performance is probably a good 10 hours.

AdP’s Sandalo holds up well in bitter Winter weather but the aromatics would really sing in Springtime.

Well done, Acqua Di Parma... well done.

product_name: Colonia Sandalo Concentrée Acqua di Parma
review_content: This fragrance is very special. If I have two sprays in the morning, I'm able to smell it for the whole day, after I take a shower and on my sleeping T-shirt afterwards. The longevity is amazing. As to the silage, I think it is just the right one - the fragrance is creamy and very warm, manly and yet not aggressive. Sandalwood, lavender and bergamot is an extraordinary combination - simple, subtle and yet quite strong especially when the ingredients are of the highest quality. The price is indeed quite high but I prefer to give my money for this fragrance than for one of the terrible overpriced fragrances by Creed or Kilian.

product_name: Colonia Sandalo Concentrée Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I’ve been testing this fragrance for the past week and was surprised because it’s not your normal sandalwood perfume. It’s intriguing, one of the most non-linear scents I’ve ever tried. The first three-minute blast is an alcohol bergamot/lemon explosion that took me back to my high school days when I’d liberally shake Old Spice Lime over my neck and shoulders after showering, making muscles and admiring my imagined animal magnetism in the mirror afterwards (yes, there was no Axe in my time). Then, Sandalo’s heart turns into a honeyed citrus essence (probably the citrus, lavender, and amber notes) with a powdery background (the sandalwood?). This slowly decays over about three hours into a cardamom/lavender that reminds me of Perfums de Marly’s Layton. Sillage is not enormous and turns into a skin scent that lasts 6-9 hours. This is a great scent for wandering about, for business, for informal social gatherings. It’s fresh and clean and won’t draw undue attention, while at the same time being bright and eye-opening, though it won’t replace the morning coffee. It’s a fall, winter, and spring scent easily, and probably summer capable.

I’m on the fence over buying this. I don’t have anything in my current collection that’s similar to the opening or the creamy heart. The dry-down, however, is redundant with Layton. I layered it with Serge Lutens’ Santal Majuscule to enhance the sandalwood and liked the dry down better that way. If I didn’t own Layton, it would be a no brainer—I like the overall non-linearity and progression of Sandalo better than the comparatively boring Layton.

Edit: After trying it many more times, I bought it.

product_name: Colonia Sandalo Concentrée Acqua di Parma
review_content:
This is not a sandalwood dominant scent. It is a clean, spicy, soapy fragrance with sandalwood nuances. In fact so clean, it immediately reminded me of the original Paco Rabanne pour Homme (green bottle). An oakmossy barbershop opening, followed by a spicy oudy sandalwood. Finally it dries down to a chergui like type of scent. Performance could be better, but its ok.

I guess you can say this is the best of the 3 recent releases by AdP, followed by Oud and Leather. By the way, this one takes note from both of them.

product_name: Colonia Sandalo Concentrée Acqua di Parma
review_content: To me the cardamome is way more prominent than sandalwood. I also smell something soapy in the dry down. Quite alluring, but doesn't last that long on me. 6,5/10

product_name: Colonia Sandalo Concentrée Acqua di Parma
review_content: In my opinion, the best sandalwood fragrance. So alluring and sexy + This will make you stand out in the current world of Dior savage and Chanel bleu

product_name: Colonia Sandalo Concentrée Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I’ve been desperately trying to figure out what this reminded me of and it’s Mandate, albeit this is smoother, stronger and all around more appealing version than the current one.
I love Sandalo. It’s masculine, complex and I think I stated in my last review that my favourite was Quercia which is still great but it’s been overtaken by this.

product_name: Colonia Sandalo Concentrée Acqua di Parma
review_content: Well, here’s an update - do not get this on clothes you do not routinely launder unless you want to always smell of sandalwood. You decide if this is a good or bad thing.

product_name: Colonia Sandalo Concentrée Acqua di Parma
review_content: Well, it is the end of 2018 and it is available far and wide, I have just purchased some in Spain. Actually, a very nice coffret with scented candle and some gel or cream. Full size bottle of scent. Not really tried it yet but the guy in the little shop gave me one spray and it was very AdP and immediately brought to mind sandalwood. I happened to be wearing Hermes Vetiver Intense and it was overwhelmed by the single spray of Sandalo. I will post again once I have road-tested it properly. First impression promising.

product_name: Colonia Sandalo Concentrée Acqua di Parma
review_content: Head turning! ADP has their version of Xerjoff’s Uden. Citrus, creamy, woody and aromatic. No rough edges present it’s all about the pleasantries. I wasn’t expecting for it to be this good. Way to go ADP.

product_name: Colonia Sandalo Concentrée Acqua di Parma
review_content: i loved this at first try. it stood outso much and i was in a really well stocked shop in a german town. the sandalwood is ad pleasan as it gets and the whole composition is warming and pleasant, yet not trying too had to pleae.

product_name: Colonia Sandalo Concentrée Acqua di Parma
review_content: The person who created this fragrance is a genius.

product_name: Colonia Sandalo Concentrée Acqua di Parma
review_content: Wow! So this was an exclusive at Harrods yet it’s taken two years to get a wider release? My opinion is that it was worth the wait. Seriously this is awesome stuff! Smells very classic and very masculine but you are paying a premium for it. I’d feared, with a name like Sandalo that it would be a very slight, sandalwood but it’s more of a classic, I detect oak moss and patchouli, and a dirty lavender with a kind of eathiness reminding me of Tom Ford for men maybe or RL Safari, VC&A Tsar or classic eighties fragrances with sandalwood. It’s an aromatic Fougere type scent, citrus top notes, herbal and woody, the soft, clean woods left at the end are like a oud and sandalwood combo. I think it’s fantastic and another classic masculine idea in the same way Quercia from this line was too. I hope it’s not wildly expensive because I want it.

product_name: Colonia Sandalo Concentrée Acqua di Parma
review_content: As of today, this is on sale at my local perfumery so I'm assuming should be available elsewhere too. First impression from a single spray on my fist: Opens with a typical ADP citrus freshness then dries down to a soft sandalwood and cardamom. I am a sandalwood fan but I'd need to spend more time with this to see if it's worth the price.

product_name: Colonia Sandalo Concentrée Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Finally a true sandalwood! I really hope they make this a standard to the collection, getting it only at Harrods makes it exclusive though. From the beginning till the end an exquisite Sandalwood essential oil blast that lasts! Not hidden at all, I think that the opening faded quick, and the base could have a bit more thickness, like maybe a slight hint of patchouli. Anyway, you want Sandalo? You get Sandalo!

Much better than Oud. This Sandalo finally brings back meaning into perfumery, the lost art. This is special, and takes some time to delve the layers.

There were hardly any reviews for this one, so had to order it online.
This was the best blind buy ever and I hope to enjoy this for a long time.

product_name: Colonia Sandalo Concentrée Acqua di Parma
review_content: This fragrance was a big let down. Figured this would be a colonia with smooth sandalwood, but this just smell like a old man cologne from the 70s...

product_name: Colonia Sandalo Concentrée Acqua di Parma
review_content:
FYI if you want to buy this fragrance!
Acqua di Parma decided to only allow Harrod's exclusivity. So if you live in the UK your in luck. If you live outside of the UK your S.O.L.
That's really dum and doesn't make any business sense to only allow one retailer to sell it. Millions of others are not able to try it because it's not available to them.
Too bad.....
Update, anyone in North America is interested in buying this fragrance, according to ADP it's not available until the end of 2018.. don't hold your breath!

product_name: Colonia Sandalo Concentrée Acqua di Parma
review_content: It's not fair! I wanted this to be a shared fragrance! I love sandalwood and love to see it in the name of the perfume too: colonia sandalo concentrato - that's music to my ears!

product_name: Colonia Mirra Acqua di Parma
review_content:
When I first got it about four years ago, it was mostly just a dry, dusty myrhh with mediocre performance. Abandoned old wooden houses must have smelled like that, I thought.

It had a somewhat bright and promising resinous opening that quickly faded and turned dry and dusty within an hour; it stayed linear and soft, almost like a whisper that way throughout its remaining lifespan of about four hours.

It took a bit of imagination to perceive that lingering chalkiness as cocoa powder, but even that would be kind of a stretch.

Fast forward a few years to the present—it has likely undergone maceration and has become a rich, moderately sweet resinous amber fragrance with clear gourmet warm tones of vanilla and rich, dusty cocoa powder.

Its projection has improved to almost an arm length, while its longevity has stretched to about ten hours.

From a meh fragrance almost designated to becoming a layering fragrance for its base notes—evolved into nearly a powerhouse!

I guess I got lucky!

product_name: Colonia Mirra Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Honestly love this stuff. ADParma very hit or miss for me. This, Essenza & Futura are great.

This is just smooth and a great cooler weather fragrance. I love Myrrh as a note and this is in my top 3 for sure, it's basic and a little linear but just right. For an ADC it lastly a decent while 4-7hrs, it's soft and has a nice bubble which I'd describe as fuzzy warm cookie dough(ish) ambery feel.
I'd imagine the sillage is very nice too.

I'm picking up another 180ml this week. I would love an EDP of this... a little deeper and bolder! Come on ADP!

Seriously on a cold morning few sprays behind the ears and BOOM! In my own Cosy bubble.

For me 10/10 for what it is. It's not an all rounder, somewhat versatile and nowhere near a beast. But! That's exactly why I love it. Simple, smooth, warm, gorgeous. Apparently discontinued, what a shame I will definitely get another bottle for a back up.

product_name: Colonia Mirra Acqua di Parma
review_content: My dad gave me this a year ago and I always thought that me, being a 20-year old college student, was too youthful for this fragrance. Over time I have come to appreciate it and honestly it's my go-to for formal occasions for when I'm feeling extra sophisticated. Really great fragrance, but very mature.

product_name: Colonia Mirra Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Acqua di Parma Colonia Mirra is a sophisticated and versatile fragrance from the Italian house’s Colonia line, blending the brand’s signature citrusy freshness with warm, resinous, and spicy notes. Launched as part of their Ingredient Collection, it centers around the rich, balsamic aroma of myrrh, elevated by complementary notes that create a smooth and calming experience.

Scent Profile:

Colonia Mirra opens with a subtle citrus burst, characteristic of Acqua di Parma’s Colonia DNA, likely featuring bergamot or orange blossom, which gives it a bright and approachable start. As it settles, the heart reveals a delicate spice accord with noticeable hints of nutmeg, adding a warm, slightly sweet, and earthy dimension. The star of the show, myrrh, anchors the base with its resinous, amber-like depth, creating a soothing and elegant finish. The fragrance strikes a balance between freshness and warmth, making it a refined take on an amber fragrance.

Performance:

Projection: Light to moderate. Colonia Mirra projects softly, creating an intimate scent bubble that feels personal rather than overpowering. It’s ideal for those who prefer understated elegance.

Longevity: Fairly good, lasting around 6-8 hours on the skin, which is impressive for an Acqua di Parma fragrance, given the brand’s lighter, eau de cologne-inspired roots. Reapplication may be needed for all-day wear in some cases.

Vibe and Versatility:

This fragrance exudes a calming, sophisticated aura, making it suitable for nearly any occasion—work, casual outings, or evening events. Its darker, resinous undertones, driven by myrrh, give it a slightly moody character that might feel heavy for hot summer days but shines in cooler seasons like spring, fall, or even mild winter days. It evokes a sense of timeless luxury, reminiscent of the discontinued Armani Privé Myrrhe Impériale, though Colonia Mirra leans lighter and fresher.

Comparison and Uniqueness:

Fans of amber-heavy fragrances will appreciate Colonia Mirra’s refined take on the genre. The nutmeg and citrus accents set it apart from denser amber scents, giving it a brighter, more wearable edge. Its similarity to Armani Privé Myrrhe Impériale suggests a luxurious, resinous warmth but with Acqua di Parma’s signature Italian finesse.
Rating: 8/10

product_name: Colonia Mirra Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I wish they'd do an EDP for this one... ADP has been a hit or miss house for me. I appreciate there perfumes but some just ain't for me.

This, Essenza & Futura are my favorites...

Considering this is an EDC it lasts quite awhile... I would love a pumped up version of this. However, this is absolutely beautiful. When I first tried it i thought bleh, nothing special but it's not meant to be... this is just smooth warm cozy and that's exactly what it's made to be and it's excellent. This will not make your jaw drop but once you wear it a few times it becomes addictive.

Come on ADP do an EDP!!! Don't know if this is discontinued or what but I have a couple of back up bottles and it's available in New Zealand.

Anyway, this is a simple masterpiece for me.

10/10 - Nothing groud breaking, nothing crazy just soothing, warm, sensual and mysterious.

product_name: Colonia Mirra Acqua di Parma
review_content: The best from the house

product_name: Colonia Mirra Acqua di Parma
review_content: I think Prada Amber Intense with its more soapy character might have the edge over this one for me personally. Very nice though. Both are discontinued so get 'em while you can.

product_name: Colonia Mirra Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Bought as sample 5 years ago. I wondered at the time, if my sample was stale. I didn't find citric top notes, or pachouli base note. It opened with a smell like stale iris and lavender, with a powdery quality that stayed the same all day.
I'm giving it another try today. It hasn't improved or worsened in 5 years. After a few hours, it's stinging my eyes a bit, with a cloying, spicy sweetness.
I found it 'meh' at first, and kind of boring. Hours later, annoying.
I'm obviously no expert. I don't know what myrrh is meant to even smell like. I don't know if my chemistry is incompatible with this fragrance or, like I suggested, it's stale.

product_name: Colonia Mirra Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Just got this, my initial thoughts.

Myrrh is one of my favorite notes, so I've wanted to get my hands on this. They don't smell completely alike, but as someone who loves Prada Amber Pour Homme Intense, this reminds me of a much less sexy, more casual, less soapy version of the Prada. If the Prada is for date nights in sleek, upscale bars and restaurants when you want to inflect a certain understated air of elevated but nonchalant "cool", then Colonia Mirra is for the following easygoing day, waking up, heading out to get a late breakfast and then a walk in the park. Overall, the blend here doesn't feel as "special" or "interesting" as the Prada. This is a lot more straightforward, but I wouldn't go as far as using the word "linear." This still has enough depth so that it doesn't get boring.

So far, this is a strong like for me, but again I'm a sucker for myrrh and oriental fragrances, so this fits right into my wheelhouse. I can actually see myself using this much more than my discontinued bottles of Amber Pour Homme Intense to conserve those. Will edit with a full review later.

Edit: The amber in this leans towards that synthetic kind of amber accord one often finds in modern day male perfumery (you know the aura I'm talking about, usually accompanied by ambroxan, though, thankfully, there's no ambroxan in this), and overall slightly "cheapens" the overall feel of this. It's surprising as my experience with other Acqua di Parma fragrances has been noting how natural they smell. I'm not saying Colonia Mirra smells "cheap", but it's just not as "elevated" as I initially thought off the first couple of wears. I do still like this though! Downgrading my rating from an 8 to a 7.5

7.5/10

product_name: Colonia Mirra Acqua di Parma
review_content: This is a real head-turner! Colonia Mirra is warm, spicy and definitely masculine. The initial citrus burst fades quickly into this rich amber and myrrh scent that lasts all day. It's sophisticated and perfect for evening events.

product_name: Colonia Mirra Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Just a superb fragrance that many have overlooked but, this is a magnificent blending of citrus and smooth amber, myrhh goodness. A semi dark Oriental with an Italian twist that combines freshness up top with a spicy, semi-sweet near gourmand drydown and a near perfect mix of amber & Patchouli in the mid to end to give it a nice, well rounded light woods & earthy mix. Close to Prada Amber Pour Homme Intense but, none of the soapy like accord that Prada is known for nor a pronounced woods that Prada has with the Sandalwood & Vetiver. Just an Italian take on a spicy oriental that creates a magic from fall to early spring. This feels slightly more casual and laid back compared to Prada's version yet, can be worn just as easily as the latter in a work or professional setting. I just prefer Prada for that particular environment or scenario. But, for friends & family gatherings or that date night occasion in cooler to cold weather, this is simply stellar. Performance is quite good as well as I get 6-8 hours of duration with half a dozen sprays. For me I rank the brown bottled colonia line in this order; Colonia Oud Intensa, Colonia Sandalo Concentree and then this gem right here Mirra but, they are all super close for me. No losers in this bunch at all.

An underrated creation that exudes quality from the first spray and on. There are still some tester bottles and 180ml. bottles available for excellent prices. If spice & everything nice is your calling, this is your gateway to that occasion.

product_name: Colonia Mirra Acqua di Parma
review_content: The leaves are falling, autumn is here, it's time to break out this fantastic warm amber-spicy fragrance. For me, I find four sprays is enough, where I typically do six, and I find it lasts. I was fortunate in that someone gave me a full-size tester bottle of this... it's great to have friends with connections like that!

product_name: Colonia Mirra Acqua di Parma
review_content: Beautiful scent of myrrh and amber, fresh with its light touch of patchouli and citrus. It has a slight subtle sweetness, I am not sure if it comes from the orange flower notes. This is really gorgeous and probably unisex. I think I need a bottle of this. Wonderful scent! this is an underrated gem! don't go buying expensive Tom Ford Myrrh scents without sampling this first!

product_name: Colonia Mirra Acqua di Parma
review_content: Smells like a less intense and more rounded version amouage crimson rocks. A warm spicy, powdery, amber frangrance. Quite resinous in the dry down. Insane sillage and longevity. Could be cousins with Tom Ford Noir.

product_name: Colonia Mirra Acqua di Parma
review_content:
A great day wearing Mirra. The trick is to apply with weight, confidence, and persistence. Then do it again.

Within 30 mins, the perfume has relaxed and settled into a lovely warm woody, resinous, soft patchouli fog that projects enough so that you can pick it up easily, wallow in it even. And yet it doesn’t overpower those around. Lasts all day and is enjoyable even after 12 hours. One of my favourite Aqua di Parma perfumes.

product_name: Colonia Mirra Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Lightly powdery and nutty amber dominant scent accented with fresh citrus. Very clean, but warm and cozy and perfect for the cold weather.
Not a big projector, have to lean to get a nice whiff, but does last for hours on skin and more on clothes.

product_name: Colonia Mirra Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Top notes are a bit hard to decipher, but there is at least some floral and citric notes. They are very pleasant, but not very distinct and they evaporate in less than 30 minutes, transforming into saponin notes.
In the mid, nutmeg is prominent but the myrrh and other, warmer spices fills out the picture.
Base is solid, and nice with amber and discreet woodiness.

The AdP signature of citrus and soap is quite obvious although the profile has more to do with Eau Sauvage EDP – citric with a spicy and resinous base – than with the classic colonias. There is, however, not sufficient citrus notes to say that this is a "hespéridé" – leaning on citrus essential oils – and the top notes are not an important part of the overall experience in general. There is more spice and resinous notes and less soapiness compared to other colonia bottles from this house.

All in all I think that if this was a stronger concentration, I would consider replacing my Eau Sauvage EDP (2017) with Colonia Mirra. Autumn-winter-early spring office scent, but does not have sufficient performance to defend the price. Although I like discretion, even the skin scent phase is too weak after 3 hours on me. Edit: Funny how the opening reminds me of the way Fahrenheit smells on you past lunchtime, but this really lasts only 15 minutes.

product_name: Colonia Mirra Acqua di Parma
review_content: A smooth delicious blend of Myrrh, Amber and Nutmeg. its the kind of scent you wear under a thick coat while knowing christmas eve and good company is just around the corner!

product_name: Colonia Mirra Acqua di Parma
review_content:
This is a lovely scent that reminds me of TF Noir in the dry down.
Not a big projector but remains around for 4-6hrs.

product_name: Colonia Mirra Acqua di Parma
review_content:
مرکباتی در کار نیست و از ابتدا اسپایسی و صمغی شروغ میشه و تا انتها تنها تغییری که می کنه ورود پچولی و امبرهست که باز هم آنچنان تغییری ایجاد نمی کنه و بیس عطر حفظ میشه.
بیشتر مردانه هست و 30 سال به بالا.
یونیک نیست اما پوشیدنیه.
***************************************************
scent:6.5/10
longevity:7.5/10
sillage:6/10
purchase value:4/10
*************
overall:6/10

product_name: Colonia Mirra Acqua di Parma
review_content: This is a wonderful fragrance. Lots of spice with very dark smoothness about it. It's not the run of the mill fragrance .

product_name: Colonia Mirra Acqua di Parma
review_content:
My first review on here, LONG time lurker..
Looking at some of the reviews below makes me question my own findings., but I found Mirra to be massively disappointing. It opens well, fresh whilst intoxicatingly reassuring and classic ADP, and the initial drydown is lovely. For the price I paid for it £65 - I thought I was on a complete win.
However - 20/30 minutes later and it's a skin scent on me. An hour or two and it's all but gone. So disappointing that I boxed it straight back up for a exchange, thinking that something had to be amiss. The second bottle was identical, so that went back too. Now I have ADP Oud, Leather and Ebano - all of which have good to great performance, so I'm not sure whether it is just my skin? The readily available, relative 'bargain bin' pricing does suggest that I may not be the only one being less than impressed though..

product_name: Colonia Mirra Acqua di Parma
review_content: Was lucky enough to get a 100ml for 65 bucks and damm this stuff is good… very warm and inviting, aslong as you go light with the sprays. a 10/10 from me. Brilliant stuff

product_name: Colonia Mirra Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Just looked at my bottle and only have about 10ml left. This is a gem, definitely one of my favorite Myyrh fragrances.

I will be getting another bottle this year, possibly another for a back up.

9/10 loses a point because it's not a year round nor most versatile fragrance.

Love it!

product_name: Colonia Mirra Acqua di Parma
review_content: Masculine, solid, linear (not a criticism - an observation of this range of single note emphasis colognes). Straightforward, brown/amber (if you find scents resemble colours, as I do). Easily wearable I can daytime/work situations, as evening ones. Safe for work, but definitely not a generic office designer scent.

product_name: Colonia Mirra Acqua di Parma
review_content: On scent alone this is 10/10 just got it in today so will have to review performance but this is beautifully spicy warm and resoniius almost gourmand but not.The fragrance so far seems to be a moderate projector and gentlemanly in its silliage,one of the highest quality fragrance for the price point which is currently 55.60

product_name: Colonia Mirra Acqua di Parma
review_content: Starts off pleasant and juicy, but then a turmeric note kicks in. Really really dislike turmeric in fragrances.

product_name: Colonia Mirra Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Since i made my first review I want to add one.
I love this one in the first place.
The more i use this fragrance I feel it is a one you can put into the realm of the ones who relate to the Arabian notes used in Oud and those very expensive ones you can find here.
The notes, as I said previous, are very distinct in their consistence and combination.

Wow this is so good and powerful and yet it is balanced and so sophisticated.
It does remind me indeed of the spice shop or market in India or the middle East but it has also that mystical smell typical for mire.
It has a long-lasting power for eau de cologne and makes you feel dressed-up for a nice diner or just for a good evening party on a sunny day outside.
What ever occasion, this is gorgeous and well balanced to wear.

product_name: Colonia Mirra Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Gorgeous fragrance from Acqua Di Parma!

I love this! Only just purchased a few days ago and it’s stunning! This seems to be a rather underrated not so well known fragrance from Acqua di Parma which surprises me!

Have seen several reviews of people describing this as a winter fragrance but I find it very very refreshing!

Like a walk through a pine forest on a sunny winters day!

True gem of a fragrance!

10/10!

product_name: Colonia Mirra Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Similar to TF Noir and Narcisso Rodriguez for him edt.
Peppery.

product_name: Colonia Mirra Acqua di Parma
review_content: Awesome and underrated smell. Professional and mysterious at the same time. A clean citrusy Myrrh that performs very well for an EdC. Smells much like Prada amber intense minus the soapiness. Also very similar to Eau Sauvage Parfum, and much cheaper if you go for the 6oz bottle. Versatile and office safe.

product_name: Colonia Mirra Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I learned to love Myrrh from Dior Eau Sauvage Parfum 2012 and Jo Malone Myrrh Tonka, but I'm just ok with this one. I'm not sure what to make of this one. Dark, warm, cozy, dry myrrh and other dark notes I can't pick out. It's nice enough but nothing pops out and grabs me.

Scent: 7 / Sillage: 8 / Longevity: 7.5

EDIT: My old notes at the beginning of my frag journey...
1st wear: Ok. Musky & sweet. Too sweet. 6-7/10
2nd wear: Too musky and sweet after 10 mins. 3 hrs later, def too musky. Pass. 5-6/10

product_name: Colonia Mirra Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I'm a big fan of Acqua di Parma line up and Colonia Mirra is no exception to this. This Eau de Cologne Concentrée, despite lacking a bit in longevity, really pays off with a luscious, deep and layered olfactory experience. It echoes the seriousness of the original Acqua di Parma but with a completely different set of notes, though it plays in the same arena in terms of elegance.

The opening is quite dark, bittersweet (almost medicinal) and reminds me of dark cocoa powder; there are sweeter orange blossom nuances that bright it up enough to avoid it feeling stuffy and gothic. As the initial citrus sparkles fade, it becomes drier and almost powdery in a very pleasant way, like if you were smelling in a wooden cupboard where resins and nutmeg have been left for months. Myrrh provides the luscious bittersweet background that becomes more prominent 30 mins in, while nutmeg is more prominent at the beginning and adds a note of spiciness.

As soon as the base notes hit your nose, the warm ambery base makes the bittersweet smell of myrrh more akin to burnt brown sugar - this is no gourmand at all, but just really gives the idea of sugar taken off the stove right before it burns. At points it gives me the idea of being sucked into a black hole and, as much as it sounds like a negative comment, it is not in reality as it removes your focus from anything else surrounding it.

Colonia Mirra has such a dark, mysterious and alluring scent profile I can't stop smelling my wrist. This is a dressed up fragrance, good for your own enjoyment and amazing when you need to smell refined and opulent. Due to its low contration, longevity is not amazing - 3 to 4 hours, give it or take it, and that is expected; it effuses convincingly but not aggressively for the first hour before becoming a sking scent. Great for fall and winter, both day and night, rainy days and formal situation. Classic Acqua di Parma bottle (batch code 0260337), in dark brown glass similar to those of the discontinued Ingredients collection; a number of fragrances in the line have been moved under the Signatures of Sun line and became EdP concentration, but alas not Colonia Mirra although this one is still widely available at discounters.

product_name: Colonia Mirra Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I am a young woman, however I thoroughly enjoy wearing this fragrance all year and weather long. I see as a very complex, but easily wearable fragrance. For me it is a very cozy smell, therefore I tend to wear it on cooler days, however I see how it could be pulled of in a nice summery, flowy dress, sipping double espresso on ice.
The fragrance opens up to this strong medicinal smell, I get just a little bit citruses, more like sweeter orange peel/ blossom citruses (probably the orange blossom). However the myrhh, amber and patchouli is amazing. After 15 minutes on my skin, it starts to sweeten and then I get just a bit of that nutmeg. But it is not sweet as in candy sweet, it is a natural sweetness. It is somehow fresh, but warm and spicy at the same time. After a hour it becomes fresh for me. It is so mysterious, but familiar at the same time. I love it when my boyfriend wears it, I love it to wear it myself.
When it dries, it becomes quite sweet and aromatic, reminds me of dialed down Black Phantom By Kilian.
I got a 180ml bottle of this fragrance at TKMaxx for a fraction of the original price. I believe I paid 68 euros. I don't think I would pay the original price for this fragrance. It is not my favorite fragrance, but I appreciate it.

product_name: Colonia Mirra Acqua di Parma
review_content: This is my all time favourite scent. I don't know how to describe it apart from unconditional love. I just love this stuff

product_name: Colonia Mirra Acqua di Parma
review_content: Quite medicinal in the early spray. But changing to more pleasant after a while when it starts to polarize gradually. I think this is more masculine than unisex. Smells classy but performance is moderate. The myrrh is dominant here, and of the same nuance with JM Myrrh and Tonka. Expensive but worth the biggest size resides on my shelf.

product_name: Colonia Mirra Acqua di Parma
review_content: Wow. Just wow.... I'm in love with it, it's definitely got that brite, fresh citrus opening that after a half hour or longer absolutely settles down into this yummy, warm, creamy, delicious, nutmeg/myrrh/amber thing that gives it a sweet, brown sugary, gourmand vibe... of course the star is that creamy, smooth, warm, nutmeg/amber/myrrh combo. My god.. A woman with whom I had a romantic date with a few weekends ago was stuck to me like a magnet, afterwards later texting me about how delicious I smelled to her. I have Colonia Mirra to thank for such a nice compliment from her.... Now the downsides... It is only a cologne concentrate, which is so disappointing. This NEEDS to be an EDP or at least an EDT... But other than so-so performance and so-so longevity, this stuff is soooo beautiful and delicious. I absolutely LOVE citrus/amber/myrrh/olibanum fragrances. I need to discover more!

product_name: Colonia Mirra Acqua di Parma
review_content: Longevity may be an issue but OMG its smells fantastic

product_name: Colonia Mirra Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Iam not sure what’s going on with this one
It very close to tf noir
But it’s weaker and it disappears very fast
Though the scent is nice my advice buy the tomford

product_name: Colonia Mirra Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Having tried most of the blue line from this house plus a handful of others in this line I haven't been overly impressed by most. This however I adore and love ALOT. It's not to say the others were bad, they were nice but not bottle worthy for me. Mirra is back up bottle worthy for me, I just wish it lasted abit longer. This smells rich, deep and opulent. Reminds me of the Myyrh in Zaharoff.

9/10

product_name: Colonia Mirra Acqua di Parma
review_content:
This starts off as a Pow to the senses then calms down to this nice mixture of amber ( and myrrh ) with other elements of the fall time ( although I wore this in the winter, it still fits perfectly )

I don't personally know or have smelled what Myrrh is but, whatever it is, this fragrance works and works well.

It's nothing explosively amazing to me, but just beautifully done and enjoyable.

A woman could likely pull this off but... it's not so obvious either way to be just for men or women to me.

*Added Oct.31 2021*
Revisiting this for a moment, this does smell like a cookie... a well made gourmet type of cookie.

product_name: Colonia Mirra Acqua di Parma
Colonia Mirra Acqua di Parma
review_content:
This is going to be complicated and I may even contradict myself on a couple of points.

I got this just after Christmas from a UK retailer who I think had made a mistake in pricing on their Euro site, it was a fraction of what they were charging in GBP and for what I paid it’s a fantastic bargain.

Putting the above aside I’ve got to say I like it but I don’t love it. I have Colonia at present, I’ve had a few other ADP fragrances in the past and have always been wowed by them, this doesn’t quite hit the spot.

The initial hit I get is of high cocoa content dark Swiss Chocolate, which immediately calms down into mirhh and amber. It’s got that ADP mark of quality all over it, but at the same time there’s just something missing to take it to another level where I couldn’t live without it.

I don’t get the longevity or projection I was expecting either. It arrived a few day’s ago and I sprayed it before bed on two nights and there was no hint of it in the morning, today has been the first time I’ve worn it during the day and after 6 hours I’m having to really search for any hint of it.

I think I paid around 1/4 of RRP so I can’t complain at that price but I would have been disappointed if I hadn’t got it heavily discounted.

It’s obviously quality and it’s nice but it doesn’t really stand out as anything special.

product_name: Colonia Mirra Acqua di Parma
Colonia Mirra Acqua di Parma
review_content:
At first wearing I quite liked this fragrance. A brighter, bit more light myrrh than usual, while still carrying the same dryness it's known for.
Something kept bugging me though and I never felt I really liked the scent. After smelling it a while I think I've realized what it is: a scratchy and strong synthetic woody amber, perhaps the old pal Amber Xtreme popping up again. This causes the fragrance to have a scent reminiscent of a more generic cheap masculine and, as my girlfriend describes it, causes it to "go up the nose" really much and hurts a little if you smell it too close. I would guess this is a way to boost the sillage of the scent, which unfortunately completely ruined it too.

It was launched in 2017 but is already discontinued as of 2020, so maybe other people agreed with me. If you like myrrh, there are just so many other scents around that I would recommend over this.

product_name: Colonia Mirra Acqua di Parma
review_content: A discontinued masterpiece that is still slept on even now. There isn't much out there that is like this one. For me it is as good as or even better than Colonia Leather

product_name: Colonia Mirra Acqua di Parma
review_content: i don't know what it is but this scent like many of the other Acqua di Parma scents smells cheap. Just everything about this radiates synthetics. I've tried a dozen or so of their scents after liking one of their Blu Meditteraneo scents and reading all of these positive reviews. I love resins and myrrh but this just doesn't sit right with me. It smells unbalanced with a largely vacant top note register.

product_name: Colonia Mirra Acqua di Parma
review_content:
The top notes last relatively little, only a few minutes. Immediately appears the main note of MIR, and from now on the myrrh is the main player who will feel throughout the period of wearing.
Elegant, totally masculine, with a long longevity and medium projection.
To get an idea of how it smells, imagine the final part of Guerlain-L`instant and replace cocoa with myrrh. They are somewhat similar towards the end.

product_name: Colonia Mirra Acqua di Parma
review_content: بوی گرم و نرم خوب و البته اشنایی دارد که در انتها به پچولی و امبر ختم می شود.مشکلی که تقریبا اکثر عطرهای کلونیابه جز چند استثنا دارند اینه که رایحه ای خاص و تک ندارند.جالبه ماندگاری این عطر بد نیست اما با توجه به خاص نبودن با این قیمت فعلی ارزش خریدش قطعا بسیار پایین است.

product_name: Colonia Mirra Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Scent: 6/10

Quality: 8/10

Originality: 5/10

Sillage: 7/10

Projection: 6/10

Longevity: 7/10

Price VS Size: 6/10

product_name: Colonia Mirra Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I love it. This is Very resinous and balsamic. Masculine. It is blended well. smells dynamically rich and powerful. Another ADP hit , this house knows how to put fragrances together. I received a compliment from a young woman , a mature
woman and an elderly woman since I bought it. Its kind of hard to wear, definitelty for a date, by the fire place, intimate, or sex occassions. It’s worth a try or buy

product_name: Colonia Mirra Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Tested it on skin: a little disappointed after the high hopes that the paper test gave me.

I thought I had found the Holy Graal of Myrrh, but no.
Don't misunderstand me: it's a good round myrrh centred frag, but my previous impression in regard to the lack of AdP's signature citrusy opening and the drydown, that reveals to be even more vanillic than it appeared on paper, makes it lean very feminine imo. Projection is moderate at best, and the fragrance is short lived on my skin (disappeared after just 3 hours).

I think it may be interesting on a woman, but quite boring on a man. That said, today I also tested Guerlain Bois Mysterieux: THIS is the holy grail of masculine myrrh. Given the price tag similarity between the 2 frags, it's a no-brainer for me for my myrrh frag quest: AdP is out, Guerlain for the win!

Edit: Guerlain Bois Mysterieux is a masterpiece imo, but should you look for a frag totally myrrh-centered, I can't recommend enough Goutal Ambre Fetiche and Armani Myrrhe Imperiale. Really, imperial!

product_name: Colonia Mirra Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I beautiful take on myrrh. It's indeed pretty warm and round, and the typical AdP citric opening is a little less fresh than other frags of the same line. Myrrh is noticeable in the heart. Then it morphs to an ambery (resin/vanilla) drydown - for sure a little less interesting than its big brother, AdP Note di Colonia III. Colonia Mirra is overall sweeter and a little less refined than the latter, but also 2 to 3 times cheaper.

A win from AdP, but try on skin before you buy!

Mildly warm evenings, 30+

product_name: Colonia Mirra Acqua di Parma
