Being an impulsive fraghead and a sucker for bargains, I ordered the 180ml bottle after I did a single testing from a department store and liking it. After several wearings over the weekend, I agree with philball that this is a mediocre release and with Bluslippers that there are better ones in the Colonia range than Pura (Essenza for instance).
Using 6 sprays, performance is less than 3 hours on my skin in mostly hot outdoor setting but surprisingly getting whiffs of it every now and then even after 5 hours which should be coming mainly from my clothes. What I get is a pleasant, unique enough soapy scent that leans masculine which should have been more than Ok if it actually lasted for at least 6 hours. Oh well, my only consolation is that it cost me around the same as a discounted 100ml decent designer bottle and it will serve its purpose as my first full bottle of ADP in my collection.
Will test this in an air conditioned setting these next few days and will update this review. Will do as much spray as needed to make it work. I got the 180, remember?
On to my never ending quest for the next bottle i.e. after the recently placed order for a 150ml Prada L'homme Intense lol

product_name: Acqua di Parma Colonia Pura Acqua di Parma
review_content: @philball, @Blueslippers! I came across a very good deal for a 180ml (definitely way cheaper than a Dior Sport 2017 100ml) that's why I am itching to pull the trigger. Guess I will need to really try it first as I am getting mixed/leaning on negative reviews so far. Thanks for your inputs!

product_name: Acqua di Parma Colonia Pura Acqua di Parma
review_content:
In response to Amen Corner, I tried this fragrance for the first time this week and I felt quite disappointed. To my nose, it was fairly generic; a light, nondescript citrus with a dash of spice - aimed at a younger crowd. Certainly not offensive but far from outstanding either. I would call this fragrance safe and commercial - okay for the cheaper, designer end of the market but not worth the AdP label or price.

However, what was most disappointing was the performance. Barely there once sprayed and completely gone in little over an hour. An over-priced tonic water and AdP's weakest fragrance yet. I know it's a cologne but for £100 a bottle, I really would expect more.

It's probably safe enough for a blind buy but it doesn't step far from a well-worn, mass-market appeal, path so don't expect too much. Personally, I think the new Dior Homme Sport is better than this, it certainly performs better and it's cheaper, although, even the Dior isn't anything overly special.

I was so looking forward to trying this, after seeing the note breakdown above and owning several AdP fragrances myself. Oh well, I guess that's what happens when a conglomerate gets its hands on a fine-perfume house and I shouldn't have expected anything more!

It's a mediocre 6 out of 10 from me (perhaps a 7, had it not been AdP or if it was cheaper).

product_name: Acqua di Parma Colonia Pura Acqua di Parma
review_content: Anyone else who has tried this? Appreciate if you could share what you get from it. I am trying very hard to stop myself from blind buying this one as a bday gift for myself : ).

product_name: Acqua di Parma Colonia Pura Acqua di Parma
review_content:
It starts with brief citrus. Nice. But very brief citrus. Then nothing. No original Colonia-style herbs, no lingering neroli like in Essenza. Then some weak, indeterminable florals appear. But not strongly enough. Then a dosage of 90s-style, aquatic aromachemicals, presumably the ozonic accord. One tiny step away from calone! (Eek!)

Then it's shifts to a smoother, ambroxan-type accord (or what I thought was ambroxan) but which must be the musk. It starts off a little sickly for me, to be honest, but then mellows, and aside from the fleeting citrus is the best bit.

All in all, it smells suspiciously to me like an aquatic - citrus, woods, watery aromachemicals. They could've called it Acqua di Parma Acqua or Eau Fraiche.

Unbearably unisex. No dominant floral or woods. Chance would be a fine thing. No real smell. A mere suggestion of a scent. Perhaps they're aiming for the younger man or the teenage market. It's a country mile away from 1Million though.

All they need to fully mess up their heritage is to do is a gourmand version. Yuck!

Seriously, I do worry that these guys have taken too much of an advantage of their recently (re-)found success in the market - one scent in nearly one hundred years since 1916 - and then waaay too many flankers.

I tried it from a good few sprays on one arm in John Lewis. A second visit might discover something different but I doubt something 'new'.

Anyway, when I left I sprayed Aramis on the other arm afterwards. Haha.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Colonia Pura Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I wore this a few times and must say I love Colonia Pura. A perfect MODERN cologne of a high quality. A 100% Demachy style. I always praise him for this ability to catch the trend and he did it again.
Colonia Pura is a journey from the bergamote / bitter grapefruit peel to the oceanic salty molecules on a slight ambroxan base. Despite the salty elements the fragrance doesn't smell as Heeley Sel Marin or something like that; it's still of a citrusy genre and the oceanic part gives it contemporary vibe.
I emphasized the word "modern" as Colonia Pura nothing like the regular Colonia or Assoluta/Intensa/Essenza. So do not expect it to be a lighter version of Colonia. On other hand, Colonia Pura has been done for the generation of Le Labo Bergamote 22 lovers, that beautiful grapefruit/bergamote/ambroxan concotion. And I do find a big resemblance to Bergamote 22; a 2,5 times cheaper Bergamote 22 with salty elements added. That's a dream of those who are looking for cologne of nowadays!

product_name: Acqua di Parma Colonia Pura Acqua di Parma
review_content:
This opens with a beautiful, full-bodied, zesty orange note with a dash of sweetness. I'm not sure if it's the aldehyde notes, or the sharp bergamot, but something gives the citruses in this an effervescent quality, very fizzy. It's very pleasant. The base seems to consist of light musk and florals. The citrus aspect never completely fades.

This seems to be a bright citrus in the opening, drying down to earthy florals. It's not blended quite as well as Essenza or Assoluta.

Now, it reminds me of a few fragrances, I can't put my finger on what exactly, but it's quite strongly reminiscent of Chanel Allure Homme Sport to my nose.

Main notes to my nose are orange, bergamot and petitgrain.

Longevity is about 5-6 hours with projection for 1.5 hours on my skin.

I'll keep using this and will give a more concise review down the line.

So far it's good, but not great. Smells very designer and mass market, but the performance doesn't seem quite up to scratch.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Colonia Pura Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Nor can I as a fan of Acqua di Parma. Only know this house since last year Spring. But it is already my second best house.
I don't have the original Colonia because of it's weak performances, but Essenza, Assoluta & Intensa and Bergamotto di Calabria are all in y top 10 Spring/Summer fragrances.
Mandorlo di Sicilia & Intensa are more for Fall/Winter.
So I would love to have a kind of the original if with better performances.
Since it will be launched only in September, does it mean it will not be a fresh Spring Summer fragrance like the original?
Also I would like to know who has rated this fragrance already? Would that be real connaisseurs? Professionals?

product_name: Camelia Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content:
From the heart of the Italian house Acqua di Parma, Camelia is born as an olfactory hymn celebrating the purity of beauty and the calm of elegance.
It is not a loud fragrance … but a quiet presence that touches your senses before it catches the eye ...
A scent that whispers rather than shouts, seen through emotion rather than sight.
Camelia is part of the Signatures of the Sun collection, a line that translates the radiance of the Italian sun into refined fragrances built around rare ingredients.
The world first met it in 2019 as an Eau de Parfum, crafted just as Joelle Lerioux Patris envisioned.
Its opening notes sparkle like dew: Italian bergamot, young mandarin, a dash of pink pepper like morning spices, and cardamom as soft as nostalgia.
At its heart lies the camellia flower ... the undisputed queen of this perfume ... gracefully centered, wrapped in herbal sage that adds balance between delicate florals and green freshness.
The base settles into a whisper of benzoin and clean, white musk, leaving a sheer, silk-like trace on the skin.
Camelia is a summer, daytime scent ... ideal for casual or light formal wear.
Perfect for air-conditioned workdays, a quiet midday stroll, or simply as a “clean fragrance” after a nice shower.
Its projection is intimate, close to the skin … never intrusive, lingering gently for 4 to 6 hours before it fades in a soft silence.
In short, this perfume suits those who adore simplicity ... scents that don't pretend to be anything but honest.
Yet … it's not for everyone.
It's for those who appreciate quiet detail and seek a feeling, not a performance.
"True beauty doesn't scream ... it’s quietly noticed."

Ahmed Hadi - Baghdad - IRAQ

product_name: Camelia Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I find all ACQUA DP a bit masc. I love a few anyway Vaniglia for example. Peony, Rose, Magnolia are girly faves
For info Cherry_Darling
Camelia does not have a fragrance. It is a scentless flower. What they are selling here is the idea of a Camelia…. an idea I always find obnoxious!
Ordered this waiting 🤞

product_name: Camelia Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Both Japanese and Italian. Flower petals with ambery depth, and a few drops of the classic Colonia Orange/Jasmin old-world magic. (I suspect AdP drops a bit of their original scent in everything they create). As it develops, orange becomes more and more prominent to my nose, and it's the orange I like the most : paired with woody notes and a balmy benzoin, but still radiating sunshine. I think I sense it so strong because I know it.
But then again, the star, the camelia, like a paler and greener rose, brings even brighter daylight over the balanced complexity of this fragrance, making it deceivingly simple and minimalistic.
All this somehow reminds me of the softness of a photographer I really like, Rinko Kawauchi. Especially an album called Semear that she did after travelling in different Brazilian cities where a great deal of Japanese immigrants were established a century ago. All those supposedly intense colors she saw, and somehow managed to give them that dreamy Japanese softness without forcing it, naturally. I imagine if she went to Italy, Camelia would be the result.

product_name: Camelia Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content: Not overly impressive at first - as others have mentioned, there’s a definite rhubarb note. I think it improves on dry down to a mild citrus / floral. Projection and performance not great, though. I picked up a large bottle during lockdown at a 75% discount - so not particularly concerned.

product_name: Camelia Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I was testing perfumes in store and ADP haven't really appealed to me before. I sprayed this one and I was curious about it... I liked it, but it also wasn't the sort of thing that I'd really buy.

I still was smelling myself on the way home and made a note of it on my phone, as it's rather expensive and I usually wait for discounts. There was just something about this one. So I did find an offer on it, on an eBay perfume store. I was expecting to really regret the purchase.

So anyway. Upon first spray, it's a musky citrus on me. I see the cardamom note and I think it's there, very well blended. It transforms into a fresher citrus and the clary sage comes out then. I think this almost smells a little bit like tea, but it's hard to define. I'm a jasmine lover, but it doesn't play in the way you expect it to here, it almost helps to keep the other notes smoothly blended.

While this isn't weak and the notes are hard to become anosmic to, it's not meant to be an offensive powerhouse. I won't describe it as intimate, but it's a subtle, comforting scent.

The longevity is what lets this fragrance down. Many of my more mainstream and cheaper scents last longer. It lasts a few hours on my clothes.

I'd say this fragrance leans feminine to my nose, especially on my skin.

product_name: Camelia Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content: Rhubarb with soft woody under tones. Leans more towards the feminine but a confident, classic dapper Dan can pull this one off. It has a peppery Jo Malone feel and in the same context linea scents which are underrated can become classic gems well worth converting. If you like rhubarb without the usual vanilla gourmand cliches them this is the one for you.

product_name: Camelia Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I get a sharp, citrussy rhubarb here - is this what camelia smells like? The rhubarb note is really distinctive to me! Super tart citrussy, with a floral peony like heart. I get the spiciness too underneath, and some creamy powderiness, but also, sadly some kind of synthetic concoction which is not agreeing with my nose. I'm comparing this with Roger Gallet The fantasie, as it is said to be similar, well it definitely is not - in my opinion RG The fantasie is far better, much lighter, more tea and lemons and aromatics, and zero synthetics. That said, if you love the tart fruity feel or rhubarb and your nose isn't sensitive to synthetics, this can be a nice one too.

** 200 samples up for swap UK - check my customs, get in touch! **

product_name: Camelia Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content: Definitely it’s a very soft refined sweet floral fragrance but I wouldn’t say very feminine. The floral note is more sweet aromatic floral, almost like hint of light honey like sweetness and I smell also some kind of sweet soft and round woody note that is probably coming from benzoin and musk. Camelia itself doesn’t normally have fragrance like rose but probably it’s an aroma chemical that mimics like rose and it’s done very well. Opening is fresh with citruses and pink pepper but transitions to this very comforting sweet floral aroma that gives you a whiff every time you move around. It’s like you’re present in a simple and modern luxurious spa. The silage and longevity are softer but not too bad. This fragrance is not for screaming loud but to have a relaxing and comforting ambiance around you so it’s so pleasant and enjoyable. Well done! 👍🏽👍🏽👏🏽👏🏽😻

product_name: Camelia Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content: Very lemony and sharp. It reminds me of Flash disinfectant. Great if you want to smell like a freshly mopped floor

product_name: Camelia Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content: A soft and pretty floral scent that is very easy to wear and to like. The rose is dominant but is a “pink” kind of rose, not the deep dark jammy kind. It does evoke the image of a camelia in bloom, but not the scent of a camellia (tbh, camellia does not really have any scent).

product_name: Camelia Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content:
This one starts off with a fresh burst of freshly cut lemon, but no lemon is shown as part of the notes. This must obviously be a combo of the bergamot and mandarin. The camelia flower is there, but in the background. After about 10-15 minutes the bergamot and mandarin settle and the camelia rose becomes more prominent. It's a very unique smelling elegant scent, but I would say it leans a little more feminine because of this rose.

The fragrance died after 2 hours and became a skin scent. Not really a scent for me, but others might enjoy this one more.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Arancia La Spugnatura Acqua di Parma
review_content: Although the longevity is short but still one of the best cologne I have ever smelled. It's pity that it's no more available as it was released as a Limited Edition. Hope to become available again. I don't know why the fragrance was even removed from the brand's website?

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Arancia La Spugnatura Acqua di Parma
review_content:
É um cheiro de limpeza, produto forte, beeeem cítrico, também de verão. Remete aquela tia rica sem consciência de classe, que tem um Creta e fala bem alto: "Como assim você nunca andou de gôndola em Veneza?, Não sabe o que tá perdendo! 😱"

Aroma: 6/10
Performance: 7/10

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Arancia La Spugnatura Acqua di Parma
review_content: Plz bring it back to the market! Mine is about running 2 of 10. Compare with it original version, it's more warmer and sweet, not that sharp as the original one. They said that they were lunched a 450ml refill package, but never seen it, sadly :(

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Arancia La Spugnatura Acqua di Parma
review_content: If anyone is selling this in the states please lmk

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Arancia La Spugnatura Acqua di Parma
review_content: Beautiful mandarin smell that is really reminiscent of mountain chai as well. I love this, and this would definitely be something I'd wear, however the price tag on it is outrageous for me.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Arancia La Spugnatura Acqua di Parma
review_content: If anyone is willing to sell this, please let me know! USA buyer.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Arancia La Spugnatura Acqua di Parma
review_content: I mean, it's almost a photo-realistic mandarin... If you want to smell like a mandarin I guess this is for you.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Arancia La Spugnatura Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Opens with a huge dose of mandarin and black pepper. Although the perfumist is a french (and famous) nose, the italian DNA of Acqua di Parma remains intact.
Evolution: In 15 minutes the almond note, a cozy musk and the molecular cedar appear. The citrus part is slowed down little by little. A beautiful composition.

Prons: It makes me happy.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Arancia La Spugnatura Acqua di Parma
review_content:
This doesn't smell like the original, and is not redundant. It's a different citrus vibe, creamy almond and musk.

I prefer it to the original.

Very nice.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Arancia La Spugnatura Acqua di Parma
review_content: It is the best smelling citrus fragrance and mandarin orange is potent throughout the fragrance but around 170£ and lasts 1 hour and barely projects

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Arancia La Spugnatura Acqua di Parma
review_content: A very sharp, bitter citrus opening but with a sweet, woody backbone. However as the citrus evaporates, it leaves an almost sour woody scent. It's still sweet, but this combination gives me almost powdery and cheesy vibes. After about 2 hours its just sour to me. As much as I try to like this - and I'll at least say that it's not a generic scent and is unisex - I feel like the Italian heritage brand ADP can do so much better in terms of citrus perfumes.... while fico di Amalfi was a lot more generic (just straight up citrus, weak fig and wood), it at least didn't give me this.... strange sour scent.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Arancia La Spugnatura Acqua di Parma
review_content: smells like a fanta. idk if thats good or bad

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Arancia La Spugnatura Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Beautiful refreshing orange with the right amount of sweetness and zestiness. It also had something floral and powdery (might be an orange blossom?). Soft musky base. Simple but nice!

Follow me on IG: scent.guide

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Arancia La Spugnatura Acqua di Parma
review_content: this bottle smells clean, orangy throughout of the scent life! A little spicy from black pepper but not overpowering, i would say the touch of creaminess of bitter almond is well blended!

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Arancia La Spugnatura Acqua di Parma
review_content: I absolutely love this fragrance, it opens with a very natural note of orange. Very pleasant, the bitter almond in this is so good, it reminds me a little of kilian's black phantom, it then dries to a very pleasant ambergris and musk, i absolutely love this fragrance, it's a fresh and sweet citrus fragrance, i absolutely like this fragrance

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Arancia La Spugnatura Acqua di Parma
review_content:
The best release of 2023 for me personally.

I love citrus freshies anyway, but I think this might be my favourite straight up citrus forward fragrance ever. I basically just get the citruses but with very light touches of sweetness and creaminess, but the orange/mandarin easily stand out above everything else in the mix.

Longevity is excellent for this type of fragrance, citrus heavy fragrances don't tend to last all that long, but on clothes this lasts all day. On skin it's about average but on my t-shirt I was still smelling it in the night after spraying it on at 8am and being in work all day.

Named due to the process of rubbing the citrus fruits against a sponge and draining the infused oils. This seems to have done wonders for the longevity of the citruses within this fragrance, as well as how great they smell.

This is a stunner and perfect for hot/warm summer days, and totally unisex.

10/10 from me.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Arancia La Spugnatura Acqua di Parma
review_content:
The special thing about this fragrance is the bitter almond! I love bitter almond scents. Pegasus by Parfums de Marly is a good example.

Here we have a high quality Italian summer fragrance. Lots of ripe oranges and tangerines. Luckily I don't smell the lemon. I prefer oranges. Musk rounds off the scent wonderfully. But the best is the bitter almond. This makes the scent beautifully creamy, almost like a lotion.

For me it is a fragrance that you can even wear in autumn and winter. A masterpiece!

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Arancia La Spugnatura Acqua di Parma
review_content: Does anybody else get a gorgeous unlisted Ambergris on the dry down?

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Arancia La Spugnatura Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Its a lovely scent, but overpriced! Otherwise get some manadarin oranges, peal them with your hands, and after you're done eating dont wash you hands.
It is a simple as that 😄

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Arancia La Spugnatura Acqua di Parma
review_content: Had to buy it after smelling it in a perfumery. Very nice take on a summer citrus scent. Unique juicyness that smells very natural. Drydown is a leafy mandarin zest with a bit of spicynes and creaminess coming from almond and musk. It's a bit expensive so don't go for it if you're short on budget.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Arancia La Spugnatura Acqua di Parma
review_content: It’s nice, fresh. Orange citrus with an almost buttery floral nut undertone. Leans female for me, so a pass

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Arancia La Spugnatura Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Very natural-smelling, literal and simple citrus. Orange, lemon with a crisp aromatic nuance in the background.

It’s unisex and summery. Performance is what you’d expect for a citrus EDT.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Arancia La Spugnatura Acqua di Parma
review_content: The dry down has too strong amber nuance, like "Norlimbanol".

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Arancia La Spugnatura Acqua di Parma
review_content: You know ADP and their use of natural smelling citrus fruits. This is another one with wonderful orange and mandarin with a touch of creaminess from the almond. Not my style, but it's very nice and cozy with 3 simple notes that jumps out for simplicity, yet so refreshing.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Arancia La Spugnatura Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Starts off very solid with a robustly fresh orange juice inspired citrus top note. Unfortunately they are using a certain lime raw material in this formula that goes bad on my skin, I don’t remember the name but it starts smelling a bit off on my skin.

Aka I’m sticking to Arancia di Capri! If you are lucky and don’t have a similar skin reaction this may however be the superior offering for you.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Arancia La Spugnatura Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Tested on skin twice. Initially I dismissed it as a less impressive version of the original.I love the original, but performance is terrible. Tested again today and liked it more than I originally did..I picked up some soapy musk and wood in the base which I didn't notice the first time. The citrus is on full blast in this one. I hold the original Arancia Di Capri in high regard and this feels unenessary and uninspired. Need to test side by side but longevity seems boosted by an aroma chemical, but it's still poor. You will need to spray the living hell out either Arancia to get them to have any legs. Ideally, carry a decant.

Performance isn't a deal breaker for me, it goes with the territory. I LOVE the house of ADP, and I've owned many, but I've still never paid full retail for any of them. 50 bucks for 3.4oz is the sweet spot for the Mediterraneo class, and ideally, try to get 5 or 6 ounce bottles because they go fast. Anyway, yeah, this feels like a waste of creativity and resources. @ Acqua Di Parma, if you're listening, please bring back Ginepro and Cedro, and stop messing around with silly flankers in pretty bottles. You're better than this.

TL;DR: OG with citrus dialed up, slightly better longevity
(but still bad) and little tweaks to the base that are hardly perceivable.

Scent 6/10
Performance 3.5/10

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Arancia La Spugnatura Acqua di Parma
review_content:
The initial smell is glorious, so fresh and fruity! I felt sure this was going to be a secure buy...
However, the scent simply disappeared on me leaving me disappointed. I wanted to love this fragrance as many of my favourite notes are present but sadly once my sample is finished there will be no pennies spent on getting more. There are far better citrus scents available.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Arancia La Spugnatura Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I didn’t like it.

I feel like they added a “trendy” and “designer” vibe in the base, which makes it last longer but smell it bad for my personal taste.
That megamare, paco rabanne carolina herrera sweet chemical vibe, might be norlinbanol?
I also feel they added something soapy/neroli/petit grain.

I think people who like that stuff will probably like this remix more than the original.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Arancia La Spugnatura Acqua di Parma
review_content:
This scent is very much a sibling to Arancia di Capri but I'd say it's a small upgrade. I've experimented with both separately and have spent a day (in the name of science) wearing one on each arm and can confirm that they are very similar, both with the same strong, fresh, orange scent that is very pleasant and natural.

Initially they are near identical, however this fragrance seems to stay stronger for longer and slightly more "full" but the core smells are the same. I also feel that the woody (cedar) dry down is a bit more prominent after a couple of hours too.

Both are nice fragrances, particularly if you want to smell like oranges but I'd say this is the (slightly) better of the two. Though I probably wouldn't pay a huge premium to get this over the original.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Arancia La Spugnatura Acqua di Parma
review_content: very juicy, much sweeter than the original imo. it does not last sadly

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Arancia La Spugnatura Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Can't wait to try this one, the original version remains my favorite hot weather juice. And the Bergamotto Spugnatura was better than the original.

The other very good ones from the blue line are Chinotto di Liguria (with its Eau Sauvage vibes) and the incredible Cipresso di Toscana (best AdP scent ?). Ginepro di Sardegna was quite great too but sadly discontinued.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Arancia La Spugnatura Acqua di Parma
review_content: I absolutely adore Fico Di Amalfi & Mandorlo di Sicilia, and just recently ended up buying a massive bottle of Colonia Intensa after sampling it at a Bluemercury. However, the rest of the Colonia originals (CLUB, Futura, OG) besides Pura didn't really move me and the rest of the Mediterraneano line wasn't exceptional to me either. Mirto di Panarea, Bergamotto di Calabria and Arancia di Capri were particularly disappointing to me and I do concur with the previous reviewer that Arancia was the least memorable of the bunch. Glad it got an update (?) but not sure it's really salvageable since it's inherently pretty generic fare.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Arancia La Spugnatura Acqua di Parma
review_content: Sampled this in store. The opening is incredible, like ripping into a ripe orange. It doesn't project but leaves a shower fresh orange scent on your skin for 2-3 hours. Stunning but all to brief for the price point, which is a shame, because the opening 15 minutes are just beautiful.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Arancia La Spugnatura Acqua di Parma
review_content: Good to know, arancia di Capri was the least impressive of the original line. Not a patch on Mandorlo di Sicilia and Fico Di Amalfi.

product_name: Fico di Amalfi La Riserva Acqua di Parma
review_content: Really sad to see AdP falling to this level of despair... A piece of advice for your gen-z marketing bros: no matter how many fake reviews you generate, your prices are still too high for the broke-a audience you're trying to target. And those who can afford your prices will only end up despising your cheap move. You gotta stop and class up, and also get rid of the campaign advisor who thought it's an acceptable idea to flood Fragrantica with reviewed-for-free comments. Not here, bro!!! You're embarrassing yourself and AdP, too...

product_name: Fico di Amalfi La Riserva Acqua di Parma
review_content: Fico di Amalfi La Riserva by Acqua di Parma surprised me after a few more tries. At first, when I smelled it from the cap, it didn’t feel like my scent at all — very fresh and salty, not what I expected. But after spraying it on my skin by accident while filming, it started to open up differently. I could sense that clean sea breeze vibe with a hint of citrus softness hiding beneath. There’s a gentle warmth that makes it more wearable. I still wish the citrus notes were stronger, since I absolutely love them, but this fragrance truly captures the feeling of salty air by the Italian sea. I believe I’ll appreciate it even more in summer — it feels like sunshine on the Amalfi coast.

product_name: Fico di Amalfi La Riserva Acqua di Parma
review_content: Fico di Amalfi La Riserva by Acqua di Parma is definitely an interesting and elegant fragrance. I was expecting a stronger burst of citrus and creamy vanilla, but on my skin, the freshness dominates. It opens very clean and airy, almost like a crisp Mediterranean breeze. While the scent is pleasant, it feels more on the fresh side than the warm or sweet side I usually prefer. Still, I plan to give it some time to settle and evolve — sometimes Acqua di Parma scents reveal their depth after a few wears. For now, I’d describe it as fresh, bright, and refined, just not exactly my personal match yet.

product_name: Fico di Amalfi La Riserva Acqua di Parma
review_content: The spray is excellent. It is smooth, controlled, and gives just the right amount with each spritz. The scent opens with a soft burst of fig and citrus that feels fruity yet not overly sweet, balanced perfectly by a clean, refreshing base. It’s the kind of fragrance that instantly transports you to a breezy coastal day. Light enough for daily wear but still unique and sophisticated, it feels both energizing and relaxing. The overall impression is effortless elegance. fresh, modern, and versatile enough to wear year-round, no matter the occasion

product_name: Fico di Amalfi La Riserva Acqua di Parma
review_content: I absolutely love this fragrance ! It’s very bright with a little hint of citrus that I love!

product_name: Fico di Amalfi La Riserva Acqua di Parma
review_content: This perfume is honestly so good! The packaging is beautiful and really gives off a classy vibe, and the scent lasts for hours. I love that it’s strong without being too overpowering—just the right amount to make people notice. Every time I wear it, I get a bunch of compliments, which makes me love it even more. It’s one of those perfumes that make you feel confident and put together the second you spray it. I truly think it’s worth the price because it smells amazing and lasts all day. If you like bold scents that stand out, this one is definitely for you! I received this as a part of an educational promotion, but I honestly would splurge to buy this for myself because it’s that good. This perfume is pretty small in size, but I think it pretty worth it for how much we are receiving when it comes to the overall smell of a perfume.

product_name: Fico di Amalfi La Riserva Acqua di Parma
review_content: What's up with Acqua di Parma lately? All these "free bottles for educational promotion" reviews on several of their entries... Not cool! Unless someone tells me how to sign up lol

product_name: Fico di Amalfi La Riserva Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Thanks to a recommendation from another reviewer, I decided to let this scent mature for about 3 weeks. Initially, it was quite underwhelming and I almost gave up on it. All I could pick up was a metallic musk with just a hint of fig buried underneath. But now it has become much more rounded, the fig has finally come forward, creamy, slightly sweet, and beautifully balanced. The musk is still present, but now softer and more refined, just enough to maintain the freshness. The projection during the first 3 hours is surprisingly strong, easily filling a room, however it's not pungent but feels airy and smooth. After that, it settles closer to the skin, but it lingers well into the next day.

That said, this is one of those scents that’s easy to go anosmic to. I initially thought it was weak until I tested it properly: I sprayed 3 times in a room, closed the door, and within minutes the fragrance filled my entire apartment. I could smell it in the air for about 3 hours, even with the lingering smell of dinner. You never really know how potent a perfume is until you test it this way.

P.S. What’s with all the fake reviews in the last few days? Did Acqua di Parma pay people to flood the page or something? I hate how it dilutes the genuine reviews.

product_name: Fico di Amalfi La Riserva Acqua di Parma
review_content: BOT REVIEWS, IGNORE THEM ALL

product_name: Fico di Amalfi La Riserva Acqua di Parma
review_content: The Aqua di Parma fico de amalfi la riserva is a very unique scent. It's not the typical scent I prefer. It's hard for me to distinguish the notes, I'm not good at that unless it's simple. To me it is a very unisex fragrance. It reminds me of a high end store at the mall. I think it's a good year round fragrance. The scent has great longevity, I could still smell it after an 8 hour day. I received this product in exchange for my honest opinion.

product_name: Fico di Amalfi La Riserva Acqua di Parma
review_content: This version of Aqua Di Parma is absolutely refreshing and bold. It’s unique scent and blends of blood orange and grapefruit are the first notes, and then it settles into a lemon woodsy scent for me. It lasted a decent amount of time without reapplying. The bottle it stunning and easy to use without leaking. I loved this scent and have already recommended to friends. This bottle was provided to me for an honest opinion.

product_name: Fico di Amalfi La Riserva Acqua di Parma
review_content: I am completely obsessed with Acqua di Parma’s Fico di Amalfi La Riserva! From the very first spray, it feels like being transported straight to the sun-drenched Amalfi Coast. The scent opens with fresh citrus and fig notes that are both bright and soothing, and as it settles, it becomes warm, soft, and incredibly elegant.The blue bottle itself is stunning luxurious and timeless, just like the fragrance inside. It lasts beautifully throughout the day without ever being overpowering. I’ve received so many compliments whenever I wear it. If you love sophisticated, coastal-inspired scents that balance freshness with a touch of sweetness, this is an absolute must-have. Acqua di Parma never disappoints, but this one feels extra special! Please go out and buy it ! I received this product in exchange for my honest review

product_name: Fico di Amalfi La Riserva Acqua di Parma
review_content:
The Acqua di Parma Fico di Amalfi La Reserve Eau de Parfum is truly summer in a bottle! From the first spritz, you’re met with bright, juicy citrus notes of grapefruit and blood orange that instantly lift your mood. As it dries down, you get hints of fig, tonka bean, and soft powdery notes that feel smooth, warm, and elegant. It’s the perfect unisex scent; Fresh, clean, and effortlessly luxurious. Every time I wear it, I imagine a sunny beach day, eating fruit, sipping a cocktail, and yapping with my girls. It’s beautifully long-lasting on my skin and clothes and honestly, a little goes a long way. The ultimate summer staple fragrance. I cannot wait to wear this during the Summer months!

Product received as a part of an education promotion.

product_name: Fico di Amalfi La Riserva Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I reviews stating you received this as a part of an educational promotion.

It’s such a beautiful fresh scent that feels like a sunny day on the Amalfi Coast in a bottle. 😍 It opens with a burst of bright citrus mandarin, blood orange, grapefruit, and lemon that instantly lifts my mood. Then it softens into a creamy blend of fig and orris, which adds this elegant and slightly powdery touch I really enjoy. The base with tonka bean and ambrettolide gives it a smooth, warm finish that lingers softly on the skin. I love that it’s unisex so my husband can wear it too and he actually loves it just as much as I do! It smells clean, fresh, and sophisticated without being overpowering.
Perfect for everyday wear or special occasions!

product_name: Fico di Amalfi La Riserva Acqua di Parma
review_content: I was given this product for educational purposes in exchange for my honest review . Fico di Amalfi is a beautiful, unisex fragrance that's great for spring and summer it’s got a richness to it that makes it smell, luxurious and expensive. It has awesome projection for being a toilette perfume it only takes two sprays to leave a nice trail behind that isn’t cloying it’s long lasting and it has a beautiful freshness and sweetness that’s different than any perfumes that I own. It’s definitely a statement scent I know this is unisex, but I feel like it means more feminine I’d be happy to wear this daily and not get tired of it it’s layered perfectly on its own that it doesn’t need any other perfumes to be warn with it. The fragrance is very uplifting and sophisticated. I really think this is a crowd pleaser, and a great blind buy. You won’t be disappointed!

product_name: Fico di Amalfi La Riserva Acqua di Parma
review_content:
This perfume makes a bold entrance. A little goes a long way and it lasts for hours. It gives a summer or early fall vibe with a slightly beachy twist, but not a typical “fresh” scent. It’s mysterious and different for someone who likes to stand out. I get fig and citrus with a tiny cherry-like hint. A love-it-or-hate-it type of scent.

Product received as a part of an education promotion.

product_name: Fico di Amalfi La Riserva Acqua di Parma
review_content: This is a very Unisex fragrance to me. It has a subtle sweet citrus scent at the opening then dries down to a very green subtle scent. It’s not overwhelming but leaves a nice scent trail for a couple hours. I think it’s a nice year round scent but u would suggest it more for men than women.

product_name: Fico di Amalfi La Riserva Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I like to start with the packaging. It's what you see first, so it's always nice to begin there. This beautiful blue bottle is simple, yet it sceams luxury. Like you see this bottle and you know it belongs in your collection.

The very first spray gives me a delight of zest and citrus and then starts to move toward floral territory before you're in the woods of just green fields.

I'd classify this as fresh, floral, and a little spicy. The beginning notes want to give me sweetness, but it's very subtle and moves too quickly to linger.

I really like the top notes and the base notes, but the middle isn't my favorite of this journey. But like all road trips, it's not where you start; it's where you end up. And believe me, you'll want your journey to end where this does. It's smells beautiful, gives off class, and you'll want this scent to hug you when you wear it.

I do think I'll enjoy this more in the warmer months, so I can't wait to see how I feel when that time comes back around. I will also add that the longevity could be better for something of this value. It all fades too quickly for my liking.

received as a part of an educational promotion.

product_name: Fico di Amalfi La Riserva Acqua di Parma
review_content: I received as part of educational promotion. It smells pretty good. It is expensive. The smell is very unique.

product_name: Fico di Amalfi La Riserva Acqua di Parma
review_content: I love the packaging. It’s very high quality for being affordable. It is luxurious in every sense of the word. It’s warm and comfortable. It has this high end vibe that I’m sitting at a very fancy restaurant enjoying an excellent meal. It’s sitting in front of the fire with your favorite person. I’m in love with this scent. I want to know who ever is wearing this scent. It gives me such a familiar feeling. But very unique at the same time. I would definitely consider this scent to be unisex but in a great way. I know I will definitely be grabbing for it a lot this winter.

product_name: Fico di Amalfi La Riserva Acqua di Parma
review_content: This perfume is such a great mix of fresh and classy. It kicks off with a burst of bright citrus—like sun-kissed lemons and crisp bergamot—that smells super clean and instantly lifts your mood. After a while, some soft woody notes start to come through, adding this cozy, natural warmth that balances everything out perfectly. There’s even a hint of pine that gives it a refreshing, outdoorsy feel without being too strong or sharp. What really stands out is how long it lasts—it sticks around for hours but still feels light, never heavy or overwhelming. And the best part? It’s completely unisex, so anyone can wear it and feel amazing. It’s like a cool morning walk through citrus trees and pine woods—fresh, modern, and effortlessly stylish. Perfect for everyday wear.

product_name: Fico di Amalfi La Riserva Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Reading the notes of this fragrance I wasn't sure how it would come together. I love Bergamot and have been venturing into more fruity and coastal scents. Fico Di Almalfi La Riserva is not what I expected.

The opening is packed with citrus. It's strong and smells more like zest instead of the juice of citrus. The wood notes surprisingly gave this a much darker fruity/ coastal scent then I expected. There is also a freshness that makes this lean aquatic. The fig was what I noticed after but I also found that It didn't add a lot of sweetness.

This is a pleasant scent that is unisex and leans a little bit more woody. I liked this it's not really a love but the packaging is a beautiful blue.
*I received this as a part of an educational promotion.

product_name: Fico di Amalfi La Riserva Acqua di Parma
review_content: I received Acqua di Parma Fico di Amalfi in exchange for my honest review, and wow — this fragrance completely took me by surprise. It’s clean, spicy, and peppy in the best way possible, with just the right amount of zest that makes it feel alive on the skin. It’s one of those scents that instantly lifts your mood — like sunshine and sea breeze bottled up with a little dash of spice. What I really love is how unique it is; it doesn’t smell like every other “fresh” perfume out there. There’s this beautiful balance between warmth and brightness, so it works perfectly for both men and women. It’s elegant yet effortless, and every time I wear it, someone asks what I’m wearing. Fico di Amalfi smells amazing, feels luxurious, and makes every day feel a little more special.

product_name: Fico di Amalfi La Riserva Acqua di Parma
review_content: This perfume is very light and fresh, with a heavy citrus top note. It's a pretty unisex fragrance with both myself and my husband enjoying its scent and using it regularly. This fragrance has a pretty good longevity, and last s a good portion of the day, maybe needing to be reapplied in the afternoon if you're wearing it all day. This is a good light everyday perfume, because I wouldn't say it's overpowering. I didn't get Commons from people saying about how fragrant I was when wearing it, but I would still get whiffs of it throughout the day. I received this product as part of an educational promotion

product_name: Fico di Amalfi La Riserva Acqua di Parma
review_content: Fico di Amalfi La Riserva by Acqua Di Parma smells like enjoying a meal by the sea. The citrus is very strong and pleasant, almost as if you can taste it. I liked that it reminded me of eating food with friends. At first it smells very light and fresh and feminine. These top notes were my favorite part. The bottom notes where it is woody and earthy make it a more unisex scent. It only requires a few sprays so a little goes a long way. The bottle is also beautiful and is definitely eye-catching. It feels luxurious and the packaging was nice as well. This will last you a long time. I received this as a part of an educational promotion.

product_name: Fico di Amalfi La Riserva Acqua di Parma
review_content: This is not the most expensive perfume I have ever owned. Let me tell you.. it’s worth it! From the longevity, to the projection, to the scent. It’s actually perfect and you can tell it is a very high quality fragrance. It reminds me of a sunny summer day. Just refreshing and beautiful. It lasts all day and night on my skin. It lasts even longer on my skin and clothes. It’s amazing how they make this perfume. They craft it so delicately you can tell they truly care about one product they are releasing. The bottle is also perfection. It’s a beautiful blue bottle. Looks perfect on my vanity. Even though it is so expensive I will be running out immediately to repurchase once I run out. Even though it reminds me of a beautiful summer day.. it is a perfume you can wear any time. Day or night. Summer or winter. Just smells amazing. Product was received as part of an educational promotion

product_name: Fico di Amalfi La Riserva Acqua di Parma
review_content: I am excited I have had the opportunity to try this new fragrance from Acqua Di Parma that is made in Italy. I have never heard of this brand but I love the pretty blue glass bottle. It is very elegant and high quality. It looks nice on my counter. I thought it was strong the first time I wore it. The more I have been wearing it the more I like it. It lasted all day, I wore days and night and received compliments whenever I went out. I live in a area that has high humidity and felt confident and fresh wearing it. I thought the combination of the blood orange, , grapefruit, mandarin , lemon, fig, and tonka beans was very interesting together. I have received this product for educational purposes and in exchange for my honest review.

product_name: Fico di Amalfi La Riserva Acqua di Parma
review_content: I received aqua di parma in exchange for my honest review . How cool to review on fragrantica as I spend a lot of time here and I have written hundreds of reviews . This is my first time trying this brand and the scent is nice . I’m very surprised though that it’s not more citrus dominant . You do get light citrus in the beginning, but ultimately it leans very fog heavy on me . It’s soft and aromatic . Very easily unisex . It reminds me a bit of nouvelle vague or mulberry fig . The fig is very green , in the middle notes it’s more of an unripe green fig smell but then it settles into a soft and powdery fig . It’s fresh and clean . Probably best suited for spring or summer . The silage and longevity though aren’t exactly what I would expect for the hefty price on this . All in all , it’s a beautiful scent . I’m not sure the bottle really matches the vibe I’m getting from it but it’s a beautiful bottle as well . This scent in a nutshell , “citrus, green aromatic, soft fig “. I’m on the fence , I can’t really tell if I like it or if I’m just intrigued by how unique it is . Will I continue to wear it ? I’m not sure yet .

product_name: Fico di Amalfi La Riserva Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Acqua di Parma’s Fico di Amalfi La Riserva is such a beautiful scent — fresh, bright, and refined without being overpowering. The opening feels like a burst of Mediterranean air, blending juicy fig and citrus with just the right touch of floral warmth. As it settles, the wood and musk come through softly, giving it a smooth, luxurious finish.
It’s perfect for daytime wear or when you want something that feels clean and sophisticated. The longevity is impressive for such a fresh fragrance, and the bottle itself is stunning on display. A timeless scent that feels like summer on the Amalfi Coast, any time of year.
I received this as a part of an educational promotion, this is my honest review.

product_name: Fico di Amalfi La Riserva Acqua di Parma
review_content: I received this perfume Fico di Amalfi La Riserva for free in exchange of my honest review. This perfume is a unisex perfume which both men and women can wear . I wear tthis perfume to my work and i have received so many compliments on this smell. my husband has started using my fragrance too. it has kind of fruity notes like italian mandarin, fig and citrus and it is finished up by warm notes which makes it perfect to be worn on the upcoming fall and winter weather. i feel refreshed and energized wearing this perfume. It came packaged beautifully with the box and big blue bottle can also make it a perfect gift for the upcoming holiday season. The fragrance of this perfumes lasts in my clothes until i do the laundry and wash my clothes so it is pretty longlasting

product_name: Fico di Amalfi La Riserva Acqua di Parma
review_content: This fragrance piqued my interest as both a fruity/citrus and a tonka lover. While it leans much more on the fig and tonka and overall “greenness” to my nose than any of the citrus notes, I do really like it. To me, it’s clean, light, and pretty unisex. Some coastal Italy vacation vibes are definitely present. It’s not so much a juicy, tart one as it is a laidback, warm fruit. Overall a fan. I received this fragrance as part of an educational promotion.

product_name: Fico di Amalfi La Riserva Acqua di Parma
review_content: This perfume is honestly amazing! The packaging is absolutely beautiful, and the scent lasts for hours. If you’re someone who loves strong, long-lasting fragrances, this one is 100% worth it. I’ve received so many compliments while wearing it, and it quickly became one of my favorites. Overall, it’s definitely worth the price — I highly recommend it!

product_name: Fico di Amalfi La Riserva Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Fico di Amalfi La Riserva is a refreshing and sophisticated take on a fig fragrance. The opening hits with bright citrus—lemon, mandarin, and grapefruit—that instantly feels clean and uplifting. As it settles, the fig note comes through, smooth and creamy but never overly sweet. It blends beautifully with soft orris and a bit of warmth from tonka and ambrettolide in the dry-down, giving it a balanced mix of freshness and comfort.

This scent feels effortlessly elegant—easy to wear in any season but especially perfect for warmer days. It’s unisex, leans slightly fresh, and has a quiet confidence rather than being loud or heavy. Longevity is better than expected for a citrus-based perfume, lasting several hours with a subtle trail. The bottle itself is gorgeous, and the fragrance inside truly matches that sense of understated luxury. A modern, polished scent that feels timeless—definitely a five-star addition to any collection. I received this product in exchange for my honest review.

product_name: Fico di Amalfi La Riserva Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Acqua di Parma Fico di Amalfi La Riserva is an amazing, elegant, timeless fragrance. I have been using
this perfume for a week now and have received so many compliments. It opens with a burst of fresh citrusy orange, grapefruit and lemon essences, then slowly develops into a deeper, warm, woody green scent. The citrus notes remain throughout but softens as the woody notes take over. The heart notes are jasmine, pink pepper and fig nectar which really shine through! On my skin, the scent lasted six to eight hours and even longer when sprayed on clothing. The balance of fresh and woody elements makes this perfect for both day and night wear.
I highly recommend for loves that love warm, woody scents!
I received this product as part of an educational promotion.

product_name: Fico di Amalfi La Riserva Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I received this product in exchange for my honest review.
I personally really enjoy this one, I am a big fan of citrus scents, and this one has it, along with lemon, grapefruit and more. It is nice and light and definitely not heavy, great for wearing everyday. I do have to add a little more when I want the scent to linger longer. I also feel that anyone could wear this, it's not super sweet either. Also, it comes in a beautiful package. I would definitely recommend this if you like light citrus scents that can be worn daily.

product_name: Fico di Amalfi La Riserva Acqua di Parma
review_content:
It’s got that classic Fico di Amalfi vibe — fresh, citrusy, and just so Mediterranean — but the La Riserva version feels more grown-up and smooth. You still get that burst of grapefruit and lemon at first, like sunshine in a bottle, but then it settles into this soft fig-and-tonka thing that’s warmer and a bit creamy. It’s like the original went on vacation and came back with more confidence.
The fig isn’t super strong, though — it’s there, but not juicy or loud. More like a subtle sweetness behind the citrus. I’d say it lasts longer than the regular version, but it’s still not a beast. It sits close to the skin after a while, which I actually like because it feels classy and not overpowering.
Overall, if you liked the original but wanted something a little deeper and smoother, this one’s a solid upgrade. It smells like sunshine, clean skin, and a lazy afternoon by the sea. Pricey, yeah, but kind of addictive once you get a whiff.

product_name: Fico di Amalfi La Riserva Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I received this as a part of an educational promotion. Fico di Amalfi La Riserva opens with a burst of citrus, like sipping a sweet, sunlit juice cocktail by the coast. The blend of blood orange, grapefruit, Italian mandarin, and lemon feels bright and sparkling, instantly uplifting. Beneath that fresh opening, there’s a subtle musky and earthy touch, likely from the orcanox and ambrettolide, giving the scent more depth and balance.

It’s beautifully unisex, never too sweet and never too sharp. The fig and orris in the heart add a creamy, slightly green softness that rounds out the citrus notes perfectly. As it settles, the tonka bean brings a gentle warmth without making it heavy.

Longevity is moderate; I get around four hours of wear before it fades into a soft skin scent. That’s typical for citrus-forward fragrances, but while it lasts, it’s effortlessly refreshing and comforting.

Overall, Fico di Amalfi La Riserva feels like a summer day in Greece bright, breezy, and full of warmth and light.

product_name: Fico di Amalfi La Riserva Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I am a big fan of fig scents, very happy I got to try this beautiful fragrance from Aqua Di Parma
I absolutely love how fresh and airy it it! Such a beautiful combination of fruit with fig being very dominant. It is so citrusy at the beginning, the mandarin , lemon and grapefruit takes me to Amalfi Coast right away -after the first sniff
The blue bottle is so pretty too, such a beautiful refreshing summer scent

product_name: Fico di Amalfi La Riserva Acqua di Parma
review_content: I received this product in exchange for my honest review. I think this reminds me a lot of a male version of Glossier You Fleur. There is a very sunny summery overall presentation out of this fragrance. It does not last very long for an EDP. I think anyone could wear this so I’ll agree it is unisex, but not particularly feminine. I love it so much, it smells clean and happy.

product_name: Fico di Amalfi La Riserva Acqua di Parma
review_content:
This product was received complimentary as part of an educational promotion.

I haven’t tried an Acqua di Parma fragrance before so couldn’t wait to get my hands on the Fico di Amalfi la Riserva. The bottle is absolutely beautiful - unboxing it is a luxurious experience and everything is very high quality. Unfortunately, whether it’s my skin or living in the Florida humidity - it seems the citrus evaporated very quickly. I was hoping to smell more of those citrus notes but I smelled more of the middle and base notes like the Fig and Tonka Bean. I am always looking for a crisp and energizing fragrance but felt this was more warm and musky. I can definitely see it being a unisex fragrance leaning towards it being more masculine. I found applying it to my clothes rather than just my skin did help the citrus last longer. I could also see layering it with another citrus scent helping it last longer. Unfortunately, once it dried down, the lasting fragrance was a lot more musky and warm than I was hoping for so it won’t be a go to for me. My chemistry just didn't seem to mix well with it. I could see it being a great Fall and Winter fragrance for someone who enjoys a heavier, musky scent.

product_name: Fico di Amalfi La Riserva Acqua di Parma
review_content: This is a really good unisex fragrance! I would say it's more of a woody, earthy citrus type that reminds me of being out at the cabin in nature. I smell the grapefruit the most but than it settles down to a more of the fig and lemon. It's definitely a bright and cheery type of fragrance perfect for a quick pick me up to start your day and give good vibes! This review was collected as part of a promotion.

product_name: Fico di Amalfi La Riserva Acqua di Parma
review_content: I was gifted Fico di Amalfi La Riserva by Acqua di Parma in exchange for my honest review. In the bottle, it’s stunning—bright citrus and lush fig that instantly transport you to the Amalfi coast. However, on my skin, the scent lost some of its charm and richness. Beautiful composition, but not the best match for my chemistry.

product_name: Fico di Amalfi La Riserva Acqua di Parma
review_content: I really loved the way it smelled and looks so aesthetic. definitely different than what I thought it was gonna smell like I am in love with the fact that it kinda smells like men cologne and my husband loved it and wore it himself. I would definitely gift this especially with the holidays coming up makes a great luxurious gift for people. it's so strong yet so light. I am obsessed with it! a little goes a long way and I would definitely wear it to every season its an all year around. The moment you spray it right away smells so amazing. love the citrus smell once I spray it and I love how much comes out when I spray. I received this as a part of an educational promotion.

product_name: Fico di Amalfi La Riserva Acqua di Parma
review_content: I'm currently wearing AC QUA DI PARMA FICO DI ALMALFI LA RISERVA PARFUME. IM VERY HAPPY WITH THE RESULTS IM GETTING FROM THIS SCENTED PARFUME. IM RECOMMENDING IT TO ANYONE. MALE OR FEMALE.

product_name: Fico di Amalfi La Riserva Acqua di Parma
review_content: I received a bottle of Fico di Amalfi La Riserva by Acqua di Parma in exchange for my honest review as well as educational purposes. The packaging was definitely high quality and elegant. At first spray, I wasn’t entirely sure about it — the opening felt a bit sharp to me and was not entirely pleasant for me. I really didn't sense citrus at all though. However, as it dried down, the fragrance evolved beautifully. The vanilla, powdery, and earthy notes came forward, softening the edges and creating a warm, elegant balance that I really enjoyed. It lasted about 4-6 hours and I noticed with hand washing throughout the day, the strength faded a bit on my wrists. It has a refined, unisex character that feels fresh yet comforting. My husband absolutely loves it and even said he would wear it himself, which says a lot! Overall, it’s a fragrance that surprised me in the best way once it settled. It would not be a fragrance that I would usually pick for myself, but I am happy to have learned about it just the same.

product_name: Fico di Amalfi La Riserva Acqua di Parma
review_content: As a fragrance enthusiast, I had really high hopes for Fico di Amalfi La Riserva. The packaging and bottle are top notch quality, which I appreciate! The notes in this fragrance are nice on their own, but something is a bit off with this fragrance. It’s as if the notes aren’t blending harmoniously. The packaging mentioned the fragrance might need a few months to “settle”, especially if you notice it seems off at first. By letting it sit, I’m hoping it will help the fragrance round out and blend better. Until then, this fragrance is only receiving a 2 out of 5 star for me. It has potential though, and I plan to revisit in a few months.

product_name: Fico di Amalfi La Riserva Acqua di Parma
review_content: I spent a vacation the past summer in Italy, and Acqua di Parma in the fragrance of Di Riserva perfectly captures the smell of salt air and Italian lemons in Positano on the Almafi Coast. It’s bright and fresh smelling and reminds me of a fancy spa or hotel. It’s marketed as unisex and some women will find this scent is for them. I do find it is more masculine smelling and love it on my husband more than I do myself. For women that prefer a bolder and more “spa-like” scent, this is worth checking out, however. The bottle is beautiful, too, and looks luxe sitting on your vanity! I received this product for review and my honest opinion.

product_name: Fico di Amalfi La Riserva Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I received this as part of an educational promotion Acqua di Parma Fico di Amalfi La Riserva is a fragrance that feels like a warm breeze straight from the Amalfi Coast. The moment you spray it, you’re greeted with a burst of sparkling citrus — lemon, bergamot, and grapefruit — that instantly lifts your mood and brings a sense of effortless freshness. As it settles, the scent reveals its heart: juicy, creamy fig blended with soft floral notes of jasmine and a touch of cedarwood. The result is a beautifully balanced aroma that feels both luxurious and natural, never overpowering but always noticeable.

What makes this fragrance stand out is how genuine and uplifting it feels. It’s elegant without trying too hard, and it perfectly captures that sunlit, carefree feeling of summer in Italy. The scent wears close to the skin, making it ideal for everyday use — especially in warm weather or during the daytime. It’s unisex, but its smooth sweetness may lean slightly more feminine. Overall, Fico di Amalfi La Riserva is a refreshing and sophisticated fragrance that evokes Mediterranean beauty, sea air, and pure serenity in every spritz.

product_name: Fico di Amalfi La Riserva Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I received this product for review and my honest opinion.
This is definitely a male scent and not anything I’d wear as a woman. It’s a beautiful scent and definitely brings the summer vibes. My boyfriend absolutely loves it and the longevity is something that surprised me. I was hoping for a unisex scent like described but it’s definitely more on the male side.

product_name: Fico di Amalfi La Riserva Acqua di Parma
review_content: This fragrance Fico di Amalfi La Riserva by Acqua di Parma is an MUST TRY!! It explodes with the vibrant freshness of beautiful fruits, giving you the illusion of what an orchard might smell like in the middle of Italy. The Italian mandarin, blood orange, grapefruit, and lemon essences are something truly to admire together. I enjoyed getting that fruity burst as I first sprayed this and as it settles, the heart unveils an elegant fusion of orris, enriched by hints of fig and lemon, while a luscious fig pulp accord adds a layer of complexity. To the base notes, a warm and inviting finish with tonka bean absolute, grounding a subtle ambrettolide and orcanox leaving behind a sophisticated trail. I guarantee people will ask what you are wearing! La Riserva is presented in a strikingly stunning new cobalt blue bottle. This scent comes in a little mini hatbox and features a newly designed label with refined details any perfume admire would love to collect.

product_name: Fico di Amalfi La Riserva Acqua di Parma
review_content: Smells like a summer escape on the Amalfi coast 🌊☀️ Bright citrus, creamy fig, and soft woods — elegant but never too much. It’s fresh, sunny, and feels luxurious without being loud. Lasts about 6 hours and leaves the prettiest soft trail. If you love clean, classy scents with a touch of warmth — this one’s worth it 💙

product_name: Fico di Amalfi La Riserva Acqua di Parma
review_content:
This is my first experience with Aqua di Parma fragrances. I wasn't really sure what to expect, although the product description was very detailed and thorough. When I received my bottle of Fico di Amalfi La Riserva, the first thing I noticed was the beautiful blue glass bottle and the premium appearance of the product. The scent itself is very nice. I must not have as sophisticated a nose as some other people, because I can only detect some of the "notes" of the scent. The strongest for me is the citrusy aspect, particularly a strong grapefruit dominating. I definitely feel like the scent is fresh, fruity, and full of citrus. I didn't notice some of the other things purportedly in the aroma, but that's ok. I like what I can smell. It is a little on the bitter side for me, but it's subtle and not overpowering. I don't feel that the scent is especially long-lasting.
I received this as a part of an educational promotion.

product_name: Fico di Amalfi La Riserva Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Yikes......really strange to see a respected niche house stoop to such levels.

The scent is quite mid too btw. A dark green version of the original that strips it of what made it so good in the first place.

product_name: Fico di Amalfi La Riserva Acqua di Parma
review_content: Gosh... so many fake reviews!!! is ADP desperate or what?

product_name: Fico di Amalfi La Riserva Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Received as a part of an educational promotion.
This is my first time trying Acqua di Parma Fico di Amalfi La Riserva and let me tell you, you need this if you want to be transported to a bright citrusy, elevated and intimate place. This is going to transport you to Italy on the Amalfi coast with the brightness and citrus.
The citrus notes come in opening with bursts of orange, mandarin and lemon. It starts of with a strong scent and gently mellows down upon wear
This is unisex but more masculine for my nose.
The longevity is pretty good and lasted around 5 hours or so on me.
I love the packaging and how sophisticated it looks in blue. Definitely recommend trying this one out and adding to your collection if you like bright sophisticated scents

product_name: Fico di Amalfi La Riserva Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I was not lucky enough to receive a tester of this for educational purposes - I blind bought it based on reviews and how much I loved the other two in the La Reserva line.

I have spent quite a lot of time with Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo testers over the years, trying to love them but finding them a bit basic and hopelessly short lived. The La Reserva set hits the jackpot and are much more what I was hoping for. There's significantly more depth to support the sparkling citrus, which sticks around for a good length of time. And I do enjoy a perfume with a sweet fig note, ever since I first met, and became smitten by, Diptyque Philosykos.

Love it!

product_name: Fico di Amalfi La Riserva Acqua di Parma
review_content: I was in heaven to receive the opportunity to review the sophisticated, unique Eau de Parfum of Fico di Amalfi La Reserva. This fragrance gives me the vibe of a beautiful man or woman taking a stroll along the Italian Coastline of Italy with the scent of this fragrance following behind. At the initial spray of this fresh classic fragrance, I smell the citrusy aroma of lemon, a touch of fig nectar with the sweet hint of creamy Tonka bean. With this versatile fragrance for both men and women, I can smell the masculinity in the notes of cedarwood and fig wood, and would make a nice scented aftershave. With the first spray the scent is strong not overpowering, but slowly dissipates over time. The aesthetics of the blue bottle and casing are stand out, with the white label standing out, and would make a great decor for on counter top or dresser. I really like the scent , and it's griws on you the more you spray it on. It makes a lovely fragrance for a breezy spring or summer night. I received this product as part of an educational promotion.

product_name: Fico di Amalfi La Riserva Acqua di Parma
review_content: I received this as a part of an educational promotion. Wow, this scent is clean, fresh, and sexy! It opens with a burst of citrus that feels so crisp and bright, and I can truly smell every note individually but working so well together. It’s a green, refreshing fragrance with a subtle cologne-like background that leans a bit more masculine than unisex to my nose. The longevity is pretty solid, around 3–4 hours depending on the person. Personally, I prefer how it smells on my man, but I still love catching whiffs of it! The blue bottle and case are absolutely stunning. I always find myself drawn to blue bottles for him, they just feel so airy, clean, and effortlessly attractive.

product_name: Fico di Amalfi La Riserva Acqua di Parma
review_content: I am a fragrance lover and citrus is one of my absolute favorite scent families, and Fico di Amalfi La Riserva from Acqua Di Parma totally delivers all of my citrus dreams! It is the most realistic citrus perfume I have ever smelled. I grow lemons and grapefruits in my yard, and this smells EXACTLY like freshly picked citrus, even with a hint of the green leaves and blossoms. I have no idea how they did it. I like that it is citrus-y without being sickly sweet–it’s like a grown-up summer scent. I think the fig in this really helps. It adds such a nice creamy background note that helps balance everything together. It’s definitely there, but I wouldn’t say this is a fig-forward scent. I think this is a pretty true unisex fragrance, it maybe leans slightly feminine but really anyone would smell great wearing this. It has nice projection, and I found it lasted over 8 hours on me. It is a unique take on citrus in my collection and I’m loving it! Note: I received this product as a part of an educational promotion.

product_name: Fico di Amalfi La Riserva Acqua di Parma
review_content: I am blown away with this scent, this is unique and The notes blend so well together. The top notes are so magical, with grapefruit blood, orange, Italian, Mandarin and lemon. This scent reminds me of a stroll on the Amalfi coast, it makes me feel carefree and relaxed. This also has an elegant sense to it, with the other notes like fig and Tonka bean, making it a bit sophisticated. I get multiple compliments when wearing this and I love that it is not a blend that you can find easily. The bottle is such a beautiful blue and makes for great decor as well. I am impressed with how long this wears and a little bit does go a long way. This seems to be more on the stronger side but I like that so personally I have no issue with that. This brand has exceeded my expectations and I highly recommend this to anyone if the notes sound intriguing. I received this as a part of an educational promotion.

product_name: Fico di Amalfi La Riserva Acqua di Parma
review_content: I received this perfume in exchange for my honest review. I love it! I love a good marine scent that is fresh and fun. This is a great unisex perfume and reminds me of vacation. I don’t like flowery scents so this is perfect for me. It smells rich and I would purchase it again.

product_name: Fico di Amalfi La Riserva Acqua di Parma
review_content: This was my first experience with Aqua di Parma perfume. I’ve heard a lot about this brand and wanted to give it a try! I put my hands on their new Fico di Amalfi La Riserva, which truly embodies the spirit of Italy. The top notes are citrusy, with blood orange, grapefruit, Italian mandarin, and lemon, which I enjoy for their sweet freshness. The middle notes feature fig, orris, and more lemon, while the base notes include tonka bean, orcanox, and ambrettolide, giving a powdery, musky finish. The scent is quite rich and lasts the whole day. It's a unisex fragrance suitable for both men and women. Personally, I find it a bit strong; I prefer lighter, more refreshing scents. Still, it’s an excellent perfume, especially for the fall and winter seasons. I received this product in exchange for my honest review.

product_name: Fico di Amalfi La Riserva Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I’ve received this product in exchange for my honest review. Acqua di Parma’s Fico di Amalfi La Riserva feels like a sunlit stroll along the Italian coast—fresh, sophisticated, and effortlessly elegant. The scent opens with a burst of juicy fig and citrus, instantly uplifting and bright, like sea breeze brushing against sun-warmed skin. As it settles, notes of pink pepper, jasmine, and cedarwood create a beautiful balance between fruity sweetness and woody depth, making it feel both luxurious and comforting.

The texture of the scent is airy yet full-bodied—it lingers softly but leaves a clean, memorable trail. I also adore the packaging: that signature Acqua di Parma bottle with its timeless blue hue captures the Mediterranean spirit perfectly. Though it’s definitely a splurge, the value lies in the quality and craftsmanship—it’s refined, unique, and long-lasting on both skin and fabric.

product_name: Fico di Amalfi La Riserva Acqua di Parma
review_content: This is my first time trying a perfume from this brand. It is a luxury product so I had high expectations and it did not disappoint! I’ve never tried a unisex fragrance before but I thought it did lean more on the feminine side. It is a very unique scent! I don’t have anything like it. It starts out with a citrusy, fresh clean scent with an edge of sweetness. As time goes on, the sweetness becomes more prominent. Even though it is a fig based scent, it’s not heavy or overly sweet like others I’ve tried. It feels modern and elegant. The bottle is beautiful, dark blue with a sleek glass design. I think it would be perfect for spring and summer! It feels too bright for winter but would be better for warmer weather. Overall, I’m very happy to add this to my collection! It’s really one of a kind! I received this as a part of an educational promotion.

product_name: Fico di Amalfi La Riserva Acqua di Parma
review_content: TF is going on with the fake reviews lol. "I received this as part of an educational promotion" and it's from a bunch of accounts that were created just for this fragrance. Like I'm sure this cologne smells amazing, but why the fake reviews

product_name: Fico di Amalfi La Riserva Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Acqua Di Parma Fico di Amalfi La Riserva instantly brought me back to summers on the Mediterranean, where my grandmother grew the most beautiful fig trees. We’d spend long afternoons under the sun eating fresh figs, and this scent captures that memory perfectly, with the ripe fruit, the salty sea breeze, and the brightness of citrus in the air.

The opening is radiant and joyful, with notes of mandarin, blood orange, grapefruit, and lemon that smell like pure sunshine. Then the fig takes the lead, creamy, green, and softly sweet. As it settles on my skin, tones of tonka bean and musks add warmth and depth, making it feel both comforting and quietly luxurious.

What I love most is how balanced it feels. It’s fresh without being sharp, warm without being heavy, and completely unisex. It’s one of those scents that instantly lifts my mood and works just as well for daytime as it does for evening events.

The packaging deserves a mention too. The deep blue glass bottle and box are stunning, simple yet refined, and perfectly capture the Mediterranean spirit that inspires this fragrance.

I received this as part of an educational promotion.

product_name: Fico di Amalfi La Riserva Acqua di Parma
review_content: I think this is one of the best summer fragrances I’ve tried lately. It opens with this bright mix of citrus and fig that instantly reminds me of being on the coast somewhere warm. It feels fresh and clean, but there’s a sweetness from the fig that makes it a little different from your typical citrus scent. As it settles on my skin, it gets warmer and slightly woodier, which gives it a more sophisticated, almost relaxing vibe. I’d say it’s unisex but leans just a touch masculine. What really impressed me is how long it lasts. I can still smell it on my skin hours later, even after being out in the heat. It’s not overpowering, just consistently pleasant and refreshing. To me, this feels like a “vacation in a bottle” kind of fragrance. It's perfect for daytime, but it transitions nicely into the evening too. If you want something fresh that still feels luxurious and long lasting, this one’s worth checking out. Received as a part of an educational promotion.

product_name: Fico di Amalfi La Riserva Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I’ve always been drawn to fragrances that tell a story, and Acqua di Parma’s Fico di Amalfi does exactly that. From the moment I first spritzed it, I was whisked away to a villa overlooking the Mediterranean, the air thick with the scent of ripening fruit and the salty spray of the sea. This isn't just a perfume; it's an olfactory vacation.
The opening is an absolute burst of sunshine. The Italian Lemon and Bergamot are so bright and zesty, they immediately wake up your senses.
