It’s like taking a bite into a perfectly ripe citrus fruit, with that invigorating tang that’s both fresh and sophisticated. But the real star of the show, the element that truly sets this fragrance apart, is the fig.
Acqua di Parma has managed to capture the fig in its most beautiful form. It’s not overly sweet or syrupy, but rather a nuanced, creamy, and slightly green aroma that feels incredibly natural. It has a velvety smoothness that balances the initial citrus burst beautifully. You can almost feel the soft, yielding texture of the fig skin.

product_name: Fico di Amalfi La Riserva Acqua di Parma
review_content: This perfume took me some time to understand, but in the end, I decided I really enjoy it. It feels deep, mysterious, and luxurious, yet it has the strong citrus notes giving it a light more airy feel. I think having the combination of these two things make it an excellent spring and summer scent. I think it can also play well both day and night time wear. When I smell this, I think of going out to dinner, somewhere fancy, at a resort after spending a full day on the beach. That fresh, but fancy feeling of a Mediterranean vacation. Additionally, the atomizer for this bottle is excellent and very high quality. The bottle design is also fabulous, and I feel the deep yet bold blue color of the bottle actually matches the scent quite well. It also lasts a long time and has a small radius of projection, which is how I prefer my scents to wear. Lastly, this fragrance is truly unisex and I think it fits any gender well. This was received as part of an educational promotion.

product_name: Fico di Amalfi La Riserva Acqua di Parma
review_content: Fico di Amalfi La Riserva Acqua di Parma is a great unisex perfume. It smells green, lightly soapy, and like a juicy grapefruit peel. There's a slight bitter note that really amps up the complexity. The fragrance is stereotypical masculine, but it's a little more fresh than just standard musk. The warmth makes it's a great daily perfume for the colder seasons. And the bright citrus notes match well for spring and summer. This scent would be a hit all year-round. As a woman who doesn't like gourmands, I really enjoyed this one. It's genderless and doesn't smell too sweet or too cologne-like. The lasting power is great. I can still smell it at the end of my work day after applying it in the morning. It's timeless and an instant classic for me. Product was received as part of an educational promotion.

product_name: Fico di Amalfi La Riserva Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I am hard to please when it comes to fragrances with dominant fig notes but Fico di Amalfi La Riserva Acqua di Parma pleasantly surprised me. It opens up with a juicy citrus (slightly bitter) blend: blood orange, mandarin, lemon, and grapefruit. Very citrusy, botanical, and warm.
Fig notes come throughout mostly as the fragrance settles down on the skin. It’s creamy, earthy, and slightly sweet. Amber notes add some powdery notes to it. The dry down is slightly warmer, soapy, and a tad bit masculine but still with the fresh and zesty DNA from the initial spray.
It’s a unique, genderless perfume. It’s perfectly embodied Italian essence. I can see myself wearing this fragrance in early spring, fall, and winter. The projection is outstanding and the scent lasts all day on me. One spritz is so powerful.
Fico di Amalfi La Riserva Acqua di Parma is an elegant, timeless, and refined fragrance. I received this fragrance as part of an educational promotion

product_name: Fico di Amalfi La Riserva Acqua di Parma
review_content: This is a beautifully well done fragrance! That blood orange note is so bright and fresh in the opening, this is a fruity and airy citrus perfume. This scent feels perfect for spring and summer, I can see myself wearing during fall time as well. The bottle is such a beautiful blue color! The projection is great, and the scent lasts for 8 plus hours on my skin. I could still smell this at the end of the day! I received this as a part of an educational promotion.

product_name: Fico di Amalfi La Riserva Acqua di Parma
review_content: Okay I’m a huuuge fig fan especially when it comes to perfumes. So I was very excited to try this scent. Fico Di Amalfi is like a citrus explosion! It’s light, it’s fresh, it’s airy perfect for summer and spring in my opinion. I definitely smell the lemon and citron notes the most followed by the fig note. I love how they included the fig tree note as well because it brings a slightly creamy note to the whole vibe. This is a perfume I could see myself reaching for on a trip to the beach with the wind whipping and the sun glaring. The longevity is about 6 hours I would say and the sillage is decent. Of course it lasts longer on clothes than skin. I think layering this with a creamy scent with a watery coconut note would elevate this and tone down the citrus a bit bringing a cozy touch. product was received as part of an educational promotion.

product_name: Fico di Amalfi La Riserva Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Wow… this scent feels like summer on the Amalfi coast bottled up. The first spray bursts with juicy citrus — blood orange, mandarin, and grapefruit dancing together. It’s so bright and happy, yet elegant.

As it settles, that creamy fig and soft iris appear — smooth, a little powdery, but still fresh. The dry down is my favorite part… warm vanilla and amber notes gently wrap everything in comfort, like golden sunlight on skin after a swim.

It’s perfectly balanced — fresh yet cozy, unisex but personal. I can smell the craftsmanship in every layer. 💛

If you love citrus with depth and sophistication, this one’s truly special.
Rating: 9/10 — timeless, luminous, and addictive.

Product was gifted to me

product_name: Fico di Amalfi La Riserva Acqua di Parma
review_content:
This perfume by Acqua Di Parma smells like an absolute dream. I only have to spray it once or twice and it lasts all day on my skin. I love that it has many different types of scents that blend beautifully together. It has hints of citrus as well as wood making it last long and feel rich and luxurious on my skin.
I love how versatile it is, i’m able to wear it in the day or night time whenever I want to stand out. I also love that my husband is able to wear it as well, and it smells differently on us. I love how sleek and sophisticated the packaging is. I would absolutely recommend this perfume to anyone (men or women). It’s not an overpowering scent but just the right amount, I have gotten so many compliments on this already. I was gifted this product in exchange for my honest review.

product_name: Fico di Amalfi La Riserva Acqua di Parma
review_content: Fico di Amalfi La Riserva by Acqua di Parma feels like a sunny escape to the Italian coast in a bottle. The scent opens with a burst of fresh citrus that instantly lifts your mood and slowly blends into a soft mix of fig and floral notes that feel both natural and elegant. There is a gentle sweetness wrapped in warm amber and a hint of vanilla that makes it smooth and comforting without being heavy. It smells clean and luxurious, the kind of fragrance that feels effortless but leaves a lasting impression. The balance of fruity and woody notes gives it depth, while the citrus keeps it light and refreshing all day. It lasts well on the skin and settles beautifully into a creamy, soft finish that feels warm against the air. The blue bottle looks stunning and matches the feeling of calm, ocean freshness inside. It is a fragrance that works for any season and any moment when you want to feel bright, confident, and refined. Every spray reminds you of summer by the sea and the quiet beauty of the Amalfi Coast.

product_name: Fico di Amalfi La Riserva Acqua di Parma
review_content: received as a part of an educational promotion. This perfume smells so nice and classy. It has a warm scent to it and fits perfectly for the colder months. It has me feeling like it’s a great winter scent or for a night out. It just gives cozy vibes when I smell it but also still in a classy way where it smells really nice. Would make a great gift also with the holiday season coming up!

product_name: Fico di Amalfi La Riserva Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I was on the hunt for a nice unisex fragrance that my male partner and I could both enjoy and I think Fico Di Amalfi is it. This reminds me of those clean and alluring unisex fragrances of the 90's. This has fresh and sparkling notes of citrus with slight hints of fig that does not leave you smelling too sweet or too spicy like a seasoning rack. This fragrance is like drinking an Aperol Spritz on the coast of Italy. This Italian fragrance is strong but balanced and fresh. You can definitely notice light scent trail in the most pleasant way but most importantly it does not smack you in the head with nausea like a side of bricks laced with herbal aftershave. It leaves an such an uplifting scent experience of sparkling citrus. This fragrance is powerful but in a sophisticated and restrained way, it does have staying power for an entire day. Aqua Di Parma has such gorgeous packaging, from the ocean blue bottle to the luxurious cylinder box. As a woman, I did enjoy this fragrance very much (it also layers nicely with florals) and partner gives it two thumbs up as well.
I received this as a part of an educational promotion.

product_name: Fico di Amalfi La Riserva Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Successful blind buy! This actually smelt the way I imagined it (if that makes sense) Fresh juicy figgy goodness in a bottle with a good amount of density. People say the EDT doesn’t last but this new EDP line has good longevity with good sillage. It lasted a full workday for me and was still going when I got home. I’d say it can be worn all year around but it definitely shines in the summer heat.

I’m surprised this isn’t getting more love. Honestly guys, do yourself a favour and grab a bottle of this stuff before they discontinue it. It’s absolutely gorgeous!

product_name: Fico di Amalfi La Riserva Acqua di Parma
review_content: This is beautiful, but until the price calms downs I woll just stick to the D&G releashes, namely LB capri in love. Same sweet fig greenish vibe, but at a fraction of the price. Side by side to the original it is: More fig, less citruses, less uplifting, heavier, vanillic, and sweeter.

product_name: Fico di Amalfi La Riserva Acqua di Parma
review_content:
This is lovely. The initial scent after just applying it is what remains of the original Fico di Amalfi edt after a few hours (when you can usually barely detect it). Less of a fresh citrus, but the blood orange does make it quite sweet. Its also deeper sweeter and greener then the original. Performance and projection are solid and this is a obvious upgrade compared to the edt. I'd say this is a unisex fragrance, like the original. My gf says it is too manly for her to consider wearing.

I got my 50ml bottle for 110€ at a discounter, would buy this everytime over the edt.

product_name: Fico di Amalfi La Riserva Acqua di Parma
review_content: I really love this one, but the price is insane for what it is! It’s a hard pass until the price comes down.

product_name: Fico di Amalfi La Riserva Acqua di Parma
review_content: This is too powdery and vanillic. Not fresh. Does not smell masculine. I prefer the original

product_name: Fico di Amalfi La Riserva Acqua di Parma
review_content:
This one smells magical, inviting you to a land of secret whispers and unexpected charm!

It's probably 70% similar to the OG, with a much more sparkly top, and a surprise transition to the warmer mid and base, and the lemon in the mid keeps the freshness going for much longer. Absolutely divine and totally worth the full bottle price. The OG does smell fresher, but is also a lot more linear, the LR is darker, more intriguing, smoother, sexier AND can smartly bridge a hot summer day into a cooler afternoon/evening!

Having said this, I agree with those reviews that say this veers away from fig. This smells fantastic, but fig is just playing around the edges of the scent, so bring an open mind and be ready to have your socks knocked off!

And just think about it, you really need to suffer from some sort of mental disorder to "hate" this... =)))

product_name: Fico di Amalfi La Riserva Acqua di Parma
review_content:
This one has a minty note. Slightly, but it's there, like spearmint toothpaste.
So if you're not a fan of mint, then I strongly recommend you try a sample first.
I'm a big fan of the original Fico di Amalfi though.

product_name: Fico di Amalfi La Riserva Acqua di Parma
review_content: Just got this today. I was always a fan of the original Fico but like the rest of the Blu range found its performance lacking. They’ve seem to have sorted that with the Riserva range. It’s not a more powerful dupe of the original, it feels a bit darker, more intriguing, but still has the beautiful fig note. A sure fire winner for me.

product_name: Fico di Amalfi La Riserva Acqua di Parma
review_content: I don’t get the hype. Smells like Avgoustous, but more fresh in the beginning. This is NOT a fig perfume. Too musky:(

product_name: Fico di Amalfi La Riserva Acqua di Parma
review_content: Really nice!! Tried in store, Surprisingly good performance and projection, kept getting whifts of it through out the day!! some here saying there isn't is surprising?? I might get a bottle of this

product_name: Fico di Amalfi La Riserva Acqua di Parma
review_content: Nice scent, but weak, more feminine.

product_name: Fico di Amalfi La Riserva Acqua di Parma
review_content: The opening is not the same as the original but the dry down is 90% but way stronger. The beauty of the fragrance is all in the dry down. Don’t expect the same opening that the original gives, non the less this is an amazing and addictive fragrance. It reminds me of Gris charnel but made in a way that suits me more.

product_name: Fico di Amalfi La Riserva Acqua di Parma
review_content: I find notes like orris and ambrettolide a bit challenging to wear personally so I'll stick to the original which I do not mind re-applying and lasts 2 hours on me anyway. I don't usually like orris with fresh notes but it's absolutely magnificent in another fig perfume, Fig de Nuit by Carl Kling, which is a darker, milky fig and nice unisex scent.

product_name: Fico di Amalfi La Riserva Acqua di Parma
review_content: Does this smell like polo red parfum by chance?

product_name: Fico di Amalfi La Riserva Acqua di Parma
review_content: much denser version of fico. got samples of both from adp counter.

product_name: Fico di Amalfi La Riserva Acqua di Parma
review_content: New addition to my collection, had a sniff of this last week in H Beauty but because it's so new there is little option for testers or decants. I liked it enough on that first sniff to buy a 50ml ( with a discount from Escentual) & so far I'm really impressed. I have shied away from ADP due to longevity issues with their EDT, this is EDP strength & is definitely hanging around. I don't think I can pick out the individual fruits but more just a collection of citrus, the fig & a bit of sweetness from the Tonka. I'd pretty much say that if you liked the OG then this is pretty much blind buy worthy.

product_name: Fico di Amalfi La Riserva Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Classy summer in a bottle.
Last 6+ hours but goes close to the skin (or I go nose blind).
I get a coconut vibe from it

Picked up a180ml for £200 so not that expensive either.

product_name: Fico di Amalfi La Riserva Acqua di Parma
review_content: Got my bottle two days ago and I can confirm it’s less of a fresh juicy fig and more of a buttery sweet scent.Smells awesome.Sprayed some after a shower and performance wise I am a little bit worried.Will continue testing tomorrow under this Miami hot and humid weather.

product_name: Fico di Amalfi La Riserva Acqua di Parma
review_content: I had the opportunity to sample Fico di Amalfi and Arancia di Capri La Reserva before launch, thanks to my best friend that bought Fico La Reserva at her last vacation travel to Miami, she gifted me two 5ml decants that the sales representative gave her, and I can say from the two this is the one I liked the most. The base notes makes Fico di Amalfi mor deep a little bit tart with a vanillic undertone, definitely sweeter, its less fresh and transparent, but richer and long lasting. The base notes provide the foundations to make this fragrance outlast its predecesor lasting between 6-8 hrs and it has a beautiful sillage. I can picture my self using it on spring and summer nights, it might be to sweet for me in the high summer. Beautiful Beautiful scent, full bottle worthy. It a Acqua di Parma can do nothing wrong in my eyes.

product_name: Fico di Amalfi La Riserva Acqua di Parma
review_content: Had the distinct pleasure of sampling this today and all I can say is “WOW”. I love, love, love the original fig and this might come close to being even more of a favorite. The woods mixed with the fig is exceptional. They mesh together in ways I wasn’t expecting. I can’t wait for the release and will definitely purchase. Unisex and beautiful!

product_name: Mirto di Panarea Limited Edition Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I expected at least a EDP concentration of this wonderful fragrance...
I am a fan but..this is nothing new actually.
I skip.

product_name: Mirto di Panarea Limited Edition Acqua di Parma
review_content: Nothing new indeed.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Gelsomino Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content: Acqua di Parma’s Gelsomino Nobile is a delicious, bright and luminous jasmine fragrance that’s fresh, decidedly feminine, and smooth. The green opening and floral heart notes feel lively and natural. It’s a well-balanced scent with good projection and longevity. It’s also easy to wear and versatile - a great option for spring and summer. 💛

product_name: Acqua di Parma Gelsomino Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content:
One that made me fall in love with perfume. My large collection started because of this. This is the most beautiful, elegant and feminine scent. Only perfume that got me constant compliment. It is not loud, but people can smell you when they are close. I have not smelled anything similar yet. It smells a bit like Jasmin tea without the bitterness.

It only lasts couple hours and I usually spray 8-10.

I only have a few drops left of it and I will cherish it forever. I'm so sad it's discontinued.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Gelsomino Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content: This is my go-to spring/summer scent! It's so fresh and floral, but not overpowering. The mandarin orange and pink pepper give it a lovely brightness, while the jasmine, tuberose and orange blossom create this beautiful, sophisticated floral heart. It lasts all day and gets compliments everywhere I go.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Gelsomino Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I wish I bought a backup bottle as soon as I found out they were discontinuing this and Iris Nobile. I have all five EDPs from the line and they went and discontinued my two favorites. At least I have Iris backups.
I love jasmine in all it's many forms. This is my special "Italian chic" jasmine. It's crisp and not as heady as one would associate with a white floral. While it can be worn all year, it shines best in the warmth of spring and early summer. Of course I blame LVMH for the decision to discontinue. I am going to have to be selective about when I choose to wear this, and do my best to preserve the quality of what remains now. There's no use in complaining about it. LVMH makes decisions based strictly on the bottom line, do once a fragrance is gone, it's gone. I see it is now selling on eBay in the $450 range. That should tell them something about the demand. If they had to "break up the band", any of the remaining three would have been fine for me, especially the Peony and Rose, which smell almost exactly the same in my opinion.

EDIT - I see I already commented on my disappointment over this discontinuation. I almost deleted my new entry, but I'll let it stand as a testament to my frustration over the loss! 🌸

product_name: Acqua di Parma Gelsomino Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content: On me this leans more masculine, I'm getting a lot of a herbal/woody scent, citrus, but no discernible jasmine. Very fresh and nice enough but I'm disappointed after reading the reviews saying it was very floral and feminine!

product_name: Acqua di Parma Gelsomino Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I'm a wee bit surprised to be writing such a favorable review. Normally citrus fragrances don't last at all - on me or most anyone, methinks. Here we have a floral that begins as a strong citrus and lingers with good musk and white florals. The top notes are happy and airy. I was told, 'That's pretty' by a discriminating friend. She was right! The base notes are quiet, but last through most of the day. The overall impression on me at this point is a modest, gentle rendition of Paul Sebastian Design. I adore Design, even if it's a beast by modern standards. In Design the top notes are loud and the base notes more restrained, if opinionated!

My overall conclusion is that the sophisticated citrus opening of Gelsomino is a delight. The base is surprisingly long lived, but as a white floral-musk, perhaps inferior to my all-time favorite in this category - budget winner Paul Sebastian Design.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Gelsomino Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content: For me Gelsomino Nobile is quite heavy on the neroli for my liking. I know it isn't listed in the above accords but I smell it all the same. Real orange blossom is very sweet and there is not much sweetness in this perfume. This perfume is ultra fresh. Green Jasmine sambac, tuberose, petigrain, neroli, slight orange blossom. Very tart and a bit headache inducing for me. There are much better jasmines out there than this. Patou's Joy, Chanel's Allure edt, Isabey's Route de Emeraude. Just to name a few. I swear this perfume smells like a glass of tang orange drink w/ some of the sugar taken out of it. I remember the smell vividly, my father used to drink gallons of it, and I despised it. Just downgraded this to a dislike. This smells like tang orange drink w/ white flowers ground into it. Very headache inducing for me. I can see why they discontinued this. I wouldn't buy it. The only thing from this line that I liked was the peony and I have a better peony from Caswell and Massey.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Gelsomino Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content: Have to say it. The decision to discontinue this and Iris Nobile is a crime. This is a stunning jasmine, and I consider the release of Iris to have been an industry game changer. I have all five, and these two are my faves. Magnolia is in the middle, and I can completely do without Rosa and Peonia if I wasn't such a freak about owing collections!!

product_name: Acqua di Parma Gelsomino Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I have several aqua di Parma Nobile line perfumes, also magnolia and peony but Gelsomino is my favorite. It has some sparkle to it that makes it so perfect. Not sure if it’s the pepper or something else but it makes this perfume so distinguished and yes, noble.

Sadly, it’s discontinued and my bottle is almost finished too… so I’m trying to save it.

And no, I don’t think Grand Ball by Dior is similar. Yeah, white flowers and all but they’re sooooo different. I have an old Grand Bal version (2014 maybe?) and it’s much more sweet and smooth, it’s a night scent where Gelsomino has some peppery freshness and sparkling to it and could be an every day perfume.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Gelsomino Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content: I adore this scent. It's long-lasting - and when I get a whiff of it, I automatically smile. It makes me feel like I'm in an Italian garden! Floral, jasmine and a whiff of peony, but the cedar cools it down, so it's not too sweet. Love.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Gelsomino Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Naturalistic jasmine, and funnily enough, a lilac note. During the dry-down, a very pleasing depth and richness start to emerge. Now I detect an aroma redolent of tea – the kind of tea-like note I would love to find in a fragrance, but ironically, thus far in my explorations of actual "tea"-inspired scents, have not yet encountered...

I wouldn't buy this, as it skews too sweet and feminine for my tastes. I also prefer a "cool" if not outright "cold" scent, and this is decidedly warm. The tea-like depth during the dry-down intrigued me, though.

I enjoyed this very much, although it is not my usual sort of fragrance. I can imagine a mature and elegant older woman wearing this. Good sillage and longevity, lasting several hours and even overnight.

It is an exceedingly pleasant fragrance, overall. I'd be delighted to smell it on somebody else, and will certainly be interested in sampling other offerings from this house.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Gelsomino Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content:
-Opens mild and sweet smelling in a natural, understated way.
-Unremarkable scent.
-Evolves to become a slightly spicy scent as it dries down. (Could it be the pink pepper?)
-Not fbw. (-)

product_name: Acqua di Parma Gelsomino Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content:
The best caption of jasmine, ever!!!!! It intoxicates and transports me to places. Not dirty, not earthy, nothing animalic. Just pure flower of jasmine with all its natural sweetness.
How could they discontinue this one??? This and the Iris is best of Parma range, yet those two who had to go?!!!
As far as I know there is nothing like this on the market.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Gelsomino Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content: On initial spray, this reminds me of the princess jasmine doll that you fill up with perfume. I had one as a child. Then about 5 mins in I smell more of the mandarine. Jasmine often turnS air freshener/laundry detergent on my skin. This one is no exception. It smells nice but more like a home fragrance on my skin. I really like the initial smell though. I may need to try it on clothes and see how it does.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Gelsomino Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content: This was given to me as a gift. I don't know how they did it but Gelsomino Nobile does not give me the vibe of an artificial fragrance; the scent captures the real smell of a big bouquet of fresh flowers. When I spray it I get taken away to nature to a grassy mountain top or perhaps an open field of flowers in the early morning with dew drops covering the petals.. Idk. The bottom line is it's like the real thing in a bottle. Despite that, I don't think it's my style so I'm giving it away to someone who hopefully appreciates the smell of flowers.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Gelsomino Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Anonymous white floral. Not terrible, not particularily good. Incredibly inoffensive and therefore pretty darn boring.
There are so many white florals that are far more interesting than this one.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Gelsomino Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Usually I am not a fan of white florals. And I thought I don't like jasmine. But somehow I ended up buying a 50ml bottle. Jasmine is so young and fresh, not irritating.
When I first tried it in the shop, it was raining and +14C outside. Was impressed by longetivity that day.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Gelsomino Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content:
8 sprays - chest, wrists, neck, hair

Initial impression was wow what is that. It strangely smells white floral like Jasmine, and leather, but not the light but sharp leather from perfumes like AP Maitrese. This is strong and projects. My husband was able to smell me about 15 feet away, and asked what the scent was.

5min- the Jasmine/leather note still continues. The cedar provides the scent an incredible masculine edge. Coworker also says it smells lovely.

30 min- the scent is linear but wonderful. It's unique, feminine, but very edgy.

1hr- the Jasmine leather note continues. I can detect the mandarin slightly.

3hrs- Still going strong with the edgy Jasmine, Mandarin, and the leather note that I smell. On a business flight, and the gentleman next to me in the plane says I smell amazing and asks me what I'm wearing. The male air hostess agrees. I've never been complimented this quickly by strangers on a perfume. Probably one of the sexiest scents I've smelled. It reminds me of TM Alien, but with a twist on the Jasmine. It's got the woodiness in the Jasmine like Alien, which I think is from the cedar, but the mandarin orange adds something spectacular. It's equally sexy to alien (if not sexier).

5hr- The scent is still going although a bit lighter and the cedar has come out more while the Jasmine had faded a bit. I'm still in love.

8hr- Scent has died quite a bit but the cedar notes are still there. I can't smell it much, but cohort who was 3 feet away says she smelled it.

10hrs- The fragrance has completely died, or so I thought. I step out outside to get to my hotel, and suddenly smell a metallic Jasmine. Looks like it's still lingering.

Smell: 9.5/10 (so fresh, woody, and unique)
Sillage: 9/10 (you will leave a trail, and many will get waves of it when you move)
Longevity: 9/10 (lasted 10 hours despite scent becoming faint)

Conclusion: I love this as Alien was one of my favorite perfumes until too many girls began wearing it. This is equally sexy but with an edge. It's not as long lasting as Alien, however longer lasting than most perfumes.

Amazing perfume!

product_name: Acqua di Parma Gelsomino Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Just received a bottle of this beautiful, Italian, golden sunshine! What a gorgeous, clean jasmine. It's jasmine right from the top. Oddly, to me it seems that the mandarin only begins to peek through as it starts to dry down slightly, perhaps augmented by the orange blossom. I do not get any pepper at all! I need to wear this a few more times to get a really sense of the structure, but this has already replaced Ikat Jasmine as my go to summer jasmine scent. I love it!!

EDIT - Ooooh! Here comes the tuberose, and she is actually behaving!!

product_name: Acqua di Parma Gelsomino Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content: Second review: I know I said in the first review that it's not complex enough to buy it. I was wrong, not everything has to be complex. But, I found it at a very good price, almost 50%off, so I ordered it after I sprayed myself with the last drops of my sample. Literally minutes after I confirmed the order, my father calls me to say that my mother is having a stroke and we took her to the hospital. I hope I'm not going to have bad memories with this, mother is ok now, but it was remarkable how I contained myself during the emergency state, and part of it I attribute to Gelsomino, I felt extremely confident and hopeful that everything will be ok, that's just a bad dream that I can control and make things better. 3-4 days after the event I was craving it like crazy, I had olfactory hallucinations/impressions that I smell it without the smell being present. My yard is filled with beautiful honeysuckle now and somehow it reminds me of Gelsomino, without smelling like it.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Gelsomino Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content: Nice jasmin, pretty much a soliflower on my skin. Sillage is close to skin, longevity is good. I think its a nice sophisticated fragrance but for the price tag I was expecting something more complex and outstanding. If I ever want a jasmin perfume I would probably get Ellie Saab or Alien instead of this.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Gelsomino Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content:
To me this smells a lot like a more floral/less fruity version of Le Parfum de Therese from Frederic Malle/Edmond Roudnitska.
Longevity and projection are both good.
I don't think I would categorize this as a floral woody musk though...
I mean, I know there's musk and woody notes in this, but the fruity/flowery notes really dominates. (Which isn't necessarily a bad thing)!
A very nice scent overall!

product_name: Acqua di Parma Gelsomino Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Floral. Delicate. Not unisex. Feminine.
Staying power is LOW. I usually wear 1-2 sprays. I bath myself in it and barely can smell it. It is not an EDP strength! For this reason it is overpriced.
Linear. No development. Pretty though.
Official sample.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Gelsomino Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content:
For some reason, it smells like warm creamy jasmine 'tea' to me. Very calming. I don't get that crisp of real flower. It's richer & bold.
Last 8 hours with moderate to good projection. Just two sprays is enough to smell myself quite strong for hours. Will get headache if you over spray

product_name: Acqua di Parma Gelsomino Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content: Lovely fragrance! It smells very natural, creamy, you feel like you can almost touch the petals of the flowers! It projects very well and it is rich and elegant. One of the best white florals out there! For fans of white flowers, a must try!

product_name: Acqua di Parma Gelsomino Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content:
This an extremely pretty but ephemeral scent. The first few minutes are almost breathtakingly gorgeous and complex, but as it wears it loses a lot of that complexity and dries down into a nice but slightly nondescript soft white floral sitting very close to the skin.

I raced through my 50ml bottle of this, as the longevity isn't great, but also because its one of the few white flower fragrances that I own that is truly daytime and office appropriate and isn't going to offend anyone.

To my nose it is not heady enough to truly be called a Night-Flowering Jasmine scent- I would describe the overall impression to be more a of a combination of lovely light and wearable white flowers. In summary - very lovely but not a repeat purchase for me.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Gelsomino Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I am a little saddened by my bottle.
I must have stored it in a place close to heat for the longest time before I realised the beauty of gelsomino was gone and I was left with an aldehydic tuberose.
Am I gutted or what?
I so love this fragrance.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Gelsomino Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I'm steadily working my way through an enormous stash of long-neglected samples, and I'm at the point now where I'm mostly testing samples I got by accident and wouldn't have picked out for myself in most cases. So I find myself sounding like a broken record in my reviews lately, and this one is no exception: this is great, I really like it, but it's not for me.

It definitely is for you if you're a lover of white florals, though, at least worth a try! The opening especially is lovely: all the white flowers are so lush and lifelike then, and the dominant tuberose is the very best kind, not too loud or overwhelming. The drydown is soft and creamy, and very nice as well. The only negative is that it doesn't project very well after the first opening: for most of the day I didn't stop to notice I was wearing any scent at all, which is rare for me.

But in the end, it's the same as usual: it's rare for me to really fall for any scent in this category, and Gelsomino Nobile isn't one of those rare exceptions either.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Gelsomino Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content: Bright fruity floral. I don't normally like fruity florals but this one is a winner! I do, however, love big, unashamed florals and Gelsomino Nobile has that in spades. The jasmine is rich and sweet, accented by the juicy orange. Not really complex or challenging but it's a lovely, happy fragrance. It does kind of collapse in the drydown. It lacks any longevity, and quickly loses the big jasmine and orange, fading into a light, rather pedestrian pink pepper musk. The opening is really wonderful though. Happy jasmine.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Gelsomino Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content:
This is a crisp, fresh and festive jasmine with some green undertones.
Gelsomino Nobile takes me to a royal garden on a chill spring morning, in another era, where time stands still. A lemonade is waiting for me, but I don't care as I'm completely absorbed by a herbarium and some old books.
I don't find it vintage, or old school, but there is something timeless and carefree in it and I blame the natural, high quality ingredients.
Not creamy, gently sweet-but it's an elusive sweetness, genderless - because I cannot describe the woman wearing this, she's not vulgar, nor is she innocent, she doesn't want to stand out, yet utterly beautiful, you have no choice but to admire her because you cannot get close to her.
Not enough complexity for a full bottle, I would have enjoyed more richness to it, although it has a weird aftersmell (I don't know if that's a thing), like the first breath of air is sweet after you take your nose out of your arm.
Longevity 6-8h, soft sillage for 2-3h.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Gelsomino Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content: I met him in Paris, in the loveliest Le Marais near place des Vosges. He was Italian, but he felt free competing with French. He was so luxurious, rich, vivid and full of life, straight and clear but not simple, very complicated and intelligent, one of a kind I had loved and always looked for. This is very important he was resistant. Many of that kind couldn’t handle my hot skin and disappeared, but he stayed filling all the surrounding. He suited me and resembled me so much, but I wasn’t sure about that from the first sight. We were together for some time, then I promised to come back one day. I did. We met in Paris again, in Italy, he even came to Kyiv (who could expect!). But… you know, there are so many new tempting meetings, I can’t and don’t want to avoid them. I’ve got a new girlfriend Juliette who Has a Gun, I can play different roles with her, being Romantina, Lady Vengeance or even Mad Madame. And others… But there is something special between us, a strong connection, he reflects me perfectly. So we are keeping in touch. His name is Gelsomino. He is Nobile. Gelsomino Nobile, Acqua di Parma

product_name: Acqua di Parma Gelsomino Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Gelsomino Nobile didn't work for me. The pink pepper note is really strong, sharp and throat-scratching in this, or at least I perceive it that way, especially in the opening.
The floral notes are clean and creamy. They're not of the heady, hypnotic kind. Besides the titular jasmine, I can smell almost as much orange blossom. In the drydown, the base of musk and woods becomes noticeable, too.

I guess it would be a nice light floral scent, if the pepper wasn't so overwhelming to me. This even reminds me of Kersone Dirty Flower Factory, which has some of the same notes, but is even more sharp to the point of being metallic and unwearable to me. Gelsomino Nobile is like a softer, more wearable version of the same concept. Maybe I'm really sensitive to pink pepper in clean white floral perfumes, even though I generally like spicy perfumes, because other reviewers don't seem to have this problem.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Gelsomino Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Acqua di Parma's Gelsomino Nobile is an extremely pretty, delicate and airy jasmine scent. Appropriate for Spring and Summer wear, this fragrance has subtle projection and an uncomplicated scent pyramid.

This office-friendly, polished jasmine was unfortunately not quite what I was expecting. I had hoped that Gelsomino Nobile would be more sensual and rich; a jasmine fragrance with an almost fecal, indolic aroma. Gelsomino Nobile is so discreet on my skin that it barely registers.

I am a huge fan of Iris Nobile in the Eau de Parfum concentration with its elegant yet creamy take on the popular iris note. Sadly Gelsomino Nobile is nowhere near as divine as Iris Nobile, at least not in my opinion.

Gelsomino Nobile opens with crisp citrus notes and soft, ethereal jasmine. There's a tiny hint of orange blossom in the top and heart of this fragrance which provides a subtle hint of sweetness. Despite featuring a multitude of white floral accords, Gelsomino Nobile is neither buttery or creamy. If anything this fragrance is a light, clean floral.

As mentioned before, the sillage is rather soft, and the longevity decent but unfortunately not outstanding. If a demure, predictable jasmine is what you're seeking I would recommend trying Gelsomino Nobile, but if you are anything like me and enjoy richer, deeper jasmine scents, I would delve further into the niche market to find what you're looking for.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Gelsomino Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content: I feel a young, fresh jasmine. Absolutely distinct and expressive jasmine. In fact, one of the most beautiful Jasmine fragrances in perfume, at least in my opinion. I use a second bottle of this perfume, my boyfriend loves it, and he's a big fan of jasmine.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Gelsomino Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content:
This is such a gorgeous fragrance, clean and elegant white floral. It's sweet and creamy at the same time, perfect for daytime use but could also work on a summer evening, if applied more generously or potentially layered with something a bit stronger and/or more masculine. I imagine it would smell great blended with a precious woody base.

The only downside are the sillage and lasting power. But especially the sillage. Acqua di Parma is on a medium to higher end brand, so I would expect they give a little more "pump" to their fragrances. It's a pity, because this is a great and versatile perfume, smells expensive and it's a very elegant perfume even if casual, so it shouldn't become a skin scent a couple of hours after spraying.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Gelsomino Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I will start with durability - about 4/5 hours. It opens with a warm, floral chord. A little in classic, noble style. Tuberose and jasmine. Definitely. Only.
There is no pepper, no feeling at all. Mild after half an hour, does not change. For me it will be a one-off adventure. I thought I would be more delighted. I recommend to try it out. But after prolonged use, however, tuberose is not much, but there is a side of mandarin with cedar, as sour as lemon in tea.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Gelsomino Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Didn't know what to expect when trying this, at first spray it was fresh and powdery green.
Slowly the tuberose crept up on me and the rest of the white florals join.
Its different from any other white floral scent I've tried and i was pleasantly surprised.
The florals are fresh, sweet and almost minty. Not indolic or sharp at all.
I notice only a small amount of musk, cedar and pink pepper but the whole scent blends so well.
Overall its subtly sweet, bright and summery.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Gelsomino Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content: Hmmmmm...I am not sure about this one AND I haven't read all of the reviews....yet. However, this one smells like it has turned (but not a SOUR turn) or something. That was inside with a temperature around 68F. I just went outside after having spritzed it on a half hour earlier into a night temperature around 32F and it smelled a LOT lighter, but a LOT better. Going to have to play with this one and temperatures.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Gelsomino Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Pretty well done light neroli fragrance.
Italian summer in the country side.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Gelsomino Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content: Its very flowery but smells more like tiare flower which I don't like.. to me it smells burnt :/

product_name: Acqua di Parma Gelsomino Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content: To me this is a very simple but well done jasmine then citrus then tuberose scent. Stays close to the skin at the beginning but then gets a little stronger in the dry down. Definitely a summertime scent but could be day or night during that season. It smells expensive but doesn't last as long as I would like. Luckily I found a relatively inexpensive bottle on eBay. A pretty decent scent in my opinion....I can picture myself wearing this to the beach or out to dinner during summer.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Gelsomino Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content: For me this has too much pepper in. It really tickles my nose for the first 1/2 to 1hour and makes me sneeze and cough. There is a slightly weird/exotic smell in it that I can't make out what it is although I have tried lots of samples with these notes. After half an hour there is the faint smell of something I really like which is beautiful (I tend to like gentle jasmine mixed with tuberose, also orange). I can only just smell it though. It dies down to white musk then it is gone within 3hours. I know it sounds promising but the pink pepper is just too overwhelming. Not sickly but tickles my nose too much.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Gelsomino Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content:
This is a very beautiful Jasmine. Period.It is lovely in it's simplicity, a flower garden after the rain. I loved it for the 3 hours I could smell it...
then it was GONE.It reminds me of MK Glam Jasmine and I wish I would have saved some pennies and bought the MK!

product_name: Acqua di Parma Gelsomino Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content: I tried a sample at my friend's house and I am in love. Hopefully I will buy it soon ;)

product_name: Acqua di Parma Gelsomino Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I get a strong blast of mandarin upon spraying Gelsomino Nobile, and the jasmine soon joins in. The jasmine here has a very light touch of indole, and is mostly sweet, clean, with a tinge of green. Unfortunately, the sweetness of jasmine combined with mandarine, translates into hard candy on my skin, which does not feel 'noble' to me in the conventional sense.

The 'candy' association dies down after about 2 hours, and a silky bouquet of fresh jasmine and tuberose is unfolded. The fruity aspect is now kept in check. Along with the green tinge, it adorns the jasmine perfectly. Gelsomino Nobile then stays this way through the dry down, only becomes a bit warmer and more musky towards the end.

The sillage is moderate to soft, and the longevity is around 10 hours. Gelsomino Nobile is undoubtedly a very feminine and elegant rendition of fresh jasmine, and it shares a similar structure of citrus and white floral as Magnolia Nobile. However, I personally am less impressed by Gelsomino Nobile, probably because there're too many competitors among the jasmine genre. Moreover, the mandarine and sweet jasmine during the opening doesn't seem to agree with my skin chemistry. I'd recommend it as a nice and bright jasmine fragrance, but do try before buying.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Gelsomino Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content: Hmmm...nothing outstanding, nothing striking or unique or different. Its OK, its white floral, its jasmine but not over the top migraine inducing jasmine. It's lady like, elegant, wearable, but just like thousands of other nice, polite ladylike floral fragrances out there. I don't think the scent justifies the price.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Gelsomino Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content: A very simple, linear, and clean composition of white flowers. Primarily Jasmine, Tuberose, and Freesia with a hint of Lily of the Valley. I get none of the other attributed notes, but likely they are in there in minute amounts to provide some lift in the top and structure in the base. Excellent for what it is, but this comes with a high pricepoint. Similar in feel to Jo Malone fragrances....which I consider simplistic and overpriced.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Gelsomino Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content: I loved it so much so I broke down and bought it at Sephora.com and spent the $145 on it. A lot of money for me. I get some great compliments on it and I never smell myself coming or going.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Gelsomino Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content: Jasmine and tuberose is all I get with emphasis on tuberose. I really don't get any musk or woods at the base. Tuberose is one of my least liked notes so this is a dislike for me. After about 4 hours the scent is unnoticeable on my skin.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Gelsomino Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Very strong white flowers - not my cup of tea.

Väldigt starka vita blommor - inte min typ av doft.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Gelsomino Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content: During the first minute, when the alcohol evaporates, there are wafts of a very realistic orange blossom scent. As the fragrance settles down, the blossom note doesn't seem so lifelike anymore. Quite soon the fragrance turns into a generic, synthetic jasmine. It aims in being pretty but ends up just being shallow. After 12 hours the (somewhat unpleasant) fresh/white musky basenotes can still be detected when smelling up close.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Gelsomino Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Gelsomino Nobile is such a harmonious scent! I always picture blooming summer garden when I smell it. Perfection. It is sophisticated, timeless and classy perfume that will go well in any season and any time of the day. My new fav :)

Update: I'm wearing it very often now and I'm very happy with it. Got a lot of compliments from both women and men. It has moderate projection, so it's never intrusive but it lasts quite long (at least on my skin) and it is classy and very feminine scent. J'adore!

product_name: Acqua di Parma Gelsomino Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Gelsomino Nobile is quality floral in a bottle, opening with a bountiful bouquet of fresh tuberose sprays--white petals and audacious green sepals. Mandarine and pink pepper then perfectly accompany the entrance of jasmine and orange blossom.

Musk and cedar are subtle in the drydown but knit the elements together with perfectly even silk stitches.

Gelsomino Nobile culminates into an outstandingly feminine fragrance with masculine tenacity, like liquid silk that binds your wrists together in uncompromising captivity.

Bold, cool, and unequivocally well-bred. A truly hypnotic floral that knows how to wield her power.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Gelsomino Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content: Feminine, clean, and oh so floral. It smells like the ultimate garden. There is a soapy quality to it, but its more like you took a walk in a garden after a shower soapy then in the shower lathering up soapy. This for me is an "Oh Wow!" fragrance. Adore it, and would recommend for a summer wedding (as a guest or the bride!)

product_name: Acqua di Parma Gelsomino Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content: This smells so pretty...perfect combo of notes..I can really smell the mandarin on first spray..drydown is warm, musky and yet clean..to my nose Demachy can do no wrong. New craving!!!

product_name: Acqua di Parma Gelsomino Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content: Love it! It is subtle and shy, but at the same time very feminine, and sophisticated which is beautiful... and it lasts all the day. I am in love with this masterpiece!

product_name: Acqua di Parma Gelsomino Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content: Beautiful natural jasmine in the first few minutes, then - terrible, headache-inducing plasticky 'jasmine.' I had to give away a bottle of this.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Gelsomino Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content:
The most obvious and apparent note in this perfume is tuberose. It's there from the first spritz until the last remnants of the dry down slowly fades away.
The next note which is obvious is jasmine which is a little screechy and sharp in the initial blast off.
I was slightly disappointed because I wanted to smell the orange, mandarin and pink pepper but all I can smell is very loud jasmine and a nice creamy tuberose.
This is nice for those die hard tuberose lovers, but I think that this is not unique enough for me. I can't tell much of a difference between this and Fracas, they smell almost identical to my nose.
Don't get me wrong, this is a lovely and long lasting scent which will delight many of you Fragranticans, but for me, this is not my nirvana. I'll keep trailing the perfumeries until the day that I find 'the one'.
Longevity is fairly average, I would say about 4-5 hours and longer when sprayed on clothes or in the hair.
Silage is pretty good too, all that Jasmin positively yells at you!
It gets a 3/5 from me

product_name: Acqua di Parma Gelsomino Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I ordered Voyage en Mediterranee Jasmin d'Egypte L'Occitane during this past fall(so called blind buy), based solely on positive reviews and received a jasmine fragrance that was not completely comfortable for me. There is something with the honey here. There is honey and there is honey. I noticed that L’Occitane has used this version of honey in their other products too(linden soap, some hair products and hand creams). It's not so prominent, it’s subtle, but it's always there. The honeyed jasmine in Gelsomino Nobile is also somewhat dirty. Just like Jasmin d’Egypte L’Occitane, Gelsomino Nobile is not a dry woody jasmine, it’s not a suffocating jasmine as some of them are on the jasmine market. Gelsomino Nobile smells very natural and will let you breath easier as if during the parched day there is finally a rain. When yesterday I smelled Gelsomino Nobile the first time, I was perfectly prepared for this beauty, thanks to L'Occitane. There are at least two positive things about me using Voyage en Mediterranee Jasmin d'Egypt L‘Occitane during past spring and winter: I hope, I have been smelling perfectly French all this time, plus, hopefully, did not inhale too many aromachemicals plus everybody around me was perfectly content with my fragrance. I still have half of the bottle left. Since VEM Jasmine is discontinued, Gelsomino Nobile is a great alternative jasmine fragrance with better longevity, less transparent.
On my quest for a true jasmine “soliflore” I've found several fragrances that I would classify as more true to a real jasmine in bloom. Gelsomino Nobile(I have used my sample) is a very pleasant and easy fragrance in it’s own right that people (my family members, for example ) notice and compliment.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Gelsomino Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content: I am lost for words as this is so beautiful. Thank you to a wonderful Fragrantica member (MrsLetterO) I have been in perfume heaven. She sent me quite a few samples including some from Acqua de Palma a house of perfumes new to me. Beautiful, beautiful, beautiful a very feminine classy perfume. It is the first perfume that my husband really likes. I know what I will be asking for birthday and Christmas this year.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Gelsomino Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content:
A unique and sophisticated fragrance that celebrates Calabrian Jasmine, a noble ingredient used in classic perfumery. A blend of: Italian Mandarin, Pink Peppercorns, Tuberose, Orange Blossom, Jasmine, Cedar Wood and Musk.". VERY floral and subtly woody.
Give it some time and it will develop in amazing combination on your skin. As it did on mine. Jelsomino Nobile - gentle, balanced sweet, with character and enigma - they can not figure out what are you wearing. Definitely going to stay in my life, wonderfull!!

product_name: Acqua di Parma Gelsomino Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content: This company has finally made a truly feminine fragrance! It goes on very green at first, which made me think it was just another fresh,green,cooling summer scent. That's why I was quite surprised after 45 mins., when it really starts to develope on the skin, revealing more depth, as the floral notes surface and blend with the green citrus ones. It's a high-quality, complex sparkling fragrance that reminds me very much of the original version of "Charlie", a favourite of mine in the 70's. It wears close to the skin, so it's a great day or work scent. I plan on buying this as a replacement for my long-lost Charlie, it'll be worth every penny.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Gelsomino Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content:
The opening of Acqua di Parma GELSOMINO NOBILE is indeed a noble jasmine. Natural, lush, voluptuous. It's a sure buy-at-the-counter winner. Unfortunately, as the perfume dries down, the all-too-plebeian base shines through stronger and stronger, eventually completely clobbering what was the natural jasmine opening. Sorry to say: this is not cedar.

I may be hypersensitive to iso-E-super, or perhaps it is fat soluble, and my cells just cannot take any more of the stuff, but I must regretfully report that I do not love GELSOMINO NOBILE. Over the course of a wear, as the day becomes more and more gray and my mood more and more somber from reflecting upon the current state of perfumery, I feel compelled to cover up its commoner base--shared with nearly every mainstream men's designer fragrance in existence today--with something, well, noble!

My bottle is small, so I do not regret having acquired this perfume scent unsniffed, but I will not buy it again. I blame the usual four-letter suspects for my disaffection with Acqua di Parma and am seriously considering boycotting all conglomerate-owned perfume houses in the future.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Gelsomino Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Starts off with a grassy green note similar to the opening of Chanel 19 then quickly turns into a nutty jasmine accompanied by light florals and powder. Sillage is moderate and so is longevity.

Like most ADP fragrances this starts off interesting but never develops into anything on my skin.

IMO a lot has to do with weak potency and overall "mellow" sillage on the majority of ADP's scents that I have tried.

Classic pretty but boring with no depth.

I believe I've run out of options from this house.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Gelsomino Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content: My first foray into the big white floral category of fragrances. Opening sharply with mandarin orange and peppercorns, this EDP caught me off guard; it actually smelled strangely smokey and almost leatherish on me at first and I didn't know what to expect. I quickly assumed it was not a good match for my chemistry. But within moments the white florals stepped in and stayed all day long. (not kidding; incredible staying power on me, now up to 11 hours.) After the initial sharp opening it settled into a warm, appealing jasmine/tuberose fragrance; the musk and cedar listed in the base are secondary players in this fragrance. These two basenotes are very subtle, adding a little heft to the floral notes without asserting themselves. The quality of the materials is extraordinary--a feature of this house, from my limited experience with their fragrances--and is a must-try for jasmine lovers. I'm not sure I'm in that catagory, so I'm going to use up my sample before making a big financial commitment on this one. But there's no doubt that this is an extraordinarily beautiful fragrance that's utterly romantic yet at the same time suggests strength of character. Always a lovely mix.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Gelsomino Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content: A present. Same old, same old... dear old My Givenchy on me, but the watermelon's a bit more on the ripe side. And costs more, too.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Gelsomino Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content: Smells Dior, definitely smells Francois Demachy style, like a signature. If you like Francois Demachy version of Miss Dior Cherie (year 2011 til 2012), you will like this.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Gelsomino Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content: This has the same indolic vibe that I get from Notre Flore Le Jasmin and I am really glad I did not buy a full bottle. Don't find it at all charming, more like a classic type of bathroom jasmin perfume. Dislike

product_name: Acqua di Parma Gelsomino Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content:
This is one of the few jasmine fragrances that I can wear without smelling utterly feminine. Being as though jasmine is the king of flowers, Gelsomino Nobile is perfect for me, a man.. What a superb blend this is. My skin amps up the base notes. The top notes remain present through the development and this jasmine is decidedly green on my skin. In my opinion, this is one of the most creative jasmine-dominant creations since 24 Faubourg and Alien. Longevity is outstanding, even in Kuwait's heat. The sillage is polite, intoxicating in a breeze. If there was ever a jasmine fragrance for a man to consider, it's Gelsomino Nobile.

P.S. - I'm pretty sure it's gorgeous on women, too.. :D

product_name: Acqua di Parma Gelsomino Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content: Liked it a few weeks ago, a jasmine and rose sweetness. Unique, feminine, mature, blooming beautifully at the time. Today, I am getting a slightly synthetic quality close to my skin. Still fragrant but may have to revisit again.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Gelsomino Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content: I am a happy owner of Jelsomino Nobile since 5 hours ago and can not stop enjoy it every minute. Give it some time and it will develop in amazing combination on your skin. Hopefully. As it did on mine. Jasminora is more aggressive in scent it leaves after some time. Not bad, just more sticking out. Jelsomino Nobile - gentle, balanced sweet, with character and enigma - they can not figure out what are you wearing. Definitely going to stay in my life!

product_name: Acqua di Parma Gelsomino Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content:
What a surprise!

I am a Jasmine lover and a Tuberose lover but I never would have put two such diva like white floral notes together on the same stage at the same time but it works.

I can see how the TR transports the Jasmine up a couple of notches and I can see how the Jasmine helps keep the TR grounded, all in all they work well together and I would never have thought it.

What an amazing perfume, love it and just have to treat myself to a huge bottle!

product_name: Acqua di Parma Gelsomino Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content:
This franrance is almost an exact copy of Notre Flore Jasmin from l'Occitane.
As a Jasmine lover, it is not 'Jasminy' enough for me.
It does not capture the essence of Jasmine.
I have a full bottle of Notre Flore that is just wasting away on my shelf...i like the scent, to sniff once in a while, but the times i spray some on, i regret it a couple of hours later..
I've red people who think it is also similar to Jasminora, but i think Jasminora has more citrus in it, this is more heavy, more sweet.
After 2 years on the hunt for the perfect Jasmine fragrance, i still wish Lush would make a perfume out of the Flying Fox (or Godiva shampoo), that is the closest i've come to a true Jasmine (and yes, i have Lust from Lush, but it does not come close to Flying Fox)

product_name: Acqua di Parma Gelsomino Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content: Today i used it, and i mixed it with Jo Malone Gardenia. I gave a conference and something like 20 women, including my wife, told me that my fragance was amazing... A women parfum? ... Or a parfum for women...? Hahahan ;))

product_name: Acqua di Parma Gelsomino Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I smell it on Saks... I love it. It evoques a dark mood, maybe i thought in Boudeleire poems. I agree, its blue and cold.
I love it.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Gelsomino Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content: I had the chance yesterday to smell this perfume, my wife did not like it, she said it makes her feel blue... I think is because it evokes the smell of a church, something like chrysanthemum which adds a cold note to the perfume. I love it though, so maybe next time I will try it on myself and see what happen!

product_name: Acqua di Parma Gelsomino Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content:
If you are a fan of Jasmine you will love this as it really is quite noble....!! I am not a fan of Jasmine as it can sit soapy or uric on my skin; but I must say that I do like this very much - not enough for me to wear as it still holds the soapiness on my skin - so I have used it on my clothes instead....!!!!

Gypsy Parfumista really says everything about this perfume.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Gelsomino Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content:
**Once again I "tip my hat" to the generous ElenaLondon, for the lovely gift of a carded sample of this, which (at the time of this review) is a Harrod's London exclusive. Cheers, dear!**

Notes, and description (from AdP sample card):

"A unique and sophisticated fragrance that celebrates Calabrian Jasmine, a noble ingredient used in classic perfumery. A blend of: Italian Mandarin, Pink Peppercorns, Tuberose, Orange Blossom, Jasmine, Cedar Wood and Musk."

This is the first AdP woman's scent I have sniffed; and I must say it is lovely! Jasmine comes right at you out of the sprayer, not heavy or thick just sweet and heavenly...dreamlike, on a soft nocturnal breeze. The mandarin orange does lend a bit of fruity clarity to this, and the pink pepper adds a subtle warmth and savoriness. It is like Lady Jasmine is strolling through her garden. She is the Mistress here, surrounded by bright, sunny citric blossoms and a slightly smoky tuberose. This perfume makes me feel like I am out of doors on a beautiful temperate evening, perhaps at a Garden Party chatting with lovely people at a very classy villa or country house. Surrounding this soiree are tall strong noble cedar trees, aromatic and warm with shady green boughs and the faintest hint of musk is on the wind, not animalic or "pissy", just natural and enticing. Gelsomino Nobile (noble jasmine) is a very appropriate name for this scent. Naturally beautiful, poised and very very elegant. If you are a jasmine lover, (as I am) you simply MUST smell this refined and stunning take on one of the most used flowers in perfumery, that is anything but common.

Sillage: good
Longevity: very good
Overall: 4/5

On reading the notes (and before actually trying this) my first thought was "Eeh, again...REALLY?!?". After spritzing and sniffing its obviously natural essence oils, combined by a skilled hand and learned nose; I can say this is one of the best homages to jasmine, surrounded by the perfect accents, I have sniffed. AdP is one of those houses that may cost more...but, trust me, it is worth it!

NB: This perfume very feminine, but I find it to be just balanced enough to wear myself. Though scents are intrinsically gender-neutral, this is definitely one slanted more towards for the ladies (or a guy who is not ashamed of his "feminine" side): slightly sweet, VERY floral and subtly woody. Amazing...

product_name: Acqua di Parma Gelsomino Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content:
The best! Perfect jasmine, soft and long-lasting. Super feminine. I wish I had bought this perfume on my trip to Italy this year. It's haunting me ... Well, stupid is who stupid does.

Guerlain AA Jasminora is very similar though. I may end up buying it instead, because AdP is very difficult to find in my country.
*****

product_name: Acqua di Parma Gelsomino Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content: Like it a lot, it's like a combination of Notre Flore Jasmin (l'Occitane) and Jasminora (Guerlain). Very classy and feminine.

product_name: Buongiorno Acqua di Parma
review_content: A fresh, green, clean , soapy citrus scent with an aromatic herbal body. Smells like you just took a shower and brushed your teeth in a way and is super refreshing and uplifting. Smells just like Harry’s fig body wash. It start off citrusy, minty and herbal and soapy from the petitgrain and lavender. Then it stays pretty green , musky and soapy thereafter. Perfect for a hot spring or summer day and is very safe for a clean fresh scent but it definitely is grassy/leafy. Despite the fragrances lighter scent profile the performance surprised me. Not bad at all however a little overpriced

product_name: Buongiorno Acqua di Parma
review_content: I just received a decant of this. It is so close to Torino21, which I own. Both on skin and in the air. This is a touch more minty and somewhat less yeasty. T21 is somewhat less expensive. I love this fragrance but too close to T21. Peace to the fragfaces.

product_name: Buongiorno Acqua di Parma
review_content: Reinassance , Givree and this are the most Elegant realistic Citrus .That's it.

product_name: Buongiorno Acqua di Parma
review_content: I've got a sample of this and I would love to have a bottle of this. Wishlist added!

product_name: Buongiorno Acqua di Parma
review_content: Buongiorno by Acqua di Parma is a wonderfully fresh, uplifting scent that truly feels like morning. The first spray gives a sense of clean air and sunlight that calm freshness right after you wake up. It’s bright, elegant, and perfectly balanced for both men and women.

product_name: Buongiorno Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Buongiorno Acqua di Parma is a citrusy, aromatic, and green fragrance.

Its opening is citrusy and herbal, slightly sweet and almost fruity, where the citrus aroma seems to come more from the leaves than from the juice or zest. As time passes, the mint note becomes more intense and realistic. Once it reaches its drydown, the scent becomes slightly musky and ambery, but still fresh.

As its name suggests, this fragrance is ideal for daytime wear and provides a pleasant sense of energy, perfect for spring and summer, casual outings, with friends, office work, etc.

Its longevity was average, lasting up to 8 hours on me, with a fair to low sillage.

Compared to Il Profumo, Acqua di Parma's other release this year, this is a more unisex fragrance, more sparkling, energizing, and modern, because Il Profumo is more masculine and contains more classic elements without being a vintage scent. Personally, I like Il Profumo more, but I think Buoungiorno could appeal to a wider audience.

product_name: Buongiorno Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Someone below said this smells like coffee?

Trust me there’s no coffee in this, some people have very strange ways of perceiving scents. This is a beautiful, green, citrus, vegetal fragrance. Spray this on, on a hot summer morning with a slight breeze and it’s just heavenly. Hence why it’s called “good morning”

This, along with the new La Riserva Arancia and Fico line from ADP are all absolute bangers.

product_name: Buongiorno Acqua di Parma
review_content:
This is just Torino 21 with a different name. Way too green and salad-y. I don't get the appeal to smell like a salad.
But if you do, I guess you can't ask for a better salad scent...

product_name: Buongiorno Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Very leafy , green scent , with Watery naunces and musk undertones.

In layman words this is more of Hermes Un Jardin flanker rather than Torino zesty Minty citrus.

Cheers

product_name: Buongiorno Acqua di Parma
review_content: ELDO You taken in a more herbal and masculine direction with less acidity and dish soap vibes, smelled great on paper but it unfortunately was overly herbal on the opening on my skin, and it dried down into something meh and died off very quickly in true ADP fashion.

product_name: Buongiorno Acqua di Parma
review_content: Quite simply: A better Torino 21.

product_name: Buongiorno Acqua di Parma
review_content: I love it, it's to cool, herbal, citric, a mixed between ELDO You or someone like you and Xerjoff Torino 21, right in the middle praising de mint-basil from the former and de citric from the later. Kinda addicted to me. More expensive than the former and less expensive than the later, like a said just in the middle. Good option IMO

product_name: Buongiorno Acqua di Parma
review_content: I feel coffee and basil

product_name: Buongiorno Acqua di Parma
review_content: Torino 21 is too heavy on the citrus and too low on the mint, but Buongiorno is too heavy on the mint and too low on the citrus. I tried both and theyre both alright but not full bottle worthy. If I would have to decide though, I would rather take Torino, because of better longevity and sillage and all in all more pleasant smell

product_name: Buongiorno Acqua di Parma
review_content: the most realistic basil note

product_name: Buongiorno Acqua di Parma
review_content: This has an opening close to Torino 21 and dries down to a creamy, fruity and minty version of LV Pacific Chill. It’s good but doesn’t last long on my skin, roughy 4-5 hours.

product_name: Buongiorno Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Buongiorno perfectly represents a new generation of fragrances that, fortunately, will save us from the chemical bombs we’ve been smelling in recent years—during the day in the streets and at night in clubs.
It’s a green, citrusy fragrance with basil and mint notes.
It’s perfect for the office and for warm spring and summer days.
Similar to Torino 21, although with clear differences: in Torino 21, the aromatic side of mint and basil dominates over the citrus notes, making it much stronger and longer-lasting; Buongiorno takes the opposite approach, highlighting the citrus opening and drydown, making it more delicate and refined.
Both are, to me, the summer of my country—Italy—in a bottle.

Buongiorno representa perfectamente una nueva generación de perfumes que, afortunadamente, nos salvará de las bombas químicas que hemos olido en los últimos años—de día en las calles y de noche en los locales.
Es un perfume verde, cítrico y aromatizado con albahaca y menta.
Es perfecto para la oficina y para los días cálidos de primavera y verano.
Similar a Torino 21, aunque con claras diferencias: en Torino 21 domina la parte aromática de la menta y la albahaca por encima de las notas cítricas, lo que lo hace mucho más intenso y duradero; Buongiorno, en cambio, resalta más la parte cítrica en la apertura y en el secado final, haciéndolo más delicado y refinado.
Ambos son, para mí, el verano de mi país—Italia—dentro de una botella.

Buongiorno rappresenta benissimo una nuova generazione di profumi che, fortunatamente, ci salverà dalle bombe chimiche che si sentono di giorno per strada e nei locali la sera negli ultimi anni.
E’ un profumo verde, cítrico e aromatizzato con basilico e menta.
E’ un profumo perfetto per l’ufficio e per le giornate calde di primavera ed estate.
Simile a Torino 21 anche se con evidenti differenze: in Torino 21 domina la parte aromatica di menta e basilico sopra le note citriche, rendendo Torino 21 un profumo molto più forte e duraturo; Buongiorno evidenzia il senso opposto, dando maggiore risalto alla parte citrica in apertura e nel drydown rendendolo più delicato e raffinato.
Sono entrambi l’estate del mio paese, l’Italia, dentro una bottiglia.

product_name: Buongiorno Acqua di Parma
Buongiorno Acqua di Parma
review_content:
This is a very pretty scent. Very green but refreshing and uplifting. The mint! the basil! it feels like being in a garden full of mint and other herbs. The citrus notes are only a little bit sweet, like mandarin and orange essential oils. It does remind me of Torino 21, but somewhat more playful and happy.

I love it.

product_name: Buongiorno Acqua di Parma
review_content: Unfortunately Buongiorno was a _plus ça change plus c’est la même chose_ type of disappointment for me. The mandarin impression is overly synthetic and feels unseasonal for a summerly, fresh scent. While it is quite well executed in the new Mandarino from the Blu Med line, here it seems misplaced and reminiscent of the artificial mandarin from a 1985 soft drink. Eventually it tones down, however, so I think all in all Buongiorno turns out to be a decent scent, but alas not for me personally. It is also debatable whether the price and quality ratio is reasonable, but since I am quite uninterested in the product that would be for others to decide.

product_name: Buongiorno Acqua di Parma
review_content: At this rate I'll be waiting 2 years to get a bottle at a discounter

product_name: Buongiorno Acqua di Parma
review_content: Absolutely stunning. Possibly their best fragrance in my opinion (maybe just edging Essenza). Fresh fruit mint and herbs. Kind of makes many of the Blu Mediterraneo series (that it could have easily been placed in) or Aqua Allegorias redundant as it does what each of them do rolled into one. Great longevity too. With 7 sprays on my hair the fragrance was still pushing out 24 hours later. One of the very best fragrances I have smelled and certainly the smell of summer.

product_name: Buongiorno Acqua di Parma
review_content: Refreshing green, on my skin the notes blend perfectly. Just got it, waiting for time to give little more intensity to the base. The feeling is great so far.

product_name: Buongiorno Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I bought the new Fico di Amalfi and they give a sample. Its Wonderful amazing... So elegant like Givree.
I have Xerjoff Torino 21 and Renaissance that both are very realistic and profile is close to that , but ...
Torino is more mint forward and Renaissance is more petitgrain forward both Xerjoff are more aggressive than Buongiorno, that is way smoother more elegant less playful and more serious perfume in my opinion.
The scent trail of this one is airy not screaming but is there , perfect balance .
The only problem is the price :(

product_name: Buongiorno Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I really really like this.

So uplifting and aromatic. Don't mind the idiot who called it mint sauce - it's not.

Citrus and green herbs. Doesn't last awfully long sadly. There's a faint powder-violet type sweetness in the heart here that I'm not crazy about but aside from that, absolutely beautiful.

Feels like ADP's response to Torino21.

product_name: Buongiorno Acqua di Parma
review_content:
조금만 덜 아로마틱했으면 좋았을 듯
개인적으로는 비누향수가 더 좋네요.

product_name: Buongiorno Acqua di Parma
review_content: Happinnes in a bottle. Very uplifting and joyful fragrance, ordered sample, cant tell much on longevity yet, but the smell is amazing. I get much of the mandarin leaf, and opening is very minty, way better than Torino 21, but the drydown is not similar. Subtle basil and rosemary with stronger citrus. 9.5/10

product_name: Buongiorno Acqua di Parma
review_content: Similar to Torino 21, from memory (I sampled it last summer). Though I remember not liking Torino21 because I found it too synthetic, while I really like Buingiorno. To the point that I am considering getting a full bottle.

product_name: Buongiorno Acqua di Parma
review_content: Amazing

product_name: Buongiorno Acqua di Parma
review_content: gosh i love adp, but they're sadly really weak when it comes to performance. I haven't tried it on skin so idk if being edp changed the longetivity that much buth, the smell was beatiful. I love how adp makes their fragrances so natural. It gives off a lemon garden vibe to me, that's kind of exactly what it smells like. Ig adp makes their fragrances to be more peacful and non disturbing rather than attention grabbing.

product_name: Buongiorno Acqua di Parma
review_content: I can’t even grasp how people would prefer Torino21 over this? Every time when I tried to sample T21 the scent is so faint and literally gone in 1-2 hours. For a much cheaper price you can get this one, which last longer and is even better.

product_name: Buongiorno Acqua di Parma
review_content: Ok I’m KiNDoF obsessed with this. By far it’s stronger and better than Torino 21 . is this the GOAT of 2025?

product_name: Buongiorno Acqua di Parma
