review_content: In fact the previous reviewer was spot on. That's not an iris scent, but an oily, rich, yellow floral one. It is posh, long-lasting, powdery tuberose with mimose and orange blossom. On me it is overhelming and I am not from faint-hearted division, since I do love Poeme and Jil Sander No4, I think Iris Nobile is on same scale as Fracas by silage and determination to suffocate.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Iris Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content: "Whole floral chorus" is right! Testing the EDP, I do love it, but it's not an iris scent. It's a lovely yellow floral which dries down to a sweet blend of powdery orange blossom and mimosa. If iris is in there, it's hard to find. This is rich, deep, golden, buttery, flowery and strong. I'm surprised and pleased, as I've probably tested too many austere and melancholy iris scents. Also there's not much citrus in the EDP, it's more along the lines of Divine "Divine" and Too Much. Having said all that, I adore it, and I'll be buying some. It's perfectly blended and very high-quality - Lovely :)

product_name: Acqua di Parma Iris Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content: This is buttery and earthy, very deep, with a licoricey edge. Definitely unisex, and bears no connection to infusion d' iris, which is much brighter by comparison.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Iris Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content: This is one of my favorite iris fragrances - possibly even THE favorite at the moment. It begins with a gentle opener of iris mixed with a bit of orange blossom. In contrast to Frederic Malle's Iris Poudre, it lacks the sharpness that sometimes comes with a colder iris. As it dries down it becomes slightly sweet, peppered with white florals. I even catch a hint of vanilla at the tail end, as the scent is about to leave me. Projection is just beyond a skin scent - someone near me can smell it for the first couple hours, but I don't believe it projects much further than arms' length. If you really love iris with a twist, I couldn't recommend this more. I'd already have a bottle if finances permitted - but believe you me, it will be a part of my collection as soon as I can manage!

product_name: Acqua di Parma Iris Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content: Iris is one of my favorite notes and flowers so I was compelled to try Iris Nobile even though many reviewers have clearly stated that there is not, in fact, much iris present here. I sampled the EDP, which is a well-crafted scent that suggests the most ginormous bridal bouquet of heady white flowers. There may be one small austere stem of iris hidden behind the gardenia, tuberose, jasmine, orange blossoms and who knows what else, but how would you ever notice it? The floral avalanche comes to rest on a sweet base of vanilla and light resins. Lots of sillage, lasts forever. Glamorous, fun to try, but somehow not memorable. Points deducted for taking the name of the noble iris in vain.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Iris Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content: So sad...I really liked this at first. The iris and bergamot notes, sweetened by vanilla, are truly lovely. Then the tuberose and orange blossom turn up to spoil the party and give me a headache. Go easy on the sprays; this stuff gets into your sinuses tear gas style.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Iris Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content: I apologise if I offend but I tried this for the first time today and after a couple of hours I was smelling my wrist and what came to mind was a milder Giorgio of Bev Hills, slightly prettier with a little hint of powder. (EDT) LOVELY!

product_name: Acqua di Parma Iris Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Iris Nobile is a real mystery, albeit a beautiful one. My love affair with IN started with a sample I ordered - the impression it gave was an an iris on a lovely cloud of full white flowers and a powdery sweet base. I decided to order a bottle last month and it made me even fall harder for this release from Acqua di Parma. Since Fragrantica doesn't have a separate page for the EdT/EdP, I'll list the notes for the latter here (according to the official AdP site):

Top: Bergamot, Aniseed, Mandarin
Heart: Ylang-Ylang, Iris
Base: Vanilla, Patchouli, Oakmoss

I was really excited when my bottle finally arrived (I was able to snap it up for a bargain price!). As soon as I sprayed it on it confused me; it didn't smell like my sample. It started out rather airy/ethereal, nothing like my sample. I was afraid my bottle already turned since it smelled so thin. The opening consisted of fresh bergamot/mandarin and a light, silky and powdery iris, slightly spiced with aniseed. To my surprise, the opening lasted rather long: about 30 to 45 minutes. Most of the time top notes don't last that long on my skin, so it was a rather nice suprise. It slowly moves on to the heartnotes: the iris becomes more powdery and it gets a slight leathery/oily feeling. The ylang ylang note is simply heaven - it's sweet and smooth, not too intense. It really lifts up the iris and works great with the top notes. The heart notes also last quite long, about 3 hours before the basenotes start to show up. From this point on I start to recognize it; turned out my sample somehow consisted only of the heart/basenotes. The patchouli gives the fragrance some darkness, the vanilla contributes to the plush, powdery feeling and sweetens things up a bit. I can't really make out the oakmoss to be honest.

This fragrance is simply a real delight. I've never had a fume 'evolve' this much on my skin. It starts out light and airy, before transforming in a blooming flower and ending with a sensual whisper. Longevity is great, about 10 to 12 hours. Sillage is really sneaky; I gave it three sprays and at first I barely noticed anything, but when the heart- and basenotes appeared it became rather cloying/overwhelming. Go easy on the trigger with this one. It's versatile enough to be used anytime and anywhere. I would even wear it when going for a night out! It's also perfectly wearable by men - it would make a slightly more floral/fresher version of Dior Homme (without the amber/cacao).

product_name: Acqua di Parma Iris Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content: for the EDP. If you like Mitsouko and older Guerlains you might rate this. In short I find it a hybrid of Mitsy and Annick Goutal's Passion. I believe it was designed to be full on, in your face, Portofino rich, take no prisoners, BOLD. I tried wearing less of it but it's pedal to the metal in the same way that Mitsouko, or Amarige is. A quality perfume to be sure but yet another 'challenging' fragrance. Seems best in a warm climate. Not a comfort scent for winter at all.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Iris Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content: It is both warm and radiant. Obviously a perfume of high quality. I think it is ideal for fall.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Iris Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content: I tested this today and it is beautiful. I will have to buy this soon. Both the edp and edt smell gorgeous in their own way. Decisions, decisions... which one to buy.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Iris Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Iris and orange blossoms and tuberose. Very heady like full blooms on a hot spring day. Over a layer of expensive dressing powder. There's an edge of anise mixed with amber for a bit of an edge, but it's more like an airy after thought of spice than any real spiciness.


Dries down to powdery, soapy floral with a hint of sweetness.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Iris Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content: A very sexy and almost edible fragrance. Bit headachy though but then many are to me. I dont wear it much but should do really, it can be heavier than the normal for me, more floral than my usual citrus preferences, but its not actually heavy.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Iris Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content:
This is pretty, powdery and delightful. Iris perfumes are often referred to as the "little black dress" of fragrances and this one fits that profile well. It's very wearable for any occasion or weather. It makes a great easy go-to perfume when you're not sure what you're looking for.

A quick word of warning to anyone looking for a rooty/carroty iris: this isn't it. It's a floral interpretation, focussing much more on the iris flower than the orris root. So just to let you know that in case that's not what you like from your iris scents.

This is so beautifully powdery. I sometimes call it my "ballerina perfume" because I could imagine it on a pretty, elegant prima ballerina.

The anise is very, very subtle. It lends a little edge to the iris, but that's all. The citrus is a nice burst in the opening, then leaves during the dry down. Surprisingly, I don't really get tuberose. I'm wary of tuberose because I find it tends to overwhelm anything it's in, but that's not the case here.

I got overnight longevity from this and sillage is moderate/strong. A little goes a long way.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Iris Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Based on EDP concentration.

I dismissed Acqua di Parma Iris Nobile the first time I tried it, as I was getting interested in iris soliflore fragrances, which Iris Nobile didn't seem to be.

Recently, while randomly reading some reviews, I was intrigued by the comments claiming that Iris Nobile focuses more on the iris flower rather than the earthy rooty orris, which I partially agree after trying it again.

On me, Iris Nobile is essentially an orange blossom-centric fragrance, although the iris is also detectable, just not that earthy, rooty, but has a more woody nuance. The floralcy, the vivid orange and the woody and slightly powdery characteristics do remind me of sniffing my pot of blooming iris last spring, as I did catch an orange nuance in the flower. However, the orange in Iris Nobile is so strong on me that I can't help perceving it as an orange blossom supported by iris as a strutural note. From time to time, I can also sense a discreet star anise flirting with the white bouquet.

As time goes on, Iris Nobile becomes more creamy with the addition of tuberose and a faint vanilla. And a moss-patchouli base quitely spreads under the white bouquet, which lends it a very classic character, yet overall, the fragrance still feels like a modern combination of floral and woody elements.

The sillage is heavy to moderate, and the longevity is at least 9 hours. Once I stop sticking too precisely to the name, I find myself enjoying Iris Nobile immensely. Such a chic, elegant composition of orange blossom, iris and moss base. I'd definitely recommend it to those who enjoy white floral or to those who'd like a solid but at the same time a more friendly interpretation of iris or chypre fragrance.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Iris Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content: I think it's a very pleasant smell. The iris is not as strong as I would like, I tend to smell more of the citrus notes and the other floral notes. Thank you, Onaona for the sample. :)

product_name: Acqua di Parma Iris Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content: Acqua di Parma Iris Nobile is a mix of sweet Iris and white floral. You really have to love white floral to appreciate this offering because, to me, it overpowers the iris smell in this fragrance.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Iris Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content: As an iris lover I felt dissappointed by this fragrance. I didn´t get the rooty nor the woody or green aspect of it. I was only getting a creamy-powdery vibe more of a violet and tuberose than of an iris. Well... How wrong I was! Last week I had the chance to smell a fragrant iris flower (despite I was told the flower itself is odourless). Now I can say that Iris Nobile is a wonderful and magical interpretation of the "Iris Sicula" flower smell. Thanks to Caron and Kurkdjian for revealing one more facet of the wonderful blue flower.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Iris Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Let me start by quoting another review : I like it and maybe in love.
It is a unique perfume yet so familiar. It evokes in my head words like elegant, luscious, extravagant, rich, warm, comfort, delicious, charming, gourmand...
It is also a perfume full with contradictions it smells old and new at once, it smells unique and familiar, seductive and comforting, sophisticated yet approachable; I think this adds to its charm.
After a couple of tries I found my self drawn to it , like a new love; you can't wait till you experience it again.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Iris Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content:
My favouite iris. My favouite fragrance all together as of late. Its a stunner! I have it in all versions and the EDP with the golden lid is my favourite. This picture should be updated. I don't think this fragrance above is being made anymore.
There is ; EDP iris nobile.!!! Then sublime and a new edt is out now which is wonderful as well.
My very favourite remains the EDP , rich and loud and sweet and orangey with star anise and vanilla. Amazing luxurious and elegant. Fabulous perfume.

The sublime is more muted and suede like due to the birch , it's less sweet and less loud. Wonderful as well. The edt now , in the tall bottle and white container is fresh and creamy ,powdery and musky. In fact it smells very similar to Nivea cream.
Acqua di Parma perfumes are incredible well made and has high quality Italian made fragrances.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Iris Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I sampled this one before, and don't remember enjoying it quite as much as I do at the moment- on this cold night, when winter just refuses to let go of its grip on us, it is really hitting all of the right notes!

Dry iris, accented with orange blossom,bergamot and amber- a little powdery, a little soapy, definitely unisex-

Excellent longevity and potency-

product_name: Acqua di Parma Iris Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Very, very light floral, in a way pretty and carefree, almost childish. I may be mistaken but it smells a sort of diet Juicy Couture JC, I mean, sugarless... and diluted also. Can't detect any note specifically, just a bouquet of white flowers. But quality is still very Acqua di Parma, Iris Nobile EDT smells fresh and natural, like a mixture just made.

Edit: it seems that I applied very little thus I couldn' smell iris Nobile properly. I can get the staranisee and amber quite strong, some vanilla, and woods up from the opening. Anisee and iris together makes IN smell a bit like Shalimar Parfume Initial. I like it very much and don't think it's that feminine after all.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Iris Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content: I had a carded sample of this and tried it but will pass it on to another perfume buddy here. While this is a classic floral fragrance that smells as expensive as it probably is, I would not call it an iris. If you are after Iris there are plenty of better options - cold, warm, sweet, dirty etc. This is iris hidden in a big bouquet - I can clearly detect a lot of tuberose here. I actually like tuberose, but I prefer my tuberose scents to be decadently sweet, with vanilla and gardenia etc. and I love my iris scents powdery, violetty, with orris root, etc. To me, these are two different kettle of fish that don't need to mix ;-)

product_name: Acqua di Parma Iris Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content: This review is based on a decant. Touted by many as one of the better iris scents. Perfumeposse said it's a beginner's more accessible iris. Opening is a bit strong with AdP's signature citrus notes, which then quickly settles down and stays closer to skin. On my skin I get mostly white floral especially tuberose. It smells too familiar. It's the same tuberose from my wife's Fracas by Robert Piguet except that Fracas is a jammy one. Marketed as for women and I would have to agree with that due to the predominant white floral notes. I don't get the orris root I love so much from Dior Homme in this but It's a quality well-crafted scent nonetheless. It would fit nicely on my wife but I couldn't see myself pulling this off. Moderate projection and longevity on my skin.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Iris Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content: Layer this perfume with Yardley's English Rose and the result is sublime!

product_name: Acqua di Parma Iris Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I have deluxe samples of both the EDT and the EDP, and love them both, though they are very different scents. If you want a perfume that screams "IRIS!" definitely go for the EDP, the EDT is just as much about neroli as it is iris. Since I'm a neroli fiend, that suits me fine.

The EDP is warmer, darker, and more sophisticated. Beautiful, but I can't see myself using it until I'm older. It's not old lady-ish, but it's just a tad too rich for this particular 20 something.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Iris Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content: Somehow both powerful and understated. If there's one perfume I own that pulls attention from men, this would be it. A mature feminine scent that knows how to pull attention and then knows what to do with it. The powdery-ness of it sometimes strikes me as a little old-fashioned. The reactions it evokes are anything but sepia-toned though.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Iris Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Based on EDP

I love love love iris and was so excited to try this version of Iris Nobile. Unfortunately for me, the iris is short lived. On my skin orange blossom and tuberose take over. I am shocked because this stage lasts forever. I've been waiting for the last 4 hours for the vanilla to show up and was hoping I might feel the iris again in the dry down. But no such luck. I tried Iris Nobile Sublime and found that closer to what I was looking for. Very nice for tuberose fans.

This is still very pretty and the longevity and silage are fantastic but "Iris" Nobile it is not.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Iris Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I got a deluxe sample of this and sprayed it on and was like "whew!" and put it in the "to give away" pile. Then just shortly after I got a whiff and thought is that the scary perfume? It smells phenomenal!! Then I ended up sniffing my arm over and over. Then I took it back out of the giveaway pile and put it back into the keeper pile. Then I forgot about it and ran across it again recently and now it is in the "to be purchased" pile.

There is no missing the iris in this so I am puzzled as to how anyone could say there is no iris in this. It is like an iris bomb. I grew up with a grandmother who grew irises and there is no mistaking the smell.

Lasts nearly all day for me and has decent sillage (or the max that I like to have, I do not want to completely overpower a room or leave a trail but I don't want a nose to have to be 6 millimeters from my wrist to be able to smell it either.)

A beautiful, classic fragrance and I recommend it to anyone looking for an old school classic scent that nobody else will have on yet everyone will notice and want to know what on earth you have on. I am not getting any unisex from this at all, it smells completely feminine.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Iris Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I was pleasantly surprised with one of the most beautiful, unique, elegant fragrances I have encountered. This is in my top 3 favorite irises.

Iris Nobile blooms on my skin and develops stronger and stronger with time but never becomes overpowering (unless the orange blossom starts to get bossy like it sometimes does). It is a sensual iris-ylang combo with only a slight edge of powder adding some femininity. There is also something in Iris Nobile that smells of sweaty, salty hair but it never crosses the line into animalic territory (although if it did, I wouldn't mind). It reminds me a little of Putain des Palaces but more refined and with better lasting power.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Iris Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content: I ordered a spray sample of this based on ecstatic mentions of this fragrance on the discussion boards. I should have looked on the notes listed for this and recognized that the high register of powderiness is perfume doom for me. The initial spray brought a very pretty scent which quickly faded to powder that was completely gone in well under two hours. This is a gorgeous perfume, but apparently my chemistry blasts the poor darling into oblivion. The scent is definitely a good one for hot weather, if it works for you. I recommend you invest in a sample and try before buying. I expect if this works for you, it will work in a memorable and very pleasing way.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Iris Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content: Am i getting something gamey in the base- maybe civet? Someone mentioned musk. Definitely ripe. I was enchanted by the top notes of this, but it's tinged obscene after several hours.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Iris Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I'm not sure how iris is supposed to smell like, and based on reviews, this isn't quite an iris perfume. The most prominent notes to me are orange and tuberose. More orange in the EdT than the EdP.
This is one of the rare cases when i like the EdT more. It's fresher, softer, brighter, very natural smelling. The EdP is heavier and it smells slightly synthetic to me compared to the EdT. I do like the EdP as well, just not quite as much. There's something in the drydown that makes me go "meh", maybe it's the oakmoss and patchouli combo? For everyday use, the EdT is perfect.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Iris Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content: I bought it because it smelled amazing on someone I used to work with. I didn't have the same luck, but it made a great bathroom deodorizer!

product_name: Acqua di Parma Iris Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content: The EDP smells like powdery iris and tuberrose but also balmy neroli that is not listed. Moderation in sillage, I'm not sure about the longevity. It almost reminds me of a new car smell. I like it!!

product_name: Acqua di Parma Iris Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content: The EDP is a warm, complex, and heady creation that really impresses me with its elegance and character. I'm new to iris perfumes so my basis for comparison is non-existent, but I had expected it to be a big powder bomb at some stages, which thankfully it was not. Gently powdery and very beautiful. The white florals (tuberose, ylang-ylang and orange blossom) are prominant throughout. The dry down is a voluptuous, earthy mixture of amber, vanilla, and cedar--I couldn't find the patchouli or oakmoss there--which lingers for many hours. Wearability is great; I would wear this day or night as long as I applied with a light hand. Long wearing, 12 hours and up on me. This is going on my wish list. Love it!

product_name: Acqua di Parma Iris Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content: I have only the body lotion which I apply after a shower and its waftiness and freshness is soft and divine especially in warm weather. I haven't smelt the EDP or other versions but now I will find them and see if they are just as gorgeous. The body lotion has the fresh iris, a touch of citrus, something like cool lime with a breeze, a subtle background of gardenia and a gentle whisper of tuberose. very classy and suitable for all occasions. a man would smell outrageously edible in this too.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Iris Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content:
This was not what I was expecting. Iris Nobile I had hoped to be a more luminous version of Hiris, an iris scent with a little more kick. This however has entirely too much.
My first thought was 'What is this white floral monstrosity??' It's not actually a monstrosity of course, but it is certainly not what I would call an iris scent. I got citrus and anise in the opening then tuberose and orange blossom and they overpower everything else.
It slowly grows gentler, but never do I feel any powder or iris. Very nice projection and the staying power is doing very well, which is apparently very good for this line of scents. Not what I wanted at all.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Iris Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content: Got EDT and EDP, a present. They smelled a lot like each other on me, musky and flowery, but the flowers weren't 100% the same. And all's good about it, but it is not my scent, not my scent at all.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Iris Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content: Um. Okay all I can say is gun cleaner, it smells like gun cleaner and old lady hair spray(aqua net). Sorry this is not for me.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Iris Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content: I have the EDP and wow this is so amazing. I had a sample years ago and remembered loving it so I recently bought one and its just as amazing as I remember. I can't get over though how identical it is to Britney's Curious, I have both and can't tell them apart. One of my top favs for sure. I am gonna put this away and wear it for spring.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Iris Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content: The EDP is citrusy iris, super!

product_name: Acqua di Parma Iris Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content: My first review was on the edt. I just sampled the edp and now I understand. The EDP is warm, comfy, floral, and spicy while I the EDT is a bit generic.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Iris Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content: headache

product_name: Acqua di Parma Iris Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content:
This fragrance is quite the chameleon on me- each time I wear it, it smells differently- unusual for me-

On first impression, the opening citrus notes seemed very dominant and bracing, placing it firmly in the unisex category- completely drowning out the iris, unfortunately-

At times, the heart is off-puttingly indolic- but not always-

Orange blossom becomes prominent in the base, and I find this to be the most pleasant phase- I smell musk too, although this note is not listed here- however, the fragrance is categorized as a floral woody musk...

The warmer I am, the better it smells- which I've noticed often happens to me with orange blossom notes-


I'm guessing that my sample is the original rather than the reformulated version, which is supposed to be heavier on the iris and lighter on the citrus-

Decent sillage and longevity- 10+ hours is pretty good in my book-

product_name: Acqua di Parma Iris Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content: Opening is disapponting with a very spicy bergamot-mandarin note, but fortunately fades away quickly, then earthy soapy iris with amber at the background comes along, but this phase also fades away quickly (unfortunately this time), after this point it is a very close to skin scent, and you can barely feel it :(( I don't get the anise and the other florals, it is a 7 out of 10, if it comes to iris I find infusion d'iris more appealing..

product_name: Acqua di Parma Iris Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I am a female in my early 20's, and this is a very elegant perfume to wear amidst a sea of tween perfumes. There were days when I absolutely loved how beautiful it smelled on me, and then there were days when, as another reviewer said, the ylang ylang made me nauseous. I very much liked the creamy drydown, but overall this fragrance is too sweet for me to wear everyday. I would have to be in a particular mood to be extra, extra girly. I bought the bottle, then returned it and opted to get a few samples of it for when I do feel in the mood.

I prefer Colonia, and also have Mirto di Panarea, as they are much lighter for me.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Iris Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content:
The following review is reffering to the E. d. P.

Elegant and well balanced a classical luminous fragrance more than an "avant garde" creation. Though iris is the main theme, many other ingredients are involved like Bulgarian rose and jasmine (in the opening) a gentle touch of peach even though not declared in the piramid above, noticeable especially during the dry down while it turns into a lovely powdery fragrance. Personally I prefer even a little more invention - when possible - BUT I see that the especially good ingredients here employed make the charming fragrance that it is and ingredients make always a difference! Good sillage, it reminds me the vintage Paco Rabanne E. de Calandre....but probably mine is just a fade memory. Very good persistence, even better than I thought. Whenever real iris is involved prices are always looking towards the sky... so if you are sure to leave it where it is, at least, think about a gentle introduction because it worth. I cannot suggest when to use it, I've tried it twice during the last three days (february) and I think it could be right for winter, probably also for the middle seasons, but I can't say without "evidences". Very good - in a different but interesting manner - either on a male skin or a female; on me it's perfect (another temptation!) but...every skin speaks a different language.
Another way to "do" perfumery. Definitely.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Iris Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content:
This has a very beautiful and showy opening but I wish it lasted longer on my skin. I actually feel I could overlook that as while it does last it smells great.

It dries down to something pleasant but not amazing. This for me is all about the start. There is also a little soapy action going on which I don't mind as it is fairly subtle.

A nicely done perfume and well worth a try for any Iris lovers!

product_name: Acqua di Parma Iris Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content: I need to do another review on Iris Nobile edp! Because believe it or not, it went from a kind-of-dislike to.. a love! I've noticed my nose has started to tolerate irisses a lot more lately than at the beginning, and I also do think... It's probably the weather. I've smelled this in warm weather, but combined with sun and sweat this smells a bit odd and as I said earlier, mediterranian-bathroom-ish. But now in wintertime, it really blossoms on my skin! It's hard too describe what it is all about besides the iris, but I really dig the warm woody edge it has to it (and cedar always seems to smell musky on me!). Fresh, warm, powdery, floraly, woody, elegant, it has it all! Very very nice (for winter)!

product_name: Acqua di Parma Iris Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content:
This is an absolutely lovely fragrance, which happily straddles two of my favorite genres, animalic chypre and white floral. Imagine Songes with a drop of Femme and you have this (EDP). I don't, however, detect a significant Iris note. I do get it in the mid phase, reminding me of the Iris in Ferre and others.
This is a beautiful, rich and elegant perfume but it isn't remarkable or strange. It is sexy, though and I would be happy to receive a bottle of this for Christmas!!

product_name: Acqua di Parma Iris Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I like EDT, it's light, crispy, perfect for summer, EDP smelled like different perfume alltogether.
I also have Iris Nobile body creme, which I tend to use even more than EDT. Body creme gives me feeling,besides moisturizing so well, that my skin smells naturally so beautiful, it's like my own skin scent. It makes me feel wealthy.
I would use light hand with Iris Nobile, it can easily overwhelm you (and others around you).

product_name: Acqua di Parma Iris Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I, just this past weekend, received carded spray samples of BOTH the Iris Nobile EDP and the EDT *bows deeply to ElenaLondon*...and here are the differences (as shown on the cards) between the two:

EDT: "An elegant floral fragrance-transparent, fresh and crystalline: IRIS, STAR ANISE, ORANGE BLOSSOM and AMBRETTE CRYSTALS."

EDP: "An intense floral fragrance-sensual, sophisticated and long lasting: IRIS/ORRIS, YLANG YLANG, PATCHOULI, VANILLA and OAK MUSK."

To me (at "firsniff") the EDP is definitely richer, thicker and more heady, sexy and deep...while the EDT (while remaining a "true" iris scent) is sharper, more "active" or energetic and spicier (after it dries down). I shall review BOTH of these "Ladies" (separately) VERY soon...

I do believe that the "for HER" AdP scents are actually more "me" than some of the men's releases are: (Cipresso di Toscano excluded) Iris Nobile EDP and Magnolia Nobile EDP, for example, are both well-constructed clean but complex florals with a touch of mystery and exotic spices, and marvelous dry downs that LAST!! My skin normally DEVOURS flowers like magnolia (or sours them!) but here they are amazing and long lasting (in either concentration)!

Kudos to Acqua di Parma! Your perfumes are as wonderful as your Colonias...maybe better! *winks*

product_name: Acqua di Parma Iris Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content: Very strong gardenia as it dries down. I was surprised when I discovered that but I can see other reviewers here also detect the gardenia. Lovely top notes but then come to the "gardenia" stage and the scent isn't so lovely any nore. The opening reminds of Couture Couture.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Iris Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content:
A strong and tenacious Orange Blossoms and Tuberose fragrance laying on a Gardenia base. The Iris in this composition it's just a side note that shows up in the middle phase but it's never dominating and remarks its presence with a barely perceptible voice. A well crafted EDP but somehow less, and no match for Iris Bleu Girs, Iris Silver Mist, Iris 39 or Iris De Nuit.

Lovely but absolutely mislabelled and a bit (just a bit) stereotyped.

Rating: 6.5-7/10

product_name: Acqua di Parma Iris Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content: This one is a nice scent but it's nothing for me. If you are into Iris, then this is a good choice.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Iris Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content: Strong sweet scent of giant Iris. Quite sweet on me. An anise note which sometimes comes forth. The cedar note comes out only eventually. Orange blossom comes out more in humidity. Superbly blended. Certainly noble.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Iris Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content: To prominent Ylang note for my taste. It made me a bit nauseous. I dont like white flowers in a perfume coz they always makes me woosy. Its a very strong perfume also so try before you buy

product_name: Acqua di Parma Iris Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Iris Nobile EdP - Makes me feel like a really rich girl. This one is a favourite. Deep, sensual and very woman-ish. I love all the notes in it and a really like the basenote with amber and vanilla. Longlasting - on my skin 6-7 hours. This one is exspensive - and I tried Burberry London EdP - which I find to be really similar but a little bit lighter than this gorgeous one. Iris Nobile is worth every penny in my opinion.

Härliga Iris Nobile EdP. Får mig att känna mig riktigt rik och flärdig. Djup sensuell och superkvinnlig doft som sitter i många timmar på huden - på mig mellan 6-7 timmar. Detta är en "dyring" och jag har även provat Burberry London EdP - som jag tycker är ganska lik denna - lite mjukare, liten aning blekare men härlig. Iris Nobile är dyr men värd pengarna, tycker jag

product_name: Acqua di Parma Iris Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Iris nobile (edp) is definitely very mediterranean. Kind of creamy but fresh, very strong... It really reminds me of organic olive soap! The way the 'bagno' (bathroom) would smell in a lovely italian villa. I think it's nice for 50+ women to smell interesting and elegant, but not for me. I absolutely don't hate it, but I don't really like it either. I think I would prefer it as a candle though.

EDIT: sometimes I really don't understand myself! Why did I make that remark on the 50+? It doesn't make any sense. I'm still on the mediterranean bathroomcandle opinion though, but that doesn't mean I wouldn't like to smell it on a 20 year old too (still not on me!).

product_name: Acqua di Parma Iris Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content: I LOVE the Acqua de Parma scents, from the unisex cologne that both my parents wear, to the new(er), floral notes of Iris Nobile, it lasts, it's distinctive, it's a great little scent, both as the EDP and as a room candle. Excellent Stuff.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Iris Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I've been sniffing all the iris-centric perfumes that I can get my nose on and happened upon a sample of Acqua di Parma IRIS NOBILE. Wow, I'm impressed. I may even be in love. Part of my surprise no doubt is due to the sheer fact that this is a perfume (edp, actually), not a cologne. Somehow I had been laboring under the misconception that a house called "Acqua di Parma" only traded in colognes, or watery "eaux". Not so, I am happy to have discovered!

IRIS NOBILE is a thick and rich, complex and layered iris perfume with a fantastically fine woody-iris drydown. I have to say that, next to this, Prada INFUSION D'IRIS does seem pretty boring--as some perfumistas have lamented. (Of course, that's fine with me, since if some did not like it I would never have acquired my big, beautiful bottle in a swap!)

This composition is closer to HIRIS, although it's true that the carroty, earthy facet of IRIS NOBILE is much less prominent. The anise adds thickness and depth. I do believe that this is a noble iris perfume, one of the best around. The quality is top-notch (yes, I'd compare it to Frederic Malle), and this composition is completely unisex. Iris lovers: do not neglect to give this gem a sniff!

************************
Addendum: having now glimpsed at The Guide, I have "learned" that, against all olfactory evidence, IRIS NOBILE is *not* an iris but a gardenia perfume! Whatever. (Perhaps chocolate smells like lobster, too...)

product_name: Acqua di Parma Iris Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content:
The first half hour of Iris Nobile EDP was all about impressions for me.

Dark soil, chopped root vegetables, dill weeds, earthworms, feet, pepper, the smell of steel shovel turning earth in the cold morning (all good). And then, an organic metallic smell, like blood and saliva (bad *bad* BAD!).

Thankfully this transforms itself into a cold, inorganic metallic base to the spicy powdery iris arising out of the ashes.

From here on in, it is all beauty and nobility. Cool, intoxicating, perfectly balanced, a little spicy, a little salty, a little floral, impossible to describe accurately. Very much worth trying.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Iris Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content: The last adp i sampled had this persistent lemon note which ruined a beautiful composition... thankfully iris nobile does not contain a heavy citrus note. It's subtle, powdery and oh so pretty. Would be wearable at work as well.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Iris Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Yes!!!
I could trade half of my perfume wardrobe for a bottle of EDP, so much so I am making evil plans how to obtain one in a month... Damn the economic rundown!
Anyway, to be helpful here- I can describe the EDP as a very soft and rich scent, very much creamy and fresh at once, round and full of vibe! I prefer the EDP to the EDT, as the latter is a little stripped down in a way, but it is probably a good choice for the hot weather. Imagine Shalimar without the vanilla and a little more fresh and mature, that's how it sounds to me. I think it is what the name promises- Iris Nobile! I LOVE it as well!

product_name: Acqua di Parma Iris Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content: Be sure to try both the EDP & EDT before you decide to purchase. Because these 2 are completley different fragrances. The EDT is lame and very light. While the EDP is a real magical stunner! So get the EDP - it's the only way to go with IRIS NOBILE! ;)

product_name: Acqua di Parma Iris Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content: I just love this scent of Iris. I have tried the EDT and Iam willing to try this fall the EDP.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Iris Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content: The EdP is like a child of Faubourg and Allure. Herbal, dry, but gentle and smooth at the same time. The opening notes are very strong, but it nicely settles down to a close-to-the-skin-scent.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Iris Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I had high expectations. The noble Iris didn't let me down: Who could turn down a classy, simplified beauty? I felt as if I were metamorphing into a real flower during the first minutes. :)

Such a downright scent stripped off of any unnecessary distractions. Very well done. In its sophistication Iris Nobile doesn't suit everybody (including a tomboy like me).

I really like the subtle anis note. It's a peculiar note choice but seems to work well! The bottle is also very stylish, oozing dignity and prestige.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Iris Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content: A very translucent, transparent iris flower.For such many notes it is a very simple, non complicated scent.Easy to wear, good for those who don`t like to wear perfumes but fell like thy are obliged to....and for hot climate, too.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Iris Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content: This Iris smells like iris. The other iris fragrances I've tested usually remind me a sweet carrot. This one reminds ma an iris flower. Not bad at all, iris fans will like it )

product_name: Acqua di Parma Iris Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content: hmm never smelled something from this brand but i would like to! the bottles look a bit like a nailpolish bottle xD

product_name: Acqua di Parma Iris Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Beautiful, absolutely beautiful. An iris based fragrance at its prettiest.

Iris Nobile is so very feminine and subtle. On the skin it becomes incredibly natural and soothing. This fragrance smells as expensive as it is worth, a delicate and interesting blend of notes which is in no way synthetic or loud.

I find that this fragrance could suit any age group, it's versatile and suitable for all occasions, all seasons.

The drydown is my favourite aspect of Iris Nobile, the powdery iris and vanilla blend is to die for. However, this fragrance is divine from beginning to end.

Lasting strength of this fragrance is excellent, well worth the money in my opinion. One of the prettiest florals I've ever come across and certainly worth all the rave reviews. Iris Nobile gets the thumbs up from me.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Iris Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content: I like this perfume - whene a smell this perfume i imagen wonderful girl>>

product_name: Acqua di Parma Iris Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content: This is a beautiful Iris but can't beat "Iris Poudre"

product_name: Acqua di Parma Iris Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content: This is a perfume of utmost elegance. You cannot go wrong with it because it is never overwhelming and leaves you fresh. I own the Eau de Parfum, and I love it. It is long-lasting, thus perfect for even a warm day in spring. It underlines the strong personality of a modern mature woman.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Iris Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content: I tried the EDT, which is fairly soft and lasted only a couple hours on my skin. The powdery iris is very much evident and it's carried through the fragrance by an almost minty citrus and sweet vanilla drydown. I found it an interesting fusion of the older turn-of-the-century classics I've tried and the more trendy new ones, but I don't know if I'd buy a whole bottle just yet. I'd like to try the EDP version first.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Iris Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content: Great and very elegant fragrance. I cannot agree on a possible overdose of the Edp, it´s not that strong in my opinion and experience.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Iris Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content: I really wanted to like this, as I love Prada's Iris. However, on me this was very one note. And sadly that note smelled a lot like Jean Nate! Yikes. Not for me.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Iris Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content: I honestly didn't know what I was getting into by buying this perfume. It's bold & mature & long lasting. It's a lovely scent.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Iris Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Iris Nobile has very noble name. It's strong, powdery and smells of iris very much. At first, the top notes and heart notes smell just like the Latvian perfume Intrigue N.1 which I left at grandma's. That one was extremely powdery, a killer scent.
Iris Nobile is real retro scent. It can seem very old fashioned to light, sweet perfume lovers, anyway this one has character and very noble personality.
Then after hours it goes more into sweet side. It has chypre feeling to it too. I was like love it, like it... oh, I own 1 like that! It's worth the price, because lasting power and sillage also is very good (I tried EDP).
Bottle is nice, minimalistic with a taste.
I'd recommend it to strong mature women or for those who aren't afraid of strong personalities.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Iris Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content: Perhaps it's the Ylang Ylang or the bergamot and tangerine, but this smells very aggressively perfume-y on my skin and very little like iris. Sort of comes across synthetic and shouting. Zoka is right: go easy, if this works for you. For me, it just doesn't work at all. Blame chemistry, I guess.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Iris Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content: Intoxicating mix of tuberose, ylang-ylang, mimosa and a touch of iris. Very nice rounded fragrance, not for a shy person, but not quite so loud like Piguet Fracas. For me it's in the same category like Guerlain Mahora... I think it is better suited for a special occasion or evening wear.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Iris Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content:
What a lovely scent! It starts light, calm and powdery and there are charming jasmin and tuberose notes in the heart. I'm not very fond of tuberose in fragances because I don't find any scent to be similar to the real flower, but tuberose here is cozy and subtle, a scent very familiar to me (in Spain it's easy to smell the "galán de noche" -tuberose- in gardens in the evenings).

I don't know which one I have smelt (EDP or EDT) but I think it was EDT and I loved it. It's in my wishlist.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Iris Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content: I admire this perfume, it's one of the most beautiful perfumes based on iris, which is sweet, powdery, refined, so Nobile ;o)

product_name: Acqua di Parma Iris Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content: Be very careful with EDP it does not allow strong dose because it can kill surrounding people. EDT is a bit softer.

product_name: Oud and Zagara Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Oud and Zagara smells like a woman who definitely didn’t push her husband off the yacht - but also didn’t shout for help. She’s stretched out on the upper deck in head-to-toe white linen, sipping a Negroni, already eyeing up husband number two. The vibe? Don’t touch my Birkin, darling - and keep your muddy shoes off the teak.

The florals are sharp as nails- orange blossom with a refined accent and zero time for your nonsense. There’s a clean, soapy chill to it, like the scent of freshly steamed curtains in a hotel suite you’re not fancy enough to stay in. The oud? Barely peeking through, but just enough to say “old money” without trying too hard.

It’s cold, composed, and smells like it’s got a lawyer on speed dial. Not quite my cup of tea but if you want to smell like inherited wealth, quiet scandal, and a perfectly timed divorce, this is absolutely your bottle.

product_name: Oud and Zagara Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Ylang ylang is the most prominent note in the floral blend, it’s more floralthan oud, the oud is the tiny soft hint you get in mass appealing fragrances, not really noticeable at all.
Sweet floral musk with a woody musky base.
It’s ok, wouldn’t buy a bottle.

product_name: Oud and Zagara Acqua di Parma
review_content: Very heavy and spicy definitely great for cold weather

product_name: Oud and Zagara Acqua di Parma
review_content: I’m really enjoying this, for me is orange blossom, with a tint of tuberose and magnolia (I know these notes aren’t listed). I love the underlying oud but it’s weak and well balanced. This fragrance is bright, yet cosy

product_name: Oud and Zagara Acqua di Parma
review_content:
A very uncharacteristic release from ADP. This is very feminine, but a strong feminine due to the oud. What I get from this fragrance:

1) 70% creamy white floral (tuberose?)
2) 20% oud
3) 10% citrus

The oud is stronger than the concentration in either Oud and Spice or Oud from ADP. The white floral is very creamy and buttery and is the dominant actor in the composition.

I blind bought this from Harrods last week. Unfortunately it is not for me. DM me if you would like a brand new bottle (with original packaging) for a nice discount.

product_name: Oud and Zagara Acqua di Parma
review_content: Stunning release from the house of ADP once again. The saffron and Oud are amazing.

product_name: Colonia Intensa Oud Eau de Cologne Concentree Acqua di Parma
review_content: One of the best

product_name: Colonia Intensa Oud Eau de Cologne Concentree Acqua di Parma
review_content:
ما اینجا با یک عطر لوکس طرف هستیم، رایحه به شدت اعیونی و باکلاس
شروع کار به این صورته که همون اول رایحه مرکباتی که با ترنج و نارنج هست شروع میشه و مشک خیلی سریع به اونها اضافه میشه حضور آگاروود رایحه رو برای ما بین مرکباتی و چوبی؛ عودی و چرمی بالانس میکنه،که اینجای کار برای من به شخصه خیلی جذابه
این چرم ملایم که در بین نت‌ها‌ به خوبی میرقصه کار رو برای ما مثل یه فضای لوکس میکنه یه جوری به قول یکی از همین کاربرهای فرگرنتیکا
مثل فضای داخلی یک اتومبیل که با روکش چرمی لوکس تزئین شده و یه ته بوی پلاستیکی هم در بکگراند کار من میگیرم که خیلی برام دوستداشتنی نمایش عطر،هم بر روی پوست و هم رو لباس عالیه، و با هر استایلی هم این عطر رو میشه بپوشی هم کلاسیک هم کژوال و اینکه در چهار فصل قابل پوشش است

product_name: Colonia Intensa Oud Eau de Cologne Concentree Acqua di Parma
review_content: please let me know if you have one for sale of this type ;) thanks!

product_name: Colonia Intensa Oud Eau de Cologne Concentree Acqua di Parma
review_content: I definelty got this put up somewhere (this isn't a review) but from memory and having the newer black bottle version which I bought back a few years ago, the concentree version has that acq oud accord that they use but it attempts to go into a more authentic oud direction a westernised oud but a more real smelling oud the black bottle version is a more westernised "less real" oud and more of the feel of oud captured in a scent I hope to find the concentree version in the brown bottle. IMP the concentree version is slightly more realistic, and I can see what the comment below is talking abou,t also that russina coriander makes ot unique, wonder what it would smell like with real Indian in trace amounts, I'm still looking for a bottle despite it not having real oud.

product_name: Colonia Intensa Oud Eau de Cologne Concentree Acqua di Parma
review_content: This stuff smells like sex on a floral beach, near a campfire burning the world's most luxurious woods. It's hard to choose when to wear this. Its an ABSOLUTE must have for any oud head, or a sillage kind of person. If you want to be noticed by men and women alike, aces!

product_name: Colonia Intensa Oud Eau de Cologne Concentree Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Colonia Intensa Oud Eau de Cologne Concentree opens with Calabrian bergamot & Italian Orange. But they're not bright Citruses. They're fresh, but they're Dark. Darkened up by the immediate presence of Oud & Leather. The Citruses are also Piney from the Amyris.

From its initial opening Colonia Oud smells more like a Leather fragrance with supporting Citruses & Woody notes than it does an Oud forward fragrance.. The Leather note is fantastic.

This combination of Citruses, Oud, & the faint Spice of Coriander makes Colonia Oud smell like luxury leather. Like the interior of some ridiculously expensive luxury vehicle.

As Colonia Oud settles on my skin it becomes so well blended that for the next 2 hours I cant pick out any of the other notes outside of Leather & Oud until I finally begin to pick up on a subtle Bitter Green, & mildly Earthy Patchouli Leaf in the dry down. Several hours after that you're left with a Dark, Cedar, Sandalwood, & Musk skin scent with Spicy nuances.

Colonia Oud is a bit of a chameleon. It appears to be whatever you dress it up as.

If you wear it as a CEO, then it smells like a CEO. If you wear it in Black Tie Attire, then it smells Black Tie Attire. But it can also be very alluring in the right situation with the right outfit. That said, if you dress it up in a Dark Leather Jacket & Dark Clothes as a Bad Boy, then it smells like a Bad Boy.

The Oud note doesnt smell Earthy, Moldy, or like a Mechanics Shop, nor does it smell like a Barnyard. It smells like subtle Dark Dry Woods.

Performance is very good with Colonia Oud, & it can be worn year round..

product_name: Colonia Intensa Oud Eau de Cologne Concentree Acqua di Parma
review_content:
The scent that got me into trying new things.
Prior to receiving a sample of this from an online niche fashion outfit, I had only encountered the real mainstream outputs of the big Houses - from the likes of; Dior, Chanel, JPG. Basically front line duty free available products.
One smell of this and I was hooked on OUD and the signature of ADP. The one is rich and deep, woody and leather laden, smooth and citrusy but with little of the sharp 'anamalic' funk of some Ouds. Very recommended, especially as a gateway from the more mass market crowd pleasers. Plus if you like this one also have a look at the ADP Leather.

product_name: Colonia Intensa Oud Eau de Cologne Concentree Acqua di Parma
review_content: A clean musky oud and leather. Clean does not rhyme well with oud or leather but in this, it does. It has a very subtle animalic touch to it that interestingly stays very close to skin while this fragrance has an over the average silage. Hands down the longest lasting fragrance marketed as EDC I have ever seen. Stays on clothing for days and projects nicely for hours; better than most of EDPs and parfums these days. Musk is chosen as the main pairing note with oud here and I really like it -- a trend breaker that doesn't use rose. It stays on long and projects really good but yet it feels light. IMO, it's a year-round fragrance and office safe. It's marketed towards men and opens up a bit masculine leaning but in dry down it is very unisex to my nose. Overall, it's a weirdly interesting fragrance in a good way. Also, it reminds me Chopard Musk Malaki.

product_name: Colonia Intensa Oud Eau de Cologne Concentree Acqua di Parma
review_content: Not bad, reminds me of dior farenheit edc.

product_name: Colonia Intensa Oud Eau de Cologne Concentree Acqua di Parma
review_content: I agree with @ugurtaskin and disagree with the below comment, I have ACQ Oud in the black bottle, I've had that for about a 1 year to 1year & 1/2 and it has all the ACQ style - an Oud but in a lighter way, but when I remeber smelling what came from the brown colonia and colonia intense it was a bit more leathery, authentic Oud, but you can't go wrong with the nore current version in the black bottle although I miss the colonia Intesa and since my back bottle is above halfway, I'm on the hunt for one of the colonia versions rather than the one in the black bottle, which again you can't go wrong but somehow there is something pleasantly blue it has that element which a lot of western modern men's designer blue fragrances have in them - which wraps the overall scent of acqua di parma's interpretation of oud, I enjoy but I'm in the hunt for the brown bottled version. Although yes you kind of can and kind of can't tell the difference its strange but the original version left a good impression.

product_name: Colonia Intensa Oud Eau de Cologne Concentree Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Y'all are funny, lol. I've had the Colonia Intensa Oud, Colonia Oud, and Oud presentations - all the exact same damn formula code; no reformulation. RELAX.

Fantastic scent. Strong stuff too! Pretty unique, IMO.

product_name: Colonia Intensa Oud Eau de Cologne Concentree Acqua di Parma
review_content:
@ joey.w

It hasn't been discontinued. There was a name change and rebottling. That's all.

product_name: Colonia Intensa Oud Eau de Cologne Concentree Acqua di Parma
review_content: It’s not discontinued. It’s now November 1 2021 and it’s still on ADP website!

product_name: Colonia Intensa Oud Eau de Cologne Concentree Acqua di Parma
review_content:
If you are a new comer to oud
And afraid of how animalic it could be
Try this one
With incredible longevity and moderate sillage
It’s a great Choice that is hard to hate
And do not buy the edp its alot weaker than this one

product_name: Colonia Intensa Oud Eau de Cologne Concentree Acqua di Parma
review_content: I love this rich oud scent, it is smooth and divine without being overpowering. It can be layered with another scent and enhance it. As a woman, I would wear it myself; both men and women can pull it off. One spritz and it lasts for hours on me.

product_name: Colonia Intensa Oud Eau de Cologne Concentree Acqua di Parma
review_content: love it

product_name: Colonia Intensa Oud Eau de Cologne Concentree Acqua di Parma
review_content: FYI, an official at ADP told me that their Oud line has been discontinued.

product_name: Colonia Intensa Oud Eau de Cologne Concentree Acqua di Parma
review_content: A great citrus-topped oud/leather. True ADP style.

product_name: Colonia Intensa Oud Eau de Cologne Concentree Acqua di Parma
review_content: I bought this last June and I'd noticed someone suggested it was more of a warm weather fragrance. So I tried it. And yeah, they weren't wrong. It works so well on the hottest days. It projects and lasts all day. I find it a little too cold for winter wear and I personally prefer something a little deeper, darker and cosier on a cold English day.

product_name: Colonia Intensa Oud Eau de Cologne Concentree Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Thinking of making it my signature, over the darkest coldest part of winter. 10ml decant from Ebay with free shipping, £9.95; cumulatively cheaper than many outlets charge for a full bottle. My first shot was sickly and cloying. The next time was extra dry and woody. Gorgeous.
It seems powerful. And 10 minutes later, even more so. One spray on a wrist, then rubbing over other wrist, and the neck, was plenty. Though one spray from Ebay seller phials tends to be too much- so possibly you can risk 2 sprays from the branded container if you own a bottle.
It's down to personal preference, but I love the intense woody aroma. It compliments the icy air of the day or evening. I personally like it as a daytime scent.
If you're trigger happy, it could be suffocating for people who hate it. And I expect some will hate it. I haven't worn it in front of my official fragrance adviser yet. She's brutally honest

product_name: Colonia Intensa Oud Eau de Cologne Concentree Acqua di Parma
review_content:
What is the difference between.:
- COLONIA OUD
- COLONIA INTENSA OUD
- OUD
I see 3 versions. How can help?

product_name: Colonia Intensa Oud Eau de Cologne Concentree Acqua di Parma
review_content: My all time very favorite men's fragrance, and I own over 19 different bottles of fragrances ACQUA DI PARMA OUD is hands down my signature fragrance I get compliments on it all the time. My friends, co-workers, and even my doctor loves this fragrance. I have both (2012 men's version) and, the unisex (2019 version). This fragrance reminds me of fresh cut wood it's perfect for day, night and, even to wear to work.☝️ 👍 Except the price is very high I spent years waiting/saving to buy it and, just this past Spring of 2020 I finally bought both versions of this fragrance. Worth the investment and, wait.

product_name: Colonia Intensa Oud Eau de Cologne Concentree Acqua di Parma
review_content: this is overdose sweet-rose to my nose. an overwhelming opening. but has a nice drydown.

product_name: Colonia Intensa Oud Eau de Cologne Concentree Acqua di Parma
review_content:
one of my top fragrances ever with enormous projection, sillage and everything else that's awesome! It fills everywhere and leaves a trail without even trying.

First time I purchased it, I was trigger happy and jumped on a train to see my (then fiancee) wife. Boy, was I silly for doing that. I think I must have given the guy who sat across me a concussion. So quick advice - go easy on the trigger.

Easily one of the best oud leather fragrances I have owned without a doubt. I do accept though, that it may not be for everyone and may be too harsh on some people's nose, but for me it is an eternal affection.

sillage: 10/10
projection: 10/10
Longevity: 9/10
Scent: 9/10

product_name: Colonia Intensa Oud Eau de Cologne Concentree Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Great ‘fresh’ oud, with terrific staying power.
Very good projection en silage for the first 2-3 hours.
After 5 or 6 hours you get more of the woody oud part.
That woody scent ...on.clothes it’s still there after 2 weeks !!

I was at a bar where a lady came back to me because wanted to smell this scent again.
she was in love with the scent, not with me...;-)

Get your hand on this ‘cologne concentree’ in the brown bottle,
Because it’s the same as the new black bottles and they are almost double the price...

product_name: Colonia Intensa Oud Eau de Cologne Concentree Acqua di Parma
review_content:
A daring oud citrus that is pleasantly unique. I love fragrances that push the boundaries and this does that in a "genius is simplicity" sort of way. It certainly feels as though you will stand out wearing this. I have received a couple of compliments and if oud gives you comfort, I think youll find it very satisfying.

I must say at first I didnt like it, but I didnt hate it. I just felt like this was something like the Middle Eastern version of Rodney Dangerfield would wear? My take is that if you have a lot of personality then you can push the edge a little more. I am not much like Rodney Dangerfield, nor am I the kind of man that can make golf pants work while enjoying a fine plate of kebab. Regardless, after a couple of wears I can safely say I like it. It projects for several hours, the peppery oud will stick around and slowly rise up off the skin. It will fill a room quite easily if you linger for a bit. The richness of it makes it hang around, it has maybe a 2 meter sillage for the first 6 hours. Citruses compete with the oud for quite a while but they will eventually diffuse off faster than the oud. Amyris connects the oud's smokiness and the sweetness of the musk and it announces its high quality ingredients quite clearly. For me, unfortunately, there is not enough basey sweetness for me to offset the oud. Im not in to sweet fragrances, but the oud skank lingers a bit too much in all phases for me. Hilariously, even though I was looking for oud fragrances without rose, I think it is sorely lacking here in a just a minute tiny amount to offset that funk.

I like it, but it's not for me. It's clever and unique and thats what I really appreciate about it, but I got bored with it fast. One spray can be fine with this if you pop it on a pulse point and not the inner forearm where it takes all day to diffuse. I found myself layering it with Aqua Amara and JHAG Not-a-Perfume (Cetalox - synthetic ambergris). Id give it a 8 overall. If you want something different than the billion rose oud combos, this is one of them. I just wish it had a bit something to offset a little more of the bitterness of the oud to me. I dont really care if a blindly miss on a couple like this, it was an enjoyable learning experience. These are the kind of scents that remind me of why I love Italian fragrances in general. I find them fearless, artful, and elegant in most of their fine crafts. Never afraid to express masculine and feminine sexuality.

product_name: Colonia Intensa Oud Eau de Cologne Concentree Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Acqua di Parmas Colonia Intensa take on oud, and what a great, unique way to do so!

Opens up with a beautiful combination of oud, leather and citruses. You're hit with a fresh, warm and woody combination. The oud isn't skanky or barnyward oud, but very woody. The leather/wood/oud combination gives the same vibe you'll also find in Issay Miyake Noir Ambre. There is coriander as well that gives it a subtle, spicy touch and then musk rounds it off and also gives it a powdery and fresh touch.

I've seen people talk about this being a rose/oud combo, but I cannot detect any rose what so ever. This really isn't a rose/oud combo. Again you have the Colonia Intensa DNA with oud. This also means, that if you normally do not like oud fragrances, but want to get into ouds, this might be something worth trying.

Due to the fresh, musky feel to it, it can in theory be worn year round, but I wouldn't wear this on hot days.

This is also something to go easy on the trigger with. One or two sprays on the chest will last you all day and you will be able to smell it for 10-12 hours easily with few sprays. Silage is also very decent, so be mindful not to choke people out.

Age-range is probably a bit more mature, but again due to the freshness and powdery, I could see someone in their 20s wearing this.

I would advise against blind buying, but if you love ouds, do check this one out! 8/10 as oud fragrances go.

product_name: Colonia Intensa Oud Eau de Cologne Concentree Acqua di Parma
review_content: Always thought of this as the perfect blend of rose and oud. The opening is almost varnish like, with harsh woody projection and an almost offensive bitterness to it. It dies down rather quickly into a rosy, warm, pungent Middle Eastern style fragrance with enormous projection. This was my go to scent for daily wear (one squirt was plenty) during the summer, and by mid afternoon I smelled like a rose garden in full bloom with that royal oud base note wafting through. Really love this one, by far one of ADP's best creations.

product_name: Colonia Intensa Oud Eau de Cologne Concentree Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I had high hopes for Intensa Oud from the descriptions and I'm a fan of the Acqua di Parma house but this didn't work for me at all.

In the opening I got a strong woody (but not necessarily oud) feel and rose. I did not make it far into the development before it started making me feel ill and I needed to shower again and change clothes.

product_name: Colonia Intensa Oud Eau de Cologne Concentree Acqua di Parma
review_content: I know it isn’t in the note breakdown but I get a lot of rose in the opening and middle.

product_name: Colonia Intensa Oud Eau de Cologne Concentree Acqua di Parma
review_content: To my nose this smells like varnished wood , i just dont like , aqua di parma are a great house love essenza .

product_name: Colonia Intensa Oud Eau de Cologne Concentree Acqua di Parma
review_content:
A unique soapy fresh western oud. If you ever wonder what oud soap might smell like give this one a try.You get the soapy fresh elements of the acqua di parma DNA with the inclusion of civilized clean oud in the base. The fragrance picks up some spicy and creamy undertone as it dries down. The transitions are gradual and the fragrance lasts a lifetime on my skin. Niche quality as the price suggests of course.

I imagine this would be the smell of the oud soap you would find in a six star hotel in Dubai. It feels luxurious, deep,elegant but surprisingly zesty and clean for an oud fragrance.

I think its a masterpiece and the best creation from ADP.

P.s. colonia intense oud,colonia oud and oud parfum are all the same fragrance.

product_name: Colonia Intensa Oud Eau de Cologne Concentree Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Scent: 8/10

Quality: 9/10

Originality: 5/10

Sillage: 7/10

Projection: 7/10

Longevity: 7/10

Price VS Size: 7/10

product_name: Colonia Intensa Oud Eau de Cologne Concentree Acqua di Parma
review_content: This is a love hate for me. I love the fact that I have found one of the best oud frags out there and its readily available for purchase and testing. I hate it gives me a sinus headache. This is good juicy wearable and pleasant. Acqua Di Parma did a great job.

product_name: Colonia Intensa Oud Eau de Cologne Concentree Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Agarwood,in my opinion,is something else.
P.Š. the original version is better.

product_name: Colonia Intensa Oud Eau de Cologne Concentree Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I Will tell you who you are .
You are an European entrepreneur who worked Many years of his life in the Middle East, in the Gulf to be more precise.
Yes this stuff is for the refined gentleman who wears a black suit and drives a Mercedes.
It’s not only the Oud here . You get a generous blast of elegant leather note in the beginning. So Royal. Then comes fruity notes in between. When you think the stuff is starting cooling down you will get a long lasting Oud note that will last for hours .
You will smell Oud to the next day. Even your sheets will take a share of this good stuff.
So sophisticated , elegant and unique.
Simply a master piece, well done 👍 Acqua du Parma.

product_name: Colonia Intensa Oud Eau de Cologne Concentree Acqua di Parma
review_content: This is a great scent. I love it.

product_name: Colonia Intensa Oud Eau de Cologne Concentree Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Smells like a cheap urinal-cake, with lots of really unsettling chemical notes. Don’t really know what else to say. Very very strong and somewhat headache-inducing. Don’t understand the hype one bit.

Scent: Horrible
Sillage/projection: Beast-mode
Longevity: Beast-mode

product_name: Colonia Intensa Oud Eau de Cologne Concentree Acqua di Parma
review_content: I am not faint of heart — I love any number of funky leathers and ouds — but, after repeated tryings, I find this to be nearly unwearable. In fact, my experience is so different from most of the reviewers here that I am left to wonder if I have a bad bottle, though purchased from a reputable retailer. For me, the first 45 minutes or so are near torture, with a loud sour medicinal note and some quality that I can only describe as urinous. And I’m not talking about the urine of a healthy, well hydrated human, but that of a semi-feral animal, e.g., think deer or raccoon. I have eclectic fragrance tastes and experience, and I read tons of Fragrantica reviews. I have never, ever had such a radically different experience from all the other kids on the block. Will definitely seek an opportunity to try from another bottle.

product_name: Colonia Intensa Oud Eau de Cologne Concentree Acqua di Parma
review_content: A very refined and elegant take on oud, which stands out from the crowd due to the finesse and subtlety evident in the blending. The opening is a fresh spicy citrus affair characteristic of colognes, yet made more unusual by the inclusion of an especially light and warm oud. The oud note seems to deepen, leading smoothly into a musky, leathery heart. Excellent longevity. From start to very long finish, this fragrance oozes warmth and sophistication. Very seductive and bound to generate allure. Without doubt, a good contender for a signature fragrance.

product_name: Colonia Intensa Oud Eau de Cologne Concentree Acqua di Parma
review_content: Wanting to buy an Oud Fragrance I looked hard at others reviews. This is the one I got and have no regrets. A Citrus too note when applying that fades away into a really nice leather and mellow Oud. Love at first scent. When wanting the best out of a fragrance you wish for one like this. One of my personal favorites for any occasion all year round!

product_name: Colonia Intensa Oud Eau de Cologne Concentree Acqua di Parma
review_content: This is absolutely unique! An exquisite blend of rich essences that seduces me especially since there isn't anything sweet in it. Something old and something new... Citrus notes and spices in shades of dark green. A gentleman from the countryside wearing tweeds while roaming the woods. Casually elegant. Manly and bold! A beautiful Indian summer or a misty late autumn and early winter morning.

product_name: Colonia Intensa Oud Eau de Cologne Concentree Acqua di Parma
review_content:
A well-executed and sleek Italian twist on the Oud concept.

To preface this little review, I don't get any Oud from this fragrance at all. I find it more revolving around the concept of Oud rather than using any of the usual Oud notes. Having said that, it's an excellent fragrance.

The opening here is gorgeous; though very contrasting and odd. It smells like a dark wood, with incredibly citric nuances. Imagine splashing freshly cut bitter oranges over some old, antique dark wood. It's a very distinct and nostalgic smell. To my nose, there may be a hint of lime, both the juice and the rind. There is a definite dark undertone to it all, musky and leathery. The composition has a very dry opening.

Interestingly, I don't find the fragrances progresses much. Over time, the citruses don't smell as fresh anymore, and take more of a backseat. I believe the coriander may give the illusion of citruses being strongly present throughout the lifetime of the fragrance. Slowly, the fragrance gets muskier, and drier.

I find that this is an extremely wearable Oud. It is not at all as conceptual and experimental as it sounds; it simply smells like very clean, bitter woods. In small amounts, it could easily be worn to the office (it's very strong).

Performance is incredible with this one. Longevity is such that it stays even after having a shower, easily lasting a full 24 hours. Projection is very heavy for about 4-6 hours. I personally don't need more than 2 sprays with this, though 1 would definitely suffice too.

All in all, a very Italian take on the Oud concept. There is no animalic facet, no barnyard smell, no sweet warmth. It's a cold, sharp and clean take.

An excellent creation.

product_name: Colonia Intensa Oud Eau de Cologne Concentree Acqua di Parma
review_content: much time spent looking for my ideal fragance and from two years ago this is it. Great, different, rich and personal. Don't forget the deodorant spray and bath gel to complete the experience

product_name: Colonia Intensa Oud Eau de Cologne Concentree Acqua di Parma
review_content: Aqua di Parma Colonia Intensa Oud has to be the most incredible and sophisticated Oud ever made. I now have what I like to call my aqua di Parma trilogy with Aqua di Parma Chinoto di Liguria, Aqua di Parma Colonia Intensa, and now Aqua di Parma Colonia Intensa Oud. If you can't spoil yourself who will???

product_name: Colonia Intensa Oud Eau de Cologne Concentree Acqua di Parma
review_content: It's like a Creed Royal Oud with citrus and it is fantastic. Wearable even during the summer. Must try.

product_name: Colonia Intensa Oud Eau de Cologne Concentree Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Perhaps my favorite Summertime oud fragrance that I have enjoyed wearing since purchasing a bottle in 2014. Oud, leather and coriander blended with citrus is what I get out of Intensa Oud, and I love it. For those expecting a deep, dank or medicinal oud...move-on because you're not not going to find it here. Instead, you're going to experience a lighter-oud- along the line of Creed Royal Oud--that shares top-billing with leather and coriander.

Moreover, if you don't like coriander than you may not like this one since it is certainly noticeable. Offhand, I cannot see why more people did not vote for coriander as a more prominent note since it is extremely noticeable (front and center from top to bottom), but it is what it is. Personally, I love how coriander and citrus are used in Intensa Oud as they are combined to make a terrific oud fragrance that can be worn year-round, day or night and is classy at the office and appropriate for an intimate evening event.

Longevity and projection are both excellent, but not beastly. One can wear this fragrance into the office during the day and it remains on your skin for a terrific evening cuddle scent. As much as I love this scent, it's a definite try because it's just a bit out of the mainstream.

product_name: Colonia Intensa Oud Eau de Cologne Concentree Acqua di Parma
review_content:
What a fantastic scent!

Finally an Acqua Di Parma I'll be happy to wear! Being Italian I've always wanted to have at least one in collection but so far nothing from the Colonia line had worked for me, although the scents are gorgeous they turn out too soapy, flowery and granmotherish.

This one is rather PERFECT. Elegant, fresh but deep, refined, unique, sexy (the first sexy scent I smell from ADP) and a KING OF VERSATILITY! The more I smell it and the more I can imagine me wearing it in EVERY... I repeat because it's quite rare... E-V-E-R-Y kind of weather, season, time of the day or night, context or occasion.

The only fragrance it reminds me of JUST A LITTLE BIT is Zoologist Rhinoceros, but without the booze and that Vicks Vaporub feel that I found really weird and hard to wear.

It can be a signature scent without any problem whatsoever.

10 out of 10 fragrance, one of the best ever smelled. And can I say something surely unpopular: it's an Aventus killer. I don't mean it smells similar, it doesn't, but can serve exactly the same purposes perfectly, it's niche quality too and way less expensive.

product_name: Colonia Intensa Oud Eau de Cologne Concentree Acqua di Parma
review_content:
It's an EdC indeed because after 2 hours all the initial complexity (which I love) is gone.
What remains - sticking out like a sore thumb - is a single aroma chemical. It reminds of isopropyl alcohol, maybe by some perceived as "medicinal". Unfortunately that one note lasts well beyond the 8 hour mark.
Only a fool would expect actual oud oil in this but some form of oud accord would have been nice. In conclusion AdP Oud is about as much about oud as is WD40.
For a seriously crafted scent, consider a look at what Heeley has to offer.

product_name: Colonia Intensa Oud Eau de Cologne Concentree Acqua di Parma
review_content: At first I was skeptical a friend gave me a sample and i was still skeptical,until 1 day I decided to wear it and Bam 2 compliments so yes I am a sucker for a compliment so i bought a FB :) I read below how some have compared it to a royal fabric softner and I get it ROYAL being the key word.

product_name: Colonia Intensa Oud Eau de Cologne Concentree Acqua di Parma
review_content: I like the fact that Acqua di parma added citruses note in order to make Oud fresher and more wearable. It has a very unique depth and touch of mysteriousness. Longevity is 12+ on me and sillage is sneaky goes from under your shirt to hit and run. In general I don't think it's an easy fragrance to wear, but would be great for an evening date in a cold night.

product_name: Colonia Intensa Oud Eau de Cologne Concentree Acqua di Parma
review_content: I got this in a parcel from an incredibly generous friend and I just love it. This is the type of fragrance that you want to smell on a lover, it's so comforting. It smells a little bit dirty, but mostly comforting. Nothing like most oudh based fragrances you'll find out there, it's a bit like the car of a very classy man. Leather seat covers, a mixture of strong, rugged and soft, fresh scents permanently afixed to the interior of said car. It's both something I don't want to smell of and something I constantly want to smell like. Not highly unusual, but maybe a try before buy. However, if you like leather or oudh scents, you'll probably enjoy this.
