product_name: Colonia Intensa Oud Eau de Cologne Concentree Acqua di Parma
review_content: This stuff is awesome. It DOES smell like fabric softener, like royal fabric sofener! This is no run of the mill scent. I personally think it's a good blind buy. Very potent but not overpowering. It's a balance of wood an fruit unlike I've ever smelt. 8-10

product_name: Colonia Intensa Oud Eau de Cologne Concentree Acqua di Parma
review_content: Just purchased from notino. This is my first aoud frag. Only time will tell. I'l be back :)

product_name: Colonia Intensa Oud Eau de Cologne Concentree Acqua di Parma
review_content: If you like this please try Hajar by syed junaid alam you'll be blown away. Citrus and oud beautiful combination.

product_name: Colonia Intensa Oud Eau de Cologne Concentree Acqua di Parma
review_content:
First impression is that this is super juice but quite an odd concoction, as it's almost a clash of 2 completely opposing scent groups, but mixed perfectly to form a wonderful frag.
I've never really liked ADP as a house but this has definitely encouraged me to explore them properly.
From the get go this reminded me of original Kouros, not the reformulated stuff, but with an added massive citrus blast and arguably the bets woody notes I've ever smelt in a frag.
And i'm no oud or Kouros fan at all but this just blew me away.

ADPCO is an incredible scent, it has room filling projection and lasts easily 24 hours on my skin.

I'm not usually a 'Buy it on first test' kind of guy but this and Black Afgano, which I think is arguably the greatest frag ever created, are two that I just fell in love with instantly.

EDIT: 29 Aug, The idea of mixing citrus with oud seems bonkers, we all know the myriad of floral/Ouds and spicey/Oud combos but citrus? Who'd a thunk it.....I think this is just keeps getting better and better and I can't think of another scent that even comes close to resembling this.

product_name: Colonia Intensa Oud Eau de Cologne Concentree Acqua di Parma
review_content: This juice is the best way to start with Oud if you are a beginner. A perfect quality price ratio and a crowd pleaser scent.Thumbs up!

product_name: Colonia Intensa Oud Eau de Cologne Concentree Acqua di Parma
review_content: Holy crap, it's just come to me: This smells identical to San Pellegrino (the drink)!!! The most masterful Acqua di Parma made, no question. It's an oud you can wear at the pool! Stunning!!

product_name: Colonia Intensa Oud Eau de Cologne Concentree Acqua di Parma
review_content: Does anyone know of any fragrance which has the dry down scent of this from top to bottom? It's just to die for! Anytime I wear this I just want it to reach the dry down

product_name: Colonia Intensa Oud Eau de Cologne Concentree Acqua di Parma
review_content: This juice right here is the one. One of my current top 3. The top notes go on a little harsh with the strong oud and leather notes. But hold on, after 20 minutes of the dry down, it is phenomenal. I get leather, coriander and course oud without the oud being real strong. The oud sits there in the background letting you know its there without being the maim attraction. The citrus note really comes out without being to citrusy. Lasts and projects all day and I mean all day, with just two sprays. Great for summer and in dry and arid climates. Be careful not to overspray especially if you wear this during summer days in humid and tropical climates. Worth the $200 price tag.

product_name: Colonia Intensa Oud Eau de Cologne Concentree Acqua di Parma
review_content:
So normally I don't care for ADP and I find the line generic and underperforming mostly.

This. How the @&€# did I miss this!? It is no beast, but it does have acceptable performance. Better then sauvage and edition blanche and most of the other "basic bastard" ubiquitous scents out there.

Sweet oud, not animalic, very approachable, very rounded and polished. For most people, unless you knew it was oud, you may have a hard time distinguishing it. I feel like this was what Creed was trying to achieve with Royal oud and just failed miserably. This does it right.

I bought the big 6+oz bottle after one day of wearing a decanted sample. Worth it.

Scent: 7.5/10 it isn't an art piece but it is definitely signature scent worthy.
Projection 6/10 for 2-3 hours and a rapid decline to near-skin/skin only afterwards.
Sillage: 6/10 for an hour or so then a very slight train.
Longevity: 7/10 even on my skin, I get 7 hours of use which is amazing for an ADP.

Would I buy another bottle? Absolutely.

product_name: Colonia Intensa Oud Eau de Cologne Concentree Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I am a fan of the Acqua di Parma line and I think they do very classy interpretations of notes. Colonia Intensa Oud is another good one in their line up and as long as you are not expecting a heavy, middle eastern type Oud Frag, chances are you will like this. I feel this is also a great starter frag for someone just beginning to get into Oud as you get all the good parts of Oud here, albeit synthetic, without any of the off putting barnyard stuff.

Top notes are a weird, slightly pungent combo of bitter citrus and Oud. The citrus notes fade and the Oud is joined by the leather and amyris or elemi notes and hints of mild, slightly sour spice from the coriander. This frag really starts to shine around the two hour mark when it turns into a beautiful, calm, slightly dry combo of leather and Oud and it stays this way all the way through the dry down, lasting a good 8 hours plus on me. Projects a lot in the first hour or so before settling down,but will give you a good 6 inch projection around you for most of it's scent life. Colonia Oud will work for most of the year except for hot summer months.

ADP Colonia Oud does pretty much all the things I want from an Oud frag and does it with a bit of Italian flair n panache. I love it and one of my go to Ouds. 9/10

product_name: Colonia Intensa Oud Eau de Cologne Concentree Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Wohaaa!! This is some serious stuff. i just received my package and it is intoxicating. I let my colleague test it and as I write, he is ordering his bottle. This would stand next to aventus in my collection :D
It's a billionaire's scent. Period!

product_name: Colonia Intensa Oud Eau de Cologne Concentree Acqua di Parma
review_content: The man below me did not read the post by the man below him properly

product_name: Colonia Intensa Oud Eau de Cologne Concentree Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I recently bought a ADP Colonia Intensa, loving the scent, but so disappointed about the longevity, it lasted for max 1 hour then all gone. So I decided to look around for another ADP, with awesome longevity, and I found this.

It's nothing like the Intensa, but it's really awesome! I just love the smell of the Oud, and the longevity is.. awesome at least.

Would really recomend this to people looking for gentleman scent.

product_name: Colonia Intensa Oud Eau de Cologne Concentree Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Oud done just right !
Followed by the Bond no' 9 Andy warhol (Face) same damn light good delicious Agarwood .
The freshness of the citrus makes it Daily/Evening
All ingredients blended tremendously awesome.

product_name: Colonia Intensa Oud Eau de Cologne Concentree Acqua di Parma
review_content: Waw, this one is a gem - smells like bergamot, suede/leather and smoothly varnished oak to me, with a slight hint of violet, rose and berries. Brings to mind a full-scale cigar humidor, a pair of the finest polished English brogues or perhaps the leather wing chairs of a New York country club; but not so much a Middle Eastern spice bazaar or that kind of thing, this is very Western. Smells luxurious and expensive; sultry, sexy and masculine... oh yes, and it lasts 12-18 hrs with one spray. Definetly worth every penny, even though I didn't pay retail it is worth it. And even though I generally don't like Oud fragrances, I love this... 5*.

product_name: Colonia Intensa Oud Eau de Cologne Concentree Acqua di Parma
review_content:
A different with balanced Oud...lovely light Oud...No flowery.Excellent longevity, for an eau de cologne.it is based with a perfect balance between citrus fresh and rich woody oud...It has got a perfect longevity..
I suggest it for fall and winter.
Fragrance: 9/10
Silage: 8/10
Longevity: 9/10
سمپل ارجینال جهت تست موجود است

product_name: Colonia Intensa Oud Eau de Cologne Concentree Acqua di Parma
review_content:
What a beautiful scent. So complex yet simple. 10/10 for me

My most complimented fragrance

product_name: Colonia Intensa Oud Eau de Cologne Concentree Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I blind bought this gem, based on the positive comments and I am very happy that I did so. It is really expensive and hard to find, but in overall the scent is very sophisticated and the performance is remarkable..
It stayed on my skin for more than 10 hours and the sillage was Ok; I got noticed even 6 hours in...
Usually I never get compliments on my frags, but for this one I received two in a day.
A very nice lady even asked me what I was wearing... I will keep this little beast in my collection and use it on special occassions.
This is real gentlemen stuff and could be even better pulled off with a suite & tie...
Enjoy...

product_name: Colonia Intensa Oud Eau de Cologne Concentree Acqua di Parma
review_content:
After trying out AdP Colonia Oud in department stores for months and asking for samples ( managed to get 3 so far ) i finally got a bought a bottle while in France over the weekend.

Seriously, I think this is the most amazing perfume I ever tried. Hyper fresh and realistic citrus with a deep and warm oud and hints of leather. Its mysterious, sensual, classy and still very fresh. It scents high quality. There is no rose here like in most ouds. I have been trying out many of the ouds on the market, even bought a bottle of Versace Oud Noir but nothing is close to AdP Colonia Oud. It is simply magnificent. Other ouds are imo eighter to smoky, to sweet or to heavy. Most of them smell of roses and I do not like it. But this one is just something else.
I see that many reviews compare this one to TF Oud Wood. But I think they don't even come close. Yes, oud is the main player in both but TF is heavy and warm while AdP is warm and fresh.

Longevity is hreat, lasts all day. Be careful when applying, very little goes a long way.

Great in summer for a white shirt with rolled up sleeves as well as a thin wool sweater during winter.

Regardless to the rather high pricetag this masterpiece is worth every cent.
But do not blind buy, must be tested out first.
Chris says here below that he finds rose to be very dominant. Interesting how our senses work. No matter how much i sniff i get no rose here.



10/10

I love it!!

product_name: Colonia Intensa Oud Eau de Cologne Concentree Acqua di Parma
review_content:
أعجبتني رائحة العود جداً في هذا العطر .. وهو موجه لمن لا يحب رائحة العود القوية .. فوحانه و ثباته جيده كونه كولونيا .. و لكن بشكلٍ عام لم يرضيني اداءه . و لكن يستحق التجربة لأن الرائحه فريدة !

الرائحه : 10/10
الثبات : 6/10
الفوحان : 7/10

product_name: Colonia Intensa Oud Eau de Cologne Concentree Acqua di Parma
review_content:
بوش بویی نیست که مردم ایران بپسندن. به شدت ایرانیارو یاد بوی عرب پولدارا میندازه و ایرانیا اصلن از این بو خاطره و حس خوبی ندارن. اکثر کسایی که روشون میشد بم بگن بازخوردشون این بود: "بوی عربارو میدی!"
-----------
Scent & Qualiy: 8/10
Longevity: 6/10
Sillage: 8/10
Creativity & Uniqueness: 8/10
Affordability: 4/10
-----------
Overall: 6.8/10

product_name: Colonia Intensa Oud Eau de Cologne Concentree Acqua di Parma
review_content: Finally an Oud that one can wear all year long! If new to the hobby of perfumery or just wanting a good signature scent I would highly reccomend getting this! After wearing it for the first time I'm speculating a possible reform as the first time I wore this it dried down to a over sweetend dark scent. Now it seem lighter and more woodsy, could of been a off batch too. Anyways, I caked a few sprays on a saks the other day and it lasted all day long and was a great fragrance. Smells very very good: no medicinal Oud, not overly done or complex and not the harsh Oud that some fragrances portray. This is a great fragrance and I think it deserves lots more attention to it.

product_name: Colonia Intensa Oud Eau de Cologne Concentree Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Ottima fragranza, della stessa stoffa e della stessa qualità di AP Leather e AP Ambra. Siamo quindi al top.

Avverto moltissimo il cuoio, forse anche più di quanto non avverta l'Oud, ma a differenza di AP Leather, questa fragranza è più dolce, morbida e per certi versi un po' meno mascolina.

Voto personale: 8/10

product_name: Colonia Intensa Oud Eau de Cologne Concentree Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Un parfum luxueux, des notes très présente d'oud avec un mélange de citron et musc donne un aspect très senior au parfum, il dure bien dans la peau et reste discret a la fois... c'est un parfum de prestige
une bouteille fine et majestueuse et une boite a la hauteur du parfum

product_name: Colonia Intensa Oud Eau de Cologne Concentree Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Acqua di Parma Light-Rose Oud.

I'm surprised the notes don't mention rose when it's so prominent, at least to my curious non-professional nose. It strikes me as a light-colored pink rose though, and not a rich deep red one. Also, the refreshing side of this fragrance didn't make it work so well during the winter months. I had better luck in warmer climate.

product_name: Colonia Intensa Oud Eau de Cologne Concentree Acqua di Parma
review_content: This is wonderful, but if you want an affordable alternative, try Oud Zaidan by Ajmal. I blind bought it on eBay for £12. Nothing on Fragrantica, no obvious website, so it really was a gamble, but I liked the descriptions given by sellers on eBay. An inexpensive "win" on the blind buy roulette table :-)

product_name: Colonia Intensa Oud Eau de Cologne Concentree Acqua di Parma
review_content: The opening was far too strong for my liking. I got an initial burst of Oud, citrus accords and something herbaceous which made me feel slightly nauseous. After approximately 2 hours the citrus notes disappeared and some musk settled in - that was nice - the dry-down was a smooth and sensual oud, musk and leather concoction that was very alluring. Longevity is second to none: sprayed it on around 17:00 and it's still going strong now at 01:52. I wouldn't purchase it because the opening is too harsh and lasts too long on my skin. Overall, it's a decent oud but nothing spectacular.

product_name: Colonia Intensa Oud Eau de Cologne Concentree Acqua di Parma
review_content: Amazing;-)

product_name: Colonia Intensa Oud Eau de Cologne Concentree Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Cologne Intense Oud, is not a conventional and classic Middle Eastern Oud wood, dirty, floral and balsamic aspects but rather a leather-oud soap which also can be seen that sense of many Italian fragrances to give that feeling to go clean and neat.

Do not get that effect must have a good fragrance Oud, since for it is worth very synthetic chords and somewhat artificial soap attached to this aspect to Essenza as not paste on a Oud, losing much and failing to find within the specific aspects of this essence and that sense of naturalness that has this wood seems to me a search of the most fascinating by the rich nuances offered, and even a synthetic way you can offer better fragrances this even at a much lower price.

Out of this aspect, the fragrance is not bad, the balance is there and it is good also the projection is also very good, but those chords as soap in such synthetic oud not really know what it is, do not offer a good Odour end result and that is vital to qualify well to a good fragrance.

Rating: 4

product_name: Colonia Intensa Oud Eau de Cologne Concentree Acqua di Parma
review_content: pffff what a lethal dose of Ambroxan-ish thing, it's a high concentrate of all the synthetic woody bases present in every actual cheap massmarket perfume for men (like One million).

product_name: Colonia Intensa Oud Eau de Cologne Concentree Acqua di Parma
review_content:
As the last few years have passed, I am still loving this one. It is unique, and even with the millions of Oud scents on the flooded market,

there is nothing quite like this on the market.

product_name: Colonia Intensa Oud Eau de Cologne Concentree Acqua di Parma
review_content:
A real italian definition of what an oud scent has to smell like. It projects decent and creates an attractive aura around you.

A real pleasure giving treasure!

product_name: Colonia Intensa Oud Eau de Cologne Concentree Acqua di Parma
review_content:
ما حداقل ده نوع چوب آگار داریم که هر کدوم با توجه به سن و سالشون باز هم بوی متفاوتی دارن
در این عطر از عود کمبودی استفاده شده که هر دوازده گرم از عصاره چوب آگار کمبودی هفتاد ساله؛حدود یک مبلیون تومن قیمتشه
عود کمبودی با یه بوی قوی رز مانند که خیلی کم دودیه شروع میشه و هر چی بمونه بوی رز ملایم و به سمت چرم حرکت میکنه..
اگر توو صد میل از این عطر دو گرم عصاره کمبودی باشه،مغزتونو تعطیل میکنه

product_name: Colonia Intensa Oud Eau de Cologne Concentree Acqua di Parma
review_content:
This manly scent is an acquired taste, but one that is worth acquiring.

There are only a handful of scents whose openings I enjoy. Whether it's my body chemistry or taste or combination of the two, I don't know? So, I take it as par for the course that I will dislike the opening.

Colonia Intensa Oud is no exception: the opening is foul. The combination of ingredients produce a pungent flowery, rose, shampoo smell that is reminiscent of the oldest of old women. Not that I dislike old women, I don't, it's just not my vibe, is all. I can't abide rose in a perfume and although it's never listed as an ingredient for Colonia Intensa Oud, that's all I get for the start.

After half an hour has passed a new aromatic presence starts to overwhelm. It smells as though it's the 80s and I have mixed Denim and Aramis together and added them to the rose to create one of the nastiest concoctions known to man!

An hour, or so, after initial application and the good times begin. The flowery rose becomes a distant memory and the Denim/Aramis battle resolves itself into something quite exquisite. The aromatics settle down and I get a sweet earthy musk with hints of coffee, sandalwood and burnt tyres.

I find it quite hard to pinpoint specific individual notes as the blend is quite masterful, it's very much an olfactory chord. And this harmonious union just keeps getting better and better for the length of its life.

Fragrances tend to last long and project strongly on me. This one goes against the grain; I get about 5-6 hours of moderate projection. I also have to factor in applying it an hour before going out to avoid the unpleasant start.

In its pomp, Colonia Intensa Oud is highly masculine, it's a heavy hitting businessman wearing a tailored brown suit and a thick, heavy, gold wrist chain. It took me a while, but I've got to say: I dig.

product_name: Colonia Intensa Oud Eau de Cologne Concentree Acqua di Parma
review_content: with Colonia assoluta is my favourite. I think it outstand all the other acqua di parma range. It last quite a bit and definitely after a couple of spray it last.

product_name: Colonia Intensa Oud Eau de Cologne Concentree Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Acqua di Parma's Colonia Oud does for Oud what Colonia Leather does for leather--softens the main ingredient by adding some citrus, making it more year-round-appropriate. Whereas the opening was a bit harsh, this dried down into something very similar to Colonia Leather. I don't get much of a sense of the other notes--it comes off as mainly a blend of citrus, a little neroli perhaps, and the main oud aspect.

Projection and longevity are slightly weaker for the "cologne concentree"--performance was somewhat better on Colonia Leather---so the value is lost somewhat.

This rounds out the concentree trio for me, and it's a very strong group overall. It might be worth trying Colonia Oud on one arm and Colonia Leather on the other, since they end up drying down similarly. Definitely a good exploration by Acqua di Parma---Oud, Leather, and Ambra are each worth trying.

8 out of 10

product_name: Colonia Intensa Oud Eau de Cologne Concentree Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Hummmm.
How to say this....
I loved the scent for the first 2 hours.
After that, I could smell roses (not listed here as one of the notes).
For me the roses took an overwhelming turn that reminded me of my grandma.
Personally I dislike roses.
The oud is very very dry and harsh.
Sillage is powerful and lasts for and entire day.
It is a great scent (not for me).
I'm 40 years old and made me feel "older".
Bought it and returned it.
I'm more a chypre - citrus scents.
Scent: very elegant.
Sillage: powerful enormous.
Longevity: Very long lasting

product_name: Colonia Intensa Oud Eau de Cologne Concentree Acqua di Parma
review_content:
به نام خدا

این عطر رو با دوستان عزیزم که با هم یک تیم خرید اشتراکی تشکیل دادیم خریدکردیم

و باید عرض کنم که بسیار هم موفقیت آمیز بود

زمانی که رو مچ دستتون عطر رو اسپری کنید با یه رایحه ی فلفلی ، کمی شیرینی مشک و بوی چوبی خشک مانندی روبرو خواهید شد

رایحه مشک و فلفل تا یه چشم به زدن از بین میره

عود جزو ترکیبات اصلی این عطر هست ولی من رایحه عودی که میشناختم با این رایحه ای که در عطر حس میشه متفاوت بوده

کین عزیز هم اشاره ای به این قضیه کردند
این عود زیاد به ترشی نمیزنه ، زیاد تاریک نیست ، زیاد دودی نیست بوی تقریبا نرمی داره و اصلا شامه رو اذیت نمیکنه
انگار همین عود در حال سوختن هستش و گرمای سوزاننده ی اون رو میتونید حس کنید با این حال اذیت کننده نیست به هیچ وجه

بعد از فاز اول ، نوبت به نت پایه عطر میرسه که دیگه بعد از این تغییری نخواهد کرد
بوی چرم و عود و یه نت چوبی دیگه تا اخر شما رو همراهی خواهند کرد
این حالت یک رایحه
تلخ ، کمی دودی ، چوبی و چرمی داره

با این که بوی بسیار ساده ای داره ولی خاص محسوب میشه
و مثل سایر عطرای فقط تلخ نیستش که هیچ کاراکتر و روحی ندارند

فقط زود در موردش تصیم گیری نکنید بزارید حداقل 15 دقیقه با پوستتون عجین بشه و بعد تصمیم گیری کنید

و یه پیشنهادم دارم براتون

عطرای تند و چوبی و دودی رو در کاغذ تست نکنید
اینا رو روی مچ دستتون تست کنید

پخش و مانگاری بسیار خوب یهم داره
مناسب تیپ رسمی
برای فصل زمستان مناسبه
سعی شود در محیط های بسته مقدار کمتری اسپری بشه
برای بالای 25 ساله ها مناسب تره



مسابقه تحلیل نویسی . جوایز ارزشمند برای نفرات برتر
حتما شرکت کنید دوستان
اطلاعات تکمیلی در پروفایل بنده موجوده

product_name: Colonia Intensa Oud Eau de Cologne Concentree Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Smells pure quality! It is very unique and sharp I would say since I haven't smelled anything similar to this. The oud is definitely there but it is rather very soft. The leather is really heavy and I also notice a kind of soapy/minty note in this. Try it before you pay 200 dollars for a bottle!!

Scent 8/10
Projection 8/10
Longevity 9/10
Quality 9/10

product_name: Colonia Intensa Oud Eau de Cologne Concentree Acqua di Parma
review_content: one of the best perfume out there

product_name: Colonia Intensa Oud Eau de Cologne Concentree Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I generously spayed this on myself approx. 5 hours ago while in a department store... woah! As already mentioned it's a heavy-hitter in terms of sillage. You don't need more than two sprays.

Not sure what to think tbh. It's got a new leather shoe smell, but it's much much sweeter than AdP Colonia Leather (which is a very odd scent). So sweet in fact that, combined with its powerful sillage, it's often sickly and nauseating. I'd suggest not getting blind drunk with this on as you will be put off it forever with a hangover. Somebody mentioned YSL Les Nuit D'Homme which I personally despise due to its sweetness, but I can definitely see the comparison. However it's much more complex than that and doesn't have an astronomically high dominant note, instead, like a creme brûlée, if you crack through the nostril-burning intensity, you're rewarded with a deep, creamy, wood/leather scent that projects a modern gentlemanly class.

I'm not so sure whether this 'suits' me personally, and I may need to test it again with less on me. However I may go on to buy the 50ml bottle as it's definitely quality.

product_name: Colonia Intensa Oud Eau de Cologne Concentree Acqua di Parma
review_content:
"For Non Oud Lovers" ***

Concentrée? No. Eau? Neither. Oud? ...
Woody something. Agreeable, that's all.

Not for oud lovers.

product_name: Colonia Intensa Oud Eau de Cologne Concentree Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I Have Waited A Long Time To Review This One!

This is a well balanced Oud. By that I mean that it doesn't lean to heavily on the Oud to define itself as a fragrance. I could honestly enjoy this as a room spray or a cologne it lingers in a very stately yet subtle way. The top notes of Citrus and Coriander rest atop the shoulders of Oud and Leather in such a way that it says "Hey, I'm here. You know I'm here, but I'm not here to bother anybody". Its friendly but not oppressive. A good starter for those that would like to get into the Oud's but are unsure.

I'm not sure if I can agree with those that have compared this to Tom Fords "Oud Wood" these two scents are too different despite the name and primary ingredient. Some have told me that the musk note is too much for their liking and I can understand that. Certain notes don't register the same with everybody.
What I will say is that these two fragrances differ greatly, though I am a greater fan of Acqua Di Parma. The scent resonates with me, its like one of those fragrances that I searched my whole life for. At the same time the Silage "Projection" of Oud Wood is higher. I guess you can just say that's because one is an EDP and the other is not. Yet I still love what it love. Acqua Di Parma, Colonia Intensa Oud.

UPDATE: THE MORE I WEAR IT THE MORE I LOVE IT!!! (09/17/15)

Fragrance: 8.5/10
Silage: 7.0/10
Longevity: 8.0/10

Thanks For Reading,
-Auminded

product_name: Colonia Intensa Oud Eau de Cologne Concentree Acqua di Parma
review_content: An interesting oud rendition. Very leathery, oily and quite sour at its heart. Starts with the usual blast of mellow rosy sweet oud note bordering on feminine which quickly gives way to almost Fahrenheitishly fierce leather, but never surrenders completely. Unfortunately I'm not sure they ultimately blend well together (even with the help of coriander as the obvious mediator). This frag definitely has got some character, but it's a split personality and while it's quite likeable on many levels, it just feels rather incoherent. Besides, I believe I get a bit of headache from it and I don't even know whether I should blame the rose (amyris) or leather for it, as both are the usual suspects.

product_name: Colonia Intensa Oud Eau de Cologne Concentree Acqua di Parma
review_content: I believe i tried to order intensa oud but perhaps just got colonia oud...but either way im sure its almost the same and for this scent i dont dislike it but i also dont have to have it. Its oud leather citrus very fresh and very masculine but has that bold oud smell i looked at this because its said to be better than TF OUD WOOD but i tend to disagree TF just does it for me its my favorite oud ive tried but this overall is a great must try, see perfume court and get a 1ml sample its worth a look but any men under 30 should probably think twice because this is very masculine/mature not a high school college scent.

product_name: Colonia Intensa Oud Eau de Cologne Concentree Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Ok, time to review. This is the first Oud based Cologne that I own and have been using it got close to 9 months now. Verdict. Awesome. It wears nicely through the seasons. On its own, the scent is just captivating. Many women (from young to old) cannot but get caught in its note. I do not personally find it overpowering compared to Oud oil which I occasionally layer over. It works well with several of the By Killian perfumes which I have been experimenting with over the last month.

Verdict: Get yourself a bottle.

product_name: Colonia Intensa Oud Eau de Cologne Concentree Acqua di Parma
review_content: Got a free sample of this (they are super generous with samples as a company, not like other stingy brands). For me this is overpowering to the point of nausea. I like some oud scents, especially the Tom Ford series and M7, but this made me feel sick. It does last a hell of a long time though! Almost impossible to wash off, took me several attempts to scrub off with hot water and soap and could still smell it strongly.

product_name: Colonia Intensa Oud Eau de Cologne Concentree Acqua di Parma
review_content: I was given a tester of this by a male friend that hated it, tried it myself, yes its strong and very masculine but there was something I kinda liked about it, I already had a roll on perfume by crown perfumes, red roses, so I put some of this on my wrist then added a small spray of the oud, just loved the result, so much that I ordered a 5ml size in a lovely little bottle and box from eBay,£14.99, OK it's only 5ml but this stuff is expensive, the resulting smell lasts all day and people have asked me what perfume I'm using , going to save my combo for nights out , should last me all through the autumn and winter.has anybody out there tried this with anything else.

product_name: Colonia Intensa Oud Eau de Cologne Concentree Acqua di Parma
review_content: If you like good performance, This is one that does it.

product_name: Colonia Intensa Oud Eau de Cologne Concentree Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I like the odor profile of this, but it's just oddly flat. Hard to explain to someone who hasn't smelled it. I guess the best comparison I can make is extremely flat soda.

The flat texture ruins what could otherwise be a really nice scent. I've found that 777 2022 Homme has a similar odor profile but the sparkle and effervescence that is missing here. 2022 Homme is the much better juice imo, although much pricier per mL.

product_name: Colonia Intensa Oud Eau de Cologne Concentree Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Three levels to this: citrus top(mainly fresh bergamot), resinous dark oud, and a hint of leather(like Tuscan leather). This is some pretty awesome juice. The oud is so intense that if you take a really deep sniff, it will burn the nostrils. It's definetely full bottle worthy and on my list for future purchase.

Edit: once the oud and leather wear off, it smells a bit like YSL l'homme with the citrus.

This is some magical juice.

Top 10 Fragrance All time For Me

product_name: Colonia Intensa Oud Eau de Cologne Concentree Acqua di Parma
review_content: A fresh take on oud. Sampled this in-store last weekend in Chicago with very positive first impressions and now can't wait to get a bottle. Kept my test strip and have been coming back for whiffs multiple times a day. Seriously impressive performance for a cologne concentree and it's agreeable this could be used as a year round oud. I'll have to test further once I have a bottle but I can easily see this being a 10/10 frag for me.

product_name: Colonia Intensa Oud Eau de Cologne Concentree Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Italian view to Oud.

There are so many oud based fragrances are being lunched in 2014 and 2015. Acqua di Parma also followed the trend.

First of all, fragrance is Eau de Cologne but when you spray it on your skin, it is very oily. My opinion for this weird situation is, some of the raw ingredients oils they use in fragrances are more concentrated than other ingredients. Thickness of the ingredients make the oiliness of the fragrance higher.

Oud Intensa opens up with sharp citrus. There is also OUD. Big oud note is here for life time of the fragrance. Citrus stays with oud for 2-3 hours. When the citrus dies down, oud also gets close to skin and settles down. Very dry and quite.

I really didn't like the scent. Way they use the oud with citrus didn't do well together for my nose. Citrus is done wrong in my opinion. They shouldn't use citrus with oud as they didn't use citrus with their leather scent.

Performance is good. Lasted around 10 hours. But it didn't project very well. You can feel the scent but people won't. Projects well for 2 hours and projects close to body for another 2 hours. Later on, it is a skin scent.

product_name: Colonia Intensa Oud Eau de Cologne Concentree Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I recently bought a ADP Colonia Intensa, loving the scent, but so disappointed about the longevity, it lasted for max 1 hour then all gone. So I decided to look around for another ADP, with awesome longevity, and I found this.

It's nothing like the Intensa, but it's really awesome! I just love the smell of the Oud, and the longevity is.. awesome at least.

Would really recomend this to people looking for gentleman scent.

product_name: Colonia Intensa Oud Eau de Cologne Concentree Acqua di Parma
review_content: luxury,leather,masculine

product_name: Colonia Intensa Oud Eau de Cologne Concentree Acqua di Parma
review_content: Best Oud fragrance I've tried. Luxurious , fresh , masculine, you will not be disapointed!

product_name: Colonia Intensa Oud Eau de Cologne Concentree Acqua di Parma
review_content: Wearing this today for the very first time. Take my advice . Purchase a bottle of Oudy woody,priced now at about $30.00. This is it with no apologies. I have had and used Oudy woody for the last three years at least. This is a copy of Oudy woody and not vice versa. Way too overpriced.

product_name: Colonia Intensa Oud Eau de Cologne Concentree Acqua di Parma
review_content: I'm not an oud connoisseur -- far from it. The one time I smelled a "true" oud at Jamal Kazura in Singapore's Arab Street I found it offputting; maybe it wasn't a "good" oud, though I doubt the shopkeeper would put his stellar reputation at risk by stocking a substandard oil. I like Creed's Royal-Oud, though I've heard that it's a synthetic oud note and that it isn't comparable to a true oud perfume anyhow; I hate Bond's New York Oud (to me it somehow manages to smell like rotting daisies). But I love this AdP Colonia Oud. It's rich, sweet and woody, and lasts forever. I find myself smelling it JUST BECAUSE... and when I'm wearing another scent, I crave this one. Maybe that's a little crazy, but that's just how alluring this cologne is to me. I bought this together with their Colonia Leather: they're both excellent, but this one's the king.

product_name: Colonia Intensa Oud Eau de Cologne Concentree Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Acqua di parma should have concentrated more on making colognes instead of this awful oud like fragrance. It definetly do not smell like oud at all... The only thing i can smell is fabric conditioner. Last long on clothes but definetly not worth 180£ a bottle for a fake oud.

Colonia assoluta and colonia intensa are both better juices for this brand. I also recommend ginepro di sardegna, the latest from the blu mediterraneo collection.

Colonia intensa oud: 1/10

product_name: Colonia Intensa Oud Eau de Cologne Concentree Acqua di Parma
review_content: bitter oud and lush leather. a bit of spicyness also adds to the scent. definitely worth a try...

product_name: Colonia Intensa Oud Eau de Cologne Concentree Acqua di Parma
review_content:
For once, this is not the oud you smell on Middle-easterns tourists - and you're not going to be running into this scent very often. Thankfully so.
It's so unique, it's a split-personality masterpiece with a stallion performance. If you're gonna wear that make sure you've got the goods that go with it because you will definitely get noticed.

I tend to find oud rather unexciting when it's the dominating note (think Oud Wood). That's purely personal. But in this frag the citrus combined with the oud is what brings oomph to the composition. It's very unexpected.

This is a mind-blowing scent. It's radioactivity in a bottle!

product_name: Colonia Intensa Oud Eau de Cologne Concentree Acqua di Parma
review_content: il top, sexy, maschio ma fresco .... ottimo

product_name: Colonia Intensa Oud Eau de Cologne Concentree Acqua di Parma
review_content: I love this, it's beautiful on it's own or using a small amout in combination with another scent to oomph up other perfumes :-) Not just for men, I am a woman in her thirties and it is pure decadence - confidence and glamour in a bottle. Not for the faint hearted!

product_name: Colonia Intensa Oud Eau de Cologne Concentree Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Changing your usual rose/oud combo to citrus/oud in Acqua di Parma way and doing it very well. This is a fresh aromatic oud of high quality blend.

The oud is dry and clean, not the stinky kind. In the opening, the citrus accord pops and, while losing it's power gradually, still lingers in the background for hours. There is something aromatic in there which elevates the scent and makes it unique. A few hours in and I get the clean musky base that adds some sweetness. AdP has made a strong scent that works in every season (regarding how many sprays you use) and goes to the more wearable side of the ouds.

9/10

product_name: Colonia Intensa Oud Eau de Cologne Concentree Acqua di Parma
review_content: in the opining reminds me a little the old version of poison,after 2 hours smell like ysl M7,very strong scent only for very cold weather,i like the composition but its to heavy for me,i prefer leather colonia

product_name: Colonia Intensa Oud Eau de Cologne Concentree Acqua di Parma
review_content:
ADP Colonia Intensa Oud - A different take on oud.

Colonia Intensa Oud is a very different rendition of oud, with a fresh yet heavy aspect to it. And by that, I mean more of a cool balmy scent.
Before trying this one out, I had a lot of curiosity about it as I knew it was an ADP release.
ADP as a house, is known for its fresh sparkly colognes and its variations on that theme;So, throwing an oud based scent into the mix made it a pandora's box for me.

Light, airy oud mixed with coriander, both sprinkled with some freshness, is what I get on my skin. The combination is pretty unique and well constructed and goes well on me.
In terms of performance, this one is beast mode. Lasts for ages, and literally refuses to die. Projection is also quite heavy and stays around for a good while.

However, I do not recommend a blind buy in this case, rather, it is a try before you buy kind of scent.

Respect for ADP, for stepping out of its comfort zone and trying something new, but at the same time maintaining its signature.

Thumbs up from me.

product_name: Colonia Intensa Oud Eau de Cologne Concentree Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Wou wou great fragrance From ACqua di Parma
Scent 10/10
Longevity 10/10
Projection 10/10
Versatility 10/10 all year around not prob at all
Overall 10/10

product_name: Colonia Intensa Oud Eau de Cologne Concentree Acqua di Parma
review_content: Super perfume..Longevity is scary. sprayed at 5am today, its 9pm as i type and the smell is heavy all over me my wife is wondering if i have another bottle hidden away at work. 16hrs and counting

product_name: Colonia Intensa Oud Eau de Cologne Concentree Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Oh my God, this is beautiful!!! I'm so glad I bought this elegance in a bottle, great fragrance!!! It is so syrupy, elegant, sour, bitter.. everything is so perfectly balanced! Great combination of oud, leather & citruses :) But, performances are just awful on me, I get 2, barely 3 hours of longevity, and projection is disaster, about 30 - 45 minutes.. :( :( :(

You must try this!!!

product_name: Colonia Intensa Oud Eau de Cologne Concentree Acqua di Parma
review_content: Quick update, no word of a lie, this fragrance stayed on my skin for 32 hours, it is insane!!! There is a yukky bit during it's life but other then that it is seriously sensational!!

product_name: Colonia Intensa Oud Eau de Cologne Concentree Acqua di Parma
review_content: I agree with Sezyvex, I sprayed this at 9am, it's now 10.35 pm and it is still strong on me, I have had a huge headache all day, but I leathered it on, it is immensely overpowering. It goes through a stunning opening, to a revolting early drydown, which smells like sour gone off yoghurt, to a sublime sweet leathery base. What an interesting fragrance, the quality of the blend is obvious, I don't know when I'd wear this, have to be honest and say I'd opt for Crabtree and Evelyn's Oud over this one, just saying....

product_name: Colonia Intensa Oud Eau de Cologne Concentree Acqua di Parma
review_content: Due to the slightly bitter citrus and I guess the tonka bean, it made me think of Dolce & Gabbana Pour Homme, the old school formula; a LOT less intense, yet similar because of the citrus / floral / leather mix. ADP Colonia Intensa Oud seems like a fresher version with a touch of oud, the real, medicinal oud, but keeping it fresh and not overpowering. I'm (still) a fan of oud and always a fan of leather, but at first, I wasn't completely won over with this fragrance, having been a virgin to the Acqua di Parma house up until now, but the more I wear it, more of the coriander and musk come out on me and I like it. Definitely can't judge this one too quickly because the finish is more complex and interesting than the start.

product_name: Colonia Intensa Oud Eau de Cologne Concentree Acqua di Parma
review_content: @honeykv ~ Thank you for the clarification.

product_name: Colonia Intensa Oud Eau de Cologne Concentree Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I have both Its just change in name, both have exactly same juice
|
v
v

product_name: Colonia Intensa Oud Eau de Cologne Concentree Acqua di Parma
review_content:
According to Acqua di Parma's website, besides Colonia Intensa Oud Eau de Cologne Concentree, there is also a Colonia Oud version and it was awarded first place in the “Best Men’s Niche Fragrance” category at the 25th International Award of Accademia Del Profumo in May 2014.

Direct quote from their site, "the fragrance opens with the purest essences of bergamot of Calabria and orange, a unique reference to the long-standing tradition of Colonia. This luminous start heralds a strongly assertive heart, where aromatic coriander blends with warm Amyris wood accents, developing through the magnetic notes of essential Agarwood oil. The fragrance continues with a surprising base, where the full and persistent character of sandal wood, the scent of leather and cedar wood, and patchouli meet clear and seducing musk notes, further valorizing the intense preciousness of Agarwood."

Now I wonder if Colonia Oud is the same as Colonia Intensa Oud. If not, is there anyone who has ever tried Colonia Oud? Is there much difference and it better? Should I get Colonia Oud if I already have Colonia Intensa Oud (that I love a lot)?

I look forward to hearing your inputs. Thank you!

product_name: Colonia Intensa Oud Eau de Cologne Concentree Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Exquisite! This has unbelievable depth.

Gonna need a mortgage to buy some though, unless I make it my only fragrance.

product_name: Colonia Intensa Oud Eau de Cologne Concentree Acqua di Parma
review_content: Oh my God! A more behaved and citrus version from One Man Show Ruby, with elegant touch of oud. And certainly much more expensive! A oud summer interpretation.

product_name: Colonia Intensa Oud Eau de Cologne Concentree Acqua di Parma
review_content: One of the best and most wearable Oud scent I've tried.

product_name: Colonia Intensa Oud Eau de Cologne Concentree Acqua di Parma
review_content: Intensely rich, deep and smokey. For me, the longevity and sillage is amazing - a single spritz is all it takes to last all day. More of a unisex fragrance. Reminds me of by Kilian Rose Oud but at a fraction of the cost.

product_name: Colonia Intensa Oud Eau de Cologne Concentree Acqua di Parma
review_content:
High respect to this quality release from AdP.

Refined and polite, beautiful and nonchallenging, still special. I'm sure others will like this on me, but personally I find it too feminine and "flowery". Don't know why, really.

8/10

product_name: Colonia Intensa Oud Eau de Cologne Concentree Acqua di Parma
review_content: Never had such a succes , in summer ,with this perfume . It's like an aura around you , people still smell it when you think it"s gone and ask you '" is that you ...who smells so nice ?" ( at least 3 times each night in discos ) . I thought it would be great in winter , tried it in summer in Ibiza ...and realised it could be my signature in any season . Sensual , dark without being too animal , deep with a touch of freshness : quite a perfection ...

product_name: Colonia Intensa Oud Eau de Cologne Concentree Acqua di Parma
review_content: Im thinking of selling all my collection and just buying this bottle i dont need anything more, its the best scent ive smelt

product_name: Colonia Intensa Oud Eau de Cologne Concentree Acqua di Parma
review_content: I really don't see this as a daytime or summer scent. The leather and oud notes are so dominant you would get the stinkface on the beach. Great for cooler temps and nights. I am not a big leather fan but I do like this mixed with the oud. The citrus notes are very tame and don't exist beyond the first 30 minutes or so. Longevity is over 10 hours with great silage as well. If I were a big leather fan I would pick up a bottle but for now, my decant is good enough.

product_name: Colonia Intensa Oud Eau de Cologne Concentree Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Artık hemen hemen tüm parfün markalarının Ud ürünleri var. Son dönemde giderek popüler hale geldiğini görüyoruz. Aslında Ud kokusuna biz Türkler yabancı değiliz ve bize yeni değil. Ancak popüler markalar el atmadığı için, ağır yağ yada salt Ud olarak kullanıldığı için genellikle "hacı yağı" sınıfında kalmaya mahkum olmuştu. Aslında oldukça karakterli ve güzel bir koku.
Son 1 yıldır bulabildiğim tüm Ud temelli parfümleri denedim. Batılı parfüm evleri de Ud'un sert ve ağır yapısını sevmiş olacak ki üretilen parfümlerin en az 2/3 ü yine ağır olarak karşımıza çıkıyor. Özellikle sıcak ve nemli ortamlarda taşıması oldukça zor olan bu kokuyu makul formda ilk olarak Acqua di Parma!da bulabildim.
Yumuşaklığı ise gül veriyor. Yani koku biraz yumuşasa da "arap" havasından tamamen kurtulamıyor. Bunu negatif anlamda söylemiyorum. Benim için şu ana kadar kullandığım en iyi Ud parfümü bu. Ancak yukarda da söylediğim gibi kültürel alışkanlıklar ve kokuların çağrışımını yaptığı ideolojik ve sosyal yapılar kişiden kişiye değiştiği için Ud'un bu hali bile birçok kişiye ağır gelebilir.
35 yaş üstü erkeklere kış aylarında yakışacak bir parfüm. Çok yoğun kullanmamak gerekiyor. Kalıcılığı çok kuvvetli ve her ortamda baskın olabiliyor. Bu nedenle fazla sıkmak (kullanmak) riskli olabilir. Eğer parfümlerim arasında Ud olsun diyorsanız bu doğru seçim olacaktır. Yukarda sözünü ettiğim kültürel yapının beğeni konusunu nasıl etkilediğini anlamanız için bu parfümü bir de Avrupalıların olduğu ortamda kullanın. Neredeyse tüm Avrupalılar bu kokuyu beğeniyor. Türkiye'de ise zaman zaman eleştiri alabilirsiniz. Tekrar hatırlatmakta yarar var, kesinlikle çok sıkmayın. Zaten yoğun olan koku boğucu hale gelebilir.

product_name: Colonia Intensa Oud Eau de Cologne Concentree Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I smelled this fragrance today, at first it was very ordinary but after two hours musk & leather kicked in. The blend of these two along with the touch of Oud made it a very lethal concoction.
Definitely a must, equally good in winter & summer. Flying colors with 09/10.

product_name: Colonia Intensa Oud Eau de Cologne Concentree Acqua di Parma
review_content: I don't know what to compare this to. It has that AdP DNA, but it also has a woodiness to it that is just lovely. If you can get this with the coffin case, that alone is worth the price tag. I find it has an almost sportiness to it, that many probably wouldn't want to agree with. It's definitely wearable. Isn't something you only can pull out on special occasion. You can use it whenever: both casual and professional. I love it and will keep it in my collection for a long time to come. Happy Hunting!

product_name: Colonia Intensa Oud Eau de Cologne Concentree Acqua di Parma
review_content:
An amazing new fragrance for men from a fragrance house that is > 100 years old.
It is masculine without being overpowering. Like any good cologne it adapts to the person's body chemistry, without becoming that person's body chemistry or masking it. In other words the scent does not smell the same on everyone and inversely it is not for everyone.
I hate patchouli, especially that cheap stuff some people slather on, but it is one of the (more subtle) scents in this and it is of course a good patchouli oil. It has nice musk, citrus, all of which add to masculinity and lightness.
It is original and sophisticated

WARNING - greater verbosity and details follow:
Tcents of the Middle East.
Itcents of the Middle East.
It is fresh and persistent — persistent in a very good way — and exudes the sensuousness of agar wood (Oud), a prestigious ingredient typical of good Middle Eastern fragrances
It is a charismatic and intensely male scent with an exquisitely balanced composition.
Top notes are the lightness of citrus (orange and bergamot) blending with the warm and magnetic depth of agar wood (A persistent fragrance which arouse sensations of assertiveness, power and virility)
It blends with warm woody notes of Amyris (oil from sandalwood), coriander and agar wood which combine to create base notes of aromatic cedar wood, patchouli, including subtle hints of leather, sandalwood and musk.
"Dee-Licous" is fresh and persistent — persistent in a very good way — and exudes the sensuousness of agar wood (Oud), a prestigious ingredient typical of good Middle Eastern fragrances
It is a charismatic and intensely male scent with an exquisitely balanced composition.
Top notes are the lightness of citrus (orange and bergamot) blending with the warm and magnetic depth of agar wood (A persistent fragrance which arouse sensations of assertiveness, power and virility)
It blends with warm woody notes of Amyris (oil from sandalwood), coriander and agar wood which combine to create base notes of aromatic cedar wood, patchouli, including subtle hints of leather, sandalwood and musk.
"Dee-Licous"

product_name: Colonia Intensa Oud Eau de Cologne Concentree Acqua di Parma
review_content: @crossdx: Thanks for converting my though into words. Btw, you got good describing skill too, good sir.

product_name: Colonia Intensa Oud Eau de Cologne Concentree Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I'm really surprised to see the Coriander all the way at the bottom of the vote pyramid. It is so strong to me, I see it as the dominant note along with Oud and Leather. Because I despise Cilantro/coriander I have very mixed feelings about this frag. Sophisticated yes, but not what I was expecting. I have a 10 ml decant so I'll continue testing but After 2 full wearings I'm still a bit ambivalent.
Update: Slowly but surely falling in love. I'm going to have to seriously consider buying a bottle. Really is one of a kind.
Update 2: Super-sophistication.

product_name: Colonia Intensa Oud Eau de Cologne Concentree Acqua di Parma
review_content: not a big fan of this scent. tested it on my arm and tried to wash it off 2x. still projects like BEAST!!!!

product_name: Colonia Intensa Oud Eau de Cologne Concentree Acqua di Parma
review_content: smells like wet laundry

product_name: Colonia Intensa Oud Eau de Cologne Concentree Acqua di Parma
review_content:
A great oud/citrus combo, quite unique and versatile for an oud based scent. I think the amyris note is a nice touch as well. Everything is well orchestrated from the freshness in the initial act leading up to a certain warmth and gentlemanly demeanour that begins to display midway through. The result is a classy and captivating fragrance appropriate for any occassion, any time of the year, day or night. I daresay it gives even the oft-cited versatility benchmark, Aventus, a run for its money in this category.

This was a blind buy online based on the reviews here and I don't regret it. I thank my fellow fragrantica members for once again being a wonderful source of feedback on scents that I don't have the pleasure of trying firsthand. That said, I do get a bit of the 'new shoes' vibe that some have detected as the fragrance develops. I don't mind it, but perhaps it'd be best to try this one out for yourself if you have the option before making the purchase. Some people seem not too keen on this fragrance on the whole, while others love it right out of the (shoe) box. I'm of the latter camp. The oud is handled very nicely here and blends well with the citrus notes in the opening, which according to the AdP site are orange and bergamot, revealing a smooth transition into the leather and musk in the drydown phase.

Now this may be a grower for some, as I found myself appreciating it more the longer I wore it. First wear was highly intriguing. I was teetering on the fence between love and a big question mark... but once I got accustomed to the slightly dry oud/amyris/coriander interplay it was a definite satisfaction. The second occassion was during a dinner at an upscale restaurant with a large group of friends and family, and not an hour into the meal I was already getting approval from the other diners.

It's classified as an Eau de Cologne concentree, but it outperforms some Eau de Parfums I have. The price tag may be steep, but based on the quality and versatility of this fragrance, coupled with fantastic longevity (12+ hours) and projection (2 sprays were enough to get people noticing), I believe it's well worth the price of admission.

I don't mean to make an already long review even longer, but I have to update my assessment. I'm loving this fragrance more and more with each wear. I'm also getting the "rose-y" note that others have mentioned, but I reckon this is a result of the oud combining with one or two of the other notes rather than an unlisted true rose note. In any case, it's masculine in its overall effect due to the woodsier undertones mingling with the citruses. It's truly a damn fine scent, and one of my new favourites. Mesmerizing and exhilarating.

Scent: 9.5/10
Longevity: 9.5/10
Projection/Sillage: 9.5/10

Overall: 9.5/10

product_name: Colonia Intensa Oud Eau de Cologne Concentree Acqua di Parma
review_content: Wearing this today and 4 hrs into it, I get smokey leather, oud with a hint a citrus. Quality juice that is definitely designed for formal occasions, any time of the year . This could be the best all-around oud on the market. 9/10.

product_name: Colonia Intensa Oud Eau de Cologne Concentree Acqua di Parma
review_content:
من عطور العود اللطيفة والمقدمة بطريقة جديدة
شيء يحسب لهذه الماركة

روائح الحمضيات في البداية غير واضحة كلمسة هو تواجدها
ما لحظتها هو العود الممزوج برائحة الجلد مع شي كرائحة الزعفران ورائحة المطر وستشعر برائحة اوراق خضراء (اعتقد انها بذ1ور الكزبرة) فهي هنا ليست بارزة ولو كانت بارزة لا فسدت العطر هذا بالنسبة لي لا ادري عنكم ؟!
نوته العود في هذا العطر اقرب كثيرا الى رائحة دهن العود الحار
Amyris وتكون واضحة في البداية وسرعان ما يتسيد
الموقف مما يضيف لمحة انتعاش للعطر وشعور بتواجد الماء وكانه يوم ممطر بجانب الكزبرة وكان برودة العطر تذكرني بطعم ماء الورد
يعيبة جدا جدا الفوحان والثبات

تحياتي ..
لاتنس ذكر الله والصلاة على النبي

product_name: Colonia Intensa Oud Eau de Cologne Concentree Acqua di Parma
review_content: the opening is quite different from the settling-down period. it turns into lubin's 'idole', quite smokey and 'oud'ey. quite nice if you're into this sorta stuff...

product_name: Colonia Intensa Oud Eau de Cologne Concentree Acqua di Parma
review_content:
One thing I can say about this fragrance is that isn't doesn't resemble anything I've smelled at least recently. The opening I don't care for bc it smells like those old skool number 2 pencils or the pencil shavings from a pencil when I was in jr high. The dry down is much more tolerable and pleasant to wear all year round at least for me its very versatile. Not a big oud fan although this is an oud you can definitely wear in warmer months.

RETAKE: This is a marvelous fragrance, the more I wear it the better and more refined it gets and I've gotten some unexpected compliments too very versatile for a year round wearings

product_name: Colonia Intensa Oud Eau de Cologne Concentree Acqua di Parma
review_content: spectacular.

product_name: Colonia Intensa Oud Eau de Cologne Concentree Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Bought this at the weekend and have worn it twice. My initial review below is fairly accurate as to how I feel about this fragrance...in a nutshell it's great smelling. I was convinced to fork out on it by my girlfriend, she absolutely adored it and as such was very persuasive.
I will have to correct my playing down of the Oud element in my first review, this scent has Oud in abundance but it's not at all rough or full on it's soft and very long lasting. The mixture of amyris & coriander with oud is quite a dizzying, sickly combo which takes a bit of getting used to but when you do it's great.

product_name: Colonia Intensa Oud Eau de Cologne Concentree Acqua di Parma
review_content:
The following review is really for my notes only, its very brief and leaves out a ton of details. Im just typing something that I remember each by. Im sure I will disrespect someones favorite fragrance too.

This one reminded me a lot of Bond No.9 New York Amber. Smells of new shoes to open then dries into a nice rose with a little oud.

product_name: Colonia Intensa Oud Eau de Cologne Concentree Acqua di Parma
review_content: This is a good fragrance . But it dose not last that long on my skin . Never the less I still love it.

product_name: Colonia Intensa Oud Eau de Cologne Concentree Acqua di Parma
review_content: I almost got sick from smelling this, had to give my sample away the next day.

product_name: Colonia Intensa Oud Eau de Cologne Concentree Acqua di Parma
review_content:
it starts with a beautiful citrus opening followed soon by a woodsy ,agarwood and musky cloud that will tenderly envelop you in a soft,sexy,comfortable wellness cloud .indeed it's a great quality frag with strong longevity and average sillage on my skin ,undoubtedly less resinous and medicinal than montale black oud ,more unisex than the previous one .




8.5/10

product_name: Colonia Intensa Oud Eau de Cologne Concentree Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Very fresh oud. Fresher than Creed's Royal Oud. Nice sillage, very good longevity. Elegent and versatile.

As the fresh AdP-DNA is always noticable, i would prefer wearing it on a sunny but cold winter day or on warm summer nights.

product_name: Colonia Intensa Oud Eau de Cologne Concentree Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Rose should be in the pyramid. This oud fragrance is indeed very rosy, very flowery for a male cologne.
BTW, I think it can easily be worn by women too.

product_name: Colonia Intensa Oud Eau de Cologne Concentree Acqua di Parma
review_content: All I get from this is pepper. Disappointed.

product_name: Colonia Intensa Oud Eau de Cologne Concentree Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I am not impressed with this at all.I was expecting much complexity but what I get from this is just a creamier Oudy Woody by Surrati.This retails for £135 while Surrati's thicker and much longer lasting version is £30 online for a full 100ml bottle.

At best try and sample first before you commit or else you may be kicking yourself further into austerity.And I will most definitely not be wearing this in sweltering heat as the oud concentration here will not allow me to breathe

Given the lack of originality here it's a sure pass.You might like it so dont let me discourage you

product_name: Colonia Intensa Oud Eau de Cologne Concentree Acqua di Parma
review_content: My taste: Am in to fragrances like YSL Rive Gauche and Body Kouros, Farenheit, Creed Royal oud and GIT, Boucheron Jaipur Homme, Gucci pour homme 1, Armani prive oud royal. A very classy blend that doesn't shout out for an oud ..but confidently reveals its presence respectfully.. very calm and warm on me after a few minutes. An underdog and a dark horse imo! Longevity/sillage/ projection perfect. Smells expensive to me and is obviously but you get what you pay for. I am over the strong oud oils so this now for me is just right and never tiring!! 10/10

product_name: Colonia Intensa Oud Eau de Cologne Concentree Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Wow !!

For lovers of a subtle warm & fresh oud, get yourself a sample soon!!!
This has a jolly, yet utterly sophisticated zest.
Beautiful oud (very easy on the nose), supported by silky musk, bright citruses and coriander, yum!
The leather is deeply buried, I hardly get any.
At last an Acqua di Parma that is not fleeting at all.
AdP CIOEdCC gives me the courage to engage in life on a difficult monday morning.

Hallelujah!

product_name: Colonia Intensa Oud Eau de Cologne Concentree Acqua di Parma
review_content: This flagrance combines the best of two worlds. You never want a flagrance to fade quickly so you have to reapply. But you also dont want to come in a room and let everybody think: there's the parfumboy. I have some flagrances that smell great but have poor longevity. But I have also some powerhouses that can knock somebody down in the first few hours...Colonia Intensa Oud is great because I can still smel it six hours after I sprayed it. And it is still as elegant and beautifull as in the first minutes that I started wearing it. Great longevity with the perfect sillage. And most important: a great and very versatile smell. For work, going out..I am wearing it now in the fall, but i could see myself wearing this also on a evening in the summer.

product_name: Colonia Intensa Oud Eau de Cologne Concentree Acqua di Parma
review_content: I've tried several oud fragrances in the past few years (TF Oud Wood, Creed Royal Oud, Ferrari Essence Oud and several Montale's), but this one has the weakest oud note to my nose. Maybe its because of the blend with the leather notes. Or maybe its the fizzy lemon-lime beverage top notes. But it's great as a combo. Unique for a fragrance, although it smells like something I've smelled before but can't quite put my finger on. Longevity and sillage are excellent - all day coverage without being overpowering. A winner.

product_name: Colonia Intensa Oud Eau de Cologne Concentree Acqua di Parma
review_content:
very long lasting but the scent makes me feel nauseous
never not for me 1/10

product_name: Colonia Intensa Oud Eau de Cologne Concentree Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Yuck!

I'm a fan of Oud blends but this is one I'll pass on. I was able to get a sample from a friend and I'm not impressed at all.

It has a leather belt, shoe polish type of smell with an odd citrus thrown in.

product_name: Colonia Intensa Oud Eau de Cologne Concentree Acqua di Parma
review_content:
For those who say, no longevity...you must have a medical issue, or octopus skin. I couldn't get this off me while Im laying in a hospital bed getting IV'ed after 3 hours. Like it was getting stronger and stronger. This was the FIRST OUD experience I had at Neimanns and waited til this week to pull the trigga. My problem is...it's too strong, even after a baby spray, so I'm trying to find a frag to calm it down!!!

So far candidates on my arms and knees are: Mandorlo di Sicilia, Black Orchid, Chanel AHEB, and Terre dHermes. My nose can't take the initial blast. I'm a nooby but KNEW I needed something different...OUD was my choice over Amber or Vetiver right now. I OWN M7 Oud Absolute, samples and decants of MFK Oud, Velvet, Cashmere, Silk Moods, TF Oud Wood and coming from Kuwait..Ameer Al Oudh.

OUD is pushing me to Ambers all of a sudden. I can't take Tuscan Leather (DIRT) smell, Someone came into NMarcus and said it smelled like Cocaine. I don't get the Citrus, thats why I'm layering. Mandorlo Vanilla is winning so far. 8 1/2 outta ten for me....due to strength and sillage and PRESENTATION!! TF needs to step up. Still on my neck since 11am, and it's 6 NOW...DRY SKIN....no unscented lotion needed...OR maybe I should???

product_name: Colonia Intensa Oud Eau de Cologne Concentree Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Sometimes names can be a bit deceptive but lets get it straight...If you're looking for a powerful woody, Oud centric fragrance, look elsewhere.
I like the smell of Oud and it is strangely intoxicating but I don't know what all the fuss is about really?
It's down to taste and what you look for.
Is it the notes that surround Oud that give a fragrance it's character or is it vice versa?
Well it depends...
This is typical of an ADP Cologne, stylish, classic citrus in the top and wonderfully fresh feel with nice, gentle Oud in the base.
So some pretty special juice and shouldn't be judged on the name because it doesn't deliver masses of Oud, it's great fragrance.

product_name: Colonia Intensa Oud Eau de Cologne Concentree Acqua di Parma
review_content:
and one thing there no such oud perfume smell like it

so save your time

and let your nose discover it

product_name: Colonia Intensa Oud Eau de Cologne Concentree Acqua di Parma
review_content:
hellht
am expert in oud while i live in UAE

had some tome ford some arab expensive oud


these one is rely arts of oud did not smell like other oud

and also loud and strong on way u did not think about it

i had it on paper from yesterday from dubai man it still

these is not power house these is master house

longlast 10/10
sail 10/10
smell if u like arts of oud but wiht uniq mix of spice and sweety wood of flower its 10/10 of oud perfume world

product_name: Colonia Intensa Oud Eau de Cologne Concentree Acqua di Parma
review_content: A very unique and interesting mix of citrus and oud. It opens as many Acqua di Parma fragrances do with a burst of citrus (I detect bergamot and orange). Things evolve and you begin to notice the medicinal oud from the heart mixed with spicy Russian coriander and warm amyris wood (I'm beginning to become a huge fan of amyris notes). I believe it is here in the heart that this fragrance truly shines. The inclusion of leather notes, cedar, patchouli, sandalwood and musk in the base is rather subtle to my nose, but all add more complexity to the scent. Would make a great masculine fragrance for the cooler months. (89)

product_name: Colonia Intensa Oud Eau de Cologne Concentree Acqua di Parma
review_content: I received a nice decant of this from emailjayford, and all i can say is WoW! The longer that this gem is on my skin, the more woody and musky it gets. Sillage and longevity are beasts with this. A must have if you love Ouds!

product_name: Colonia Intensa Oud Eau de Cologne Concentree Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Today I put Tom Ford Tuscan Leather on one arm and ADP Oud on the other.

The ADP Oud is slightly more noticeable but IMO is a really lightweight oud. I guess it goes with the "fresh" image that the ADP line is known for. I do think it is a pleasant scent although quite tame. If someone new to oud fell in love with this they would have a HUGE wake up call when smelling other oud fragrances.

Unlike most of the ADP line this seems to be more durable. It is labeled INTENSA which means to me a decent EDT strength and that's just what I am getting from it.

Nothing to rave about IMO.

product_name: Colonia Intensa Oud Eau de Cologne Concentree Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Absolutely the best fragrance I have!
Sillage and longevity second to none, only amouage library collection have similar longevity.
After two days and several showers still persistent.

product_name: Colonia Intensa Oud Eau de Cologne Concentree Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I don't usually do reviews but for this one, I have to comment that it's one of the longest lasting fragrances that I have ever tried. I have to wonder if people become anosmic to part of it after a while if they claim that it does not last.

Otherwise, it starts with AdP citric DNA and then the synthetic oud rears it's head. The rose from the AdP DNA combines for a short while to give a familiar rose/oud accord but that disappears all too soon. Soon after comes a woody, leather like ambience that ultimately adds some musk. Interestingly, the AdP citrus, rose freshness seems to come back and rest on top of the woody musk and it stays that way for a very long while. Ultimately, it becomes quite woody with leathery goodness remaining and if I strain, I can detect some more musk. Two showers and multiple scrubbings later, I still have to go without fragrance for a day because remnants of this remain on my skin. Two thumbs up for tenacity. I feel that I got value for my money. Otherwise, a hearty recommendation for a fresh take on the oud bandwagon.

product_name: Colonia Intensa Oud Eau de Cologne Concentree Acqua di Parma
review_content: spray it on, smells amazing in the start. 2 hours later its completely gone! totally like the perfume but dont like it enough to spend that much

product_name: Colonia Intensa Oud Eau de Cologne Concentree Acqua di Parma
review_content: Oud Eau de Cologne? That requires a leap of faith, and time to adjust. It's like, mushroom sorbet, anyone? Six hours later, and still vibrant...

product_name: Colonia Intensa Oud Eau de Cologne Concentree Acqua di Parma
review_content: A "maybe": I only got robust tanned leather in the dry down, which isn't necessarily bad. Better than the squint enforced by the clash of citrus and leather/oud at the opening. Give it another try? Never thought oud could be coy! Good longevity!

product_name: Colonia Intensa Oud Eau de Cologne Concentree Acqua di Parma
review_content: best oud-ish fragrance i have come across in a long long time. adp in my book have mastered this citrus woody marriage to perfection. i used to think m7, tom ford or royal oud by creed were actually good... but adp is in a different league on its own up there

product_name: Colonia Intensa Oud Eau de Cologne Concentree Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Probably doesn't contain real oud, but as a guy who usually has a problem with oud fragrances, I enjoy this one a lot. It's a solid, attractive fragrance with a fizzy, coca-cola kind of vibe (slightly syrupy), and of course an excellent pairing with a sleek, vinyl-style leather (think Tom of Finland). Lasts quite a while but never feels overpowering. Acqua di Parma has a penchant for making lightweight fragrances, despite how strong they may seem.

I'll probably buy a bottle of this eventually, because I need a solid woody-oriental that won't make me feel weighed down.

product_name: Colonia Intensa Oud Eau de Cologne Concentree Acqua di Parma
review_content: not entirely sure it smells expensive.. but it does smell great on my skin- thumbs up

product_name: Colonia Intensa Oud Eau de Cologne Concentree Acqua di Parma
review_content: I have several oud fragrances in my collection including Creed. I love the Creed but Acqua di Parma has them all beat. This is a beautiful fragrance of citrus and wood smoke. I sprayed my cap last week and it is still there going strong. I can't believe the staying power of the oud. They did not hold back on the essential oils here. Well worth the money. Good job Acqua di Parma!

product_name: Colonia Intensa Oud Eau de Cologne Concentree Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I wasn't immediately impressed with this upon a spraying on a card - too feminine, too floral, not woodsy enough - but some hours later it smells quite nice.

However... having tried this, the Tom Ford oud, the Jo Malone oud and the Creed oud, I still like Creed Royal Oud the best.

product_name: Colonia Intensa Oud Eau de Cologne Concentree Acqua di Parma
review_content: ساده وشیک خلاصه تصور من در یک لحظه بوئیدن این رایحه متوانم بیان کنم و اما چگونه از این سادهگی و زیبائی استفاده کنم فقط برای خود قابل هضم است برای یک بنت لی اتومبیل چه توصیفی وجود دارد

product_name: Colonia Intensa Oud Eau de Cologne Concentree Acqua di Parma
review_content: Okay so I have been playing and layering. This is my new favorite oud. I like it better then Tom Fords oud wood or many of the others ive sampled. Today I layered it with the over done trendy fragrance A*Men Angel. Not the regular Angel but the one that was supposedly aged in a vat of leather for five years. A*men Cuir. The combo was very sweet and long lasting. I almost received as many compliments as when I wear Sycomore & Coromandel together. So it projects! Let me tell you. Plus I loved smelling myself everywhere. At the gym, tanning, swimming lessons. I got out of the pool and guess what. I could still smell it. I topped it off with some "Leather N10Z" by Intense, and I am now laying in bed about to drift into dreamland with my muscles smelling like a big Arabic chocolate bar.

product_name: Colonia Intensa Oud Eau de Cologne Concentree Acqua di Parma
review_content: A quality fragrance from the house of Acqua Di Parma. Although Oud is not my favorite note, it is a well done fragrance. Impressed with this? No. There is obviously the big splash of oud, with some powder and woods laying in the background. Not my favorite from Acqua Di Parma. Try it.

product_name: Colonia Intensa Oud Eau de Cologne Concentree Acqua di Parma
review_content:
im getting way to much floral on this one. I dont smell any oud here, just roses. Almost too feminine.

Update: I've been trying for 2 weeks and this is absolutely the most feminine scent I've come across. There is zero masculinity here. Great if you want to smell like the bouquet of flowers at a funeral.

product_name: Colonia Intensa Oud Eau de Cologne Concentree Acqua di Parma
review_content: i originaly bought a bottle of this when it was first released and sold it soon after - ive recently bought another bottle to give it another try and i'm glad i did. it lasts 10-12 hrs on my skin .starts off strong but settles to a lovely, very long lasting scent -the dry down has nuances of the original colonia intensa with an exotic vibe . excellent stuff

product_name: Colonia Intensa Oud Eau de Cologne Concentree Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I really like this one.
IMO it is a cross between Montale Black Aoud and Maison Francis Kurkdjian's Oud.
If you the like the Montale, but find Black Aoud too strong, this one will suit you.
If you like MFK's Oud, but don't like the price tag, here is a cheaper, but equally as good (maybe a bit better) option.

**EDIT**
OK, been wearing this for a day now, still love it.
The dry down of this fragrance is like Armani Privé Royal Oud.

product_name: Colonia Intensa Oud Eau de Cologne Concentree Acqua di Parma
review_content: A very interesting Oud, the dry down reminds me of Frederic Malle French Lover (Bois d'Orage) with more kick.

product_name: Colonia Intensa Oud Eau de Cologne Concentree Acqua di Parma
review_content: Lovely stuff, a beautiful citrus opening followed later by a lovely oud. Excellent longevity, for an eau de cologne. AdP wants it to be exclusive, so it isn't sold everywhere. Major let-down is the price: 160 euros for a 100 ml bottle. Too exclusive for my wallet.

product_name: Colonia Intensa Oud Eau de Cologne Concentree Acqua di Parma
review_content: This new scent by ADP is divine! The top notes are characterized by ADPs signature citrus notes which evoke the beginning of a new world of eclectic scents which begin with a clean and fresh scent drawn into a seductive warmth of oils of Morroco and the deep woodsy scent of Oud. As the hearts dry down you embark once again into the soft and playful scent which is reminiscent of soften rose water.

product_name: Colonia Intensa Oud Eau de Cologne Concentree Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I do like the AdP colonia intense and was just about to get a bottle when I came across the OUD version.
I don't know much about fragrances but I just wanna know if this smells any different or does it just last longer, as there is a considerable difference in price!!!

product_name: Colonia Intensa Oud Eau de Cologne Concentree Acqua di Parma
review_content: I was surprised by Colonia intensa oud. A nice, summery interpretation of oud. I don't find it too complex, it is really straight forward and doesn't change much.

product_name: Colonia Intensa Oud Eau de Cologne Concentree Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I smelled this new fragrance twice today. First at the AdP counter at la Rinascente and then at the AdP store in Via Montenapoleone.

The Rinascente counter was mobbed by a large family of wealthy oriental foreigners who were all gushing about it and who bought a bottle.

The AdP store was liberally spraying the scent into the street hoping to attract customers. A well-dressed lady walked into the fragrance cloud and immediately started coughing like crazy.

I think the Oud EdCC is a well-done fragrance who most definitely will sell very well. Its combination of light/fresh elements with woodsy/resinous elements is much better executed than MFK's Oud.

product_name: Colonia Intensa Oud Eau de Cologne Concentree Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Very lovely light oud, like Robert Piguet Oud mixed with Byredo Oud Immortel. No flowery (rose) additions but no heavy oud accords either. Very Nice! I don't get any leather note but this is beautiful anyway. Longevity is not super great, but still, I think worth the price! After about 5 hours it sits pretty close to the skin, but still very noticeable.

Update: Going on 10 hours and still lovely!

product_name: Colonia Intensa Oud Eau de Cologne Concentree Acqua di Parma
review_content: Just went to Harrods and had a sniff. It's quite heavy on the oud/rose. Too sweet for my liking.

product_name: Lily of the Valley Acqua di Parma
review_content: Something here was outright repulsive.

product_name: Lily of the Valley Acqua di Parma
review_content: This is a really lovely, fresh scent! It's definitely floral but not overpowering. I get a lot of the black currant and grapefruit in the opening which makes it bright and playful. The lily of the valley comes through beautifully in the middle, and the musk and cedar base is grounding without being heavy.

product_name: Lily of the Valley Acqua di Parma
review_content: Pure and beautiful but I prefer more projection. My SA said this was getting discontinued.

product_name: Lily of the Valley Acqua di Parma
review_content:
beautiful clean, slightly animalic, realistic lily of the valley. it’s truly delightful, delicate and feminine. soft and soapy yet clean. one note, pure white florals
sillage and longevity are very poor and price is unjust

product_name: Lily of the Valley Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Women after shower in the noon nice breeze with drizzling & little nude lipstick sitting on a log 🪵 in a flower garden with some blackcurrant tree sipping her iced lemon 🍋 tea.

That’s how this smells. Extremely generic but gorgeously rounded.

product_name: Lily of the Valley Acqua di Parma
review_content: White florals I can get behind. Mixed accents. Black currant forward but refined. 🤤Nice blend. A little too musky, spicy and soapy for my taste, but I like it.

product_name: Lily of the Valley Acqua di Parma
review_content: old lady decoration soap vibe.

product_name: Lily of the Valley Acqua di Parma
review_content: A light soapy frag that is crowd pleasing but not unique enough to justify a full bottle.

product_name: Lily of the Valley Acqua di Parma
review_content: This is good!! Such pretty floral fresh fragrance. I do not like florals but this one is sooo good, I want a bottle!!

product_name: Lily of the Valley Acqua di Parma
