review_content: This smells like that note I'm looking for in every perfume and if it's the main note I'll buy the perfume. It's so good. A beautiful chic floral that has a tiny bit of sweetness. It's way too expensive for me to buy though. 🥺😅

product_name: Lily of the Valley Acqua di Parma
review_content: Smells like body odor. If I really sniff hard I can smell the notes, but just getting a whiff of it it doesn’t smell pleasant. It also doesn’t project at all all. Sillage is zero. Great for someone who just wants a light citrus/floral. Same vein as D&G light blue, but a little less strong.

product_name: Lily of the Valley Acqua di Parma
review_content: According to my husband this smells like hand soap 🧼 I actually do think it smells clean, not too floral, not headache inducing. I could see a doctor, nurse anyone working in a medical setting getting away with this since it does kinda smell soapy :)

product_name: Lily of the Valley Acqua di Parma
review_content: Smells the SAME as Peony & Blush Suede by Jo Malone. I like it :)

product_name: Lily of the Valley Acqua di Parma
review_content: Where is the lily of the valley? Ridiculous price

product_name: Lily of the Valley Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Lily of the Valley is a run-of-the-mill citrus-led white floral scent. Nice quality, but utterly generic, it doesn't even feature a particularly prominent lily-of-the-valley note to my nose - it is a jasmine-led generic white floral.

LotV opens with fresh citrus notes, followed by clean but heady jasmine. Sweet and strong, it is lifted nicely by the citrus. As it develops, some green lily-of-the-valley emerges, alongside sweet magnolia. The lily-of-the-valley is just part of the white floral accord, not a focal point, and doesn't get a chance to shine as a result.

The base notes are really strong - it becomes very musky and woody as it progresses. It is a predictable progression of the white florals, but it goes a bit sour on my skin. It fades to a musky skin scent. Sillage and longevity are moderate, and it is a feminine-leaning springtime scent.

Aside from the sour drydown, LotV leaves a lot to be desired, and is nothing special or original. Given its price point, I expected more. Diorissimo it ain't. 2/5.

product_name: Lily of the Valley Acqua di Parma
review_content: Summer Spring Scent 4/10 Floral scent, smelling of white florals. Really leaning feminine. Biggest issue is performance, it sits really close to the skin. Sillage 2/10 Longevity 2/10

product_name: Lily of the Valley Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Dislike because of the superfluous price for a boring fragrance with sub-optimal sillage.

@vasilisnikolo, beats me.

product_name: Lily of the Valley Acqua di Parma
review_content: In theory, I would fall head over heels for this fragrance. Love each note listed! For some reason, I get a very strong aquatic note that I can't seem to get past. I believe I'm getting the aquatic note in place of magnolia? Anyone else? Still, I'm a big ADP fan!

product_name: Lily of the Valley Acqua di Parma
review_content: I used to love ADP but haven't been liking many of their new releases. I hoped this would be somewhat unisex but it's extremely feminine. I can't see any guy wearing this. The cedar and musk in the base reduce the sharpness of the citrus and floral somewhat but I was hoping they would work harder to mellow it out more like Bergamotto di Calabria which I love. But if you're a woman who likes florals by all means give it a go but I find it quite headache inducing.

product_name: Lily of the Valley Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Brilliant perfume! this is wonderful summer perfume
If you are a white floral lover, you'll adore this!
It is that type of perfume that you'll smell throughout the day! And its a clean summer invoking freshness and subtle (not loud) but very much classy perfume! I need this for summer!

product_name: Lily of the Valley Acqua di Parma
review_content: Another sign that i should not blind buy. This smells like puke on my skin i'm really confused :( No flower whatsoever.

product_name: Lily of the Valley Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Finally bought a full bottle. AdP is my favorite house but I'm not a huge fan of most of their recent signature collection (e.g. yuzu, osmanthus, Sakura), however, LotV is one of my favorites from the entire house. Feminine but I love wearing it and it lasts a long time.

EDIT: Realized I don't love this as much as previously thought. Adding this to the list of recent releases I'm not very impressed with. Still smells pleasant but the more I wore it, the more feminine and one dimensional it became. Wish it implemented more of the classic ADP bergamot we all love.

product_name: Lily of the Valley Acqua di Parma
review_content: Gorgeous scent. I love it. It’s such a sophisticated cool and sensual take of different florals. I can picture standing on the sea side edge with the wind blowing through a white flowy dress on a 69 degree day wearing this. It’s lovely. Day time fragrance for sure. Very spring. 9/10.

product_name: Lily of the Valley Acqua di Parma
review_content: Maybe I didn't try this in the proper weather, but it smelled very strange to me. Like half of the scent was missing. It was very light and airy smelling, but it still smelled like half of a perfume. I remember sensing something watery and aquatic about it too. I enjoyed testing it out, but my mind couldn't grasp the fact that it smelled like a gust of wind and not much else. Definitely unisex, though. Anyone could wear this. I really don't know why it was so weird. I would try it again in scorching hot weather, maybe that could help the top notes really sing.

product_name: Lily of the Valley Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I grew up with the tradition of gifting Lily-of-the-Valley on May 1st, as it is a tradition in Belgium (and France). When I tested this fragrance, I was instantly brought back to those days. It smells exactly like a LotV, with notes of other flowers (jasmine, magnolia, and geranium). It is a fresh, green, and (white) floral fragrance, and although I think it can be worn at any point (except on cold days), I think it is the perfect spring fragrance for those who like floral scents. It is a slightly more feminine fragrance.

The performance is alright. It lasted on my skin for about 4 hours or so, and the sillage was a bit intimate. It is quite a bit pricey imo.

7/10. The scent is quite pretty (8/10), but the performance is left to desire (6/10).

product_name: Lily of the Valley Acqua di Parma
review_content: Smells like Dior J'Adore, they have even many notes in common. LoV almost gone under a strong bouquet of other fragrances. Not bad at all, but not a LoV.

product_name: Lily of the Valley Acqua di Parma
review_content: Very nice scent, it’s flowery but not to sweet. I’d wear this as a guy in his 40’s I think it’s totally unisex, not to dissimilar to Dior Lucky from the Maison Dior range.

product_name: Lily of the Valley Acqua di Parma
review_content: I would ask you why new black line of acqua di parma is more expensive than older classic series like colonias and blu mediterraneo or the same perfumes in brown bottle like quercia that i have?

product_name: Lily of the Valley Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I like this! But not on myself, to me this definitely leans feminine because of the sweetness combined with the white flowers. It's not overly sweet, not at all, it seems very well blended. It's a classy sweetness, combined with that typical white flower smell (my nose can't specifically tell apart the lily-of-the-valley/jasmine/magnolia yet). I think some guys could pull this off, it's just too sweet for my own liking.

Would love to smell this on a flowery lady with a dress waving around her on a spring afternoon in a beautiful city park.

EDIT: and it performs very well! Can still faintly smell it the next day.

product_name: Crystal Incense Acqua di Parma
review_content: I check it in Düsseldorf Breuniger. Worst parfum of ADP omg, it is just grapefruit and lemon smth. Did they really test before sale ? So sad for this wonderful brand they are loosing their graound i guess, also as ı speak with them alreday stop their amazing parfum leather 😤.

product_name: Crystal Incense Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Well - seems like there are different interpretations of this one - so I’ll throw mine out there.

The opening kind of falls in line with what you’d expect from an acqua di Parma. Woody, spicy, citric. Even to the point where you’d think “oh, this is more barbershop”

However - once that opening wears off (and it does so pretty quickly) - you are left with straight incense and ginger. Think of a “spiced incense”

It’s definitely a nice fragrance - definitely on the mature side. No sweetness at all.

A really nice buttoned up take on incense and citrus.

EDIT
You know, after spending more time with this, I think the fella below has a good point comparing it to Creed Royal Oud. It’s been a while since I smelled it, but I’m thinking he’s right. Although I am certainly getting incense on my end.

product_name: Crystal Incense Acqua di Parma
review_content:
TLDR This is primarily a cedar bomb, woody, slight spiced, very dry, dirty musk fragrance. This is not sweet at all. 100% masculine. IMO from the things I like, this is a 5/10, generally a dislike, but that could change in time. It is niche level. BUYER BEWARE, This is not an incense fragrance like the name would lead you to believe. No Interlude Man here.. Most incense fragrances have a sweet element, which is absent here. (An update changed my opinion to a 7.8/10 and a like)

Okay, so people out there super into the Royal Oud by Creed. I tried it at a boutique and thought it was slammed with the cedar scent - not really my thing. I bought this, blindly, because I thought it would be a slightly sweet, spicy, incense with some wood, but this is an absolute cedar bomb on the first spray with pepper and musk. It is a skanky musk, not of the clean, sweet variety. It smelled like a boy and I wasn't sure if I liked it or not.
After about 10 minutes, I'm definitely picking up more of the benzoin and olibanum, but I typically go to La Nuit De L'homme when referencing for cardamom, and I'm not getting much of that at all. The cedar is fleeting during the dry down, which I'm not complaining about. This strong cedar smell comes and goes, then comes back.
Okay, you know what this reminds me of? I was in japan and I went to Nara after another backpacker showed me a video of some people feeding deer, so I naturally wanted to go see for myself. I took a friend and spent about 13 hours walking around in the forested areas of Nara. At one point we stumbled on a huge wooden building and people were lined up to get in. It turned out to be the Todaiji Temple, the largest wooden structure in the world. This Acqua Di Parma Crystal Incense reminds me of being inside that building with all the people and the dirt and the smell of the wood and some light remanences of burning incense.
It is summertime and this was released last year, so I can't give a full judgement without wearing it in all seasons, but I would necessarily classify this as a primarily cedar, woody, slight spiced, very dry musky fragrance. IMO this is much better than the Creed Royal Oud which should be renamed to Royal Cedar.

Review based on a full presentation 100ml example.

Update... the more I wear this the more I like it. Its strange, because im not generally into wood chips smell, but there's something with way more depth at play here that is very pleasing for me. Upgrade to a 7.8/10.

product_name: Crystal Incense Acqua di Parma
review_content: I love it! Has a certain lightness to it that I’ve come to expect from AdP. I love the choice of incense they used. Good solid male fragrance without the heavy used car salesman woody smell or too light lemon pledge smell with just enough oomph to make it interesting. Definitely office friendly. Possible year round but have to try it in winter first. If your body chemistry works with fragrances like Ganymede you will likely do well with this although it is not like Ganymede. In fact I can’t think of anything that is a good comparison.

product_name: Crystal Incense Acqua di Parma
review_content: Seems like folks are not too fond of this one. In that case, if you're moving on from it, check out my swap list and I will take this off your hands. Pm me!

product_name: Crystal Incense Acqua di Parma
review_content:
very scratchy ambers, and an unpleasant overpowering ginger note at the start.
the aldehydic notes are quite overpowering, like a laundry room.
very clean and vintage if that's your thing. not for me.

product_name: Crystal Incense Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Dark dank incense, kinda musty and sharp. Almost like an oud. The citrus hangs around but smells more like orange than grapefruit.

Churchy and moody. Personally not a fan of this one.

product_name: Crystal Incense Acqua di Parma
review_content:
First review of someone who actually owns it!!......
I love what ADP do with the signature line. they take a specific 1 or 2 notes and just do them well.
Oud, Saffron, lime/oakmoss, vanilla etc.
They tend to be pretty unique scents in that they dont clone a popular designer fragrance or join a bandwagon (an ambroxan bomb/sauvage style/aventus style etc).
They arent usually overtly "brave"" but also have uniqueness that separates them from "mass-appealing"
This is no different....
The citrus opening is quite fizzy & sparkling and could easily be mistaken for either orange, grapefruit or mandarin type citruses.
You can feel the ginger in there too.
The mid and dry down is an easy on the nose olibanum - not too smokey or astringent. Its softened by what I assume is the cedar and/or cardamom..


It's an excellent fragrance and performs well so far. dont let the olibanum or incense fool you into thinking this is a winter only fragrance - the citrus opening is bright and can be worn all year around.

What I find clever in this fragrance is the transition through the notes, the dry down has no resemblance to the top. If you only smelled the dry down on someone, you could never guess that there was a bright citrus opening - its evidently very well made.

product_name: Crystal Incense Acqua di Parma
review_content: Sounds interesting

product_name: Iris Nobile Edizione Speziale Acqua di Parma
review_content: At the first test it seemed to be a simple floral fragrance. Pleasant, but not "AH"... but something prompted me to buy it. And I do not regret a bit!!! Very delicate and feminine fragrance. Iris is not particularly felt, in my opinion, more ylang-ylang manifests itself. It opens with a very warm and sweet flavor. I would say that this is a classic in its purest form. Nothing superfluous. The fragrance of a well-groomed lady with good taste. Men are crazy about it - tested on all my colleagues!!! In cool weather very beautiful trail, in the heat more sweetness and colors gives out.

product_name: Colonia Mirra Acqua di Parma
review_content:
When I first got it about four years ago, it was mostly just a dry, dusty myrhh with mediocre performance. Abandoned old wooden houses must have smelled like that, I thought.

It had a somewhat bright and promising resinous opening that quickly faded and turned dry and dusty within an hour; it stayed linear and soft, almost like a whisper that way throughout its remaining lifespan of about four hours.

It took a bit of imagination to perceive that lingering chalkiness as cocoa powder, but even that would be kind of a stretch.

Fast forward a few years to the present—it has likely undergone maceration and has become a rich, moderately sweet resinous amber fragrance with clear gourmet warm tones of vanilla and rich, dusty cocoa powder.

Its projection has improved to almost an arm length, while its longevity has stretched to about ten hours.

From a meh fragrance almost designated to becoming a layering fragrance for its base notes—evolved into nearly a powerhouse!

I guess I got lucky!

product_name: Colonia Mirra Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Honestly love this stuff. ADParma very hit or miss for me. This, Essenza & Futura are great.

This is just smooth and a great cooler weather fragrance. I love Myrrh as a note and this is in my top 3 for sure, it's basic and a little linear but just right. For an ADC it lastly a decent while 4-7hrs, it's soft and has a nice bubble which I'd describe as fuzzy warm cookie dough(ish) ambery feel.
I'd imagine the sillage is very nice too.

I'm picking up another 180ml this week. I would love an EDP of this... a little deeper and bolder! Come on ADP!

Seriously on a cold morning few sprays behind the ears and BOOM! In my own Cosy bubble.

For me 10/10 for what it is. It's not an all rounder, somewhat versatile and nowhere near a beast. But! That's exactly why I love it. Simple, smooth, warm, gorgeous. Apparently discontinued, what a shame I will definitely get another bottle for a back up.

product_name: Colonia Mirra Acqua di Parma
review_content: My dad gave me this a year ago and I always thought that me, being a 20-year old college student, was too youthful for this fragrance. Over time I have come to appreciate it and honestly it's my go-to for formal occasions for when I'm feeling extra sophisticated. Really great fragrance, but very mature.

product_name: Colonia Mirra Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Acqua di Parma Colonia Mirra is a sophisticated and versatile fragrance from the Italian house’s Colonia line, blending the brand’s signature citrusy freshness with warm, resinous, and spicy notes. Launched as part of their Ingredient Collection, it centers around the rich, balsamic aroma of myrrh, elevated by complementary notes that create a smooth and calming experience.

Scent Profile:

Colonia Mirra opens with a subtle citrus burst, characteristic of Acqua di Parma’s Colonia DNA, likely featuring bergamot or orange blossom, which gives it a bright and approachable start. As it settles, the heart reveals a delicate spice accord with noticeable hints of nutmeg, adding a warm, slightly sweet, and earthy dimension. The star of the show, myrrh, anchors the base with its resinous, amber-like depth, creating a soothing and elegant finish. The fragrance strikes a balance between freshness and warmth, making it a refined take on an amber fragrance.

Performance:

Projection: Light to moderate. Colonia Mirra projects softly, creating an intimate scent bubble that feels personal rather than overpowering. It’s ideal for those who prefer understated elegance.

Longevity: Fairly good, lasting around 6-8 hours on the skin, which is impressive for an Acqua di Parma fragrance, given the brand’s lighter, eau de cologne-inspired roots. Reapplication may be needed for all-day wear in some cases.

Vibe and Versatility:

This fragrance exudes a calming, sophisticated aura, making it suitable for nearly any occasion—work, casual outings, or evening events. Its darker, resinous undertones, driven by myrrh, give it a slightly moody character that might feel heavy for hot summer days but shines in cooler seasons like spring, fall, or even mild winter days. It evokes a sense of timeless luxury, reminiscent of the discontinued Armani Privé Myrrhe Impériale, though Colonia Mirra leans lighter and fresher.

Comparison and Uniqueness:

Fans of amber-heavy fragrances will appreciate Colonia Mirra’s refined take on the genre. The nutmeg and citrus accents set it apart from denser amber scents, giving it a brighter, more wearable edge. Its similarity to Armani Privé Myrrhe Impériale suggests a luxurious, resinous warmth but with Acqua di Parma’s signature Italian finesse.
Rating: 8/10

product_name: Colonia Mirra Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I wish they'd do an EDP for this one... ADP has been a hit or miss house for me. I appreciate there perfumes but some just ain't for me.

This, Essenza & Futura are my favorites...

Considering this is an EDC it lasts quite awhile... I would love a pumped up version of this. However, this is absolutely beautiful. When I first tried it i thought bleh, nothing special but it's not meant to be... this is just smooth warm cozy and that's exactly what it's made to be and it's excellent. This will not make your jaw drop but once you wear it a few times it becomes addictive.

Come on ADP do an EDP!!! Don't know if this is discontinued or what but I have a couple of back up bottles and it's available in New Zealand.

Anyway, this is a simple masterpiece for me.

10/10 - Nothing groud breaking, nothing crazy just soothing, warm, sensual and mysterious.

product_name: Colonia Mirra Acqua di Parma
review_content: The best from the house

product_name: Colonia Mirra Acqua di Parma
review_content: I think Prada Amber Intense with its more soapy character might have the edge over this one for me personally. Very nice though. Both are discontinued so get 'em while you can.

product_name: Colonia Mirra Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Bought as sample 5 years ago. I wondered at the time, if my sample was stale. I didn't find citric top notes, or pachouli base note. It opened with a smell like stale iris and lavender, with a powdery quality that stayed the same all day.
I'm giving it another try today. It hasn't improved or worsened in 5 years. After a few hours, it's stinging my eyes a bit, with a cloying, spicy sweetness.
I found it 'meh' at first, and kind of boring. Hours later, annoying.
I'm obviously no expert. I don't know what myrrh is meant to even smell like. I don't know if my chemistry is incompatible with this fragrance or, like I suggested, it's stale.

product_name: Colonia Mirra Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Just got this, my initial thoughts.

Myrrh is one of my favorite notes, so I've wanted to get my hands on this. They don't smell completely alike, but as someone who loves Prada Amber Pour Homme Intense, this reminds me of a much less sexy, more casual, less soapy version of the Prada. If the Prada is for date nights in sleek, upscale bars and restaurants when you want to inflect a certain understated air of elevated but nonchalant "cool", then Colonia Mirra is for the following easygoing day, waking up, heading out to get a late breakfast and then a walk in the park. Overall, the blend here doesn't feel as "special" or "interesting" as the Prada. This is a lot more straightforward, but I wouldn't go as far as using the word "linear." This still has enough depth so that it doesn't get boring.

So far, this is a strong like for me, but again I'm a sucker for myrrh and oriental fragrances, so this fits right into my wheelhouse. I can actually see myself using this much more than my discontinued bottles of Amber Pour Homme Intense to conserve those. Will edit with a full review later.

Edit: The amber in this leans towards that synthetic kind of amber accord one often finds in modern day male perfumery (you know the aura I'm talking about, usually accompanied by ambroxan, though, thankfully, there's no ambroxan in this), and overall slightly "cheapens" the overall feel of this. It's surprising as my experience with other Acqua di Parma fragrances has been noting how natural they smell. I'm not saying Colonia Mirra smells "cheap", but it's just not as "elevated" as I initially thought off the first couple of wears. I do still like this though! Downgrading my rating from an 8 to a 7.5

7.5/10

product_name: Colonia Mirra Acqua di Parma
review_content: This is a real head-turner! Colonia Mirra is warm, spicy and definitely masculine. The initial citrus burst fades quickly into this rich amber and myrrh scent that lasts all day. It's sophisticated and perfect for evening events.

product_name: Colonia Mirra Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Just a superb fragrance that many have overlooked but, this is a magnificent blending of citrus and smooth amber, myrhh goodness. A semi dark Oriental with an Italian twist that combines freshness up top with a spicy, semi-sweet near gourmand drydown and a near perfect mix of amber & Patchouli in the mid to end to give it a nice, well rounded light woods & earthy mix. Close to Prada Amber Pour Homme Intense but, none of the soapy like accord that Prada is known for nor a pronounced woods that Prada has with the Sandalwood & Vetiver. Just an Italian take on a spicy oriental that creates a magic from fall to early spring. This feels slightly more casual and laid back compared to Prada's version yet, can be worn just as easily as the latter in a work or professional setting. I just prefer Prada for that particular environment or scenario. But, for friends & family gatherings or that date night occasion in cooler to cold weather, this is simply stellar. Performance is quite good as well as I get 6-8 hours of duration with half a dozen sprays. For me I rank the brown bottled colonia line in this order; Colonia Oud Intensa, Colonia Sandalo Concentree and then this gem right here Mirra but, they are all super close for me. No losers in this bunch at all.

An underrated creation that exudes quality from the first spray and on. There are still some tester bottles and 180ml. bottles available for excellent prices. If spice & everything nice is your calling, this is your gateway to that occasion.

product_name: Colonia Mirra Acqua di Parma
review_content: The leaves are falling, autumn is here, it's time to break out this fantastic warm amber-spicy fragrance. For me, I find four sprays is enough, where I typically do six, and I find it lasts. I was fortunate in that someone gave me a full-size tester bottle of this... it's great to have friends with connections like that!

product_name: Colonia Mirra Acqua di Parma
review_content: Beautiful scent of myrrh and amber, fresh with its light touch of patchouli and citrus. It has a slight subtle sweetness, I am not sure if it comes from the orange flower notes. This is really gorgeous and probably unisex. I think I need a bottle of this. Wonderful scent! this is an underrated gem! don't go buying expensive Tom Ford Myrrh scents without sampling this first!

product_name: Colonia Mirra Acqua di Parma
review_content: Smells like a less intense and more rounded version amouage crimson rocks. A warm spicy, powdery, amber frangrance. Quite resinous in the dry down. Insane sillage and longevity. Could be cousins with Tom Ford Noir.

product_name: Colonia Mirra Acqua di Parma
review_content:
A great day wearing Mirra. The trick is to apply with weight, confidence, and persistence. Then do it again.

Within 30 mins, the perfume has relaxed and settled into a lovely warm woody, resinous, soft patchouli fog that projects enough so that you can pick it up easily, wallow in it even. And yet it doesn’t overpower those around. Lasts all day and is enjoyable even after 12 hours. One of my favourite Aqua di Parma perfumes.

product_name: Colonia Mirra Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Lightly powdery and nutty amber dominant scent accented with fresh citrus. Very clean, but warm and cozy and perfect for the cold weather.
Not a big projector, have to lean to get a nice whiff, but does last for hours on skin and more on clothes.

product_name: Colonia Mirra Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Top notes are a bit hard to decipher, but there is at least some floral and citric notes. They are very pleasant, but not very distinct and they evaporate in less than 30 minutes, transforming into saponin notes.
In the mid, nutmeg is prominent but the myrrh and other, warmer spices fills out the picture.
Base is solid, and nice with amber and discreet woodiness.

The AdP signature of citrus and soap is quite obvious although the profile has more to do with Eau Sauvage EDP – citric with a spicy and resinous base – than with the classic colonias. There is, however, not sufficient citrus notes to say that this is a "hespéridé" – leaning on citrus essential oils – and the top notes are not an important part of the overall experience in general. There is more spice and resinous notes and less soapiness compared to other colonia bottles from this house.

All in all I think that if this was a stronger concentration, I would consider replacing my Eau Sauvage EDP (2017) with Colonia Mirra. Autumn-winter-early spring office scent, but does not have sufficient performance to defend the price. Although I like discretion, even the skin scent phase is too weak after 3 hours on me. Edit: Funny how the opening reminds me of the way Fahrenheit smells on you past lunchtime, but this really lasts only 15 minutes.

product_name: Colonia Mirra Acqua di Parma
review_content: A smooth delicious blend of Myrrh, Amber and Nutmeg. its the kind of scent you wear under a thick coat while knowing christmas eve and good company is just around the corner!

product_name: Colonia Mirra Acqua di Parma
review_content:
This is a lovely scent that reminds me of TF Noir in the dry down.
Not a big projector but remains around for 4-6hrs.

product_name: Colonia Mirra Acqua di Parma
review_content:
مرکباتی در کار نیست و از ابتدا اسپایسی و صمغی شروغ میشه و تا انتها تنها تغییری که می کنه ورود پچولی و امبرهست که باز هم آنچنان تغییری ایجاد نمی کنه و بیس عطر حفظ میشه.
بیشتر مردانه هست و 30 سال به بالا.
یونیک نیست اما پوشیدنیه.
***************************************************
scent:6.5/10
longevity:7.5/10
sillage:6/10
purchase value:4/10
*************
overall:6/10

product_name: Colonia Mirra Acqua di Parma
review_content: This is a wonderful fragrance. Lots of spice with very dark smoothness about it. It's not the run of the mill fragrance .

product_name: Colonia Mirra Acqua di Parma
review_content:
My first review on here, LONG time lurker..
Looking at some of the reviews below makes me question my own findings., but I found Mirra to be massively disappointing. It opens well, fresh whilst intoxicatingly reassuring and classic ADP, and the initial drydown is lovely. For the price I paid for it £65 - I thought I was on a complete win.
However - 20/30 minutes later and it's a skin scent on me. An hour or two and it's all but gone. So disappointing that I boxed it straight back up for a exchange, thinking that something had to be amiss. The second bottle was identical, so that went back too. Now I have ADP Oud, Leather and Ebano - all of which have good to great performance, so I'm not sure whether it is just my skin? The readily available, relative 'bargain bin' pricing does suggest that I may not be the only one being less than impressed though..

product_name: Colonia Mirra Acqua di Parma
review_content: Was lucky enough to get a 100ml for 65 bucks and damm this stuff is good… very warm and inviting, aslong as you go light with the sprays. a 10/10 from me. Brilliant stuff

product_name: Colonia Mirra Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Just looked at my bottle and only have about 10ml left. This is a gem, definitely one of my favorite Myyrh fragrances.

I will be getting another bottle this year, possibly another for a back up.

9/10 loses a point because it's not a year round nor most versatile fragrance.

Love it!

product_name: Colonia Mirra Acqua di Parma
review_content: Masculine, solid, linear (not a criticism - an observation of this range of single note emphasis colognes). Straightforward, brown/amber (if you find scents resemble colours, as I do). Easily wearable I can daytime/work situations, as evening ones. Safe for work, but definitely not a generic office designer scent.

product_name: Colonia Mirra Acqua di Parma
review_content: On scent alone this is 10/10 just got it in today so will have to review performance but this is beautifully spicy warm and resoniius almost gourmand but not.The fragrance so far seems to be a moderate projector and gentlemanly in its silliage,one of the highest quality fragrance for the price point which is currently 55.60

product_name: Colonia Mirra Acqua di Parma
review_content: Starts off pleasant and juicy, but then a turmeric note kicks in. Really really dislike turmeric in fragrances.

product_name: Colonia Mirra Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Since i made my first review I want to add one.
I love this one in the first place.
The more i use this fragrance I feel it is a one you can put into the realm of the ones who relate to the Arabian notes used in Oud and those very expensive ones you can find here.
The notes, as I said previous, are very distinct in their consistence and combination.

Wow this is so good and powerful and yet it is balanced and so sophisticated.
It does remind me indeed of the spice shop or market in India or the middle East but it has also that mystical smell typical for mire.
It has a long-lasting power for eau de cologne and makes you feel dressed-up for a nice diner or just for a good evening party on a sunny day outside.
What ever occasion, this is gorgeous and well balanced to wear.

product_name: Colonia Mirra Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Gorgeous fragrance from Acqua Di Parma!

I love this! Only just purchased a few days ago and it’s stunning! This seems to be a rather underrated not so well known fragrance from Acqua di Parma which surprises me!

Have seen several reviews of people describing this as a winter fragrance but I find it very very refreshing!

Like a walk through a pine forest on a sunny winters day!

True gem of a fragrance!

10/10!

product_name: Colonia Mirra Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Similar to TF Noir and Narcisso Rodriguez for him edt.
Peppery.

product_name: Colonia Mirra Acqua di Parma
review_content: Awesome and underrated smell. Professional and mysterious at the same time. A clean citrusy Myrrh that performs very well for an EdC. Smells much like Prada amber intense minus the soapiness. Also very similar to Eau Sauvage Parfum, and much cheaper if you go for the 6oz bottle. Versatile and office safe.

product_name: Colonia Mirra Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I learned to love Myrrh from Dior Eau Sauvage Parfum 2012 and Jo Malone Myrrh Tonka, but I'm just ok with this one. I'm not sure what to make of this one. Dark, warm, cozy, dry myrrh and other dark notes I can't pick out. It's nice enough but nothing pops out and grabs me.

Scent: 7 / Sillage: 8 / Longevity: 7.5

EDIT: My old notes at the beginning of my frag journey...
1st wear: Ok. Musky & sweet. Too sweet. 6-7/10
2nd wear: Too musky and sweet after 10 mins. 3 hrs later, def too musky. Pass. 5-6/10

product_name: Colonia Mirra Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I'm a big fan of Acqua di Parma line up and Colonia Mirra is no exception to this. This Eau de Cologne Concentrée, despite lacking a bit in longevity, really pays off with a luscious, deep and layered olfactory experience. It echoes the seriousness of the original Acqua di Parma but with a completely different set of notes, though it plays in the same arena in terms of elegance.

The opening is quite dark, bittersweet (almost medicinal) and reminds me of dark cocoa powder; there are sweeter orange blossom nuances that bright it up enough to avoid it feeling stuffy and gothic. As the initial citrus sparkles fade, it becomes drier and almost powdery in a very pleasant way, like if you were smelling in a wooden cupboard where resins and nutmeg have been left for months. Myrrh provides the luscious bittersweet background that becomes more prominent 30 mins in, while nutmeg is more prominent at the beginning and adds a note of spiciness.

As soon as the base notes hit your nose, the warm ambery base makes the bittersweet smell of myrrh more akin to burnt brown sugar - this is no gourmand at all, but just really gives the idea of sugar taken off the stove right before it burns. At points it gives me the idea of being sucked into a black hole and, as much as it sounds like a negative comment, it is not in reality as it removes your focus from anything else surrounding it.

Colonia Mirra has such a dark, mysterious and alluring scent profile I can't stop smelling my wrist. This is a dressed up fragrance, good for your own enjoyment and amazing when you need to smell refined and opulent. Due to its low contration, longevity is not amazing - 3 to 4 hours, give it or take it, and that is expected; it effuses convincingly but not aggressively for the first hour before becoming a sking scent. Great for fall and winter, both day and night, rainy days and formal situation. Classic Acqua di Parma bottle (batch code 0260337), in dark brown glass similar to those of the discontinued Ingredients collection; a number of fragrances in the line have been moved under the Signatures of Sun line and became EdP concentration, but alas not Colonia Mirra although this one is still widely available at discounters.

product_name: Colonia Mirra Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I am a young woman, however I thoroughly enjoy wearing this fragrance all year and weather long. I see as a very complex, but easily wearable fragrance. For me it is a very cozy smell, therefore I tend to wear it on cooler days, however I see how it could be pulled of in a nice summery, flowy dress, sipping double espresso on ice.
The fragrance opens up to this strong medicinal smell, I get just a little bit citruses, more like sweeter orange peel/ blossom citruses (probably the orange blossom). However the myrhh, amber and patchouli is amazing. After 15 minutes on my skin, it starts to sweeten and then I get just a bit of that nutmeg. But it is not sweet as in candy sweet, it is a natural sweetness. It is somehow fresh, but warm and spicy at the same time. After a hour it becomes fresh for me. It is so mysterious, but familiar at the same time. I love it when my boyfriend wears it, I love it to wear it myself.
When it dries, it becomes quite sweet and aromatic, reminds me of dialed down Black Phantom By Kilian.
I got a 180ml bottle of this fragrance at TKMaxx for a fraction of the original price. I believe I paid 68 euros. I don't think I would pay the original price for this fragrance. It is not my favorite fragrance, but I appreciate it.

product_name: Colonia Mirra Acqua di Parma
review_content: This is my all time favourite scent. I don't know how to describe it apart from unconditional love. I just love this stuff

product_name: Colonia Mirra Acqua di Parma
review_content: Quite medicinal in the early spray. But changing to more pleasant after a while when it starts to polarize gradually. I think this is more masculine than unisex. Smells classy but performance is moderate. The myrrh is dominant here, and of the same nuance with JM Myrrh and Tonka. Expensive but worth the biggest size resides on my shelf.

product_name: Colonia Mirra Acqua di Parma
review_content: Wow. Just wow.... I'm in love with it, it's definitely got that brite, fresh citrus opening that after a half hour or longer absolutely settles down into this yummy, warm, creamy, delicious, nutmeg/myrrh/amber thing that gives it a sweet, brown sugary, gourmand vibe... of course the star is that creamy, smooth, warm, nutmeg/amber/myrrh combo. My god.. A woman with whom I had a romantic date with a few weekends ago was stuck to me like a magnet, afterwards later texting me about how delicious I smelled to her. I have Colonia Mirra to thank for such a nice compliment from her.... Now the downsides... It is only a cologne concentrate, which is so disappointing. This NEEDS to be an EDP or at least an EDT... But other than so-so performance and so-so longevity, this stuff is soooo beautiful and delicious. I absolutely LOVE citrus/amber/myrrh/olibanum fragrances. I need to discover more!

product_name: Colonia Mirra Acqua di Parma
review_content: Longevity may be an issue but OMG its smells fantastic

product_name: Colonia Mirra Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Iam not sure what’s going on with this one
It very close to tf noir
But it’s weaker and it disappears very fast
Though the scent is nice my advice buy the tomford

product_name: Colonia Mirra Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Having tried most of the blue line from this house plus a handful of others in this line I haven't been overly impressed by most. This however I adore and love ALOT. It's not to say the others were bad, they were nice but not bottle worthy for me. Mirra is back up bottle worthy for me, I just wish it lasted abit longer. This smells rich, deep and opulent. Reminds me of the Myyrh in Zaharoff.

9/10

product_name: Colonia Mirra Acqua di Parma
review_content:
This starts off as a Pow to the senses then calms down to this nice mixture of amber ( and myrrh ) with other elements of the fall time ( although I wore this in the winter, it still fits perfectly )

I don't personally know or have smelled what Myrrh is but, whatever it is, this fragrance works and works well.

It's nothing explosively amazing to me, but just beautifully done and enjoyable.

A woman could likely pull this off but... it's not so obvious either way to be just for men or women to me.

*Added Oct.31 2021*
Revisiting this for a moment, this does smell like a cookie... a well made gourmet type of cookie.

product_name: Colonia Mirra Acqua di Parma
Colonia Mirra Acqua di Parma
review_content:
This is going to be complicated and I may even contradict myself on a couple of points.

I got this just after Christmas from a UK retailer who I think had made a mistake in pricing on their Euro site, it was a fraction of what they were charging in GBP and for what I paid it’s a fantastic bargain.

Putting the above aside I’ve got to say I like it but I don’t love it. I have Colonia at present, I’ve had a few other ADP fragrances in the past and have always been wowed by them, this doesn’t quite hit the spot.

The initial hit I get is of high cocoa content dark Swiss Chocolate, which immediately calms down into mirhh and amber. It’s got that ADP mark of quality all over it, but at the same time there’s just something missing to take it to another level where I couldn’t live without it.

I don’t get the longevity or projection I was expecting either. It arrived a few day’s ago and I sprayed it before bed on two nights and there was no hint of it in the morning, today has been the first time I’ve worn it during the day and after 6 hours I’m having to really search for any hint of it.

I think I paid around 1/4 of RRP so I can’t complain at that price but I would have been disappointed if I hadn’t got it heavily discounted.

It’s obviously quality and it’s nice but it doesn’t really stand out as anything special.

product_name: Colonia Mirra Acqua di Parma
Colonia Mirra Acqua di Parma
review_content:
At first wearing I quite liked this fragrance. A brighter, bit more light myrrh than usual, while still carrying the same dryness it's known for.
Something kept bugging me though and I never felt I really liked the scent. After smelling it a while I think I've realized what it is: a scratchy and strong synthetic woody amber, perhaps the old pal Amber Xtreme popping up again. This causes the fragrance to have a scent reminiscent of a more generic cheap masculine and, as my girlfriend describes it, causes it to "go up the nose" really much and hurts a little if you smell it too close. I would guess this is a way to boost the sillage of the scent, which unfortunately completely ruined it too.

It was launched in 2017 but is already discontinued as of 2020, so maybe other people agreed with me. If you like myrrh, there are just so many other scents around that I would recommend over this.

product_name: Colonia Mirra Acqua di Parma
review_content: A discontinued masterpiece that is still slept on even now. There isn't much out there that is like this one. For me it is as good as or even better than Colonia Leather

product_name: Colonia Mirra Acqua di Parma
review_content: i don't know what it is but this scent like many of the other Acqua di Parma scents smells cheap. Just everything about this radiates synthetics. I've tried a dozen or so of their scents after liking one of their Blu Meditteraneo scents and reading all of these positive reviews. I love resins and myrrh but this just doesn't sit right with me. It smells unbalanced with a largely vacant top note register.

product_name: Colonia Mirra Acqua di Parma
review_content:
The top notes last relatively little, only a few minutes. Immediately appears the main note of MIR, and from now on the myrrh is the main player who will feel throughout the period of wearing.
Elegant, totally masculine, with a long longevity and medium projection.
To get an idea of how it smells, imagine the final part of Guerlain-L`instant and replace cocoa with myrrh. They are somewhat similar towards the end.

product_name: Colonia Mirra Acqua di Parma
review_content: بوی گرم و نرم خوب و البته اشنایی دارد که در انتها به پچولی و امبر ختم می شود.مشکلی که تقریبا اکثر عطرهای کلونیابه جز چند استثنا دارند اینه که رایحه ای خاص و تک ندارند.جالبه ماندگاری این عطر بد نیست اما با توجه به خاص نبودن با این قیمت فعلی ارزش خریدش قطعا بسیار پایین است.

product_name: Colonia Mirra Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Scent: 6/10

Quality: 8/10

Originality: 5/10

Sillage: 7/10

Projection: 6/10

Longevity: 7/10

Price VS Size: 6/10

product_name: Colonia Mirra Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I love it. This is Very resinous and balsamic. Masculine. It is blended well. smells dynamically rich and powerful. Another ADP hit , this house knows how to put fragrances together. I received a compliment from a young woman , a mature
woman and an elderly woman since I bought it. Its kind of hard to wear, definitelty for a date, by the fire place, intimate, or sex occassions. It’s worth a try or buy

product_name: Colonia Mirra Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Tested it on skin: a little disappointed after the high hopes that the paper test gave me.

I thought I had found the Holy Graal of Myrrh, but no.
Don't misunderstand me: it's a good round myrrh centred frag, but my previous impression in regard to the lack of AdP's signature citrusy opening and the drydown, that reveals to be even more vanillic than it appeared on paper, makes it lean very feminine imo. Projection is moderate at best, and the fragrance is short lived on my skin (disappeared after just 3 hours).

I think it may be interesting on a woman, but quite boring on a man. That said, today I also tested Guerlain Bois Mysterieux: THIS is the holy grail of masculine myrrh. Given the price tag similarity between the 2 frags, it's a no-brainer for me for my myrrh frag quest: AdP is out, Guerlain for the win!

Edit: Guerlain Bois Mysterieux is a masterpiece imo, but should you look for a frag totally myrrh-centered, I can't recommend enough Goutal Ambre Fetiche and Armani Myrrhe Imperiale. Really, imperial!

product_name: Colonia Mirra Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I beautiful take on myrrh. It's indeed pretty warm and round, and the typical AdP citric opening is a little less fresh than other frags of the same line. Myrrh is noticeable in the heart. Then it morphs to an ambery (resin/vanilla) drydown - for sure a little less interesting than its big brother, AdP Note di Colonia III. Colonia Mirra is overall sweeter and a little less refined than the latter, but also 2 to 3 times cheaper.

A win from AdP, but try on skin before you buy!

Mildly warm evenings, 30+

product_name: Colonia Mirra Acqua di Parma
review_content: I found this fragrance more conservative that the version Oud or Ambra. I would list these three in the following order: 1.Colonia Oud 2. Colonia Ambra 3. Colonia Mirra being the last one a more subtle and more quieter than the first two. I would give a final score: 3 of 5

product_name: Colonia Mirra Acqua di Parma
review_content: This stuff smells deep and rich almost like a cookie dough vibe, but manly. It will turn heads for a mature audience. I think people are sleeping on this one, modern and vintage. a casual and dress up fragrance that gets the job done.

product_name: Colonia Mirra Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Acqua di Parma is such a classy brand.

From the moment you open the box you can feel the quality and the luxury. Colonia mirra delivers exactly what its name says. From the very start you are greeted with an ambery, sweet but steady myrrh note. This is for the elegant, dark haired gentleman over 30. Longevity is good but not excellent. If you genuinely like myrrh, give it a try. However, my myrrh obsession is already fulfilled by the 2012 version of Eau sauvage Parfum which has a bit more brightness IMO and better performance.

product_name: Colonia Mirra Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Spiritual, meditative, sensual, deep, elegant, masculine.

Perfectly matches its name as it's VERY resinous, which I find lovely.

However, the more it drys down the sweeter it gets and becomes a bit cloying. It's also not very easy to wear so although I fell in love with the scent at the beginning I won't be buying a bottle, I can't spend so much on something that's not 100% satisfactory.

product_name: Colonia Mirra Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Acqua di Parma, my new favorite brand and a true master of blends.
All their perfumes are made of high quality ingredients and this one is no exception.

This perfume says: I enjoy being a man!

This creature is extraordinary, utterly admirable. Everything about this perfume is as it should be. Everything is in its place. Everything is balanced.
The notes come in, play their role in the light of a resinous myrrh and amber accord and slowly fade away with a goodbye kiss on your senses.

The opening is a little bit powerful, but just enough to grab your attention. Then the myrrh comes in and the beautiful, sweet, and boozy amber starts to play in the background. This is the main theme of the perfume and it will be like this until you can't smell the perfume anymore.
I've applied it 12 hours ago and I can still smell it on my arm. I actually sniffed my arm more than 100 times today.

Myrrh and amber are two of my beloved notes in perfumes and they always will be. So I have to say, this is one of the top 5 perfumes I've ever smelled in my life, maybe even the best.

Overall, a sweet lovely perfume, made of high quality ingredients, suitable for colder months with a not-so-casual vibe.

Thank you for making this gem!

Scent: A beautiful combination of myrrh and amber. 12/10
Uniqueness: 10/10
Longevity: 10/10

product_name: Colonia Mirra Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Mirra is the third one I have tried from the ADP Ingredient line after Oud and Leather and like those two, I love this one as well. This is a beautiful, powdery spice n Myrhh fragrance.

Top notes are a fleeting dash of citrus and the sharp spicy note of the nutmeg. This spicy nutmeg is joined by a very beautiful myrhh note. This heart phase is just lovely and then turns powdery when the patchouli comes into focus. The dry down is a blend of the myrhh, and powdery patchouli with hints of amber notes. All in all, very clean smelling for want of a better word. longevity is pretty decent, around the 6-7 hour range on me although projection dies down after the first hour into what I would call the "hugging" range. I get whiffs of it all through it's scent life so it does last.

In conclusion, I would say if you are a fan of the Myrhh note or of powdery frags in general, this is a good entry with the usual fantastic ADP quality in ingredients and blend. I would say this is Masculine mostly although a woman could easily pull this off too if she does not mind the spice. Definitely a large decant or Full bottle worthy for me. 8.5/10

product_name: Colonia Mirra Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Wow this is amazing. If I was forced to compare it to something similar, I’d say TM Ultra Zest, but this ADP mirra is a much more refined + creative take on that basic idea. (for the sake of giving ppl an idea who haven’t smelled it yet).
This has a feel to it that feels like it is blooming when u wear it, with this extremely beautiful + lush + full, but at the same time fragile/nuanced + transparent,

product_name: Colonia Mirra Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Just a big myrrh coat. This just wraps ya up in a big, dusty, fuzzy, myrrhy blanket that’s perfectly warm, soothing, and sweet.

Mirra is long lasting, has very good projection, and is made from quality ingredients. Even though they don’t smell anything alike, this could be in the same family and of the same quality as TF Noir Extreme; if you like one, you would probably like the other one, too.

Mirra had me at first smell. 10/10.

product_name: Colonia Mirra Acqua di Parma
review_content: Un parfum sophistiqué, rare comme composition, mérite bien d’être un parfum niche, il est très volupté, englobe un coté ambré majestueux, c'est un parfum pour homme virile et non pas pour jeune homme

product_name: Colonia Mirra Acqua di Parma
review_content:
After investigation, the originality of this frag is probably due to a component which is not stated in the parfume pyramid above, myrrh oil, which gives rise to some confusion or questions in the reviews here (honey? creamy? amber? ...).
Myrrh is present here in two forms: myrrh resin (a middle note) and myrrh oil (a base note along with a discrete patchouli).
It's this oily base note which is really dominant and long lasting in this frag.
I should have read the small booklet which is included in the 150 ml box I bought ! It tells it all: no amber as erroneously stated in the pyramid above, just myrrh oil.

product_name: Colonia Mirra Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Applause, what a well balanced and interesting perfume.
I didn't expect otherwise by this house of course.
How to describe this perfume is not easy. It is a compilation of different notes that are not natural easy partners to combine. This perfume is distinctive and also adepts to everyone who wears it.
The opening is a typical Italian based perfume with the the fusion of citric notes. But they are not overwhelming.
The aromatic raisins and nutmeg keep it in balance.
Happily the patchouli is of a good quality so it stays in the background, but gives also balance by its light sweet freshness to the strong fusion of the balsamic amber and spicy nutmeg notes.
This is really a nice perfume for a man who is distinctive but also modest.
When to wear? I guess its a four season perfume:)
Every note reacts different according the season you wear it.
This is a really modern perfume for one who likes class and style in a modest way. It represents in some way the Italian way of life like the Blue mediterraneo series really do.

product_name: Colonia Mirra Acqua di Parma
review_content: This one's derivative but not really a carbon copy of anything. I get hints of Creed Tabarome, Creed Aberdeen Lavander, Diptyque Eau Duelle, and Rag & Bone Amber. It's basically all of those mixed together, with some neroli or petitgrain sprinkled in

product_name: Colonia Mirra Acqua di Parma
review_content: Best Coca-Cola scent ever.

product_name: Colonia Mirra Acqua di Parma
review_content:
@RogerM72
Mhyrr is a quite complicated scent and ADP is right to give it a try IMHO.
I agree that something is lacking in the parfume pyramid ... could be honey, or also a special tuberose-evocative amber I smell only on some of the parts of my skin after an hour.
I'll try to investigate !
A great frag nevertheless.

product_name: Colonia Mirra Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Acqua di Parma masters the blending of aromatic scents, and here they've done it again! In Mirra we have the fragrant and sweet myrrh mixed with aromatic nutmeg and neroli on a pleasant amber base. The myrrh notes came out relatively quickly after the initial citrus blast, and gradually became sweeter over the course of the dry down. Just like any other ADP scents all notes are harmoniously blended. No harsh edges.

The performance is at least 7 hours, however the projection can be a bit shy on cooler days.

I like it a lot, and would say this is a good summer myrrh perfume, which is not that easy to come by!

product_name: Arancia di Capri La Riserva Acqua di Parma
review_content:
This is literally a photorealistic smell of orange zest, but with a sense of depth that helps it linger a lot longer than the EDT. It almost has a thick creaminess to it. It doesn’t seem to last as long as the Fico La Riserva but I do think I become more nose blind.

I’ve really gotten into ADP lately. I think they are on par with LV when it comes to natural, fresh citrus scents.

Managed to pick up a 100ml bottle for £100 which was an absolute bargain.

product_name: Arancia di Capri La Riserva Acqua di Parma
review_content: Good scent, but hardly the best orange I've tried. The original has terrible performance but a great smell. Also best in class are 19-69 Capri, Guerlain Mandarino basilica and forte, and Lv Afternoon Swim. If I was to rank them I'd choose this 4th out of the five I've listed. Very good, but sacrifices that airy citrus, for a heavier base, as the person below me mentioned.

product_name: Arancia di Capri La Riserva Acqua di Parma
review_content: Blind bought this as I love the EDT so much. But, as is the usual case when “intensifying” a fragrance, it’s lost all its zing and freshness. The woods really weigh it down and I’m getting way more bitterness than the fresh orange juice of the EDT. Also quite disappointed with performance. I have the 180ml and fear this will last a very long time on my shelf.

product_name: Arancia di Capri La Riserva Acqua di Parma
review_content: I always enjoy orange-based fragrances (have not quite forgiven L'Occitane for discontinuing Feu d'Orange), and this one almost knocks it out of the park. The additional maceration gives it greater depth and the bigerade together with blood orange and petitgrain provide a very satisfying citrus kick, supported by aromatic herbs. Cannot say that I can identify the mineral notes, but presume they are adding something to the overall composition.

product_name: Arancia di Capri La Riserva Acqua di Parma
review_content: Super realistic citrus with Frederick malle uncut gem ambrettolide drydown, this is incredible along with the new fico di amalfi, great perfumery

product_name: Arancia di Capri La Riserva Acqua di Parma
review_content: best adp. Really fruity imo and lasts really long as well. You have to try this its soo damn good

product_name: Arancia di Capri La Riserva Acqua di Parma
review_content: This is really nice. The dry down is a beautiful balance of citrus, musk and chef's kiss of amber.

product_name: Arancia di Capri La Riserva Acqua di Parma
review_content: This still retains that fresh and natural smelling orange note like in the og, but the longevity has improved so much. I tried a couple fresh/sweet fragrances a couple days ago, including ones like god of fire, pacific chill, roja isola blu and elysium, and this held up against all in terms of longevity. When you pair that with how incredible it smells, this deserves high ratings, and I may pick this up sometime soon unless I go for Argos Neptune's trident instead (also very good and long lasting orange fragrance but with a prominent tea note).

product_name: Arancia di Capri La Riserva Acqua di Parma
review_content: Easily one of the best orange fragrances that smells natural. Very decent sillage / projection for a citrus. The citrus musk combo here is amazing, highly recommended

product_name: Arancia di Capri La Riserva Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I found this acqua di parma maybe 3 weeks ago, and was really surprised at how good it performs and lasts compared to the older acqua di parma fragrances. 4 hours after spraying this on, I was still enjoying this smells it had on offer, walking the streets of the city.

On initial spray It gives lots of citrus and fruitiness, its very light and settles quickly to a more masculine earthy/woody mineral scent with that blood orange citrus smell remaining in the background. Amazing summer fragrance in my opinion.

product_name: Arancia di Capri La Riserva Acqua di Parma
review_content: Smells great and performs much better than the original on my skin. Tried new on one hand and old on the other. Can’t smell the original while I can still pick up on the reserva pretty easily.

product_name: Arancia di Capri La Riserva Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Comparing my samples of Original and La Riserva side by side now.

The original is way more bright and fresh.

product_name: Arancia di Capri La Riserva Acqua di Parma
review_content: I’m a huge fan of FICO di amalfi and arancia di capri BUT this is without a doubt the best offering from the la riserva line. Juicy blood orange that absolutely sparkles in the high heat with salty mineral notes. Might be my new favorite from aqua di Parma. And don’t get me wrong the new fico di amalfi is still amazing I purchased that as well but something about this arancia di capri just does it for me as I live in Arizona and it’s so hot here. The fico di amalfi I say would be excellent for nights out during the summer as it is sweeter.

product_name: Arancia di Capri La Riserva Acqua di Parma
review_content: I have a sample and unfortunately, the durability of this scent is max 2h... I gave it to another person to try - exactly the same. I was very disappointed.

product_name: Arancia di Capri La Riserva Acqua di Parma
review_content: had the opportunity to sample Fico di Amalfi and Arancia di Capri La Reserva before launch, thanks to my best friend that bought Fico La Reserva at her last vacation travel to Miami, she gifted me two 5ml decants that the sales representative gave her. I had great expectations for this one I can say this is the one I liked the least, its way different from the original, even tho the additional note provide more deepness I guess for my skin didn’t work well. On paper smells beautiful, like grabbing an orange peel an rubbing it between your finger, fresh, slightly bitter with a creamy sweetness. On my skin reacted totally different, it gave me the olfactive experience that Dior Fahrenheit also has, like smelling grease/gasoline but less prominent and slightly sweeter, it’s the mix with citrus and leather that might cause it. Definitely a more complex fragrance, It has a great performance tho between 6-8 hrs, and has a good sillage. I recommend to try it first before buying because it might not work for your skin (like my case).

product_name: Colonia Leather Eau de Cologne Concentrée Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Yep! Discontinued.
And another one.
Ciao Bella!

product_name: Colonia Leather Eau de Cologne Concentrée Acqua di Parma
review_content: Fantastic fragrance! I guess if you are to own a leather fragrance, then it has to be done right. ADP do make good fragrances, and have maintained quality for many years now. I have collected a few Leather fragrances from various houses over the years, and thought perhaps it is time to let my 2018 Special Edition 180ml leather wrap go for the right deal and home ( Perfect for collectors ). PM if interested.

product_name: Colonia Leather Eau de Cologne Concentrée Acqua di Parma
review_content:
This is probably the most wearable leather fragrance I've owned. I've owned many all the classics like TL, OL etc. I will say I LOVE Ombre Leather Parfum. They give me the same vibe and energy.

This is a class take on leather very much down the TL route albeit smoother, rounded and softer. This is an EDC after all and lasts a good few hours. The citrus & woody notes in here are very nice and set it apart from its counterparts. This is versatile for a leather perfume, im 6 foot, solid build etc and love TL but honestly I think this is better.

This and OLP are the best leathers, ADPL for winter/fall and OLP for spring/winter. I think this could be worn in summer in thr evening in a specific situation it would be 🔥

Is this mind blowing? No
Is this groundbreaking? No
Is this a standout perfume? No

Then what is it? Well its just a really great smooth take on this leather DNA. I don't find it harsh, ashy, dirty etc its a crisp clean leather with a slight edge to it. Its classy and refined.

9/10 - Losing a point for versatility (Not a complete year round perfume)
10/10 - Leather DNA, this is what you want to wear to be noticed but not choke people out.

Bravo! This, Mirra & Essenza are incredible compositions!

product_name: Colonia Leather Eau de Cologne Concentrée Acqua di Parma
review_content:
One of the best leathers around, and one of the fragrances that got me into fragrances.

More rugged than Tuscan Leather, citrus notes are sharp but inviting in the dry-down, making it slightly friendlier for warmer wear. Pure masculine stuff, hope it never changes.

product_name: Colonia Leather Eau de Cologne Concentrée Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Another masterpeice by Francois Demachy who gave us the most elegant leather of all time; Dior Homme Parfum. ✨👑 (and just liked the beloved DHP, AdP Colonia Leather is also discontinued 🙄)

AdP Colonia Leather is slightly fresher and lighter than the EdP version. But make no mistake is this is still a smokey primal brooding dark leather where the Paraguayan Guaiac wood takes center stage and gives you that dark smokey aspect of a leather accord. They both share the exact scent profile 💯 The difference is just in the intensity of the notes. ✨

It's a true leather fragrance where the leather is always present throughout the fragrance's journey with you. The famous AdP citrus is also here to give it that elegant freshness, preparing you for a dark descent into the primal dark journey of the rugged bold leather accord. This is such a well-blended formulation! The cedar gives it that alpha masculine sharpness. 😎

This smells like you had to do some hard decisions in your head. It is a very serious fragrance, which is why it's leaning very formal. 🤵

A video review is also available on my YT ▶️

product_name: Colonia Leather Eau de Cologne Concentrée Acqua di Parma
review_content: Heavenly

product_name: Colonia Leather Eau de Cologne Concentrée Acqua di Parma
review_content:
The best leather perfume ever made
10/10

product_name: Colonia Leather Eau de Cologne Concentrée Acqua di Parma
review_content:
This thing is atomic strong and very masculine.
Smells like brand new leather not suede or dusty old leather, even with a shoe shine vibe.
Not subtle or velvety at all, two spays go a long way.

product_name: Colonia Leather Eau de Cologne Concentrée Acqua di Parma
review_content: The Best Leather perfume that I’ve got ,, 👍🏼👍🏼 nothing more to say just try it then u will got what I feel 😌😃

product_name: Colonia Leather Eau de Cologne Concentrée Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I own both this and Tuscan Leather.
While Tuscan Leather is the new, designer made leather jacket, Colonia Leather is the jacket that went through a few motorcycle crashes with cigars in its inner pocket.

Imagine this: You are at the Italian coast, starting the aperitivo. The girls order an aperol spritz and the boys a negroni. One guy doesn't want either, and orders a whisky and lights up a small cigar. Everyone looks at him weird. He doesn't care and does what he wants.

THIS is how he smells. As you could probably tell from the length of this review, I am very passionate about this fragrance (and Acqua di Parma as a whole). Perhaps I am biased because I am Italian, but there is nothing quite like ADP available. How they go about their perfumery is pure art, and modern designers could learn a lot from them.

To start: I don't think this smells like Tuscan Leather at all, in the same way that a retro leather jacket is very different from a modern one. This one is more masculine, more rough. It's the perfect combo between that classy Acqua di Parma citrus and the animalic notes from the leather, woods and smoke. Like a man riding a sports bike in a suit :)

I'm not saying that this is 'a better fragrance' than Tuscan Leather, but damn, there is just nothing like this on the market. Tuscan Leather has a few alternatives like Godolphin and that one from Rasasi (they are all worse than TL though), but there is not a single fragrance that captures that Italian masculinity like this one. Besides, it is not redundant to own them both. I reach more for Tuscan Leather when the setting is outside/colder and more for Colonia Leather in warmer settings.

Moreover, I do detect a slight difference between the old Colonia Leather and the new black bottle (I have a decant of the new stuff). The new version has a slightly more prominent raspberry note, but I only noticed the difference when I smelled them side by side, and it would be impossible to detect the difference in the air. I am sure it is caused by the fact my old, brown bottle is from 2018 so it has aged a bit, while the decant is from the newest bottle. It is not worth hunting old bottles, unless you connect sentimental values to it.

Lastly, the fact that people think this is "hard to wear" and "too smokey" makes me even love it more. This stuff is Italian confidence in a bottle. 10/10.

product_name: Colonia Leather Eau de Cologne Concentrée Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Beautiful fragrance.

For me I got 180ml for $190 AUD (off of a friend of a friend) which is incredible value, however I would still pay up to $400 for the size. This fragrance is a beast, lasts for ages and smells so unique. Strong, dark leather smell with a mix of oud and citruses. I blind bought this and I loved it, so I would say if you like leather and oud fragrances this one will be up your alley.

Would recomend picking this up if you can as im pretty sure these are limited release.

Smell 9/10
Longevity 8+ hours of projection

product_name: Colonia Leather Eau de Cologne Concentrée Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Now evaluating this fragrance with a decant of the "Leather EdP" version from 2019, which, according to my research, is exactly the same fragrance:

The leather note is incredible right from the opening; it is probably the strongest and most natural leather note I've ever smelled. This note is very animalic in its naturalism but not dirty like Kouros; it’s more reminiscent of well-tanned leather tools, sun-worn and rustic, rather than sweaty animals and other bodily odors.

From the opening, there is a quite smoky oud that brings similarities to the house's Oud & Spice and really consolidates for me that, contrary to what I previously thought, Acqua di Parma is not just about fresher, naturalistic, and minimalist (or barber-shop) fragrances, but also has some of the best dark and "niche" fragrances on the market.

product_name: Colonia Leather Eau de Cologne Concentrée Acqua di Parma
review_content: I've been buying this a good 10 years now and many other leather fragrances. if your in to leather you cant go wrong with this stuff brown bottle .... top 3 leather fragrances.......... acqua di parma leather, amouage reckless leather and tom ford tuscan leather 2007 2013... just a note on Tf tuscan leather.... the new stuff is crap

product_name: Colonia Leather Eau de Cologne Concentrée Acqua di Parma
review_content: Opens very animalic. Kind of shocked the senses. The fruit/citrus and floral notes are much more subdued to me. It's very leather forward. Once that animalic opening subsides, the very rich leather accord takes the spotlight. I wouldn't call it soft. Reminds me of the raw unfinished backing of leather than the more finished leather of Tom Ford's two fragrances. I used the word 'primal' in my Tuscan Leather review. It's much more appropriate with Colonia Leather by a long shot. You wear this, you are wearing unabashed leather. You ARE leather.

product_name: Colonia Leather Eau de Cologne Concentrée Acqua di Parma
review_content:
چرمی-گلی-سبز
در شروع خیلی سبز و اتو کشیده هست
اما در ادامه با ورود رز کمی نرم تر میشه
و دوست داشتنی تر
خیلی بهتر از توسکان لدر هست از هر نظر
****************************
scent:7.5/10
longevity:8/10
sillage:7/10
purchase value:3.5/10
********
overall:6.5/10

product_name: Colonia Leather Eau de Cologne Concentrée Acqua di Parma
review_content:
This is a widely well regarded and hyped leather fragrance. I've seen several YouTube videos where fragrance reviewers put this in their top leather fragrances. As a lover of leather, I had to grab it and see what it was about. Here's how it went;

Scent:
Opening is a shotgun blast of leather, with the orange, raspberry, and lemon hiding underneath. The leather note in this fragrance is very similar to the leather note in Tom Ford's Ombre Leather. In the dry down it's the same powerful leather, but the fruit notes have swapped places with the wood notes. I've also seen this compared to Tom Ford's Tuscan Leather, specifically in regards to the raspberry note. I've never smelled Tuscan Leather before though, so I can't give any opinion on that. But I can certainly understand when looking at the note breakdowns.

Performance:
Initial opening is very strong, easily fills a room. Sillage matches that intensity, leaving an easily noticeable scent trail. Certified nuclear. After a few hours, the projection was still around 3 feet and the scent trail was still prominent and easily noticeable. Even at about 6 hours I was still getting some projection and a modest scent trail. Altogether the scent lasted on my skin over 12 hours, making it certified eternal. However, when I took a shower about 24 hours later the water reactivated the scent and made the whole shower smell like leather. That's some performance.

When to wear:
This is a leather bomb, through and through. But I feel the other notes that accompany the leather lend it enough versatility to be suitable all year long, day or night. You could even pull this off at this office, just go LIGHT on the sprays.

Blind buy:
If you like leather fragrances this is definitely blind buy worthy. The leather note is SUPER strong, so that may turn some people off, but there's nothing particularly "funky" about it. The performance is stellar, so you won't be disappointed.

Final verdict:
This took a top 5 spot from Carolina Herrera's CH Men Prive as my favorite leather fragrance. I've smelled Ombre Leather before and I LOVE it. It is/was my favorite leather fragrance. I don't have it in my collection yet, but I think even Ombre Leather would have a tough battle beating Colonia Leather for my favorite leather fragrance. It's just THAT good. It's worth noting that Colonia Leather is discontinued, but the general consensus within the community is that Acqua Di Parma's Leather EDP is the same juice in a different bottle. I've smelled both and I can confirm that is the case. Bottom line; get this fragrance if you like leather fragrances. If you can't find Colonia Leather, go for Leather EDP.

Scent: 10/10
Longevity: 10/10
Sillage: 10/10

product_name: Colonia Leather Eau de Cologne Concentrée Acqua di Parma
review_content: Nuclear leather. One spray and you’ve over sprayed. Do yourself a favor and just get a decant. This is a very distinct, deep leather. Makes Red Tobacco seem subtle. Very challenging wear.

product_name: Colonia Leather Eau de Cologne Concentrée Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I'm looking to sell a 100 ml sealed bottle of this perfume.
Email me at jordantzouvelis13@gmail.com for more information.

product_name: Colonia Leather Eau de Cologne Concentrée Acqua di Parma
review_content: This is an extremely elegant cologne that I wear for special occasions. The fragrance is very rich. It last a long time. It feels more night , winter and autumn to me. But I've worn it in the summer. It fits me well.

product_name: Colonia Leather Eau de Cologne Concentrée Acqua di Parma
review_content: Very nice leather fragrance my favourite on the market at the moment. It smells clean classy expensive and it still manages somehow to keep the animalistic side of the leather. If you are a refined bad boy this is the best leather scent. Ombre Leather is the scent of a cowboy that comes out from the barnyard compared to this one. so it is up to u what a bad boy means. is it the ombre leather the bad boy the average joe from Hollywood movies that lives at the county side and while at home is working in the barnyard beats his wife and kids and goes to pub to get drunk and play pool or is it the refined mafia type of guy. this is how tuscan leather should have smelled like but it failed to do so. You cannot teach Italians how their leather smells like

product_name: Colonia Leather Eau de Cologne Concentrée Acqua di Parma
review_content:
My Thanksgiving fragrance.
The great Colonia Leather by Acqua di Parma.

The leather, rose, cedar, Paraguayan petitgrain, Brazilian orange, a touch of that raspberry and even the honeysuckle is a tad noticeable but you mainly get the most mature smoke and leather in class. This smells like an aged man wearing a fuzzy sports coat at the airport after he finished eating a cigarette.

This works as a perfect Autumn in tropical weather fragrance but I think it can be pulled off generally in both chilly and warm weather.

I've always said a good fragrance paired with a good meal enhances the dining experience.

So after devouring all the couscous, lentil-stuffed mushrooms, mac, cranberry salads, sweet plantains, cornbread, pumpkin pie or whatever it is everyone eats, I'm glad to have this scent tag along with me on the back of my neck.

product_name: Colonia Leather Eau de Cologne Concentrée Acqua di Parma
review_content: Is the special edition the same formula as the original or is it like the newer parfum?

product_name: Colonia Leather Eau de Cologne Concentrée Acqua di Parma
review_content: Art in a bottle. It's created for someone who doesn't need to work anymore and the only thing left to do is to explore a hedonistic approach to life. Remember Kubrick's EYES WIDE SHUT? if this movie had a smell..

product_name: Colonia Leather Eau de Cologne Concentrée Acqua di Parma
review_content: Someone chewed grape bubblegum, but not for very long, then spat it out into a full ashtray. Genuinely great.

product_name: Colonia Leather Eau de Cologne Concentrée Acqua di Parma
review_content: Imagine if TF Tuscan Leather had a child with 1988 Dior Fahrenheit - and that child is now a distinguished 50 yo former rocker turned high-class antique dealer.

product_name: Colonia Leather Eau de Cologne Concentrée Acqua di Parma
review_content: Leather, but, to my nose, an older, dry, smokey, incense-ash leather. Masculine. Extra potent (a little goes a long ways) and extra long-lasting (a little lasts all day). I am using it very minimally in some layering where the addition of a leather note might be apt.

product_name: Colonia Leather Eau de Cologne Concentrée Acqua di Parma
review_content: Amazing, , just class. For me it is the best winter scent it last on me 4ever, i love it

product_name: Colonia Leather Eau de Cologne Concentrée Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I just bought one of 180 ml but i didn't like it. Still i wanted to give her a chance and i wore today for work and to be honest can't stand it. To me it smells like gasoline or something... I want to sell it.. If somebody wants it, let me know.
Mine is the 2014 Special Edition with the leather wrapped bottle and cylindrical box.

product_name: Colonia Leather Eau de Cologne Concentrée Acqua di Parma
review_content: pablo escobar perfume. cocaina

product_name: Colonia Leather Eau de Cologne Concentrée Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Two words: Perfectly Blended !

This perfume does not get enough love in the community.
The fresh DNA of ADP perfectly blended with a smooth leather.
From the nose that made us master pieces like Dior homme intense and Sauvage, the master perfumer Francois Demachy.

It might be most suitable for winter, but IMO you can rock this easily on fall or even summer nights.

Scent: 9.5/10
Longevity: 8/10
Sillage: 7.5/10

product_name: Colonia Leather Eau de Cologne Concentrée Acqua di Parma
review_content:
