This is a very nice leather. I like it more than TL because it is definitely more wearable. Although I have heard people comment on this being a year round scent I would just stick to fall/winter/ and spring nights. The leather is very dominant as I feel a lot get citrus dominance in the opening. All around a nice buy for me and I will definitely be using this guy for a long time.
Projection 4-5 hours
Longevity 10+
Scent 8.5

This fragrance I give a 9/10.

product_name: Colonia Leather Eau de Cologne Concentrée Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Tom Ford's Tuscan Leather is one of my favorite scents. It is listed as a unisex fragrance, but personally I find it very masculine. Colonia Leather, to me, is like a unisex Tuscan Leather. It has that rich and pure leather smell that Tuscan Leather has, but the mandarin and rose really add a softness that I think makes this more appealing to more people, where Tuscan Leather seems more like a love it or hate it kind of fragrance. It also gives it a more unisex touch. I love this scent.

Also, I didn't think I could wear a rich leather scent on a hot day, but this worked beautifully. The citrus adds a freshness to it that also makes it kind of a more versatile Tuscan Leather.

product_name: Colonia Leather Eau de Cologne Concentrée Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I decided to try Acqua de Parma leather....this juice is UNBELIEVABLY all leather. I haven't come across a frag where leather is as realistic as this one is. After spraying it on my skin I feel like I was in stable all day with that deep animalistic quality all over me. The woodsy base of guaiac gives this juice depth which is untouchable making it ABSOLUTELY SEXY.
Longevity and Silage is excellent lasting over 8hrs...you can pick up the aroma about 2ft away.
Finally thoughts,
I've tried several different version of leather frag's. The top two which I enjoy is either Tom Ford or Acqua de Parma leather. If you want a real attractive leathery blend this juice is worth it. Perfect during the fall/winter months and going into early spring. Adjective which describes this fragrance is Sexy, Sophisticated, Elegant and Masterpiece. 9.5/10.....I recommend this juice without a doubt!

product_name: Colonia Leather Eau de Cologne Concentrée Acqua di Parma
review_content: A potent leather scent with just a hint of that Acqua di Parma citrus DNA working in the background. I like it, especially during cold weather, but I'm not into leather scents enough to buy a full bottle. Lasts 12+ hours on my skin.

product_name: Colonia Leather Eau de Cologne Concentrée Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Eau de Cologne Concentree? EDT? Or maybe lasting power of a parfum but projection and silliage of a cologne?
Marketing ploy? yeah probably the latter.
Anyways the scent.
Since I've smelt and worn TL I've been on a quest to find a similar scent without the raspberry note of TL, it ruins it for me. My wife said it best about TL "It's like I went out for the night with a man and got so hammered that I came home with a woman"
So this was next on my list. It is very nice, it's the exact same leather as TL but fresher and not so heavy. This can be worn year round easily. But as this dries down something is still unsettling to me. It might be the rose, something is giving me a "first Aid Kit" type of smell in there.
Shit.
While I like this better than TL for sure, it's still not my luxury leather scent. On to Montale aoud leather next.
Fingers crossed.

Longevity is about 6 to 7
projection is about 7 too
and scent is an 8

product_name: Colonia Leather Eau de Cologne Concentrée Acqua di Parma
review_content: WOW.i blind purchased this as I was after a good leather and wood fragrance.im glad I purchased it.its just an explosion of nice fragrances and it's one of those Purfumes that you can smell every note.the smell reminds me of a 1960's Italian hotel room.for a cologne it last's a very long time and projection was also surprisingly good for a cologne.if your into leather and wood fragrence's don't pass this up.

product_name: Colonia Leather Eau de Cologne Concentrée Acqua di Parma
review_content: The very best leather ı have ever smell it is little bit expensive but trust me it is amazing ı thınk acqua di parma luxery parfums like oud and leather are very best science

product_name: Colonia Leather Eau de Cologne Concentrée Acqua di Parma
review_content:
The first couple of hours all I get is a not-very-masculine sweet floral, but when it's properly dry the leather and wood come through and this becomes positively intoxicating. As others have suggested, if you don't like this at the first sniff: stay with it! It's lovely. I bought this together with the AdP Colonia Oud, which will be my fragrance for the remainder of the winter, but I'll return to Leather in the springtime. Looking forward to it!

Edit: I don't know what the actual concentration of fragrance oils is, but I think the "eau de cologne" label, even with the "concentree" designation, is a bit of a misnomer. This is powerful stuff, and in my experience it lasts forever.

product_name: Colonia Leather Eau de Cologne Concentrée Acqua di Parma
review_content:
The notes that Fragrantica mentioned aren't really all the notes in this fragrance.
I do own a tester bottle and notes are listed behind of the bottle. Let me give everybody the actual note breakdown in this fragrance.

Fragrance Family: Aromatic Leathery

Top Note: Brazil Orange Oil, Lemon from Sicily, Raspberry Accord

Heart Note: Hungry Red Thyme Oil, Honeysuckle Accord, Paraguay Petitgrain Oil, Rose Accord.

Base Note: Leather Accord, Morocco Atlas Cedarwood Oil, Paraguay Guaiac Oil.

My honest review:
This is very nice fragrance first of all. Opens up with some citrus, sweet citrus that almost gives you fruity feeling. Leather opens up at the first spray but It gave me a suede scent feeling and I noticed that it is because of the citrus. Citrus made it feel like suede. After 10 minutes, citrus gone away and leather became more dirty as I like. This fragrance carries Raspberries as the Tuscan Leather does but I can feel the raspberry more in this one comparing the Tuscan Leather. Following overs, it doesn't chance alot and keeps this fruity leather for 10 hours. Longevity is great but projection is bad, After 2 hours it gets close to skin. But this factor makes this fragrance more versatile. Dark fragrances like this can not be worn all the time but because of it is close to skin, it is great for every time wear.

Comparing to Tuscan leather and there are many more fragrances that is similar to it. They can be compared by longevity and projection maybe even price point. This is a good one at the price point of $220 retail. The quality you get is almost the same as Tuscan Leather. You spent more for TL and get 50ml comparing to here 100ml.

This is my opinion after all. This is a buy for me. All the way...

product_name: Colonia Leather Eau de Cologne Concentrée Acqua di Parma
review_content: To me it is very surprising that nobody mentioned a very pronounced honey note.

product_name: Colonia Leather Eau de Cologne Concentrée Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Colonia Leather - Chic Fresh leather

Having tried their colonia oud and loved it, I had good expectations from colonia leather. And Acqua di Parma surely did not disappoint.

What I love about this frag is that they've combined the elegance of the colonia dna with the ruggedness of leather.
This is the sort of leather I like - both fresh and dark, with an overall softness yet being full bodied in its nature.
It is utterly chic and smooth in it's approach and represents the class of ADP.

Fresh Citrus-y opening with a floral leather behind it. Screams quality from the first sniff. It feels quite airy and transparent at first, which then becomes a little heavier with the leather creeping up. It feels like a wet fresh leather, with some woody undertone - the overall result is truly splendid. The elegant leather then takes centre-stage and the little florals linger on in the background.. this is what remains till the end.

If you ask me, I love it's overall structure.. neither too harsh nor too soft, very sophisticated and alluring in it's demeanour. I also get reminded of the core of colonia intensa (their colonia ones) which is what supports the overall notes.

Great performance, around 10 hours with 3 sprays.. a nice scent bubble around you without being too heavy. This isn't as beastly as the colonia oud, but it packs a good punch in itself. In terms of versatility, one can wear this all year round, preferably so during spring and autumn.

Marvelous creation ADP! Can't wait for the next release in this series.

product_name: Colonia Leather Eau de Cologne Concentrée Acqua di Parma
review_content:
In the same vein of the Oud, Acqua di Parma has created a fresh leather. While it might sound unusual pairing leather with citruses, the result is very nice.

In the opening I get a minty accord that goes with the citruses. The leather is there, shy at the first spray, but becoming stronger and stronger by the minute, and the overall feeling is of an airy and bright leather. Like how they did with the oud, the leather is clean, not stinky. The end of the fragrance brings the woods to the surface and, in the AdP style, this is another classy gentleman's colonia.

9/10

product_name: Colonia Leather Eau de Cologne Concentrée Acqua di Parma
review_content: Per me è abbastanza strano non resistere all'acquisto di un commerciale, ma stamattina ho ceduto....e sono soddisfatto mi piace come cuir pleine fleur di Heeley e mi ricorda parfum d'habit di MPeG....unica cosa migliorabile il prezzo, non proprio popolare.

product_name: Colonia Leather Eau de Cologne Concentrée Acqua di Parma
review_content: In my opinion this scent are the most intersting introduced in 2014.Acqua di parma & Guerlain produced all this years high quality fragrances.I love this scent for winter cold days.

product_name: Colonia Leather Eau de Cologne Concentrée Acqua di Parma
review_content: Leather true, aged! A very unique composition where the the leather is the main piece having background the guaiac wood and citrus sweetened by a soft rose. No "sharp edges", "round", well balanced, elegant and serious. So it ADP is one of my favorite houses!

product_name: Colonia Leather Eau de Cologne Concentrée Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Wou wou great fragrance From ACqua di Parma
Scent 10/10
Longevity 10/10
Projection 10/10
Versatility 10/10 all year around not prob at all
Overall 10/10

Nov
15
2014

product_name: Colonia Artist Edition by Clym Evernden Acqua di Parma
review_content: I like this one over the original as more ambery “rosey” and slightly denser and elegant though the changes not exceeding 5% imo “ no major changes”, it’s like tuning the notes differently yet reserving the original scent with a modern twist, if you like the original this one would be a very good choice and also perform a bit more. I have the bottle with like flags stickers.

product_name: Peonia Nobile Hair Mist Acqua di Parma
review_content: Absolutely gorgeous peonies, roses and pink pepper, with a fruity hint. I purchased it from Shoppers, for $64 plus tax for 50ml. As a scent, it's simply beautiful. I thought it would be alcohol free, since it's a hair mist, but it has alcohol. Very disappointing. Silage and lasting power are poor. So basically thumbs up for the beauty of the scent, thumbs down for the execution. It is the first hair mist perfume that I buy and while I don't regret buying it, I cannot whole heartedly recommend it.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Magnolia Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content: Fell in love with the scent; citrus forward with some really elegant floral notes behind. However I find that this just does not last on my skin. It doesn’t seem to be a common problem amongst others so i’d say don’t let this deter you, but for me the performance is honestly trash. Sillage becomes intimate very very quickly and for the price it just doesn’t feel worth it.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Magnolia Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content:
The review is for the body cream.
It is generously scented with the composition of Magnolia Nobile. It also has super small rainbowy shining particles. I rubbed the cream into a leather jacket and it is now scintillant. Easily can be worn alone during the day and to work. It gives off the intense scent of magnolia with its purity and citrus aspects that are enhanced with lemon, tartness of citron and slight bitterness from bergamot. The entire room is scented by me wearing the cream.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Magnolia Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content: By the notes, this should big a big white floral. It's more of a delicate white floral. It's very fresh with delightful citrus - oh, how I miss that lemon note of yore! - and then such a delightful blend of flowers, like the world's most beautiful small bridal bouquet. I like big white florals in the summertime, for those hot summer nights, with the powerful jasmine and tuberose, scents like the great Fracas. But this is perfect for late spring, early summer . . . an ideal June wedding fragrance. And best of all, it lasts and lasts! I'm delighted. Signature seasonal fragrance worthy.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Magnolia Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Fragrantica says this resembles Eau de Magnolia, but in truth, smelling this feels much like looking at a photograph of something you once loved—recognizable, and equally distant. To my nose, the citrus here is clearer and more upfront, but it sorta lacks that kinetic, almost windswept quality which is precisely what makes Malle’s feel so alive.

And the magnolia: it's silky, smooth, a little milky, and admittedly pretty. But pretty in the way a quiet, careful kind of portrait, one that never dares to unfold beyond safe, clean lines, is—pretty indeed. But not yet beautiful. Here, you aren't appreciating at the type of magnolia which catches fluid beams of sunlight in its buttery petals, not the type with fresh air moving through its crisp yet lush green leaves. Rather. You're simply observing one feels like it’s been plucked and resin-coated for display, glossy but not creamy, preserved in its aesthetics but motionless beyond the surface.

It’s nice. Completely inoffensive, and a much better alternative to the same house's Magnolia Infinita. Look for magnolia in Nobile, and it'll manage you a decently crafted one at the very least. But hold a bloom with true purity, true presence, and you'll find yourself struggling to settle for something that only mimics it.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Magnolia Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content: This leans unisex with a slight feminine touch on me. I’d describe it as 60% aromatic/citrus and 40% magnolia. I’ll likely give it another try when the weather warms up—it’s currently subzero where I live, which might not be the best setting for it.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Magnolia Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content: This is like a fairy tale. Picture a mist of sparkling lemon floating around a mythical castle. A surrounding moat of Venetian cream custard is where the fairies set sail in miniature boats of woven vetiver or a single rose petal, whipping the custard into a frenzy with their tiny vanilla bean oars. Parasols with sandalwood ribs open, so onlookers from the turrets can take flight on the voluptuous winds...I'm in love with this scent. It's a bright & tangy lemon custard concoction that isn't exactly a gourmand, and has quite good performance for the citrus which stays around during the drydown.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Magnolia Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I’m a major fan of this perfume. A very bright and joyful citrusy floral that maintains elegance and refinement. Good performance as well, and you can find it for a decent price.

I was at the mall today and smelled Clinique Happy (the original) and am surprised to say the dry down is very similar to Magnolia Nobile. The latter I think is more citrusy though and smells higher quality.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Magnolia Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content: Lots of lemon on top, then a creamy, buttery magnolia. This is followed by a faint, clean floral vanilla in the far dry down but not a candied vanilla, more dry & maternal. My first Acqua di Parma and the quality is noticeably impeccable. I'm reaching for this everyday. Ironically, since my perfume collecting began, I have continually been searching for a signature fragrance and surprisingly, Magnolia Nobile just might be it. Performance during summer in the south, is the perfect amount of sillage/longevity for me. I'm curious how this will perform come fall/winter.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Magnolia Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content: I just don't think aquatic notes are for me

product_name: Acqua di Parma Magnolia Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Citrus Cologne-Like & Creamy-Waxy Magnolia...

First Impression: now this would be the type of magnolia scent I would expect from Acqua di Parma - citrus-y magnoiia with a strong cologne vibe. Opens with a bright & sunny citrus burst featuring citron, but already the white floral tones are coming through with a cologne/perfume-y vein running through. The magnolia here has a waxiness that falls short of marshmallow or bubblegum, and leans more to Sunlight bar-soap mixed with perfume (it's also more faint than I would have liked, but this might be improved with a stored/aged full bottle). Earthy & woody tones in the base serve as anchor points for the bright bouquet. The citrus if very forward here, and tilts the composition to a citrus-cologne-tinged-with-magnolia, more than a magnolia-tinged-with-citrus, although this spin fits the Acqua di Parma branding. I just have a tester but the performance is slightly above average for a citrus-floral, and it's a gorgeous citrus-cologne & magnolia scent. This may not have been the magnolia I thought I was looking for but it's become a favourite, and for what it is, it's a love for me. Enjoy!

Contrast to Splendida Magnolia Sensuel Bvlgari:
This is brighter and more citrus-cologne forward than Splendida Magnolia Sensuel Bvlgari, although they've been compared and have a similar vibe of citrus-magnolia, going through similar gyrations, with some patchouli in the base.

Update: I've come back to this one and it keeps growing on me... so much that it's probably my favourite magnolia right now... creamier & fluffier than my first impression, with a bit of sparkle in the citrus top notes. Totally addictive.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Magnolia Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content: very citrus-heavy with an undertone of floral; i'm not really getting any vanilla. it's definitely quite fresh but also a very standard scent; i feel like i've smelt it before in other perfumes. although i enjoy it enough to think it definitely smells good, i don't think it's particularly sophisticated or complex in its DNA. it's somewhat similar to elizabeth arden's green tea; both are a bit soapy. i can see this being a beautiful summer beach scent or even a post-shower bedtime scent. i'm not sure if i would repurchase and it's not worth the price for me personally, but it does smell like something a rich woman would wear; i bet it's a compliment-getter for others

product_name: Acqua di Parma Magnolia Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content: This is the most photorealistic southern magnolia perfume I've ever smelled. I live in Atlanta, GA and every summer, the humid air is laden with the ethereal sweet citrusy scent of these giant waxy magnolias. It is one of my favorite parts of summer in the south. I've tested so many magnolia scents and nothing else comes close. After going on a binge of trying 10+ "magnolia" perfumes, I blind bought this one. It was love at first sniff. I was immediately transported to sunny summer days under the shade of a giant magnolia tree enveloped in the nostalgic scent. It is a dead ringer to my nose. If you're looking for a true southern white magnolia, this is her!

product_name: Acqua di Parma Magnolia Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content: I really want to love this but it smells similar to a furniture polish my mum used to use. Similar to issey miyake eau and magnolia.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Magnolia Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Magnolia Nobile is another excellent floral scent from Acqua Di Parma. I was very taken with Rosa Nobile, and can appreciate Peonia Nobile, despite it not being my thing. Magnolia Nobile is, predictably, magnolia-dominant. This creamy, sweet-but-fresh flower strikes a lovely balance between light and lush, but is too often relegated to the background. Here, it is firmly centre-stage, but complemented to perfection by other well-chosen notes.

MN opens with magnolia, initially slightly aquatic. There is a lovely lemon note up top, complementing it to perfection. In this way, the freshness of the magnolia flower is showcased initially.

As it develops, the floral heart emerges, with the other notes serving to complement the magnolia. Powdery, clean jasmine and soft, dewy rosewater-like rose are evident alongside the increasingly lush, creamy magnolia. I don't get any tuberose. Some patchouli adds a little earthiness, predictable but pleasant.

There is a soft woodiness to the drydown thanks to the dry vetiver note. A hint of powdery vanilla adds subtle sweetness to the tail end of this scent, and it becomes sweetly musky as it fades to a skin scent, remaining transparent. Sillage is moderate and longevity is long-lasting.

A fresh, citrus-led floral with just the right amount of sweetness, MN is an elegant, feminine spring/summer scent. Unremarkable on the surface, it is beautifully composed magnolia-centred floral made with good-quality ingredients. Effortlessly elegant and an easy reach on warm days, this is a cut above the myriad safe fresh floral designer offerings on the market. 4/5.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Magnolia Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content: Makes me feel like I’m in some soapy bubble bath with a glass of sweet white wine or champagne. I smell more of the floral than citrus in this.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Magnolia Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content: Very feminine, very opulent, very elegant. This is my second favorite among those 3 sisters. My first favorite is Peonia Nobile.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Magnolia Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Undoubtedly a beautiful scent on my vegetarian skin. A citrus opening but with plenty of magnolia as well. It rings like a beautiful olfactory bell. Bright, vivacious and very classy. A shame about the slight chemical like backdrop.
There is something very Annick Goutal about this lovely. Expensive and very Continental.
Well blended but there is not much depth to it.
One to wear on days when you want to feel special. Your best outfit on.
It's sad that it doesn't last long but not that surprising.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Magnolia Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content:
As another reviewer has noted, this reminds me of 5th AVenue, only prettier and more about magnolia than lily of the valley. It has a lemon-magnolia opening and then a perfume-y-white floral theme. The perfume-y bit seems to me lovely but less desirable than my ultra favorite in this category: Jessica McClintock! If Magnolia Nobile is a soliflore with other flowers in the base, J. M. is her younger, less serious sister who is not a soliflore! I like 5th Avenue, but it goes in a soured lily direction on me. Jessica Mcclintock does not. She is stunning, as is Magnolia Nobile. Nobile's take on Magnolia immediately strikes me as a mature white floral which is also classic. If I were to compare it to JM, it seems older. Both are classics, however, and both appeal to those who like 'perfume that IS perfume'.

Not recommended as a blind buy but a true delight to sample. <3

product_name: Acqua di Parma Magnolia Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content: Magnolia Nobile is very, very citrus heavy. So much so that it makes my nose turn up and my eyes water. Way to lemony, it has a Joy dish soap smell that I just can't get past. If I wore this perfume, I would swear I was washing dishes. To citrus/soap heavy for me.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Magnolia Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content: So so pretty! The citrus floral opening is addictive and fresh, and then the jasmine + magnolia stays around. I've sampled quite a few citrusy floral this month and this gotta be among the top!

product_name: Acqua di Parma Magnolia Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content: Love love this perfume! The magnolia note of this is particularly strong which is amazing. You first get hit with notes of citrus and bergamot, after it dries down you get sort of a milky, musky magnolia that kicks in. The longevity is not bad too, it lasts about 6 hours for me and I have gotten compliments on it! I think this would be a wonderful wedding perfume.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Magnolia Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content: sour

product_name: Acqua di Parma Magnolia Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content: I have a full bottle for sale in the US. Please PM me if you are interested.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Magnolia Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Extremely pretty ultra feminine perfume. I can see a bride wearing it on her wedding day. It is spring in a bottle.
It makes me think of EA 5Th avenue, only better

product_name: Acqua di Parma Magnolia Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Easily becoming a big love. I wish I pulled this out more during the high heat of mid summer but I was put off by how feminine this leans as I reach for more unisex offerings. I can see it being a bright song for crisper autumn days however.

The longevity and sillage work appropriately to present the charm of this perfume, not too beast mode but always present. It’s sweet and vivacious, it’s classy but warm. It’s mellow and yellow, baby

product_name: Acqua di Parma Magnolia Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Quite nice, yet slightly too sweet, rather too soapy, and much too expensive.

Update: Well, I spoke too fast, as I find myself spraying this every time I pass by a duty free. Now I don't like fruity florals, but I have accepted that the nose works in mysterious ways, and I think my nose considers this to be a fruity floral done right.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Magnolia Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content: I get the citrus in the first few minutes before Magnolia Nobile turns into paint thinner on my skin. I think the paint thinner phase is supposed to be "airy green floral" with the florals and remaining citrus in the heart. Magnolia Nobile is not the first fragrance that my skin has turned what should be a beautiful accord into household chemicals. Thankfully, after an hour of paint thinner, the scent turns into a pretty peppered woody skin scent with enough vanilla to smooth the edges. Worth the experiment with a sample - if only for the dry down.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Magnolia Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content: Fabulous fragrance that evokes clear and fresh spring atmospheres, the sumptuousness of magnolia, the undisputed queen of this very feminine blend. The opening citrus notes harmonize beautifully with tuberose, jasmine and rose. The bottom becomes warm, enveloping, reassuring. Extraordinary fragrance.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Magnolia Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content: Citrus + white floral with some soapy undertone. Smells clean, non-offending but lacks character.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Magnolia Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content: Wonderful scent. very flowery I'm so pleased

product_name: Acqua di Parma Magnolia Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content: This is a very clean smelling floral, almost soapy. It starts off with strong citrus top notes, but dries to a lovely floral which is surprising tenacious for this brand. Very feminine, very inoffensive, great for spring because it is so fresh and playful. Nothing not to like.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Magnolia Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content: Mississippi is my home state. Our state flower and tree is the Magnolia, and they're everywhere there. Growing up, I loved to deeply inhale the delicious scent of the blossoms. While this fragrance doesn't exactly smell like those magnolias, it is a beautiful floral fragrance that starts out with a refreshing burst of citrus. I got it just in time for the beginning of spring.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Magnolia Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content: Beautiful, ladylike citrus and magnolia

product_name: Acqua di Parma Magnolia Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content: Really loved it when I sprayed it on a paper. However on my body, after the fruity note, the floral notes don't seem to blend well on my body. It somehow became a confusing mix of floral notes that didnt smell pleasant. I guess it's because of my body chemistry. If it smell on my body like how I smell it on a paper, I would get a bottle.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Magnolia Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content: A fantastic blend of fresh citrus and deep, luxurious magnolia. There is some depth to this fragrance. Almost like a massage oil used in fancy spas.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Magnolia Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content: Today is my first day of wearing this. I am very pleasantly surprised. I've been looking for a good magnolia that includes a bit of lemon. There are lots of magnolias throughout the world, (note the number of pink blossoms in the photos) but the one I grew up with is the huge, creamy white blossom with a hint of lemon at the center. It's been very elusive as a perfume. Magnolia Nobile is very close. I love that it opens with an array of citrus notes. I wish the middle notes were stronger on magnolia, but the floral blend is pleasing, nonetheless. I have to admit I have resprayed twice today before I fully allowed the base notes to develop, so I can't really speak to the transition. I hesitated to wear this today because it's very cold outside. I shouldn't have worried. This is a great cold weather perfume. I can see it turning into a year-round favorite.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Magnolia Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content: This is nice, but a bit too proper and composed for my personal preferences. It has a particular rich person out for the day doing nothing in particular kind of vibe, but not in a fun or carefree way. I do like the way this has blended floral and citrus, it has an interesting progression that oscillates between citrusy and flowery and overall it hits perfectly in between citrus versus floral typing in a very nice way. I think you could wear this comfortably going out with your coworkers or extended relatives and be sure to make a good impression and not offend anyone’s scent preferences. But it’s for sure not something I would wear on a date.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Magnolia Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content: Nice blend between citrus and magnolia. Although this is feminine, as a guy i have no issue using it. The sillage and longevity are pretty good, surpassing other aqua di parma cologne style fragrances.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Magnolia Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content:
A lovely, nice, feminine frag from Acqua di Parma. I am a fan of the house.
It is an elegant scent, very feminine (very different from Iris Nobile!)
Starts off citrusy & fresh - very pleasant, to discover a warm heart of Jamsine and magnolia - a note that i don't particularly love but here it is not too overpowering.

The best in this scent is the creamy/woody drydown, very cozy, very feminine.
A perfect, classy scent for fall-winter.
I wish it had a tad more of staying power, though, seen the price they sell it (and it never goes on sale).
Absolutely worth testing!

product_name: Acqua di Parma Magnolia Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content: This screams ELEGANCE and feminine energy. I imagine a beautiful girl or woman staying at a high end resort in Italy wearing a gorgeous linen dress carrying an hermes picnic basket handbag. It smells like the perfect mix of florals with just a dash of citrus and can work day or at a beautiful ball. The yellow juice makes me think of liquid sunshine and works very well with the classic packaging and scent. Longevity is great, lasts well over 7+ hours on me. Try to buy it on sale though, quite expensive.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Magnolia Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content: Timeless elegance in a bottle – the zesty opening settles into a velvety floral-vanilla and everything is so so mellow. The magnolia flower is perfectly complemented by citron whereas jasmine and tuberose enhance the floralcy of the composition. The result is a magnificent fragrance that never fails to garner compliments.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Magnolia Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content:
At first, it is a fresh and floral feminine scent, full of magnolia and citruses. As time goes on, I can smell the tuberose, vetiver, and hints of vanilla. It’s such a pleasant smell for anyone who’s a fan of floral scents, but beware, at first it is strong and I, as someone who is not huge on flowery smells, thought it was overpowering.

The sillage at first is fairly moderate, and it smells strong. The longevity is of about 6 hours. The value tho, is not that great. It’s overpriced. 150 USD for 50 ml? That’s too much, even if it smells good, as after 3 hours, the sillage is fairly intimate.

Overall, I’ll rate it a good 7/10, tho it’d be higher if it wasn’t so expensive.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Magnolia Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content: I have been obsessed with magnolias this summer for some reason. Whenever I can reach a blossom, I have to inhale it—the sweet white floral with a fruity edge. This perfume has been a treat because it feels so realistic to me. I can bring that essence with me all day. And this is one of the longest lasting florals I’ve ever had!

product_name: Acqua di Parma Magnolia Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Elegant and feminine.
Creamy floral, slightly sweet,
and feels very soft and smooth.

At first, I didn't like it that much because it seemed not distinctive. I felt like I have smelled it before. But within it's simplicity, there is elegance. I imagine golden sparkles, sweet, and creamy florals - not too transparent and not too opaque, it's very well balanced. It gives the impression of very poised and reserved woman.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Magnolia Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content: This is so, so good. Smells like a fresh summerbreeze, coming from the Amalfi coast. Really feminine. Am a big fan of fresh and fruity florals that make me feel really 'clean'.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Magnolia Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content:
My fragrance journey has started late in life, and after years of wearing D&G The One almost exclusively, I've started changing it up. The idea of mimosa and citrus was very appealing, and the rave reviews here made me choose this as one of my first experiments.

Let's just say that I don't get it. Maybe I got a bad bottle? It smelled like straight chemicals on the first spray, very biting and sharp. Then it was pure raving citrus, no florals, and after about an hour, no smell at all. On the second try it was much the same, and still no florals to speak of. Today is my third try, and it was less chemically, but still nearly pure citrus, and almost completely faded by the time I made it to my desk downstairs.

I'm shocked, and I'm going to have to try a tester somewhere now that I can go out again because my experience with this doesn't NOT match up with any of the reviews here.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Magnolia Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content:
No breaking in needed, great from the first sniff. A woody vibe to me, along with the magnolia and citrus. Close to the skin after awhile, but beautiful throughout.
Subscription sample. This one is pricey, I'll enjoy it for now, not sure yet if a full bottle will be in my future.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Magnolia Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content:
After finishing a sample of this and then really missing it once I'd used it up I ended up buying a bottle, this is the second time in 2 years that I've had a real craving for a scent like that so this really did make an impression on me.

Magnolia Nobile is a happy scent, its sophisticated and grown up without feeling heavy, stuffy/mature and without feeling immature at the same time. The opening is citrussy and bright with citron, bergamot and lemon popping out initally before starting to settle down to a citrussy magnolia musk, I can detect some patchouli for the first 30 minutes which then subsides, a wonderful vanilla/sandalwood combination is also present in the background which adds some creaminess to the drydown and takes away some of the sharpness from the citrus notes.

This really puts a smile on my face whenever I spray it on, it reminds me of a strong boss lady, but shes kind, caring and happy but at the same time when she means business, she MEANS business and will not suffer fools gladly, so whilst this is a happy, summer scent it really does have some backbone and makes me feel pulled together. This would be excellent in an office, formal spring/summer events as well as for casual wear during the warmer months. It kind of reminds me of a longer lasting version of Clinique Happy.

Longevity is excellent with 7hrs of wear from 3 sprays and a moderate silage which is pleasant but does not intrude or offend (unless you're really heavy handed on the sprayer, in which case anything can become offensive and harsh)
100ml repurchase worthy, signature worthy, a PERFECT scent!

product_name: Acqua di Parma Magnolia Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content: On dry-down this scent reminds me of the North Woods in the early summer. Linden and birch trees. It's much less heady than I anticipated and sharper. I see some mentions of lemon below and I understand why - it does have an almost bitter (NOT unpleasant) edge to it. I got good longevity but poor sillage. In any case, since this reminds me of late spring/early summer by the lake, it will be a keeper as a scent memory, but not sure I'd want to smell like this as my scent.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Magnolia Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content: Beautifully made, floral and delicate. Fancy and elegant. I've never smelled fresh magnolias so it's hard to say if they got it right...all I know is that I dont get any citrus notes at all! Love it though, great perfume for when you want to feel a little special!

product_name: Acqua di Parma Magnolia Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content: I absolutely looove this perfume! ❤️ Anybody who looks at my favourites and perfumes that I own can easily figure out that I relly like fresh citric scents and this one is just like fresh Positano lemons in a bottle! It takes me back to Italy every time I wear it and it just makes me feel like I am walking down the beach in Positano or Capri with the sun warming up my skin and a little sea breeze helping me refresh my mind. Beautiful scent!

product_name: Acqua di Parma Magnolia Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content: This one embraces the same classical, floral-centered spirit you can find in the other "nobile" offerings, yet, it seems to have a distant linkage with the "colonia" range for its notable citric-herbal (underline the word herbal), and slightly woodsy cologne background. It's mature and classic, and I also find it fancy. It could be elegant during the summer days along chic sundresses or shirt dresses, especially for tranquil personalities. It could also work as a successful mother's day gift. The Magnolia begins waxy and posh, but ends up in the last dry-down phase to soapy and mild when it's dying. Beautiful indeed, with acceptable performance.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Magnolia Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content: So so beautiful! It's not a soliflore so if you expect a true magnolia you would probably be disappointed. It's very lemony but not too fresh. More like the rind of lemon, paired with pretty magnolia notes. It has a heaviness to it, something with weight, maybe vetiver? Very natural. Luxiourious but effortless. It's very grown up but imo would smell wrong in too serious settings. I would personally only wear this in warm weather and dressed in my most feminine clothing, otherwise I wouldn't feel comfortable. To me it has quite a sillage for being a citrus-floral!

product_name: Acqua di Parma Magnolia Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content: This is so pretty. My grandmother had a magnolia tree in her backyard when I was growing up. It is probably why I love magnolia. This starts with an intense blast of citrus but give it a minute and this beautiful magnolia comes out. It took me right back to playing in her backyard and plucking fresh magnolia blossoms off the tree and inhaling them. It has good longevity and silage. If you like magnolia you will be happy you bought this.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Magnolia Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content: Strong Citrus + Magnolia opening. Soury note continues.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Magnolia Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I try not to read the spoilers when I have a fragrance to test. This one had the word magnolia in the name, so it was hard to avoid expectations. Therefore I was a little surprised by an initial impression of spice and bitter citrus. This is not a simple sweet floral - a big plus for me, especially now that the weather is getting cold.

The citrus remains strong on dry-down, but the gentler magnolia also comes to the fore. It's a really interesting and unexpected combination.

I don't get any of the soapiness or bright lemon other testers mention. The citrus is less bright than bitter (in a good way) to my nose, but I can't really pull out any one citrus note.

After a few hours, all that is left is a very light magnolia scent.

I like it, but I'm not sure when I would wear it.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Magnolia Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I’m not a fan of citrus dominate fragrances, but this is cute to me. The magnolia in this kind of reminds me of toiletry items or maybe even lotion. The bright and sunny citrus stops it from fully going into that territory. I feel like i have to be in a smiling mood to wear this. It really is like a magnolia lemonade.

I think how one wears this determines if this is a mature scent or not. This would be totally appropriate on someone wearing southern prep aka Lilly or going to a garden party. It would smell elegant, but youthful in those situations. I think in a dark business suit it would come across more mature. I only feel that way because this is not a serious fragrance

product_name: Acqua di Parma Magnolia Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content:
if you ever smelled an Italian magnolia in bloom and you loved it, this is the perfume for you. It is natural, strong, classy, and of impact. It is a bold statement like only a magnolia flower can be. great blind buy if you love magnolia, excellent natural ingredients from this brand, that never smells industrial or chemical.
Honestly, I love it. 4/5

product_name: Acqua di Parma Magnolia Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content:
This could be a dryshampoo or hair spray scent.
But in a good way.
A very soapy scent.
It gives many whiffs along the day.
Some of the notes reminds me of Le Couvent Palmarola which I adore.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Magnolia Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Trying out a small sample of this perfume right now. I've worn it all day twice now, before making my mind up to write a review. This scent embodies the words "beautiful" and "elegant" for me. It reminds me of something my mother would wear to church or for special occasions. My mother is beautiful and she always smells absolutely lovely, but I'm not sure I want to smell exactly like her. I prefer fresh, energizing, uplifting, clean scents. This is rich, grounded, and, as other reviewers mentioned, somewhat opulent and quite old-fashioned. Gonna give my sample to my mom and if she likes it (which I am almost certain she will) may get her a full bottle. It is definitely full bottle worthy--but more something she can always keep in her collection and wear for those unique occasions.

For me: maybe 3/10 (lovely, but just not my style)
For mom: 8/10 (a great fit)

P.S. When I say "rich"...I really do mean rich. Two sprays of this is filling the room up right now, and as much as it is a beautiful scent, I'm kind of getting a headache. So be easy on the nozzle.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Magnolia Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content: Magnolia Nobile by Acqua di Parma makes me feel opulent! It is like a warm sunny day in the spring with blossoming magnolia trees and fresh lemons. This magnolia is not pungent; it is sweetened up with jasmine and rose singing in the background. This fragrance is well blended and smooth, absolute compliment getter!

product_name: Acqua di Parma Magnolia Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I chose this for a frag subscription. My thoughts:

While the Magnolia in this isn't what I would necessarily call "True", it is unmistakably Magnolia. I think it blends nicely with the other notes, and remains present throughout the entire wear.

This is THE high society southern belle, in a bottle.

Ultimately, not for me. I'm not her. I will hold on to the 7 ml I have, and probably wear it someday to see my Grandma, at church. Otherwise, I have no clue when I would be moved to put this on, even though I think it's very pretty and classic.

***Edit:
welp, I found the proper occasions for Magnolia Nobile. I recently wore this for my beloved Grandfather's funeral service. It was perfect for the occasion, and I found it even comforting. Even received a compliment from my auntie. ;) Glad it was there to reach for, that day.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Magnolia Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I originally dismissed this fragrance as a bit "meh" - kind of smelt it before or not my taste. I do this a lot with samples. But then months later I'll come back to it and smell it in a completely new light. That's what happened here.

I'm not a fan of magnolia as a singular note (Frederic Malle's version is just too naturalistic for me). This is why I think this fragrance blend works so well. I love the crisp lemon and balance from the other florals.

It is by no means just delegated as a summer scent because of its heavy citrus, this can be worn all year round and would be quite exquisite in winter.

There's something incredibly elegant about it, it is the white floral-citrus mix I've been after for so long - usually this kind of perfume is ruined by orange blossom but there is absolutely none here thank goodness.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Magnolia Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content: I grew up in Mississippi, "The Magnolia State." I played in old civil war era magnolia trees as a child. Trust me, I know this flower. Magnolia Nobile captures SOME of the magnolia essence but not all. They nailed the lemony, watery elements. However on dry down, it lacks grounding and depth, and should be more indolic. It is also somewhat chemically. Sorry ya'll, this is a great perfume, but its not MY magnolia. I just have high standards for this note :)

product_name: Acqua di Parma Magnolia Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Scent: 8/10

Quality: 9/10

Originality: 6/10

Sillage: 7/10

Projection: 6/10

Longevity: 7/10

Price VS Size: 7/10

product_name: Acqua di Parma Magnolia Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content: Creamy lemons! Lovely perfume. I tried this in the summer but found it too lemony and kind of sour. This is much better as a fall/spring or even winter cool weather scent. Now I can detect other aromas besides lemon and magnolia, specifically tuberose, vetiver and sandalwood. Much better :)

product_name: Acqua di Parma Magnolia Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content: I really like the fragrance for the spring/summer. It settles on the skin very nicely with the magnolia/floral scent, but right away it's bright and citrus-y. I could still smell it 5 hours after application, but it faded a lot after that. I'd say it's feminine and versatile, can be worn day or night.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Magnolia Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content:
It may be the middle of July, but I think I found my summer fragrance! This is so fresh and zesty from the citron and lemon, but still soft and romantic from the magnolia. I get bits of vetiver that keep it on the greener side as opposed to the waxy aspects of magnolia, and just a touch of sandalwood in the base that keeps the fragrance grounded. It is definitely sophisticated, and true to its Italian heritage. I think it's ageless and easy to wear, though it might feel more appropriate to those over 25 and a bit more worldly. I think it is an excellent choice for those who have decided to break away from some of the achingly sweet gourmands out there and want to move on into a more adult fragrance. It's a love and will be trying her jasmine sister next!

EDIT - Oh no!! After wearing this for a full day I discovered that I am not getting any of the longevity others seem to be getting! Less than 30 minutes after spraying generously, the scent had all but vanished. Curious to see if I was experiencing some anosmia, I asked others if they could smell it on my, and they could only detect a faint trace when sniffing hard on my wrist and neck. I need to find a way to make this work for me! It is just too beautiful to not wear, and too expensive to respray every half hour! Hopefully there is a lotion or cream I can layer with because I just adore this one.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Magnolia Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content: On my skin the citron is really bitter and strong and unfortunately overpowers the magnolia. If I had been blind-testing I would have guessed this was either a spray of Lemon Pledge cleaner or a very bitter citrus fragrance. Bummed because I love magnolias (mine are in full bloom as I type this) and the reviews are so positive. Glad I got to try it out before blind-buying.
reviewer_name: what is this I don't even

product_name: Acqua di Parma Magnolia Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content: Lush, fresh, slightly sweet and very beautiful. An opulent and natural smelling fragrance. Unfortunately longevity is disappointing. But, it is the best magnolia i’ve ever smelled.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Magnolia Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Complex and yet so delightful and clean. Innocent but still mature and feminine. I LOVE this fragrence. Its sofisticated but still in harmony, suites as much in the office as on the vacation trip.

The only thing i would like to change is the sillage which is quite soft, this kind of excellent perfume should take more place in my opinion.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Magnolia Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content: A soft, beautiful, and delicate perfume of early magnolia blossoms. One of my favorite blossoms of spring, as a note, magnolia is a gentle, delicate watercolor brushstroke of harmony and beauty across your skin. A soft, subtle and delicate floral ballet of bergamot, citrus, cedar, magnolia, Bulgarian rose, jasmine, sandalwood, patchouli, vanilla and vetiver, this perfume is like lying down for a nap on the green grass underneath a majestic magnolia tree, dreaming while embraced by the sweetness and innocence of the magnolia blossoms.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Magnolia Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content: this smells just like the new baby blooms of magnolia on my front yard tree here in Florida.. like sunshine and sparkly lemon/honeysuckle/jasmine that the young bloom smells like..not cloying or indolent or too "twangy".. It is also not a ripe bloom with creamy background like a gardenia.. it smells literally like a young magnolia bloom... absolutely beautiful...thank you aqua di parma for capturing that heavenly smell...

product_name: Acqua di Parma Magnolia Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I love it! However, as many of you already mentioned, it doesn´t last too long.
On me it´s very delicate, beautiful, ellegant, soft, pure and more sweet than citrus notes appear...some girls complained that they felt too much citrusses, I don´t feel any - but my ph does it always with fragrances :)) on me everything smells sweet, event the freshest colognes, that´s why I must be careful about too heavy vanilla fragrances...but this one is just beautiful...like home..like love...like romantic evening with the hint of wind colored by magnolia...
I wish it could last longer, cause for that price it deserves it...

product_name: Acqua di Parma Magnolia Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content:
As a rule, I'm not very drawn to white florals - I have nothing against them, but they just don't excite me: especially now that my collection has grown enough to make priorities indispensable, even the ones I admire a lot very rarely make it onto my wishlist after sampling. Magnolia Nobile falls into that category as well: I enjoyed my sample very much, more than I thought I would, but it doesn't make my heart beat any faster, so I doubt I'll ever need more of it.

It is a luscious scent, though, so happy and mellow! Another reviewer on this page calls it a Goldilocks kind of fragrance, and that's exactly right: it's extremely well-balanced, super comfortable. It's not too much of anything: not too unsubstantial or overwhelming, not too sweet or too bright, not too soapy or too powdery. Classy! The lemon note especially is lovely: delicious and soft, with a little sweetness to it that keeps it from making the magnolia too sharp or too sour. I had to use more sprays than I usually do, but when I did projection was just right as well, at least for a couple of hours. Longevity is about as good as can be expected from a composition like this.

I only wish I had tested this in spring, because I'm starting to long for fall and sweeter scents after this long summer, but that's neither here nor there really. All in all, I'm impressed as always by Acqua di Parma.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Magnolia Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content: Yes, this is acceptable. Of all the free samples I got today by chatting up salespeople in John Lewis, this is probably the least insufferably boring. I mean, don't get me wrong, it's not outstanding, but the blend is very finely balanced and (on my skin) the citrus really sings through the petals in a way you don't often encounter. Nice summer scent, not overly sweet.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Magnolia Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content: Like many others, I wish that this was longer lasting. I haven't lived near a magnolia tree in years, but this instantly transported me to the smell of them in full bloom. The waxiness of the petals as I plucked them from the tree, the heavy, fatty scent of them on the breeze. This smells like midday in high summer, it's wonderful.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Magnolia Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content: Liquid sunshine, radiating optimistic charisma

product_name: Acqua di Parma Magnolia Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content: Nice, but very short lived. I really can't smell the base notes. Citrus & magnolia fragrance.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Magnolia Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content: Classy fragrance of womanity. it smells like a an 'adult' woman who wears big earring, silky underwear is sensuous and has many secrets...

product_name: Acqua di Parma Magnolia Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content:
This is much better than the Iris nobile or Peonia nobile.
Lighter, more easy-going mild scent.
It's not one of my favorites, but I think it's worth a try.
Nobile line seems to be a bit too strong for me.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Magnolia Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Wow I fall in love with this cologne.It's scent is my lovely woman.
A beautiful and fashionable lady.
I love it and I like wear this cologne so much.
8/10

product_name: Acqua di Parma Magnolia Nobile Acqua di Parma
Acqua di Parma Magnolia Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Gorgeous.
On my wish list.
I like the brand and famine - quiet ... sweet notes from this bottle.
It's a scent of delicate woman. Married loving her husband and a very sensitive... loving warm young, pretty female.

Stunning formula.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Magnolia Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Citrus accord? yes; but be patient, the citrus calms down just a little within aprox. 30 min.

This is exactly how magnolia grandiflora smells (citrus note included.) Go outside, find a grandiflora tree. Yes the one with the big white flower! You'll see... this is simply GORGEUS.

I know it's price is high, but so is the quality. I find Magnolia Nobile has much more projection/sillage (in my case moderate) than for example: Guerlain's Aqua Allegoria line, Prada's Infusion line, or Hermes' Jardin line.

It also has more longevity (in my case moderate). All other fragrances just mentioned, except Infusion d'Iris, turn into a skin scent for me rather quickly, in about 2 to 3 hours. While Magnolia Nobile continues to project approximately 4 to 5 hours, and it lives longer as a skin scent.

So, I say enjoy it! This to me, is the perfect spring/summer fragrance.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Magnolia Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content: Amazing quality. A full blast of magnolia combined with richness, creaminess and something pleasantly green and real to tie the delivery together. A masterpiece, sophisticated and elegant. This lasts on the skin but doesn't use fanfares to overpower anyone. There is a nice, delicate development from start to finish and I love it all the way even though I can't tell what exactly happens along the way.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Magnolia Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Edit 2022: I was more generous than I ought to have been. This is incredibly faint. What is beautiful abut it is gone just as quickly as it comes. Wasted potential.

Wonderful floral, that magnolia is so soft and sweet. This is a really motherly scent, it reminds me of summer at the end of my mother's bed, massaging her feet with the window open and the smell of flowers coming in with the cooling breeze. It’s really something personal here, very nostalgic. There are citrus notes too, but they are light and overall the perfume unfortunately fades quickly. 8/10

product_name: Acqua di Parma Magnolia Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content:
amazing very light and pretty , perfect for a wedding, office or any other ocasion when you want to smell amazing but demure !

love it

product_name: Acqua di Parma Magnolia Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content: This is divine. I love citrus fragrances but in the winter when I need a perk up, the citrus needs to be more uplifitng rather than the zing I crave in summer. The white florals soften the bergamot to compose a lovely fragrance to urge on spring in the dark of winter.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Magnolia Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content: I was so happy when I read the name of it! - Magnolia! I love magnolia scents but somehow this turned out very disappointing to me. I couldn't smell any magnolia at all, way too citrussy for my taste. I guess spring/summer perfume, too fresh for winter.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Magnolia Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Magnolia Nobile reminds me of an Italian café in the shade under a tree. An icecream-stand beneath striped awnings. Sweet lemon gelato, and creamy white florals.
One of the best "fresh" summer fragrances out there which isn't a mango/coconut bomb, or aquatic boringness (no offense, Aqua di Gioia and Cool Water, but..)

Must say that it's ageless as well. Everyone could wear this, no matter what age.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Magnolia Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Southern magnolia (Magnolia grandiflora) + musky base
or lemon + apricot + baking soda + oil paint? + a hint of wintergreen + sometimes I get a bubblegum note.
On me very long lasting (24 hours). It reminds me hot summertime, contrasting stripes of light and shadows under trees...

product_name: Acqua di Parma Magnolia Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Take only a sip of Pina Colada, close your eyes and think about summer nights at the beach bar's. Little breeze in the air, sound of waves...

Open your ears, Magnolia Nobile wants to say something...

product_name: Acqua di Parma Magnolia Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Who doesn't like the smell of fresh lemons?

So it's not a magnolia solo- who cares? I can't believe there are negative reviews of this perfume. It is not my go-to, but how could anyone dislike this? it is the freshest, zingiest, yet softly floral marvel of a perfume that smells nothing short of a glorious no-clouds-in-sight summer day in Capri! It is the best pick me up for those dull days when you think, why can't I be done with this day already.

at the beginning the bergamot and lemons explode (with elegance, I must add, this is no cheap scent), then the flowers seep in from both sides.if you are patient, you will be able to pick out all the gentle flowers that follow. The dry down is soft, lingering... dreamy. gorgeous!

product_name: Acqua di Parma Magnolia Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I came upon this one at Saks by chance, liked it in the bottle, then liked it on paper, then loved it on my skin. I walked around the mall for several hours to see how this fragrance aged on my skin--still loved it, and bought it. I've never made a perfume decision that quickly.

The citrus top notes mix beautifully with the white flowers beneath. The jasmine is divine. Like umsultan below, I also pick up the lily of the valley.

It smells like my parent's green room when the orange flowers and jasmines are in bloom. This fragrance is not soapy, not very sweet, not musky. Nothing tacky and overblown in this composition. It's tasteful. I just love it.

Update: The more I use it, I'm finding that I'm conscious all day of a heavy licorice-like note, and the citrus that I thought I picked up when I first tried it is no longer a note to my nose. Still a lovely floral scent.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Magnolia Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content: I just got my mini sample of this. impression: Love at first sniff. i Love floral perfumes. but its hard to find the perfect floral these days, floral perfumes are either soapy or candied. this one, although many says its more citrus-y than floral. i dunno! yes, its fresh like summer fruits. but to my nose first thing i smell is magnolia then tuberose. and on my skin i can even smell lily of the valley!(although its not written there) its so fresh and i can tell this is made with high quality ingredients, the notes blends very well. this is my first experience with Acqua di Parma perfumes. I cant wait to test other perfumes from this brand.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Magnolia Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content:
The opening of Magnolia Nobile is indeed very lemony, which fits the 'cologne' aesthetic of Acqua di Parma. The lemon is not aggressive to my nose. It feels kind of powdery, but not dry or overly juicy. It's almost like fine yellow crystals shimmering in the sunlight.

The magnolia languorously enters the scene. At first, it's mingled with the citrus, as the later enhances the watery lemony aspect of magnolia. Later on, as the citrus gradually steps aside, the magnolia takes on a slightly waxy texture while remaining transparent, as if I'm sniffing the redolence among the fleshy petals of magnolia.

The fragrance eventually becomes a silky skin scent of white floral after about 5 hours. Except for a faint trace of tuberose and jasmine, I'm unable to discern other notes clearly, especially the base notes, but I'm sure that they help to ground the white floral discreetly, unlike some overwhelming white musk.

The sillage is relatively soft and the longevity is around 9 hours. Magnolia Nobile is arguably quite simple in structure, but executed beautifully. It may not be the most realistic rendition of magnolia, but both the watery lemony and waxy aspects are present, and it's more like an artistic representation of magnolia, bright but not blinding, as if the magnolia is seen through a pale gold lens. Classy, elegant and feminine, yet in an effortless manner and somehow laid back, I'd definitely recommend it as a versatile citrus-floral fragrance.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Magnolia Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content: Fresh, light, lively, crisp and juicy citrusy white floral! Great for summer and heat. The first blast and you get tons of citruses, then magnolia, then it settles into classy white floral. The citrus stays noticeable to the end. This one is high quality, well blended with freshness, sweet and bitter notes and juicy citrus. Compared to Acqua di Parma Acqua Nobile Magnolia EDT this one has much better sillage and longevity.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Magnolia Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I've tried Magnolia Nobile quite a few times now. My experience with this perfume is so different from everyone's that I'm not sure what's going on... but I get a big, big magnolia straight from the beginning. This magnolia is not sweet, but loud. I also smell jasmine and strong tuberose which makes it even more floral. Citron is light, and to my nose it doesn't blend well with magnolia. No rose, no vetiver.

This whole fruity flowery mess dries down to a shampoo/hairspray type of scent on me and is not very attractive. Longevity is a good 7 hours and projection 2-3 feet. From the pungency of scent I assume this is a high quality perfume, but it's a bit too much and I feel like I'm invading into other people's personal space when I wear it. This is disappointing because I love Iris Nobile and thought this would smell as great. Good that I only have a 20ml spray.

Pichola by Neela Vermeire is a perfume with similar style, but much better development on me. I recommend checking that out too if you think Magnolia Nobile is your cup of tea. I like Pichola, but Magnolia Nobile is sadly a pass.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Magnolia Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content: This is not the magnolia I was hoping for. Rather than smelling fresh and creamy like a true magnolia, this is a syrupy fragrance, spiked with a heavy-handed dose of lemon and citron reminiscent of household cleaning products. I love jasmine, but here it overwhelms the magnolia, and the lemon + rose combination makes this almost more like a geranium fragrance, only heavier and not as herbaceous and fresh. If you are searching for a magnolia soliflore, keep looking. Magnolia Nobile has too much going on to do justice to the flower it's named for.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Magnolia Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I've waited too long to review on Fragrantica, a website I love!

Came upon this fragrance during a 2012 trip to Epcot Center in Orlando. Stumbled across the display at the Italy or Venice area and was over-taken...immediately in-love. Do you know that heady, over-whelming, wonderful olfactory sensation one experiences when entering a high-end parfumerie or a unique & spell-binding candle-shop in a tiny European town or Big American City? THAT is what got me...those fragrances...that fragrance...it was instant love.

Magnolia Nobile begins with loads of citrus, which I normally dislike...I do not like fragrances with strong, opening citrus notes. After settling in and simmering down a bit, the magic of Acqua di Parma Magnolia Nobile begins! The more this fragrance settles down and remains on the skin, the finer it becomes! Staying power is great...silage is super, too. A little does the job. Over-doing the application can be over-powering. This is a HUGE perfume, a BIG one...not for the shy or meek!

Again, thinking I would dislike such a "floral" and citrusy scent, magnolia is dominant; yet the mixture of citrus (lemon & bergamot), floral (rose & jasmine) and woods (amber, musk) make this perfume truly unique.

IMHO, this perfume is very feminine but not trendy or juvenile, not hip or lively. While this doesn't smell like the top drawer of grandma's dresser, I would call this a more mature and "lady-like" fragrance...not a fun and playful one. I like the fact that Acqua di Parma does not make dozens of "trendy" fragrances; the perfume maker chooses to perfect, develop and modify the "tried and true" base and basic notes.

As the Acqua di Parma website states, "this perfume DOES have a distinct structure that is enriched with surprising notes." There are opening notes of bergamot, lemon and citron that develop with rose & jasmine. The dry-down is sandalwood, patchouli...a hint of vanilla.

I absolutely love this stuff! It definitely ties as #1 with my other "go-to" fragrance, Frederic Malle Musc Ravageur. Completely different fragrances but similar in so many ways

product_name: Acqua di Parma Magnolia Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content:
EDP 1.7 fl oz.
starts with fresh but not sharp citrus, then it sweetens into a floral bouquet(not sure whether I smell more jasmine or tuberose?). it fixes up with a hint of patchouly, not overpowering.
Not summery to me, not for hot days. Classy and sophisticated, grown up yet modern, not an obvious floral scent.
lasting power:4-5 hrs
sillage: moderate (more than arm)
vote: 8/10.
repurchase: yes.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Magnolia Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content: Its a beautifully done female fragrance, no doubt about that ! Guess what, being a guy i have been layering it under YSL La Nuit parfum version with astonishing results. NOT more then 4 sprays (2 each) strictly night or evening use. ladies are all over this combination. thumbs up !

product_name: Acqua di Parma Magnolia Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content:
If I had to use only one word to convey the character of this perfume, it would be 'classy'. Except that the word 'classy' isn't classy enough and has negative associations for some reason so instead I'll use a plethora of adjectives including - but not limited to -: elegant, unique, expensive, exclusive, feminine, sensual, delicate, delightful, beautiful.

Nothing too original in that list I know but this really is a stunning scent and, of my rather vast collection of perfumes, is easily the one I get most comments on - particularly from men!

I'm on my 3rd bottle and think of it as my signature scent. Very highly recommended if you want something different, elegant and romantic in a very grown-up way.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Magnolia Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content: Delicate, feminine floral. This is very well blended, classy fragrance. I smell magnolia, light citrus, light rose, sandalwood, patchouli. It does resemble magnolia flower scent. Very, very well composed. My favorite ladies scent from Acqua di Parma.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Magnolia Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content: This scent is fairly sweet but has a freshness too. It is very citrus based. I also smell spicy undertones of Sandalwood. The floral scent if very much a white scent which gives a sweetness, which reminds me of Paris but a lot less powdery and sickly. I find it very nice to wear on a warm summers day. Only a very little is needed of the scent because it is strong and long lasting.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Magnolia Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Magnolia Nobile opens with a burst of citrus on my skin. I do have a problem with citrusnotes - they very often turn male'ish on my skin. Magnolia Nobile is not male'ish, its superwomanish scent, but my skin turn citrusnotes to be very sharp and maleish most times..A gorgeous scent and its very longlasting too.. true gem

Magnolia Nobile öppnar med en rejäl citrus-spark på min hud. Jag har problem med citrusnoter för de blir oftast manliga på mig. Magnolia Nobile är verkligen inte manlig utan superkvinnlig men min hud reagerar konstigt och citrus blir oftast skarp och manlig på mig. En underbar doft som sitter länge på huden. En lite juvel!

product_name: Acqua di Parma Magnolia Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content: Best floral fragrance I've tried. Smells expensive. Very elegant and feminine, intense but not overpowering. Reminds me a bit of lily-of-the-valley with citrus notes. Silllage and longevity is fantastic, I can smell it on my wrist in morning just after waking up.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Magnolia Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Elegant, gorgeous citrusy floral fragrance! The first sniff was even too heavy, I was waiting something softer…
It’s so pity, but I do not know how smells natural magnolia - next summer I’ll absolutely try to find one for pick it up and fix the smell to my memory…
Anyway, I could feel a lot of lemon, jasmine, tuberose and some woodsy notes. The scent is sunny, but absolutely not girly. Very feminine, grown up.
“Nobile” is just the right adjective!

product_name: Acqua di Parma Magnolia Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content: i've never smelled the magnolia flower when i bought this perfume. i love this perfume. yesterday i was driving in a neighborhood and saw a magnolia tree, i backed up to it and picked off a piece of the petal from the flower, smelled it, took it home and compared it to my perfume, it's exactly the same! so realistic!! now i just love this perfume even more.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Magnolia Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content: Beautiful, classy, wonderful. I could go on and on praising this beautiful perfume. The notes of magnolia, jasmine and citrus make this utterly adorable to wear. It is what I imagine a wealthy Italian woman wears when on a night out with a handsome man. Alas I only have a small sample but fully intend to buy a large bottle soon. Have I found the best perfume for me at last?

product_name: Acqua di Parma Magnolia Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I wore it during all my summer holidays, it's a beautiful floral, very feminine, elegant. I love it! Gorgeous.
It's one of my favorites. Perfect for spring and summer.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Magnolia Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content: Citrusy, zingy C-O-L-O-G-N-E with hard to tell "floral" notes.. Not horrible, but I would not reach for this even if I was gifted this expensive cologne. Almost nauseating...for me anyway..

product_name: Acqua di Parma Magnolia Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content: A beautiful gem. This is gorgeous. A women that smells like this is definitely going to grab my attention. Stunning perfume. Well done. Great for summer time nights. It's sweet, citrusy, powdery, woody, floral. Well blended. Bravo! Acqua Di Parma did a great job. Try it.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Magnolia Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content: Oh, this is WOW! So beautyful, so frech and feminine, I'm truly taken how much this perfume impressed me. I'm not easy to impress. It was a blind buy but immediate love. Euphoric! Make room on your schelf for this QUEEN!

product_name: Acqua di Parma Magnolia Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content: So beatiful!

product_name: Acqua di Parma Magnolia Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content: Actually, I can't feel any magnolia in this fragrance. It rather smells citron, lemon and something like lily-of-the-valley. A huge disappointment for me as a magnolia lover(

product_name: Acqua di Parma Magnolia Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content: Yes, it does smell like a happy and youthful spring. It does feature a very lovely magnolia. Its composition is, indeed, quite well-balanced. And yet... I would never call this scent "soft" or "subtle". In fact, to me, it's anything but. When the magnolia is singing with her ever happy and hi-pitched voice from morning till night (due to the great sillage, I can hear it all day long), it gets quite tiresome. Although I do like this perfume, I wear it not so often. I usually spritz it on occasions when I need a strong anti-depressant. It always works.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Magnolia Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content: This smells yellow and warm and sunny. Very happy and a lemony-floral delight. Something in this reminds of Tribu by Bennetton. Acqua is a definite cut above and much more sophisticated, still, something in there. Will be picking this one up sooner than later!

product_name: Acqua di Parma Magnolia Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content:
First sniff reminds of Yes lemon dishwashing liquid, yeak.... which calms down immediately. Next note is sweet magnolia with that freshness left from the lemon... soooo youthful and at the same time sothing. Wonderful!!!

When it starts to settles down a joyful fragrance emerges of jasmine, magnolia and only hints of lemon left.... Truly a delightful fragrance! Clean, fresh and feminine ... in a flowerish mature way but at the same time youthful in it´s character :))

It smells absolutely delicious!!!!


Först påminner doften mig om Yes citron diskmedel, yeak......vilket lyckosamt lugnar sig omgående. Fram kommer en doft av ljuvlig magnolia uppblandat med en fräsch ren citrondoft. Såååå ungdomlig men på samma gång lugnande.... Underbar!!!

Efter ytterligare ett tag börjar jasmin ta plats, uppblandat med magnolia och svaga toner av citron. Verkligen en ljuvlig doft!!! Ren, fräsch och feminin... på ett blommigt, vuxet och moget vis men samtidigt ungdomlig i sin karaktär :))

Den doftar absolut helt uuunderbart!!!

product_name: Acqua di Parma Magnolia Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content: This is lovely out of the bottle and for the first half hour. The magnolia and lemon began to give way after that to something disappointingly sour and synthetc. I was surprised. may be a chemistry issue? will definitely try again however because in those first ten minutes I thought this might be the perfume I had been searching for.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Magnolia Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content: Usually I prefer more complex scents, but this one impressed me to the point that now it`s on my wish list. It opens with citron, and during some 5 or 10 minutes it`s only citron, nothing else. But then the magnolia builds its way in, next come the tuberose (am I the only lucky one here who detects the tuberose so clearly???) together with the jasmine and rose. That`s when it becomes amazing. Sure the citrusy notes remain dominant all the way, but they are so nicely sophisticated floral citrusy notes. It`s fresh but sophisticated, floral but not heady or overwhelming, simple but noble. Sometimes I get tired from all the complex scents I have in my collection, and I wanted something less complex, but it was hard to find something that would satisfy me. This frag = BINGO! Very soon I`ll have it on my shelf! Congratulations to myself!)))

product_name: Acqua di Parma Magnolia Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content: This opens bright and sparkly with nice full citrus notes and the magnolia quickly makes its debut, pretty, lightly floral, slightly waxy. As this mellows, a soapy jasmine winds its way in and a soft vanilla sweetens the dry-down. Very nice fragrance, although the staying power isn't too amazing.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Magnolia Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content: It was a present. Nice, gentle lily of the valley on me.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Magnolia Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content: A little old fashioned but beautiful, feminine and elegant. It opens with real lemons and stays very tangy that for about 5 min then is becomes sweet and more floral, the magnolia notes are very soft. I like it but won't buy it again. If you like complex scents pass on this one it can make you feel chic and clean but not exciting !
