And oh how wrong I was, because today, I can finally say there is a fragrance I hate. This went straight to the base notes and was a horrible cacophony of strong hard leather and incense smoke.

In my country, the burning of joss paper (or incense paper, or to the Western world, "hell's banknotes") is a ritual in our ancestor worship. It is not uncommon to see people burning joss paper in metal cannisters on the streets - mostly in residential areas. I was walking back home with not a care in the world, when all of a sudden I started to smell Leather. I was alone on the escalator ascending a footbridge, and was obviously quite confused to be bombarded with this horrible smell. This was also through my K95 mask. As I started walking along the footbridge, in the distance I saw a man burning joss paper. And that is what Leather smells like to me.

product_name: Leather Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content: best leather fragrance in the market.

product_name: Leather Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content: You know when they say "Barnyard Oud" well this is a Barnyard Leather and it is so dense that I believe Tom Ford takes this then waters it down (a lot) and makes Tuscan Leather out of it, is that dense I'm not kidding. Bottomline Eau de Cologne suits me better but I'm sure a lot of people will find this one is a better choice for them and the longevity, projection, and sillage are HUGE.

product_name: Leather Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content: Just an FYI - SAME formula. This has not been reformulated as far as I can tell. The formula code remains the same from the brown box (that I've owned) to the black presentation (that I currently own). Formula code: 08873/A. Buy with confidence. :). Excellent stuff.

product_name: Leather Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I get much more smoke in here vs tuscan leather, and less fruityness too.

The opening is full on smokey charcoal BBQ leather, but the drydown becomes more bearable. Honestly thought it was supposed to be a cleaner leather, and to some extent it is, but the supporting notes aren't what i'd call clean, and make for a challenging wear imo.

product_name: Leather Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content: I only have a sample but I will get the full bottle. This smells very expensive. A sharp yet smooth sexy mysterious leather. I usually hate lemon but I’m here it works with the leather so much. It dries down with a sweetness mixed in that’s not sugary at all ..I think it’s a blend of raspberry and rose making that scent. The smokiness in here is very pleasant. This is 100% unisex

product_name: Leather Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Acqua Di Parma Leather EDP opens with a moderate to a strong projection of leather, woody, faint fruit, and floral accords. The opening is mature, intense, bold, but not harsh, elegant, and refined. The leather is by far the most noticeable note, a natural leather, polished, with a suede touch, elegant, not pungent or animalic, and without that combustible or gasoline vibe found in leader prominent fragrances. A step behind is the guaiac wood, a woody smoky, and leathery note. Several steps behind are the raspberry, orange, and honeysuckle, adding a very shy sweet fruit, and white floral accord. The rest of the notes are there to provide support but don’t have any significant participation. The fragrance is linear, all featured notes come up as soon as the fragrance is applied and continue into the dry down. One Acqua Di Parma Leather EDP has reached its full dry down, it can be summarized as a moderate to a strong projection, leather, and guaiac wood fragrance with faint fruity, floral and spicy accords. The fragrance feels bold, casual, dense, dry, elegant, exotic, expensive, formal, gentle, high-quality, leathery, masculine, mature, modern, natural, nicely-blended, polished, refined, warm, woody, and very pleasant.

BATCH REVIEWED: 2021 (#7109Y).
WOW RATING: 10/10. A very refined, and polished leather fragrance,
DISLIKE RATING: 3/10. The leather is a prominent note, not harsh or animalic, and with a suede touch.
UNIQUENESS: 6/10. Leather fragrances are relatively common.
MASS APPEAL: 8/10. This is a refined leather fragrance; however, in general, leather fragrances are not crowd-pleasers.
PROJECTION: 5/10. Good, about 5 feet around the wearer.
SILLAGE: 5/10. Good, about 5 feet behind the wearer.
APPLICATION: 2 atomizations.
LONGEVITY: 8/10. Impressive, about 8 hours, it projects well for over 5 hours.
SEASONS: Winter, fall, colder days, daytime, nighttime, and climate-controlled environments.
OCCASIONS: Formal events, outdoor gatherings, office, business, casual, holidays, vacations, clubbing. This is an office-friendly fragrance.
VERSATILITY: 7/10. A great and refined leather fragrance, ideal for formal and casual wear.
GENDER: Masculine, the leather, and woody accords lean it to the masculine side.
AGES: 25 and above.
RECOMMENDATION: Acqua Di Parma Leather EDP can be purchased for about $75. It is a very polished, intense, but not harsh, leather fragrance that feels business-ready. This is a great buy.
BLIND-BUY: Yes, but only if you are familiar with its main notes.
SIMILAR: These are examples of fragrances in the same genre. Al Haramain Opulent Saffron EDP is a fantastic, sweet tonka, suede, almond, heliotrope, and amber fragrance; Carolina Herrera CH EDT Men is a great, mild, sweet, leather, suede, woody, and ozonic fragrance; Guerlain L’Homme Ideal EDP features leather, almond, bergamot, and vanilla fragrance; Mancera Gold Prestigium EDP is a superb, sweet, vanilla, orange blossom, leather, and oud fragrance; Paco Rabanne 1 Million EDT Men is a good, sweet ambery, leather, and spicy cinnamon fragrance; Tom Ford Ombre Leather is a fantastic, intense, leather, white floral, spicy, and ambery fragrance; Tom Ford Tuscan Leather EDP is a very good, intense, leather, fruity, and spicy fragrance; Valentino Uomo Intense EDP is a great, mild, leather, sweet tonka, vanilla, and powdery iris fragrance; Montale Aoud Leather EDP is a great, intense, leather, wood, and spicy saffron fragrance; Acqua Di Parma Leather EDP is a fantastic, intense, leather, guaiac wood, raspberry, and orange fragrance.
SUMMARY: A moderate to a strong projection, leather, and guaiac wood fragrance with mild fruity, floral and spicy accords. The fragrance feels bold, casual, dense, dry, elegant, exotic, expensive, formal, gentle, high-quality, leathery, masculine, mature, modern, natural, nicely-blended, polished, refined, warm, woody, and very pleasant.

product_name: Leather Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content: Extremely strong leather, and lasts practically forever (even 1 spray is more than enough). Hard to love but very unique and stands out. Very much as "wear it for myself" vibe.

product_name: Leather Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I had to completely erase my first review cause this perfume actually delivers! The leather you'll find here is raw at the opening but it gets soften by the rose, sweet orange and cedar later on. My only complaint would be the cedar, it takes too much strength.

Its great to layer with other fragances due to its simplicity, but be advise, is not shy, it can actually overpower it. So far I've tried it with D&G the one edp and Versace Oud Noir. Brilliant layerings.

I'd strongly suggest to sample this one before buying.

product_name: Leather Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content:
This is insane,
It's truly a beastmode parfume, and the scent is amazing, smoky leather, wood, raspberry and almost like there is a petroleum scent mixed in.
Super masculine.

If you like the old Farenheit from dior, i think you will like this aswell.

Remeber, this is strong, so less is more.

product_name: Leather Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content:
The brown bottle formula was WAY BETTER. they basically ruined this one!. i dont see why they changed it.
now it has kinda unpleasent quality about it.
if you had the brown bottle and thinking about buying the black new on, well dont!

product_name: Leather Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I dunno. Other than being a leather dominant fragrance, I’m not seeing the comparisons to tom Ford Tuscan leather.

Acqua di Parma Leather is beautifully intense - the Leather note almost comes across as a petroleum type smell - with the most subtle kick of sweetness and tangy-ness buried in the background.

I think Tuscan leather and acqua di Parma leather certainly compare when you consider the fact that they are both “harsh” leathers - but in terms of actual smell similarity...I just don’t see it.

I find this to be one of the more unique leathers I’ve come across - and its oddly satisfying. The opening is distractingly harsh - not a “that smells awful” type harsh - more of a “oh shit - maybe i should’ve spayed it once.”

Within 20 minutes or so, the smack in the face wears off - and you’re left with a pleasant, slightly citrusy leather. I would also clarify, that although rose is listed in the notes, it’s not prominent. Again, I would think of a heavy “petrol” type scent when trying to compare this to others. There was one by histoiries de Parfums called Petroleum that kind of reminds me of this. I sold it a long time ago...it was definitely more rugged and less refined than this - but same ballpark.

If you’re a fan of fairly rugged/masculine heavy leathers, I can see this being appealing. To me it’s a very nice Alternative to the standard “Tuscan leather” type scent. I’m a big fan

product_name: Leather Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content: Starts off bitter and green due to Parma's Italian DNA but soon becomes a more enjoyable Ombre Leather. Its drier, smokier, and carries an herbal element that is quite enjoyable. The dry down is all about Leather, smoked warm gaiac wood and hints of raspberry. I don't like Ombre Leather due to its powdery jasmine/sweet dry down, so this could be a great alternative.

product_name: Leather Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content:
You know how they say "Barnyard Oud"
Well this is a Barnyard Leather

product_name: Leather Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content: Arrived yesterday. Heavy on the leather. Don't get much citrus or raspberry in this until the dry down. I became 'nose-blind' to this within about 15 minutes. Was still there the next morning as a skin scent. The dry-down is the best part for me. I much preferred this over TF TL. I have Ombre leather which is much sweeter than this. This is much more wearable than TL, which I find has a resemblance to methelated spirit or varnish. I like it, but I don't think I'll be using enough of it to buy another bottle. Got it at a 30% off deal.

product_name: Leather Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content: Just got this today and love it.It smells very similar to Rasasi La Yuqawam Homme,with that raspberry present in the Leather.This is a well blended fragrance for sure with very good performance.

product_name: Leather Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content: Smooky leather like you are in a Cowshed

product_name: Leather Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content: The name says it all: Leather. This smells like leather, pure and simple. Dry, dark, high quality leather. Very dry in fact. If you like leather scents, you will most likely enjoy this. Should be perfect for usage as a leather base in layering.

product_name: Leather Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content: Tested in 2020 at the store. Femme fatale scent. Very rosy leather on my skin.

product_name: Leather Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I tried Colonia Leather first, and was immediately impressed by the blend of the sweet rose with the harsher leathery note. It offered something different to your TFTL, slightly more versatile, not so dark and animalic, but intriguing.

This Leather is darker and thicker, and the rose that added a playful contrast in Colonia Leather is far more distant, while the citrus takes higher precedent.

Overall I think they are both great scents but this Leather is too similar to TFTL. While the leather note itself is excellently represented, it lacks originality, and I think I'll be sticking with the earlier Colonia release.

product_name: Leather Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content: Andy is correct, the difference is negligible if it even exists at all. The concentration remains the same at 80% alcohol listed, therefore, 20% perfume.

product_name: Leather Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Personalmente preferisco la vecchia versione dove la pelle era molto più liscia e pulita.
Questa nuova versione si appoggia molto di più allo stile di TF tuscan leather, ma preferisco di gran lunga quest'ultimo.
Non è un cattivo profumo, ma prediligo sicuramente la vecchia versione per il momento.
7/10

product_name: Leather Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content: The EDP is more leathery and smoky at the begining than Colonia one but they both goes the same way after a while. I like it a lot and I agree that it's more leathery than Tuscan Leather.

product_name: Leather Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content: Is this any different than the Colonia Leather? I tried it on a strip and it smelled the same to me. The leather accord, more like suede, feels a little synthetic but very elegant

product_name: Leather Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Unfortunately, I haven't tried the Colonia and can't compare those two.
I think the dry-down of the EDP is very similar to TF's Tuscan Leather (on my skin anyway). Where the AdP is slightly more leathery than TF.

I love that fragrance and will surely try the Colonia too.

product_name: Leather Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content: This black bottle has much more tarry smoky dark smell whereas the I remember the brown leather bottle smelling more like luxury car new leather seats smell. Therefore the association of where each fragrance takes me is totally different.

product_name: Leather Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Like for Oud and Ambra, this one is exactly identical to Colonia Leather, both in scent and performance. It's just a new packaging, no change in concentration, despite the new EDP label.

Smell is great, but because of the lack of creativity, I dislike this one.

product_name: Colonia Oud Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I have a sample and have now worn this twice to get a sense of what I think about it. I should say as context that I am not familiar with the Acqua di Parma brand and find its vast and complex range a bit overwhelming. I also typically wear niche perfumes, so anything like this that comes from a classic house, with a classic vibe and personality, is unfamiliar to me.

This one begins for me with a very strong, mildly unpleasant scent, evocative of leather car seats, James Bond, and the Mediterranean. Like many strong openings, this one would be definitely too much for the first 30 mins in most social settings. The smooth bitter orange, varnish, leather, oud smell is interesting and very European.

Within 2 hours, I can barely smell it. It fades into a non-specific, mildly ozonic oud-leather scent. Most of the citrus is gone. It definitely smells like "cologne" not any specific natural note.

Overall, it's too subtle yet too off-putting, too innovative yet too classic, and ultimately too varnish-y dark for my specific sensibility. I would want my ouds funkier and longer-lasting, and my citruses brighter and more refreshing, and the combination of the two seems intriguing but ultimately didn't work for me. Still intrigued about the brand though.

product_name: Colonia Oud Acqua di Parma
review_content: This is a seriously impressive fragrance. The oud is present but not overpowering, and the citrus top notes add a refreshing brightness that balances it perfectly. It's definitely masculine and has great longevity.

product_name: Colonia Oud Acqua di Parma
review_content: This is a great cologne. Makes me feel confident. My only gripe is the lack of projection and longevity.

product_name: Colonia Oud Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I'm not a big fan of Acqua Di Parma, so this caught me completely off guard. This is a clean, fresh, woody, and spicy fragrance with oud supporting it all the way. smells of quality and stays smelling like quality throughout the wear time.

Open: It hits you with citrus and oud. Not a harsh oud, nor a bitter citrus. The Oud stays for the whole lifetime of the fragrance, but the citrus dies down over time little by little (as most citruses does). It's a Very pleasant and well balanced combination of oud and citrus and has an addictive scent.

Mid: The spice, dry cedar, leather, and a clean musk starts to really shine underneath the Oud, and what's left of the citrus. It now reaches the "clean out of the shower" stage. This is where the musk really starts to give cleanness to the fragrance.

Dry-down: Pretty much the same as the Mid, but the citrus is all but gone. Has a hint of sweetness, probably from the leather accord. Less projection, but still detectable in the air.

This is an all year round, any time of day, any scenario and occasion type of fragrance. I can't think of an occasion where this wouldn't work. Suit or t-shirt and flip-flops. either way works. I would also say any age, as long as you don't prefer sweet gourmand fragrances. Leans very masculine in my opinion.

Personal score: 9/10. I have a 5ml miniature bottle, and i'll be getting a larger bottle when it runs out. This is a fantastic fragrance.

product_name: Colonia Oud Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I wonder what on earth these people hating has got in their bottle , It's Frkn Awesome . 🔥
Silage - 7
Perf. - 8
Frag- 9
VFM- 8

product_name: Colonia Oud Acqua di Parma
review_content: it is a bold, powerful oud wood fragrance. i like their sandalo also and i like what tom ford does with the oud theme,hard to decide who is best but definitely worth a try

product_name: Colonia Oud Acqua di Parma
review_content: I like this at first, but it does have a funk to it that I find a little off putting. I’ve now realized I don’t like leather notes and I find them very unpleasant. I tried tf ombré leather and had the same feeling as this

product_name: Colonia Oud Acqua di Parma
review_content:
finally got my hands on this rather more vintage bottle, my first love for oud fragrances that started my journey as a perfume collector. Decided to finally purchase this after I have 30+ fragrances in my collection.

Its not your usual oud fragrance, its rather fresh & classy, safe enough as an office scent, classy enough as a night scent, but heat & humid will kill this fragrance.

Performance is so-so, not so bad for a cologne concentree.

product_name: Colonia Oud Acqua di Parma
review_content: Fresh and aromatic. I generally prefer my ouds a little nastier so I’ll be honest and say it’s not really doing anything for me

product_name: Colonia Oud Acqua di Parma
review_content: To my nose this isn't fresh at all. I personally don't get any citruses whatsoever. Nevertheless I do like it and enjoy it in fall and winter.

product_name: Colonia Oud Acqua di Parma
review_content: I have this but there's a cheapo scent I bought off Amazon called Oud Maraam £25 for 100ml ,I read it was a spot on dupe for this ADP oud so thought I'd try it ,And it is exactly the same .Layer it with Oudh Jamal by Al Aneeq ,another chepo dupe off Amazon. Both smell identical to this and lasts a lot longer to be honest .

product_name: Colonia Oud Acqua di Parma
review_content: Ive never smelt the new version/black bottle....but the brown bottle of this stuff is fu****g amazing... had maybe 8 bottles of this stuff over the past 12 years. got 1 x half bottles left...I've smelt many top aftershaves over the years and this still filters to the top......

product_name: Colonia Oud Acqua di Parma
review_content: This fragrance absolutely nailed the smell of luxury. It reminds me of being inside luxury car, like a brand new Rolls Royce with alcantara. I personally like western oud over eastern. This is not cloying or overly sweet. Its perfect. Its masculine, its clean its amazing. The drydown is a super creamy and smooth leather / sandlewood type scent, but it has an accord I just can;t describe. Its smells of such high quality. 9.5/10. Never smelled anything like it. Its an original creation.

product_name: Colonia Oud Acqua di Parma
review_content: Absolutely beautiful. Fresh Italian acqua di Parma DNA and oud is soft and almost not detectable but gives it a little body. This is for a man with class.

product_name: Colonia Oud Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Firstly, I'm no fragrance reviewer nor I can breakdown the notes.

Simply a fresh oud. Not suitable for hot summer days.

Men's classic fragrance.

product_name: Colonia Oud Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Colonia Oud epitomises the combination of classic Italian perfumery with clean, contemporary western oud. It opens with a juicy burst of bergamot and orange, alongside a refreshingly spicy pairing of amyris and coriander.

This is soon followed by a clean-cut, modern, synthetic oud which is smoothed round the edges, and mellowed to match the continental style of Acqua di Parma. Combine this with a soft leather, backed up by sandalwood and cedar - and you’re left with a scent as fresh and invigorating as it is dark and brooding.

This fragrance stays true to the heritage of the original Colonia, utilising darker notes to take it that step further. It’s great for casual everyday wear as well as formal occasions, and would work very well as a signature scent for a classical individual.

product_name: Colonia Oud Acqua di Parma
review_content:
This is interesting. Takes a nice leather note, much better than the note in ADP Colonia Leather, and mixes this quality leather in with an oud accord and a crisp citrus note.

This frag is leather, orange and a touch of pungent oud. It smells pretty good but is a bit of a challenging wear.

product_name: Colonia Oud Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I have a 100 ml sealed bottle of this perfume and looking to sell.
Email me at jordantzouvelis13@gmail.com for more information.

product_name: Colonia Oud Acqua di Parma
review_content: Smells like 7 figures in the bank.

product_name: Colonia Oud Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Fantastic and different take on oud. Sophisticated, compliment receiving and long lasting. Delivers confidence but don't over spray - it projects very well too.

Scent = 9/10
Longevity = 9/10
Projection = 9/10
Value = 9/10

product_name: Colonia Oud Acqua di Parma
review_content:
What ADP did with leather they also did with oud. Taking a normally skanky note and making it fresh and light. My only regret was after getting Colonia Leather I didn’t explore the rest of the line.
Well better later than never.
Mature classy masculine scent. Maybe even barbershop style but not in the traditional way? I mean I can imagine smelling like this after leaving a high end Italian barbershop.
Lasts forever And gives a great scent bubble.

product_name: Colonia Oud Acqua di Parma
review_content: What an absolute beast on longevity is this one. Of course it depends what’s the fabric you’re using but it will last hours and hours no matter which one you’re wearing. The odor it’s elegant, it immediately hits you at the opening, in a good way I mean it, and it keeps stronger on middle notes, be careful with not over spray it. For sure I would not use it daily, keep it for nice events you have at night time, in winter and autumn.

product_name: Colonia Oud Acqua di Parma
review_content: I was expecting a stinky oud, but this is actually very classic and approachable. There is a medicinal touch to it that is specifically reminiscent of the dentist. The scent overall is very smooth and agreeable. Classic, luxurious, masculine leaning but still unisex. I enjoyed wearing it, and I enjoyed totally disregarding anyone who gave me side eye for it. But all in all I do prefer something a touch sweeter in my ouds.

product_name: Colonia Oud Acqua di Parma
review_content:
On the opening, it’s pure Oud with citrus notes. A bit overwhelming; perhaps a bit old fashioned.

On the dry down, the leather really takes over and works well with the Oud, accompanied by a soft amber scent.

Not bad.

Edit; I’ve been wearing this for three days now and I can honestly say, it is divine. I put it on at 10am and can still smell it when I’m in the car at 5pm. Luxury Oud. Not old fashioned at all.

product_name: Colonia Oud Acqua di Parma
review_content: Colonia Oud is amazing but will not suit everyone, the opening is very sharp and oudy, beautiful but you can love it as much as someone else can hate it. After some time the oud has less impact than the leather in this one as the fragrance will quickly smell like a luxury leather on a genuine jacket. You still can wear this casually. Very masculine, very good performances

product_name: Colonia Oud Acqua di Parma
review_content: A very nice citrus interpretation of oud. The initial spray is very sharp with citrus but drys down to a woodsy yet slightly sweeter fragrance. I truly cannot detect much oud in this.

product_name: Colonia Oud Acqua di Parma
review_content: Not a review, but information for anyone seeking a clone. Fragrantica does not have it listed, but I recently blind purchased Éclat 788. As I own and love Colonia Oud, I was able to try them sid by side. All I can say is this is the closest match I have ever found in a clone, both in terms of notes and longevity, projection and sillage. There is a subtle difference in the sharpness of the opening, but not at all chemical or uncomfortable. And I get a bit less coriander while approaching drydown. Otherwise these two are twins. This one is so well done that it makes me want to explore other clones from the same house.

product_name: Colonia Oud Acqua di Parma
review_content: I am wearing ADP Oud on one wrist and Dior Santal Noir on the other and after three hours I am surprised how similar they are! Actually, I cannot tell them apart now.

product_name: Colonia Oud Acqua di Parma
review_content: soapy non offensive oud, just bad

product_name: Colonia Oud Acqua di Parma
review_content: Smelled quite unremarkable, and I am not just saying that to be critical. Compared to the rest of the offerings by this quality house, Colonia Oud seemed lackluster. Acqua di Parma is famous for their sparkling citrus colognes, made in the Italian tradition. With Colonia Oud, I really went in there wanting to find something in this scent to love, but there is none. There is no brilliant opening, nor is the dry down really oud-y or spicy. The inverse of Acqua di Parma Oud and Spice.

product_name: Colonia Oud Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Smooth, vanilla, ambery, soft, friendly oud with a hint of sweetness. Not a funky or animalic off putting oud but a very friendly approachable oud. Love it for winter and colder fall weather. Think it'll be too dense and cloying in hot weather. Great date night scent.

Scent: 8.5 / Sillage: 8 / Longevity: 8

EDIT (9/13/22): Revisiting again and still loving it. Smooth tuxedo vibes. Dark and polished but a friendly gentleman.

EDIT: My old notes at the beginning of my frag journey...I guess my tastes have evolved as I didn't like it initially, but digging it now.
"Smoke and leather. Good life. Not me. 6/10"

product_name: Colonia Oud Acqua di Parma
review_content: An atmosphere in which one could say anything. I brush the bread crumbs from my sleeve. Tonight the world's colas imbibe the false cherries within them.

product_name: Colonia Oud Acqua di Parma
review_content: What the differences versus oud edp and vs intensa oud??because i think oud eau de cologne is discontinued ..thanks

product_name: Colonia Oud Acqua di Parma
review_content:
My first Oud perfume (about some 5-6 years ago). This plus the Acqua di Parma DNA make this absolutely amazing ... plus the leather note. Elegant. Sophisticated. Classy.

I go nose blind after a while, but I've received compliments about 6 h after spraying it when I could barely smell it on me. Apparently I still had a "fragrance bubble" around me. Absolute greatness!

One of my top five picks to take with me to a deserted island in the event of a zombie apocalypse. I really love this stuff.

product_name: Colonia Oud Acqua di Parma
review_content: Opens with strong Oud. The dry down is amazing!

product_name: Colonia Oud Acqua di Parma
review_content:
لم يعجبني العطر
العطر يذكرني بعطر فالفيت عود من لطافة
جرب قبل الشراء

product_name: Colonia Oud Acqua di Parma
review_content: Bandaids. That’s it. That’s the smell.

product_name: Colonia Oud Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Opens with a lot of oud. Then the oud makes place for sandalwood. A lot of sandalwood. Then the oud comes back. Then sandalwood. Then oud. You get it. I just don't really like sandalwood, but I can imagine that someone else who's into sandalwood and oud would love this. Citruses are very faint.

Personified:
Guy that takes himself seriously, maybe a bit too much. Likes to impress. Likes motoroil. But also his girls creamy lotion.

Bless/pass:
Pass

product_name: Colonia Oud Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Definitely pleasant, hard to dislike I think.
A bit of a Classic acqua di palma opening with some wood in the background, but lots of balsamic notes. A touch sickly sweet . The mids are gentle oud, slightly medicinal but not harsh with a very slight hint of rose, then sweet leather takes over backed by a gentle powdery soap.
The end of the dry down is sweet and woody, very smooth and leathery, just a hint of soap left.

Everything is very rounded. Smooth and soft. I'd like a little something to cut through, maybe a touch of bitter orange.

Good afternoon scent on a warm autumn day.

product_name: Colonia Oud Acqua di Parma
review_content:
The notes are masterfully blended with this one. The projection is really good for older bottles, don't know about the newer bottles but it should be similar going by the quality of this house.
There is definitely a hint of rose although it's very sleek. In the air, it smells very expensive and masculine.
Amyris is one of my favorites if done right. this is one of the few perfumes I have a backup bottle of because I know I will use this one for sure.
9.5/10

product_name: Colonia Oud Acqua di Parma
review_content:
The amyris is trong with this one. Like as has been said, a very wearable frag that contains oud, but isn't necessarily an "oud fragrance"

I get equal parts oud, leather, and amyris, creating a warm but smooth oud. Very nice, would work better in colder months though. (I wore today at 70 degrees). Very nice, especially if you like amyris. I'd say that for lovers of mfk's amyris extrait (never tried the edp), this would be a great winter option.

product_name: Colonia Oud Acqua di Parma
review_content: I don't get how this is called oud. Yes it's dark and spicy but in a armpit sweat way after eating indian food, especially the opening. It does not smell like oud! Yes it's handsome and classy but ehh. I'll be trying this again in 3 -4 months to update.

product_name: Colonia Oud Acqua di Parma
review_content: Now wearing this for a second time from a sample I received and it is clearly not for me. I get none of the top citrus I keep reading is present; on *my* skin, it’s just a dense, stuffy fragrance that gives off a pretentious, somewhat off-putting scent. I respect it, but I hate it. Try before you buy with this one.

product_name: Colonia Oud Acqua di Parma
review_content: If you are looking for an oud that can be worn year round, look no further. This is an amazing fresh take on oud. Fantastically blended. Fresh, bright, beautiful citruses off the top. If you are at all familiar with the house you should know that when they take on any kind of citrus they almost never fail. And the oud is definitely there, but it is by no means dark and heavy, but more airy and light. Definitely signature scent worthy for the right person.

product_name: Colonia Oud Acqua di Parma
review_content:
What the difference between
- COLONIA Intensa oud
- COLONIA Oud
- Oud
There are 3 versions. Are they all same, what's the difference who can help?

product_name: Colonia Oud Acqua di Parma
review_content:
This is hands down my signature fragrance I have both 100ml./3.4 oz and, 180ml/6 oz. bottle of ACQUA DI PARM OUD from the original 2012, and, unisex 2019 version. I absolutely love, love, LOVE this fragrance.🤪 My mom loves it, my co-workers love heck it even my doctor loves it. Nearly every single time I wear it I get complements. It's long lasting and, not to to over powering. I now own close to different bottles of cologne and, Acqua Di Parma Oud is my all time favorite it just reminds of the smell of fresh cut exotic wood. A few years ago I was killing time at my local Bloomingdale's department store before a job interview, and I stumbled into the men's fragrance department. I randomly picked up the large dark brown 6 oz. bottle of Acqua Di Parma Oud and, at first spray I feel in love with it except with the price the 6oz. bottle cost well over $250 US dollars😦just this past Spring of 2020 I I finally purchased my first bottle of Acqua Di Parma OUD online at a discounted price and, out of all bottles the fragrance house of Acqua di Parma makes to me this is ranked number #1☝️ 👍

Note: For those of you reading my review if you want this fragrance to last even longer try moisturizing the area you usually spray (neck, wrist, inside of elbows, lower armpits) with FRAGRANCE FREE lotion or non scented oil FIRST. I tried this and the fragrance lasted all day.👍

Very truly yours,

Julian Ernesto Garcia
Los Angeles, CA, USA

product_name: Colonia Oud Acqua di Parma
review_content: Too sweet, very less oud. Disappointed.

product_name: Colonia Oud Acqua di Parma
review_content:
A bright oud fragrance, not like other oud based fragrance that usually dark fragrance.

In my opinion this fragrance is suitable to used in daylight.

Great sillage, projection and longetivity.

product_name: Colonia Oud Acqua di Parma
review_content:
The opening is Sharp and tangy. Then it just melts into a very comfy cozy LIGHT oud/leather scent with a hinge of citrus in form of a bergamot. Office-friendly oud and a safe choice both for women and men for all-year-around oud.

I find that it sits Close to skin and does not Project, but I might be wrong.

For my personal taste, I prefer Jo Malone Oud&Bergamot for a citrusy oud. Worth sampling if you like this one.

product_name: Colonia Oud Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Strong and sharp opening, there is some bitterness, like one said, propolis vibe.

There is better drydown, but you have to wait couple of hours to come.
Ends with a rustic leather, oud and ambroxan, here lay all the beauty of it.
Dusty and mature scent.

product_name: Colonia Oud Acqua di Parma
review_content: Office friendly Oud. A lot of depth but with the signature Aqua di Parma freshness. In my opinion a unisex fragrance.

product_name: Colonia Oud Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Does anyone smell something resembling honey?

I do! 🍯

Its accords remind me of the most natural and strangely attractive honey with propolis.

•

From the opening, I don’t get an “in your face” citruses. Just enough to lend the Acqua Di Parma DNA to the perfume.

Instead, it dissipates very fast, giving room for the beautiful oudy-honey-propolis smell that I talked about, with a rich floral background and a leathery touch in the dry down.

Because of this honey-propolis vibe, Acqua Di Parma Colonia Oud presents a slightly medicinal type of oud.

But it has to be said: it’s not overwhelming at all. In fact, it’s amazing the way it is.

•

Acqua Di Parma Colonia Oud is very linear, not in a bad way. It’s blended so perfectly, that its consistent oudy-honey-propolis smell remains until the end. And when I say end, it means a loooong time after you spray it.

I’m talking about 8-plus hours of longevity and at least an arms length projection in the first 2-3 hours.

If you close your eyes and sniff it deeply, you’ll notice a floral note standing up, not as a main player. It’s Amyris. 🌼

It’s fantastic how this floral note gives richness to the perfume, despite being so sutil.

Another thing you’ll notice is some “brightness”. Probably it comes from the coriander seed. As in gastronomy, coriander seeds confers some “brightness” or “freshness” to the recipe.

(Just a little digression: you would be surprised how gastronomy and perfumery look alike)

The leather only presents itself in the dry down.

•

Unlike most people here, I don’t think this is a fragrance more appropriate to the night. It’s “brightness” match perfectly with the day.

I would recommend Acqua Di Parma Colonia Oud for the cooler days of spring 🌱 or for the autumn 🍁. But if you, like me that live in Brazil, use to face hotter days, go on and enjoy the fragrance. Just go easy with the trigger. 😉

•

To me, Acqua Di Parma Colonia Oud is an opulent translucent nutty-brown honey pouring over a velvety, cracked brown trunk of a tree, in a forest, next to the flowers.

product_name: Colonia Oud Acqua di Parma
review_content:
This is the best OUD I have smelt, my son has this on his nightgown, 48 hours plus smells like it is just been sprayed.
Very warm and beautiful! Projecting and most certainly beautiful.

product_name: Colonia Oud Acqua di Parma
review_content: Smells like dry woods with orange citrus. I really enjoy it... To me it's an all year round fragrance which is cool for an oud fragrance, summer I go with 2 sprays and winter I go with 4-5 and it's an all day scent

product_name: Colonia Oud Acqua di Parma
review_content:
A unique soapy fresh western oud. If you ever wonder what oud soap might smell like give this one a try.You get the soapy fresh elements of the acqua di parma DNA with the inclusion of civilized clean oud in the base. The fragrance picks up some spicy and creamy undertone as it dries down. The transitions are gradual and the fragrance lasts a lifetime on my skin. Niche quality as the price suggests of course.

I imagine this would be the smell of the oud soap you would find in a six star hotel in Dubai. It feels luxurious, deep,elegant but surprisingly zesty and clean for an oud fragrance.

I think its a masterpiece and the best creation from ADP. 

P.s. colonia intense oud,colonia oud and oud parfum are all the same fragrance.

product_name: Colonia Oud Acqua di Parma
review_content:
This is an aquatic oud-leather for the summer. A basic, traditional summery Middle Eastern blend that's already well-known in certain ME countries for daily casual use. This is not considered fancy in the region I'm talking about, but rather their basic cologne that you smell everywhere."Piccante Corpo Oud" by "Oud Milano" is a better option for such a style; however, "Oud Milano" is not listed within Fragrantica.

2024 Edit: Oud Milano had closed permanently, and all of their products are pulled out of market.

product_name: Colonia Oud Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Wealthy middle-age man essence...

Harsh strong opening of dark woods will hit you just after spraying this on. Synthetic blast to your nose that will take its time to calm down. Then an oudy-leathery accord will dominate this fragrance. It feels mature, straight to the point, not hiding any subdued nuance in the background.

To me this smells wealthiness. Nothing sexy here or even elegant or classy. It's like a big golden watch used to show off power and position, but without any hint of good taste or refinement. Do not get me wrong, this smells good, but the important thing here is the message and the power this message is communicated: "I am a big fish and I want everybody to see it"

To be used under the following circumstances:
Dress-up over casual
Night over day
Men over women
Mature over young
Cold over warm
Show off over discrete

Uniqueness: medium

Scent: 7/10

Performance: high

Would I buy it: No (I do own it, but now I do have better options for these kind of scenarios/mood)

product_name: Colonia Oud Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I tried Tom Ford Oud and Creed Royal Oud before I decided to buy AdP Oud.

Tom Ford Oud is a well crafted Oud, but on my skin, it starts developing floral notes throughout the day, which makes it too feminine for me—I don't mind unisex but floral notes are a turn off for me.

Creed Royal Oud is fantastic to smell because it's more herbal. It feels like if you're walking in a forest, right in front of agarwood. I loved it but not to wear as a fragrance. Also, it made me feel I'd only wear it on a rainy Sunday in Fall. Very special. For anybody in search of oud fragrances, give it a try.

Now AdP Oud was just a wow. I'ts definitely an oud fragrance with reminiscences of sandal, a layer of leather (for some too leathery but for me not at all if you compare it with Tuscan Leather) and a layer of burnt match which is oddly addictive. It made me feel I could wear it each time I wear a suit or want to impress.

Complex, different and appealing. Great longevity and medium projection and sillage. That's why I bought it.

product_name: Colonia Oud Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Lovely mix of a cologne type of a scent and some Oud mixed in.

Willing to swap this for Gucci Oud Intense, which I own in 90ml but is not so much my cup of tea. Text me if interested!

product_name: Colonia Oud Acqua di Parma
review_content: I wanted to try this after hearing good things but sadly i was very disappointed. A citrus fresh oud, no thanks. I like my ouds strong and masculine, no freshness needed. Also performance i found to be lacking 5-6 hours and no real sillage.

product_name: Colonia Oud Acqua di Parma
review_content: This one was an instant no thanks for me. It smells like leather that had very sweet perfume sprayed all over it and then they wiped the leather down with water but you can still smell this sweet weird stuff primarily. Smells weird and not attractive to me.

product_name: Colonia Oud Acqua di Parma
review_content:
lets talk about class and sophistication. It's elegant, masculine extreme classy scent. I believe only gentleman can put this on. Its the best version of oud where it is not overpowering and dirty yet very existing and sexy. Despite the fact it is cologne concentration. This master piece last for ages and when I say for ages i really mean it.

Normally most of perfumes does not last on my skin at all, but this stuff is amazing, what else can I say that I wore it today 7:00 am in the morning and took two shower through the day and it is still on my skin the only thing sillage is not big and that what you want because oud is very rich and strong so if it is loud it will annoy people around.

A signature scent that will grab you tons of compliments, boost your mood and make you recognisable. Furthermore, it worth every penny you spend on it specially if you do the maths and buy 180ml, at least you are 100% confident no one will smell like you.

Just one last tip for sure it does have very organic natural authentic oud.

product_name: Colonia Oud Acqua di Parma
review_content: Im shocked that no one really has mentioned that this is really similar to the sour Tom Ford Noir in the drydown..so disappointed with this blind buy..

product_name: Colonia Oud Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I smelled oud oil in an oud boutique at the mall few days before buying colonia Oud. And i think they are using real oud oil in this.

A very refreshing oud due to the citrus, feels very natural, Dry with a pinch of sweetness.

Lasts a very long time with moderate projection and has a human quality about it.

Overall a great fragrance, Signature scent worthy.

product_name: Colonia Oud Acqua di Parma
review_content: Enjoyable enough for a full size bottle (180ml). Noticeably similar to the Sandalo but not my favourite in the dark bottle series, that accolade goes to the Leather. I am also a fan of the Ebano version but this Oud is very wearable and garners plenty of compliments, more so than the rest of the line. Good performance, very classy, high quality ingredients but unfortunately it all comes at a price, a high price.

product_name: Colonia Oud Acqua di Parma
review_content: Unique! I have been trying and discovering some wonderful scents from this house including this one. With it being summer I’ve been enjoying the citrus’s present in many Colonia fragrances which I possess. Colonia, Pura, and Essenza to be specific when I began to gauge the costs of full bottles. That’s when I spotted it. Colonia Oud in a huge 6 oz bottle. I had heard of this scent but never had a sample before. On sale for about 150 bucks. I began to research until finally deciding to blind buy it. Figuring I love the others, I Love Oud! Let’s see what this talk is about when you combine the two. As always, I am glad I did. Not only do I have a great scent in a huge bottle to turn to in the days ahead but I also expanded my knowledge and experience on this fragrance journey. While I can say that this was not what I expected, some bring about comparisons to Creed royal oud while others mention Oud Wood by Tom Ford, I’d say that this is very Unique and that I get the mentioning of those as this juice is of the finest quality as they are. Just way different. A fine, blind buy for me due to the fact that I like leathery, citrusy, Oud scents. Perfect for me.

product_name: Colonia Oud Acqua di Parma
review_content: This is very sharp, almost unwearable for me in the 1rst hour or so, and thats with 2 or 3 sprays! It does however start to calm down and be more user friendly. It smells ALOT better in the scent cloud around you, rather than trying to smell directly on the skin! I've only tried this recently in the heat though, so I'm gonna try agin in cooler weather, hoping it won't be as aggressive! People around you should love this, but don't let them get too close...

product_name: Colonia Oud Acqua di Parma
review_content:
This is an intense leather fragrance, with some added oud that adds an Arabic vibe to it, freshened ever so lightly by a citrus note that's barely noticeable. It's smells like the inside of a new leather bag or a car with leather seats.

This scent is sharp & spicy. Can be too much for some.

As an oud fan, this was a disappointment.

As a leather fan, this was good.

I like it but not enough to wear it.

Like.

product_name: Colonia Oud Acqua di Parma
review_content:
After TF Oud Wood, this would have to be the next best oud perfume out there IMO. It’s dark and mysterious – I love it!

Be warned, it is very intense especially at the start – 2/3 sprays will be more than enough. Definitely for the colder nights.

Fragrance 8/10
Performance: 8.5/10
Versatility: 8/10

product_name: Colonia Oud Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Wow. This is an awesome, refreshing oud fragrance. Over the past two years, oud has become my favorite note. Of course, that means a lot of my favorite fragrances are suitable mostly for summer and autumn months. I have been on the hunt for an oud fragrance appropriate for my summer and spring rotation. Acqua di Parma Colonia Oud satisfies that craving perfectly.

Admittedly, I didn't enjoy the fragrance at first, but it quickly became the one sample I kept returning to. The word that comes to mind every time I sniff my decant is "juicy." The bergamot and orange are almost edible in this fragrance; coupled with the oud and elegant leathers, you have a masterpiece of a fragrance. Arguably the best AdP has ever produced.

I'll add finally that this is most appropriate for business-casual to formal attire. You'll definitely smell sophisticated with this one.

Scent: 10/10
Performance: 7/10

product_name: Colonia Oud Acqua di Parma
review_content: This is one of my favourite oud fragrances. Amazing scent. It evokes a special feeling in me. Longevity is very good! and sillage is perfect. Performance is top. Just 2 sprays enough.

product_name: Colonia Oud Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Smells like a particularly cheap urinal-cake, with lots of really unsettling chemical notes. Don’t really know what else to say. Very very strong and headache-inducing. Don’t understand the hype one bit.

Scent: Horrible
Sillage/projection: Beast-mode
Longevity: Beast-mode

product_name: Colonia Oud Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Adding to my previous review:

On my skin, I get average/good projection in the first hour, moderate/low projection in the following 3/4hours before settling as a skin scent. Good longevity, as I can still detect it after 12 hours and a shower (as a subtle skin scent). That said, unlike previous reviewers, it is no beast on my skin, and doesn't perform better than Colonia Ambra.

The opening is a little disappointing, as I get an impression leather (despite there's no leather accord - the pyramid is inaccurate) and the usual wet wood note (a little amped up) supposed to give an impression of oud (no real oud oil here, probably just cypriol, like in Colonia Ambra), like in other designer oud frags, with an added supporting orange note. Then it transition through an elegant musky/soapy stage. The drydown is much more interesting though, with a woody/musky drydown, quite similar to Colonia Ambra (rounder in Oud, since there's no ambergris tincture).
To me, the opening/heart seems like a fine-tuned/high-quality version of Versace Oud Noir (or should I say the opposite, since Versace ON has been released 1 year after this one). It wouldn't surprise me if the same -unknown- perfumer authored both.

Whichever you choose - Colonia Oud or Colonia Ambra - you can't go wrong with either. They are definitely of the same family: indeed, of the 9 olfactive notes of Colonia Oud, 6 are shared with Colonia Ambra. The latter is fresher and more casual, while Oud is woodier/warmer, and maybe a little more formal. Personally, I chose Colonia Ambra, as it's a little funnier and interesting imho, even if more linear than Colonia Oud.

As always, try before you buy!
30+, colder evenings

product_name: Colonia Oud Acqua di Parma
review_content: Impressions: smells modern, something a socialite would wear.

product_name: Colonia Oud Acqua di Parma
review_content:
An unbelievable masterpiece of perfumery, Acqua di Parma's Colonia Oud smells like nothing else out there. It's a dark citrus-oud combination with premium ingredients like Calabrian bergamot essential oil from Italy as well as amyris essential oil (West Indian sandalwood). Usually oud fragrances pair the oud with rose, vanilla, patchouli, or amber, but this goes a unique direction by pairing the oud with Italian citrus, sandalwood, and leather. This is another masculine power scent, akin to the feeling I get from smelling Creed Aventus or Mancera Cedrat Boise (but not smelling anything like them at all). I can't really describe how it smells too well since the ingredients are blended so well, so one would have to simply smell this for themselves. Colonia Oud is one of my favourite fragrances of all time. Projection is moderate leaning strong, while it also has the best longevity out of all the Acqua di Parma line, projecting well for over 5 hours. Overall this is the greatest thing Acqua di Parma has ever released in my opinion (along with the minty green Colonia Club, another of my favourites).

5/5

product_name: Colonia Oud Acqua di Parma
review_content: If this didn't have oud in its name, I wouldn't be aware of any oud. But maybe it's just my newbie nose. Not recommended if you don't like leather. This actually made me kinda dizzy.

product_name: Colonia Oud Acqua di Parma
review_content: This is one of the most unique scents in my collection. The oud is present but it's very subdued. The citrus and leather are the prominent stars of this composition. Works well in both cool and warm weather (I wore this to dinner one night during a vacation in Mexico. Got nothing but complements from other vacationers.) This is definitely a long lasting complement monster, but do not blind buy this. Get a sample first because this may not be for everyone. 9/10 from me!

product_name: Colonia Oud Acqua di Parma
review_content: I don't get any oud, but I do get a lot of leather. Also, opens like a really sweet and fresh, fruity/citrusy popscicle. Coriander disappears after the opening, and no, it won't make you smell like indian food, it's really fresh and uplifting. I think this perfume can be worn even in summer, definitely a scent for the entire year. First fresh/fruity, non-oriental oud scent I've encountered. On my skin, performance is so-so. Not like people described the old formulation. Better than a freshie, but definitely no powerhouse.

product_name: Colonia Oud Acqua di Parma
review_content:
This is going by memory from when I had a while back. Wore it a lot, so remember it well.
I wasn't overly crazy about it. Very heavy and almost oily. Not very elegant, or sophisticated. Quiet linear, as in I remember the smell not evolving too much.
Leathery oudy dark and medicinal If I remember right. I've smelt ouds from other houses and I find they all smell very similar but with obvious deviations, but similar still..
All this sounds negative, but I funilly miss it... It's a bold masculine confident smell! For better of worse, you know your wearing quality, you smell good, though others around might not agree..

product_name: Colonia Oud Acqua di Parma
review_content: Oh boy I had to scrub this absolute turd juice right off. Not pleasent at all imo.

product_name: Colonia Oud Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Tested on paper strip. Beautiful oud.

Fall/Spring evenings, 30+


Edit: I retested it on paper. Unfortunately, I made the mistake to stop by the booth of MFK just before that, to smell MFK Oud (both the EDP and the Extrait de Parfum), and that killed the show.
Of course, one can tell that AdP costs half of MFK... but there's barely any oud in AdP's Oud Colonia. It's a nice fragrance taken in its own, that keeps the fresh original Colonia vibes, a little more leathery. If it's and oud-centered fragrance you're looking for, pass on that one!
That said, the non heady oud and citrus freshness make it one of the few (if not only) oud containing fragrance that could be worn in Summer evenings, assuming it's not extremely hot.

Edit 2: tested on skin. Very elegant, good projection. Will buy a full bottle soon.

Edit 3: testing it again today. No Oud in this one (other than the usual oud-like wet wood note found in any mainstream designer oud frag), but it's not a dealbreaker, as I find the leather/patchouli heart followed by the sandalwood/musk drydown beautiful (better than Colonia Leather's drydown).

product_name: Colonia Oud Acqua di Parma
review_content: Skanky with a cumin vibe. Fresh enough for the first hour or so and then descends to the depths of inequity.

product_name: Colonia Oud Acqua di Parma
review_content: It is an unparalleled fragrance. Acqua di Parma colony Oud leaves its mark. The sign of that warm and at the same time sparkling trail. Have you ever smelled the freshly polished wood with a brush? It is a fantastic creation!

product_name: Colonia Oud Acqua di Parma
review_content: This is a good oud scent. Phenomenally fresh. Citric ,woody and dirty. I mean its very good compared to how other brands do it, but this more for a Man thats 35 and Up, or maybe any one that is well dressed. Its Fresher than what I'm use to, not overly strong. Its polished, refined, and sophisticated, I give it that. I'll stick with Jo Malone's Oud and Bergamot, its more tune for the younger generation.

product_name: Colonia Oud Acqua di Parma
review_content: After my 100ml bottle ran dry I picked up 180ml thinking I'm covered. However I noticed a difference upon spraying. I got the last spray or 2 out of my old bottle and did a side by side with the new one..and to my dismay it's been reformulated. Clearly they are both similar but the new formulation lacks the freshness of the old. The leather in the new one is slightly more creaky with the toned down freshness. I subsequently returned the bottle. My advice get a batch code with 6/7 digits ignore the 4 digit ones which are the new formulation. The aesthetics have also changed ever so slightly in bottle cap colour and darkness of the glass giving away also new formulation.

product_name: Colonia Oud Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I’m glad I didn’t blind buy this - even though I’m a big AdP fan.

On paper this fragrance smells of dominant citrus notes and on my skin I really only get old leathery notes and not much Oud at all... classic top quality AdP ingredients, however, and Colonia Oud remains strong on my skin even after I try to wash it off.

Great if you like leathery fragrances but not so much if you seek Oud.

product_name: Colonia Oud Acqua di Parma
review_content: This is a stunner- so glad I got a 5ml decant. 9.10

product_name: Colonia Oud Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I have usually not had good experiences with ADP fragrances before prmarily because of longevity issues. But this baby changes it all wow! I love the scent, the dry down and the longevity and am considering switching to this as my all weather signature scent! It's a stunner and although I never wear scents for compliments this one got quite a few in the 3 days that I have owned it.

A must have for the fine mature gentleman connoisseur amongst you.

scent: 9
sillage: 7
longevity: 8 (8-10hrs solid)
value: 8

product_name: Colonia Oud Acqua di Parma
review_content: When you spray aventus or sauvage or acqua di gio profumo or bleu de chanel , all around said that they smell it before , this is my most unique perfume at all

product_name: Colonia Oud Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Aventus killer.

Finally an Acqua Di Parma I'll be happy to wear! Being Italian I've always wanted to have at least one in collection but so far nothing from the Colonia line had worked for me, although the scents are gorgeous they turn out too soapy, flowery and granmotherish.

This one is rather PERFECT. Elegant, fresh but deep, refined, unique, sexy (the first sexy scent I smell from ADP) and a KING OF VERSATILITY! The more I smell it and the more I can imagine me wearing it in EVERY... I repeat because it's quite rare... E-V-E-R-Y kind of weather, season, time of the day or night, context or occasion.

The only fragrance it reminds me of JUST A LITTLE BIT is Zoologist Rhinoceros, but without the booze and that Vicks Vaporub feel that I found really weird and hard to wear.

It can be a signature scent without any problem whatsoever.

10 out of 10 fragrance, one of the best ever smelled. And can I say something surely unpopular: it's an Aventus killer. I don't mean it smells similar, it doesn't, but can serve exactly the same purposes perfectly, it's niche quality too and way less expensive.

product_name: Colonia Oud Acqua di Parma
review_content:
It's an EdC indeed because after 2 hours all the initial complexity (which I love) is gone.
What remains - sticking out like a sore thumb - is a single aroma chemical. It reminds of isopropyl alcohol, maybe by some perceived as "medicinal". Unfortunately that one note lasts well beyond the 8 hour mark.
Only a fool would expect actual oud oil in this but some form of oud accord would have been nice. In conclusion AdP Oud is about as much about oud as is WD40.
For a seriously crafted scent, consider a look at what Heeley has to offer.

product_name: Colonia Oud Acqua di Parma
review_content: WOW! Well crafted and extremely balanced from start to finish. Great longevity and sillage. The most unique Oud fragrance I own or have tried. It has the AdP dna for sure but the juice is so much more than the usual. Nice citrus with spice with a soapy type oud and musk combination with hints of leather. Exceptional IMO. A must have. Full bottle worthy. If you find this juice in your price range grab it up. Enjoy!

product_name: Colonia Oud Acqua di Parma
review_content: I dont have a problem to use this perfume for the rest of my life , i own creed aventus, dior sauvage parfum, versace eros, acqua do gio profumo, valentino uomo intense. Acqua di parma oud is my most complimented fragrance , i get 5 complements in one day

product_name: Colonia Oud Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Fragrance -Colonia Oud Acqua di Parma
Bottle from - 2016

In my opinion,this fragrance is one of the best oud-leather combo on the planet.
Colonia Oud opens on my skin with a fresh,elegant,clean and citrusy oud with dominant bergamot and with a hint of spicy,green and a bit woody and resinous coriander laying on top of a fine leather.
Soon enough,during mid development,coriander becomes stronger,more spicy and more woody with a strong presence of clean oud and fine leather and with a nice touch of a bit rich,woody,balsamic and well-known fixative amyris(amyris-often referred to as West Indian Sandalwood, due to its similar aroma- it is a practical, less expensive alternative to Sandalwood essential oil).I can detect a hint of divine rose,but it's not listed in the notes.
This all leads into a woody,leathery,musky,a bit dry and oudy base with dominant oud,leather and cedar and with a wisper of musk,sandalwood and a bit earthy patchouli.
It has some similarities to Colonia Leather by Acqua di Parma.

Longevity - 10/10(10+ hours)
Silage/Projection - 9/10(heavy projection and silage for the first 3-4 hours,than sits closer to skin for the duration of the scent's evolution)
Weather -For more or less any time of year.I personally wouldn't wear this on a really hot summer days.
Age - 26+
Compliments - 8/10
Scent - 10/10

Main notes according to me - oud,leather,coriander,amyris,cedar,bergamot.

The drydown is woody,leathery,musky,a bit dry and oudy and I get some -oud,leather,musk,sandalwood and patchouli.

Emotions - sophisticated,classy,refined,profound,elegant, distinguished.

Occasion -Perfect for special occasions,life defining moments,formal and semi-formal events.

This is the scent of a distinguished gentleman.

product_name: Colonia Oud Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Sold my Colonia Intensa oud bottle last year and bought a bottle of Colonia oud for a reasonable price and what can I say. I did like colonia intensa a lot but I thought it was too good to use in school or at work and I never really used it except on one wedding in a relatively warm autumn evening (not the best time as it was a winter scent). I was kinda missing the luxury smell of colonia intensa and I got an opportunity to buy a bottle of colonia oud (very similar to intensa according to fragrantica) and to my surprice, it is identical to colonia intensa oud. I dont feel any difference at all. The oud is really nice and modern with some minty notes.

Scent: 9/10
Projection: 9/10
Longevity: 8/10

product_name: Colonia Oud Acqua di Parma
review_content: Contrary to most reviews there is a lot of oud in here it’s unwearable for someone who despises oud.

product_name: Colonia Oud Acqua di Parma
review_content: Another winner from AdP. Colonia Oud has a nice citrus/woody opening, then gets pretty linear with the oud and leather with the orange faintly in the background. Although the oud is definitely present throughout, I was really surprised with how dominant the leather is. You could almost call it a leather fragrance with oud in it. Regardless, they both share the main stage while the other notes take a back seat. For a cologne concentration, this performs really well, more like an EDT so don't worry about longevity. Overall, it's one of the best and easy to wear oud fragrances I've worn.

product_name: Colonia Oud Acqua di Parma
review_content: This Fragrance is simply amazing! The best Oud Fragrance money can buy and it lasts forever, The Dry Down is pure mystical magic, Perfect fall/winter evening scent & My girlfriend Loves it. 3 sprays of this bad boy and you’re good to go.

product_name: Colonia Oud Acqua di Parma
review_content: Why is there no rose note listed? It is the most forward note. Am I nuts? This smells a lot like Zegana’s oud with a bit less rose. Also, very similar to the Guerlain Oud that just came out. It does have ridiculously long longevity. I’m sitting here at least 14 hours after I put it on this morning and it is still going strong.

product_name: Colonia Oud Acqua di Parma
review_content:
This is a royal scent.

One of the best smelling fragrances ever that I have tried. Beautiful, noble, so sophisticated and luxurious.

I second the below comment by @chillzz1230 "Hands down best Oud. Nothing comes close. Pure magic in a bottle."

The lightest, softest and most wearable oud touch with amazing citruses and woods.

Extremely better than Creed Royal Oud in my opinion although I am a Creed Fan.

Impossible to be disliked. If you find it discounted go blind buy and you will never regret.

Great longevity and projection.

One disadvantage though is that I detect ambroxan (not listed) in the drydown which I am not really a big fan of.

product_name: Colonia Oud Acqua di Parma
review_content: Fantastic!

product_name: Colonia Oud Acqua di Parma
review_content: I purchased a 5ml miniature of this in a lovely little satin lined box for my other half, it was awful on him, not to be deterred I tried some , well what a powerhouse this one is , I sort of liked it but it was far too masculine , it's been sitting around for a good year as I couldn't seem to tame this beast down, last week I received a 6ml decant of the original body shop vanilla oil, first I applied a drop of the beast on my wrist followed by the vanilla oil , no , the beast took over, today I applied the vanilla oil to my wrist first then a tiny bit of the beast , well bingo, it smells divine, 4 hours later and it's still like I just applied it, that's going some for me as my skin seems to eat perfume, even the heady ones don't last well on me, so pleased I kept it .

product_name: Colonia Oud Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Foram 0,5 ml de puro prazer olfativo com a amostra que ganhei.

Marcante, intenso e muito presente porem sem ser indiscreto.

Tem permanência residual muito interessante.

Difícil de achar por aqui, Brasil.

product_name: Colonia Oud Acqua di Parma
review_content: What makes this frag really great is the marvelous balance here between oud and amyris (torchwood oil), modulated by the leathery base. It softens the otherwise somewhat violent agarwood notes while respecting all the dimensions of this oud's outstanding scent.

product_name: Colonia Oud Acqua di Parma
review_content:
For me, this fragrance is one of the best oud base scents I'ver ever smelled!

It starts with a nice juicy citrucy note with some woods in the back and 5/10 min later the oud starts to take place to be the main character of this beautiful fragrance.

It's a very clean, a bit fresh and elegant oud, very well blended with a leather accord, which gives the scent more warmth and depth.

10/10!

product_name: Colonia Oud Acqua di Parma
review_content: Buddy of mine wanted to go fragrance shopping. We went to all the major stores blommys, saks, and bergdorf in nyc. Fast forward 100 fragrances smelled later and my friend decided to buy intoxicated by killian, it smelled really good however not as good as colonia oud I have to say this is the best oud i have ever smelled better than royal oud, TF oud wood or oud mineral this blows it out of the water i have to get this i have a decent collection and i have to buy this. When you first spray this it fills the air then settles to a beautiful leather oud scent i cant explain how good this is definitely an A++++

product_name: Colonia Oud Acqua di Parma
review_content:
This has one of the best opennings I've experienced in a long time.
I will be ordering a bottle as soon as I finish my review.
Great first impression!
Some have said they can't wait for the citrus to settle? I think they are great in the opening, well blended with the darker notes, and you get such an enjoyable burst of contrasts.
I like the smell of a strong oud, but sometimes they can be too heavy, this is bright and wearable, a daily driver someone described it on YouTube.

Atelier Colognes have a philosophy of making their fragrances fresh and cologne like, even their heavier frags like Oud Saphir. This also still has the original Colonia Intensa cologne freshness, with a vague synthetic oud and leather. It does not smell of high quality notes like TF Oud Wood, but they crafted a very pleasant and wearable fresh oud frag.

I am selling my M-7, to get a bottle of this. I have M-7 Fresh also, this is warmer darker, smoother than M-7 Fresh, but it's fresher and fruitier than M-7. M7 is a much better fragrance, a true oud, but I am more into fresher frags now.

Some Oud lovers I heard say this is their #1 Oud, or top 3. After Creed Royal Oud, this is my #2. TF Oud Wood is richer, and amazing scent, but it's not nearly as wearable, comfortable as Acqua di Parma Oud.
This wears like a rich cologne or reminds me of a fougere, yet it has those beautiful darker notes of oud and leather.
There are some slightly sweet woody notes, maybe the Elemi resin ( tourchwood).

There is a bit of powderiness to it, I don't like powder, but it's nice here, just makes it soft and ads to the wearability.

PS: On second thought, I may not get this. The opening burst of notes was great, but then it quiets down too much, and becomes more of a nice aromatic. So performance and quality of notes not too high. This is only cologne strength, not edt or edp.

Well I did find a good deal and pulled the trigger, it is very wearable and pleasant. Not much oud though, once you get past the openning, it's more of a soft leather, with warm and fresh spiciness, citrus.
Projection is softly moderate, longevity average.

The Intensa Oud is not more intense, it is the same frag.
This is over priced for what you get performance wise. I guess I'm used to finding better discounts, this is not discounted much. It should be around $100 for what you get.
For the great scent alone it's worth a bit more.

PS: I ended up selling my bottle after a few day. I think it's over hyped, not much oud, or leather that you can pick out,
an indistinct synthetic mishmosh.
I purchased Oud Saphir, a high quality fresh Oud and leather frag. It's discounted from $250 retail for $108. on Amazon.

Rating: 7/10

God bless John 3:16

product_name: Colonia Oud Acqua di Parma
review_content: One of my favourite. The opening is citrus with the woody notes in the background. This smell is most likely linear. In the base is musk and leather . Leather is not dominant here , only a supplement to rich and deep oud mixed with amyris. Love this so much, using with so much pleasure!

product_name: Colonia Oud Acqua di Parma
review_content: Hands down best Oud. Nothing comes close. Pure magic in a bottle.

product_name: Colonia Oud Acqua di Parma
review_content: First _ I LOVE this house. Nice opening and short middle --but the dry-down is just too BLUNT. Oud needs a support team (see: TOM FORD's Oud Wood). Smells like old antique furniture in a dry basement.

product_name: Colonia Oud Acqua di Parma
review_content: A masterpiece. Hands down my favorite men's Acqua di Parma fragrance. The dry down after a full day's wear is utterly delicious. The citrus and musk is so skillfully blended that it allows the oud to take center stage.

product_name: Colonia Oud Acqua di Parma
review_content:
OH ADP COLONIA ouD, THE TIMES WE HAD TOGETHER. No ONE WILL EVER UNDERSTAND HOW YOU CHANGE LIVES, I HAVE SMELLED 1000 FRAGRANCES IVE WITHOUT YOUR CONCENT AND I TRUELY AM SORRY FOR YOU ARE THE ONLY FRAGRANCE THAT IS PERFECT 10 IN EVERYWAY, ONE WHO HASNT EXPERIENCED YOUR DRIFT JUST WILL NEVER UNDERSTAND HOW PERFECT YOUR BLEND IS.


Yours truely.

product_name: Colonia Oud Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Oud, where is the oud?

I think this was named by the same person who named Royal Oud from Creed, the latter having a tad bit more of oud than this one

Update: there's faint oud in the drydown, but I still don't see this marketed at oud lovers, there's about a million oud perfumes and oils that have more oud, and you can actually get some real oud for the same price.
I'm not a fan of this one at all

product_name: Colonia Oud Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I LOVE this one. It smells like what I imagine an old world aristocrats office smells like. I don't want to share it with you savages ;)

this is fantastic for cooler nights and is beastly so I go light on the trigger. a little dab will do ya.

product_name: Colonia Oud Acqua di Parma
review_content: Pure magic, I find this fragrance gets better as the day goes on. My skin does not do well with most fragrances I use ending in poor longevity, but not this powerhouse! Di Parma Colonia Oud screams money and class.

product_name: Colonia Oud Acqua di Parma
review_content: It might be just my decant though, because I am not getting the beast performance every one here boast about. To me, its just an eau de cologne. Its not bad, its a very safe, day time, office friendly scent. Lately I have been getting a lot of weird looks at the office, ever since I started wearing more... creative type of frags such as Oud Ispahan and Jubilation 25, I think its time to dial back a little bit.

product_name: Colonia Oud Acqua di Parma
review_content: First of all I simply love it, and if heaven smells like this, I'm already there. The fragrance is classy at first spray, and if you feel a bit down, air filled with this will give you a boost. Forget generic perfumes. Yes, it smells really strange, in a way that you have not smelled it before. It is smooth, not too invasive. There is a rose undertone to it and that goes on and on, so if you're not into rose as a guy, you'll struggle. Yes, I get a distinct leathery scent as well, and that is quite nice. The combination is intriguing. I will definitely wear it more. It does not by far smell cheap alcohol-based perfume and it does not deteriorate to something unrecognizable over time. It stays pretty much the same and that is good, because you'll get reminded how good it smells over and over again. Was it worth the money? I say yes to that. You'll get a fine and distinct fragrance with the longevity of Methuselah.

product_name: Colonia Oud Acqua di Parma
review_content: Disappointing. I was expecting more leathery oud to go with the citrus. In the end its just a soapy clean concoction, ok for office use.

product_name: Colonia Oud Acqua di Parma
review_content:
When I read reviews about it and oud fragrances review, I mush interest for purchase oud fragrances. I also use oud fragrances which made in Saudia Arabia, but when i use this item more interesting only 1 or 2 sprays much more for day and long lasting. nose behind this fragrances more sniff like and like for want to smell.
Great fragrance specially for special occasion, but this fragrance is more costly and not affordable for every person and not available in every shop. specially demand i can be purchase.
I impressed by this perfume and much like it. I honestly write for if u like oud can purchase it. more impressed and most remarkable personality perfume. Long lasting is good more than on my skin 12 hours intense smell on about 6 hours and other on more than 8 hours.
Top fragrance.

product_name: Colonia Oud Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Many are lukewarm about this juice, as it seems that anytime a house these days prints the word 'Oud' on a bottle the chips are not stacked in favor of the house for a welcome reception. The word 'Oud' is clearly overused by the industry as a whole, but that is the topic of another post.

The opening of bergamot and orange peel are the primary kicker here and follow this all the way to dry down. ADP do the bergamot orange peel dance very well, all be it in a straight forward manner. Any 'Oud', whatever this rather vague word means, is to be found in a smoky backdrop that informs the orange peel; supports it I suppose in a most lazy sort of way. I use this liberally during the summer months, as i find this scent just forward enough to present a certitude that I find missing from most, if not all, aquatics or citrus bombs that littler the market. Interchange one for another these days, but I digress.

Sample first, as with everything, but for those with a nose towards the woody side of scent this juice has legs. Bottle worthy in fact.

Longevity as a skin scent is strong. I have very dry skin and get a full eight hours. Projection is minimal which during the summer I find is preferable.

product_name: Colonia Oud Acqua di Parma
review_content: Boss scent all the way, powerfull men can pull this off. Definetly suited for older men with status.

product_name: Colonia Oud Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Why does Fragrantica have two different pages for the same fragrance with simply a name change?

Come on now..

Anyways, this is a fantastic fragrance! Strong as hell, and unique. It's not the typical rose/oud - this is different! And it's delicious. One of my favorite fragrances.

Highly recommended to at least check it out!

product_name: Colonia Oud Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Can we be real here for a moment and acknowledge that this Oud is nice but it (like most of the ADP line) does not really deserve some of the praise heaped onto it out there?

They are all nice (except club, that is not nice) but I went all gung-ho into bloomingdales yeaterday ready to finally pick up a few different bottles and was so disappointed by the actual quality versus the cost.

Tom Ford's Oud Wood does this ADP oud's job much better in nearly every way.

Is there something I'm missing here?

product_name: Colonia Oud Acqua di Parma
review_content: Its the same fragrance, they just removed the "intensa". If your bottle says colonia intensa then that just means you have an older bottle. Thank you. That is all.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content:
TWO

Not a go-to for me; this is a report after finishing a 2 ml decant. I picked it up to compare with my all-time summer favorite (Dior Homme Cologne) and a shoulder-season staple (Bergamote 22).

BdC smells great, especially if you like citrus (I do). It is less “iced lemonade” than Dior Homme Cologne and more like the whole fruit.

TL;DR: A photoreal take on an Italian citrus most of us have not smelled in person. Bright citrus-green opening that settles into a light woody-musky hush. Polite, easy, pleasant, but likely to underwhelm on performance, especially projection.

Rating:
Opening: 4.1/5
Drydown: 2.8/5
Overall: 3.5/5

Opening
Fresh-cut bergamot on a board. Knife through peel and pith, oils mist up with a green-bitter spritz. The interior is ripe enough to read a touch sweet. Sweet, acidic, and green at once. The blend is seamless; I do not see edges between the citrus, ginger, and bergamot. Together they paint a convincing bergamot portrait.

The issue: despite smelling fantastic, it lies flat on my skin. Detectable at about two feet, but it does not seem to want to be smelled. Where Dior Homme Cologne leaps off my skin, this is reticent and almost apologetic.

Heart
No distinct heart notes on me; it stays linear. At about 90 minutes I am still getting that beautiful bergamot, just closer to skin.

For a fresh scent, it is oddly dense, like the aroma is bound up in the fruit’s oil and cannot quite escape.

Drydown
The opening thins to skin level around 3-4 hours. By about 4.5 hours it is a soft, slightly creamy (benzoin?) skin-musk.

A faint musk trace sticks around 6-8 hours, but only with your nose on skin. Nice to wake up to, but no one else will notice.

Performance on me
