product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content: I'm not usually a fan of citrus-based scents but I absolutely love this fragrance. Heartbreaking that it doesn't last long at all. What a damn shame cause this is a happy day in a bottle!

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content:
This is a citrus bomb on my skin with a hint of ginger but no other notes. It lasts in cold weather (50 degrees) at least 6 hours on my extremely dry skin and has a nice scent trail for several hours. I live in the Arizona desert so it is hot most of the year here. I’m unsure how this fragrance does above 90 degrees but I bought it in November when we were still in 90s and it lasted about 4 hours as strong skin scent. I love it! I plan to buy the lotion and shower gel to increase time it lasts. Not sure why other reviewers had bad luck with it.

This is unisex and a safe blind buy. I receive compliments and zero complaints on scent. FragranceNet.com sells samples which is how I tested it first before buying it on sale.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Bergamotto di Calabria is a citrus aromatic. It projects with a stingy zesty citrus accord, between bergamot and citron. It's awakening, invigorating, and has a touch of candy-like sweetness to it. Not sure what the concentration here is, but the aroma dies down hard after the opening, and shortly after is very hard to pick up (unless presumably you have a virgin nose).

I think this one had so much more potential for greatness, but possibly Acqua di Parma is playing hard ball here, and doesn't wish to cater to the underlying problems of people. Instead, they might be taking a page out of Ralph Lauren's book, and are seeking to force people into finding a more effective solution for their problems (in the sense of some olfactory rejuvenation therapy). Although the formula here is a bit simple and linear, the fragrance is so good that it would probably be well worth the effort. That's just the classic style of Italian cologne.

You could always bathe in it I guess, but not sure how popular that's going to make you with all those sensitive noses out there amongst the crowd. I really enjoy this one for its style and flare, and would suggest just wearing it on the skin, so that you can freshen up regularly without it becoming overbearing to anyone.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Citrus fizzle. Looks like it's unanimous then - I smelled this without reading any of the reviews here and had exactly the same experience. Soaringly gorgeous, bright, zingy, tingly, sunny, fresh-air bergamot, exactly that delicious tang that makes good Earl Grey tea so refreshing. Just beautiful. Puts a smile on your face and makes you think of clear blue skies. Perfectly unisex, utterly charming. And this after I've had a string of failures with other AdPs which looked great on paper but turned too cheap / butch / aftershave-y to work on my female skin.

Drawback: lasts for an hour, at most. Aaaargh! Che fiasco! In a perfect universe maybe I'd buy a one-litre bucket of this and spritz myself with it hourly. In this one, AdP have scored an own goal making Bergamotto di Calabria, because it's persuaded me I really need a bergamot perfume for summer 2019 and I want to explore the note further, but I know for sure I won't be paying out for AdP's take on it.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Yes it smells good, Its a go if you like bright crispy scents..

Here is how it smells to me, Its like a an expensive lemon/ lime & citrus house hold cleaner.

The bad, the performance is just bad, doesn't last. Maybe a 30 minute blast of citrus, ginger and cedar, then nothing at all on the skin. You'll have to spray every hour .

From a Mans' perspective, ADP Ginepro, Cedro and Cipresso are the very best, classics at that.

More feminine

Perris Monte Carlos' Bergamotto is way better. Try it

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content:
An effervescent bergamot opening leads to a rather non descriptive middle and end. It’s all about the top notes with this one. Fleeting as they may be, for those few glorious moments they do shine brighter than the sun, and take you away on a temperate summer vacation.

Sillage and projection are non existent

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content: Bitter orange and lemon, citrus, Froot Loops, fades quickly. No.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content: Very good scent, ruined by a poor performance. A pity, indeed.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Nice scent and high quality citrus notes, like other Blu Mediterraneo line fragrances but always I have a problem with this line: weak performance on my skin :(
I love this line very much.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content: Apparently I wasn't born with the right pH to allow me to enjoy hours upon days of longevity that other Fragranticans report. I unfortunately don't get 24 hours after a gym workout and two showers with only a single spray which my wife delivered from the next room. It's a shame because a fragrance budget of about $150 could last a lifetime.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content: Gorgeous, gorgeous bergamot, lime, and lemon scent. Some floral undertones, but little in the way of base notes to lend it longevity. Even used in layering, it only lasts an hour or two, at most. Sillage and longevity are both quite poor, but it smells BRILLIANT when still on the skin. "Good-to-very good," 85/100.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content: Very high quality lemon citrus scent, perfect for summer. But as others have said, very poor longevity. So poor in fact, that I cannot detect this after just 20 mins. Such a shame as the scent is so good.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content: I have to agree with Thee Maestro and say I don't have any problem with the longevity either. 2 or 3 sprays and I can smell this all day. It's a great bergamot scent, the type I'd been seeking for a while, from a lovely line of fragrances.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content: Fresh, pleasant, very short lived.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Crisp citrus scent that is so true to it's name. I thoroughly enjoyed it and I enjoyed it for a long time.
I don't get performance issues at all, it lasted a full work day. Sillage was effortless for this gem, projection was not bad either, I'm really confused by some reviews, it's like we're not reviewing the same scent at all.

Lovely summer scent, I recommend it, but having read the reviews here, I'd say beware the danger of counterfeit fragrances, especially with these niche fragrances!!

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content: The most beautiful uplifting citrus scent I've ever smelled. Very pure and high quality bergamont and Italian lemon. The only drawback is the performance which is not the best in the world. I get 3-5 hrs of solid longevity.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content:
It's a nice fragrance, but on my skin it's too acid and doesn't smell as good as it sprayed in the air.
Very poor longevity. There are better fragrances in Blu Mediterraneo in my opinion.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content: A beautiful fresh citrus opening which turns into Yardley's lemon verbena soap after five minutes (not a bad thing) and then lightens up a little and is joined by vetiver. As with a few of the other AdPs I'm finding I really enjoy the top notes but am left a little dissatisfied by what comes next. This is a beautiful fragrance, no doubt about it - if you're after the definitive soapy lemon fragrance, this could be your dream come true.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Citrus opening, drying down to a sweet, woody set of middle notes. If there was vetiver in the mix then It was subtle to the point of being subliminal. That said, for something that's quite simple, this fragrance actually seemed to have a lot of character, for a couple of hours or so.

If I drew up a list of things I like about Bergamotto, it'd be a decently long list. But projection and value for money wouldn't feature. This stuff is expensive, and, for the price ADP are asking, it should last a lot longer and have far better sillage.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Whilst I agree that the initial zesty citrus fades in 20-30mins, what it leaves stays for a reasonable few hours. It is subtle though; but in a pleasing way that suggests it's gone deeper into the skin... like how chlorine does after a swim in a public pool, but with no similarities in fragrance!

It's sweet and floral, but believable. Some fragrances are strong enough to suggest they are masking something - this is not one of those.

Plus, I'm allergic to a lot of AdP fragrances, so far not this one!

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content: Totally agree with Happyme2009 below. Smells great, then evaporates in less than 10 minutes. Looking into if I can return it.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content:
One of the biggest wastes of money thrown away in my entire life as a parfume collector.
I wanted this for the longest time . It's pricey and honestly, a mockery of a perfume.
Water with a few drops of bergamotte oil . Divine, zingy, sublime, for all the 30 seconds it lasts . After that it changes into a skin scent that lasts a little more, and then it vanishes without a trace . Even on clothes is gone in no time.
Absurd, and I was so expensive. I am really pissed off for wasting my birthday money on this . If I was the perfumerer who creates this , I'd be embarrassed . Seriously, not even worth $20, as for what I paid for it is simply obscene . $156 Ripoff. I am never buying another Blue Mediterraneo Edt, Never.
That being said, the smell, when you can actually smell it, it's the most natural lime and bergamotte you could dream of. I have a bottle of essential bergamotte oil next to me, they are very similar. Except that the oil was one tenth of the price of the perfume. So I guess I'll need to mix this edt with some essential oil and hope it becomes strong .... what a pity. It could have been the perfect summer fragrance . And keep in mind that I usually prefer not so strong fragrances.
My recommendation ? Don't buy . I did and I regret it. Swap anyone ? 150 ml bottle, with box, booklet, everything .

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content: Verry lemony..like you would pour some of those lemon cake extracts on your skin..not for me.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content: I had a sample given to me at Holt Renfrew. I was very excited for this scent. I was like "maybe I'll find a nice summer scent". I'll be honest I did, for about 10 minutes. Then poof! Gone. Has a sprite smell kind of vibe. Or rather it smells like what it tastes like. Not sure if I applied it wrong, but it was just after my shower. I'll give it another go soon. But for now, not worthy of a purchase.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Bergamot üzerine konumlanmış bir parfümün Türkiye de işi zor. Bizler limon kolonyası ile büyümüş bir nesiliz. Yani limon ve bergamot kokusunu aslında zihnen tüketmiş durumdayız. Tabiki halen keyif alıyorum ama ilk başta zihnime hücum eden o küçüklüğün kolonya hissi, ballandıra ballandıra anlatılan parfümleri bir anda 3. Lige gönderiyor. ADP nin bergamotu da aynı kaderi paylaşıyor malesef. İlk dakikalar zaten tam bir limon kolonyası bir y dakika sonra biraz ama biraz odunsu hava oluşuyor ve kolunuza sıkıp burnunuzu dayadıysanız bunu alabiliyorsunuz. Yoksa o da mümkün değil. Kalıcılık ve koku dağılımı oldukça zayıf. Keyifli mi ? Evet, eğer bergamot istiyorsanız keyifli. Zaten bergamot için sadece ADP ve Zegna alıyorum. Zegna biraz daha taze duruyor ve biraz daha kalıcılık konusunda iyi. Ancak her ikisi de sadece kendiniz için keyifli. Etrafınız muhtemelen yeni limon kolonyası kullandığınızı sanacaktır.
ADP keyifli bir iş çıkarmış ama dediğim gibi bu coğrafyada büyüyen birisi için bu bir parfüm değil. Sadece kaliteli bir kolonya havasında.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content: I'm glad I didn't get the full size bottle. I put this on... a lot of it and barely could smell anything. I don't even know what it really smells like. They must know their fragrances are weak (this one esp.) I guess as long as we buy it they don't feel the need to address the issue. The lotion lasts MUCH longer so I wear that now and to heck with the EDT.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I have a sample and I am HOOKED.

a casual, easy-to-wear, classy 09:00AM summer time fragrance.

I promise you, this will put a smile on your face.

**UPDATE: I actually bought this at a great price! This is just heavenly!

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Fantastic smell. Fresh, tangy and sweet at the same time, it gives you a pleasant feeling of cleanliness and soapy freshness. I just love it!!!

P.S. I have read comments complaining about poor sillage and/or projection. This type of smell - as all the Βlu Μediterraneo series- is meant to be delicate and discreet in a classy way. In no way is this a powerhouse nor was it meant to be. This is European elegance. So , for those looking for class and european "chic" this is it!

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content: Absolutely fantastic throughout. The citrus top is so fresh and true. Pricey but well worth it.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Love it! Great Fragrance for either summer or winter. Love the bergamot and lemon start with the soft Drydown, which is the best part. I keep smelling my wrist while wearing this one.

It also smells very natural.

Only wish the base would be stronger.

besides that the price is alright for 150ml.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content:
It's a nice and fresh citrus scent.
Easy to wear, most suitable for summer. Totally unisex in my opinion. Not very feminine, but not masculine either.
Basic lemony scent, a little too basic for that kind of price.
Quite fine, but for that price I would be able to find at least two bottles of good perfume.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content:
If only this (and many others from this house) worked on my skin, I'd be a very happy man.
I get very little from this beautiful fragrance. Very little at all. Spray, sniff - gone!

It's a recurring annoyance for me with the house of Acqua di Parma. Classy and wonderful as most of them that I've tried are, I am always left feeling somewhat disappointed.
I love the smells but the strength is wasted on me.

I have tried all the Blu Mediterraneo collection and (most of the) Colonia collection too and none of them last more than an hour on my skin giving me practically no projection / sillage. I mean, like nothing.

Sure, I get the amazing smells and adorable flavours they permit but they are nothing more than a skin scent on me. Maybe it's my DNA, although I have seen other similar comments.

It's for those reasons that I find them far too expensive and over-priced for what they offer you as a buyer. I've spent a small fortune buying some of these fragrances but sadly, I simply can't afford to justify making the same mistake again.

Yes, I know many people will strongly disagree with me and mention that we shouldn't expect all fragrances to be powerhouses, sending passers-by into an olfactory frenzy; but I definitely want something more to show for my money than what Acqua di Parma have offered me to date.
Damn!

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content: Tried this with my mother when we went out on my birthday. She liked it and said "It smells lemony." "That's the bergamot and lemons then" I replied. It's nice but doesn't seem to warrant the huge price tag for just a fresh citrus with a fairly generic and fast dry down. I am often disappointed with high end stuff. We ended up buying Next Eau Nude, which is quite sophisticated and Next Paradise, which my husband loves and is only £4 for 10ml.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Bergamotto di Calabria is a beautiful fragrance, simple, elegant and just lovely. I find it quite intoxicating.

Yes the performance is certainly not the best, but this is one of those rare moments for me when the overall effect of the fragrance makes up for it's performance woes IMO.

It does remind me slightly of Sel de Vetiver but only briefly. It also reminds me of Dior Homme Cologne to some extent, but it is better to my nose than the Dior. It reminds me of many fragrances in part, however none capture the magic that this possesses for me.

This is what I might have imagined Grace Kelly to waft of in "To Catch a Thief", though I realize the movie was in Nice.

I realize there are a million versions of this type of fragrance, but this for me is very, very special. It is the best of summer in a bottle.

8.5 overall while taking it's lacking performance into account.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content: smells great. but out of all the acdp blue line. This is by far the weakest. Gone after 1 hour. Too bad.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content: Bergamotto di Calabria has a pleasant citrusy opening that rapidly adds a spicy soapy component. The dry down, which develops quickly, is all about the ginger, bolstered by hints of cedar, musk, and benzoin. If you like ginger this fragrance might be for you, but be advised you're going to have to reapply it a lot: the longevity is very short. Very. I wanted to like BdC--I generally like all the notes that go into its formulation--but, at least on my skin, it really doesn't work. It seems thin, linear, uninteresting, and weak.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Such a nice juicy, bright opening. The bright opening of citrus tones stays for a good 20-30 minutes before the vetiver peeps through just barely.

Sitting on the beach, with a fruity drink in super hot weather is the picture this gives me. This definitely leans towards the masculine side.

The staying power is horrendous, which i am assuming is due to the bright opening which never really goes away. I'm not sure how anyone can justify paying the price of this fragrance for such lame longevity.

I will say if it lasted longer and has better performance, I would have to give in and buy it.

Scent: 7.5/10 (Nothing new, just smells really good)
Longevity: 3/10
Sillage: 3/10

Overall: Disappointing.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria is my first fragrance from the AdP Blu Mediterraneo line. This is a very fresh and enjoyable citrus fragrance, but for my money, Tom Ford's Italian Cypress is a far better "mediterranean" fragrance. I'm sure I'll try a few other AdP fragrances from this line. Suggestions are welcome.

Update: I've tried this several times now and although the opening is quite nice, I'm down to barely a skin scent in 2 hours. I'm sure it's me but I'm not going to upgrade to a full bottle.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria is the best begamot fragrance I have ever had..
it opens with citrus(bergamot and citron) then it turns to with ginger, cedar and vetyver..
I have smelled bergamot and citron and vetyver in this magnificent product the most. benzoin and musk Notes are very weak..
This fragrance has too short of a staying power.
but I really enjoy this scent ..

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria is a very pleasant citron scent with some bergamot and lime which sits next to the skin. As the lemony notes mostly fade away after an hour or two, it becomes a very gentle woody musk. It's very delicate but it does last quite a long time, around 6 or 7 hours before it starts to vanish properly off the skin.

Bergamotto di Calabria is the nicest of the Blu Med range by far. It's flexible in that it works day or night and any time of year and for any occasion. I like the bottle and the packaging too. However, I do think it is overpriced. The Blu Med range feels more like a marketing gimmick by AdP to get the cash registers ringing. The revivification of the company in the last twenty years has led to lots of new lines but very little of genuine top class merit for the money. BdC is a genuine unisex perfume and you could use it straight out the shower, getting back from work, going to bed, just about anything you want that relies on subtlety and discretion. If you want to make an impression or just smell your perfume after an hour, then it's not the one.

I like it but I wish it was stronger and lasted longer.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content: Green lime in a bottle .. That how I can describe it .

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content: Very fresh and clean scent! The lemon/citrusy notes are definitely noticeable. Unfortunately, this fragrance fades way too quickly and only lasts less than 10 minutes on my skin.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content: Very clean, very fresh, very ticklish on my nose. This scent is almost perfectly balanced on me. Perhaps it is a touch too ozonic, actually, but the lotion form of this scent rounds that out amazingly.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Bergamotto di Calabria is a straightforward lemon and bergamot fragrance on me. The citrus is aromatic and gently sweetened. The presence of cedar renders the scent a powdery woody texture, while the ginger brings a subtle cool, crystalline feeling to the citrus.

The sillage is soft and the longevity is around 6 hours. Although I'm more drawn towards the tart, juicy, sparkling interpretation of lemon, I did enjoy the cool citrus breeze of Bergamotto di Calabria immensely. It would definitely make a refreshing experience on a sultry summer day.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I believe it's unisex, so decided to try.
Very fresh, clean citrus with a dry understated woody finish. Didn't get any of the described spices, just the citrus and woody notes.
I wouldn't buy it for myself but would quite enjoy it on my man. Seems like a nice all-year round scent, mostly for daytime wear, but one would get away wearing it as a day-to-night fragrance too (might however need a top-up spritz towards the end of day).

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Amazing..!! The Acqua di Parma line is incredible and a “best kept secret” for fragrance perfumers…

I was reminded this morning of the clean and fresh feeling of wearing Acqua di Parma’s, Bergamotto di Calabria. This juice is good..!! Out of the bottle, you get the initial blast of bergamot notes followed by the dry-down into an extraordinary blend of citrus, ginger, green, and a whisper of vetiver notes. Somehow, I have managed to accumulate nine (9) of the Acqua Di Parma fragrances – each unique and amazing in their own identity, but all share a common citrus DNA. While Bergamotto di Calabria (BdC) is geared toward Spring and Summer wear, it does offer great flexibility during this timeframe – from casual outings to more formal events. I find that BdC lingers close to the body and unfortunately, last only about four (4) hours on me and clothing. But during that 4 hour window – whoa, this juice is good stuff.. Given the brevity and low sillage of the fragrance, I would suggest that BdC is “office safe” and will add that based on the note composition, BdC is totally unisex.

My final tally for Bergamotto di Calabria is 4.0 stars out of 5.0 stars. It is classy, refined, and will leave the wearer feeling clean and fresh. If this fragrance only had greater staying power, definitely a Top 5 fragrance. Based on my increased confidence level while wearing today, BdC comes with a solid recommendation to add to your collection and is a definite “love” in the fragrance community…

Enjoy your day and happy fragrance hunting…

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Bergamotto di Calabria embraces the semi-bitterness of the eponymous bergamot note, which stands out above all else and is mainly paired with a musk base.

I haven't tried many fragrances that rely solely on bergamot, not coupling it with another citrus or top note, but this is almost a refreshlingy bitter take on a citrus-heavy fragrance. Its opening only is slightly saltier and more acidic than its dry down. Longevity and projection are on par with most other ADP fragrances, good but not great.

Most reviews cite similarities to Dior Homme so I'd have to try that to compare, but as it stands, this is a pleasant warm weather day fragrance. Still debatable if it merits the Acqua di Parma price, cheaper designer options notwithstanding, but something that I imagine most men and some women could pull off in the summer especially. I probably wouldn't opt to buy this as I get a similar-enough experience from the cheap, grapefruit-based Elixir White by C.O. Bigelow, but some may find ADP BdC more compelling.

7 out of 10

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Overwhelming lemons. All I got was lemon. Not a deep or complex scent.

Edited to say after two hours of dry down I can't smell anything at all.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content: Lovely scent but try Dior homme cologne which is half the price...

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content: In my opinion it's the weakest of the Blue Mediterraneo scents. It has a mild citric tone, so never sharp, harsh and even less strong. The citric notes never stands out alone, being for the begining to end always mixed with a sweet tone, not candy like, maybe more like a mild flowery note (I can't identify it more acurately), just a bit sweet, to give a balance to the composition. As the others Acqua di Parma Blue Mediterraneo scents, everthing feels natural and in place.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content: I didn't love or hate it. It opened smelling exactly like orange flavored Pez candy and settled into a pleasant enough citrus zest smell. Not a particularly complex fragrance. You get all citrus all the time, at least on my skin to my nose. It may still be a little too cold in the Midwestern US for this, but it was warmish and sunny and I really wanted to try one of my AdiP samplers.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content:
VERY similar to Atelier's Grand Neroli, except this one has a slight bit more of a tangerine type of scent. It opens with a citrus blast, rapidly becomes a skin scent and then dies.

As much as I like the fragrance, I can't spend this kind of cash on something that has so little longevity. Grand Neroli is a much better buy.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content: This perfume makes for a very pleasant hour. First there's a very nice blast of fresh citrus for ten minutes or so, and then the ginger begins to dominate on my skin and it starts to smell deliciously like cookies. Still some citrus in the background but mostly sweet ginger. This split personality makes it interesting and great for every season, and if it lasted more than an hour I think I might love it. As it is, I like it very much.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content: A somewhat one note fragrance, this hesperidic offering from Acqua di Parma is definitely bright and cheerful. Intense citrus facets of bergamot are further amplified by citron, beautifully capturing both the sour and bitter notes found in the freshly peeled rind and pith of each. Unfortunately, this is all that one can appreciate, as the accompanying notes are so far relegated to the background as to be nonexistent. I am only able to note subtle nuances of ginger far into the dry down, which does pair nicely with the intense citrus. Rose and cedar are lost on me. Lastly, barely perceptible vetiver (here capturing its lemony and woody facets) is noted several minutes after applying. Like most other citrus based fragrances, its tenacity and sillage are weak. I prefer Creed's Neroli Sauvage over this. (147)

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content: My favourite of the Blu Mediterraneo iterations. It hits just the right tone for me in terms of freshness, with an intensely cool bergamot and lemon, but sadly lasts barely 30 minutes on my skin.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content:
To me, it smells like citrus, bergamot, soft pine and little ginger. Love it! It's so fresh, little sweet and yummy! Easy summer scent, but longevity is not great around 2 hours on my skin.

I prefer this version over the other citrusy fragrance from Blu Mediterraneo - Arancia di Capri . Arancia smels more masculine on me.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Zesty lemon !
This one is my forth favourite out of the blue line. Mandorlo being the first then Mirto then Fico Amalfi and now this. I am not sure if I will purchase it though because its true , the lasting power is not as good as with the others. But I usually don't mind that and just take it along and respray every hour ;).
This one is like sweet lemon pie. Very good !!!! Its so lemony and the ginger and ceader with the tonka is quite gourmandish to my nose. I can't resist it.
A great choice for warm summer days !
I still prefer Mirto and Fico as well as Mandorlo but if I ever add onto my colection it will likely be Bergamotto

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Bergamotto di Calabria Acqua di Parma
review_content: Another great smell from Acqua Di Parma, which lasts for all of 20 - 30 min, shame, why do they do this.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Colonia Pura Acqua di Parma
review_content: Words can’t describe this. 9.5/10

product_name: Acqua di Parma Colonia Pura Acqua di Parma
review_content: Just smelled like a musky bar of soap from your grandparents to me. The citrus and 'freshness' didn't come to play. Slightly spicy musky and not interesting, tried to remove it.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Colonia Pura Acqua di Parma
review_content: I'm obsessed with this cologne. Sucks that it legit doesn't last AT ALL.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Colonia Pura Acqua di Parma
review_content:
THREE

I went on a mission this summer to try neroli-forward traditional colognes. I hoped to find something fresh that fits a casual T-shirt vibe for Westside LA. I grabbed 5 ml decants of Neroli Portofino, Mandarino di Amalfi, Colonia Essenza, and Colonia Pura and wore them throughout the heat. Pura ended up my favorite of the bunch. The twist is that the whole “neroli cologne” lane ended up reading formal to me. Pura is less formal, which leaves it in a tricky spot. When I want a dressy cologne, I would reach for Mandarino di Amalfi, and for truly casual, I would go outside the lane. I’m sure I’ll finish off the decant next summer, but won’t re-buy.

TL;DR: Easier-going Essenza energy with an ozonic, airy opening, then a smoother floral-citrus where orange shows more than expected, finishing in a clean woody-musk that sits close. Clean, modern, polite. Casual feel in a traditionally formal genre. It does evolve from opening to heart to drydown; not wildly, but enough to feel like a journey. Probably a good wardrobe piece for someone who likes this scent profile, less so for me.

Rating:

Opening: 3.1/5
Drydown: 2.8/5
Overall: 5.9/10

Opening
Early ozonic hit. Petitgrain pushes a clear soapiness on my skin, stronger than I prefer. I had hoped that skipping neroli would avoid that effect, but petitgrain plus white musks and airy florals creates the same “Cheap McDonalds Soap Dispenser” vibe (how my nose reads heavy neroli). It feels like a softer, friendlier Essenza that stays in the classic cologne mold, just airier. As the soapiness settles inside the first half hour, a gentle orange facet unexpectedly comes forward.

Heart
From about 60 to 120 minutes, it is an easier floral-citrus that is smooth and tidy, with a light herbal thread. The coriander note blends with the florals and reads greener than Essenza. It is pleasant and feels purposefully “traditional cologne” while clearly offering a unique take.

Drydown
By hour 5, you are in a clean woody-musk of cedar, soft patchouli, and white musks. It does not project much, but it has more presence than the airy opening suggests. Quietly masculine and easy to carry into evening. The core trace lingers to about 7 hours, mostly at skin level.

Performance on me
Polite, but strong for the genre. About 1.5 to 2 hours of aura, then close to skin. Roughly 5 to 7 hours total, with the last stretch as a subtle skin scent. I’d catch scents of it through the day if I applied it to my wrists if I was hand talking.

Versatility
High in theory and trickier in practice. The DNA says formal, but it wears casual on me. I would use it for a T-shirt-and-shorts creative meeting, although I still prefer other summer picks for that slot.

Use cases
Office days, client coffees, brunch where you want the first hug to smell clean. School events and travel days, anywhere conservative etiquette helps.

Vibe
White tee, good jeans, fresh haircut. It’s clean and modern, but not “too cool”. This is the well dressed guy who's wearing a white t-shirt tucked into jeans with a crew cut. He looks good, smells good, but doesn't have too much main character energy. The cooler dude with messy hair who may be stealing your girl is probably wearing Neroli Portofino.

Blind-buy safe?
No. I think this whole genre requires testing. Won’t perform well enough for some. Florals won’t land for others. Too mature for yet others. Give it a decant if you want a clean, modern feeling cologne that replaces some of the “Floral!” with ozone and aldehydes.

Comparisons
Colonia Essenza: Sharper, dressier, more neroli-forward snap and more obvious soapiness. Pura is softer and airier, a modernized take.
Tom Ford Neroli Portofino: Louder orange-blossom soap. Next to NP, Pura reads less soapy and more airy and orange-clean. Less floral, more white-musk and ozonic.
Tom Ford Mandarino di Amalfi: Juicier mandarin and grapefruit with *mint, basil, and thyme. More sparkly and aromatic in the heart; less overtly soapy than **Pura. Dries down to light citrus-aromatic over musks and woods, while Pura turns cleaner and more white-musk polished.
Dior Homme Cologne (2020): Brighter “iced-lemonade” citrus and better early projection. Pura trades fizz for tidiness.
Le Labo Bergamote 22: Greener, grapefruit-tinged bergamot with a diffusive *musky-woody* halo and a clearer vetiver and cedar second act. B22 radiates more, while Pura stays closer and cleaner. It still has a three-phase evolution, just subtler.

Conclusion

Colonia Pura threads the needle between classic Italian cologne polish and modern, low-key cleanliness. It was my favorite of the group, yet it is the least “me,” because it lives between dressy and casual. If you want that perfect just-showered aura without orange-blossom drama, this nails it. If you want sparkle, volume, or a signature flourish, reach for Bergamote 22, Dior Homme Cologne, or Mandarino di Amalfi. For hot days when you want to look put together without trying, Pura delivers exactly what it promises.

Context for review: Multiple wears from a 5 ml decant, warm weather, moisturized skin, mostly indoors with brief outdoor breaks.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Colonia Pura Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Wear this if you want to smell like your girlfriend.
Those floral notes are so overpowering that I can't even smell any citrus in the opening, maybe just a faint bergamot. I like the smell, but I prefer to smell it on a woman rather than on myself.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Colonia Pura Acqua di Parma
review_content: A light barbershop scent with a hint of mandarin or orange. Doesn’t really make sense. Like a flat Tom Ford Mandarino, or a more intense Lacoste or 4711.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Colonia Pura Acqua di Parma
review_content: Dont know what the hate about this fragrance, pura open a bright citrus with some hint on sweetness good to refresh your mood then go drydown to citrusy vanilla vibes.regarding to longevity it last me morethan 12hrs specially if you spray it on cloth not that nuclear but you feel it and smell it all around you. The good thing about this fragrance was you are not smell the same with the other lad around but you trying to be different.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Colonia Pura Acqua di Parma
review_content: Reminds me of a more herbal MFK 724. Poor longevity. You get more longevity out of fragrances that cost much less. The first twenty minutes you’ll feel like an ozonic goddess, after that it’s hard to tell that Colonia Pura is even there. You won’t be reminded of it through sillage. It just… disappears. I assume it is best layered over a scented moisturizer and body oil. Otherwise it is just not worth it.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Colonia Pura Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I wear this as a basic cologne... I bought it for my brother for christmas... the salesman at the Bloomingdales was a pro... and for some reason I felt the need to buy this....

Long story short, my brother didnt like it... so I kept it... Im trying to use it all cuz Its a little too expensive to gift to a random person... but smells too basic to give to a friend or family member.

So when I do decide to wear it and I want to smell like a basic clean man... I spray the hell out of it, cuz the bottle is so big... over 6oz of this shit I still need to go through...

Acqua di Parma has some amazing scents... this is not one of them... unless you are a white dude who enjoys a warm glass of milk before bed, then go for it... youll smell ok at the next family wedding you get invited to...

This scent aint winning you any physically attractive ladies.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Colonia Pura Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Smelling from a paper strip two hours after spraying: Sweet scent, reminds me of a coastal shop that sells summer scarfs, long dresses and straw hats.. I think ozonic and musk notes dominate and are presented in a sweet flowery way.
Quite corny when you think of it. It's OK.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Colonia Pura Acqua di Parma
review_content: Opens citrus aromatic, it quickly turns watery and musky, then something fruity like Chinotto di Liguria and musk.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Colonia Pura Acqua di Parma
review_content: I received a sample from a mail-order service. While it's enjoyable, I won't repurchase it. I think it's within the unisex range, but the sweetness is high pitch, so someone taking a cautious first step toward sweet instead of rugged probably should start elsewhere. Like many freshies, Colonia Pura doesn't last. To its credit, it's not a repeat of everything. The fruity mixture moves beyond citrus, so it smells more like an oceanside farmer's market. Thus, the bright open is a bit green, ozonic, and marine. The brief later phases are floral, then ozonic again, and woodsy. In addition to being short, the journey is all over the place, if pleasant and evocative. There are two catches: First, this is sweeter than my favorites, so I wonder if I'd find it cloying after repeated wear. Second, the short jasmine stage was potent, so I'd only wear this when staying in instead of risking trouble for people with allergies. Still, if you're looking for something uplifting, brightly sweet, and slightly romantic that might surprise you, I'd give this a try.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Colonia Pura Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Imagine relaxing in a Private Yatch with family and friends during summer, that was the image that came to mind when smelling this fragrance. To Describe in One word, this Scent is Rejuvenating. Opening with a Bright-sweet-juicy Begamotte-Orange note, accompanied by the ozonic notes which give " Light airy" quality that that gives it a subtle radiance touch, It dries down to this smooth Powdery Floral shower gel scent that further dies down to this woody musky base. In my humid and equitoral(burning hot) climate, Longevity i get 4-5 hrs, projection is Moderate for the first 1 hr, before drying down to somemore intimaite, though i still get wiffs of myself occasionaly around the 2-3hr mark. Extremly versetile spring summer morning scent, Overal 7.75/10.


Personal Thoughts: I recommend spraying this on clothes for better Lonngevity,

product_name: Acqua di Parma Colonia Pura Acqua di Parma
review_content: Such a fresh and citrusy fragrance with some floral aspects to it, though not so floral that it leans feminine but also not too masculine in the dry down. Once fully dried down after some hours its a nice musky woody and yet still fresh with a hint of spiciness that still maintains well to the scent.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Colonia Pura Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Went to a store a few days ago (galeries lafayette) and was surprised to see AdP and even more surprised to see that some of their perfumes were available for testing !

Short story, I've been trying to recreate an amateur homemade version of Colonia Pura for years now without pulling of something good. I have quite a few chemical and essential oils to do so. And by essential oils I mean real ones : bio ones from France and Italy. After years of searching, reading and learning the marketing of AdP about this one.

What a deception.
First : this is a two stages scent, citrus for 1 to 2 hours and then soap at skin scent range.
Second : fake, chemical citrus here. Not bergamote, not orange and definitly not petigrain. Having all of them (really good, pure essential oils quality), the opening of Colonia Pura is none of those. Just a disapointing generic chemical lemon, like candy lemon without the sugar.
Third : marketing bullblabla. There is no narcissus, jasmin (who I recognise immediatly for the real essential oil, very strong and amazing, and expenssive. So just Hedione ?), cedar (not atlas, not virginian, not others, so just Iso e super ?), and definitly not patchouli. I don't say they are not here, just you can't smell of feel them. Just soap.
Final : the dry down, after 1 or 2 hours of chemical lemon, just the soap is remaining. Good or bad it is up to you but on me, just a generic hotel lemon soap. The in between is ok you get the soap through the citrus fast but there is nothing else here. No ozone, no flowers. Soap. And after 4 to 6 hours it is turning bad on my skin, almost yuky.

Happy not to have blind bought this one !

Tldr, what a deception for a cologne at that price and marketed so fresh and with some naturals. Not good and definitly not natural, just lemon soap.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Colonia Pura Acqua di Parma
review_content: ADP should be put in the category of those cheap fragrances because they are so bad in terms of longevity and projection and too expensive for their quality, we only pay for the brand name and the presentation of the box, and as for the smell, it's ok, just don't last longer than 10 minutes...

product_name: Acqua di Parma Colonia Pura Acqua di Parma
review_content: The opening of this is wonderful, the ozonic note really elevates the citrus, but sadly this pleasant phase lasts maybe 15 minutes. Then nuclear jasmine kicks in, overpowering everything else. Despite having very different body chemistry and preferences, both me and my partner experienced the middle notes as extremely unpleasant and a bit sickening. The jasmine is really persistent and long lasting, I had to wash it off and could still smell hints of it after. I didn't get to experience the drydown. People who have issues with jasmine turning bad on them should stay clear of this.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Colonia Pura Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I love this scent. It’s summer. It’s classy. As always with ADP bottles it looks the part too.

Observations about longevity are not unfounded, it’s steady, you need to reapply before lunch and mid afternoon if you want to keep the thing alive, and it isn’t going to fill a room, but it will ooze classy and rich summer vibes to those within your sphere, and that’s ok with me. It will always be in my arsenal, I love it, and those in my life do too… and that’s all that matters. You could reach for this after the gym, at the poolside, on a summer night… it’s an all rounder. It would never be mistaken for generic in my view, it’s too classy and sophisticated for that, too expensive smelling, but it’ll never offend and never let you down…

In terms of the profile, it’s citrusy but has an undercurrent of earthiness and jasmine… it’s vibrant and playful in a way, but really elegant. Others have commented that it’s a chinos and yacht kind of vibe, and I whole heartedly agree with that, and who doesn’t want to smell like they’ve just egressed their yacht?!

Overall, a respectable 8/10, if it projected a little more it’d be a 9 or more, but the score is like the scent, decent, worthy.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Colonia Pura Acqua di Parma
review_content:
#803 in my "Tour de Fragrance"

I will never understand why anyone spends more than $35 on a citrus freshie and this scent has not changed my mind. I tried every one of the Blu Mediterraneo line. Performance is always terrible for any citrus freshie but those set a new low. Absolute waste of money every one of them. Performed like an $8 Cuba Paris scent. Hell, the Nautica's, Chrome's, Ferrari's, even Adidas performed better. This scent far outperforms those AdP blues, but it's still just a "me too" among the hundreds of citrus freshies on the market.

Of the scents I've tried this reminds me of MFK's very disappointing and ridiculously overpriced Aqua Universalis Forte (when they have "water" in the name, believe them). You get nothing from this scent you won't get in a bottle of John Varvatos Artisan Blu, a $27 EDT. Projection-wise, by mid-morning coffee break no one will know you're wearing this, though it's a skin scent for 6-7 hours. It's certainly car pool, elevator and office safe, as is every citrus freshie since they're all too mild to offend anyone. But I don't see what you get with this scent that you don't get with a $35 bottle of Chrome Aqua, or a $23 bottle of Armaf Ventana Marine, other than the AdP rep, which based on the nine AdP scents I've tried to date I would to say is undeserved.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Colonia Pura Acqua di Parma
review_content:
It is ok
performance is week
if you want the same smell with a much better performance go for Mancera wave musk: almost identical with a much powerful longevity and sillage

product_name: Acqua di Parma Colonia Pura Acqua di Parma
review_content: This stuff is divine. For what this fragrance does and how it makes you feel in a tropical climate you really cannot go wrong. I first smelled this at Epcot of all places in the Italy pavilion. If you are familiar with the park, then you would know that several of the countries feature fragrance brands from their respective countries of origin. At first sniff I was in love with this juice. It is not crazy complex but very sexy, alluring, and masculine although generally a unisex smell if that makes sense. The retail price is not terribly out of touch, but the price you can get this at on grey market retailers is insane! I got my 100ML for around $62 and I can't see how that could've been a better deal. This fragrance is very adult though in my opinion. I can't see a teen pulling this off. Im in my early 20s and I still feel a little out of place when I wear this sometimes. It's just so sophisticated and grown rich man smelling. This is like all of the best aspects of sunscreen fresh type fragrances but made a little more well rounded with different accords. As far as when to wear this, I would say anytime spring or summer. There's not really a casual vs. formal scent to this. More of a who are you as the person wearing this type of vibe. This is white linen, suede summer walks, and cream colored pants type of vibes to me. Longevity is great but projection is not. People will need to be close to smell this on you, but they will be able to smell you at least 6 hours after application. Fantastic performance for an Eau De Cologne concentration to me. If you can get this for sub $80 and are into what I described above I would say just grab it. You really can't go wrong with this juice. It might even get you a new love interest if that's what you're looking for ;).

product_name: Acqua di Parma Colonia Pura Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Colonia Pura by Acqua di Parma is a cherished part of my fragrance collection, embodying both elegance and modern sophistication. From the moment I first encountered its vibrant opening, I was captivated. The blend of bergamot, lemon, and orange greets you like a warm embrace, instantly uplifting and refreshingly bright. It’s not your typical citrus scent; it carries a touch of regal freshness, reminiscent of stepping off a yacht into the sun-drenched Mediterranean.

What sets Colonia Pura apart is its seamless evolution. The heart of the fragrance reveals jasmine, dancing gracefully with narcissus and coriander. This floral bouquet adds a layer of complexity, transforming the initial citrus burst into something more refined and harmonious. The jasmine, in particular, stands out, lending a sophisticated charm without overpowering the composition.

As Colonia Pura settles, the base notes of patchouli, cedarwood, and musk come forward, grounding the fragrance with a warm, earthy elegance. This balance between brightness and depth is what makes Colonia Pura truly special. It’s a modern take on the classic Colonia, paying homage to its heritage while introducing a contemporary twist that feels both timeless and current.

In my experience, Colonia Pura is versatile, suitable for any occasion. It’s invigorating enough for daytime wear, yet sophisticated enough for an evening out. I appreciate how it adapts to different settings, always maintaining its elegant presence.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Colonia Pura Acqua di Parma
review_content:
The opening is much more floral than the others in the line. The narcissus is quite defining, with jasmine providing a slightly powdery yet very fresh background. The aldehydes curiously give me an aquatic sensation, similar to the aquatic flowers in Eau D'Issey, especially the feminine one.

It's probably the furthest from the original Colonia and has the most modern tones. There's something metallic as well, reminiscent of the metallic-aquatic, fresh, and floral side of Hermès H24.

Over time, the white musk appears and reminds me a bit of the dry down of Dior Homme Cologne (one of my favorite scents). It is the most unisex in the line, leaning slightly towards the feminine, and like the entire line, it is delicious.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Colonia Pura Acqua di Parma
review_content:
My impressions after going through a 2ml sample:

The opening smells like spraying Acqua di Sale once and lemon pledge twice in the air. It’s scary how close the cologne dries down like Acqua di Sale and its baby sister Fiore dell’Onda. About 70% there with less of a tangy seaweed note, replaced with a generic citrus scent you’d find on those hand wipes they give you at a fish restaurant.

Pleasant cologne overall. One could say it’s overpriced but considering the overall quality of the juice and lower proportion of aroma chemicals compared to its peers, it’s a well concocted fragrance. Inoffensive, leans feminine but you could totally rock this if you’re an extroverted, happy fellow.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Colonia Pura Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Fresh laundry hanging under a citrus tree, while someone is peeling an orange next to you. Nothing impressive, but No one around you are going to complain about this scent (unless they hate clean cloths and citrus...). Longevity and projection is pretty good on me. 2 sprays are blasting of my skin for 3 solid hours, until i got wet and dried of with a towel. After toweling off, it's 8-10 inches of the skin projection. Enough to leave an ok scent trail. Pretty good for a fragrance like this.

This is Very Italian perfumery. Soapy clean and refreshing, a hint of spice, and loads of citrus, florals, and woods. Perfect when you want to freshen up, dress down and relax, or dress up in style.

Personal score: 8/10. What's not to like? Citrusy, floral, and woody, is one of the oldest and most loved combinations of fragrance. This has a classic style and a classic scent. Exceptional versatility.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Colonia Pura Acqua di Parma
review_content: Got it as a gift for bday.. surprisingly good longevity on my skin (didn’t expect it to last 7-8 hours). Smell is nice, got that Colonia DNA in it, mix of old fashioned and modern smell in a good way. Great for summer days in nature. Not for everyone’s nose imo

product_name: Acqua di Parma Colonia Pura Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I can't even work up a lengthy review of "Colonia Pura". I certainly don't despise this, and if it were from another house, I'd probably go to the "like" vs "ok" rating, but this is in no way what I expect from AdP. I can't say old fashioned on this, as I am a fan of old fashioned frags. This one just comes off as a bit dated and irrelevant.

My review is as effete and apathetic as the fragrance and I'm not going to get into my personal experience with this. The notes listed on this Fragrantica profile are 80% correct in their depiction save for waxy musk, wet rocks and the slightest tinge of fish.

This has some utility, but sorry, but this is 4/10.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Colonia Pura Acqua di Parma
review_content: One of the weaker AdP releases. A pretty straightforward soapy citrus-green scent. Gets pretty boring on the drydown.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Colonia Pura Acqua di Parma
review_content: Its nice but it's probably my least favorite from the Colonia line up that I've tried. Opening is an orange blast. Very nice quality citrus which unfortunately doesn't last. The ozonic and florals take over rather quickly. The ozonic notes overpower the citrus. It's ok but I'm not crazy about the ozonic notes. Goes alittle soapy which muddled everything to some extent. Something about how the ozonic motes mix with the florals isn't for me. There's also something slightly sour in here. Acqua di Parma does citrus aromatics like none other. This one unfortunately isn't for me. I much rather prefer Colonia Essenza and Intensa. It's fine but not great. I'll finish off my sample but probably won't get a full bottle.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Colonia Pura Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I’ve been wearing this for the last 3/4 years during spring & summer. I liked it because it got away from your typical citrus freshies. The more experience I have with this, the more it moves into one of my favorites.

Opens ozone, slight citrus, and w/the narcissus note (this is the main note on me throughout). Very light and airy. As it continues to dry down the musk note adds depth.

Longevity and projection are average…5/6 hours. I overspray to increase both.

I am never disappointed when I apply this. Certainly one of their best IMHO. Saying that, this is very different than ADP’s fragrances….I certainly would sample and wear for a day or two before going all in with full bottle.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Colonia Pura Acqua di Parma
review_content: The house is among my favorites for a reason. Cannot imagine a summer without one of their colognes. This particular one opens with orange citruses and quickly dries to a white floral scent. Next to it I identify an elegant coriander note that is similar to one I find in my beloved Kouros. The base is light woodsy and somewhat mineralic to my nose.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Colonia Pura Acqua di Parma
review_content: Original Colonia and Essenza are loves of mine. There's just something harsh about Pura that is cloying to my nose. Don't overspray this like the original or you'll choke yourself out.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Colonia Pura Acqua di Parma
review_content: Taking into consideration the countless perfumes I have tested, this particular one smells unbelievably amazing. It is a spring to summer scent with a musky along with citrus and rejuvenated flowers. The downside does not last long, around 5-6 hours of moderate projection. I suggest if it doable to find it on counters around 100 euros per 180ml, don’t hesitate to purchase it, would be a nice remarkable add on in your collection.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Colonia Pura Acqua di Parma
review_content: When I first wore this fragrance, it reminded me of something else. I quite couldn’t put my finger on it. But as soon as I saw the perfumer, it then hit me: Dior Homme 2020. Pura is a bit more citrusy and less woody. These fragrances don’t smell exactly alike, but share a similar scent profile.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Colonia Pura Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Colonia Pura by Acqua di Parma:
This is a very airy, aromatic and green fragrance centred around an almost powdery and somewhat chalky white floral note. It is by far the “airiest” frag I’ve come across and smells sweet yet clean at the same time. I’d say it’s unisex but leans slightly more masculine. Due to its very airy profile performance isn’t the best but it’s a very pleasant warm weather scent.

Top notes: Ozonic, bergamot, orange, petitgrain
Middle notes: Corriander, jasmine, narcissus
Base notes: Light musk and cedar

4/5

product_name: Acqua di Parma Colonia Pura Acqua di Parma
review_content:
More of a chalky-musk rather than powder.. There is a calm & smooth citric sweetness here mixed w/ the musk that makes me think of Pez candy. I think it may be sweet patchouli creating the slightly strange scent.
@Discardedandroid said- ‘fun dip candy’. Yes the chalky simi-sweet white dipping stick!
As much as I absolutely hate Jasmine- the blending, harmony & softness of notes is extremely pleasing. Care-free vibe 🍃.
Spring time banger. Unisex. Casual.
Soft citrus, ozonic, dewy, soapy-sweet florals that doesn’t smell feminine.

Edit: 3/4/24
So I bought a 100ml.. this batch differs slightly from the sample I had.
It’s more green- specifically petitgrain smelling.. because of this, it isn’t as smooth & sweet. It’s more like a herbal citrus soap.
Hell I still absolutely love it though.
My ‘happy’ fragrance. Puts a big ol’ 😊 on my face every time I spray this

product_name: Acqua di Parma Colonia Pura Acqua di Parma
review_content: A much fresher version of the original Colonia: "zingy bitter citrus with herbal aromatics, a touch of fresh spice, and a clean soapy undertone." Here the citruses no longer have that bitter tinge to them, a more prominent jasmine further brightens the scent profile, and the base is more of an ozonic musky experience without the soapiness. More modern and more unisex to me. Moderate projection fades over 3-4hr, longevity 8-10hr.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Colonia Pura Acqua di Parma
review_content: Love it, bought a bottle.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Colonia Pura Acqua di Parma
review_content:
ADP Colonia Pura
Clean gentle classic scent
My favorite from ADP
Fresh citrus clean soapy and floral
👌👌

product_name: Acqua di Parma Colonia Pura Acqua di Parma
review_content: Probably the worst Acqua Di Parma I've tried so far. A big pass. 4/10

product_name: Acqua di Parma Colonia Pura Acqua di Parma
review_content: The opening is great. The rest? Not so. A headache-inducing, synthetic, ozonic mess. Test this before you buy it.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Colonia Pura Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I think I tried this once and couldn't get past the awful hamster cage/stale hay accord.
Perhaps it was another ADP variant though, it was a while ago but definitely one of the 'Colonia' line not the Blue Med line..

product_name: Acqua di Parma Colonia Pura Acqua di Parma
review_content: At first this almost gives me a “corn tortilla” type of smell that I did not really like. However, on my skin that actually did not stay long. After about 10 minutes it is a very beautiful fresh & clean scent. I will have to give this more wearings this summer.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Colonia Pura Acqua di Parma
review_content: mildly spicy take on the original. Subtle wood, jasmine and citrus. Floral, and musk, as stated. Pleasant. It's for daytime use, but I prefer it for humid summer evenings, and at bed time- I personally find it relaxing to spray some on. Maybe the light spices and wood make it a bit suitable for evenings, but I really don't know. This is far from an expert review

product_name: Acqua di Parma Colonia Pura Acqua di Parma
review_content: It's clean, crisp and refreshing. It's a go to summer fragrance for me. I bought it twice now and I'm happy with it.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Colonia Pura Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Really like this. I am a fan of the original Colonia and while this isn’t the same, it has a similar “vibe” but modernised.

Really clean and fresh, but not too soapy, a bit of musk but it stays more citrusy floral than musky on me.

I got pretty good longevity and performance from this as well for what it is. It doesn’t project massively, but that’s not what you buy this scent profile for. Longevity though - I was getting wafts a good 6-8 hours later, and can smell it faintly on clothes the next day after respraying around 4pm.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Colonia Pura Acqua di Parma
review_content: Smells much more citrusy to me than the original, unfortunately in drydown steers in another direction that Colonia which I don't really like.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Colonia Pura Acqua di Parma
review_content: This one is really synthetic once the citruses are gone.. Are all ADPs like these?

product_name: Acqua di Parma Colonia Pura Acqua di Parma
review_content: I swear acqua di parma is so goated, because I like this despite habitually hating ozonic fragrances.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Colonia Pura Acqua di Parma
review_content:
sugary lemon gum vibe..


Masterpiece!

product_name: Acqua di Parma Colonia Pura Acqua di Parma
review_content: It's very lovely and there's not much to dislike despite it being very weak. On a warm day in a linen shirt it's really quite delightful. You can smell the naturals so clearly: Oranges and bergamot with a lovely subtle sweetness and air of sophistication. It's VERY Italian and conjures up images of walking through a sun dappled path in Amalfi with the sound of the sea in the distance and orange trees either side of me. I can hear the birds singing and the air is warm, yet fresh. I'm on my way to a terrace overlooking the coast to have an early afternoon aperitif and a light lunch with great company. Yes, the longevity is bad but it's a cologne and can be reapplied whenever you fancy.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Colonia Pura Acqua di Parma
review_content:
This unique scent takes strengths from Aqua Di Parma's Colonia and makes it fresher, floral, and smoother. This scent reminds me of playing tennis in the summer! It can be overwhelmingly fresh on clothing on first opening, but when you let it rest on your skin it is a marvelous scent that will offer lingering floral, citrus, and herbal notes. This scent will be good to you if you are patient with it :)

I most admire the use of Jasmine, Petitgrain, Orange/ Mandarin that make it sweet and floral

the Patchouli and Coriander offer good balance as well

Try this scent as part of your ADP collection, well worth it!

product_name: Acqua di Parma Colonia Pura Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Response to Let_it_be,

I know exactly what you mean about it having some resemblance to Obsession by CK. It’s that aromatic element but I can’t pinpoint what exactly.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Colonia Pura Acqua di Parma
review_content: This is a nice classy scent, but it's nothing memorable. It's unoffensive and a bit of a bore.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Colonia Pura Acqua di Parma
review_content:
A different take on your usual colognes that may not suit everyone. While I do love my usual cologne, I appreciate ones that take on a different route. This one opens with a blast of citruses, but it is mixed with strong ozonic notes and aldehydes. Soon after, Narcissus comes to play and adds a sweet floral note. The dry-down is mostly musk with some woody aspects and very faint patchouli.

For an EdC, the performance and sillage are so good. Overall, it is a really unique and interesting take on your typical cologne DNA. However, I recommend trying it before purchasing a full bottle.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Colonia Pura Acqua di Parma
review_content: I don't think this is as good as the original colonia. There was something sweet or liquorice about it I didn't like

product_name: Acqua di Parma Colonia Pura Acqua di Parma
review_content:
An ozonic/narcissus flower variation on the OG Colonia ( kind of gave me memories of wearing Givenchy Insensee too ). Very nice...still think Essenza and OG are more my taste but I don't hate them for providing a new flanker. Well-done.
Edit: A reviewer below me compared this to Dior Homme Sport 2021 and yes it has that same steamed and starched white shirt sort of ozonic things going. Worked well in this 70 degree day.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Colonia Pura Acqua di Parma
review_content:
It took me a long time to remember what this fragrance reminded me of - Obsession for men!

They don't smell exactly alike, but they shared something similar. Btw I am talking about the original Obsession for men from many years ago, not the current one.

What's that sweet note in it that smells so good?

product_name: Acqua di Parma Colonia Pura Acqua di Parma
review_content: Smells like dior homme sport 2021 specially the drydown IMHO. Great smell. Smells classy

product_name: Acqua di Parma Colonia Pura Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I have a problem with Acqua di Parma, like with most commercial fragrances apparently - but with Colonia Pura I finally understood what's wrong with AdP colonies: my skin is very acid and highlights all the "wrong" notes in every perfume I try. In this case, all the pleasant citrusy and flowery notes quickly disappear and all I'm left with is a very chemical, awful smell that could remind that of a cheap car fragrance.
I had to give up a LOT of fragrances for this reason, and this makes me really sad and frustrated (it happens with very expensive niche Parfums as well!).
Too bad :(

product_name: Acqua di Parma Colonia Pura Acqua di Parma
review_content:
For me this more modern version of Colonia beats the original (and Essenza), a very pleasing iteration that I am very happy to wear and smell on others. It still feels traditional but fresher and less soapy in the dry-down than I find with the original.

Out of all the Aqua Di Parma fragrances I still favour some of the Blu range (particularly Mirto, Chinotto and Bergamotto) as they feel a bit more interesting but Pura offers an excellent classic fragrance. Well worth checking out.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Colonia Pura Acqua di Parma
review_content:
The citrus in here gives off a sour smell off my skin. But I have had the same issue with light blue intense and in a lesser extent with versace pour homme. So if you have already experienced this, maybe you should expect that with colonia pura.
That being said, it is not a bad scent, it's okay even with this "sour" smell, because it is balanced with floral and aquatic notes. If this was mainly citrus, it would have been a problem for me, but it is not the case.

Edit : the sourness issue is fixed after about 20min, now I get a pretty interesting but easy to wear aquatic citrus along with the other notes.
Overall, it is a fresh and clean fragrance, but it is not at all generic, it still smells interesting enough for the fragrance aficionado.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Colonia Pura Acqua di Parma
review_content: This is the only aqua di parma fragrance I have tried and it has quickly become my go-to scent for the summer. Wonderful light citruses that can be worn casually but this also has a grown up element to it as well and would be great in the office too without being offensive to anyone. It can be enjoyed in the warm weather by anyone in their mid-20's and up! Very safe fragrance and decent value when purchased from a discounter too.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Colonia Pura Acqua di Parma
review_content:
This is the most "modern" of the Colonia flankers i have tried (I have not smelled them all). It's very fresh, airy and floral and to my nose 100% unisex. It's always nice when fragrances try a new route and do things in an unexpected way. If I had blind smelled this the first time I tried it I would never have guessed it was a AdP Colonia flanker; there is nothing of the familiar DNA in Pura.

This is a very pleasant and fresh scent for the summer but it took a little while before I could put my finger on why I didn't like to wear it as much as the other Colonias. I then figured out that it's the jasmine that puts me off from wearing Pura. I prefer to smell jasmine on women, not on myself. Pura is to jasmine heavy for my taste. I asked a few female friends to try my sample and they enjoyed Pura a good deal. It's a nice and fresh fragrance for the warm weather, but just not for me.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Colonia Pura Acqua di Parma
review_content: Hmm, definitely the weirdest of the Colonia line I've tried yet. The added ozonic notes to the Colonia formula make me think a little bit of some kind of powdered candy from when I was a kid, maybe it was "Fun Dip"? Either way it's surprisingly sweet and the ozonic notes behave the same way violet does in that the fragrance becomes very smooth. It's an interesting twist on the original Colonia but for me the twist doesn't pay off. It's just okay.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Colonia Pura Acqua di Parma
review_content:
The deliciously divisive commentary below is hilarious.

Back in 2008 I wore the original Colonia when it was just creeping back onto the radar, and, to echo @Leftofcenter below also felt like Cary Grant himself when I wore it. Despite not usually being a fan of citrusy fragrances, I've always loved ADP's sharp, lemony opening, but not how it evolved on my skin.

Last summer in Rome, I tried Essenza and nearly bought a bottle, but after trying it once more in my native Paris, found it incongruous. Today, I popped into the Paris boutique and spritzed Essenza on my left arm and Pura Colonia on my right and I have to say that Pura is the more intriguing of the two, at least here. The citrus quickly let the aldehydes and ozonic notes forth and they're fascinatingly blended with the musk, to feel both fresh and salty yet cosy and skin-like all at once.

I could see how this could be too adolescent on men, but on this woman it's a wonderfully different fresh summer scent.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Colonia Pura Acqua di Parma
review_content: Summer, Scent: 6,5/10 Opening is citrus, smells like lemon peel. Smells like Turkish kolonya. In the dry down however it gets a bit warmer, perhaps its the cedar. Silage: 3/10 Longevity: 2/10

product_name: Acqua di Parma Colonia Pura Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Colonia Pura was my first ever encounter with the Colonia line from Acqua Di Parma and while it was the first that I tried and fell for, it was Colonia Essenza that I first purchased (I'll review that later, it really does deserve a piece), Pura is fresh, cool and has a really unusual metalic/ozonic quality which to me, makes it a bit more interesting.

The opening is brisk, ozonic aldehydes fizz while bergamot, mixed with orange begin to emerge, it sort of reminds me a little bit of cloudy lemonade with ice. The thing is with Pura, the ozonic notes seem to stay throughout wear, the ozone/aldehydes give the florals; jasmine and narcissus, some real pop and along with a small touch of coriander, theres an injection of extra depth. The ozonic florals lace together in the base with white musk and cedar which wraps up the entire composition beautifully, giving a freshly laundered t-shirt/just out of the shower vibe.

The longevity is good for an EdC, I get 6 hours with a moderate silage. I honestly can see this working well on women as well as men, its perfectly unisex and I think if you're looking for a scent for someone that doesn't generally like wearing scents, this could be one to try. It'll work well for the office, casual wear and I really can't wait to try this one out at the beach too. Personally, I feel due to its light nature that Pura is better reserved for the summer months and I do think that while its well made, it could be a little bit more reasonably priced.
I would repurchase, and I'm glad I got a 100ml bottle since Mr Gin also seems to like this one as well.

Contrary to one reviewer, I am not "writing lies" and nor am I affiliated with Acqua Di Parma, I'm just writing out what I smell and what I feel, which we are all entitled to do here.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Colonia Pura Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I have the pura dopabarba lotion. It is mild to me, but my wife says it is very strong. She even said; "You smell like a retirement home".
After a shower, I use it as a softener on my beard. Nice for lounging---pretty darn fresh imo.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Colonia Pura Acqua di Parma
review_content:
It smells nice, clean and smooth, but they put too much aldehyde. It gave me a headache.
Agreed with the comment below by thiagovidotto, felt the same way and it sucks.
Aura Maris by Lorenzo will be similar to this but different
I wish they reformulated and tone down the aldehyde.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Colonia Pura Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Well, Colonia Pura is definitely a different take on the AdP barbershop genre. It both corrects some of the things I don't really like about Colonia, and introduces new oddities all its own. The word "Pura" might make you think this is a "back to basics" fragrance. Ha-ha, no, not at all. This is like a "virtual reality" fragrance. Interesting, but definitely not natural.

That soapiness in the original Colonia is replaced with a sort of robotic ozonic quality. It definitely smells clean, but less of a "just showered" clean and more of a "just got my car detailed" clean. There are floral components somewhere in the mix, but they are sort of mystery white floral "accords", as opposed to a more specific lavender scent in the original Colonia.

For me, this is a "like", not "love" fragrance. I think it smells really good, but also rather fake. It seems to tickle my throat and make me cough a bit. Not sure what component is doing that.

It's like the "auto-tune" version of Colonia. It can be fun, but I wouldn't want it every day, just as I wouldn't want auto-tune in every song. Acqua di Parma, feel free to use these synthetics as a tool for effect from time to time. But don't think you can replace the old ways entirely without anyone noticing.

Anyway, it's worth a look if you are into fresh, masculine, citrus, herbal (or robotic) fragrances.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Colonia Pura Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I have read that people compare this with the original colonia. This however doesn't smell like the original. However this is a modern fresh masterpiece. But if you have the original colonia of essenza (both oldschool) and you would like a new oldschool fragrace, do not get hope.

However as i said, the fragrance by it self is very good and uniqua

product_name: Acqua di Parma Colonia Pura Acqua di Parma
review_content:
The ozonic note is really offputting to me. I bought a 100ml bottle and enjoyed it at first, but it, unfortunately, became the only fragrance I own that I dislike.

The sweetness + the ozonic note is nausea-inducing. My fiancé also felt nauseous from the scent, which is crazy to me!

I actually thought I had bad juice, but I got it with the body wash and deodorant. Since these 3 products smell the same, I am assuming the juice is not bad.

It would be great if the ozonic note was not there...

Very sad. I will sell my bottle.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Colonia Pura Acqua di Parma
review_content: I love the Acqua di Parma Colonia range but there are several different variances of it so it's confusing to know which is which. Each of them are subtly different from one another but all are very nice. One of them is my favourite but I haven't tested it in a store for 3 or 4 years and can't remember which one it is! Maybe this one. Next time I get to test the range I need to make a note of it! Anyway, the one I favour is almost as beloved by me and almost rivals the now, tragically, discontinued Tuscan Soul so at some point I'm going to get myself a bottle! The Colonia range is definitely suitable for men and women, although I'm sure some women may not find them 'sexy' enough for them to wear.
