It is classy and bright, the bottle is glass (which I’m a fan of). The scent last for a while on clothing, but given the price range I feel it could be better. Overall I feel this is a nice bold fragrance to add to the collection. I will say I would like to try more from this brand now that I’ve tried this product. I hadn’t heard of it until recently but I’m glad I know about them now. I received this product as part of an educational promotion.

product_name: Gelsomino a Freddo Ambrosia Acqua di Parma
review_content: I have been in the beauty industry for over eight years now and this is my first time trying this brand. I am a big fan of trying new fragrances so I was very excited to try this one. One of my preferences is not anything that is very sweet or candy like scents so I was very pleased that this fragrance was not like that at all. It lasted on my skin for a good amount of time and I received compliments wherever I went. It is not over powering and it is also not so weak. It was the right amount of strength for me and I enjoyed the notes of this fragrance. I typically go for something that is not overwhelming to the nose or too overwhelming for those around me and I found that this fragrance was perfect for me. I do not like walking around with a very strong heavy scent so I really enjoyed this one!

product_name: Gelsomino a Freddo Ambrosia Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Acqua di Parma Gelsomino a Freddo Ambrosia Eau de Parfum is a new fragrance that I have tried multiple time in the last couple of weeks. I am
Not a perfume aficionado, I tend to wear the same fragrances over and over. I like medium strong scents, and I prefer a long lasting fragrance. I really liked this product!The scent is very pleasant, and not overwhelming at all. It is not particularly feminine. I see it as very unisex and easy to wear. Given the brand, I was not surprised at the high quality and long lasting nature of the product. The packaging is standard for this brand and it is beautiful. Perfect for a gift. The bottle is heavy and high quality, as you would expect. Price is consistent for the brand . Overall, this is a great product and I recommend it for anyone looking f for a new scent that is beautiful but not too feminine for fall. I received this product as part of a promotion in return for my honest opinion.

product_name: Gelsomino a Freddo Ambrosia Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Gelsomino a Freddo Ambrosia Acqua di Parma Is a really nice scent. It’s nice and warm perfect for this fall weather. It kind of a spicy sensual scent. It’s nice for a night out. It is a unisex scent but to me it leans a bit more towards a masculine scent. Probably due to the more woodsy scent. It is a long lasting perfume I didn’t have to reapply throughout the day lasted at least 5 or 6 hours on. I really liked the packaging of this perfume super nice and the bottle itself is really nice.

*I received this as part of a promotion*

product_name: Gelsomino a Freddo Ambrosia Acqua di Parma
review_content: I was so excited to try the Aqua Di Parma Gelsomino a Freddo Ambrosia. The beautiful yellow box it came in drew me in and reminded me of beautiful lemons. I really loved the simplicity yet elegance of the parfum bottle. When I sprayed the fragrance I was pleasantly surprised it had a lovely yet warm feeling. I definitely smelled the notes of lemon, sandalwood and vetiver it reminded me of a santal fragrance. I loved that it wasn’t too overpowering and left me smelling delicious. I definitely recommend this fragrance and will continue to wear this fragrance. I received this parfum in exchange for my honest review.

product_name: Gelsomino a Freddo Ambrosia Acqua di Parma
review_content:
This perfume is my only perfume that has its own box and it is absolutely beautiful. I was really surprised how it came and when I smelled it it smelled like winter and fall together it has notes of musky but yet citrusy scent . I would recommend this product to my family and friends especially for a gift .
I received this pride for exchange of my honest review

product_name: Gelsomino a Freddo Ambrosia Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Acqua di Parma Gelsomino a Freddo Ambrosia Eau de Parfum truly feels like luxury in a bottle. From the first spray, it gives a refreshing burst of clean citrus mixed with a hint of spice that immediately feels elegant and sophisticated. As it starts to settle, the jasmine begins to unfold, not the overly sweet or powdery kind, but a smooth, rich floral that feels modern and refined. It blends beautifully with warm amber woods and subtle smoky undertones, creating a scent that feels balanced and effortlessly chic.

What I really love about this fragrance is how it melts into the skin and becomes more personal the longer you wear it. The notes don’t fight for attention; they flow together in harmony, transitioning naturally from bright and fresh to warm and sensual. The projection is noticeable but not overpowering; it’s the kind of scent that makes people curious enough to ask what you’re wearing without filling the entire room.

The bottle itself is simple yet luxurious, with its clear glass showcasing the pale golden liquid inside and minimalist design that perfectly matches the fragrance’s refined personality. Gelsomino a Freddo Ambrosia feels timeless and versatile, fresh enough for daytime wear but with enough depth to make it perfect for evenings or cooler weather. Overall, it’s an elegant, unisex scent that carries sophistication, warmth, and modern charm in every spritz.

I received this product as a part of educational purpose.

product_name: Gelsomino a Freddo Ambrosia Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I received the Gelsomino a Freddo Ambrosia Eau de Parfum complimentary for education purchases.

I love the luxurious yellow box packaging and the bottle design is beautiful as well.

Smelling directly from the atomizer I smell tea, some spice and hint of jasmine. When I initially sprayed it I was hit with a strong blast of cardamom, citrus and alcohol and I thought it was a very masculine scent that I could not wear. As it dried down I really loved the tea and jasmine notes and the spicy cardamom became more subdued but still there. I would say this is definitely unisex but leaning slightly masculine. I will wear it occasionally but would not buy it myself, because there are similar more affordable perfumes.

product_name: Gelsomino a Freddo Ambrosia Acqua di Parma
review_content: I want to start by saying this fragrance is AMAZING. The first impression I had was the component and how beautiful it is. The color, the mechanics of it, it all screams literal luxe and is the very definition of understated luxury. When it comes to the scent, it is exactly the scent that comes to mind when you think of 'old money'. My description is refined, effortless, warm and powerful. The specifics of the scent form my POV is the jasmine is crisp and cool rather than too sweet or overpowering.This fragrance gives off a relaxed kind of luxury (I know I keep saying luxury) but it's almost like you’re on a yacht in a light linen shirt, the sun warm, the sea breeze gentle, and everything feels perfectly in its place. If sophistication had a scent, this would be it, and I absolutely love it. Product was received as part of an educational promotion.

product_name: Gelsomino a Freddo Ambrosia Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I’ve been wearing the Acqua di Parma Gelsomino a Freddo Ambrosia Parfum, and it’s honestly one of those scents that surprises you the more you wear it. The first spray opens with this citrusy and clean lemon scent with a bit of spice underneath. Then the jasmine, but it’s not the usual soft or girly floral. It is so much richer and deeper woody notes, that come through later.

To me, this fragrance leans a bit on the masculine side, definitely not sweet or powdery, but still wears beautifully as a unisex scent. I actually love that about it. It has that confident, elegant vibe without being too heavy or overwhelming. The blend of jasmine, black tea, and woods feels smooth and modern. The dry-down is where it really shines for me, it settles warmly, and slightly smoky, which makes it perfect for colder weather. I received this perfume as part of an educational program.

product_name: Gelsomino a Freddo Ambrosia Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I had high hopes for this perfume, but it turned out to be a bit different from what I expected. The scent leans more on the masculine side — bold, woody, and slightly spicy — rather than the soft, feminine floral I was anticipating. The opening hits strong with woody notes blended with cardamom and a touch of zesty lemon, creating a striking first impression. However, despite that powerful start, the lasting power is surprisingly weak and fades faster than I’d like.

It’s a fragrance that works better for evenings or cooler weather when you want something sophisticated and noticeable, but it doesn’t quite fit my personal taste for daily wear. While I appreciate the experience, it’s not one I see myself reaching for again. I received this perfume as part of an educational program.

product_name: Gelsomino a Freddo Ambrosia Acqua di Parma
review_content: I’m a fragrance enthusiast and this is my first fragrance from this brand. I am loving the Acqua di Parma Gelsomino A Freddo Eau de Parfum, it’s refreshing, warm and sophisticated that beautifully captures the essence of jasmine with a modern, vibrant twist. The glass is clear, showcasing the pale golden liquid inside, and the label and cap are minimalist yet luxurious .The perfume opens with fresh citrus notes. Definitely getting another bottle before this runs out. The packaging looks luxurious. I received this product as a part of educational purpose.

product_name: Gelsomino a Freddo Ambrosia Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Acqua di Parma Gelsomino a Freddo Ambrosia Eau de Parfum is luxury in a bottle! The way that this fragrance develops and becomes a part of you is a special experience. The fragrance is distinct in an alluring, head-turning kind of way, but as it wears, it melts into the skin, forming a unique bond with the wearer. While it is vibrant, the scent does not enter the room before you. Rather, the sillage invites others to ask, “Who is wearing that amazing fragrance?!” I love how the fragrance develops right under your nose. Upon first spray, it envelopes your senses and takes you on a scent journey through the fragrance notes, starting with the bold frankincense, dense cardamom, and zesty citrus, to be immediately and pleasantly greeted by jasmine and white florals, leading to a symphonic finale of deep amber woods. I like how the notes are balanced and maintain their consistency throughout. This may be controversial, but I like how the fragrance softens, and even though it has a lot of what can be considered “intense” notes, it is not abrasive to the senses but a sensual, refined delight.
This product was provided in exchange for my honest review.

product_name: Gelsomino a Freddo Ambrosia Acqua di Parma
review_content:
An intense and unforgettable fragrance

The Gelsomino a Freddo Ambrosia Eau de Parfum by Acqua di Parma truly impressed me with its strong and long-lasting scent. From the very first spray, it feels elegant and sophisticated, with an enveloping floral note that lingers beautifully on the skin for hours. It has a noticeable projection without being overwhelming, combining freshness with a warm, comforting background. It’s the kind of perfume that leaves a memorable trail and defines presence. Perfect for special occasions or anyone who loves fragrances that express personality and elegance. A truly unforgettable scent that blends intensity and softness in perfect harmony.This product was provided for promotional purposes in exchange for my honest review.

product_name: Gelsomino a Freddo Ambrosia Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Review of Acqua di Parma Freddo Ambrosia Eau de Parfum

If you’re looking for a fragrance that truly captures the essence of summer while remaining sophisticated, Acqua di Parma's Freddo Ambrosia Eau de Parfum is a must-try. From the moment you spritz it on, you’re greeted with a refreshing burst of citrus that feels invigorating and uplifting. The top notes of bergamot and lemon create a bright and zesty opening that instantly transports you to a sun-drenched Italian terrace. It’s the kind of fragrance that makes you feel alive and ready to embrace the day.

As the scent develops, the heart notes reveal a beautiful blend of floral and herbal elements. The inclusion of lavender adds a calming touch, balancing the initial brightness with a subtle depth that is both comforting and elegant. This transition is where Freddo Ambrosia truly shines; it evolves from a lively citrus into a more complex and refined scent that feels perfect for both day and evening wear. It’s versatile enough to wear to the office or for a romantic dinner, making it a great addition to any fragrance collection.

What sets Freddo Ambrosia apart is its longevity and sillage. The base notes of cedarwood and amber create a warm, inviting finish that lingers on the skin without being overpowering. You’ll find that even after hours, there’s a delightful softness that remains, reminding you of the fragrance without overwhelming your senses. Overall, Acqua di Parma Freddo Ambrosia is a beautifully crafted perfume that embodies elegance and freshness, making it an excellent choice for anyone looking to elevate their scent game. If you appreciate high-quality fragrances that tell a story, this one is definitely worth exploring!

product_name: Gelsomino a Freddo Ambrosia Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I’ve previously tried a fragrance from Acqua di Parma some years ago and I loved it but this Gelsomino A Freddo Ambrosia is on another level. This fragrance is a complete statement maker and it projects like crazy!!! At first when I sprayed it, I immediately get the crisp lemon brightness, it is enveloped in the jasmine that somehow felt both fresh and deep. By the time the woods get settled in, I knew I was wearing something special. It’s refined, distinct, and perfect for when I want to feel a little elevated. There’s a whisper of cardamom and frankincense that gives the scent a quiet sophistication, like jasmine vines stretching in the evening air beside a flickering candle. There’s also an unexpected note of black tea and orris in the middle that keeps the fragrance from becoming too traditional. Even though it’s floral, it is not soft or simple.
What I love most about it is the balance. It’s bright but not sharp, woody but not too heavy. It feels unisex in the best way. Such a refined and polished scent overall!
I received this fragrance for free to test but my thoughts are completely unbiased.

product_name: Gelsomino a Freddo Ambrosia Acqua di Parma
review_content: I recently tested Gelsomino a Freddo Ambrosia by Acqua di Parma, and while it opens beautifully, it ultimately left me disappointed. The first impression is a bright lemony freshness that strangely reminded me of gardenia, even though that note isn’t listed. It's possibly due to the combination of jasmine, orris and sandalwood that gives off the smooth velvety gardenia like scent. It’s elegant and uplifting, but quite strong at first, so I applied sparingly to my neck and wrists. Unfortunately, the scent faded within just a couple of hours, leaving almost no trace on my skin or clothes. The packaging is stunning, and the fragrance itself is lovely at the start, but given its high price and poor longevity, I can’t recommend it overall. I received this as a part of an educational promotion

product_name: Gelsomino a Freddo Ambrosia Acqua di Parma
review_content:
A dose of sophistication in a bottle! It smells like a timeless memory, a vintage room somewhere in Europe. Not too floral, not too woody, not overpowering, but charming.
As much as I am a fan of French parfum houses, I was very pleasantly surprised by this Italian brand and the craftsmanship of this fragrance. The jasmine notes are very subtle, and patchouli brings warmth yet not very prominent. I haven’t gotten any “powdery” feel at all, it is more warm and sensual. This is a very balanced scent combo in my opinion, the one that stands out and very replicates in the market. It is long lasting!! For over 4-6 hours. The craftsmanship level truly depicts luxury. Nothing about this fragrance smells “cheap”. If you are looking for a unique scent that’s not too seasonal, I would give this fragrance a try.
I received this as a part of an educational promotion.

product_name: Gelsomino a Freddo Ambrosia Acqua di Parma
review_content: Acqua di Parma Gelsomino a Freddo Ambrosia Extrait de Parfum is a strong and long-lasting fragrance. When I first opened the gorgeous orange box, the first thing I smelled was dill. There’s a certain note in some fragrances that smells like dill to my senses. That scent lingered on my skin until it dried, then I smelled the smoky, woodsy jasmine. The scent projection isn’t that great. Only a few people said they could smell it on me. I only need to use a few spritzes for it to last all day. I received this as part of an educational promotion.

product_name: Gelsomino a Freddo Ambrosia Acqua di Parma
review_content: I recently discovered Gelsomino A Freddo Ambrosia Parfum by Acqua di Parma , and I’m genuinely in love. The moment I sprayed it, I was captivated by the fresh, almost icy brightness of the jasmine, it’s delicate yet powerful, like a cool breeze through a blooming garden. There’s a beautiful balance between floral elegance and a soft, almost creamy sandalwood warmth that lingers on my skin for hours. It feels refined without being overpowering, perfect for both day and evening wear. Every time I wear it, I get compliments and questions about what it is. It’s become one of my signature scents, and I love how it makes me feel fresh, confident, and a little luxurious. Highly recommend! I received this product as a part of an educational promotion.

product_name: Gelsomino a Freddo Ambrosia Acqua di Parma
review_content: Gelsomino a Freddo by Acqua di Parma has been the perfect scent to wear for crisp, fall weather. It has a smoky, woodsy aroma that adds depth and intrigue when you're wearing it. Right off the bat when I sprayed it , it was intense and rich. This is a scent that takes over a room and leaves a statement. I have received compliments on it and people stopping me to ask what I have on! I have to mention the elegant packaging as well. It is a transparent glass bottle showcasing the yellow liquid , it is just a delight to look at and have on my vanity. It is different than any scents that I have in my collection and the lasting power is amazing. I sprayed it on top of my clothes and could smell it lingering the next day. It is captivating and I always reach for it when I want to stand out. It's Unisex, so it would make the perfect holiday gift for anyone and I highly recommend! I received this product as a part of an educational promotion.

product_name: Gelsomino a Freddo Ambrosia Acqua di Parma
review_content: This Gelsomino a Freddo Ambrosia by Acqua di Parma fragrance is absolutely a hit with me. This is my first time trying a scent from this brand and it is a pleasant experience. From the first spray I just love it. It gives me a rich yet cozy vibe. It is a floral-woody scent with a touch of spice that I prefer in the colder months. Honestly did not know how the different scents would play together but it is really good. For me on my skin the dry down is remarkable sandalwood is a favorite of mine and this parfum does it justice. I received this as a part of an educational promotion.

product_name: Gelsomino a Freddo Ambrosia Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I’ve been absolutely loving this fragrance! It’s unique and lasts for hours! The very first time I wore it, I received a compliment. I wore it to work for a 6 hour shift and it lasted until I went to bed that night. I like to also spray it in my hair and it left my hair smelling good even when I woke up the next morning.
I received this as a part of an educational promotion.

product_name: Gelsomino a Freddo Ambrosia Acqua di Parma
review_content: I’ve been wearing Acqua di Parma Gelsomino a Freddo Ambrosia, and it’s honestly one of those scents that feels special without trying too hard. The first spritz feels fresh and elegant, then it softens into this warm, woody floral vibe that’s perfectly balanced — not too sweet, not too masculine. It feels very refined and comforting at the same time. The packaging is simple but so classy, with the golden liquid that looks beautiful on my shelf. What I really like is how long it lasts; I can still smell it on my skin hours later, even after a busy day. It’s the kind of scent that makes me feel confident and put-together. My husband actually noticed right away and told me I smelled really good — which made me love it even more. Definitely a luxurious scent I can see both men and women enjoying. I received this as a part of an educational promotion.

product_name: Gelsomino a Freddo Ambrosia Acqua di Parma
review_content: I received Gelsomino A Freddo Ambrosia by Acqua Di Prama as a part of promotion campaign from beautytap. I have not tried any of their fragrances before so I was very very excited. I have heard mixed reviews about their fragrances, but if you ask me about this particular fragrance, I am simply in love with it. Its such a sophisticated, vibrant and alluring scent. Its the type of scent you want to smell more. And good thing it lingers with you for quite a long time. Its a truly unisex scent and anyone can wear it from what I have experienced.For me its a fresh, citrus, woodsy scent with a little added spice in it. It opens with fresh and citrus notes of lemon mixed with little spice from cardamom. With time it becomes even spicier and little floral when there is addition of Jasmine notes. Best part is dried down where you can enjoy sandalwood for quite a bit of time. Packaging is simple but elegant and I love the card boxing. Although its quite highly priced fragrance, but I think it pays for your money as the fragrance speaks for itself. Definitely a worth buying scent.

product_name: Gelsomino a Freddo Ambrosia Acqua di Parma
review_content:
This fragrance smells like the coolness and calm of early morning. The jasmine is not sweet or heavy, but fresh and pure, as if it has just bloomed at dawn after a rainfall. At first, there’s a light touch of citrus — like a thin ray of sunlight breaking through the mist. Then the soft, transparent jasmine unfolds, surrounded by green notes and a gentle breath of air.

On the skin, it wears quietly and elegantly, without demanding attention, yet leaving a feeling of refinement and inner harmony. This fragrance is not about passion, but about calm, clarity, and light. It’s the kind of scent you want to wear when you need balance — when you just want to breathe and feel at ease.

product_name: Gelsomino a Freddo Ambrosia Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Acqua di Parma’s Gelsomino A Freddo Ambrosia is such a beautifully balanced scent — soft, floral, and quietly luxurious. The jasmine note feels fresh and airy, like petals just picked at dawn, while the base adds a warm, slightly musky undertone that lingers beautifully on the skin. It’s not overpowering, but it definitely makes an impression — clean, sophisticated, and timeless. I love how it transitions from crisp and cool to gently sweet as it settles. Perfect for spring mornings or cozy evenings when you want something elegant yet comforting.
If you enjoy refined florals that feel effortlessly classy, this fragrance is a must-try.

product_name: Gelsomino a Freddo Ambrosia Acqua di Parma
review_content: Acqua di Parma’s Gelsomino a Freddo Ambrosia is a beautifully refined fragrance that feels luminous, elegant, and quietly luxurious. The first spritz reveals a fresh, radiant burst of jasmine that’s crisp and airy, like delicate petals kissed by cool morning light. As it unfolds, the scent softens into a creamy floral with hints of musk and amber that linger beautifully on the skin. I love how it captures both freshness and depth—sophisticated yet effortless, never overwhelming. It carries that unmistakable Acqua di Parma signature, polished and timeless, with a modern warmth that makes it perfect for both everyday wear and special, graceful occasions.

product_name: Gelsomino a Freddo Ambrosia Acqua di Parma
review_content: Acqua di Parma Gelsomino a Freddo Ambrosia Extrait de Parfum is a rich, warm, and sophisticated scent. It’s a powerful and long-lasting fragrance. I love the elegant blend of jasmine, with the bright citrus opening, and the deep, smoky, and woody undertones. It’s got a uniqueness to it but still has a familiar luxury feel to it. It grabs your attention and I love wearing it.

product_name: Gelsomino a Freddo Ambrosia Acqua di Parma
review_content:
The first spritz is crisp and green, almost icy, before the jasmine unfolds softly beneath it, delicate but alive. It’s a floral scent that feels balanced rather than powdery, with that clean, dewy undertone Acqua Di Parma does so well. There’s something quietly confident about it, elegant without being loud, like silk in perfume form.

As it settles, the fragrance warms slightly, and the florals become smoother, more golden, while still keeping that cool, refreshing brightness. I like that it feels different from typical jasmine perfumes, lighter and more contemporary, with an almost meditative calm to it. The longevity is impressive too, lingering softly throughout the day without ever becoming overwhelming. It’s the kind of scent that makes you feel polished but not perfumed, like it belongs on skin that’s just come in from a morning breeze. On gray days, it adds a touch of clarity, and on bright ones, it feels effortlessly in tune.

product_name: Gelsomino a Freddo Ambrosia Acqua di Parma
review_content: Where's the entry for Zafferano Ambrosia?! It's absolutely exquisite!

product_name: Gelsomino a Freddo Ambrosia Acqua di Parma
review_content: This fragrance is unique and elevated compared to most scents on the market. The frankincense mixed with the other notes creates a really mature scent that makes you have to sit and think about it. It’s almost like it tells a story. It’s unique and will make you stand out from any other person wearing a perfume. As far as the product itself, scent aside, I do enjoy the packaging that it came in. It added to the experience of the fragrance and didn’t feel cheap. The bottle is beautiful as well and sets itself apart from others. If I had to change just one thing, I’d prefer if the scent lasted longer and lingered more. It’s such a beautiful scent and the extra punch and the lingering of the scent would be incredible together. That would show an even bigger message. Overall I really enjoyed the fragrance and it’s up there on my favorites list. I received this as a part of an educational promotion.

product_name: Gelsomino a Freddo Ambrosia Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I’ve literally had this perfume for just one day, and I can already tell you that I’m obsessed! Gelsomino a Freddo Ambrosia by Acqua di Parma is an absolute must have for the fall season. It’s sophisticated, elegant, and has that perfect balance of warmth and depth that feels cozy yet refined. The scent is bold, woody, and warm with a spicy undertone that lingers beautifully throughout the day. I’ve been wearing it for about five hours now, and it still smells just as rich and captivating as it did when I first applied it, which proves how long lasting it is. I’ve already received multiple compliments, and even my daughter’s teacher messaged me to ask what perfume my daughter was wearing because she loved it so much. That’s how noticeable and memorable it is! I can confidently say this fragrance has earned a permanent spot in my collection, and I’ll definitely be repurchasing once I run out. It’s my new go-to scent and without a doubt my current favorite!
This review was collected as part of a promotion.

product_name: Gelsomino a Freddo Ambrosia Acqua di Parma
review_content: As someone who truly loves perfume, I’m always searching for something that feels timeless yet unique—and Acqua di Parma Gelsomino a Freddo Eau de Parfum absolutely delivers. The scent opens with a crisp, refreshing jasmine that feels both delicate and sophisticated. What really impressed me is how long it lasts—even after hours, the fragrance still lingers beautifully on my skin. It’s fresh, floral, and effortlessly elegant—perfect for anyone who appreciates refined, long-lasting scents. I received this as a part of an educational promotion

product_name: Gelsomino a Freddo Ambrosia Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I grew up in a family where everyone adored perfumes and had many different fragrances.
So for me, since then, buying perfume is almost a sacred ritual. I know I’m depressed when I stop wanting to buy new scents. But thank God, this time I feel different — I’m meeting this autumn in a completely new way because I’ve found new love: a perfume whose scent can be described in one word — luxury. You’ll never mistake this scent for anything else. It stays on the skin for twelve hours and more — and on clothes, I won’t even start, you can still smell it days later. I can't clearly sense the citrus notes, but the amber and woody tones give it depth. The iris is simply fantastic — I’m experiencing this combination of aromas for the first time.
These are the perfumes that captivate and envelop you from the very first breath. When I wear them, I feel like I’m returning to myself. They are forgotten pleasant memories, especially of my trip to India, and that means a lot to me.
Its not "easy" combination, but perfect for evenings and especially for cold time of the year.

product_name: Gelsomino a Freddo Ambrosia Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Not sure if these these are troll down votes or not, but I tried this scent once (take with a grain of salt) and can sort of understand the controversial feelings. The open and mid were not outstanding, especially considering the price. But man the drydown was great. Maybe not 340 for a 50ml great, but pretty nice. Performance was good too which is what they were aiming for. That and to try and grab some cash from the extrait craze. I'll update again after further testing.

P.S. if you don't like the EDP because of the heavy florals, this is a better option.

product_name: Gelsomino a Freddo Ambrosia Acqua di Parma
review_content: Great scent

product_name: Acqua Nobile Magnolia Acqua di Parma
review_content: I actually like this almost better than the Magnolia EDP- yes this has many more notes but it literally floats likes a refreshing citrusy and flowery cloud around me when I first put it on. The citrus keeps the Magnolia which IS noticeable to me from getting this sort of decaying undertone that many magnolia note scents have on me- so I'm happy! It does remind me of sitting on my Great Aunt's wraparound porch in a little town on the border of Texas and Louisianna, as a child. She had two big magnolia trees and there were lemon and lime bushes planted around the base of the porch intermingled with Jasmine- so maybe this is why I ADORE and love this scent so much. It never fails to get compliments and never fails to lift my spirits and give me a little bit of the warm comfort at the same time. Its hard not to think of sitting on a big white chair with my feet dangling drinking sweet tea and lemonade with my grandparents and my great aunt. Everyone's chemistry is different and I have been looking for a good magnolia scent forever. This is the best I've found for MY chemistry.

product_name: Acqua Nobile Magnolia Acqua di Parma
review_content:
To me, this doesn’t smell like magnolia. The opening is a generic white floral, mixed with bitter lemon and musk. The white floral aspects smell like freesia and lily of the valley (both are problem notes for me - freesia is often high pitched and screetchy, and lily of the valley is often too powdery and dated.)
Dislike

product_name: Acqua Nobile Magnolia Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Ottimo profumo, piacevole da sentire sul corpo di una donna nelle frizzanti mattinate primaverili. Magnolia super, ma anche un scia acida dovuta al mix di neroli, arancia e muschio. Peccato per la longevità ed il sillage troppo limitate.
Profumo 9/10
Sillage 3/10
Longevità 3/10

product_name: Acqua Nobile Magnolia Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Acqua Nobile Magnolia has a very similar development with Magnolia Nobile on me. It opens with prominent lemon, and then dries down into a slightly watery magnolia. When I compared the two side by side, Acqua Nobile Magnolia smells softer and slightly less floral than Magnolia Nobile, and it also gets a bit more dry during the 4th and 5th hour. But I doubt I'd be able to tell the different when sniffing them separately.

The sillage is soft and the longevity is around 6 hours. If you'd like a slightly less floral and more 'cologne'-like take of Magnolia Nobile, I think Acqua Nobile Magnolia would fit the bill.

product_name: Acqua Nobile Magnolia Acqua di Parma
review_content: Nice citrus magnolia scent, very wearable in summer heat. However, something is missing here for me.

product_name: Acqua Nobile Magnolia Acqua di Parma
review_content: A very beautiful opening with a lot of citrus and magnolia. Unfortunately it only lasts for minutes and then it settles into a nice scent which will disappear soon too. The dry down is almost unnoticeable. It's a shame though for such a promising fragrance

product_name: Acqua Nobile Magnolia Acqua di Parma
review_content: Initially there is a gorgeous burst of Lily of the Valley and Citron, as it begins to dry down the magnolia comes through, and it switches into a very definite White floral, I think the citrus notes disappear pretty quickly. Acqua di Parma fragrances in my opinion either last forever, or disappear without trace within an hour or two, sadly this is towards the latter, lovely fresh summer fragrance, while it lasts. It's a beautiful fragrance, but there are a lot better in ADP's range.

product_name: Acqua Nobile Magnolia Acqua di Parma
review_content: I bought this and since had to return it to the company. I really disliked the synthetic quality to the smells in it. There is no dry down. It just disappears without a trace. I caught the magnolia/citrus at the open and it was really a smell for an older lady. I hope I get the refund for the $170 for it soon. I had judged completely and totally wrong on this. I get so excited sometimes. I don't think clearly.

product_name: Acqua Nobile Magnolia Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Lemon tart , a citrus floral!
A very cheerful. Magnolia scent with citrusy top notes and a sweet musky vanilla accent. I am likening this quite a bit , this is a nice hot weather scent. Its a citrusy/ Flowery /fresh perfume , extremely happy :) and cheerful. I might be the only one that prefers this to the EDP.

product_name: Acqua Nobile Magnolia Acqua di Parma
review_content: I love the fact that this fragrance, while perfect for summer, has no sharp citrus edges and is smooth, sensuous and utterly feminine. I love wearing this and compliments are guaranteed.

product_name: Acqua Nobile Magnolia Acqua di Parma
review_content: Super fresh and pure, invigorating floral. Very subtle and light - a veil of scent, perfect for summer. Sparkling, citrus top evolves into breathtakingly beautiful, fresh and romantic flowers sweetened by a touch of vanilla. Top notes are crisp and refreshing, heart is full of fresh flowers and the base is soft and silky. It's beautiful and classy. Moderate longevity - 5 hours. Moderate sillage - it wraps you in a cloud of scent for 2 hours, last 3h it stays close to skin.

product_name: Acqua Nobile Magnolia Acqua di Parma
review_content: I really, really like this but doesn't last on me. Shame because it's lovely. It's like a summer in the Med bottled up.

product_name: Iris Nobile Sublime Acqua di Parma
review_content: Too mature for me even though I'm an Iris fan. The Jasmine note is strong and smells cheap too. Not a fan!

product_name: Iris Nobile Sublime Acqua di Parma
review_content: It's a soapy, powdery iris scent with a good performance. Would suit a mature woman and could be a blind buy if she likes iris note, but not a fresh one but rather sometimes a cloying type. Wouldn't wear a lot.

product_name: Iris Nobile Sublime Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Looking to try this - would anyone who has it be willing to do a decant swap? I have both Iris Nobile (EDP) and Nobile Iris (EDT). Alas they are no longer in production, and though this too is now part of history, I really want to sample it!
Please message me.

product_name: Iris Nobile Sublime Acqua di Parma
review_content: Iris x Tocca Stella x Ylang ylang x potpourri

product_name: Iris Nobile Sublime Acqua di Parma
review_content: This is a very elegant yet powerful feminine iris. A crisp delicate mandarine and bergamot float over an icy cold perfect Iris Pallida which reigns supreme here. A bit of Ylang 1st press, then lacy orange blossom and sambac jasmine are woven throughout add understated complexity never smothering the Iris. A very restrained and light woody base of locust and birch frame this magnificently tailored garden in flawless, relaxed ease. No excessive sweets outside of what the natural florals bring. A touch heady, but not indolic in any way. Not much in the way of oily greasy orris and low on the powdery spectrum to my nose. Subtle frankincense and wood mitigates it with beautiful balance. I absolutely adore this

product_name: Iris Nobile Sublime Acqua di Parma
review_content: warm oily powdery note supposedly of the Iris. Can not detect other whites or woods. Consistent throughout.

product_name: Iris Nobile Sublime Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Powdery Citrus WhiteFloral.

This is potent stuff, just as the original EDP. I sprayed on paper and it fills the room. All the Nobile perfumes I have tried, even the Acquas last all day on me, with quite substantial projection.

I do appreciate that some fragrances are stronger and last longer than others, but longevity experiences are jolly subjective. Dependant on body heat, skin oils, weather, season and what a person is normally used to wearing. If you are used to wearing veritable beasts every day, all else is going to feel a bit light!
I don't find Iris Nobile Sublime to be a light scent.

Reminds me (obviously) quite significantly of the original EDP and EDT, in fact I was hard pushed to tell the difference at first sniff.
But on comparison, this one is cooler, slightly less sweet (fruity spicy violet vanilla woods), less funky chypre, to the original. In that respect, it could be perceived as a bit lighter, airier in character. Less Iris. I can still detect the star anise. cannot for the life of me detect birch!?? maybe something salty, which is perhaps a bit suedelike, but suede/leather is probably more likely from the iris. And I am getting some likeness to the metallic cool white florals in Jardins de Bagatelle EDT. And something that smells very like gardenia.

Anyhow, all the Iris Nobiles I have worn are gorgeous, and if you like one, you might like them all, as they are of similar essence. White florals (with plenty of orange blossom and citrus oils sitting atop a smooth rooty iris), with that sweet spicy Francis Kurkdijan & Caron's perfume pizzazzery.

Iris Nobile EDP is golden yellow sunset, Sublime EDP is early morning dappled sunlight in a forest of blooms.

product_name: Iris Nobile Sublime Acqua di Parma
review_content: Iris nobile sublime is a little too subdued for me. It’s very pretty and natural but it doesn’t waft.

product_name: Iris Nobile Sublime Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I just LOOOOVE this fragrance. Everytime I wear this and smell my wrist, my reaction is: "My God! I smell great!" Ha!

I like this more than Acqua di Parma Iris Nobile, as it has a star anise note that is really not my favorite, while this one doesn't include anise. Yet on my skin, this is the only one of Acqua di Parma's fragrances that just has poor longevity. On me, it becomes a skin scent about 2 hours after application.

Such a pitty! given that this is my favorite fragrance from this house. I even get better performance from Acqua Nobile Iris, which is an EDT. Still, I will continue to purchase this beauty. It will always be in my wordrobe. That´s how much I love this.

FYI, duration on my skin:
-Acqua di Parma Iris Nobile EDP: 4 hrs of moderate projection + 2 hrs as skin scent, and can live on my silk scarves up to 2 weeks.
-Acqua Nobile Iris EDT: 3 hrs of moderate projection + 2 hrs as skin scent
-Iris Nobile Sublime EDP: 2 hrs of moderate projection + 4 hrs as skin scent

product_name: Iris Nobile Sublime Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Very very elegant and nothing over the time. It is a bit like the "younger" version of Shalimar for me.

Clean, succint, and pure...

product_name: Iris Nobile Sublime Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I'm surprised at all the votes for medium silage and longevity.

For me this perfume has been a top performer in both aspects, and I don't have a great nose so unless a perfume is strong I probably won't notice it beyond the first half hour or so! INS is strong and projects - I can even smell it on yesterday's clothes from a foot of distance. Even on my skin it lasts several hours, which is a feat since my body chemistry seems to neutralize the vast majority of perfumes within 30-60 minutes.

In terms of fragrance, it's a beautiful, elegant, feminine sweet floral with some 'gravitas' to it. It's womanly, not girlish, and it's got a certain thickness to it...It smells 'liquid' or 'silky' to me, rather than 'airy' like a lot of perfumes do. It's primarily iris and orange blossom with an ever-so-slight spicy/woodsiness in the background that gives it that extra oomph.

Grade A juice!

product_name: Iris Nobile Sublime Acqua di Parma
review_content: Not an "iris" and not something of "nobile" or "sublime". Ugly and synth. 2/10

product_name: Iris Nobile Sublime Acqua di Parma
review_content: so royal

product_name: Iris Nobile Sublime Acqua di Parma
review_content: a twin of 24 faubourg !!!!!!

product_name: Iris Nobile Sublime Acqua di Parma
review_content: Beautiful perfume, but imo not an iris. On my skin the mandarin is prominent, and then the neroli.

product_name: Iris Nobile Sublime Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Acqua di Parma Iris Nobile Sublime, on me, smells quite similar to Iris Nobile EDP, mainly an orange blossom flanked by smooth iris. I'm not sure whether I can easily tell them apart if I smell them seperately.

But when compared side by side, there are a few noticeable differences. Iris Nobile Sublime appears more floral, less woody and more transparent, although it's still unmistakably elegant like the original EDP. The comparaison also helped me to pick out some more discreet notes in the original EDP, such as mimosa.

The sillage is moderate to soft and the longevity is around 8 hours. Although I find them too similar to own both, Iris Nobile Sublime is still a sophiscated floral and a solid offering from Acqua di Parma. If you happen to find Iris Nobile EDP a tad too thick, I think the Sublime version might work well.

product_name: Iris Nobile Sublime Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Absolutely heavenly !!! Acqua di Parma really knows how to create fragrances. Not only do they smell natural and of highest quality but also they have a certain elegance and richness to them that some others houses just can't quite establish. I am impressed by the entire iris. Line , EDP is amazing , rich full and elegant like no other iris scent out there. Now with the addition of sublime this iris line is even better and it is gourgous change to its original perfume. Very similar in my opinion. At this point I need to wear them both side by side to add the difference between them to my review. Which I will do in the next few days ! So far I feel it is as round and smooth and elegant as its sister :)
After wearing both I am loving both but they are quite different. The orig EDP is deeper, louder and intense. It's my favourite of all perfumes as of late. The sublime is muted , smoother and the birch makes it suede like , it not as loud and its softer and a tat less sweet. As mister chaz mentioned ,it almost feels transparent. That's a good way of putting it. Both fabulous !!!!

product_name: Iris Nobile Sublime Acqua di Parma
review_content:
This fragrance is amazing and its been in a cosmetic bag with other samples. Im surprised at Acqua di parma because their line is usually wears as low in sillage. I think the ylang and white flowers will allow it to last longer than others in this line I've tried before.


Great Fragrance.

product_name: Iris Nobile Sublime Acqua di Parma
review_content:
This is a beautiful feminine floral, very soft and slightly powdery, wears like a sheer veil. Boy, someone knows how to make good florals! it evokes an image of someone angelic and mother-like. The woody notes are beautiful, it almost feels transparent.
Overall, it's a great day-time orange blossom & iris scent, but somehow I still prefer the deeper and more intriguing Iris Nobile EDP.

product_name: Iris Nobile Sublime Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Gorgeous!! But what can I say...I love iris and orange blossom and this is the best of both worlds. Out of the bottle the neroli is beautiful and lends a gorgeous damp honey note. Not damp like musty but damp like dew on the petals of the flower. Like they were picked at the perfect moment.

Soft, elegant, ladylike...a slight hint of powder but ever so slight before the iris politely invites herself to the party. The iris begins to shine and radiate without making the other notes obsolete. A light touch of jasmine. Like you just brushed up against a beautiful blooming bush in full bloom. This almost has a musk like quality. No heavy woods and no detectable patchouli. The ending is as beautiful as the beginning. I sampled this earlier today and just ordered a bottle.

This lovely definitely is sublime!!! xoxo

product_name: Iris Nobile Sublime Acqua di Parma
review_content: I love this. It reminds me of my mother. Not that she ever wore this perfume. But this smells like the idea I have of her, if that makes any sense! Usually, I never lack words when comes the time to describe a fragrance, but not with this one. I just know it makes me very nostalgic, but in a serene way. I wear it whenever I miss her. Thank you Acqua di Parma.

product_name: Iris Nobile Sublime Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Sample review:

I had high hopes for this perfume... unfortunately this is not for me. Something is really off putting to my nose, I don't know what it is... it reminds me of civet and makes me smell dirty...

Nope nope nope... I don't like this at all.

product_name: Iris Nobile Sublime Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I have the roller ball for this and it smells absolutely amazing.
I would def recommend getting a full size bottle of this!

product_name: Iris Nobile Sublime Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Thanks to lovely MrsLetterO I am wearing a sample of this today. All I can say is that so far is that the opening notes are very promising and it smells gorgeous to me.
So, after wearing this little beauty for 8 hours, this is what I think...opening quite sweet, almost like a cross between Tom Ford Violet Blonde and Balenciaga Paris which is quite strange as there are supposedly no violets here? The drydown is a bit soapy and a bit powdery, somewhat similar to Iris Nobile but less woody. The scent would be suited well for a cold rainy day, just like today, as it is a lovely warm comfort scent which slowly turns into a 'nuzzle' scent.
One thing I will say is this though...shame it only comes in 75mls size and shame it's soooo pricey.

product_name: Iris Nobile Sublime Acqua di Parma
review_content: This is a great fragrance! I had the chance to smell it this morning and it is a beautiful jus for women. Overall floral, with a warm woodsy heart that cames out after the blast of mandarine and iris. I would suggest it for sure!

product_name: Acqua Nobile Rosa Acqua di Parma
review_content:
[AUG. 2021]
This was the kind of rose I wanted for quite a while!

Most non-niche designer florals tend to be too sweet or too bright and they usually make my nose invert itself but the 125ml Rosa EDT is exactly the pretty, light, dainty and surprisingly natural smelling tea-rose I've tried. Even Jo Malone didn't cut it (PS: I love Bronze Wood and Leather.)

I've had real rosewater and AdP's Rosa is a wearable version of that with none of the musky damp smell or pond-water inclinations of other "dirty" / naturalist roses (my exception for this genre goes to Paestum Rose, Olene, Florence Iris, Prive, Narcotic Venus, Feminite Du Bois, La Panthere Parfum, and Oud Royal.)

Has that beautiful rosewater smell very similar to Serge Lutens' Santal Majuscule but the Majuscule's cocoa-rosewood powdery sweetness got too cloying for me after a prolonged use of time. (Ironically, I still can't get enough of the milk-incense of my Carner Palo Santo because its that delicious! I guess for Majuscule it was both too bright and too heavy. Also sold my Creed Acqua Fiorentina after a while because if I'm getting this and Narcotic Venus (or Roja 51 Essence), best to send off Fiorentina to a more caring home!)

Regardless, with 125ml and a beautiful stand (the base of its box) and large bottle for this price this was a pretty good deal for me! Sometimes I might be anosmic but people around me can definitely pick up my Rosa. Quite like a 4711 but less body-tonic, more like perfume: light and multi-use with added body and detail thanks to Rosa's supporting cast of well picked spring flowery notes!

If you loved Perfume Workshop's Tea Rose (1977) this is the bang-for-buck upgrade you're looking for - - goodbye to itchy alcohol sensations and eye-wateringly thin and sharp emulations of roses. (Also consider for a wonderful time with quality florals: perfumes by Dawn Spencer Hurwitz, Patricia Nicolai, and Amouage! If this is your favourite genre of florals please enjoy Amouage's Love Mimosa!)

PS: The others are right, its very Magnolia flower smelling! This is probably why I picked Rosa EDT over Magnolia Nobile, besides price tag and the Magnolia Nobile's "yes, yes..." milquetoast agreeableness.

product_name: Acqua Nobile Rosa Acqua di Parma
review_content: Pretty but nothing to remember or groundbreaking. It could be a safe gift to buy

product_name: Acqua Nobile Rosa Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Another beautiful bright rosey fragrance. In the Acqua Nobile tradition of splendidly blended florals, on a slightly sweet, creamy base. I often prefer to wear the Aqua EDT versions, the top and middle notes are uplifted and more able to escape the more dense/intense EDP base notes of this line. I barely detect the citrus.

The freesias and pepper feel very present to begin in this cool weather testing, alongside a soft fruity edge. Salty sweet skin, of amber and musk. And of course, the main players, a full blooming bushel of roses. I could have done without the freesia (I just don't enjoy freesia note in perfumery) and cyclamen notes, but they're not too much of a pair of intruders to the mix.

It reminds me somewhat of With Love by Guerlain, but i prefer Rosa Nobile, as it's easier to wear, brighter, more rosey, a more sweet amber dry down, without the sharp, slightly chalky "florality" that is so present in floral perfumes from early 2000's.
La Colle Noire also springs to mind, even Aerin's Rose de Grasse. Depends what you are looking for in a rose. This rose is pretty, modern, clean, quite simple, but not boring.

EDIT: this has really quite a powerful scent to my nose today. esp. for an EDT. It's been a few hours, it seems to intensify with wear.

product_name: Acqua Nobile Rosa Acqua di Parma
review_content: Sometimes you find cheap perfumes that smell expensive (the best kind!) and sometimes you find expensive perfumes that just don't live up to the pricetag. This is the latter for me. The top notes of this are a loud, obnoxious, very typical "perfumy" smell that I feel like I've smelled hundreds of times before and didn't like it any of those hundreds of times either. Once you get down to the pretty little rose that's been buried, suffocating under all the top notes, it's so quiet and exhausted from all the weight that it's barely detectable. I'd have to spray too much of the part I don't like to smell the part that I do like, and that's a no-go for me for sure.

product_name: Acqua Nobile Rosa Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I have a vivid image from my childhood. Wintertime, I'm asleep and my parents are back from the movies. My bedroom is like a freezer, my mother enters my bedroom and on top of my blanket covers me with her fur coat.
The fur coat was impregnated with a scent similar to Rosa Nobile.
Rosa Nobile is like a warm hug.the rose is accurate and perceptible but it's a clear scent, not heady. But I Guess peony and violet help on that.
Undoubtedly I would purchase this fragrance, it's extremely nice and attractive. But perhaps it's my mind playing emotional blackmail to my senses.
Either way, I really like it. As feminine as it gets.

product_name: Acqua Nobile Rosa Acqua di Parma
review_content: Not very rosey, a lot of calone though. Reminds me more of magnolia accord than rose. That is not bad to me as i am often put off by strong rose scents but the calone"freshness" is not something i enjoy. Simple slightly rosey freshness is what you find here.

product_name: Acqua Nobile Rosa Acqua di Parma
review_content: A pretty "pink" rose with a supporting cast of fruit and other flowers. Nothing unexpected or out of the ordinary. Just a fresh, gauzy, weightless rose for those who don't like the intense, almost jammy red roses that you sometimes get. I like both kinds :) but I guess I will look for something more unique.

product_name: Acqua Nobile Rosa Acqua di Parma
review_content:
A very nice and freshsweet Rose/Musk/soft pepper-mix scent. Great for the office or everyday-scent. Reminds me alot of Van Cleef Arpels Feerie Rose des Neiges.

En väldigt fräsch och lite söt Ros/Musk/ mjuk peppar-mix doft. Perfekt för kontoret eller som varje-dag-doft. Påminner mycket om Van Cleef & Arpels Rose des Neiges.

product_name: Acqua Nobile Rosa Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I had sampled the previous version of Rosa Nobile and liked it but found that it had poor longevity. This newer version is very synthetic smelling, more sour fruity with the black currant note, and smells like every other synthetic rose perfume out there. Luckily, the one I'm wearing today was a free gift with purchase from Nordstrom. Very glad I didn't spend the money for a rollerball of this!

Unoriginal, and I don't like the black currant note.

product_name: Acqua Nobile Rosa Acqua di Parma
review_content: Rose scent created in old-fashioned, solid way, that makes me think of charming high society ladies in the 40's. It's true rose with a bit of spice. So far from today's mainstream sweet sticky scents!

product_name: Acqua Nobile Rosa Acqua di Parma
review_content:
The opening of Acqua Nobile Rosa features a more obvious lemon note than Rosa Nobile. But after about 30 minutes, these two have a very similar revolution on me - turning from a unisex peppery rose to an aqueous concoction of limpid rose, peony and salty musk. I can't tell much difference even comparing them side by side.

The sillage is moderate to soft and the longevity is around 9 hours. Acqua Nobile Rosa is as pretty and modern as Rosa Nobile, just slightly more citrus and lighter. But I'm not sure it stands out among other similar but more affordable modern rose fragrances.

product_name: Acqua Nobile Rosa Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Still no reviews, so I will add mine.
Got a small tester spray vial of this perfume, decided to try it on, my partner likes rose perfumes, I always think they are a bit "old lady cupboard", or soap like.
This was a pleasant surprise, it is not only soapy rose, but it has a nice freshness, something citrus like in the opening, then a fresh touch of cassiss, very gentle. And lots of fresh roses, almost smelling like wild roses.
Reminds me or rose scented lemonade, and that is good.
Nice spring early summer perfume, it reminds me a bit of Eau d'Issey, but I can't say why.
May be I'll become a rose convert...

product_name: Colonia Il Profumo Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Something between Hermes Citron Noir and Chanel pour monsieur, but a high quality, easy to wear juice.
Unisex, although it leads to more masculine I would be happy to smell it on a woman.
I will have to wait for spring to try it in the high temperature.

product_name: Colonia Il Profumo Acqua di Parma
review_content: Smells like really basic boys locker room (albeit a version that smells like it was made of high quality ingredients) overlaid with a really punchy and sharp citronellol note that made me feel ill. Dry down was just a very basic cologne but the top notes were horrific. Heavily regret spraying this on my skin, I felt like a prisoner.

product_name: Colonia Il Profumo Acqua di Parma
review_content:
After seeing all the trends—the oud, the sweet gourmands—it's fragrances like Colonia Il Profumo that remind you why the classic formulas always shine. Sometimes, simplicity and quality are truly all you need.

This is such a bright, uplifting fragrance that just puts a smile on my face. It follows that classic structure: sparkling citrus in the top, some floral middle notes, all resting on a clean, woody-aromatic base.

What keeps it from being boring is the subtle creativity in the blend. The notes of pineapple, verbena, and ylang-ylang add a touch of uniqueness that makes it stand out from typical citrus colognes. It's unique enough to be interesting, but still familiar enough to feel comforting. A solid release that proves classic style never fails.

Rating: 7/10 (Uplifting and timeless.)

product_name: Colonia Il Profumo Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Very classy piercing barbershop scent. Reminiscent of old school splash aftershaves and soapy shaving foam. In the dry down it becomes very fresh and soapy in a similar way to imagination. Decent projection for the 2-3 hours. Reminds me of something my Grandad used to wear. It has that old man vibe about it. But a well groomed and put together old man who has a lot of money and prefers the finer things in life.

Makes you feel like you have your shit together. And people who don’t know you might think you’re wealthy. Neither of which are true. But hey, it’s good to let people assume 😂

product_name: Colonia Il Profumo Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Really nice, delicate ”old money” scent
Clean
Beautiful

BUT

for 160€ / 50ml it’s a tough sale..

product_name: Colonia Il Profumo Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Definitely in the lane of the Colonia line, feels like the original Colonia with that Lemon, Petitgrain and Verbena on top and Vetiver with Cedar to give it some depth. You can absolutely use it every day, even on autumn-winter, but it’s more suited in the day for these seasons. I personally feel it has too much depth for a high heat summer day, but you may be able to get away with it if you like stronger fragrances, for this case I would definitely go with Essenza. Duration is good but not great or beast mode, absolutely worthy of trying this fragrance.
9.5/10

product_name: Colonia Il Profumo Acqua di Parma
review_content: I've never smelt an Acqua di Parma fragrance that I've liked and Il Profumo does not break the streak. To me, it starts off with very sharp and unappealing citrus, then dies down into a mishmash of deeper notes. It's virtually gone from my skin in an hour, with just a faint whisper of a cologne-like scent. Anyone want a 12ml of it?

product_name: Colonia Il Profumo Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Acqua di Parma Il Profumo is a citrus, herbal, and woody fragrance.

Its opening has excellent citrus and herbal notes, as is customary with Acqua di Parma. Bergamot and lime are the most noticeable, along with herbal notes of petitgrain, basil, lemon verbena, and neroli flower. As the minutes pass, woody notes, oakmoss, vetiver, patchouli, and a leather accord vaguely reminiscent of Parma Leather increase in presence, but in this fragrance, the aromatics dominate.

This new version of the Acqua di Parma cologne line is ideal for daytime wear in any season and occasionally for evening wear during the summer. Perfect for office work, formal, or casual situations, as it provides a good degree of elegance.

The longevity of this fragrance was not bad for me, lasting up to 8 hours. With a good scent trail for the first two hours, it's moderate to weak throughout its development.

This is another fragrance I really liked from the 2025 releases, and I've already enjoyed several this year.

product_name: Colonia Il Profumo Acqua di Parma
review_content: Bug spray/citronella candles. The citrus is really astringent in this one. Smells a little soapy also from the strong neroli. Not a fan

product_name: Colonia Il Profumo Acqua di Parma
review_content: This scent instantly took me back to sitting in an Italian country estate, surrounded by lemon & orange orchards. It's fresh and rich, not overpowering. Unfortunately it didn't last more than a couple of hours on me, the only negative.

product_name: Colonia Il Profumo Acqua di Parma
review_content:
It's that type of scent very appealing to me. Here we have nothing new for sure but this parfum is very nice. So nice that i bought a 180ml bottle. basically it's the original colonia but more modern, deeper, denser. This and buongiorno are very solid releases. Regarding the performance, i have to say that my 180ml bottle has an inferior performance compared to the 100ml tester bottle of the store. The difference is quite clear to my nose. So this is the only down side, i hope the maturation of the juice will help me. However the smell is fantastic but the price is a bit too high considering the performance (at least with my bottle).
Bellissimo profumo, è la classica colonia ma un po' più moderna, più densa e interessante. Se vi piace il genere è un amore scontato. L'unica cosa deludente è la performance: la mia bottiglia da 180ml ha una performance nettamente inferiore a quella del tester del negozio. Quello della profumeria mi è rimasto tanto sulla pelle mentre quello che ho comprato dura molto meno. Che sfiga.

Scent -9
Longevity -6,5
Sillage-6,5
Uniqueness-6,5
Versatility-8,5
Presentation-6,5
Compliment factor-8
Backup bottle? Maybe

My vote-8

In one word- sun

Alternative - the colonia og, colonia essenza, dior eau sauvage...

product_name: Colonia Il Profumo Acqua di Parma
review_content: An aftershave gel for a 60 year old man that surprisingly lasts quite long as for perfumes of this brand. If you like Versace LHomme or Eau Savage, you will definitely like this one too.

product_name: Colonia Il Profumo Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I do like the Colonia line very much, the original, pura and essenza. Saying this is tried this out in John Lewis last week and it’s amazing and bought a 50ml bottle on the spot. Fresh, quite fruity citrus, not too sweet. Relatively long lasting and natural citrus too, maintains the same dna of the original Colonia so if you like that it’d be hard to not love this. Everything feels updated with more advanced ingredients . A bit fruiter and a more long lasting dry down, projects for a couple of hours and dries down to a slightly fruity, soapy neroli.
If you have the money to burn it’s an easy, impossible to hate, blind buy especially for aa more mature man/woman who likes citrus and pettigrain/neroli. Either way do yourself a favour and seek it out to sample next time you see an Acqua de Parma stand.
Outside of this site, I will gatekeep this for myself :)

product_name: Colonia Il Profumo Acqua di Parma
review_content: I’m anti Citrus guy and I like this one which is citrus based, that says a lot

product_name: Colonia Il Profumo Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I had posted a review of this fragrance in the past, when I sniffed it at a store and couldn't get over how good it smelled. I am happy to report that I was able to get my hands on a 100ml bottle of it and wear it a couple of times. I still stand by what I said a long while ago. This is an absolute banger of a fragrance.

This is a quite complex fragrance. The opening is pretty much bright, fizzy, very strong, almost bitter citruses with some sweetness in the background. Most of the very strong citruses wear off in around an hour or two, leaving behind the sweetness and introducing some floral notes. This sounds very feminine, but the sandalwood (and maybe leather too?) slaps it right back into the masculine zone (or unisex at the very least). Definitely not a super masculine fragrance, and I can imagine ladies being able to pull this one off without too much of a problem. The dry down lasts around 7 -8 hours on my skin which is really really impressive for this kind of fragrance. In total, the fragrance lasts for around 8-9 hours on my skin. This is not a weak fragrance by any means. And if this somehow still doesn't satisfy you, you can apply a bit of it to your clothes without having to worry about them getting spoiled. Just make sure you apply from a distance and avoid applying on pure white clothes. This is easily a 3 season special occasions fragrance for me. Every now and then, I just keep on reaching for the bottle, and sniffing the cap. This fragrance always brings a big wide smile to my face.

I also got my hands on the OG colonia, and now I can actually see that they are quite a bit different from each other. Il Profumo is definitely the modern version of the OG colonia. If I were to talk in audiophile terms, ADP took the OG colonia, bass boosted it (made it sweeter), and treble boosted it (made the citruses stronger), and made it louder (project more and last more), and named it Il Profumo. The OG colonia does not have this much sweetness or brightness. It is for sure a timeless scent, but the Il Profumo, however, might not be considered as a timeless scent. I do prefer the Il Profumo, not just because of the longevity, but also the scent. Overall, I would rate this fragrance 10/10 not taking the high price point in consideration. Just the scent itself and its performance is absolute perfection.

product_name: Colonia Il Profumo Acqua di Parma
review_content: Essenza revisited, modernized and more versatile, I prefer this one. I tested it today, it's 34°, unfortunately the longevity is not good on my skin, I will do another test later when it's milder

product_name: Colonia Il Profumo Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Opens masculine with a really fruity and clearly pink, not black, pepper (pink peppers are fruits), brightness and citrus.
When the mids come the rose gives it some sweetness and it starts to lean unisex.
Once the florals disappear it dries down masculine again. I get vetiver in the dry down most prominently but it is not out of balance like I find a lot of fragrances with vetiver.

I sampled this along with PDM Castley (which is beastly) and this clearly performs worse than that but I would not classify this as bad performance. I think it has normal/good performance.

This is a banger and my current favorite from ADP.

product_name: Colonia Il Profumo Acqua di Parma
review_content: I'll Profumo opens sort of like a trybrid of the OG Colonia, the greatest Citrus Aromatic ever Dior Eau Sauvage EDT, and maybe Chanel Pour Monsieur. Really nice. My invoking those three comparatives is based on memory, even though I have bottles of all three in my collection. I did spray the 1916 Colonia original on blotter to compare while wearing Il Profumo though. The Il Profumo is modern, while the OG is of course a more vintage DNA. And I think the OG is smoother, and the classic vintage scent profile is classier. It gives me vibes of a luxury soap in an Art Deco luxury hotel in Hollywood of the 1920's. I can imagine Cary Grant wearing it in the 1930's, which he did. Thats the advantage of the original Colonia for me. Il Profumo has more of a scratchy, woody texture due to its cedar, vetiver, and petitgrain. It also dries down to go its own way, so it's not entirely redundant to the others. It's beautiful, make no mistake about that.

product_name: Colonia Il Profumo Acqua di Parma
review_content: I agree that it is similar to Colonia OG and to Chanel Pour Monsieur. So slightly powdery.Elegant

product_name: Colonia Il Profumo Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Fragantica is wrong again on the official notes. Here’s the official breakdown straight from the brand’s website

Olfactive family: Citrus Aromatic

Top notes: Italian Bergamot, Grapefruit, Blood Orange, Petitgrain

Heart notes: Rosemary, Ylang Ylang, Orange Leaves Absolute

Bottom notes: Vetiver, Patchouli

product_name: Colonia Il Profumo Acqua di Parma
review_content: Wonderful and FUN lemon candy opening. Then turned saltier with shades of my beloved Colonia Futura. But the final stage smelled like the original Colonia, which is to say, old-fashioned.

product_name: Colonia Il Profumo Acqua di Parma
review_content:
You want a citrus cologne type smell that’s going to last? Going to have to make some compromises. This is that. And in line with LV line of freshies. Naturals mixed with synthetics/molecules to helps push it and stretch out performance. And you can smell it. It doesn’t have the fully natural smell of the OG.

But it does have the staying power. However after a few hours it’s more of an intimate affair. I always find that with scents like these, when you spray them is the best most uplifting part. I don’t mind reapplying if I can. It’s that burst of freshnes that is mood lifting and refreshing. And for those that have it, during the mid and base you get wafts of Dior’s Eau Savauge EDP.

Also the notes here are off. There is no pineapple or neroli. Wish they had put neroli.

product_name: Colonia Il Profumo Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Modernized version of Colonia but on steroids. Opening is more pronounced.

Still prefer essenza tho.

product_name: Colonia Il Profumo Acqua di Parma
review_content: Classic AdP Colonia DNA intensified. It smells of quality but I feel like it needed an edge to stand out from this collection and similar stuff.

product_name: Colonia Il Profumo Acqua di Parma
review_content: This is not acqua di parma style of cologne. Cheap synthetics feels like dior sauvage.

product_name: Colonia Il Profumo Acqua di Parma
review_content: annoying bergamot , reminds me of a saloon shop liquid for men after shave

product_name: Colonia Il Profumo Acqua di Parma
review_content: I'm glad I had the opportunity to try this in a 1.5ml sample size first before spending on a full bottle. My experience was, unfortunately the exact same as reviewer Vladyslav1389: initially a plate of rich, juicy citrus that lasted for all of about 10 minutes before quickly thinning out and proceeding to a fairly pedestrian base. Too bad, had high hopes for it...

product_name: Colonia Il Profumo Acqua di Parma
review_content: Ah, what a classic. Absolutely gorgeous and a tad more intense. Smells exceptionally masculine and something you would smell on someone that owns a yacht. So pleasant and inviting.

product_name: Colonia Il Profumo Acqua di Parma
review_content: A more refined and nuanced version of Colonia. Retains the citrus opening and the pleasing colonia DNA, but adds a touch of sweetness, warmth and more mature complexion. Lasts quite long on skin. Sandalwood and patchouli add nice woody notes to it. Would recommend 09/10.

product_name: Colonia Il Profumo Acqua di Parma
review_content: I love this fragrance and it was not disappointing at all. It smells near the original, but with added pineapple, lavender and ylang ylang. A brighter version to the original. 10/10

product_name: Colonia Il Profumo Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Modern interpretation of the classic however personally I prefer the original.

Colonia has a timestamp on it, it feels of its time and timeless. Part of the reason I enjoy it so much is to think of all the people who have worn it through the years and how it was the scent in the air during periods of history.

This opens much the same to my nose and stays similar for the first hour or so but when the soapy citrus notes begin to drop off your left with a very modern woody base which could be any number of modern perfumes. The original settles into a feeling of quiet Italian confidence where as this just loses that in my opinion.

It’s nice but it doesn’t scratch the same itch as the original. It’s a product of it’s time and the fact that the general populous want everything to last forever and project heavily, some things aren’t meant to.

product_name: Colonia Il Profumo Acqua di Parma
review_content: The mid is the same as the OG Colonia to my nose, with the top having a pineapple twist added and the base notes have been given a modern aroma chemical treatment (something vanillic? Akigalawood? After three hours or so you can tell it’s not a classic AdP. A bit redundant but it’s alright.

product_name: Colonia Il Profumo Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Aloha all,
I can’t get away from this. I wrote a review on Reddit and a version of it is:

This cologne is Earnest Hemingway driving a limited edition convertible Porsche, with a 24 karat colored orange-yellow-brown supple leather interior, highlighted with a French Ultra Marine Blue trim. The exterior can be whatever color you like most: heather Grey, Black, Warm Dark Blue, or Silver?

The motor was made by three well-dressed, sun-kissed Italian engineers, on loan from Ferrari, who took their time to pay homage to both Porsche and Ferrari ethos, while they perfected this smooth, efficient, quietly elegant rumble of a beast machine; adding several inches to the front, back, sides, and roominess; they also made sure not to deviate too far from either brand. A Porsche on the outside; a Ferrari on the inside, and a unique updated Porsche emblem.

This Earnest Hemingway edition Porsche only drives during balmy weather and when the sun is glowing orange warmth, or is it that this car simply changes the weather to be as such whenever you are near it?

Earnest drives from one town to the next. Stopping at restaurants along the way that overlook the Mediterranean. You warmly wave to him when his silage hits you. He’s not arrogant, at all, and smiles back. He never speeds, so you can see his face, but if you’re unaware… he might pass you before you smell him.

When he stops to eat. Waiters bring him some fresh cheese, olive oil, and a small portion of healthy protein. He stays briefly, and is served an espresso which he drinks in and enjoys for what seems an eternity, yet quickly gets up and reads aloud to everyone his latest vignette he dreamt up while driving to this meal. He’s gone and you are left wanting more, but fully understanding a novel within minimal words. Like his prose, this cologne is: simple, succinct, and to the point.

I have been cheating with this. It’s a near 9.6; however, it does not last as long as I’d like, and I have added some Molecule 01 to my travel bottle along with decanting some of this cologne into it, and I love it! Definitely helps!

I also have molecule 01 + patchouli and molecule 01 + black tea. I just layered the M01 + patchouli, let it dry, and then applied my five sprays of Colonia il Profumo (one behind each ear, back of neck, chest, and shirt & neck - just after moisturizing with hyaluronic acid). This is my normal routine with this; however, you could go 7 sprays and if so, this is what I’d recommend if you’re going out out:

Shower. Moisturize with Hyaluronic Acid; special attention to back of neck and behind ears.

Spray behind each ear, one back of neck and hair, another moisturized undressed chest, one back of knees (squeeze close together), one spray into each crook of your elbow, held close to your body with your shirt now on (so some overspray hits your shirt), and then you’re done. Normally I’d only do five! This cologne needs five sprays, and possible refresh of three sprays several hours into your day.

3-5 for school, work, or day to day, and seven if you’re going out out.

I think layering it with the M01 and patchouli is ingenuous! I already know the M01as a base helps. Tomorrow I will try two layering sprays of the M01+ black tea plus 5 sprays. I am afraid to derail the original, but I’m after longevity here and I am convinced the M01 helps.

One small caveat is: the ylang ylang seems to bother my eyes until it dries down. I am a little sensitive to some things but not a lot, but I noticed this each time I wear it. I will push past this, because that is how elegant this scent is.

For what it’s worth: I KrUsH Acqua Di Gio Profundo and just got the Elixir (and love it), most days of the week. I also appreciate Armani Code, Le Labo Tuberuse 40 & Santal, but my running top five are:

Molecule 01 layered with: ADG Profundo.
ADG Elixir (thus far - a little too new to tell - this might drop down one).
This! And, layering is still being fleshed out.
Molecule 01 layered with: Acqua Di Parma Amalfi.
Prive Blue Laluzi.

product_name: Colonia Il Profumo Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I’m glad I sampled it. This fragrance starts out great but immediately this takes on to different direction that doesn’t quite resemble the colonia DNA. Not really classic soapy but more of a modern citrus and woody. Resembles of many modern designer colognes. A safe blind buy. But disappointed by the absence of “Colonia” profile.
PS. This doesn’t have pineapple or leather or many notes that fragrantica states. It should be corrected.

product_name: Colonia Il Profumo Acqua di Parma
review_content: I bought the 180ml, which I’m regretting. It’s nice at first but the dry-down veers into woody amber territory, which I’m not fan of.

product_name: Colonia Il Profumo Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I'm a little puzzled that no YT reviewers (other than Persolaise) have bothered to review this?
Possibly because they've not been sent a free bottle?
I mean, it's not a clone house, and it's a major house, and it's out there now, so.....?

product_name: Colonia Il Profumo Acqua di Parma
review_content: I don't understand people who write about durability for several hours. I bought 180 ml for $250 hoping for durability, but I got 10 minutes of rich citrus, which is similar to lemon candies when you just opened the package with them. Then it disappears and sandalwood or moss appears, which is almost elusive, unless you sniff very hard and closely. But after an hour, it is gone altogether. I look at the name "Profumo", then in the mirror at a person who could buy a simple cologne for $50 and understand why. The biggest disappointment of 2025. I can conclude that the reviews here are written in the interests of the company. Be sure to buy a sample or decant before buying a bottle.

product_name: Colonia Il Profumo Acqua di Parma
review_content:
At last, what all the Colonia fans have been waiting for. A parfum of the beautiful fragrance that will last. Unfortunately this is not it. I have the original Colonia, which is amazing, but wears off quickly as we know.
