Then I purchased Essenza hoping for something that lasts longer (which it mildly does).Then I accidentally found out that there was a parfum drop of the original. So I received a bottle for my Birthday and was super exited to try this version out. Four good neck sprays and one on each wrist reveals a nice lemon and Neroli scent and that’s about it. Hasn’t got the nice soapy/powdery trail of the original and dries down just as quickly to nothing within an hour or so. It’s a pretty basic scent that you wouldn’t mind spending £25 on but not over £100. So after waiting a long time for this release and I’ve used it everyday for a week now and have to ask other people ‘can you smell it’?, to which the answer is “barely”.
So overall way too expensive for a generic fresh scent that won’t last. A disappointment I’m afraid.

product_name: Colonia Il Profumo Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I messed up by smelling it at a store the other day. Now I am desperately waiting for it to hit discounters......If it doesn't hit discounters by 3 months or so, I will just buy it full retail. I am just taking the benefit of the fact that this is a summer-ish fragrance and right now it is full winter.

This was my first time smelling anything from Acqua Di Parma. My initial reaction to it was something like: "It feels like somebody squeezed a lemon right inside my nose".....in short, I didn't like it. However, I took the test strip home along with many others that I smelled at the store that day. Colonia Il Profumo grew on me like bamboo. And I can easily say that this would last a really really long time on the skin since i could still smell the perfume on the strip 3 days after.

To me, this is the freshest smelling fragrance that I ever put my nose on. This one would easily be a "special occasions summer fragrance" in my collection. I would easily rock it during the day and even night.

Honestly, my nose isn't developed enough to be able to make out much of a difference between the OG version (Colonia EDC) and this version. The only difference was that this one smells a little more strong, a little more on the lemon which I can easily say is just because it has more fragrance oil. I am not buying the EDC because everybody says that it doesn't last more than 4 hours. I am only waiting for the Il Profumo because of the longevity. Otherwise I would say both are quite similar and I don't have a preference for one over the other.

And yes, this is my first Fragrantica review EVER. I just had to start with this fragrance. I am absolutely in love with it.

product_name: Colonia Il Profumo Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I agree with what @chemdar is saying a couple of messages below. I does inscribe itself in the colonia line (no surprises there). The pineapple is maybe the one note that sticks out. Once it dried down I found the neroli to really come forward and to make Colonia Il Profumo to smell a lot like Essenza.

I don't know for the longevity if I would say it's greater than anything else in the line. It seems to be alongside Essenza and C.L.U.B. but I would need to try a few more times to be sure.

Overall a pleasant experience, but I will wait until it hits discounter sites before considering buying it. In the meantime, I'll stick to Essenza to get my Colonia fix.

product_name: Colonia Il Profumo Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I love it!

So juicy, full of zest with the elegant drydown.
10/10
Can’t wait for spring to come so I can given this one a proper wear in warmer weather.

product_name: Colonia Il Profumo Acqua di Parma
review_content: To me, this fragrance smells alike to colonia. the differences are the slight pineapple notes at the top of the fragrance that is gone after a few second and that this has greater longevity compared to anything else in the colonia line.

product_name: Colonia Il Profumo Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Got a sample a week back, totally fell in love with it!

The original Colonia was a signature scent of mine, but after sampling the new. Well it has changed.

Colonia profumo still has the same DNA as colonia, but made it modern and up to date. Not as sharp, smoother, more lemony opening and last longer. Florals lingering in the background. Due to it being an EDP the EDC has a larger projection.

Colonia Profumo is a signature scent for the well groomed, stressfree man who knows his own worth!

All seasons, all occasions, day and night!

Instant purchase and one of my top 5 of all time!

product_name: Colonia Il Profumo Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Have smelt this today and I am not impressed. This iteration smells like a marketing product (which factually it is if you check the website and all the very expensive accessories presented with the launch of this eau de parfum) because it lacks personality compared to the original and as such will please the largest common denominator, which is LVMH politics nowadays. Leans more feminine too.
A hard pass and makes me appreciate my last buy, Bienaimé Monsieur, even more.

product_name: Colonia Il Profumo Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Smells fantastic. Fizzy, warm, masculine. Very nice citrus, as is to be expected of ADP. Performance is mediocre, at best. Price is just too much for an ADP, regardless of concentration. I know some will disagree. That's ok. I tested it, and despite it smelling good, it neither blew me away nor performed in a way that could justify the high price.

(Once this hits discounters, the price issue won't be as big of a deal, though)

product_name: Colonia Il Profumo Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Thick, oily neroli, fresh mint, fizzy grapefruit and a dry, clean woody note.
An actual improvement on the original with sweetness being toned down and the citrus being way fizzier and a touch more bitter which I always enjoy in a freshie.
Lovely stuff!

product_name: Colonia Il Profumo Acqua di Parma
review_content: Just received this today and am immediately impressed. The sandalwood-suede-patchouli is sooo lovely and adds a nice warmth and depth to the hyperpresent super sparkly citrus. Unisex leaning masc so far. Will report back 🥰

product_name: Colonia Il Profumo Acqua di Parma
review_content: Stunning. Did I say stunning. I only purchased Naxos last week (which I am trialling) but if you love citrus and really sweet and powerful citrus, this is for you. This is far stronger than Naxos - it shares similar notes but it’s much more powerful. This is very sweet and almost takes you into Gourmand as some how it is super sweet on my skin - the lemon and orange are candied and also fresh - it’s not bitter at all. I think the blending of the florals and the pineapple give this its sweetness without me smelling it as a note (not being a fan of pineapple in fragrance - I’m really happy about that 😊). One squirt and I was hooked. This is my first in this brand - and now I will definitely try many more.

product_name: Colonia Il Profumo Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Firstly, this is a very AdP style fragrance, that doesn’t veer off a well trodden path so fans of the house will be pleased. I’ve only just got it so will update more once I’ve worn it properly. However, first impressions give me a very bright, fizzy citrus opening that’s strong and potent. As it dries down, the florals come to the fore and this stage actually reminds me more of pre-reformulated Essenza, which I had many years ago. It has that soapy clean, floral musk. Fortunately, I don’t find the florals too feminine and this can easily be worn by anyone. I’m not a patchouli fan but fortunately I don’t get much in the base. It’s very reminiscent of Colonia overall but with a more modern vibe.

Performance seems decent although not a powerhouse but certainly more potent than many of their fragrances, lasting throughout the day with a good amount of projection for a few hours before lingering as a more intimate scent. I find it perfectly unisex and this will be a stunner when the summer arrives.

Fans of AdP style fragrances who wish for better performance will find this super appealing. They’ve stuck to what they do best rather than taking it into completely different territory which is a big win for me. The big trick they’ve pulled off very well, imho, is maintaining the essence of Colonia but giving it a slight update so it doesn’t smell so dated, whilst increasing performance which is always a good thing. I could imagine this becoming very popular. Gorgeous fragrance, bravo AdP.

product_name: Colonia Il Profumo Acqua di Parma
review_content: Yes! This is what I'm talking about! Colonia is my favorite fragrance of all time so I'm very excited to own this. I've been wanting ADP to put just a BIT more emphasis on performance to make the house more relevant, and I'm glad this is how they begin. All that's left are some new modern Italian standalone fragrances (i.e. not a Colonia flanker or ingredients/Mediterraneo/signatures of the sun collection).

product_name: Colonia Il Profumo Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Wearing this as I type. The original, whilst classic, had a slight fustiness for me, this is colonia brought up to date. It’s very clean and warm. Well put together, classic even. Im looking forward to this one in summer, but for a fresh lift and post shower clean feeling, it’s lovely in winter too.

So let’s get into it. I get the pineapple but literally the faintest of faint. The ylang ylang gives a nice floral touch but not overly feminine, especially as it’s balanced out by the neroli. The musks are gentle, clean, almost suedy.

Look, I could go on, but this is much more than the sum of its parts. I think it’s a beautifully crafted fragrance. Longevity seems fine. I liked it after sampling so I hit the 180ml bottle. This is going to be a great weekend go to and daily up-lifter. It’s classy, it’s clean. It’s elegant. Don’t expect fireworks, but expect to feel well put together when wearing this. Recommended.

product_name: Colonia Il Profumo Acqua di Parma
review_content: Sampled this in store today. Faithful to the original, however it does feel stronger and longer-lasting. I pick up more florals, giving it a slightly more modern feel than the orignal. I really didn't pick up any pineapple, thankfully. Overall, I'm happy to report it's still "Colonia", but amped up, as a "profumo" should be. Pleasantly surprised, as I haven't liked any of the AdP releases in a while. Planning on purchasing.

product_name: Colonia Il Profumo Acqua di Parma
review_content: What's the deal here? Any news on this? Can't find anything about it...

product_name: Colonia Il Profumo Acqua di Parma
review_content: As biggest Acqua di Parma glazer, I hope it will be a Worthy continuation of Colonia's legacy.

product_name: Colonia Il Profumo Acqua di Parma
review_content: Are we in the future?

product_name: Colonia Il Profumo Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I'm interested in this one.
I hope it's a better performing yet still as 'sparking' version of the EDC, perhaps slightly modernised, and minus the old guy/lady vibe in the dry down.
Sadly however, I fear it will simply be an over heavy, cloying and darker take on the OG, More like Dior Eau Sauvage Parfum 2017 than Colonia, at which point I'm out.

The proof will be in the testing, and I hope I'm wrong.

product_name: Colonia Il Profumo Acqua di Parma
review_content: Was launched in 2025. Fragrantica trying to trip me up.

product_name: Colonia Il Profumo Acqua di Parma
review_content: blimey, mention pineapple and watch the aventus comparisons. sigh

product_name: Colonia Il Profumo Acqua di Parma
review_content: This is something I’ve been asking for since about 2018, very excited to try it when it comes out.

product_name: Ambra Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content: Sexy leather car interior, very umami and not offensive like Ombré Leather and the rest of the abbrasive leather fragrances. Doesn’t have any sweetness, tho. Really addictive but performance is bad. If you can live with that, this is sexiness in a bottle. I might get a bottle just bc of how good this is but I don’t wanna pay more than 80 bucks for it because it’s gone after 3h.

product_name: Ambra Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content:
This amber is salty. Truly, undeniably so. No sweetness or bubble gum, no smoke, as might be expected. No, there's a certain fragrant dryness as sensed in pencil shavings and oily graphite, orris root, ambrette and clay. But most of all, thick ambergris the way I imagine it without having smelled the real material. Seamud, deep and rich mineralic smell, crossbred with the original Colonia's bitter-floral orange blossom. It seemed force-fed into the fragrance at first and I can imagine it's obligatory for all AdP fragrances to contain it in small amounts; but it surely gives a certain familiar soapy barbershop angle to the saltiness, a bit of light in this glowing dusk of a fragrance.
It is salty ambergris, yes, but taken out of the sea, inhabiting it's own space between storms and cozy homes.
Ambrarem by Histories de Parfums renders a similar salty amber accord, pairing it with equally elemental oud note. It is more dramatic and somber at the same time, like a gothic driftwood from a Frankenstein movie (love it).
Here, thanks to the Acqua di Parma lining, a strange but acceptable balance, or contrast, is achieved. Despite the raw unsweetened nature of the material, it can easily serve as a regular cologne, too

product_name: Ambra Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content: THE autumn fragrance, incredible scent! Long lasting, you get whiffs from this throughout the whole day!

product_name: Ambra Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content: Blind-bought because of the sandalwood-ambergris combo and I am not disappointed. It has an intense, slightly aquatic, slightly animalic ambergris that gives the entire fragrance a pop, a somewhat leathery--or dark wood--backbone, a smoothness from the sandalwood, and an uplifting rose. It smells quite masculine, but in a mature way. It gives off the mission in sf vibes. Color-wise, this fragrance is chocolate brown, cerulean blue, and magenta colored. If you've ever smelled an ambergris candle or match, this fragrance smells like that but with added depth. I don't get crazy projection or longevity--and the juice isn't thick like a perfume would be. That said, I got mine for pretty cheap, so I am planning to spritz the hell out of this.

product_name: Ambra Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Such erratic creation. I think this is huge advantage of this fragrance. It is multifaceted from the beginning to the end, and brilliance of these facets change from vegetal to mineral, floral to animalic. At start there is tense oily citrus wave mixed with loud, slightly powdery rose of the heart. The green, vegetal note sound with I think cypriol in the core too. Together with musk from the base those three might be quite mischievous, as it reminded me of stable smell at one stage of the evolution. Sweet (sweaty) hay/horse coat, earthiness. Not dirty but not clean either. However, this weird sensation lasts only for a minute as the fragrance settles and projects as slightly powdery, musky-ambery, soapy even, perfectly balanced with hint of imitating leather woods. It's never loud, yet it is very long lasting, leaving a tray of oriental sweetness with hint of ambra fused in animalic tone. It is not fresh in anyway, but it does splendid job in the cloudy morning as revealing. I agree with the Baltic Sea connotation. It's not a happy scent. It is somehow raw and primal, yet soft and refined. As it's purpose is to be just beautiful, not easily descriptive, ephemeric idea of a perfume.
In 2024 I sadly attended two funerals, in the mid spring and mid autumn, I was closely involved. AdP Ambra was my shield and tribute. As precious balm for both body and soul. And I am not even sure that I like it. Surely I respect this creation. I recommend to try it for the certain unsettled mood, serious occasion, somber weather walk.
Rarity. Curiosity. Sacrum and Profanum.

product_name: Ambra Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content: Ambra struck me as nothing really special, certainly not the type of fragrance that I prefer. After the initial trademark AdP citrus opening (which is always nice), it melts down into a smooth, creamy, floral nondescript soft scent. Leans feminine rather than unisex. Longevity is quite good - got at least 10 hours out of it with only average sillage and projection. Tried it from a sample. Not my style.

product_name: Ambra Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content: Is nobody going to address the fact that Acqua di Parma Colonia Ambra and Ambra edp are exactly the same fragrance? I just went and picked up samples of BOTH and they even share the exact same FORMULA number (09366/A) which literally means that the juice inside BOTH of these bottles is IDENTICAL... I mean, you can very very obviously tell if you simply wear them both... They are EXACTLY the same... That didn't bother me as much as the fact that they smell kinda cheap and are both dripping with ambroxan... They're not TERRIBLE but I rather doubt there's even a drop of ambergris tincture between the two of them which leaves me very relieved I didn't blind buy (either of) these... Again, not bad but my hopes were high and I'm disappointed.

product_name: Ambra Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content: This is a good sweet scent. After a couple of hours, I started noticing an animalic note coming from my arms. Today was a hot day, and throughout the day I caught whiffs of it as I sweat. I think it's a good summer scent, but I'm not buying it again. I prefer Oud EDP.

product_name: Ambra Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content: smells like a less refined version of nous somme ammants by d'orsay. it's something i would smell from men working out at the gym. good to cover up BO.

product_name: Ambra Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content: Sexiest fragrance I've had my nose on. Lightly animalic and leathery ambergris with rose petals enveloped in a warm musk. Opens a touch lighter with citrus, dries down sultry, warm, comforting and a bit erotic. I don't get any salty notes, to each their own.

product_name: Ambra Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I received a sample of this when getting my Fico Di Amalfi and was obsessed with it ever since. To me, it’s creamier and more intimate that the Colonia Ambra.

It opens very bright and fresh to me, and then dries down beautifully with ambergris and sandalwood being prominent and the vanilla slightly peeking through.

My only issue is that for some reason it dries down very quickly on me. I wish I had more of the gorgeous opening notes last just a bit longer. Nevertheless, this will easily be one of the top fragrances for me once I buy the full size of it.

product_name: Ambra Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Smooth black leather, hints of dry smoke, tiny hint of cozy amber sweetness. Easy wearing. High quality and natural smelling. This is nice. I'm more of a citrus aromatic guy, but this is an easy to wear fall and winter fragrance.

Scent: 8 / Sillage: 8 / Longevity: 7.5

product_name: Ambra Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Ambra Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma

I saw a tester on sale, I went through some reviews, it was pretty mixed received. Decided to to Blind it solely for the fact Adp has always been quality and also I was able to get it at a very cheap price for a tester without box from a trusted reseller.

This definitely has pretty much legit Ambergris in it because if you know how Ambergris smells like and too much of it, it's almost there. However the typical dna/vibe of an Adp that exist in their range like Sandalo, Oud and Leather, it's there. However if you were to blind fold me and ask me to guess it's brand, I'll also think it could be a Guerlain PL or Dior PL.

The sandalwood is there at the beginning as well with the mixed cirtrus which isn't the typical fresh cirtus. Somehow it also reminds me abit like Amber Nuit Dior with heavy Ambergris. After 15 minutes or so this does smell similar to something I have, but I cannot exactly remember which but it seems like a Hybrid between Guerlain Encens Mythiques and Santal Royal, possible but I'll need to get back to do more sniffing.

The Amber is there, the rose patchouli is there, some muskiness and incense like smell from the labdanum, pretty strong sandalwood, somewhat smoky as well. For new noses and inexperienced noses, this scent may not be easy for your nose. It took me a good 10 minutes or many constant sniffs to get my nose settled to the sourish saltiness blend But Ambra is pretty well blended with the rest of the notes rather equal and I don't get an over prominent smell of certain notes.

I'm wearing this for myself now so I do not know how well received this is or will I get any compliments. I think I'll like it enough with a few more full wears. Decent projection and silage and very good on the skin. Easily 6-10 hours skin chemistry dependent.

Definitely a sophisticated and elegant scent for users.

product_name: Ambra Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I smelt this at the airport both on the way to my destination and on the way back home. Testing it on two separate occasions gave me the impression that I love it. I ended up buying a 100ml bottle once I returned home only to absolutely hate the way it smelt after 30 seconds or so.

The initial opening is a soft citrus but then you’re immediately hit with this burnt and bitter rubber note which completely ruins the fragrance. I assume this is the Cypriol Oil as I love the remaining notes in the composition. Unless the way in which the perfume has been blended is the reason why the burnt rubber note appears. Either way, I can understand why people dislike the fragrance.

It’s a real shame as without this bitter note, the fragrance is absolutely beautiful and would honestly be a masterpiece from Acqua Di Parma.

product_name: Ambra Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content: This is stronger than I expected. It has a bitter note similar to Gucci voice of the snake but quite softer and smoother

product_name: Ambra Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I got a free sample of this and i can understand why the sample was free. Don't get me wrong it smells really pleasant, clean and fresh. Kinda like a health clinic or a spa. But there's nothing special about it.
It's just not unique.

product_name: Ambra Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content: This one really smells very similar to Tom ford Noir Extreme.

product_name: Ambra Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content: Fragrance that at the juste pulvérisé appears immediately sour and citrus and then fades and turns into more structured notes boises and épices with a vague hint of rose, the base notes are warmer, resinous and dry. An evanescent texture with oriental scents that on my skin when dry down appears impalpable and talc, pleasant but labile. I have to study it better.

product_name: Ambra Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Absolutely enchanting. Ambra shares the AdP Oud DNA but is more salty marine. It's the ambergris. By all accounts this has real ambergris in it, and it certainly doesn't smell like ambroxan. It's dirty-sexy, aquatic-animalic, intoxicating, get-outta-here-if-you-don't-like-it boss man smell. Ambra EdP is powerful enough to survive swimming and a shower, so a little will go a long way.

Beautiful creation and a dividing line: either hang out with the ambroxan bombs in the mall, or walk this way to smell life at it's richest.

product_name: Ambra Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Reading reviews you would think this juice is going to be horrible but I find it very good! I don't get any gross out vibes but there is Ambergris in this and I don't think many people have smelled real Ambergris.

Ambergris on its own its disgusting, but mixed in here its a fixative and gives some real depth. It's also got some really nice woods & musk. But IMO the real star is the labdanum. Smells very classy and would pair perfectly with a suit.
There's some resemblance to Sandalo, Oud EDP and Colonia leather DNA.

Is it my favorite signature of the sun ADP?
No, I think I might still lean towards Oud EDP but this is a close second.
It's actually pretty similar to Oud EDP but just add Ambergris, cypriol and petigrain.
7.5/10 for me.

product_name: Ambra Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I love most of Acqua di Parma fragrances.
I am not getting the reason for low reviews. Probably chemistry may be off-putting for someone.
This is definitely not the classic oriental amber that someone may have in mind. For me is a masterpiece. I cannot smell fish or paint or animalic, but a cloud of classy fragrance.
It is very difficult to describe notes, probably because I have never smelled real ambergris(?). It is mainly dry and pungent.
I would love on my husband, although the performance is close to skin scent, something more intimate.
To me this is heavenly. Test before buying. 4/5

product_name: Ambra Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content:
At first I thought that it might just be my skin that won't let go of this wet dog vibe, but it appears that a few reviewers below have also experienced an unpleasant animalic aroma. Somewhere near the 6th hour, when most other notes have faded, you are left with what I can only describe as 'Wet dog after a swim in the ocean'. You should try it for yourself and see how it works - on skin, not paper! The first six hours were actually quite pleasant, if a little harsh.

The Oud and Leather remain the undisputed kings of the Signatures of the Sun line.

product_name: Ambra Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content: I struggle to understand the low rating this gets. I am cross wearing this with Dior’s Ambre Nuit, and prefer this one when I want more ambergris and less cinnamon. I find this extremely pleasant and wearable, all day any season. Somewhat overpriced would be my only criticism.

product_name: Ambra Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content: My third ADP it is really smooth ,sugary and soft it has no other brand this type of fragrance ADP is really know what they are doing

product_name: Ambra Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content: This fragrance taught me that I really don't like ambergris. There's something about this that just smells a bit gross, at least on my skin. It's too intensely musky for my nose. To each their own, I guess.

product_name: Ambra Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content: Tried this in Neimans. Smells awful. Like you took a dirty hippie and set them on fire and roasted rubber over the flames. Awful, straight awful. Have tried a few Parma's and don’t think I’ve ever hated one, but this an utterly putrid assault on the senses.

product_name: Ambra Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content: I disagree. I did a side-by-side comparison. First I spritzed this new one on, and thought I could tell the difference from memory. I remembered the old one seemed to evolve quickly to a considerably creamy drydown, this one seemed sharper. Since I only seemed to remember the drydown of the old, I then decided to do it properly and ran to another shop that still carried that brown bottle. The quickest way to explain the difference is, that this new black Ambra bottle to me feels like it has more oud-like (dark woods) and black leather feel, where the old one is more like brown leather, w less if any wood. It's like the leather accord these siblings have follow the leather accords changed in the namesake black vs. brown, respectively. I don't own none of these (I did test all on skin) so this is first impression basis. Which is best? I personally feel the brown is more sympathetic. The scents are similar, I suppose what matters is where that smell association takes you. That is the best thing with AdP, they always take you somewhere!

product_name: Ambra Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Exactly identical to Colonia Ambra, both in scent and performance. It's just a new packaging, no change in concentration, despite the new EDP label.

A big dislike because of lack of originality.

product_name: Ambra Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content: So, all change at AdP - all these black bottles and sales assistants telling me they are perfume strength (couldn’t tell what percentage perfume though, so I showed her the label on the base of the bottle. 80% alcohol). Just for the record, in Spain the price appears to have been hiked by 15 euros for a large bottle. Also, Leather and Ebano were missing from the very extensive concession I visited - I was informed that Leather is being discontinued, at least in Spain. Fortunately I have a small independent perfumer who has plenty in stock, I will have to buy a couple of the big bottles. They also had the Yuzu etc......all very nice. I have to cogitate and digest what I’ve learned.......

product_name: Ambra Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content: Lovely "noir flacon". Wouldn't mind getting this Ambra EDP, Leather EDP and Oud EDP all in their noir glories!

product_name: Rosa Nobile Hair Mist Acqua di Parma
review_content: Smells like pickles ;(

product_name: Rosa Nobile Hair Mist Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I adore this hair perfume right away after I sprayed it on my Locs. Since I have curly Locs I have to bend my head down and spray all over and the Locs ends, then head up for the front of my head and back of head.
My goodness, the Rose , Virgin Sandalwood, Lilly of the Valley, Bergamot and Musk fragrance to hru out the dry down. Wearing a santin bonnet holds the hair perfume fragrance continue to hold over night.
I started to sniff my Locs ends the out the day and smiling of the Roses top note after 30 minutes. I do not have to respray for a retouch at all.
This hair perfume is spot on, a blind purchase, all year round day and not ght and very long lasting past 14 hours due to the wearing of a satin bonnet.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Arancia di Capri Acqua di Parma
review_content: The best fresh orange fragrance on the market. Smooth, fresh, sophisticated. Longevity is not the greatest but when layered last a while. Would recommend layering with Parfums De Marley Althair one spray and then two sprays of Arancia di Capri and you get a sexy vanilla orange!

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Arancia di Capri Acqua di Parma
review_content: This perfume has my heart. It was the one that started my love for a fresh scent with plenty of juicy citrus. I LOVE the way it floats on my skin and lingers - it is my signature scent and I always get compliments. Plus I bought it at a little negozio on Lake Garda. If you want to authentically smell like you just came home from Italy, this is the line. While Dolce & Gabbana tries with Light Blue (which has somewhat of a synthetic drydown on me) - nothing beats Aqua Di Parma. Fantastico.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Arancia di Capri Acqua di Parma
review_content: Again, wonderfully fresh and natural fragrance from ADP, but again, as typical with the blue mediterraneo line, poor projection and longevity. Such a shame because I simply adore it. It’s giving orange sorbet on a summer day. It’s literally essence of orange citrus fruits in a bottle. Really uplifting scent. They released an EDP which I’ll review too.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Arancia di Capri Acqua di Parma
review_content: yeah it's a bit "citrusy" in the way bug spray is citrusy. if i wanted to smell like this i'd spray OFF! Deep Woods

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Arancia di Capri Acqua di Parma
review_content:
smells like gorgeous orange but after an hour i swear i can't smell anything- either the orange or the base notes :(
shame but it's saves me a decent amount of money haha

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Arancia di Capri Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Today I'm staying with the house of Acqua Di Parma, but moving on to their Blue Mediterraneo collection. Up first: Arancia Di Capri. Now I don't know much Italian, but I know enough to know that arancia means orange. With that being the case, I'm expecting this to be a bright and vibrant citrus-forward fragrance. Will the Blue Mediterraneo collection strike a better chord with me than the Signatures of the Sun collection did? Let's get into it and find out.


Opening:
The opening is citrusy, fresh, and green. The primary notes that envelop me are orange, mandarin, petitgrain, and bergamot. The orange and mandarin are the undisputed stars of this initial accord. As kindred spirits from the citrus family, they naturally share a radiant quality. However, their individuality shines through: the orange presents a distinctly rindy and tangy facet, while the mandarin offers a juicy, inviting sweetness. Together, they paint a photo-realistic and natural portrait of a freshly cut, sweet, tart, and undeniably succulent orange, beautifully reminiscent of the vibrant orange notes found in fragrances like Louis Vuitton's Afternoon Swim or Météore. Next, the petitgrain and bergamot arrive. The petitgrain imparts a clean and crisp green accord, adding a much-needed balance to the predominantly citrus-heavy opening. Lastly, the bergamot layers in a touch more citrus, but with its characteristic spicy, aromatic, and subtly bitter edge, providing depth and nuance.


Dry Down:
The dry down is citrusy, fresh, and musky. The primary notes I continue to experience are orange, mandarin, petitgrain, and musk. The orange and mandarin remain the focal point in the dry down, still offering that wonderfully realistic orange accord, though now it is much more subtle and reserved, like a memory of the initial vibrancy. Following closely are the petitgrain and musk. The petitgrain retains its familiar fresh and green accord from the opening, but in a significantly softer and quieter manner. Lastly, the musk gracefully rounds out the dry down, imparting a gentle and clean "fresh laundry" accord that feels comforting and understated.


Performance:
The initial projection is commendable, reaching a notable six feet. Sillage mirrors this strength, leaving an easily discernible scent trail. However, by the three-hour mark, the performance had considerably softened. The projection became quite intimate, settling to about arm's length, and the scent trail was only faintly noticeable. The fragrance ultimately receded to a skin scent by the fourth hour.


When to Wear:
Arancia Di Capri is undeniably a quintessential spring and summer fragrance, tailor-made for daytime wear. This is the type of scent that truly shines for casual sun-drenched outings, perhaps a leisurely day at the beach or an invigorating session at the gym. However, its casual character suggests it wouldn't be the most suitable choice for office wear or more formal occasions where a more commanding presence might be desired.


Blind Buy:
If you find yourself drawn to vibrant, orange-forward fragrances akin to the aforementioned Afternoon Swim or Météore, this could very well be a safe blind buy for your collection. Just bear in mind that its delicate nature means frequent reapplication will likely be necessary to enjoy its full charm throughout the day.


Final Verdict:
I'll begin by stating this: the opening of this fragrance was downright beautiful. The photorealistic juiciness of the orange, interwoven with the crisp, green essence of petitgrain, perfectly captured the very soul of a quintessential summer fragrance. It's not often I encounter a fragrance I can genuinely compare to such heavy hitters as Afternoon Swim, but Arancia Di Capri was, for a fleeting moment, punching far above its weight class. Unfortunately, that magnificent burst of life was extremely short-lived, and the fragrance became a mere skin scent almost before I could fully savor its dry down. Had Arancia Di Capri maintained that captivating opening and offered even average performance, this would have been an absolute knockout; a fragrance I would have immediately sought to acquire a full bottle of. Sadly, that wasn't the case, and this experience ultimately proved to be a pretty significant letdown. I'm sincerely hoping this isn't indicative of the entire Blue Mediterraneo line, as I have another one scheduled for review tomorrow.


Scent: 9/10
Longevity: 5/10
Sillage: 4/10
Mass Appeal: Very high
Versatility: Average
Gender: Unisex
Value: Way overpriced

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Arancia di Capri Acqua di Parma
review_content: Una fragancia bastante rica, olor a naranja realista desde la salida hasta el fondo, fácil de gustar, fácil de vestir en calor extremo, a pesar de su bajo rendimiento y proyección, el olor queda pegado a la piel por más de 8 horas, pegando la nariz, como si fuera el olor natural de tu piel, lo que te hace sentir limpio a pesar de sudar por el calor

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Arancia di Capri Acqua di Parma
review_content: Kind of okay, but it doesn’t compare to the summery Tom Fords. It’s rather synthetic and actually resembles an air freshener.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Arancia di Capri Acqua di Parma
review_content: You like oranges? You LOVE oranges? This is THE fragrance for you. You know how you spray a fragrance and you get that awful metallic/bitter/machine-y taste on your tongue? And then you try to drink water...or coffee...or juice to get rid of it, but you can't? Well THAT does not happen here. You are literally EATING the orange. OMG. Delicious. And, without the bitter white stuff or rind. And, you'll smell good too. Be careful, a passerby may wanna take a bite....

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Arancia di Capri Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Quite a beautiful blast of orange in the opening, but that dies off rather quickly, within half an hour for me. Then it sort of blurs into your standard musky, amorphous, forgettable scent. The dry down is fine and not offensive, but it's boring and the musk dulls the brightness of the citrus.

I do actually want to smell like an orange. Too bad the eponymous orange lasts for the blink of an eye; I guess they wanted something to stick around for longer so they added musk and a bit of caramel. Overpriced for what it is. 5.5/10.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Arancia di Capri Acqua di Parma
review_content: This is a realistic orange lemon and great fico di amalfi is better bit not by much

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Arancia di Capri Acqua di Parma
review_content: Smells great, but fairly linear. Orange on citrus on mandarin (but happily never veering into cleaning product territory)

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Arancia di Capri Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Hey YOU. Wanna smell like a MASSIVE orange. We got you.

HOWEVER - if you live in Germany you can probably go to a perfume store where they make their own scents and ask them to give you 30ml of high concentration orange oil mixed with alco and it smells exactly the same for a fraction of the price. WINK

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Arancia di Capri Acqua di Parma
review_content:
More like Bitter orange (rine)/ green mandarin, musk & petitgrain. Very much Italian perfumery.
Simple, Bland, boring & unrememberable!
Not smooth, comes off as synthetic & perfum’y 😷🤧. Flattens out in the dry down.
Smells similar to Dior homme Colonge 🤮 mixed w/ the better Orange Sanguine.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Arancia di Capri Acqua di Parma
review_content: Getting back to this "mandarin jewel", absolutely kindest member of the ADP blues was because I accidentally pimped it with Dior Homme Perfume 2012 edition. And my gosh with what result! The Dior's enormous longevity captured to Arancia with while the ADP cutted the overly creaminess of Dior "lipstick vibes". Soo smooth and light summer scent born and became! My adorable lady (Shiba Inu 😊) took it to it's signature!

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Arancia di Capri Acqua di Parma
review_content:
It smells like a very strong, complex orange. It's not bad, but unless you're very into smelling like an orange, I think there are better citrus scents out there. If you're willing to pay this price point, Louis Vuitton Afternoon Swim is preferable to me, although it's more lemon/bergamot than orange like this, but I think it's just a generally more pleasant, less in-your-face sophisticated fragrance.

Scent Description: Orange with depth
Sillage: Low-Medium
Longevity: Low-Medium

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Arancia di Capri Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Não tenho nada a dizer, simplesmente perfeito.
Cheiro de laranja pura e matural de uma maneira suculenta...
Uma pena a fixação dele ser muito baixa

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Arancia di Capri Acqua di Parma
review_content: It smells nice but you could achieve the same effect by rubbing yourself with an orange.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Arancia di Capri Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Acqua di Parma Arancia di Capri is like a burst of sunshine in a bottle. It opens with an instantly uplifting mix of citrus notes you can really find a lot of oranges here.

As it settles, the fragrance softens with a gentle floral heart of jasmine and magnolia, adding a touch of elegance and a delicate sweetness that balances the bright citrus. The baseyou can really smell the orange.

Overall, Acqua di Parma Arancia di Capri is a beautifully crafted fragrance that feels like a breath of fresh Mediterranean air. It’s the perfect choice if you’re looking for a luxurious, citrusy scent that brings the warmth of summer wherever you go. This is the best orange fracrances oat

The longevity is dissaponting on my skin it only last about 4-5 hours and you can only feel it a armlength away. If they fix that it's a top 20 oat for me.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Arancia di Capri Acqua di Parma
review_content: smells like an orange peel, kinda boring though, and the performance isn't great

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Arancia di Capri Acqua di Parma
review_content:
probably the best natural mandarin/clementine scent you can smell. it reminds me of that fresh fruit peeled , with that juicy bubble sparkling fruit pulp opening, it already won my heart and nose.

solid 4 hours longevity and 2 hours proyection, you can find this bottle super cheap at discount stores .
this bottle also probably the cheaper and better version of LV afternoon swin. you want a cheaper , non arab version of that smell look no further to this

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Arancia di Capri Acqua di Parma
review_content: The opening is very nice u get a orange blast then it turns powdery which I don’t really like but it’s still good

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Arancia di Capri Acqua di Parma
review_content: Smells like I just started peeling a clementine ...... That's kinda epic

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Arancia di Capri Acqua di Parma
review_content: a versatile fragrance i can wear everyday, the orange in this just smells so good trust me

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Arancia di Capri Acqua di Parma
review_content: Refreshing bright orange, then turn sweet and powdery in minutes.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Arancia di Capri Acqua di Parma
review_content: Have it as my body lotion. It's safe, simple, relaxing and slightly masculine. I layer it with versace eros flame to get that mandarin smell out.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Arancia di Capri Acqua di Parma
review_content:
★★★★★☆☆☆☆☆
Simple, slightly sour citrus blend with a soft powdery drydown.

Ultra-safe and inoffensive, synonym for no character. I wouldn’t even go out of my way to form an opinion about someone wearing this.

Price is ok for a niche fragrance, but way far from good value when the longevity and projection are so poor.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Arancia di Capri Acqua di Parma
review_content: Smells great, orange and mandarin dominant however doesn't last very long on my skin, seriously lasts around maybe an hour before it becomes a bland skin scent. There are much better choices from house IMO.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Arancia di Capri Acqua di Parma
review_content: I can't pick up any orange in the opening, just a realistic sugary lemon (close to lemonade I would say) next to soap and I can't get over the soapy smell in AdP fragrances. :(

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Arancia di Capri Acqua di Parma
review_content:
The opening is wonderful, smells very natural. It´s just orange, mandarin and lemon. The orange is strong at first, dies quickly, then the mandarin takes over, dies quickly, the. It´s lemon time, but it also dies quickly. After that it´s just faint leaves, leftover citrus mush (cleaner vibe) and hint of musk, maybe caramel? Some tiny sweetness.

It projects really well …. For 10 minutes 😒 the next 20 minutes it´s decent, the smell changes a lot during that time, after 30 minutes it´s a skin scent - and not very pleasant one, it kinda gives I accidentaly sprayed airfreshner on my hand.

I expected it to have bad performance, so I bought just the 30ml thinking if I like it I will buy the big bottle, overspray and take the small one with me to refresh it after an hour. But due to the much worse performance than expected and very uninteresting drydown I dont think it´s worth it. Will probably just use it once or twice in the highest heat when going for a swim.

It´s a shame, the opening is an absolute banger. 10/10 scent opening, performance 2/10(only because it actually projects the first 10 minutes really well), it wasnt expensive, you can find this brand very discounted - and I understand why. Overall 7/10

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Arancia di Capri Acqua di Parma
review_content: Very realistic orange scent, immediately smells of straight orange juice before becoming kind of soapy?? You'll have to bathe in it to get any decent longevity or sillage, can't say I'm a fan.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Arancia di Capri Acqua di Parma
review_content: This is my go-to summer scent! It smells just like a fresh Capri orange grove. So bright and uplifting. Everyone compliments me when I wear it.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Arancia di Capri Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Not doing much for me. A harmless and weak orange. Not the most vibrantly aromatic or the most natural orange but it does the job alright.
7.1/10

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Arancia di Capri Acqua di Parma
review_content: Oh wow, this is such a realistic freshly squeezed orange and mandarin combo. I also smell a tea note, perhaps this is petitgrain? Probably my favorite fresh fragrance, and I do not like fresh ones very much.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Arancia di Capri Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Yes, yes, yes, and all the “yes” you need. This is such a beautiful scent. Natural, completely orange, this is the most natural perfume I’ve ever smelled. I use this to sleep.
Also, yes. This last 1 hour. I can recommend you this if you like citrus and if you like simple-natural scents. Absolutely this is not for wearing. This has the same performance as a body mist. Disappointed on that end but the smell I literally 100/10, what a shame.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Arancia di Capri Acqua di Parma
review_content: Let me tell you this is one of the most delicious and fresh fragrances I have ever smelled. It literally smells like a freshly sliced amalfi orange and the fresh ocean water. It is phenomenal. This is a masterpiece. The longevity is quite good for a citrus fragrance. The thing is that you go nose blind to it quickly because it is so much citrus, but I get over 5 hours from it. Every time I wear this I feel like I am in Italy, it is simply perfect, rejuvenating, so fresh and yummy. I will be reaching for this very often in the summer, you can overspray and it just smells even better too. It is a mostly citrus fragrance, not sure why people are upset that this isn't a 10 hour beast mode fragrance. It isn't supposed to be. I don't care what anyone else says, this is a masterpiece. I can't get enough of it.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Arancia di Capri Acqua di Parma
review_content: In the opening moment of this fragrance, I was sure this was the one orange fragrance to rule them all. It starts off smelling like you just peeled a fresh orange. However, it turns into something that smells more like an orange cleaner. I need it to stay like that opening note and be bright and clear. As it is, I think I'll mostly use the sample I have to mix with something else because it's not inspiring much love on its own.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Arancia di Capri Acqua di Parma
review_content: Smells like caramellized oranges or a fanta, also reminds me of fancy soap. Recommend spraying on clothes, however people might be overreacting with the performance, it works fine for me.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Arancia di Capri Acqua di Parma
review_content: Pretty good. A decent photorealistic limey orange juice, I guess. It lasted exactly 2.5 hours on my skin and I sprayed heavily. I know citrus fragrances aren't supposed to last, but I couldn't tell a perfume was there just two hours earlier. I think this could work layered, perhaps. Orange sanguine lasts roughly 6 hours and is a stronger blood orange scent.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Arancia di Capri Acqua di Parma
review_content: Such a realistic orange note on my skin. I get a blast of orange and fresh citrus that lasts throughout the life of the fragrance for me, backed with some subtle sweeter and green notes. Could be dressed up or dressed down. The quality is amazing and it lasted a decently long time for me. Fairly linear, but if you enjoy and want to smell like freshly cut oranges, this is for you.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Arancia di Capri Acqua di Parma
review_content:
If you like candy-sweet fragrances, you’ll love this. On initial spray, I got a whiff of something like a juicy orange Jolly Rancher. Smelled great, but not really for me. When I brought my nose closer to my skin though, I noticed the fresh green petitgrain note, which made the fragrance suddenly more interesting.

Unfortunately (for me), the petitgrain note disappeared within minutes, and I was back to sweet orange candy. I personally wouldn’t wear this, but actually do love the way this smells. Acqua di Parma does release this as a home fragrance and a bath/body fragrance, and I can see it being perfect as an uplifting pick-me-up in the shower or for a spa day.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Arancia di Capri Acqua di Parma
review_content: Nice profile if you like orange and mandarin. But the projection is shy and the longevity moderate. I recommend North Stag IV, you will get much more for your money (especially with a few weeks / months of maceration). Much better performance with a similar profile (with slightly more musk in the dry down). Totally unisex, I enjoy wearing it, but my partner too.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Arancia di Capri Acqua di Parma
review_content: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Arancia di Capri might be the simplest fragrance in the Blu Mediterraneo lineup. Launched in 1999, it’s a straightforward blend of orange, mandarin, and lemon, offering a fresh, easygoing scent. It’s pleasant but doesn’t bring anything new or unique. Great for casual wear, it’s a safe, uncomplicated citrus fragrance that sticks to the basics without taking any risks. If you're looking for a no-fuss, familiar citrus, this fits the bill, but there are other options with more depth.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Arancia di Capri Acqua di Parma
review_content: My first impression after smelling Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Arancia di Capri: 'Wait a second, I've smelled this before... It's the same as Lush Sun!' Since Arancia di Capri was actually launched a good 15 years before Sun, it is easy to conclude that Lush's perfumer Mark Constantine was greatly 'inspired' by Arancia di Capri. I've always loved Sun, a perfect combination of lemon and orange in a fragrance, but hated its poor longevity and sillage. Is Arancia di Capri any better? Alas, nope. It shares Sun's transparent citric fruitiness, but also its abysmal performance. At least Sun used to be very cheap (not so much anymore), whereas Arancia di Capri has been greatly overpriced since the get-go.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Arancia di Capri Acqua di Parma
review_content: Blu Mediterraneo Arancia di Capri. What can I say about this fragrance? It is simply gorgeous. This is the olfactory equivalent of a perfect summer holiday romance. Undeniably addictive, ripe and fresh and forever young, but alas, heartrendingly short-lived. Just as soon as you have fallen completely in love, it is already time to say 'arriverderci'. If there were no problems with the longevity of this fragrance, I wouldn't even glance at another summer scent. Indeed, even with the performance issues I will always have a bottle in my collection - a testament to this masterpiece of a formulation by ADP. Although the fragile lifespan means this fragrance regrettably falls short of signature scent status, one is left with no other choice but to return to the Caprese peninsula to experience this bittersweet affair over and over again.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Arancia di Capri Acqua di Parma
review_content: One of the best fragrances I’ve ever smelled. I didn’t expect it would be so good. I don’t know if I am the only person that smells a peach note

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Arancia di Capri Acqua di Parma
review_content: freshly cut orange and lemon zest, weak longevity, max 5 minutes on me, it s a shame such a good fragrance can be ruined by its longevity. If it wasn t for this i would give it a 10/10, but i give a solid 8/10. Love it, i almost need a new 150ml bottle after 1 month

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Arancia di Capri Acqua di Parma
review_content: First 10 minutes are juicy, aromatic orange, but what follows is more green/lemony... In any case, performance is not good enough, even for this brand. Decades ago, when competition was less, brands like this one could get away with the notion of an overpriced cologne. But there are new kids on the block who can do quality colognes, not only for less, but with more daring.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Arancia di Capri Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Smells a little like Afternoon Swim with a high dose of green leaves. Great for summer on a man or women but does lean a touch masculine. Super upscale smelling but bring the bottle with you cause just like all most realistic citrus scents it dies quickly. Even with that said its a big bottle worthy fragrance.
7/10

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Arancia di Capri Acqua di Parma
review_content: The opening is a green and a bit bitter orange. After a while it’s a nice, clean citrus scent. More masculine than feminine, in my opinion. It’s a pleasant choice for summer, i have no complaints.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Arancia di Capri Acqua di Parma
review_content: I actually like this alot. Very bright and citrusy. The opening does make me think of splitting an orange as others have said. I have a major issue with overly sweet fragrances and I find this slightly sweet but not syrupy or cloying. My major disappointment is that it does not last on my skin at all. Within 30 minutes it is a skin scent for me. While lovely, its mighty expensive for the limited sillage and longevity. Something tells me I might enjoy the whole collection, so if I can find it on sale sometime- maybe.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Arancia di Capri Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Musky citrus that leans a bit masculine.

It's a nice summer scent and I like it! Just doesn't last long at all. It makes me think of fresh oranges on a beach.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Arancia di Capri Acqua di Parma
review_content: Super happy fragrance, first sniff I fell in love. I understand that some people say it smells like fanta. But to me it doesn't do it justice. It's not sticky type of sweet at all, its 50% green 50% orange. Very well balanced, juicy orange and fresh orange greens. Like you just plucked an orange along with a bunch of its leaves. Hyper realistic, but also hyper fresh. Like the freshest orange in the world was found in a sunny land somewhere.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Arancia di Capri Acqua di Parma
review_content: Continuing to work through my Blu Mediterraneo discovery set. This is my favorite so far in that I least get 3-4 hours from it. Lovely opening. Fantastic actually. Like peeling a fresh orange with zest and pith and a spray of juice. So real you can taste it. Definitely fades quickly but I get whiffs of a woody musky dry down for 3-4 hours. Not FB worthy but very pleasant.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Arancia di Capri Acqua di Parma
review_content:
The first time I used this perfume, it smelled like urinal disinfectant. Like most of the Blue Mediterraneo line, but the problem was undoubtedly my nose. On a second occasion, that urinal smell was no longer present in my brain (I don't know why) and this perfume, along with Fico di Amalfi, are my favorites from this line. Fresh and classy. Summer in a bottle. But there's the issue of performance combined with my body chemistry, which is a drain for citrus perfumes. I rarely get 3 hours where I can smell anything from this line (whereas with other perfumes from the brand like Zafferano or Oud, the experience is quite different, with both lasting over 8 hours).

Therefore, I can't recommend this perfume given the usual price found in online stores. While Zara perfumes are half the price in stores compared to the USA - €20 for 100 ml - Acqua di Parma perfumes (or Mancera, for example) are much cheaper in the USA (at discounters) despite being, like Zara, two European brands. I don't understand this disparity, but paying around €80 for a 75 ml EDT that lasts only 2 or 3 hours (on my skin) is not justifiable (for me, as I'm far from swimming in money).

But, I emphasize, this is a magnificent perfume (except for the performance) with a super realistic orange scent (done in a soft and non-harsh way) and it's the scent profile I associate with a typical summer day in Portugal with temperatures of 35ºC / 95ºF or more.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Arancia di Capri Acqua di Parma
review_content: Fresh squeezed orange juice. Photorealistic. Sooooo juicy and zesty, it makes me thirsty lol. Quite sharp opening, like freshly peeled oranges with that hint of bitterness, but the caramel softens it into a sweeter, smoother fragrance. Longevity isn't great and it's a bit overpriced, though.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Arancia di Capri Acqua di Parma
review_content: Okay, here it's the thing. I LOVE it. It's the perfect mix of citrus and sweetness. And it almost feels like a gourmand fragrance because it makes my mouth water, literally makes me crave orange juice. BUT it does not last at all. It is gone after 30 minutes (not kidding). This is a harsh disappointment, especially since it is quite an expensive fragrance. So, I'm sadly selling this one because why would I want a perfume that disappears after just a few minutes?

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Arancia di Capri Acqua di Parma
review_content: I would say this is entirely a citrus scent with a tiny bit of caramel and salt but it’s sharp. A strong sharp fruity scent. Would be great with afternoon swim by LV. Good for day and outdoor. Expensive for a toilette. The scent is like the elephant in the room that you can’t put your finger on. Extremely unique. Will be rebuying and maybe be my scent of the season, we will see too be continued…

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Arancia di Capri Acqua di Parma
review_content: Orange is the star here. Sweet Italian and mandarin. And it's a brilliant orange melange. Maybe my favorite orange bomb scent. Interesting with the presence of a lemon note too, which I guess is here to lend a bit of tartness to the orange brilliance. Bergamot is found everywhere. Petitgrain offers the green leafiness of course, and the caramel note stands in audaciously whimsical contrast, giving a smooth, thickened sweetness in the base. Contrasts well with the citrus sweetness in the top. Spray the heck out of this though, as it's not the greatest performer given the citrus orientation.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Arancia di Capri Acqua di Parma
review_content:
A solid summer fragrance, very easily wearable. Perfect for the day time, and it has great longevity so couple of sprays during the morning will last you till the night. All the top notes are very prominent in this fragrance. It’s a very orange and mandarin heavy fragrance with a good dry down of musk. I wouldn’t say it’s the most unique fragrance, but its longevity makes it quite decent for its value. Honestly, it’s just a great summer fragrance to own and just really easy to wear.

Scent: 8
Projection: 7
Performance: 8
Value: 8
Overall: 8

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Arancia di Capri Acqua di Parma
review_content: Nice, juicy, fruit-forward scent reminiscent of summers by the sea in Italy, as intended. It's super photorealistic but doesn't have much sillage and fades fast. Great for out of the shower in the evening when entertaining with an intimate group at home. Put on some silk lounging pajamas, some dangley earrings, and this, and you're good to go. Wish it lasted longer... I might try layering it with either another ADP scent or a body lotion to give it a little boost.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Arancia di Capri Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Absolutely beautiful. Litteraly smells like slicing open an orange, getting both halfs and taking a deep whif of pure juicy citrus.

10/10

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Arancia di Capri Acqua di Parma
review_content:
i absolutely love this scent, the opening is one of the best ever, its smells more like orange than orange, not too bitter, not too sweet. it then dries down to a weak, but beatyfull more bergamot, cardamom and (im aparently the only one) some floral notes. abselutely lovely

scent 10/10
silliage 7/10
longevity 3/10
blind byability 8/10

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Arancia di Capri Acqua di Parma
review_content: I love this. This was the first orange fragrance I’ve tried a few years ago and I absolutely loved it, but I didn’t get a full bottle because I first wanted to test some other orange fragrances. Orange Sanguine, Afternoon Swim, Mandarine Basilic, Orange Soleia and Arancia di Sicilia didn’t work out for me for different reasons. Arancia di Capri is perfect. It’s natural smelling and refreshing in hot weather. There is a hint of greenness that contributes to the natural smell of this fragrance. The scent is sweet, but not in a syrupy way. It’s down the middle unisex (leaning ever so slightly masculine).

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Arancia di Capri Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Apparently the 75 and 150 ml versions are being turned into 100 and 180 ml bottles soon. They’ll have screw tops like the signatures of the sun line.
There’ll be a new one called Mandarino di Sicilia, while Cipresso is leaving the line up. Colonia Futura and Sakura are also leaving the brand

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Arancia di Capri Acqua di Parma
review_content: For me this fragrance felt quite masculine. The opening was, as others have said, a true orange but more peel and leaf than juice. For me green notes. Also like others I found that it didn't have much longevity

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Arancia di Capri Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Ive smelt very similar for much less.
The fruit smells a little sour to me.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Arancia di Capri Acqua di Parma
review_content: sharp, grassy, herbal orange's leave

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Arancia di Capri Acqua di Parma
review_content: My favorite fragrance. Lovely clean and fresh citrus smell, I get mandarin the most. As it dries down it gets a bit sweeter which is pleasant. People around me said it smells just like CK One, so if you like that you’ll probably like this.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Arancia di Capri Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Man I want to love this scent. While it has an amazing citrusy/orange opening it simply doesn't last. After only like 2-3 hours I can barely smell it at all. It may just be my skin but I don't even really smell the middle notes or dry down, just the opening and then its gone.

Smell: 10/10
Basically everything else: 0/10

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Arancia di Capri Acqua di Parma
review_content: I definitely get the caramel in the dry down. Too sweet for my taste.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Arancia di Capri Acqua di Parma
review_content: It’s unbelievably photorealistic. It smells more orange than an orange. Amazing scent, I haven’t been able to try it on my skin so I can’t comment on silage or longevity but the opening is incredible

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Arancia di Capri Acqua di Parma
review_content: it smells exactly how i imagine a summer vacation to italy would smell like. its got such a perfect balance between spice, musk, and citrus. the citrus is strong, but not overpowering. i think there is some balance between the musky herbal smell vs the citrus. it's a good summer day choice for anyone who likes an orange-y, green fragrance

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Arancia di Capri Acqua di Parma
review_content: This is the type of fragrance that makes you wanna end it all, one of the greatest openings of all times which lasts for approximately 2 minutes at best and then dries down to a dollar store fruity champoo smell which lasts for a few hours before completely fading. So dissapointing, when i smelled the opening i thought i found the one haha

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Arancia di Capri Acqua di Parma
review_content: I really like this fragrance, the opening smells like a fresh orange peel. It’s not something i would wear but it is amazing for layering. Would be 10/10 if it lasted longer

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Arancia di Capri Acqua di Parma
review_content: A great frag if your looking for something that lasts you enough time to put on drive to the beach relax for a bit then get in the water. A very uplifitng juicy orange scent with about 3 hrs longevity

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Arancia di Capri Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Arancia di Capri by Acqua di Parma:
This is a light, refreshing and sparkly citrus fragrance perfect for any age or gender. AdP do the best and most realistic citrus notes out of any house I've come across and this one focuses on a really raw, juicy orange that smells gorgeous. The only downside with this fragrance though is the performance, it barely lasts and doesn't project at all which is a real shame because the opening is so good. This can only realistically be worn during summer if you want it to last 10 minutes but there are other frags from the Blu Mediterraneo line that have amazing citrus notes with better performance.

Top notes: Mandarin, orange, lemon but as more of a background note
Middle notes: Petitgrain, orange
Base notes: Musk, caramel but not overly sweet

2.5/5

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Arancia di Capri Acqua di Parma
review_content:
This is so very reminiscent of Moschino's Funny minus the oakmoss that makes Funny a tad too bitter for me sometimes.
OTOH, Funny has more presence and much better staying power.
Arancia di Capri is a lovely scent but way too faint and fleeting for the price.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Arancia di Capri Acqua di Parma
review_content:
A watery, uncarbonated citrus juice drink garnished with a single green leaf. Light, fresh, and slightly sweet with creamy undertones. Very soft projection for 2-3hr, longevity 5-6hr.

The perfume equivalent of a glass of water with a lemon wedge in it. Pleasant and refreshing enough but so, so weak and so, so forgettable.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Arancia di Capri Acqua di Parma
review_content:
One of the most exceptional citrus colognes available on the market, in my opinion, is characterized by its robust citrus notes. This fragrance is a delightful choice for any summer occasion, boasting a refreshing opening that retains its appeal even after an hour of wear. I recommend layering it with a vanilla-based fragrance to enhance its complexity.

However, it is important to note that its projection is somewhat lacking, and its longevity leaves something to be desired. Consequently, some may consider it overpriced given these performance factors. Nevertheless, its exquisite scent has garnered numerous compliments, particularly from individuals aged 25 and above, though its appeal to younger demographics is uncertain.

For optimal enjoyment, I suggest using this fragrance indoors to mitigate its performance shortcomings.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Arancia di Capri Acqua di Parma
review_content: I'm not very taken by this. Its a basic scent, though i'd give it credit for being more orange than lemon. It would make a good aftershave to blend something you usually wear with it. Its way overpriced. Id rather wear Paco.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Arancia di Capri Acqua di Parma
review_content: Smells like citrus and blue sports drink - that’s it. Headache inducing fragrance.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Arancia di Capri Acqua di Parma
review_content:
It is a therapeutic scent.
Whenever you feel down and sad, it can put a smile on your face. If you had a bad day, take a shower and spray yourself with it as generous as you want. It’ll make you function all the rest of the evening. Just keep smelling your arms, it’ll cheer you up. Just try!

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Arancia di Capri Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Blu Mediterraneo Arancia di Capri is another simple, refreshing cologne from this range. Fleeting and ephemeral as they all seem to be, it is more like an aromatherapy than a scent proper. It is fairly predictable in structure - citrus-led with an underlying greenness, very refreshing and natural-smelling. However, given its limited performance, I consider it overpriced.

AdC opens with a radiant, orange-led citrus accord, like olfactory sunshine. It becomes a little more tart as it develops, thanks to the bergamot and perhaps some lemon. The green undertone follows closely, enhancing the citrus with verdant freshness. The slightly woody petitgrain is a beautiful addition here thanks to its fresh woody greenness.

It fades fast, becoming a sweetly musky skin scent with a hint of citrus remaining. Sillage is intimate and longevity is weak - it lasts slightly longer than Bergamotto di Calabria.

A pleasant, unchallenging unisex cologne, AdC is made for hot weather and repeated application. It is very refreshing, but there are many classic colognes out there with better performance and lower price points. 2.5/5.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Arancia di Capri Acqua di Parma
review_content: Best way to describe Arancia di Capri is orange and green. Juicy, citrusy oranges and green leaves. Might be the best from the house. Fantastic for hot weather. I have a travel size now but will probably get a full bottle when that runs out.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Arancia di Capri Acqua di Parma
review_content: Make no mistake this is a beautiful summer scent! I liberally douse myself in the burst of oranges that explodes from the pretty blue bottle. Alas, I cannot disagree with the majority of the comments....the joyous notes evaporate rapidly. I am confident I still smell fine for any intimate encounter but the everlasting gorgeous orange scent is mine alone to enjoy. And enjoy my bottle I will...but I doubt I would buy again. Anyone for an edp version??? Count me in!!!!

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Arancia di Capri Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Notes:
Mostly citrus orange, similar to how it is in Guerlain Mandarine Basilic, very juicy and realistic. Slight hint of greenness from petitgrain, slightly soapy (think posh hotel hand wash), with soft caramel and musk accompanying.

Audience:
Feminine-leaning unisex. Summertime scent. Office friendly, non-offensive (not very sharp). More mature than Xerjoff Lira, as doesn’t smell overly cakey

Performance:
Too weak to do it justice. A massive shame as I love the scent but can’t decide whether it’s FBW just to overspray

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Arancia di Capri Acqua di Parma
review_content:
#196 in my "Tour de Fragrance"
Another One Bites the Zest

The point of the top notes of any fragrance is to get the suckers at the fragrance counter to make an impulse buy, with the uninitiated believing that what they smell for a few seconds at the counter is how they will smell all day if they buy the fragrance. But the truth is citrus as a top note never endures much past the dry down. You buy for the base notes that will remain and sustain through the hours, and if you don't like those base notes, too bad, because in an hour or less after you spray, that's what you've bought. Purchasing a scent with citrus as its sole component is just nuts and this is a hard fact that this scent demonstrates perfectly.

After an opening blast of orange soda this gets bitter like orange rind, the dry down doesn't change or improve but vaguely reminds of an old barbershop hair tonic with added lemon zest, and in a half hour not even that. It's not repellant, it's just not attractive or comforting or much of anything, and again, as with all but one Blu Med I've tried, the performance is just abysmal. And this may in fact be the worst scent in the line.

This is a seriously pointless fragrance. If you just want to smell this kind of scent get some Orange Fanta or Sun Maid Lemonade. Get a lemon meringue pie. Anyone who isn't in the room with you when you apply this won't get anything from this by the time you drive to work. I don't know why anyone would waste money on this fragrance when there are so many better scents on the market. Is it the company rep? The pretty bottle? You can do way better than this, even in the under $20 category. This is just a waste of your money. Don't bother.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Arancia di Capri Acqua di Parma
review_content: Made a blind buy on this, quite disappointed, it smells like a cheap cleaning product and gives me a headache. There are just better citrus fragrances at better prices

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Arancia di Capri Acqua di Parma
review_content: Smells exactly like orange peels

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Arancia di Capri Acqua di Parma
review_content:
This smells like water with citrus rind in it and a bit of musk, not much else.
It really lacks character and is boring and unpleasant. Almost a citrus hand soap or bathroom deodorizer scent.
The longevity and projection are poor as well. Worn in summer heat, is is noticeable within a few feet, for about an hour. After that, it's a skin scent. In 3-4 hours, it's pretty much entirely gone.
Purely a daytime summer fragrance. But I wouldn't recommend it.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Arancia di Capri Acqua di Parma
review_content:
VERY light opening. I can smell the orange and it's really quite nice, but it's incredibly low 'volume'. Instant skin scent. A little soapy. Has a clean watery vibe but not salty. Very lightly green/leafy. Reminds me of the opening of Kenneth Cole Black (which I love) but weaker.

In the middle I start picking up a hint of tobacco leaves? Not sure what that's about. Otherwise it still smells like citrus "in general" instead of any particular note. A slight undercurrent of powdery musk. It gets even lighter by the minute. On my body, it's nearly gone in like 30 minutes. It disappears faster than a misty body spray. Usually the fragrances that others complain about their short longevity work for me. This one just dissolves into my skin I guess.

The scent stays consistent throughout the (very short) life of the fragrance. It smells very nice. I really like what I can notice. It's like a lighter, more unisex version of Black. I would really like it if I could keep smelling it. But it's gone in record time. I've never experienced something disappear so quickly.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Arancia di Capri Acqua di Parma
review_content: Boring and somewhat annoying citrus projector. I wore this a lot when I was younger and it was never memorable. If you love quasi-realistic, distilled orange and it’s summer time, go for it.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Arancia di Capri Acqua di Parma
review_content:
A lovely mandarin orange, with just a hint of caramel and musk underneath.

This is beautiful, but it fades very soon, and mostly stays near the skin. I would much more recommend something longer lasting (even if it is more expensive), but this is still quite pretty and refreshing.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Arancia di Capri Acqua di Parma
review_content: Juicy, crisp, fresh, sweet, slightly bitter, bright mouth watering orange. Smells very natural and realistic. Definitely unisex, it is not masculine or feminine. Simple, but so good. Perfect hot weather wear. 8/10.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Arancia di Capri Acqua di Parma
review_content: The most beautiful, realistic orange scent i have ever smelled. Just great, really. I love it, will get a full bottle sooner or later for sure.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Arancia di Capri Acqua di Parma
review_content: This is a nice scent. It's really just orange all the way down. Still, a nice smell. Not great longevity or strength.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Arancia di Capri Acqua di Parma
review_content:
This fragrance smells delicious.
So fresh and tart and juicy in the opening and then the more it dries down, the deeper the caramel note becomes.
There's a cozy tea vibe that comes in the dry down as well that's just beautiful.
By far, this is my favorite from the house.
It does lean a bit feminine but I don't care, I wear it because I love it and it makes me smile throughout the day
as I catch wafts.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Arancia di Capri Acqua di Parma
review_content: It smells like a luxury hand soap. Great for a casual day scent if all you're doing is walking outside.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Arancia di Capri Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Please spray your clothes for a long lasting fragrance that will keep you happy for many hours :D
