What is it with people's obsession about only spraying on your skin? Most of these fragrances contain quite a few chemicals that ain't too healthy for your body anyway, so do yourself a favour and spray your clothes and you won't have to complain about the scent disappearing withing 20 minutes.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Arancia di Capri Acqua di Parma
review_content:
So for me, when i first put this on, yeah fruity! Very tart lemon. Then weirdly grapefruit, maybe that is the bergamot??After it settles on my skin and fades though it does have a nice woody scent, but more like wood by the sea not by the forest. Its an EDT so I don't expect a lot of staying power, or maybe I just have dry skin, but after an hour or so i can barely smell it.
So, I like it, but for the cost and the longevity I probably won't be buying it.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Arancia di Capri Acqua di Parma
review_content: Really like this one, such a shame the scent is no longer there within a few hours. Wish they would make a perfume version with longer hold

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Arancia di Capri Acqua di Parma
review_content: smells very fresh, can definitely smell the orange and lemon, however smells a little bit like soap in my opinion and longevity is not long at all.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Arancia di Capri Acqua di Parma
review_content: Photorealistic citrus fragrance. It smells similar to when you peel an orange and have orange peel stuck in your fingernails.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Arancia di Capri Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Very natural smelling scent. Light and airy, perfect for summer. Initial citrus is slightly rindy, which contributes to that natural scent. That calms down a bit after about 15-20 minutes and the sweetness comes about. Not too strong but just enough. Performance.. don't expect much. Is it worth the price? Would've been nice if it was more affordable. Got a travel size to use it intermittently in summer or on vacation.

Based on scent, lovely. Based on price vs performance, probably can do better.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Arancia di Capri Acqua di Parma
review_content:
This fragrance smells AMAZING. I am incredibly happy to finally have it in my collection. Hands down my favourite fragrance from the Blu Mediterraneo line. This is the most beautiful natural smelling summer citrus fragrance I have ever smelt. It smells to me like a photorealistic californian mandarin being peeled, broken apart and juiced. Super sweet mandarin. I absolutely love it. The only issue with this is and most of the Blu Medditeraneo line is that the longevity is horrendous. About an hour to an hour and a half of longevity and 20 to 30 minutes of projection before becoming a skin scent. Fortunately the smell and affordable price makes up for it. Xerjoff Renaissance smells very similar to this and the Xerjoff performs much better however this AdP smells much nicer than the Xerjoff.

Women often gravitate to Jo Malone and I feel like Acqua Di Parma could be the Jo Malone for men. However most of the Blu Mediterraneo line smells better than Jo Malone's offerings to be perfectly honest

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Arancia di Capri Acqua di Parma
review_content: Fresh, summertime citrus scent. It doesn’t last the longest but I’m at peace with that as it’s so light and fresh I wouldn’t expect it to last longer than an hour or two. If you own this and Mandorlo di Sicilia then I urge you to try layering these two together. It makes the most wonderful creamsicle summery smelling scent

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Arancia di Capri Acqua di Parma
review_content: Great citrusy pick me up. Longevity and performance aren’t beastly and that’s probably by design. Surprised no one has picked up on the similarity to Xerjoff’s renaissance. If you’re looking for this scent profile + beastly performance, go with xerjoff instead.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Arancia di Capri Acqua di Parma
review_content: Citrusy fresh, a little musky and a green tinge to it thats how I would describe this scent. It has also a clean soapyness. Really nice for the warmer weather. Negative points : longevity is max 4hours, and quite pricy for a weak scent.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Arancia di Capri Acqua di Parma
review_content: Pick a citrus and you'll probably find a note of it in here somewhere. There is a sweet earthiness to the base that really elevates the scent beyond the fruit and into something more complex and romantic. Only complaint is that the longevity is far too short, and the sillage leaves much to be desired.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Arancia di Capri Acqua di Parma
review_content:
So so so delightful and simple. Sweet citrus with a warmer undertone that doesn’t take away from the brightness.

I’ll be layering this with Chanel Allure Homme Edition Blanche as I LOVE the bergamot and tonka but have wanted more citrus

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Arancia di Capri Acqua di Parma
review_content: This is so mouthwatering delicious if you enjoy the smell of cutting into a juicy orange that was picked fresh off the tree this one is for you! 🍊

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Arancia di Capri Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Delightful natural citrus scent that acts as an instant pick-me-up before leaving the house. The dry-down is a soft clean musk. It smells high quality and is beautifully blended.

However, hardly any sillage to speak of, longevity around 4 hrs on me in moderately cool European climate.

I did enjoy it, but would not necessarily repurchase at the given price point. For that either it would have to perform better or have a more interesting note profile.

Nice freshie for spring/summer, in case you received it as a gift.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Arancia di Capri Acqua di Parma
review_content: Beautiful citrusy scent! Unfortunately doesn’t even last longer than 15 minutes.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Arancia di Capri Acqua di Parma
review_content: Smells just like the juicy rush of vitamin C you get when peeling Cuties for the kids. Clean and realistic blast of fresh mandarins. I absolutely adore the fragrance itself, but the performance is wretchedly disappointing even for a citrus freshie. Completely gone in less than 1 hour. If you can get a big bottle at a discounter and don't mind spraying yourself 100x during the day, its worth considering, but who has time for that?

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Arancia di Capri Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Beautiful Beautiful and just beautiful. I cannot believe I never even knew about this beauty until now 🙄
Where has it been all my life???

Petit grain and citruses are my favorites so I had to blind buy the big 5 oz. bottle (it was on sale) and oh. my. goodness!!!!!! Y U M M Y !!!!!!

This is definitely a Summertime scent and yes, the longevity isn’t the greatest but it doesn’t bother me, I absolutely looooove it!

I do not necessarily detect the caramel note though perhaps it balances the citruses and brings depth to the whole composition? All I know is that this smells like heaven on earth and I am thrilled to have added this beauty to my collection!!!

🍊🍋🧡💛💚🤍

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Arancia di Capri Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I bought this fragrance for the beautiful realistic juicy orange and the romantic association with the nature of Capri. Unfortunately, the mental vacation it takes me on is always too short. Like many others have pointed out, this fragrance has no lasting power nor projection.

This morning I sprayed 26 times, and my sister sitting next to me in the car could not smell it. When I asked her what I'm wearing, she said, "Funny? All I can smell is something sour.” That's how I feel about this scent. The poor performance deterrs me from buying more ADP fragrances.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Arancia di Capri Acqua di Parma
review_content: Acqua di Parma's entire Blu Med line is absolutely heartbreaking. The citruses are all so incredible. Sweet realistic and uplifting. For me at least, after one or two hours, it is undetectable unless I put my arm right up to my nose. I love citruses in the summer but the price point of around $80-100 per bottle just isn't worth it for me with such poor longevity. Its too bad because the opening is amazing.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Arancia di Capri Acqua di Parma
review_content: Beautiful naturalist scent. The lemon note can sometimes shine through for ten minutes and be sharp but it calms down. Very good drydown. It then gets light gourmand. Some think this scent reminds them of sunscreen. Not for me unless you are using the Biotherm citrus sunscreen. Maybe this has the same scent vibe. On me it stays on 3-7 hours. Longer on clothes. I have used this in hot weather and in sunney but - must have a jacket - weather. Always good clean scent. It is citrus fresh. So you must like that.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Arancia di Capri Acqua di Parma
review_content: "Gone in 60 seconds " . Yes, ADP does citrus very well, and that projection / longevity is an issue with citrus. But, come on ! You can do better ! This is the third ADP frag I've tried ( Colonia and Fico di Amalfi are the other two), and this is the weakest of the three. By far. This is not priced as a cheapie ! Abysmal performance with a barely there (dry, bitter orange) scent. Regrets.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Arancia di Capri Acqua di Parma
review_content: I have 3 bottles of Blu Mediterraneo line, the 3 scents are just evanescent on my skin, they do not last more than 5 minutes. The scent of this one is not crazy at all. I want to sell my bottle because I found so much better fresh lemon/orange fragrances from other brands. No interest for me.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Arancia di Capri Acqua di Parma
review_content: Yes! Oranges, mandarins but without the overly sharp bitter part of the zest. Just right, one of the few scent you need to have! Only downside, it doesn't last long and the sillage is verry poor. I bought it for 60-70€ in a set with the shower gel and the body lotion spray on. It definitely lasts longer if you use them all together and honestly, that price for a 75ml bottle and shower gel and lotion. You can't go wrong

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Arancia di Capri Acqua di Parma
review_content: I love the fragrances of Acqua di Parma very much, their quality is indisputable, unfortunately I have found that on my skin the Blu Mediterraneo line especially the citrus line so the aforementioned Capri Orange has a surprising and lashing juste pulvérisé, a delicate evanescent dry, and then inexorably disappear into thin air in the dry down… a real shame.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Arancia di Capri Acqua di Parma
review_content: Sillage and longevity are both lacking for this lovely, clean citrus scent.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Arancia di Capri Acqua di Parma
review_content: This is pleasant inoffensive for hot summer days. It is good for layering. The main notes are orange, mandarine, petitgrain, musk and caramel. It is simple orange fragrance yet interesting with nice additions of petitgrain, musk and caramel. 10/10

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Arancia di Capri Acqua di Parma
review_content:
This is just beautiful. I love orange & mandarin scents, they are my favourite notes in a fragrance. I've been looking for an orange or a mandarin dominant fragrance for quite some time and this, this is just the thing I was looking for. It's bright and fresh, perfect for a summer day when the weather outside is extremely hot.

The only downside would be the longevity, but the price makes up for it. This is one of those fragrances that I would repurchase without a doubt!

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Arancia di Capri Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I've known the house for quite a while, but I always focus on the more woody and heavy-scented perfumes. This summer I wanted to find my signature cologne and after exhausting research and testing I decided to go with Fico Di Almafi, I was delighted with the brand, so I went and tried the rest of the line.

Let there be said that I'm not into citric scents, I don't like them and they don't like me either, but Arancia Di Capri is the first citric scent I feel comfortable with. It Is bright, fresh, natural, calming, and most of all it fits me well. It performs better for the weather it was designed...hot days of summer. As other reviewers mentioned the only downside of this cologne is the short longevity.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Arancia di Capri Acqua di Parma
review_content: You know when you just go about your day..working, going to the grocery or just doing some mall errands..and you go home taking off your shirt and it rubs on your nose and you have a sniff of it.... then you noticed your shirt still smells fresh! This is what you this perfume do. Might not be able to smell it on your skin but it sticks on your clothing. I love it!

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Arancia di Capri Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Maybe it has something to do with the cardamom, musk, or petitgrain but I get a strong tea accord.
Some how my bottle lasts all day, 6+ hours noticeably.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Arancia di Capri Acqua di Parma
review_content: Arancia di Capri is lovely, I mean Acqua di Parma really gets their citruses spot on - this is a sweet orange that's fresh with zingy petitgrain. The other notes help this not to become straight orange juice, and it's this musky bright clean aura all around you after it dries down. I can't help but feel that this ought to be in a splash bottle, though. I splashed on a 4 mL decant earlier and by hour 4 it had considerably faded - I could still get a sense of it lingering around me, but definitely would need to reapply if you wanted it to still be refreshing. It is beautiful, though - it doesn't turn sour on me like some citruses do in the heat. If it were more affordable, I would bathe myself in it this summer.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Arancia di Capri Acqua di Parma
review_content: This is a beautiful scent. The only downside is that is only lasts an hour or so.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Arancia di Capri Acqua di Parma
review_content: Love the smell but can’t stand the performance. Even with 30+ sprays the scent lasts on my skin for barely a hour. Lasts more on clothes but the projection is extremely weak. If they ever made a EDP line with this I’d definitely buy again, but for now I’ll use up my 5oz bottle till it’s empty

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Arancia di Capri Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Absolutely gorgeous!!

This is simply stunning!! Orange orange orange all the way! Nothing at all synthetic. Just a full on explosion of juicy oranges with hints of lemon and bergamot. If you want to get away to the Amalfi coast for a eew hours then spray yourself with this!! Perhaps the most refreshing fragrance out there! A real compliment getter also.

10/10 from Acqua Di Parma!

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Arancia di Capri Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Very mixed citrus forward, especially orange and bergamot. I get a slight tea accord that's not listed as well. I also get a peachy type accord in the opening but could just be a combination of the notes together. The opening is beautiful. A little greenness comes out as the citruses calm down. Petitgrain is more prominent than the cardamom. Not really detecting any musk or caramel to be honest other than an ever so slight, way in the background scent which you won't notice unless you're specifically looking for it. This does smell pretty natural, i will say. I do get a slight fig-like accord here, similar to Fico De Amalfi but it's not as prominent.

Longevity and projection is not good. The top prominent notes dissipate pretty quickly and it become a skin scent very quickly after application. You have to sniff right on skin to smell anything very soon after spraying. If you can get this for a massive discount, this would be a good warm weather scent. I would never ever pay full price for this. I was able to get a tester 5oz for $60 with cap and for that price, i don't mind. Had i paid full retail, i would have been extremely disappointed. Beautiful scent, just does not last. Be prepared to carry a decant if you want to wear this for an entire day.

Very office safe, good for warm summer days also. Presentation is classy and nice and the same as the others in the line.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Arancia di Capri Acqua di Parma
review_content: Such a beautiful scent. The opening is similar to drinking a sweet orange juice. Then the dry down is a calming caramel indeed. However the only major downside is its longevity - it just dissipates on my skin after a few minutes.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Arancia di Capri Acqua di Parma
review_content:
God how i love this one! so calming! so fresh! so summery!
the first time i smelled it i immediately had that "vacation sensation"
its PERFECT for the beach and hot days.
longevity is not the best but for me its enough for a work day or the beach.
this one is my signature summer fragrance.
i would highly recommend this one for the summer and hot days!

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Arancia di Capri Acqua di Parma
review_content: This is the weakest fragrance I ever tried. I received a sample of it and I sprayed the entire sample bottle on me. I only smelled the first few seconds, then zero. I asked my husband to smell me ans he said he doesn’t smell a perfume on me. Those first few seconds were beautiful though, I wish it lasted.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Arancia di Capri Acqua di Parma
review_content:
It is super fresh and good choice for hot day.
Performance is average with over spraying, it gave me around 4-5 hrs. But it is quite noticeable.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Arancia di Capri Acqua di Parma
review_content: Lovely, refreshing and comfortable scent, but longevity is quite disappointing.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Arancia di Capri Acqua di Parma
review_content: This smells like walking in an orange field when is raining on a summer day. I hate this one doesn't stay for a long period. In less than an hour it is almost gone. However, this fresh citric scent is an instant punch of happiness and positivity. It smells far from a synthetic laundry detergent like some other mentioned. Aqua di parma knows how to capture the natural fresh smells in their products. Big fan of this brand.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Arancia di Capri Acqua di Parma
review_content: This parfum is not at all fresh to me. It smells like stale laundry detergent water I would imagine. I feel there is a herb note in it which annoys me a lot. BTW, where is caramel and musk??? I did a blind buy because there was a big hype about this frag last year. Today I was bored and I gave it another try - still hate it. It smells so weak yet managed to annoy me completely. I thought I'll just cover it with something strong. So I sprayed YSL black opium intense (which I also don't like). Now I want to kill myself. Two negatives don't make a positive. I should have thought it through.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Arancia di Capri Acqua di Parma
review_content: I like this citrus, but it's so weak on my skin. I barely smell it anymore even after just some minutes.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Arancia di Capri Acqua di Parma
review_content:
It is a hot February day now, so I'm blasting away at this vial sample of Arancia Di Capri. It totally effects me like Liz Claiborne for women. Liz on women made me go bananas and I wanted to smell it all the time. This ADP Arancia really borders feminine imo, but It just may work for a guy. The caramel drydown is light, but nice. I just wish it was muskier like Cedro de Taormina. Longevity on ADP Arancia is not good, but it is NOT an e.d.p. either. I am going to try this one for the warmer months. Spring / Summer comes a bit earlier in central Texas.

Update:
Initially the scent is nice, but drydown is like cloying, powdery baby wipes...especially in the heat. Cool Water has the same effect, the drydown is offensive.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Arancia di Capri Acqua di Parma
review_content: Never had a citrus quite like this, acqua knows how to do it well. Not too sweet or overpoweringly mandarin, the balance between the freshness and the musky drydown is fantastic. Only thing is it doesn’t last long on me, after a few hours what remains is the musky hint of it

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Arancia di Capri Acqua di Parma
review_content: I like the smell but it's too masculine for my taste. It's very fresh and would be good for a sunny beach day in my opinion.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Arancia di Capri Acqua di Parma
review_content: freshly ripped orange, little sweet because of the caramel (barely noticeable, i thought it was sugar). there's a note that me it warms. i own 60+ fragrances, TOP 5. wish the longevity & projection are better. 30 min projection, 3 hr longevity.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Arancia di Capri Acqua di Parma
review_content: This is just citrus. There is nothing else to it. When I smell it I just smell fresh lemon peel. Definitely something I have to layer, maybe with moschino I love love to make it more mature and expensive smelling? Alone it just smells like lemon rind and it smells a tad masculine. Its a nice fragrance if you want to smell like lemons though!

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Arancia di Capri Acqua di Parma
review_content: Arancia di Capri is pure orange (and mandarine) peal oil nuance fragrance! Because of that it is the most appealing ingredient to be layered with other odor parameters! My recent and most suitable for upcoming autumn is the combination of the three fragrances; 1. First layer the fixative: Loreal Men Expert serial "Mountain Water hydra power" (moisturiser). 2. On that spray "Lozione Dopo Barba" series VETIVER by Santa Maria Novella. 3. On those spray a layer of AdiP Arancia di Capri! Voila! A staying fresh bright, dry but delightly manly sweet but seriously taken new autumn fragrance!

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Arancia di Capri Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Acqua di Parma's Arancia di Capri is a moderately pleasant perfume. It's a sweet orange perfume overall rather like Monotheme's Verde d'Arancia. It is not a fresh orange perfume like Hermes's Eau d'Orange Verte or Atelier Cologne's Orange Sanguine. It isn't a photorealistic orange by any stretch of the imagination.

What you get with Arancia di Capri is a scent that quickly settles to an intimate projection but has a lot of durability as long as you're not wearing it on your arms in the sunshine, in which case, of course it won't last long. You get an opening of orange, lemon, bergamot and a touch of mandarin and cardamom to give you a sweet orange accord. Around 30 - 40 minutes in the petitgrain slips its way into the olfactory experience. Alas, petitgrain is a note that tends to disagree with me and it gives me a slight headache here for a while until it fades away. This general sweet orange accord stays for the next seven hours or so. And then, just as the perfume appears to fade away there's a little surprise - you finally get the slightest whiff of caramel with the musk. This rather surprised me as there seemed to be an hour or so of a faint orange and greenness and then nothingness for a while before the caramel and musk made a brief fleeting appearance. They are there but you'll need to be away from sunshine, be properly hydrated, eating well, paying attention and have a good nose!

There's no prize for originality in saying this but it is a spring, summer and early autumn perfume, more for day wear than the evening. It's subtle and a gentle projector so it's also one purely for your own enjoyment. Hardly anyone will smell this on you after the first hour unless they're standing right next to you in very close quarters.

It's pleasant enough but at £82 for 75ml and £124 for 150ml it's just too pricey to justify a repurchase when there are cheaper perfumes that do the same feminine, sweet, orange accord for far less money.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Arancia di Capri Acqua di Parma
review_content:
My review will mirror so many others - fantastic orange and petitgrain to open up. As it dries down it transitions from a realistic fresh orange note to more of a gourmand-style orange as the caramel steps forward much more. In the end as a skin scent it's very soft and low-key and more classically Italian musky-aromatic citrus.

It's performance is not that good, but as I've said for others I have times when I do want a scent that has a shorter lifespan - I call them Sprinters, and I like to have a handful available for each season, but for those who avoid low-longevity frags, this is definitely one to steer clear of.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Arancia di Capri Acqua di Parma
review_content: Very lovely fresh scent, pure citrus. Doesn't lean either neither feminine or masculine would suit both genders as long as they are aiming for a fresh summer citrus scent. Usually citrus scents remind me of cleaning products but this one doesn't smell anything like it!

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Arancia di Capri Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Summer in a bottle.

I agree with the reviewers below, it's not the longest lasting fragrance...
But, for the hot Australian summers it's so nice and refreshing.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Arancia di Capri Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I’d recommend you pass on this fragrance. I purchased a 150ml bottle at the beginning of summer and have been using it for a over a month.

The opening is amazing. The orange & citrus are very natural and refreshing. This, not unexpectedly of citrus, is pretty much gone in under 30 minutes, even on clothes. The mid notes are very weak, and on my skin or clothes I never get to the base notes. Never. None of that promised caramel. So basically, the whole experience is over in about an hour.

The real annoying part: After I spray some on, a few hours later I can go to the atomizer and there it is…caramel! It smells so good and realistic. But on my skin or clothes, it never shows up. Not in 20+ wearings.

Of course, YMMV. My advice to anyone looking at any of these AdP Blu Mediterraneo fragrances is try it on, and walk away. Leave. Don’t be taken in by the amazing opening. Go away and see where it takes you. It’s definitely not a blind buy, strictly based on performance.

I’m going to burn through this 5oz bucket by the end of summer and never look back. Which is such a shame.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Arancia di Capri Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I wanted something that felt like MFK's petit matin but lighter. This is PM-lite. I received a 2ml sample when I bought another perfume from my local perfumery store, and I must say that it was a pleasant surprise. The petit grain in this one drew the scent profile of PM into my mind, but still remaining unique with its citrus-dominant profile.

Honestly, the caramello note does not rear its head in a typical cloying fashion but more of a soft sweet embrace around the other notes. While I appreciate PM's floral-citrus-musk composition, I find this a lot lighter and puts me in the mood for some sun.

Longevity is understandably shorter for a citrus-dominant EDT (about 3+ hours for me), get this in its big 150ml flacon format and you'll be living on a citrus-powered cloud for as long as your bottle lasts.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Arancia di Capri Acqua di Parma
review_content: Smells like I’ve just had a shower in San Pelligrino Aranciata…but I’m not complaining because it smells light and refreshing. The longevity and sillage is really poor unfortunately which means you do need to overspray.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Arancia di Capri Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Such a realistic orange juice type of smell this one has, oh lord. It makes me wanna drink it. I think this is a very natural scent, the notes are well blended together and the musk and caramel come around just to give it a little hint of depth to the citrusy forward scent.

Overall: loved it, this is a summer killer. I just wished this lasted a little longer, so i would recommend you guys get the 150ml and overspray as you wish in order to make it last.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Arancia di Capri Acqua di Parma
review_content:
It smells like orange peel and petitgrain in the best way possible! It takes me back to walking through an orange grove on a warm summer day!

The fragrance sits very intimately on your skin, and it lasts for about 4 hours. Sometimes when I walk around, I catch a scent of it and I am always pleasantly surprised! It is perfect for both gender and the value is alright imo.

8/10. The only way it could get better was if the sillage and longevity were better.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Arancia di Capri Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Good scent with week performance

Scent : 9
Performance : 2

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Arancia di Capri Acqua di Parma
review_content: Citrus notes through and through. Smells like I rubbed an orange that’s still attacted to the tree on myself. Nice hot day fragrance that isn’t too loud. Good for those 100+ degree days. Doesn’t really project and is a skin scent for about 3 hours .

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Arancia di Capri Acqua di Parma
review_content: The opening is so Wow. Its like a natural, cold Mandarin Orange Juice, i want to drink it. But longevity issue. I wish it would stay long on my skin.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Arancia di Capri Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Orange, though not the freshness of a ripe fruit and its zesty tang, but rather a synthetic, soapy quality. At first spray, it might as well be an orange jelly bean, or a car air freshener. It settles a bit, but given its poor longevity, what is it all for?
That is what I got, in any case, when I was otherwise hoping for a light summer fragrance.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Arancia di Capri Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Really good Orange. Is it better than Atelier Orange Sanguine?
Orange Sanguine smells like a real damn Orange. This is not as photo realistic but is still good in its own way. It doesn't smell too synthetic to my nose.
My only complaints are

1. I wish it had vetiver in the base instead of caramel. If I'm wearing this in the heat I don't want caramel. Not that the caramel is cloying or super strong, I just would have picked something else for the base, or just omitted that note altogether.

2. My skin likes to drink this and it seems to perform worse than others on me.

I still could see myself buying this at some point if the price was right. I like the all the citruses and musk.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Arancia di Capri Acqua di Parma
review_content: First time smelling this at holt renfrew, my girlfriend and i really enjoyed it. I enjoy the sweet and juicy citrus (mainly orange) and its a perfect fragrance for summer. I also enjoyed tom fords mandarino di amalfi but its not worth spending 200 dollars for a 50 ml when you can buy a 150 ml of this for 88 dollars ... previous reviews are sadly true that the longevity of both are weak (1-2 hrs) i was hoping it miraculously lasted long for me but it didnt. Solution: carry around a 5 ml decant and respray every two hours. Definitely worth the money in my opinion and its not a hassle to make your own decant either.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Arancia di Capri Acqua di Parma
review_content: I received a sample of this a while back and found it pleasant enough at the time but not worthy of purchasing, especially given its poor lasting power (typical of Acqua di Parma scents ime). After trying it again today it suddenly hit me that this smells remarkably similar to Elizabeth Arden Green Tea! I'm just comparing them side-by-side now and they are almost indistinguishable. The AdP is perhaps a little less harsh and chemical but I honestly don't think I could tell the difference if I didn't already know. So if you like this but can't quite justify the price I suggest picking up a bottle of dirt cheap Green Tea.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Arancia di Capri Acqua di Parma
review_content: May on the Mediterranean coast. Late breakfast, marble floors, white linen, warm dry breeze through the windows. Fresh squeezed orange juice. You can see citrus trees in the rocky soil and the ocean in the distance. I want this as a candle scent actually.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Arancia di Capri Acqua di Parma
review_content: I much prefer Orange Sanguine to this. While orange sanguine is a natural orange juice with the tanginess and sweetness of a real orange, this one is super harsh and synthetic and trying to pretend it's an orange. There are much better orange fragrance options out there.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Arancia di Capri Acqua di Parma
review_content: I will never forget the first time I came across this fragrance on my trip to Japan, a beautiful flight attendant wore this and I find it a perfectly suitable occasion to wear this refreshing scent. The scent is joyful and inviting, with a bit of naughtiness vibe.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Arancia di Capri Acqua di Parma
review_content:
-Initial impressions: I could see this becoming my favourite of the Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo lineup.
-Said to have weak longevity due to its concentration (Eau de cologne)
-Testing others from the Blue Mediterraneo lineup in-store (on tester strips), I ended up preferring Chinotto.

*Update*
-Secured a sample to test on skin.
-This disappeared on me within the hour.
-Has an aromatic, sharp opening that assaults your olfactory receptors.
-Reminiscent of biting into a piece of lime after your tequila shot.
-Unisex, refreshing.
-Not fbw. (-)

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Arancia di Capri Acqua di Parma
review_content: A lovely scent good for hot weather. Its an EDT so you know it can't last too long but this doesn't last on me more than a few hours. The opening is lovely but soon loses its projection, but for me, I layer it with Guerlain Nerolia Bianca to bring out more of the sweetness of it since i love the citrus in this. I would not buy again, but it is lovely for wearing around the house and after a shower.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Arancia di Capri Acqua di Parma
review_content: Mediocre scent. Synthetic, generic DNA found in many cheaper citrus scent. Performance is ADP standard which means pretty bad. Definitely not a bottle worth.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Arancia di Capri Acqua di Parma
review_content: I live in the northern hemisphere and it is winter now. But I cant wait to the summer to use this again I use it sometimes now aswell. But it isn't the same as giving yourself a shower of fresh orange juice. However much I love that feeling that this fragrance gives I cant rate it high. Because the performance really sucks and that is why I think it is overpriced

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Arancia di Capri Acqua di Parma
review_content:
The opening is delightful, a sweet, fresh and realistic orange with a hint of spice in the background to keep it from becoming too much like the smell of orange pulp. The problem for me came once you I got to the dry down. It’s got this cheap manly musk that turns into the smell of sweat and cologne when it mixed with the cardamom and what I assume is the caramel note. It reminds me of what my brother could come home smelling like after basketball practice.

He’d spray COPIOUS amounts of Ck One over his sweaty clothes to hold him off until he got home and showered. I’ll leave it up to your imagination to imagine what that smells like. Hard pass for me.

I love Acqua Di Parma but they’ve got much better to offer in their selection for me to settle for this.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Arancia di Capri Acqua di Parma
review_content: Ehh. It's alright, but something in it strikes me as synthetic rather than juicy orange.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Arancia di Capri Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Beautiful, juicy, fresh, summery smell. Oranges, mandarins, and happiness.

This perfume is truly unisex and makes anyone more attractive. This could not offend anyone; appropriate at the office or on a hot summer day at a beach bar.

If only it lasted longer... I think a lot of us would shower in it.

I purchased a bottle for my boyfriend (as a treat for myself haha!) for him to wear in the summer. He complained it barely lasted an hour and I agree.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Arancia di Capri Acqua di Parma
review_content: This scent is a beautiful, sophisticated citrus scent that I think would appeal to almost everyone. There's nothing offensive about it--it's just clean, bright, and fresh. It's not overly sweet or "fruity" either, which I love. It reminds me of sitting in the sunshine on a balcony in Santorini drinking mimosas and laughing with friends. You know when you start to peel an orange and you get that first splash of citrus with the almost bittersweet rind undertone? That's what this smells like to me. Summery and alluring. And the best part is I can spray it--literally douse myself in it--and it settles nicely into the background. I get headaches from perfumes very easily but this one never does that. It's literally the only perfume I have ever used until it was gone and I had to buy another bottle within a year.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Arancia di Capri Acqua di Parma
review_content: buy a kilo of oranges instead and squeeze it and you will get the same result :D

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Arancia di Capri Acqua di Parma
review_content: Like the bergamot fragrance from the same collection, this is utterly delightful and terribly weak. It's not an artificial orange fragrance, but a juicy explosion of true, zesty orange with a hint of sweetness. You have only a couple of minutes to inhale this joy, though - as the scent disappears into nothingness in less than an hour. Can't say whether there is another layer beyond the juicy orange splash as I simply can't detect anything on my skin after a while... So sad, this could have been a great summer fragrance.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Arancia di Capri Acqua di Parma
review_content: might be cheaper to just get a bottle of orange juice. maybe even spring for fresh squeezed.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Arancia di Capri Acqua di Parma
review_content:
A like, but not an inch more than that.
Smells like you just spilled your apricot/orange freshly squeezed juice on accident on yourself.
Smells natural , which is good.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Arancia di Capri Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Very light, fresh, orange. Not too sweet or dry, just right. Very natural and soft, not sharp or acidic. Light sillage and longevity, but very pleasant. Scent: 7.5, Longevity: 6, Overall: 7.5

UPDATE: After more wearings, I really enjoy this. Not the most unique or mind blowing fragrance, but a very comforting soft orange scent to wear casually on a warm lazy Sunday or strolling through a small Italian village. I gave it a 7.5 rating for scent, but it deserves higher...I can't give it a 9 because it's a simple scent and not sure how much perfumery is involved, but that's the feeling I have because it is such a pleasant, easy to wear, and memory inducing fragrance.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Arancia di Capri Acqua di Parma
review_content:
The opening starts out really nice, with a realistic, juicy, fresh, zesty orange. Smells like freshly squeezed orange juice, and it's delicious. A nice change from most other citrusy fragrances which mostly tend to lean more towards a lemon vibe.

However... As it dries down, within a couple of hours it transforms into something that mostly just smells like a cheap orange-scented bar of soap. What a disappointment...

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Arancia di Capri Acqua di Parma
review_content:
With so much praise being bestowed on this fragrance, I decided to write this review as a counterbalance and point out some of the faults that, in my opinion, have been given mere
lip service in some reviews, but in most cases outright ignored.

For those whose Italian is a little rusty, arancia is the Italian word for orange, so right away you know what's in store for you. This is OJ all the way, baby! The good kind though, not the bad kind. The opening is a blast of freshly squeezed orange juice, and it's quite good.
Unfortunately, it only lasts for about a minute and then fades away to a mild orange/lemon scent that stays for the rest of the journey. Occasional wafts of caramel hit your nose as Arancia dries down, but this is a linear scent through and through.

This is Acqua di Parma, so the quality and ingredients are all top notch; my main problem with this scent though is that the longevity and sillage are practically non-existent. Yes, it's a citrus-based fragrance so nobody is expecting beast mode performance, but at this price point Acqua di Parma needs to deliver more than this. Within an hour, people sitting next to you will have trouble picking up the scent, and unless you're outdoors in the high heat this stuff is barely noticeable past the two-hour mark. Interestingly enough, because of this problem, Arancia would actually make a great gym scent, although I doubt most people would use it in that setting.

So, if you're looking for a fancy gym scent, or you're a die-hard fan of orange and you have the money to purchase multiple bottles (because you'll be reapplying like crazy), then I would recommend Arancia; if not, don't bother. This may sound harsh, but Arancia is a niche version
of a Demeter orange fragrance. If you're a fan of this then more power to you, but the weak longevity and sillage, especially for the price, frustrate me way too much. Thumbs down.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Arancia di Capri Acqua di Parma
review_content: This smells absolutely amazing, gorgeous orange citrus, zesty, fresh and sweet, its like the best orange chew sweet you ever had. I get a few hours from it which is fine for a fresh scent, just carry a decant on hot days and top up to get the lovely opening again. I honestly can't praise this stuff enough, this is up there with edition blanche, dior cologne, colonia essenza and man eau fraiche for a hot day, spray on your pillow will make you dream of walking round an orange grove. 10/10.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Arancia di Capri Acqua di Parma
review_content: A very refreshing citrus scent. Clean, fresh, and pretty good longevity for this type of thing. Arcania di Capri brings to mind either being at the sea or running through an orange grove. The scent is pretty one dimensional to me, just oranges. Both orange peels and freshly squeeze juice feel present and very natural. This scent is both happy and healthy, like being on vacation with a full serving of Vitamin C.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Arancia di Capri Acqua di Parma
review_content:
everything from this blue line smells nice but this particular one and fico lasts the longest.easily over 6 hours. the opening on this is something i want to drink
10/10 summer beauty, very upclass

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Arancia di Capri Acqua di Parma
review_content: Something that Jude Law in "The Talented Mr. Ripley" would wear. Rich and dandy, the sun and the sea, jazz and yachting, golden boy.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Arancia di Capri Acqua di Parma
review_content:
My summer love~~ it is very orangy.
some of my female friends (who are more on girly sweet gourmet floral fruity scents) don't like this orange scent that much coz' they find it may too sharp for their liking.
Well~~ for me, I just love using during summer, esp. during those high heat + humid days.
spray some during summer morning definitely feel fresh and sparkle.
and it stay on me nearly 8 hours.
this is a great one

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Arancia di Capri Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I received this from a friend, not knowing anything about it except that it was described as clean citrus and good for summer.

This surprised me more and more as I wore it. Upon initial spray, i got an intense orange which is underlined by some green and slightly herbal notes, possibly petitgrain, with opening reminding me of MFK Aqua Celestia. As the initial blast dies, the mandarin note comes to fore with an faint candied sweetness that is beautifully clean and classy. This is a very subtle scent that you can go a bit heavier on ...especially when the sprayer is amazing too!

This lasts a surprisingly long time on my skin - about 7 hours later, my wife could smell it on me as she looked over my shoulder while i was seated at the couch, and complimented me on how attractive I smelt. Even walking around the house, I noticed the faintly sweet sillage lingering in the air.

Will be buying more of this!

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Arancia di Capri Acqua di Parma
review_content: Candied orange start to a soft floral dry down. Bright but fleeting. Ideal for a humid summer day relaxing poolside.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Arancia di Capri Acqua di Parma
review_content:
This one is my favorite in the set I received.
(in order : Arancia, Chinotto, Mirto, Fico, Bergamotto)
And it was the last one I tried, because, orange seemed pretty basic but it's a very fun orange. Green and crisp. Juicy yet with some depth.
Just wished more longevity like all the line but this is lovely.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Arancia di Capri Acqua di Parma
review_content:
My notes a couple years ago reads the following: "Opens like a gin and tonic, chills out, then the herbal comes out, orange."

Tastes change. Sometimes, longevity and projection aren't important indicators anymore. When you look over a collection, the assumption for some may be, each fragrance has a character, or a role. Arancia di Capri's role, as I see it, is fulfilled exceptionally, but it isn't nearly as celebrated. And that's fine by me.

This fragrance has survived multiple collection culls because of what it provides. Is the theme unique? Quite the contrary: citrus scents -- inspired by Italian towns, at that, are a dime a dozen. And, for the most part, they smell pretty similar to one another. Not exactly, of course, but all of them are generally in the same ballpark. So what's special about Arancia di Capri?

Well, truth be told, not much. But that doesn't mean it isn't somehow an exceptional fragrance. And that's because it embodies a fragrance that is valuable because of its scent, and role, and less projection, or longevity.

On one hand, you have the run-of-the-mill Dior Homme Cologne, or Terre d'Hermès Eau Très Fraîche, which represent designer fragrances that definitely have mass appeal. Sure, you might have to spray a dozen times with DHC for anyone to smell it, but that sweet lemonade is for you to enjoy.

Enter Arancia di Capri, who, like DHC, cannot really be fully detected at a distance. But, it's the most enjoyable orange scent to me, and guess what: that's what matters.

No one is going to smell your Arancia di Capri. It's performance is abysmal. It's in the same league as Acqua di Bergamotto by E. Zegna. But that element of being undetectable to others makes it the perfect vehicle for learning an important lesson about enjoying fragrances. It is for you.

It is perfectly inoffensive. It is understated. It is a played out theme, but if you enjoy it, it's a wonderful and unknown melody that you can hum to yourself.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Arancia di Capri Acqua di Parma
review_content: I'm a huge fan of AdP's Blu Mediterraneo line, and Arancia di Capri is another masterpiece. I'm a sucker for quality citrus fragrances, and this is such a well balanced orange scent it left me speechless the first time I tried it. It was love at first smell. It's not synthetic at all, I don't know where the reviewer below got that from. It's totally natural, if you've been to South Italy, this is what it smells like, it takes you back to that lovely holiday. The first time you put Arancia di Capri on, it's like peeling a fresh juicy orange and taking a long deep whiff up close. Guaranteed to put a smile on your face. Try it, I think you will absolutely adore this scent.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Arancia di Capri Acqua di Parma
review_content:
My first review here, but I'm so in love with Arancia di Capri that I can't keep it in.
On my skin, it opens with a citrus smell, sweet orange, not the peels, but the juicy flesh. On the top there is a hint of fresh, bright lemon, which fades in about an hour. When it dries, freshness transforms into delicate sweetness of orange and caramel, may-be with some peach. An hour later I start to smell a bit of cardamom.
This perfume is warm and comforting, it stays close to skin, but remains there for more than 6 hours.
I wear this perfume whenever I’m tired or feeling lonely, it is comforting and warm, and makes me feel softly feminine. In fact, I mostly use it at home.
Will be getting a big bottle, if I spray more the smell is more noticeable and lasts longer. Silage is soft, so I won't disturb anyone with it.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Arancia di Capri Acqua di Parma
review_content:
This is one those fragrances that tempted me to taste it ... in the fragrance game very difficult to find this much natural smelling fragrances but out of perfumery game you can buy a packaged juice ... I can get some apricot ish vibe plus citruses . Not lemony it is orangey ... issue is performance... 1 hour max and unfortunately that 1 hour is poor 1 hour
More reviews on my YouTube:
Mehdi Scent

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Arancia di Capri Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Scent: 7/10

Quality: 8/10

Originality: 4/10

Sillage: 6/10

Projection: 5/10

Longevity: 6/10

Price VS Size: 5/10

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Arancia di Capri Acqua di Parma
review_content: A very naturalistic, ultra refreshing citrus cologne with a top note dominated by a photorealistic note of orange, supported by zingy bergamot and lemon. It’s a beautifully uplifting and invigorating fragrance which, like nearly all freshies, has fleeting longevity. Wonderful for hot sunny days or nights, especially fresh out of the shower. The poor longevity necessitates frequent resprays, but otherwise it’s delightful.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Arancia di Capri Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I love a good citrus fragrance and had wanted to try this for a while. I seized an opportunity when a local department store had a discount on fragrance.

On me it is straight up citrus, all top note. It never develops into anything else and the longevity is poor (not unusual with me though). It literally smells like freshly squeezed citrus juice and then just fades away. I actually wear it to bed now as it relaxes me and I want to get some use out of it!

Don't get me wrong, it is very pleasant but for general wear I can't get any mileage out of it without layering it significantly with something else (I recently layered it with a sample of Sole di Positano and that worked quite well).

I have a feeling it would work far better in a hotter climate.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Arancia di Capri Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I am so happy with the review posted by slpfrsly! That review is what got me to blind buy a bottle. There is nothing left to be said about this perfume that has not already been stated by slpfrsly but I would like to say that I agree with everything they say below. It is lovely.

When I first sprayed it I initially wasn't totally sure about it but after it dried I knew it was for me. Initially, at first spray, reminded me of one of the Moschino cheapies, but only for a couple seconds.

I love freshie colognes and layered this with Mugler Cologne and the combination of the two is great and seems to make it last longer on my skin.

A lot of people are talking about how fleeting the scent with this one but in my particular case, ALL perfumes are fleeting on my skin. I haven't met one so far that lasts more than 2 hours, so this is comparable to most in my opinion as far as longevity.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Arancia di Capri Acqua di Parma
review_content: I love orange notes so this fragrance is just perfect for me. I live in a tropical country that's hot and humid all year round. This fragrance works perfect for that weather. The lovely orange scent holds well in high heat. Not great longevity but I'm ok with that. Fairly office safe too. I feel so bright and sunny and happy when I wear this!

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo Arancia di Capri Acqua di Parma
review_content: Reminds me of the Elizabeth Arden green tea perfume I wore all throughout high school, I think I will layer this with Mugler angel croisiere for extra sweetness and zest

product_name: Iris Nobile 10th Anniversary Special Edition Acqua di Parma
review_content: Very pretty, slight sweet iris, delicate and faint. Nice, but the strength and sillage is too porr to be worth the money

product_name: Iris Nobile 10th Anniversary Special Edition Acqua di Parma
review_content:
-Opening notes are similar to Serge Lutens Fleur d’Oranger. (Could it be the Jasmine?)
-Longevity: Low-Medium. Lasts 4 hours or so.
-Projection: Low. Turns to a skin scent within the hour.
-Nondescript.
-Not fbw. (-)

product_name: Iris Nobile 10th Anniversary Special Edition Acqua di Parma
review_content:
an exquisite fragrance. best worn on cool fresh days.

after an initial burst of citrusy delight with star anis, she begins to dry down into a something ladylike, yet slightly sweet and earthy. the earthiness i smell is definitely oakmoss and patchouli. the main flower in front is orange blossom, with a soft ylang sitting behind her. the iris is very gentle in this. there is a touch of vanilla and amber, but the oakmoss and patchouli stay alongside right through the dry down on me.

sillage is medium and lasting at least 12 hours.

the note inside the box tells you that this is exactly the same formula as the original and also lists the notes, which are different from above.
i will list them when i get chance. there is definitely lovely oakmoss in this composition.

oh what do i know?...but is this really a "floral woody musk"?
Iris Nobile smells like a chypre to me. not a classic chypre like Mitsouko, but not like the floral woody musks i have experienced. a modern chypre. and it definitely has the Francis Kurkdjian vibe.

product_name: Mirto di Panarea La Riserva Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I am not sure what combination in this frag at the beginning to half an hour reminds me of Bleu Marine Pour Lui by Pierre Cardin (1986). https://www.fragrantica.com/perfume/Pierre-Cardin/Bleu-Marine-Pour-Lui-2594.html

It might be the Citron + Myrtle + Sage + Lavender and maybe the Lentisque. Some of what I mentioned may not be included in the notes of that Bleu Marine Pour Lui, but I am sure that some of each constituent in each mentioned ingredients above may work its way to recall me with that nostalgic scent I really enjoyed when I was very very young.

I like this Mirto di Panarea la Riserva 2025 anyway. Its greenness, refreshing and dry juniper berries, that cineol among others in Myrtle and the aromatic tea like in lentisque really make my day every time I spritz it on.

product_name: Mirto di Panarea La Riserva Acqua di Parma
review_content:
My recent encounter with Acqua di Parma was a happy accident. I saw a sample of what I thought was the classic Mirto di Panarea (2008), a fragrance I hadn't smelled in years. But upon receiving it, I realized it was a new EDP, named Mirto di Panarea La Riserva.

Though it appears to be a flanker, the scent has almost no connection to the original. The iconic myrtle note of the classic MdP is barely noticeable here.

The opening is a definite "wow." It's a powerful, citrusy, metallic, and woody citron-rosemary accord with a touch of juniper. This initial blast instantly reminded me of two other fragrances: the openings of FZOTIC/Bruno Fazzolari's Five (2013) and, in some extent, Ferragamo's Acqua Essenziale (2013). All three share that clean, sharp, and almost futuristic opening that feels both modern and invigorating.

However, the impressive start doesn't last long. As the citrus notes fade, the metallic accord gets stronger, and a subtle yet high-pitched peppery note of Iso E Super becomes increasingly and rapidly noticeable. This shift leads the drydown to become strikingly similar to that of Atelier Cologne's Bohemian Orange Blossom (2022)—or dozens of summer fragrances from main-strain designer brands in the last decade—with a key distinction: while the Atelier uses a notable dose of neroli and overall feels lighter in a way of EDT; La Riserva makes the same space with rosemary and feels stronger like an EDP after all. While both are in the fresh citrus category, this synthetic, dusty, peppery, and woody drydown is not what I typically seek in this genre.

I wish its drydown could have been better. Even a reinterpretation of Five's drydown would have been preferable to this adaptation of Bohemian Orange Blossom's.

Rating:
9/10 for the openning;
3/10 for the drydown

product_name: Mirto di Panarea La Riserva Acqua di Parma
review_content: I have spent quite a lot of time with Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo testers over the years, being frustrated that the fragrances that sounded so beautiful were disappointingly 'plain' for want of a better term, and impossibly short-lived anyway. All change with this one! Beautifully aromatic and green, bitter herbs and sprightly citrus that seem inclined to stick around for a while (thanks, apparently to the dread amberwoods which I can never identify anyway). The whole composition is absolutely gorgeous. I will need to check out the other Riserva options now.

product_name: Mirto di Panarea La Riserva Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I absolutely love the Riserva edition of Mirto de Panarea. As others have said, it is less citrusy than the original. The only credited citrus note is citron. Riserva is an aromatic bomb 💣 It smells as if you are walking through a beautiful aromatic herb garden.

Just looking at the notes, I actually love every piece of this creation lol … juniper, citron, lavender, sage, Myrtle, myrrh, patchouli, labdanum and mastic.

It has good longevity and projection. And best of all, my wife likes it on me, which is very very very very very rare.

9/10 and a Fragrantica score of 4.6

product_name: Mirto di Panarea La Riserva Acqua di Parma
review_content: Selling 180ml, pm if interested

product_name: Mirto di Panarea La Riserva Acqua di Parma
review_content: I find the opening a bit harsh and with petrochemical connotations, to be honest. A “well-known member” of a different site said of the original that it smelled like screenwash. While I like the original a lot, I think he could be on to something if he referred to La Riserva. For a fresh, more masculine myrtle scent, I recommend Osaïto from M. Micallef instead. Note: The dry down is quite nice, surprisingly enough. It just takes quite a bit of time for the slightly unpleasant top to dissipate. At least you should try this one before buying.

product_name: Mirto di Panarea La Riserva Acqua di Parma
review_content: I love the composition of the original EDT, but this is a bit of a departure. It’s hyper aromatic, like pouring gin and green sticks through a wood chipper. It blasts you with herbs and green notes and a hint of citrus, with the original DNA hiding underneath it. I’m curious to see how it smells once it dries down more; they were unable to give me a sample in the store unfortunately. I do not feel that this is a safe blind buy.

product_name: Mirto di Panarea La Riserva Acqua di Parma
review_content: smells quite green to me

product_name: Mirto di Panarea La Riserva Acqua di Parma
review_content: This one packs much more punch the the subtle, creamy original. I like original Mirto Di Panarea, but I find this one so much better. More woody, less aromatic, less feminine. I do not find it redundant have both, they are not that similar. The longevity and projection are multiple classes above the EDT. Love it.

product_name: Mirto di Panarea La Riserva Acqua di Parma
review_content: Loved the EDT this one takes it to another level. 10/10

product_name: Mirto di Panarea La Riserva Acqua di Parma
review_content: Can someone say where I can buy this version in EU ? Thank you.

product_name: Mirto di Panarea La Riserva Acqua di Parma
review_content: Beautiful "upgrade" to my favourite scent of the line. This has more depth to it than the EdT, lasts longer and is slightly sweeter, while staying just as green and funky. Lovely release, as long as we don't look at the €230 retail price tag for the 100ml. (Where the EdT is €155 for that same 100ml.) Not worth getting at retail, especially if you already have the EdT, since they are very similar.

product_name: Mirto di Panarea La Riserva Acqua di Parma
review_content: What is this, the fifth iteration of Mirto di Panarea released by ADP? Since it's an EDP, let's hope this one is actually a noticable departure from the original.

product_name: Mirto di Panarea La Riserva Acqua di Parma
review_content: Citrus combination with dryer drydown makes it seem great for summer nights - hint of gin

product_name: Mirto di Panarea La Riserva Acqua di Parma
review_content: Bright citrus opening and a slight floral drydown

product_name: Acqua di Parma Profumo 2008 Acqua di Parma
review_content: Nothing short of perfection. Happy to add it into my collection. Such stunning honey laced with labdanum.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Profumo 2008 Acqua di Parma
review_content: Very exotic aroma. The simplified description of the predominant chord in the opening is rubberized and very dated deodorant. This awful strong opening lasts for seconds though. The relief comes quickly with a very smoky, powdery, leathered and rubbery chord, aided by a very loud, strict and carnal floral chord: this pair delivers a mature and dirty leathered-floral aroma - comes to mind brothel or mature luxury prostitutes. I don't recommend interpreting my review as negative, because I really liked it, I just think it's too challenging for very young man or women. Very restricted versatility: nocturnal occasions that provide the necessary freedom to use something so challenging. Very high performance, near beast mode.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Profumo 2008 Acqua di Parma
review_content: Juzme, a fragrance doesn't have to have every single note as another to be similar. That is why it is "similar" and not "exact". Plus, not every note is listed on Fragrantica or even in the brand description on their own website. They mention key notes and that's all. This isn't some scheme against consumers, AdP reformulated Profumo to make it a little brighter and fresher and therefore a little more modern. I own both fragrances and they are for certain similar, but different enough to where I still wanted to own both.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Profumo 2008 Acqua di Parma
review_content:
QUESTION : how can this one be similar to the other one ,with violets ,as this one does not have violet in its formula ???
Can anyone explain how come they are valued as being similar ?
Looking left and right for infos about Acqua di Parma creates only confusion.Looking at the notes and at reminds me of ,the confusion will only be greater.
A reminds of B and C. But B does not remind of C,only of A , and so on :-)))))))))))
Looks like they make it on purpose to confuse the buyers.
Have already encountered the scheme in other brands .

product_name: Acqua di Parma Profumo 2008 Acqua di Parma
review_content:
This smells like class, luxury and elegance. It's a truly stunning chypre, oozing with old school opulence. I'm usually the first to complain about crazy expensive perfumes, but this one is worth the money.

Maybe it's just me, but I find that the chypre label is becoming like the oriental label - perfumes are calling themselves that but not really being true to the genre. This one is a true chypre and I appreciate that.

This opens as a powdery, citrussey, jasmine and rose. The citrus doesn't last all that long and then it becomes all floral. The rose is restrained and dry, but still lush. The jasmine is such high quality. There isn't the slightest whiff of anything synthetic here.

The dry down becomes a little woody, a bit sharper than the powdery and ultra feminine florals that precede it. The moss is gorgeous, so rich and earthy. It finally becomes musky, but in a very feminine way.

This is old school movie stars holidaying on the Riviera, dripping in jewels and arranging secret trysts away from the prying eyes of the paparazzi.

If this perfume was a movie, it would be To Catch A Thief. Grace Kelly would have loved it.

It's got moderate sillage and the longevity is stellar. I put this on in the morning, showered later at night and could still smell it on me when I got into bed.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Profumo 2008 Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I got curious about this fragrance simply because of the cost. I was lucky enough to find a gorgeous mini online and... I really didn't think I was going to like it. The first time I tried it my initial impression was, "Gah! That's strong!" and I was afraid it would give me a headache. However, I was really busy that day and must have washed my hands up to my elbows 10 times or more and guess what? The scent was still there. Since this is almost a miracle when it happens to me, I decided that I had to give Profumo a second chance.

I'm so glad I did! Once it settles into my skin it's such a soft, classy, warm and feminine scent. It reminds me of 50's glamour and an age when women wore dresses and heels daily. I can definitely see myself investing in a large bottle of this in the near future.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Profumo 2008 Acqua di Parma
review_content:
A truly wonderful scent, the price is justified and money is well spent when you get so much in return. Better just one bottle of magnificence than a thousand bottles of mediocrity. This is what I said to myself to stop my credit card guilty feelings.
The scent is wonderful as I said, it comes from an age when scents were made with passion, dedication and art. Wearing it today is a hommage to good taste and the hope it has not completely gone lost.
In certain moments it reminds of Mitsouko, maybe only for being a chypre but I would also add also for being a masterpiece that stands the passing of time without wrinkles on skin. Buy it if you like lovely scents that lasts a lot, if you like wearing something special, if you despise those modern scents which smell all the same.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Profumo 2008 Acqua di Parma
review_content:
To me the amber is the dominant note here.
Unfortunately not all amber based fragrances smell good on me!
I agree that it's from the same family as mitsouko etc.
Classy old school you can say.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Profumo 2008 Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I tested this yesterday, but I'm not sure if it was the new Profumo or the old one. Probably the new one.
I really like it! It's a complex, sophisticated, extremely rich refined scent! It may suit old fashioned tastes or a need for a deluxe night out!
It's warm, multi-layered fragrance with many nuances and a strong woody full body drydown. Very classy and suitable for a grand dame or a grand dame at heart!
Well, nothing forbid to wear it everyday, but the price is just crazy for my budget!
For sure you get lot of kickback for your money. It is long lasting, with good sillage and always changing on skin as old perfumes used to be.
The florals are mingled together and the drydown is rich in oakmoss. Absolutely a beautiful complex chypre that many would tell suitable for mature elegant ladies not under 35. Anyway the choice is left to personal tastes.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Profumo 2008 Acqua di Parma
review_content: What a lovely fragrance. Kinda old fashioned with its floral, slightly powdery notes but absolutely very feminine and classy. I don't smell too much bergamot or anything sharp and didn't find the drydown too woody. But that could just be how the scent works with my body chemistry. Really worth trying. Too bad it's so outrageously expensive.

product_name: Colonia C.L.U.B. Acqua di Parma
review_content: Very nice got it 50 percent off would not pay full price but very elegant for warm weather nice dressed occasions. For example I used it for prom but i absolutely love it and do recommend if your willing to spend the price.

product_name: Colonia C.L.U.B. Acqua di Parma
review_content: Selling my bottle of this, DM me if interested!!

product_name: Colonia C.L.U.B. Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I like this fragrance. It reminds me of Acqua di Gio EDT. Unfortunately, the performance on this is god awful. It projected for a good 3 minutes, and then became a skin scent. On my skin, it lasted about 2-3 hours total.

This is fresh, bright, and green, just like Nautica Voyage. I prefer Nautica Voyage to this, as it is way cheaper and way more worth it. This is extremely overpriced.

Overall rating: 4.5/10. While I may like the scent, it's just not worth what you're paying for at all. I have the same opinion on ADG EDT and many of its flankers. Get Nautica Voyage if you want a fragrance that has a similar vibe to this, is cheaper, and preforms better. Nautica Voyage is more fresh though.

product_name: Colonia C.L.U.B. Acqua di Parma
review_content: My favourite house for summer. Lovely citrus and fresh herbs. If you use the body lotion before spraying it lasts 8-10 hours. Sprayed this morning at 7 am. Now 10.35 and my mrs says I can still smell that on you, the room is full of it. Many thing ADP is weak, you just need to add the lotion after you shower. I have most of their range as I’m mad about it and natural ingredients. Use it well and this may be your thing. Masculine and woody. Great EDC.

product_name: Colonia C.L.U.B. Acqua di Parma
review_content: Spray on top of Dylan Blue and you have Blue de Chanel EDP

product_name: Colonia C.L.U.B. Acqua di Parma
review_content: Simply water with pepper, with a mist of greenery.

product_name: Colonia C.L.U.B. Acqua di Parma
review_content: Fresh, opens very beatifully. Its an oldschool type aftershave, shower gel scent in a good way. May be nostalgic to some, very manly. Me and my girlfriend love it and prefer it over colonia, or colonia essenza. Longevity was also way better than I expected.

product_name: Colonia C.L.U.B. Acqua di Parma
review_content: Fresh and citric, perfecto for summer and spring.

product_name: Colonia C.L.U.B. Acqua di Parma
review_content: The shiso is all I get and overpowers it. Stick with OG Colonia.

product_name: Colonia C.L.U.B. Acqua di Parma
review_content: Skin scent in 30 minutes. People claiming hours of projection are lying thru their ass.

product_name: Colonia C.L.U.B. Acqua di Parma
review_content: Smells like a male sports team locker room: big nostril-piercing deodorant funk. Some of the notes listed (e.g. lemon, rosemary) are among my favourite smells from nature but are not discernible here except in the screechiest synthetic form. An aggressive cedar bomb for the most part. Longevity is extremely impressive for a ‘cologne’ and it is still prominent the day after application.

product_name: Colonia C.L.U.B. Acqua di Parma
review_content: Very good smelling fresh green scent. The scent makes me feel ....a I'm happy and outdoors with my family kind of feeling. It works excellent for the spring or summer time. Projects for the 1st hour then nice scent bubble for a few hours. Its a scent people will notice and like. Lasts maybe 4 - 5 hours on my skin and till next day on clothing. I'm wondering where the bottles that last a few minutes were bought. Fot reference..I bought mine at Bloomingdale's.

product_name: Colonia C.L.U.B. Acqua di Parma
review_content: It’s an EDC so it should be known that this is a skin scent cologne. Smells exactly like a barber shop. Good for people who need something that is not strong but noticeable up close. Lasts for maybe 2 hours if you spray twice on each spot.

product_name: Colonia C.L.U.B. Acqua di Parma
review_content: Smell absolutely disappears after half an hour.

product_name: Colonia C.L.U.B. Acqua di Parma
review_content: Old Spice

product_name: Colonia C.L.U.B. Acqua di Parma
review_content: Any guy on here hating on this fragrance should get his testosterone checked.

product_name: Colonia C.L.U.B. Acqua di Parma
review_content: A very boring cologne, it opens very energizing, but the rosemary note that makes it interesting goes away after 3-5 minutes. Then it dries down to something that reminds me heavily of Armani Mania by Francis Kurkdijan, a fragrance that I had but I never really liked it at all because of it’s boringness. Some resemblance gets me to Kologne, Shield of Protection by Kilian at the opening, that is really a very nice cologne, and it lasts double the time of this, quality is also on a whole other level. This is usable, fresh, but I would pay $60 at much for this kind of scent and quality, feels a lot synthetic and it goes away after 3-4 hours. I would only recommend this to someone who loved Armani Mania. 5/10

product_name: Colonia C.L.U.B. Acqua di Parma
review_content: i tried some Acqua di Parma, but i think i don't like it's dna. It's not the details, it's the basis i have problems with.

product_name: Colonia C.L.U.B. Acqua di Parma
review_content: Very similar to Habit Rouge L'Instinct, very blue. A bit boring.

product_name: Colonia C.L.U.B. Acqua di Parma
review_content: I absolutely love this. Can't wait to wear it on beach walks! Super masculine, fresh, non-offensive. Amazing!

product_name: Colonia C.L.U.B. Acqua di Parma
review_content: What a disappointment. Bought this thinking it was the amazing fresh club scent with lavender, but no... more like ambroxan cologne, and now I'm stuck with a big bottle of randomness. Should have paid more attention. I find this scent quite heavy actually for a cologne, miss the freshness fougeres of club. Not my cup of tea, and I usually love adp scents, fan of Colonia essenza, even some more intense scents like Oud etc.

product_name: Colonia C.L.U.B. Acqua di Parma
review_content:
this is a classic fresh cologne for men. greatly balanced, not too heavy not overly fresh as in boringly fresh. you can definitely feel the spices and that’s were the magic is! attractiveness scale is high.
amazing gift.

product_name: Colonia C.L.U.B. Acqua di Parma
review_content: This is my idea of a modern gentleman’s scent. Citrus and woods, no old school chypre screechiness here. This is in the same vein as Chanel Allure Homme, Montblanc Explorer Platinum, Dior Homme ‘20, etc. Just beautifully balanced citrus and woods, great for office setting or every day wear.

product_name: Colonia C.L.U.B. Acqua di Parma
review_content: Got a sample, Smells like allure homme sport to my nose, Redundant for me, smells great but cant justify buying a full bottle. If youre looking for a safe blind buy and an all round everyday cologne look no further.

product_name: Colonia C.L.U.B. Acqua di Parma
review_content: Mint, white sugar, squeezed lemon and nettles in a pestle and mortar. A breezy summer EDC that projects for a paltry one hour before quietening to sherbet on your skin.

product_name: Colonia C.L.U.B. Acqua di Parma
review_content:
In this time where most male scents are overly feminine due to the influence of sweet bases (damn you 540, this is your fault), comes this. It’s a generic male scent, in the vein of Armani Code, but achieved using quality ingredients. This makes the experience so much more high end. I have over 100 scents (95% niche), but did not have a generic male scent due to them being overly synthetic. This is a beautiful addition to my collection.

Don’t pay retail tho, it’s longevity isn’t tremendous, due to it being a cologne. But if you pay a small price, just reapply several times (honestly I do this with every single scent anyway).

product_name: Colonia C.L.U.B. Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Absolutely Love this. Absolute classic fresh musky masculine cologne. Quality and longevity far exceed the price. If you’re a a guy in your 30’s pr older you will be hit with nostalgia! Younger people you can call it vintage and love it aswell.

First botes you get are citrus and aromatic. Then it dries down into a lovely fresh subtle musk. The pink pepper, citrus and musk base note are the most prominent notes.

I wanted something subtle, classic with that Italian sartorial feel and it’s exactly that. The added bonus is my girlfriend cannot leave me alone when i wear it! It is definitely subtle until you get close to the skin where it sits for a good 12 hours.

One thing that might put spme people off is that the opening notes only last around 2-4 hours so if you want a strong far projecting fragrance this won’t be for you. Perfect for if you work in close proximity to other people like me and need something a little more subtle though!

Peace and love people 🫶

product_name: Colonia C.L.U.B. Acqua di Parma
review_content: My first from this house and have to say it’s pretty solid I knew when I bought it it wasn’t gonna wow me but it’s definitely a good scent it’s easy and versatile smells very much like bleu de Chanel edp except in the dry down it’s less of a harsh sharp citrus and much more calm and smooth id recommend if u have the money for it overall probably like a 7.5/10

product_name: Colonia C.L.U.B. Acqua di Parma
review_content: This is Acqua di Parma, trying to be mainstream and target younger audiences. On scent alone it works for that reason. But if you’re looking for something classic or old fashioned look elsewhere. This is as boring and banal as AdP can get. It fits right in with the typical mall lineup at the local department store.

product_name: Colonia C.L.U.B. Acqua di Parma
review_content:
This is a decent fragrance but simple.

Nothing wrong with simple but this is THE idea of just fresh male fragrance which i can appreciate.
