The combination has a certain balmy, sweet spiciness like anise/licorice as previous reviewers noted, which brings an unusual depth to the otherwise conventional cedar note in fresh perfumes.

Unfortunately, this interesting phase doesn't hold more than 1 hour. Afterwards, Cedro di Taormina is reduced into a typical aromatic lavender-tonka men's cologne over a woody peppery and clean musky base.

The sillage is mostly close to skin, and the longevity is at least 6 hours. Cedro di Taormina is mostly consistent with the overall aesthetics of the Blu Mediterraneo line, being a fresh, cologne-style woody fragrance. I quite like the interplay of anise and cedar during the middle phase, but the ubiquitous lavender-tonka peppery woody dry down is unremarkable on my skin. If you would like a conventional citrus woody fragrance with a subtle anise twist, Cedro di Taormina might fit the bill. Otherwise, I would not particularly recommend it based on my personal experience with this fragrance.

product_name: Cedro di Taormina Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Wow, they got this one right!
I never say hardly, a fragrance transports me, but this one does, something green, woodsy, maybe some hay, laying around in a citron grove in Italy in the Summertime.

Lemon is common and borring, but here it is so nice and natural, very lemony, but more aromatic, it is a fine citron note to open.

This reminds me of Creed Spice and Wood; Both have a fruit and pepper accord that blends with cedar.

I just like this a lot. I have 4 from the Mediteranian line, yes this is the best.
From the notes it may seem ordinary, but this is an extraordinary Summer fragrance. It is beautifully blended, unique green, fresh, with just the right amount of pepper.

I loved the citron, basil, lavender opening, but after 10 minutes that nice sweet lemony top note disipates, and a stronger pepper and basil accord, that smell a bit like anise or liqourice is left in the mid. I smelled that kind of spiciness befor, and I know some will like it, but I think it's going to be a pass for me.

Rating: 7.5/10

God bless. John 3:16

product_name: Cedro di Taormina Acqua di Parma
review_content:
The best from this line IMHO.

10/10

product_name: Cedro di Taormina Acqua di Parma
review_content:
A new great perfume in this marvellous line.
This perfume reminds me in the long run a bit of Annick Goutal Mandragora.
The perfume opens with a very prominent citric-spicy note.
In about a hour it turns in the basil spicy note and the cedar. These two with the Lavender give the note that reminds me of Mandragora of Annick Goutal. These notes together give that anise-like scent, very refreshing and with the lavender a bit soapy.
In the lavender note you smell the original, colonia.
Its is a refreshing very characteristic perfume that fits very well in humid warm days.
Again a great perfume in this line.

product_name: Cedro di Taormina Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Fresh, manly and very mediterranean. Great summer scent. I recently bought it while on vacation in southern Spain and I somehow think my Spanish experience was enhanced cause of this perfume :)
Not great longevity but still a good 2 hours projection and then a skin scent for another 4-5 hours.
Very enjoyable.

product_name: Cedro di Taormina Acqua di Parma
review_content: Smelled this while in Taormina. Smelled exactly like Taormina. The combination of woods and citrus was very pleasant; the woody scent kept the citrus from shouting too loud. Would recommend!

product_name: Cedro di Taormina Acqua di Parma
review_content: Wore this today on a hot dry day to the hills for a hike, and then to the beach for a swim. I smelled the petti grain and lavender most strongly at first. After about an hour I mostly smelled the lavender and a bit of dry cedar. The lavender smelled soapy and clean. After about 7 hours I smelled a gentle mix of cedar and labdenum, almost vanilla-like. The dry down was definitely my favorite part. I liked this one..definitely fresh and smelled real....not synthetic at all, which I greatly appreciated. I will continue using my sample until it wears out...and consider buying a full bottle. This is a fresh and inoffensive, light fragrance for summer. I wonder how it will smell in the dead of winter....I suspect it might bring back memories of summertime, which would make it a worthwhile purchase. It smells more masculine than feminine to me, which is neither good nor bad....just an observation...although I think both genders can get away with wearing it...embellishing it...with their own personal style and flair.

product_name: Cedro di Taormina Acqua di Parma
Cedro di Taormina Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Smelled this yesterday for the first time and was very impressed. I've been searching for a new fragrance, something for the summer, something that will WOW me... This one did it for me.

I had sprayed it on a paper strip which I brought home and couldn't stop smelling it. I left it on the table next to me as I was working on my laptop and kept getting wiffs and it smelled amazing! I moved to the next room and brought the paper strip with me. I then retuned to the room I was initially in and I was still smelling it. Whoa, this stuff is strong...or am I smelling something else altogether?? I was a bit confused. Then I went to the table and sniffed the area where the paper strip was resting before and it was this!!!!! WTF! That was the reason I didn't buy it on the spot, because it is EDT! After that all I kept thinking was buying a full bottle. So today I went and bought it and I'm enjoying it very much.

I also get a resemblance to bleu de Chanel but as it dries down it goes down a different path that oddly reminds me of my girlfriend's Princess Oud by Creed, minus the oud and ambergris. By the way, I love PO by Creed on my gf and this one reminds me of that scent but a masculine and lighter version. I love it.

Great silage and very good longevity. This is a very refreshing and pleasant spring/summer scent.
9/10 for what it is.

Update 7/10/2016: I returned this today. I love the smell a lot but, compared to that little paper strip, on my skin this lasts 2 hours! Very bummed about it... If I got around 4-5 hours (even though that's considered pretty weak) I would have kept it, that's how much I love the smell. Oh well, on to the next one.

product_name: Cedro di Taormina Acqua di Parma
review_content: A new Fragrance by Acqua di Parma is a good reason to be excited – and this release under the Blu Mediterraneo line was refreshing, going back to the roots of the Italian House. Acqua di Parma followed Colonia Club, which is good but this new Blu Mediterraneo blows it out of the water in my opinion. It is no mystery if you have been around Acqua di Parma; the Fragrances are very well blended. This comes off very lemony and right away gives way to the other notes like petit grain, black pepper, and basil. While the middle notes are starting to project, slightly powdery and flower smell from the rockrose (labdanum) and lavender arise. While the vetiver, cedar, and guaiac wood ties it all in. A favorite from the line, it feels more complex in a sense than the others and found it to be the longest lasting one so far. The description "Cedro di Taormina is the scent of fire, earth and wind!" is the best way to describe this eau de toilette.

product_name: Cedro di Taormina Acqua di Parma
review_content: Great scent to own. Smells very natural and not synthetic like most aquatics in its class. Has great projection and longevity on my skin. Automatic compliment scent. 9/10

product_name: Cedro di Taormina Acqua di Parma
review_content:
At first, it's pure lemon juice meeting skin - very true to the natural fragrance of freshly squeezed lemon. That first zesty experience then makes way for the heart of the fragrance relatively quickly.

For the most part of wearing this fragrance, the citrus note experience is closer to that of an orange or mandarin - still fresh but sweeter than the opening. The lavender is a silent but perceptible complement to the citrus notes. It is the only scent close to herbal that I can detect - on my skin the basil is not perceptible.

In the background, I do however enjoy the bed of vetiver and warm wood that the citrus fruits and lavender are resting on.
Overall, a highly pleasant fragrance. The whole experience lasts about 2 hours on me. As this is a light scent, no problem to simply re-apply and start it over again - I don't think this juice will be overpowering. Very nice and truly Italian summer fragrance!

product_name: Cedro di Taormina Acqua di Parma
review_content: First impression.... This fragrance smells like a woodier version of Eau de New York by Bond No. 9. So far, I really like it and the price is decent. This fragrance deserves further consideration.

product_name: Cedro di Taormina Acqua di Parma
review_content:
nice Cologne style, as good as Cologne by Etat Libre d'Orange with a softer and woodier+labdanum base who gives to the petitgrain a marshmallow (guimauve) effect.
Lovely

product_name: Cedro di Taormina Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Fresh and woody citrus with fresh spicy middle, very enjoyable, I really loved it from the moment the SA squirted it... unlike the other popular ADP's, this is more youthful and slightly bolder. I have 2 other ADP's, they are refined and tame in comparison. I don't get the lavender, although I always expect Lavender to stand out, this is a really lovely perfume.
Sillage = 6/10 -It's present but not loud.
Longevity 7.5/10
Scent 8/10
and 8/10 for price because it was 45% less than the other 2 ADP that I bought!
Overall this is confidently a 8/10 Summer day off!

product_name: Cedro di Taormina Acqua di Parma
review_content: can't wait to try this out :)

product_name: Cedro di Taormina Acqua di Parma
review_content: La foto y los ingredientes todo estan

product_name: Colonia Ebano Acqua di Parma
review_content: This is a seriously sophisticated scent. The woodiness is prominent but balanced nicely by the honey and spices. It's warm and inviting without being overly sweet. Perfect for evening wear or special occasions.

product_name: Colonia Ebano Acqua di Parma
review_content: Ebano is a great fragrance, in fact, my favorite of the entire house. I just realized that despite owning this fragrance for 2 years and buying a backup bottle last year, I have never written a review. This is my go-to scent for Fall and Winter months. This is aromatic with a dark, beautiful ebony wood. It has a slight touch of resins. This is an executive fragrance for days when you want to feel like a boss. Ebano is for someone in a position of authority. However, it is not an austere cologne. The touch of honey gives this creation a warmth and approachability factor. This is a great dad scent. Too bad it’s discontinued and did not get it’s own EDP line. I get about 4-5hrs of longevity and decent projection for the first hour and a half than it sits closer to the skin.

product_name: Colonia Ebano Acqua di Parma
review_content: Typical mens woody, peppery fragrance. Old school vibe

product_name: Colonia Ebano Acqua di Parma
review_content: Classical pepper scent. When you smell it, you will immediately say “what does this smell like?” ; its unoriginal, yet wearable. For me, evokes similarities to a blend of Terre d Hermes and the powerhouse pepper/vetiver fragrances of the early 90s such as Gucci Nobile. Yes, Nobile is perhaps what this reminds me of.

product_name: Colonia Ebano Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Less similar to TF Anthracite than i would have liked, I’d say it feels more like a mixture of Bottega Veneta homme Parfum with Tauer LADDM. It has a spicy warmth with the pepper and resins that feels like the BV, but the dry petitgrain, bergamot and Vetiver reminds of the dryness of the Tauer. The Bottega is much warmer and comforting compared to the spicy dryness of this one, but depends on what you’re looking for.

I would say daily scent, but its fairly aggressive for the office unless you are as well. The chili is fairly prominent as in Mugler Taste of Fragrance, and Guerlain L’homme ideal l’intense so you may have to be a spicy character as well to rock this. Definitely pleasantly unusual

product_name: Colonia Ebano Acqua di Parma
review_content: What a lovely fragrance. Masculine and elegant. Not a fragrance to wear to turn heads but something that will make you smell sophisticated and confident. I need to get myself another bottle asap before the prices become painful.

product_name: Colonia Ebano Acqua di Parma
review_content:
What a beautiful cologne! It’s classy, sophisticated and manly, but not overly so.

To me it smells timeless and I find it to be wearable for any occasion and season, although I suspect it shines the most during summer.

I get a solid 3-4 hour performance with a decent sillage as well, which is all we can ask for with this concentration.

The warm honey note is very nice and not too strong.

Scent 7/10
Longevity 7/10
Sillage 7/10

product_name: Colonia Ebano Acqua di Parma
review_content: You still can get this here in Europe for a cheap price. Ireally love this. Love the honey and the ebony wood.

product_name: Colonia Ebano Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I get the pepper and ebony. Slightly spicy and resinous woods. Can't say I love it, it's nothing I crave. It's nice enough for colder days. Not sweet or cloying at least.

Scent: 6.5 / Sillage: 7.5 / Longevity: 7.5

EDIT: My old notes at the beginning of my frag journey...I guess I warmed up to it over time..
1st wear: Smoky, whiskey, woody, leather. 7/10
2nd wear: Creamy and sweet? Liking it more 2nd time around. 8? 8-9?
3rd wear: Warm and creamy. 9.

product_name: Colonia Ebano Acqua di Parma
review_content: This is great. The honey note gives a similarity to the honey in Kilian Back to Black. This dries down very barbershop, Vetiver, masculine. Great stuff shame its discontinued.

product_name: Colonia Ebano Acqua di Parma
review_content: This fragrance is a nice cologne. And sometimes a ‘good’ or ‘nice’ Cologne is a perfectly exceptionally appropriate fragrance to wear. We don’t always need to be traversing the seven opulent myrrh Oud amber heavens on Aladdin’s oriental carpet or blazing with sweet gourmands, citrus or sea salt. This smells refined expensive traditional warm captivating very masculine and authoritative. And here’s what it smells like - upon entering an antiquarian book store steeped in the scent of its own creaking oak beams you make a beeline for the leather bound books published in the 1700s. Scrolling through the darkened stiff dusty pages you happen across thick and spiced honey bizarrely oozing from the bind and you take a hard sniff. There is also a feeling of slightly charred or very antique wood but overall it’s surprisingly warm and cozy. It is as if the perfumer took Tom Ford’s Noir Anthracite, diluted it for more acceptable daily wear and mixed in a hearty warmth from honey. This is what I would imagine the inner cloisters and corridors of the British houses of Parliament might smell like… and many of the ministers within probably smell like this too. It also reminds me of the scent emanating from a freshly opened tin of honeyed pipe tobacco . Where the youthful ambitious (but unseasoned and mildly insecure) might buy TF Tobacco Vanille, their fathers go for Ebano - because they know they’ve already got it / made it and know who they are. It’s a different composition, a generation above TF TV, but in the same family. Longevity and projection are modest but then this isn’t meant to be a garish spectacle but rather a quietly confident statement. At drydown it does resemble somewhat of a traditional barbershop scent, a very civilised and pleasant terminus for this olfactory journey.

product_name: Colonia Ebano Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Maybe a barber shop fragrance but with woods and spices
Incredible fragrance that change constantly from the opening to the dry down
Longevity is moderate t
It’s special in its own way same as most Aqua di parma fragrances

product_name: Colonia Ebano Acqua di Parma
review_content:
A weird clash of notes. There is a pleasant Ebony wood note at the centre but it is tainted with a sickly honey accord and a weird sharp citrus. It’s quite characteristic of Italian colognes but there is little likability.
It’s also very flat and there is little depth to the scent. I expected an opulent, assertive masculine woody fragrance but all this reeks of is inauthenticity. A big disappointment.
I would advise gentlemen to avoid this purchase as it doesn’t leave a clean impression. It’s like a dusty old house. This would have been far better if they played up the Ebony with olibanum, oakmoss, galbanum i.e. dry and cold notes instead of this weird pairing of a warm gourmand with woods.

product_name: Colonia Ebano Acqua di Parma
review_content: Smells like it wants to be capsicum and chocolate at the same time, yuck.

product_name: Colonia Ebano Acqua di Parma
review_content: Way too strong for a guy in their 30's. It's the kinda smell you would get when opening up a time capsule from 1981. Way too strong... I was gifted it by my mother in law. Tried it a few times and then gave it away. I'll pass

product_name: Colonia Ebano Acqua di Parma
review_content: Took me a while to appreciate this one but now i can't get enough of it. Beautiful ebony and sweet patchouli scent. 8/10

product_name: Colonia Ebano Acqua di Parma
review_content: I said I was going to buy a bottle of anything that came close to smelling like my beloved Calvin by Calvin Klein... Wow, this is the closest I’ve smelled of anything put out in the last 20 years. Very reminiscent of that decade. The notes don’t match, but the overall scent is very close... but can’t bring myself to purchase it. Been there done that. Time to move on.

product_name: Colonia Ebano Acqua di Parma
review_content: For men only. Strong and piercing. Nothing unisex on this one. If you looking for a very woody, slight resinous and honey scent this is it. A sophisticated deep woody scent for wearing for outside casual events. An old school scent from the 1980s released for men, that just want a scent from the way back when to wear in modern times. Nothing modern on this one. Mature women and men will appreciate this one. This stuff really resemble Polo Green.

product_name: Colonia Ebano Acqua di Parma
review_content:
8/10- For those tired of cedar and sandalwood.

Ebano is a nutty smelling woods, this shines in an autumn morning. I get vibes of Bowmaker in terms of scent type. I love the heart of this fragrance, it doesn't project much but stays on for longer than you expect. Very classy leathery woods, modern and masculine.

Projection dies at 30 min from my first spray but the scent stays on skin for 6+ hours. I like all aspects of this fragrance. A solid cologne.

product_name: Colonia Ebano Acqua di Parma
review_content: A quick update - so, I have two bottles of this, a big 180ml and a small 100ml version that came in a coffret set. Not that it matters very much, this is effectively a discontinued fragrance so supplies are finite, but performance is very batch dependent. The 100ml stuff has beast performance, the 180ml stuff is mediocre. Well, I say mediocre, it seems to have gone at around the 4 hour mark, however, once I step into the shower the next morning...pop! There it is again, heavy and strong. Perhaps it can be refreshed with a splash of water, a trick many have used over the decades to reinvigorate a fading scent during an evening out. Anyway, all academic as supplies will soon dry up and the fragrance will be consigned to the history books.

product_name: Colonia Ebano Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Too masculine, dark ebony tree (that is more of A cedar character in the opening), dry patchouli that is sweet at the same time due to honey.
Longevity 4/5 hours.
I don’t see it interesting enough to buy a full bottle. Try before you buy.

product_name: Colonia Ebano Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Scent: 7/10

Quality: 8/10

Originality: 6/10

Sillage: 7/10

Projection: 6/10

Longevity: 7/10

Price VS Size: 6/10

product_name: Colonia Ebano Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I'm tempted to say that this is probably one of the best official encounter perfumes there is. What I mean by official encounter is any meeting of importance outside of family/friends ties. Beautiful, powerful, warm scent totally outside of sweet floral and fruity notes. It is a warm woody perfume that keeps the timber smell all the way through. Cut a fresh branch of an evergreen tree, put it to your nose, and there you are with a dark, bitter, resinous scent that goes on and on. The bitterness is augmented with vetiver, pepper and patchouli. Honey makes is at more sweet wearable bitter scent, but is is not a base note, so to the end you really just smell more or less bitterness and dirt of the patchouli. First hours though are just mellow bitterness with a soapy quality to it. It has also a very Xmassy vibe to it as you basically smell as a fir for about six to seven hours. You will blend beautifully in with the misteltoe and fresh-cut branches of spruce.
The perfume has a solid versatility, but obviously also limits. It is not for teens, it is not fresh, its is not a summer party scent, it is not a date scent if you are young. This perfume gives you more sense of grit, stating you mean business and in a civilized manner, so it is not for a rebel. I read here that it resembles perfumes of the late 70's and 80's. There is definitely a factor to it, and as it was an era when the perfume should counter stench of cigarettes and alcohol, the power was indeed in demand. Today, the power of the perfume stays, but it is perceived many times as an overkill, because when you don't stink, there is nothing to beat. I would not consider Ebano as a particularly heavy scent, but more of a wanna-be reminder of those times. Combination of quality, elegance and power you'll get here, will give you a silent boost and a sense of well-being impossible to monetize. This makes it easily one of my latest favorites.

product_name: Colonia Ebano Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Tried this because of the ebony as i've never tried it. My impression of the ebony note after a few wearings is interesting. It's just darker wood as advertised. Not sure it's because of the other notes supporting it, but what i smell is a mix of cedar and something that reminds me of gunpowder/coal/blacksmith? Not sure if that is how ebony smells, but i like it.

As for the overall impression of the fragrance.
The top notes dissappears almost immediately, the honey and ebony takes over. Those also gets toned down alot within 15 minutes and gone within 30 minutes. All im left with is patchouli and vetiver in their known AdP old school style.

Can't say im surprised about the poor longevity, as no Acqua di parma last on my skin. So if you have good longevity on your skin, this will probably last on you too. But my skin just ate up the top and middle notes within 30 minutes so i can't really convince myself to invest that kind of money for poor longevity.

product_name: Colonia Ebano Acqua di Parma
review_content:
This is a bit underrated, in my opinion, because other scents in this line are such big hitters, namely Oud and Leather. Indeed, with the arrival of Sandalo you basically ended up with a trio that are going to cater to the majority of customers looking at the Ingredient Collection. As such, Ebano is woefully overlooked, which is a shame because it is such a well-done perfume. Woody, resinous, a hint of incense, I really think it has a close affinity to Gucci’s original Pour Homme. There is also the just perceptible spicy warmness, fig leaf pluminess of Tom Ford Tom Ford for Men Extreme. Longevity and projection are excellent in my experience and the fragrance is surprisingly versatile. I have also layered this with the aforementioned TFTFME and the result was stupendous, they complement and contrast with each other so perfectly. Real surprise for me and leaps straight into my top 3........
EDIT: Top 3 of AdP

product_name: Colonia Ebano Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Colonia Ebano is very smooth fragrance with lots of honey-sweet resins and vétiver kept on the fresh side of heavy by a relève of bell pepper. Good for cooler/cold days.

Longevity is excellent on my skin: the next morning the smooth pepper and patchouli remain very present.

I love it; my girlfriend hates it.

product_name: Colonia Ebano Acqua di Parma
review_content: Very sophisticated scent for formal occasions. I tend to use it in my professional meetings all year round. I've to be honest, I did not like at the beginning. I had a sample and could not find it that special but then at some point this year I decided to buy a full bottle and I became addicted. It screams elegance without being offensive.

product_name: Colonia Ebano Acqua di Parma
Colonia Ebano Acqua di Parma
review_content: A bit disappointed with this one. What i get mainly is sweet patchouli. Tried to like it but i guess why bother too much. 6/10

product_name: Colonia Ebano Acqua di Parma
review_content: I really wanted to love this fragrance, I was extremely excited at the prospect of another AdP Colonia and one based on Ebony wood sounded delightful, unfortunately Ebano misses the mark. It starts very well, the opening is really superb, the red pepper note hits upfront, both fresh and spicy and then the unmistakable ebony note is among the best I’ve smelled, owing to the fact that it is the true focus but with touches of vetiver and other cleaner woods. Totally masculine, on the darker side with a dusty, dry feel and a hint of patch earth too. The thing which lets this perfume down is the drydown, it dries down, to creamy woods quickly and Is just a bit flat. Ebano is something which could’ve been so good and even glimpses greatness briefly but I’ve come across this before with this kind of woody scent. The drydown is passable but very boring and like something bog standard from the designer realm, I feel a bit bad giving it a hard time because it’s okay but could’ve been so much better. I’m not too bothered about the performance but it is a low lying hum as can be expected from an ebony/woods fragrance with little silage but still unusual for this line as they are usually strong. In conclusion then, I loved the opening and thought I may have hit on a holy grail of old skool, peppery, masculinity but that excitement was too short lived. I’d recommend anyone to try it but Ebano didn’t meet my high expectations.

product_name: Colonia Ebano Acqua di Parma
review_content: Very good fragrance. Strong opening. Amber honey red pepper really are noticeable. A very solid fragrance, with very rich woody notes. I guess its best for night and winter. Also very oriental and unique. Scent is very rich and masculine. Performance and zillage both moderate. Radiates well on rhe skin but not offensive. I ll give it 8/10

product_name: Colonia Ebano Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Yes a really old school perfume. I agree totally. And no its not typical Italian. It reminds me of an old English gentlemen's society club with well dressed men:).
It opens with the fresh-bitter aromatic note citric with petitgrain.
Then the honey sweet aroma comes through.
The vetiver is there as a basic note that stays until the end.
Then the perfume ends in the woody-warm spicy old school scent. It reminds me a bit of old spice.
Its a good perfume when y like this old school combination.
When to wear? Definitely more wintertime and more for when y like a more classic way of life. Like I said its a typical old fashioned society perfume more English than the Italian vibrant and stylish perfumes this house offers. This perfume is a bit moderate compared to other ones of this house.
In the same year AdP released two very different perfumes in 2017 that are totally the opposite of each other: This one and the Mirra version.
I can tell because i tried them on my wrists:).
I prefer the Colonia Mirra more. But they are both very well balanced with style and class.

product_name: Colonia Ebano Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Old school woody scent which reminds me a lot of Je suis un Homme from Etat Libre. They might not have the same notes but they are at the same level with regards to their smell. This one is less dry compared to Je suis un Homme and has a dirty aroma which Je suis un Homme doesn't have. Overall, it is an OK scent for people above the age of 30 years. However, considering the price it is not worth all the money.

Scent: 7.5/10
Longevity: 8/10
Projection: 8/10

product_name: Colonia Ebano Acqua di Parma
review_content: "Smells old school, but new. Smells so seductive." Said a female co-worker of mine. You'll know exactly what she means when you smell it. This is right up my alley, bought it immediately after I tested it. For grown men. Its really woody yet fresh and sweet. BTW less is more.

product_name: Colonia Ebano Acqua di Parma
review_content: A very enjoyable, elegant woody cologne. Woods are pleasant, not sharp, but dusty dull, quite smooth.

product_name: Colonia Ebano Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Agree with @bart4543 - relaxed version of TdH
I have AdP Leather in my personal Top5 but all latest releases - Colonia Club / Quercia / Mirra / Ebano - total disappointment imho :/

product_name: Colonia Ebano Acqua di Parma
review_content: Just tried this one. it smells very similar to terre hermes once it dries down.

product_name: Vaniglia Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content: Love this. The opening is quite woody; the vanilla notes begin surfacing little by little after a few minutes. It's not pure vanilla, of course; there's something slightly floral about this. Anyway, this is a very intimate, cozy, gourmand scent; it just irradiates comfort for me. Like an artesanal vanilla muffin that just came out of the oven. Projection is nothing to write home about; it works inside your personal space for the most part. Longevity is a good 7-8 hours. It's a unisex fragrance for me, maybe leaning a bit more toward the feminine side. Great for the colder days or nights that you want to spend cuddling with your partner.

product_name: Vaniglia Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Vaniglia could easily be renamed "Vaniglia & Friends", don't go in expecting a pure vanilla scent and you won't be disappointed.

This smells like a delicious, moderately dense sunny vanilla cloud. ☀️☁️ There's a lot more than just vanilla contributing here, but the overall scent smells oh-so good. There's a mildly soapy quality to this which gives it kind of a "balmy" vibe, as if you were using a luxurious hand cream. I'm willing to overlook this as the smell is so good. Vaniglia is blended to perfection and makes its presence known in a classy way, if there's one thing Acqua Di Parma excels at it's giving fragrances that calm, assertive presence instead of being desperate and trying to fill the room. This is my ideal volume for a fragrance.

Vaniglia is a fragrance that delivers and offers no surprises, honestly a 20-30ml bottle of this would be more than enough, 100ml, let alone 180ml of this would bathe you in it for the rest of your life. And while it smells good, it's not a very practical fragrance to wear. Discontinued or not, I don't think I'd shell out the big euros for a bottle. All that said, Vaniglia is definitely worth sampling. ☀️

product_name: Vaniglia Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content:
High quality vanilla with sunny citruses, ADP style.
Smells unisex to my nose.
Longevity is good on my skin.

product_name: Vaniglia Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content:
An unprecedented fascinating interpretation of precious Madagascar Vanilla.
The essence of vanilla acquires new depths, combining with notes of bergamot, mandarin, neroli and jasmine for a luminous and enveloping composition.
Vaniglia is an oriental vanilla, woody, citrus, floral, powdery perfume.

The scent opens sharp citrus and quickly heads towards a stunning vanilla with a slightly woody floral touch. In the end it becomes a predominantly vanilla/musky fragrance and sweet in measure. One of the best vanilla in the collection and with the best performance of the House of Representatives I've ever met with the usual quality; for those who like vanilla perfume: MANDATORY!

product_name: Vaniglia Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content:
This. This is a surprise. The heliotrope is soooooo
Good. It’s very forward in the opening.
Then the neroli.THEN the jasmine and vanilla. The dry down adds some mandarin, but not too much this is not incredibly citrusy like most ADP fragrances.
I’m still getting the heliotrope throughout!
It doesn’t have great longevity but I overspray because I love it.
I spray it on my cashmere sweaters and scarves and it lasts forever!
I would love this on a man. I feel this is truly unisex.

product_name: Vaniglia Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content: reminds me a lot of vanillary by lush. I don't dislike it, but don't reaallly like it. it starts out smelling like cat pee on me, and then dries down and smells like an old ladies perfume. not my fav but could be worst.

product_name: Vaniglia Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content: Not something I would wear as a man, but would 100% gift this to my girlfriend. Such a beautiful soft vanilla smell, and the neroli makes it slightly soapy. Reminds me a lot of those scented sunscreen lotions girls sometimes wear. However, it goes for around 180 euros which is just difficult to justify. 'Oud' and 'Leather' are valued a lot better in my opinion. If I come across a good deal in the future I'm definitely buying it though!

product_name: Vaniglia Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content: This fragrance seems to have been discontinued :(

product_name: Vaniglia Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content:
This is a really great vanilla, that would do well in the warm weather. As the name would suggest, this is vanilla dominant, with noticeable neroli and heliotrope. The opening to me, comes across as a floral vanilla with slightly bitter neroli and citrus. As it develops the neroli-citrus combo becomes less bitter, and IMO gives it a warm-weather/summery feel. I actually get a fairly hefty dose of neroli in this fragrance. As it dries down the heliotrope becomes more noticeable, contributing to a powdery effect. I also get something slightly sweet, borderline gourmand...akin to powdered sugar.

While the name is indicative of the scent, I find the bottle a bit misleading. This is not a dark, heavy, woody vanilla. To me, it's a summery, floral, powdery, and slightly sugary vanilla. I really enjoy this a lot. As far as performance goes, this is great- it lasts ALL day. Is feminine IMO.

product_name: Vaniglia Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content: A very well done quality Vanilla fragrance, some light supporting florals and that Aqcua Di Parma twang. Unisex. Classy, well done and not overpowering.

product_name: Vaniglia Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content: it is quite feminine to my nose.

product_name: Vaniglia Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content: This perfume is like a mixture between AdP Essenza and vanilla beans. Neroli aspect is pretty obvious. Imagine a typical cologne with vanilla hint. It really is unisex. Smells very nice on me and also on my partner. However, on him it stays much much longer. It is definitely not a mainstream juice, but not too extravagant to pull it off.

product_name: Vaniglia Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content: Nice Vanilla scent. Powdery Vanilla. Floral Powdery Vanilla. It leans a bit feminine due to the florals, and a bit due to the soft powderiness combined with the florals, but there is easily enough unisex orientation to suit me. Evidently the heliotrope helps impart the vanillic accord and almond facet. Its light enough for seasonal versatility. This is good and I'd buy a full bottle at a good price. But my favorite two Vanilla scents remain Ted Lapidus Pour Lui and Tom Ford Tobacco Vanille.

product_name: Vaniglia Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content:
A different, not Common vanilla.
Vanilla is extracted from the pod of the plant of the same name, a climber that is part of the orchid family, making it the only one to produce an edible ingredient.
Here we have it in its sweetness and not cloying roundness, initially accompanied by a splendid heliotrope and citrus fruits, which I feel prevail as an accompanying note, to finally meet a splendid jasmine that surronds it, thus making it very pleasant even for those who, like me, is not particularly lover of this note.
An Aztec legend (who used it to flavor cocoa), narrates that vanilla was born from the blood of the goddess Princess Xanat, beheaded by her father who did not want to marry her off to a mortal.
Passion , femininity , decisiveness : characteristics that I fully find in this fragrance .
“Lady Agnew of Lochnaw” portrayed by John Singer.

product_name: Vaniglia Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I don't give a damn about the performance,
If its smell fantastic ill buy it, only problem is its waaaay toooo expensive.
Smells delicious, a very realistic Vanilla beans.
Love from first sniff 💙👌

product_name: Vaniglia Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content:
This perfume is delicious but unfortunately I would never buy it because of its poor performance on my skin.

It has an opening with nuances of citrus cologne that gives way to a powdery vanilla with floral aspects of jasmine.

It has a moderate-soft sillage and lasts on my skin for no more than 3 hours.

Without being the same at all, if you fancy a perfume with vanilla with a cologne vibe at a good price and with better performance, I would recommend Per Hai from the Spanish firm Oveh Madrid.

Smell 7.5/10
Duration 3/10
Sillage 4/10
Quality/price 3.5/10
Versatility 4/10
Packaging 7/10
Would I buy again? I did not buy it

product_name: Vaniglia Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content: This is really nice but very expensive, almost prohibitively so. It's a green, powdery vanilla that's sweet but not overly so and not cloying at all like some vanillas can be. I actually thought this was too mature for me at first (my boyfriend said it smelled like something his mum would wear) but I don't think that anymore, it's classy and chic and I feel very grown up wearing it. Unfortuunately, as mentioned, it also has a very grown up price tag attached to it so would only buy if I got a great deal on it.

product_name: Vaniglia Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content: Soapy deep vanilla, it is very nice.. it is a lot heavier than eau duelle for instance, more powdery. In regards to vanilla fragrances, eau duelle is still the winner in my opinion. That aside, this a great fragrance!

product_name: Vaniglia Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Like Tom Ford Tobacco Vanille that I tested recently, Vaniglia is a really good unisex vanilla-dominant scent. It is more subtle and wearable with more mass appeal than TV, but it still is an intriguing, creatively composed scent.

Vaniglia is vanilla-dominant throughout, as the name suggests. The vanilla is deliciously dry and powdery. It opens with citrus-tinged vanilla, mostly thanks to the neroli. Heliotrope adds a hazy, almond-like undertone, but this scent is not a gourmand, despite the tendencies here.

It becomes more floral as it develops, with jasmine rounding out the vanilla. It is more powdery here and a little bit sweet.

Woody notes creep in as it dries down, providing the dry, powdery vanilla with a beautiful warm counterpoint. It fades to a powdery skin scent. Sillage and longevity are moderate.

Vaniglia is a high-quality, subtle unisex vanilla scent, dusty and powdery with just the right amount of sweetness. Cosy yet elegant, it is really satisfying to wear. Ideal for cold days. 4/5.

product_name: Vaniglia Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I've been wearing it for a week in cooler fall weather and it has become a clear 'love' for me.

The opening is slightly sweet leaning but still quite natural vanilla which in the drydown settles down onto the most cozy fluffy powdery base. Throughout wear I get short soft soapy whiffs - think 5-star hotel soap - as well. This just makes you smell like someone who only bathes and slathers themselves in the most lux body care products. On me it's really the vanilla, the heliotrope and the musk that play off each other in the most beautiful comforting and classy way.

Since the days have been getting colder I find myself reaching for it almost daily. Sillage depends on how much you spray. With three sprays I get about an arm's length, which is my personally preferred range. As for longevity, it last throughout the day on me, on my clothes until I next wash them.

Solid no-nonsense well-blended and completely unisex pick for the colder months.

product_name: Vaniglia Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content: It's a whole vanilla perfume. The opening is a neroli infused with a roasted deep powdery vanilla. In the middle, the vanilla becomes sweet and unfortunately, the neroli leaves; but, the vanilla still powdery and deep. In the drydown the scent is less sweet. It's settled on a powdery woody vanilla.

product_name: Vaniglia Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content: This fragrances starts with a neroli infused with natural smelling non sweet vanilla. As this fragrance dries down the heliotrope makes the vanilla denser an denser somewhat like a suncream (not suncream smelling) but so natural. It smells just dense and warm, like vanilla pudding but natural. This is just Unisex because it lacks both the harshness you usually meet in a man fragrance and the sweetness you have in a female fragrance. If you are a male and wearing this people will think it's a men's fragrance, if you are a woman they'll think it's a women's fragrance. There is nothing synthetic about this fragrance. I don't want to say it's either good or bad, because everyone has his tastes, you'll be the one to decide.

product_name: Vaniglia Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Beautiful, sexy rich vanilla.
More suited to women than men.

product_name: Vaniglia Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content: A gorgeous blend of heliotrope and vanilla. My first impression was that it was boring and plain, but getting to know it more the beauty of it emerged. Very clean, a bit powdery and light. Maybe a tiny bit soapy, I don't know how to describe it properly.

product_name: Vaniglia Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content: A classic vanilla, not for me. This one has decent performance. All I get is powdery vanilla. It did get a bit lackluster after a while. Unisex leaning femme.

product_name: Vaniglia Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content:
3 words: Classic, sensual, cosy, it also has so much depth, is enveloping and sophisticated in a comforting way.
So, I went to the department store and perfume shop and sampled lots of fragrances on blotter cards, this and carner (tardes/ rockstar) Jacques fath (curaçao bay) aerin (hisbiscus palm) plus lots of others bronze goddess fraiche, solar and intense, Chloe love story, idole and more. 20 + fragrances. Wanted more but you know it was starting to get awkward in there ;)
ANYWAY, I kept all the samples, obsessively whiffing and sniffing several times throughout the last two days and getting rid of some that faded and I’m down to my last 5 favourites. I was going to write vaniglia off as it seemed just so so when I first sprayed, BUT I held on. This develops into something smouldering and deep and delicious. It’s intoxicating, wow I am genuinely surprised because the more I smell the more I like. This is a keeper I just know. It doesn’t aggravate the sinuses or have any shrill high pitched notes that creep up on you. It delivers. It smoothly and deeply caresses you with a pure but slightly dark sensuous experience. This is a truly good fragrance. Very enveloping, my opinion changed not just slightly but dramatically. This requires time to show its best true colours. I feel they must have used very expensive ingredients because out of all of my testers this one still feels like it hasn’t reached its peak, it’s not fading and feels like it’s still going after two days. The only other fragrance which has developed into something more and has clarity of smell (and I like more too than when I sprayed it, it actually made me feel a bit sick for the first day) is hisbiscus palm. I can now see why people like it. The carner ones and curaçao bay are just starting to fade but held out well. Hisbiscus palm and vaniglia have been well curated and feel like solid complete fragrances that stand the test of time. I have decided to purchase vaniglia and the other 4 in due course.
If you like vanilla I really think you can’t go wrong with this, I am so impressed with the luxurious, heavenly and expensive fragrance. It feels like pure unadulterated luxury. It has a lot of depth. I can detect the floral notes and less so the citrus and they add more height and range to the vanilla essence of this fragrance but it’s just so well blended. I can picture a classy woman, in cashmere who has style. Early autumn 🍂 time and winter this is most suited too but could layer this other times to increase longevity of other perfumes.
Edit: I went onto their website to check for ingredient list, it contains BHT, which is dangerous and I emailed them (I know this is to help maintain integrity and preserve the fragrance) and got a long email response which was like a politician evading the direct question I asked. So not helpful. They surely must be able to use a more natural preservative. It made me not buy this beautiful scent after all. Such a shame.

product_name: Vaniglia Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content:
OMG!

This was one of my first fragrances ever, so naturally as I've been collecting and upgrading into the niche realm in search of quality and longevity, this had been collecting dust at the back....

As I'm currently on my way to Selfridge's, I decided to put this on because of its poor performance (so I can test new frags). As soon as I sprayed it, I had shivers and goosebumps all over due to how densely delicious this smells.

Deep, Dark, Clean and Alluring Vanilla.

I decided to cover myself in it and everyone I passed on the road was compelled to inhale this perfume. It affects people in the same way The Moon by Frederic Malle does. And to be honest I think this is nearly equal to Musc Ravageur, just not as long lasting.

10/10 - This is 180ml worthy & will be used every morning while I jog/workout

product_name: Vaniglia Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Very surprised about this one.It doesn't really shout out AdP DNA, and I don't know why it's so under appreciated. I think this fragrance is gorgeous, definitely feminine leaning, but it's gorgeous, tillage and projection are nice and soft. Longevity is a little better than usual you would expect from AdP. To me this is probably my most versatile Fragrance, office, gym, out for a meal, out for a walk, I really can't think of it being out of place in any situation. It is a Vanilla leading frag, but very nice and soft, and just so delightful and as someone else stated; very comforting.

I tried Camelia and did not particularly like, I also own Ou from the same family, love it equally, except this one is most definitely feminine leaning. It's one of the very few frags that I *will* buy again when this bottle is finished. I'm tempted to try another one out of this family, but I think the black bottles in this collection appear to be as the bottle indicates slightly darker.

product_name: Vaniglia Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content: I was pretty underwhelmed by this. An ok soft, powdery vanilla scent - it is not cloying. But I definitely will not be persuing this when there are so many better options in terms of interest, longevity and projection.

product_name: Vaniglia Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content: I received this today in my scent mail. Initially I was a tad disappointed. I think in my mind it was going to be THE perfect citrus gourmand, balanced lemon and vanilla notes. It is nothing like that, on me. Initially I get cloves, sa LOT of cloves, slight cinnamon notes, and dry woody cedar, with just a touch of orange. Not being a huge fan of cedar or strong cloves and cinnamon, this did not please me. However, on me this comes into it's own in the dry down. The spices soften and become a clove/vanillic 'dry' scent (this may have heliotrope, but I do not get a lot of sweetness or powdery notes - they are there, but not overwhelming), with an orange citrus layer floating along side. Not a beast mode scent, but nor is it a shrinking violet. Considering my skin eats most things extremely quickly, the longevity was pretty good. If I had to pick an image to describe this I would say 'orange spiced Christmassy baked goods fresh out of the oven'

product_name: Vaniglia Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Vaniglia by Acqua di Parma was love a first sniff! Not your usual gourmand vanilla.

This starts with a fresh blast of neroli, bergamot and heliotrope, plus vanilla, which is always present (I can't smell the mandarin). The heliotrope gives Vaniglia a cool vibe, making it different from other vanillas. During the dry down, cedar and musk become present, but the vanilla and heliotrope continue their presence, and the scent become slightly powdery.

Vaniglia has great longevity on my skin, more than 7 h and radiates moderately. This is very well blended and makes a great office scent.

Elegant, classy, well balanced, high quality vanilla scent. Unisex. This is very good!

product_name: Vaniglia Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Smelled this a few times in the store before I purchased a bottle.
This has vanilin extracted from cloves which is also found in vanilla, so it's very similar if not identical to vanilla. I pick up neroli, vanilla, jasmine, musk, cedar & big dose of hedione. I get citruses only in the opening minutes.

Performance is good and scent is relaxing imo. Leans a very slightly feminine thanks to the jasmine which is not super pronounced, but it's there. Smells like if L'Artisan Parfumeur Traverse Bosphore and Tom Ford Santal Blush had a baby.
It's also versatile enough to wear in the cold and heat because of the neroli and citruses. Fantastic execution. Sleeper from the house of ADP.

Scent 7.5/10
Performance 7.5/10

product_name: Vaniglia Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content:
This was an instant full bottle worthy purchase for me. That initial blast of Mediterranean freshness contrasted with the marzipan-like sweetness of the heliotrope that gently melts into a creamy, slightly green, jasmine and raw vanilla extract. Exquisite to say the least.
Uncommon opinion which I haven’t seen shared anywhere, but this is like the original Joop! Homme all grown up, clean shaven, and understatedly dashing.

product_name: Vaniglia Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content:
A vanilla scent that is marketed for men.

To me it is unisex, very powdery, and a vanilla/cedar mixology

I like it - still sampling to see if I like it enough for a full bottle. I do like ADP's other Vanilla offering, Mandorlo Di Sicilia. Great for summer evenings.

product_name: Vaniglia Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content:
PSA: this does not smell like vanilla. at all.

this smells like cedar and maybe musk and a lot of those big aroma chemicals used by brands like essentric molecules which make the whole fragrance smell like white noise (or in this case, drab gray/beige noise).

so this is basically modern trendy niche perfumery in a nutshell and it’s not my thing. I’ve always been attracted to unisex/androgynous fragrances but this recent obsession with genderless scents have been leaving me cold. I appreciate the idea/effort but most of these are so devoid of character. they’re empty of any spirit or passion. just empty.

PS literally nothing like YSL Manifesto.

product_name: Vaniglia Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content: This is heliotrope and jasmine over vanillin. Vanilla is NOT I repeat NOT the dominant note. It’s sweet and powdery. Usual citruses in the beginning but again it’s a powdery sweet scent. If vanilla was the point this missed it.

product_name: Vaniglia Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content: Smells great.

product_name: Vaniglia Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content: Vanilla ice cream with citrus sprinkles on the top. Not impressed.

product_name: Vaniglia Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I have tried several ADP’s over the last few years and the bottom line is this is a house I generally avoid due to the fragrances smelling like old barbershop which is just a smell I don’t enjoy. A sample of this made its way into my hands twice now and I will admit I really like this one.

This smells really polished, no barbershop here. A very floral vanilla that changes slightly for that first hour then settles into a creamy vanilla scent. I can see this being a compliment getter from everyone.

I’m sampling quite a few things right now to make my next big purchase and I would say this is a serious contender for a big bottle buy.

Update: I have sampled this three times now and the first few hours of this fragrance is great. But what the hell is up with the dry down? Like grandma soap. Every time. If it wasn't for this horrible drydown I'd be all over this.

product_name: Vaniglia Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Boring replica of "Manifesto Elixir" from YSL launched 6 years earlier.
"Vaniglia" displays mediocre and weak performances, for 3x the price of YSL.

Overpriced and disappointing.

product_name: Vaniglia Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content: Can someone tell me if this is as sweet or less sweet than the colonia version?

product_name: Vaniglia Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content:
This fragrance smells like warm vanilla in the best way possible. Whenever you go, it’ll smell like a vanilla cookie fresh out of the oven.

Smells forever (I can sometimes still smell it when I shower the next day) and it is strong enough to perfume the whole room or car during the first few hours of wearing it. The only time wearing it is bad is during a hot summer day because it might give you a headache, but it is perfect for every other time!

It's a solid 9/10 from me!

product_name: Vaniglia Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content:
God, this is good! An instant love for me 😍

Woody heliotrope vanilla heaven, with a twist of sitrus! A great unisex scent IMO. The opening is more on the masculine side and the drydown leans a bit more feminine.

It's quite heavy on the heliotrope, but pulls it off without smelling dated or cloying. My sister douses herself in manifesto from time to time and I didn't think of them as similar, but will certainly have to test them side by side.

Vaniglia is very well balanced and the perfect vanilla for me: a bit quirky, not too sweet but still creamy and delicious! Yum!

Performance: not sure what to think yet. Usually I can smell a perfume on myself very well, but I think my nose gets used to this. My sister said I smelled great when I had just applied it, a few hours later she had to get really close to smell it, but all of a suddon she said "Oh, I just smelled your perfume! You applied it again!". I hadn't, I had just walked past her, so I guess it doesn't project much except the first hour, but sillage may be better. Seems to last great on clothes.

product_name: Vaniglia Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content: Initial blast smells like classic vintage perfume. Dad said, I smell like my great grandma’s closet. I told him, she must have been one classy lady. Then, I got waxy old lipstick note that I didn’t expect as iris is not listed in the scent pyramid. Jasmine blooms shortly after, unfortunately it has that banana note I usually get from white florals. I sometimes like that but not today. I feel like it ruined the vintage classy vibe I was enjoying and turned the perfume into just another generic white floral direction.

product_name: Vaniglia Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content: Delicious Fragrance absolutely fabulous. First smell Milano vanilla ice-cream what a joyful happy smell.

product_name: Vaniglia Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content: The masculine equivalent of L'heure bleue, one of Guerlains masterpieces. Cedar makes it a bit darker though heliotrope and vanilla give this fragrance the same powdery vibe. Quite unique fragrance, highly recommended to all male (and female) vanilla lovers!

product_name: Vaniglia Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content: Strange, unique vanilla. I don't enjoy the opening, it smells like a classic old fashioned cologne. However, it changes, heliotrope and vanilla become the most prominent notes. Yummy warm vanilla powder, slightly bitter and woody. True unisex. Classy and expensive smelling vanilla. Professional setting or a special event. When you want to wear a vanilla fragrance that smells sophisticated and refreshing. Not the best performance, it is rather modest, but sometimes you want / need just that. It's great for spring and summer months, that cologne base is lovely, neroli and spice... No spice listed, but there's something spicy about it, a tiny amount of herbal spice. On their website they claim that the sweet essence of vanilla is extracted from the cloves. So that's what a spicy note is, cloves. Overall, it's an interesting scent, with a beautiful contrast of cold herbal citrus opening and a warm vanilla powdery drydown. Luckily, I don't get a lot of florals / jasmine, mostly bitter orange blossom. Yay!

product_name: Vaniglia Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content: A cologne scent with a perfect vanilla pod touch. Very unisex. I truly like the warm edge the vanilla here gives to the classic clean, perfect cologne.

product_name: Vaniglia Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content:
A very nice change from the others in the brown AdP line (which I love most of) with a slightly gourmand vanilla touch.

I am not a huge fan of the opening stages I think the jasmine pops a bit too much for me but the mid onwards to drydown this fades to leave a nice heliotrope and vanilla over the top of a musky clean base.

Reminds me of a touch more masculine and less gourmand version of Profumum Roma's Meringa.

product_name: Vaniglia Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Intense heliotrope vanilla centered scent, I know it is not in the notes pyramid according to Fragrantica, but I smell leather and benzoin in this. Actually this makes me think of a niche type of Shalimar..

Unisex. Very sexy. Projection is ok in the first 2-3 hours then it becomes a skin scent. Perfect for night dates..

product_name: Vaniglia Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
Vaniglia Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content: Perfectly balanced Vanille, the florals and woods keep it rich and warm,,, and I'm really difficult to please when it comes to the vanilla, after lots of disappointments, I can welcome aqua de parma back to my collection.

product_name: Vaniglia Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content:
As with others in ADP's signatures of the sun line they take elemental scents and turn them into well construed perfumes.

As someone who enjoys sweet and spicy scents and this is right on the money for me. It's now my signature scent. It's a woodsy vanilla with a sophisticated touch. None of the other notes come out overemphasised. Great for office and leisure use.

Sweet and sensuous, gentlemanly but bold. A masterpiece.

product_name: Vaniglia Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content: This is not what you expect from the name of it! This perfume is a fresh neroli-heliotrope-white musk scent on a vanilla base. After 3 hours the dry down gets a bit sweeter. Longevity is great, sillage is awesome for the first hour, then it gradually softens to become a skin scent eventually. Borderline gourmand but not quite. On the fresher sweeter side but definitely not cloying. I pair it with YSL Magnificent Gold, to tone down the oud in MG and make it wearable for summertime.

product_name: Vaniglia Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I am not an acqua di parma fan. However i have tried this fragance and i love It. I dont know if It really worths the price or if maybe It can be a bit too soft for the money It costs but i know It has a great smell and i know that i could feel It for at least 4-5 hours perfectly and then very close to the skin for 6-8 hours. It is a very soft vanilla, a bit like the plástico dolls smell, delicate and perfect for daytime use. Although It is vanilla i think is elegant and weareable un any situación, even in the formal ones. It is true that the most importante notes are heliotropo, vanilla and neroli. The BEST AdP i have tried till the moment...

Scent: 9.5
Longevity: 7.5
Sillage: 6
Quality/price: 5
Versatility: 9
Originality: 6
Global: 9

product_name: Vaniglia Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Excellent vanilla-centered fragrance.

Smooth, soft, pleasant, cozy, warm, inviting... Just lovely.

A little bit on the dry side with hint of woodiness.

A bit sweet in a powdery way, but not cloying at all (like some sweet vanilla fragrances can be), and like another reviewer said this feels mature somehow.

Somewhat floral and with a certain citrus vibe, but the floral and citrus notes are very well balanced against the vanilla so that the notes blend together beautifully and support the vanilla which is absolutely front and center. The vanilla makes it warm, while the florals and citrus keep it clean and fresh.

It definitely leans feminine in my opinion - I think my mom would love this, actually - but a confident man could surely pull this off. I'm envisioning tanned skin in a light linen suit on a warm summer evening in southern Europe...

product_name: Vaniglia Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content:
simply for vanilla lovers, I have tried quite a few from this House but most suffer from longevity issues. this is better. i am not sure on the price tag but if you love Vanilla, musk, heliotrope and jasmine, you should try it. smells heavenly on ladies. cozy and personal, intimate sessions this will be a win, i LOIKE ;)
8.5/10
ps. if you love this and want a beast.. get mancera Holidays. tom ford soleil blanc is similar too

product_name: Vaniglia Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content: A sweet vanilla opening held up by a VERY feminine smelling mid/base. I wouldn't go to extremes, but there is definitely something vintage/old-school about it that I would not see on anyone young at all. I felt like I time-traveled to the past into a very melancholic moment with this scent.

product_name: Vaniglia Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content:
A delicate triad of citrus, jasmine and heliotrope wrapped in a soft, dry, woody vanilla. It's not syrupy or cloying, the cedar and musk keep it balanced and sheer.

Leans more feminine to my nose, mainly because it smells very similar to J'adore EDP.

product_name: Vaniglia Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I find this fresh, sweet (Not cloying) and very wearable.
The bergamot note is far stronger than I expected, but in a good way. This is a skin close scent,
lovely, just lovely!

product_name: Vaniglia Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content: Soft, powdery, yummy vanilla that is not cloying. And I love it!

product_name: Vaniglia Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Tested this black bottle today, it’s certainly strong enough but although I liked the sweet vanilla opening, this very soon morphed into a decidedly feminine scent.
This is probably better suited to my 77 year old mother than me.
It’s nice but it’s not for me.
Other than Quercia, I’ve not really enjoyed any of the ADP releases over the last two years.
They’re prolific alright, I’ll give them that.

product_name: Vaniglia Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content: To me it smells identical to Manifesto YSL / Kenzo Amour. If you like those this will be for you

product_name: Vaniglia Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content:
This is reformulated and quite different from the brown bottle version, the new formulation is less feminine. The jasmine is significantly toned down and the vanilla note is a little less sweet as well.

From AdP's website description the vanilla note here comes from clove extraction. Quite surprising to me that clove contains vanillin, anyway that's the secret of vanilla note not being very sweet but instead more woody here. Overall, it's a very pleasant and versatile fragrance with a unique fresh twist, just the way I imagine AdP's vanilla to be.

product_name: Vaniglia Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content:
The Shop assistant describe it as a "bitter vanilla" and I agree with him. What a balanced combination!!!

The whole line it's wonderful, I couldn't choose, fortunately for me it's far off what I'll pay for fragrances :)

For me, it's all unisex. If you like it, wear it, I say!!!
Boys, I know for you it's difficult, but you can look at it, this way: you wanna attract women? Smell of what women like

product_name: Vaniglia Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content: it is surprisingly fresh, or should I say: refreshing. The Bergamot, cedar and neroli are really there. But they do not hinder the vanilla, but they give it a refreshing aura and it turns a rather boring scent into a very interesting one -> because i never thought Vanilla could be so fresh. great job!

product_name: Acqua Nobile Iris Acqua di Parma
review_content: This is beautiful! On me, the Iris blooms, almost with a clinical unisex fouger opening that I loved. Soon the citrus came through. The scent lasted for about 3 hours and 5 on my jacket. Nobile Iris was fairly linear, no huge shifts or weird changes. Frankly it just smelled good. Clean, but not quite "fresh", complex but not overly so. Definitely signature scent worthy, for the right person. I'd say this is fine for work (be light with it though) and shines on weekends with friends and family. After the shower too. Loved it.

product_name: Acqua Nobile Iris Acqua di Parma
review_content: Ohh my my my what a beauty aqcua iris nobile . such a bright uplifting scent . i havent had this joy happening for some time . I first was not sure if i wanted this but blind bought it at a good price . the citron and nerolie greats you right away , before it swiftly brings in the orange flowers and mandarin. And offcourse the beautiful Iris howering abow it. i dont think i have anything like this ,the closest i get is some stages of Gelsomino from the same house . bout brilliantly beautiful. I feel so feminin and classy wearing this . put together but still aprotiable and warm . this is classy for sure . i want to put on a crisp outfit and take a walk in the spring morning . i have been down a few days but this manage to lift my mood enormesly what a scent can do for you <3 There is a toned down vanilla and musk here , just to stop it from being dry or bitter (nerolie tends to do that on me). Im so so happy i got this beauty . now i realy want the Original and sublime aswell . Acqua de parma sure is classy and a deligth to wear

product_name: Acqua Nobile Iris Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I love all of Acqua Di Parma´s renditions of iris. Iris is, in my view, the most italian of fragrances, as Italy is one of the top exporters of orris burre in the world. I currently own Acqua di Parma Iris Nobile EDP, and Iris Nobile Sublime EDP, as well as this beauty here (Acqua Nobile Iris EDT). Thankfully the packaging is very different, because the names are so similar, but the fragrances, though clearly realated, have different formulations, and this is my favorite in this kind of weather (upwords of 83F/28C degrees.)

The reason I love this: Hellooo Citron! Aromatic and fresh, and thanks to the brilliant house of Acqua Di Parma: long lasting for an EDT! It lasts about 4 hours on skin and much longer on fabric. While I find Acqua di Parma Iris Nobile EDP (6 hours, by the way) lovely for having more presence and projection, it is to me, more of a spring fragrance, while this: Acqua Nobile Iris EDT, is FANTASTIC for summer!

I lived in Italy, one of the happiest moments in my life, and Acqua Di Parma's Iris Nobile as well as Santa Maria Novella's Melograno are the fragrance of Italy to me.

I hope you find this review helpful if you´re trying to choose between the 3 fragrances. Evaluate the weather in your city and don´t write this beauty off just because it´s an EDT. This is quality perfumery!

Enjoy your summer!

product_name: Acqua Nobile Iris Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Luxurious, elegant and refined.

One of my favorites.

I have a friend who also wears this and when I smell it on her, it smells very luxurious.
It smells like high quality.

Really beautiful and a delight to wear.

product_name: Acqua Nobile Iris Acqua di Parma
review_content: A beauty and a stunner .... alas projection is modest. For the price we pay- longevity should be louder and stronger. And we are talking Nordstrom & Bloomingdales price tags.

product_name: Acqua Nobile Iris Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Love it !!! Fresh but warm at the same time , lovely iris creation , a hint of powder, as for me I hardly detect the violet , it is mostly dominated with iris . If is bright without being a lemon scent
It reminds me of prada iris absolu which I love !! Nothing more to say, I love it !! Great creation !! It isn't a sophisticated outgoing bold scent , still it is a quality airy and comforting perfume , feminine and very easy to wear !!
only issue is longevity isn't great, thank goodness I have a big bottle so I reapply often .

product_name: Acqua Nobile Iris Acqua di Parma
review_content: EDT: For me a violet dominated scent, the citrus and green notes swiftly giving way to a full-bodied (a little predictable) sweet violet which stomps on any delicate iris. For those seeking a cool, mysterious iris in the Chanel or Guerlain vein, this is not it.

product_name: Acqua Nobile Iris Acqua di Parma
review_content: Thought my Iris journey is over with Prada D'iris (which I love) till I got sniffed to this warm comforting scent in a bottle...Iris, mandarin, vanilla totally smells DIVINE!

product_name: Acqua Nobile Iris Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Truly beautiful iris scent. Very soft, unlike many other iris scents that are cool and harsh. This iris scent is like delicate satin that you love on your body. Absolute delight.

Update: There's something in its base that puts me off. What a shame.

product_name: Acqua Nobile Iris Acqua di Parma
review_content:
At first it's a very loud bright accord of citrus and white flowers. It cools down in about 10 minutes and turns into a white flower, citrusy, fresh and sparkly excellently blended perfume. It is slightly sweet and slightly bitter (violet leaf?) and I like it. This fragrance is very wearable and enjoyable, it smells expensive.

When the scent settles after an hour or so I can get some very soft iris flower, quite realistic. There is no iris root in this perfume so it lacks the buttery and powdery feel as you may expect of an iris perfume. So to me this fragrance is not much about the iris, it is a very classy Mediterranean citrus flower+citrus summer scent.

It took me some time to warm up to this one and I can say now I love it for the summer. Sillage is arm length and the longevity is good several hours. It is worth the price

product_name: Acqua Nobile Iris Acqua di Parma
review_content:
This is a drop-dead gorgeous scent. So wonderful that I'm burning through my rollerball fast even when I restrain myself from reaching for it!

Acqua Iris Nobile smells like the most exquisite and elegant floral. The iris is very buttery here, and is sweetened by orange blossom. I could definitely smell the violet leaf that gives Acqua Iris Nobile a green tinge while neroli and minimal citruses shadow in the background. While Acqua Iris Nobile is a fairly linear perfume that boosts iris and OB all the way through, the smell of it is so wonderful that I really don't mind the linearity of it. Actually I like how it stays floral and doesn't turn musky or soapy on me during dry down like Infusion d'Iris by Prada. Sillage is moderate turning soft, and longevity is around 6 hours on me. Also the dry down of this perfume smells extremely like Iris Nobile Sublime offered by the same company.

The overall effect is a green fragrant iris that is to die for!

On a side note in terms of the impression this perfume gives off, I really think it depends on the style of the wearer: if you're a oriental lover this might smell "cold", but if you wear lots of green than this can smell "cheerful" and "casual". Regardless of your background, everyone here seems to agree upon the high quality of the scent, which one simply cannot deny once you catch a whiff of this beauty.

Definitely full-bottle worthy for me.

product_name: Acqua Nobile Iris Acqua di Parma
review_content:
If you are new to the world of perfumes and want to try one that you will know immediately is well made and expensive, get yourself a sample of this. I waited to write this review until I had a few other niche perfumes under my belt for comparison. I hope I can convey how beautifully special this one is.
Well blended is the key. There is absolutely no synthetic smell at all. It is the cold, no nonsense fragrance that a lady in a business suit wears. Or a lady judge! It is soft power, a bit powdery from the amber, slightly floral from the iris. Not at all like Prada Infusion D'Iris (which is very nice too). This is cold and classic like a beautiful ivory statue. If Athena was feeling aloof and chose to wear a scent it, I can see her picking this one.
I don't want to scare anyone away with this review. This is one of my new must haves for when I need to think clearly and make decisions. This is a very special scent that all others can be held up to when deciding if a scent is good quality. No nonsense, no kidding.

product_name: Acqua Nobile Iris Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I own Iris Nobile and wear it often and I was surprised to find this "acqua" version of it to actually feel stronger and more substantial than the original, with a much bigger emphasis on the iris. However, where the original is one of those "little black dress" perfumes that's suitable for pretty much anything, this one really lends itself best to spring/summer.

It's a really sparkly, zesty kind of a fragrance, one that makes you smile. A little bottle of sunshine.

Iris and violet leaf are strongest on me, with a sparkling citrus backdrop. The iris in this feels rootier than the one in the original version, but it's still a more floral iris that rooty orris accord.

I find this fairly linear, save for a hint of vanilla at the close.

The sillage is soft/medium and for longevity, I get about 8 hours from it, so it's pretty good there.

I'll be getting a full bottle of this for summer because it's the perfect summer scent. Very happy and cheerful, but also very ladylike and elegant. Definitely a great addition to the Nobile series.

product_name: Acqua Nobile Iris Acqua di Parma
review_content:
On me, Acqua Nobile Iris is dominated by green violet leaf, neroli and citron. The violet leaf is a bit sharp in the opening, which is then smoothened by a discreet vanilla. The eponymous iris behaves more like a strutural note at first, providing a mineral powdery texture, but later becomes more discernable along with orange blossom, rendering the drydown a little bit more floral. The overall effect is clean and fresh, cologne-like yet with a graceful feminine touch.

The sillage is soft and the longevity is around 7 hours. Acqua Nobile Iris is a refreshing spring/summer fragrance, casual and comfortable, yet with an understated elegance. If you happen to be looking for a citrus cologne with a twist, Acqua Nobile Iris is an option with a solid structure.

product_name: Acqua Nobile Iris Acqua di Parma
review_content: I realised why I did not love this beautiful fragrance at first - I was chronically overspraying. With lighter touch, I am liking it more and more. For me the orange blossom becomes prominent and longlasting. I think less is definitely more with this one. I really like the iris close on my skin. This is a timeless fragrance and I don't think I will ever get tired of it.

product_name: Acqua Nobile Iris Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Ahhhh... a cozy citrus. An interesting combination of brightness and powderiness. It reminds me of waking up at dawn in a country house, full of windows, very early as the sun begins to lift over the horizon after a night of rain. You walk into the sunroom filled with flowers, then settle into your breakfast of freshly squeezed orange juice. On the other hand, this is a lovely perfume to wear to bed, it is very relaxing.

Acqua Nobile Iris is an authentic and softly sensual perfume. It feels baby fresh without smelling of baby powder. Very gentle but also uplifting. It is similar to Acqua Nobile Magnolia, which is in the same family, because of these qualities, and because of the similar notes and structure. These Acqua Nobile perfumes are also both ageless and timeless, for any floral lover.

I think that if you like Prada's Infusion D'Iris in the EDT concentration more than you like it in the EDP, you will also like this one very much.

Thanks Germany, for the samples!

product_name: Acqua Nobile Iris Acqua di Parma
review_content: I love this one. Its clean and sweet and violet , irises ,,,, one of my favourite combos. The musk and vanilla makes this to be warm soft and clean. Like a baby product or like Nivea cream. It's very comforting and one of my favourite. I like wearing it in the morning and to bed. It's not an going out for dinner scent but every other place is quite suitable. If I wear it and want to step it up abit and make it fancy I add the new EDP iris sublime.

product_name: Mandarino Millesimato 2022 Acqua di Parma
review_content: If anyone is interested in selling me their bottle, please message me!

product_name: Mandarino Millesimato 2022 Acqua di Parma
review_content: Asked my mom to buy this in Rome for €220, number 1079/2022 piece. Bottle is gorgeous, scent is an accurate representation of natural mint, last quite long on skin (sillage is great) and priced quite fairly for what you get for. Wore this several times outside and to school, performance is fairly good for a citrus fragrance. Best release from Acqua di Parma for the quality you get for (unlike other release with weak longevity) in my opinion. From my experience, don’t spray at clothes, will wear off in 1-2 hours, I found it to last the longest when I spray it on my neck.

product_name: Mandarino Millesimato 2022 Acqua di Parma
review_content: Given there are only 2022 bottles globally available, I felt compelled to give this one a try. I was surprised by the spearmint. It feels really nice, and although it sits close it feels as if it’s made to do so. Naturally energizing but highly personal, it’s a quality fragrance. Very light, highly compelling; and, the spearmint is totally unique. Calmer than the mint in the OG Colonia Club and far more subdued than Green Irish Tweed, but it vanished far too soon to justify a purchase.
