Perhaps at a later stage I can try the standard version and see how the spearmint sits then. If this lasted longer or transitioned rather than disappearing so quickly, I would have bought it. It’s a very nice two-hour experience.

product_name: Mandarino Millesimato 2022 Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Bought my bottle today,number 744 of 2022.
As a big fan of the house,I was expecting more to be honest.It is citrusy,soapy and very linear.What you spray is what you’ll get throughout the wear of the fragrance.It didn’t last too long.I need more time with it to get to know it better

product_name: Mandarino Millesimato 2022 Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Tried and tried again, with curiosity and expectations. First impressions. It is a much less tart tangerine than other fragrances on the same notes; it is not flat like other citruses that focus only on the characterizing note. It opens crisply, with green and fresh notes, but soon and steadily becomes a sweet tangerine with notes of musk and patchouli that combine well, leaving the tangerine always as the protagonist but not as the only protagonist.
Because of its sweetness, it is not necessarily a daytime-only scent. Definitely very elegant and also quite different from what exists on the same notes. The duration is not negligible, although predominantly on this base that does not focus only on tangerine. An elegant perfume, certainly unisex, for what little I have smelled the corresponding eau de toilette, different and more "complete" and complex.
The price is limited edition, assuming it remains so. Certainly when compared to a "Pur Kinkan"
Edt by Cartier, which is little more than a scented water, (albeit of the highest quality and which I adore)
sold at € 275 (75 ml), it can stand. The product, I reiterate, seems to me to be really of great quality. A gem for lovers of the genre, even for those who are "scared" of mandarin as a basic idea. This is more, much more.

product_name: Mandarino Millesimato 2022 Acqua di Parma
review_content:
A delicate and very natural tangerine.
I found the Millesimato version to be "warmer" and sweeter than its "Sicilian Mandarin" sibling.
The duration even on me is about 6-7 hours: not great considering that we are talking about an Eau de Parfum but it is still a citrus scent, so you cannot expect miracles.
Since this is a limited edition (2022 pieces, but...we'll see if it really is!) I picked one up in the Milan boutique at its debut, during Design Week. I happened upon the number 1672/2022. And unfortunately no: you can't choose the bottle number because you would have to open the box to do that. So it's absolutely random.

product_name: Mandarino Millesimato 2022 Acqua di Parma
review_content:
The most realistic, natural and long-lasting tangerine I have ever tried. It opens with green and slightly tart notes...and then comes the sweet flurry...not invasive, not annoying, but beautifully lingering...
A very realistic, elegant and really nice tangerine....
The saleswoman was not very generous and gave me a spray on my wrist...which still lasted me 6 hours...
only downside the price.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Mandorlo di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Closest thing I have to smelling like Root Beer but still not close enough. Smells very similar to Trussardi's Passeggiata In Galleria Vittorio Emanuele II but it doesn't have a chocolatey element to it.

Mandorlo di Sicilia has weak sillage and it feels like it wears off fast or maybe I get anosmic to it because every now and then I will catch a whiff. So I would say you could wear this in an office setting and not offended many people.

I can't explain how it smells even though I just compared it to root beer. Initial spray smells like pink bubblegum and for a second it feels like root beer. Just like Trussardi's Passeggiata In Galleria Vittorio Emanuele, Mandorlo di Sicilia has an artificial scent of almond biscotti and vanilla on the dry down.

They also both smell odd when I spray them on certain polyester clothes so I would try it on skin or cotton fabric if you don't spray fragrances on your skin. On my skin I mostly get the pink bubblegum smell. But if you like bubblegum I wouldn't get this for that fragrance. The best pink bubblegum fragrance I have tried is Lush's Snow Fairy.

I think this is a decent almond baked-goods scent that isn't TOO sweet so it could possibly lean towards being unisex. I'd say it's good for the fall.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Mandorlo di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Smell is
So so yummy and fun. You can smell the star anise and vanilla. Sweet, and kinda different but mass pleasing.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Mandorlo di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content: Wonderful aroma of almond and vanilla, completely agree with comparisons to a root beer float! I have the 180ml and I love it but never really had any compliments whilst wearing it. Projection and longevity both weak. As in keeping with this line unfortunately.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Mandorlo di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content: Smells very much like bubblegum. Projection is poor but longetivity is decent.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Mandorlo di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content: smells like straight vanilla essence

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Mandorlo di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content: Muy unisex. Le estoy agarrando cariño poco a poco. Cuando me la dieron a probar la primera impresión fue de esto no es para mí. Pero dejé pasar unas horas y la evolución y secado los sentí maravillosos. No tenia nada así en colección y realmente me gustó mucho. Un postre con mucho anís y algo frutal, dulce sin empalagar y con un cítrico poco presente pero que le da el toque. Riquísimo. Mi esposa lo usa igual y le queda espectacular.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Mandorlo di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content: I love the root beer float scent that its giving me but I wish it lasts longer on my skin. I love layering this with Dama Bianca or Junoon noir. Giving it a 3/5 and I don't think I would repurchase.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Mandorlo di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content: This is like opening a bag of those white and pink candied almonds. Same smell.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Mandorlo di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content: Not for me. This is too much like double bubble bubble gum. Would not want to smell like bubble gum.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Mandorlo di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content:
[On skin]
Opens with a fantastic burst of fizzy root beer. It's playful, sweet, yet mature and has surprising depth, smelling very natural too. I'd say it's completely unisex. A warm, playfully sweet, and inviting scent. I could definitely see this as a summer fragrance, but it somehow does have a warm vibe to it. It's intimate and inviting, and honestly, I find it addictive as the wearer; I just keep going back in for a sniff.

After about 15 minutes, the fizziness settles, and the root beer evolves into more of a root beer float, with creamy vanilla stepping forward while the root beer scent is still very much there. I don't get much citrus on my skin. I truly love this fragrance, probably because I have positive childhood associations with root beer. My only wish is that it projected more and lasted longer, but that's a common desire for me with these Acqua di Parma scents. Regardless, I got myself a small bottle just to enjoy at home every now and then.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Mandorlo di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content:
So gooooood 🤤
ROOT BEAR FLOAT 100% 🍺🍦

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Mandorlo di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content: A little but spicy, warm and soo winter type of scent.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Mandorlo di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content: Cosy and comforting powdered almonds with a hint of Juicy Fruit gum. This creamy sweet scent is light wearing, due to its EDT concentration which makes it a perfect gourmand for the summer months.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Mandorlo di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content: Smells good for the minute it lasts.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Mandorlo di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content: Wow, this really does smell like root beer. This reminds me of Rogue Smoking EDP by BDK, which has a bit of a medicinal smell to it, this removes that entirely. I've heard many people say that Rogue Smoking smells like Dr Pepper, and it's true, so I guess Dr Pepper with the medicinal smell from it removed is just root beer. I feel like this can be worn anytime, as its not too sweet or fresh. This is also a very affordable fragrance.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Mandorlo di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content: love love loveee this! I got it from my mom, and it's a great sweet gourmand that isn't overpowering. It feels very vacation-y and perfect for summer, and the longevity is really great. I put this on in the morning, went to the gym, swam in a chlorinated pool, showered, and could still smell it on myself! Does remind me a little of Dr. Pepper or root beer but only when I think about it

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Mandorlo di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Despite the name, Mandorlo di Sicilia leans far more orange creamsicle than almond on my skin. I understand the root beer comparisons floating around, but for me, it's a creamy citrus scent. The vanilla here is surprisingly wearable in the heat. Not cloying or heavy, but smoothly blended with the orange, giving it a soft gourmand quality that doesn’t overwhelm.

For a fragrance marketed around almond, I get virtually none of it. It’s also not nearly as feminine as often described; I’d call this firmly unisex. There’s absolutely space here for a man to wear this confidently, especially if he has a taste for gourmand scents as I do.

This isn’t your typical summer fragrance. Rather than reaching for freshness or marine notes, Mandorlo di Sicilia invites closeness. It’s a rare warm-weather gourmand that whispers "come closer" instead of projecting loudly.

Speaking of projection: it's subtle. I catch occasional wafts, but it wears close to the skin. Longevity is still unconfirmed, but based on its performance so far, I estimate around 8 hours. Will pick up a full bottle to scratch my gourmand itch in the hotter months.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Mandorlo di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Mandorlo di Sicilia is a non-heavy gourmand, sweet without being childish. A unique almond-citrus-vanilla blend.
Its almond-vanilla heart feels soothing, like marzipan on a warm summer day, with moderate longevity and sillage.
Gender-neutral and non-intrusive, perfect for warm climates
A comforting, relaxing, “feel-good” scent. Love it.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Mandorlo di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content: smells like root beer and is so comforting. Its warm and cozy not sexy and seductive. Best for spring early summer and Autumn. High heat might make it cloying and Winter cold might not allow it to project

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Mandorlo di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content: This fragrance is an elegant blend of biscuity almonds and creamy vanilla, accented by subtle yellow florals and sweet summer fruits. Tolu balsam, white musk, and cedar provide a balanced base to what might otherwise have been an overly sweet perfume. Depending on where you focus your mind, the scent might transport you to artisanal biscotti —or to bubblegum mouthwash (is that the anise?). It wears close to the skin and unmistakably evokes the sunshine, warmth, and glitterati of the Italian coast.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Mandorlo di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content: Juicy fruit bubble gum and root beer floats and yellow almond cake. Surprisingly, however, it never goes saccharine and somehow works best in the sweltering heat.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Mandorlo di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content: Everything about this is harmonious - except for the star anise! Blindly bought a large decant, and I just can't come to terms with the toothpaste-y, dentist office smell. I feel like I'm in a waiting room when wearing this.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Mandorlo di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content:
For me it smells a lot like toothpaste/root beer/bubble gum. Though it's gonna be a bit more nutty. Its very sweet and fun smell, but for me it's not very wearable.
It smells amazing on the paper, so probably my skin chemistry doesn't fit!

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Mandorlo di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content: Most underrated warm-weather gourmand. It's sophisticated and unique. Vanilla-almond mix is just perfect.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Mandorlo di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content: I discovered this beautiful perfume 25 years ago, when the Blu Mediterraneo line first came out. It reminds me of summer days, Italy, being a young woman and going out on dates with my English husband, in restaurants and bars in Milan, during the spring and summer, before we got married. It is the most beautiful and elegant almond perfume, no bitterness or flowers. It is sweet but not in a sickly gourmand way. I still use it with the shower gel and body cream, in summer only, as a beautiful and nostalgic treat. I love it. Longevity and projection are not great but this is a masterpiece from Acqua di Parma 💙

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Mandorlo di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content: Smells nice but too feminine for me

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Mandorlo di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content: smells like pico de gallo

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Mandorlo di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content: Powdery sweet, literal fruity stick bubble gum smell.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Mandorlo di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Testing Mandorlo di Sicilia from a 1.5 ml Aqua di Parma sample. I quite like this scent, I am not going to lie. It’s an EDT concentration, according to the sample card, so I need to manage my expectations accordingly regarding the performance, but the perfume is nice. Different. Distinctive from other perfumes that are heavy on vanilla or almond and I currently have in my collection, which is a plus!

I get mostly from the plethora of notes listed the anise, orange, vanilla, almonds and the peach. It’s a very warm, cozy, comforting type of scent that is very mass appealing and easy to use as a signature fragrance. It has a uniqueness about it which is undeniable.

I like it but I wouldn’t rush to get a bottle. It’s something that’s missing for me in the scent to make me spent my money. Lasts about 4 hours on skin with minimal sillage. It’s interesting but not for me at this moment in my life!

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Mandorlo di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Whoever says this has a poor longevity must be crazy :o) - I have close that smells days after being sprayed with the scent. I do agree, that the sillage isn't enomous, but it is plenty.

I have now tried many of the Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo versions, but this is my absolute favorite.

It is like nothing else in my collection. I would however have liked, if the Star Anise was a bit more prominent, but it could be, that it would destroy it. Just a thought.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Mandorlo di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content: Perhaps the only warm-weather gourmand I've smelled, and it does a great job of fulfilling that niche. Longevity for me was far better than I expected, especially for such a light, airy fragrance. Only criticism is that the vanilla definitely overpowers the almond (I see where the birthday cake/root beer people are coming from) - kind of smells like what I imagine a warm-weather focused flanker of PDM Althair would smell like.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Mandorlo di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content: by far the most interesting and different of the line, the almond and vanilla is really nice and feels different without being too out there

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Mandorlo di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Birthday cake and root beer. That's all I have to say.

It has a slight play doughy note in it but I think it's from the combination of almond and anise. It's a lovely, comforting smell regardless

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Mandorlo di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content: Smells like a caramac bar, which I happen to love, but not everyone will want to smell like that. Gourmand lovers only. I just wish it lasted longer, it’s gone within the hour on me which makes it way overpriced. Would be my signature if it had better longevity

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Mandorlo di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Beautiful almond, vanilla, and anise/licorice. It does give a root beer vibe in the opening. Sweet but not heavy or syrupy, leans feminine. In the late drydown the sweetness feels richer and more dense with vanilla, but it never feels dark. It is not very strong and stays close, though I'm finding most almond dominant scents are not loud.

If you like scents like Rouge Smoking or Hypnotic Poison there is a good chance you will like this.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Mandorlo di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content: I quite like this one. It’s not too sweet but scratches the gourmand itch that hits in colder months —while also, I suspect, working for warmer weather. This does smell like an artisanal root beer that’s been made less sweet and more vanilla than the typical Barqs root beer you might find at the store. It’s funny because I got it to have an almond perfume, but this doesn’t really smell like almond to me. It’s more of a sweet, spicy aromatic scent not dissimilar to Moon Milk by Frenshe, though that one leans more winter than this does. I find that it lasts up to 6 hours with low projection after the first hour or so. I prefer that with sweet scents though, otherwise I get tired of them. The perfect gourmand for those generally ambivalent towards them. Try if you like the afor-mentioned Moon Milk, or Sea, Sud, Sun by Versatile Paris, or L’etang Noir by Maison Louis Marie.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Mandorlo di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content: If you love anise or black licorice or root beer, this will be your scent. It’s really good, a gourmand in a non traditional way. It’s not too sweet to my nose. Sadly it lasts only 30 minutes before disappearing after an hour. Not even the vanilla lingers so prepare to respray multiple times a day. I wish it was stronger.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Mandorlo di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content: Smells like a child. How come? My friend has this, and when I smell him with it he just smells like baby formula and diapers and play-dough. He gets mad when i say so but it is right.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Mandorlo di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content: Root beer float (vanilla ice cream). Light enough to wear in most seasons. Doesn’t feel synthetic. Almond or anise are not overpowering

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Mandorlo di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content: Smells of Christmas sugar cookies with almonds and white frosting. It definitely is not an citrus-aromatic like other APs. It is wonderful, mouthwatering and I reserve it for Christmas week exclusively. Don't understand where the root beer comes in . There are so many root beers that all smell differently so maybe some smell like cookies.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Mandorlo di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content: Precursory sniff from the bottle gave me root beer vibes; once on my skin it actually smells exactly like sarsaparilla (they're extremely similar drinks, honestly). Glad to see I'm not the only person who gets root beer/sarsaparilla from this. Love the way this smells, but don't want to smell like it myself haha

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Mandorlo di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content:
WOAH it smells EXACTLY like rootbeer. Took me right back to this time I was camping in my family's RV at Yogi Bear's Jellystone Park Camp-Resorts and there was this very American sports restaurant/bar nearby and I ordered a rootbeer. Literally A&W rootbeer. I love it. If you don't like rootbeer, you won't like this. But it's so fun. I get a small twinge of mint, but that honestly could be the star anise. This feels like that one recipe where people make "healthy coke" with random ingredients and it comes together to taste like coke. Does that make any sense

Anyways, after it dries a bit I get more of the fruit and vanilla, and it fades a bit from the rootbeer. No jasmine tbh. What a rollercoaster. A good ride

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Mandorlo di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content: Balsamic, almost syrupy vanilla. Deep and powdery and unsettling on first spray. Rich and spicy, the star anise is really the star of the show here. I wish there was more almond, as I really like almond notes, but this just makes me almost uncomfortable. Also i get zero fruit here. Smells just like root beer. I’m highly disappointed in this, as it is listed to be something that I would adore.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Mandorlo di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Almond and vanilla. It starts with a blast of alcohol and then settles down with an earthy edge.

I like it, but I wouldn’t say I love it, especially with AdP prices. The performance is just not good enough for the associated cost.

Overall, it’s cosy and nice for wearing to bed but I won’t repurchase.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Mandorlo di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content: One of my favourite, great Vanilla and Almond blast.. sillage, decent.. take a 5ml Atomiser out if your on the razzle, this and the amazing PDM Althair are defo chick magnets..

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Mandorlo di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content: amazing first niche fragrance in my collection and I have no complaints. I get a fair amount of compliments. it's a really good sweet type of smell if you like that type of stuff.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Mandorlo di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content: Smells like root beer to me, its pretty good.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Mandorlo di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content: Less floral and sweeter-smoother than Daima Fragonard which has the heliotrope violet and gardenia and so it's to me much lighter ethereal and feminine and its sweetness is more fruity, while this is more unisex and summery. This is bolder and more almond-infused even tho the almond here is a top note, while Daima has the almond more subdued by the other notes despite being a middle note, it's there but more subtle than in this. I like both but Daima has some dusty vibe at times from the sandalwood and the heliotrope which sometimes has a vintage powdery dusty feel along with the sandalwood, while its floral notes kind of overshadow the beauty of almond. This is very very intense so a little goes a long way. It's beautiful and I love the unisex quality it has. I've noticed that anise gives a nutty and solar-warm undertone in perfumes such as Korres Philosia and so it does provide a warm-solar nutty element here pairing nicely with the almond. The ylang ylang is always a solar playful note and makes this very uplifting and happy. It's a fruity summery almond scent that despite its intense almond scent it differs from Hypnotic Poison/sweet hope la rive and the lactonic play doh bomb Police Forbidden. Its fruitiness lasts in the drydown and later on and it becomes more feminine gradually. It's not a sharp heavy scent despite being intense and bold, it's smooth by the vanilla, with moderate warmth from the tolu balsam which is also beautiful and makes the scent rich and decadent. The peach isn't obnoxious as it normally tends to be to me, and here it balances out the citrusy element from the top notes, same as in Daima. Overall full bottle worthy for me and a nice summer treat for lovers of Hypnotic Poison and Police Forbidden which I consider more heady perfumes and winter-appropriate while this is perfect for summer to me and day time wear too. I love the bottle also and since I'm Mediterranean from Greece, our neighbors love almond as much as we do and this scent reminds me of my fav island Spetses where we spent some summers and my fav sweet was the almond sweet delight of Spetses the traditional Greek dessert of the island with almond and rosewater - it was the perfect dessert for the greek summer without the heavy ingredients of most desserts. We sometimes had it with ouzo the anise drink that ppl relate to the Italian sambuca but ours has some differences so the anise note here makes total sense to me.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Mandorlo di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Mandorlo di Sicilia is a soft spiced, vanilla based, almonds perfume. For a perfume with the name almond in the name, I was expecting it to be mostly focused on almonds but I can smell easily in here mandarines, anise star, vanilla, some un descriptive warm flowers and balsams. It’s much more complex than I was expecting judging by the name. I say that being pleasantly surprised, not with disappointment.

I like Mandorlo di Sicilia. Would I get it for full price? No, for sure! Again, performance is the issue for me. It’s moderate like all the Aqua’s de Palma I have sampled so far and unfortunately I live in the cold North where these lightweight fragrances get lost most of the times in the crisp air.
But I see the appeal of this working perfectly fine in the warmer climate of the South of Europe or other warm/tropical areas.

It’s a good one if you love a sweet, spicy vanilla based scent that features heavily the almond note. Aqua di Parma is doing something really good with this blue line.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Mandorlo di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content: I don’t like much gourmand scents, but my oh my!!! Aqua di Parma Mandorlo de Sicilia is a delicious concoction of perfectly balanced almond and vanilla that instantly transports me to a happy place. It sits on the skin for hours and gives you the warmest of embraces. A triumph.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Mandorlo di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content:
It is gorgeous during spring but also lovely during summer. I feel the almonds and floral scents that accompany them. To my male it smells like cake so popular are the almond oils. I can feel also ylang, vanilla and tolu balsam. They are like facets of the almond scent that's the main star. I've never been to Sicily but I can imagine it might smell like that where almonds grow. Oleander flowers smell similarly, too.
It reminds me of Dragée by Reminiscence which is more gourmand, of La Dompteuse Encage by Serge Lutens which is more floral and of Devotion by D&G which is more chemical and sweeter. Today it was too uneventful, I'm changing my love to like.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Mandorlo di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content: If you want to smell like the candy shop of your dreams, layer this with Truly's Unicorn Fruit. On its own, it’s a lovely, light, anise almond similar to Hypnotic Poison, just not as deep or dense. I would consider it a summer or warm weather scent but it’s not going to be out of place in cooler temps and layered with a deeper winter scent it could be delicious.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Mandorlo di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content: Very brief and fleeting. Nuttiness then vanilla. Some warmth. Immediate skin scent and I could not find it after an hour.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Mandorlo di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content: Don't get me wrong, it's a really good frangrance with a great scent, but if sweet perfumes make you nauseous, this one does it 10x worse. I bought this perfume as a blind purchase (don't do that) and completly regret it. If you're not like me and can rock a sweet scent without wanting to puke 24/7 than this one is perfect for you!

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Mandorlo di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content: smells like an almond biscotti with a side of anise, almost rootbeer-ish but not too sweet or artificial. i really like it, i just have to be craving it for it to work on me.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Mandorlo di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content: To me it smells like a root beer float. Vanilla and anise are the most noticeable notes, and I can detect a bit of citrus too but virtually no almond. It is a very photorealistic root beer float, and as somebody who can be sensitive to a lot of fragrances I can't find another vanilla scent that stays away from being powdery and headache-y the way this one does.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Mandorlo di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content: This reminds me of something I've smelled before. Beautiful, romantic, nostalgic fragrance with a med strong sillage, very sweet a little too sweet but otherwise perfect Mediterranean fragrance.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Mandorlo di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Mandorlo di Sicilia by Acqua di Parma is a delightful journey to the heart of Sicily, encapsulating its warmth and charm. The opening notes of star anise, bergamot, and orange blossom create a sweet, citrusy introduction that is both inviting and uplifting. As the fragrance evolves, the heart reveals a creamy blend of green almond and ylang-ylang, evoking the scent of Sicilian marzipan.

The base notes of cedarwood, vanilla, and white musk add a comforting, lasting warmth that lingers beautifully on the skin. The longevity is impressive, easily lasting throughout the day, while the sillage is moderate, leaving a gentle, memorable trail. Mandorlo di Sicilia is a harmonious blend of sweetness and sophistication, making it a truly enchanting fragrance experience.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Mandorlo di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content: 5/10, smells like straight up root beer for half an hour and then it’s gone.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Mandorlo di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content:
45 minutes of fizzy vanilla root beer heaven

I’m pretty sure this is the only short lived fragrance that I’ll ever keep

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Mandorlo di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content: Nothing special about it, for sure it is too sweet. Smells boring and outdated.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Mandorlo di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content: This smelled great at first, a light summer gourmand with a root beer vibe. As my bottle maturated, the anise note became too dominant. This fragrance also had longevity issues no matter how much I oversprayed. I rehomed my huge 5oz bottle.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Mandorlo di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content: Women's perfume level sweet. Makes me a little bit sick. Not a bad smell, it's just too much.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Mandorlo di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content: Just came back from an online review of ADP and this was my favourite of 10 ADPs - at least on paper. On skin it smells sweeter. I'm a mid 50s bald, straight male and while it's more feminine than I'd like, I'm more than willing to wear high quality oriental style fragrances like Mandorlo di Sicilia especially ones that smell like root beer.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Mandorlo di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content: Blind bought after reading reviews. I wish I would love this one but it's too sweet and smells like rootbeer float, not the almond scent I'm looking for.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Mandorlo di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content: Gourmand almond great for fall.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Mandorlo di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content: I didn't know root beer could smell sexy but here we are. I get root beer float from this and I actually really like it. I get the root beer vibe from Caramel Cascade too so I like to layer them! I wonder if it's the almond/anise combo? Either way I enjoy this one.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Mandorlo di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content: It was a blast of rootbeer float complete with vanilla ice cream on first spray. The drydown was better on my skin. I like the creaminess of the vanilla and the “rootbeer” taking a step back.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Mandorlo di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content: Love at first sniff!! Smells like an almond biscotti with candied orange, kind of like a Pannetone fresh out the oven. Not too sweet, not too food like but still delicious and gourmand. It is a beautiful fragrance!!

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Mandorlo di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content: I can't explain in words how much I love Mandorlo di Sicilia

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Mandorlo di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content: ELEGANTLY made almond! It is sweet but not dessert-like, it is very beautiful, likeable if you are an almond lover. Really creamy, soft base

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Mandorlo di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I am gourmand lover perfume; more foody it smells, better for me so I was so excited to try this. Unfortunately, i have to agree with most comments; the scent is weak and also on me it smells like burnt rubber, on dry down I can detect some almond but otherwise this is nothing close to nice almond perfume.
Italica is still no 1 almond perfume for me.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Mandorlo di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Okay honestly I kind of get the root beer float comparisons, but MOSTLY, this smells to me like almond extract made into perfume. Literally as soon as I sprayed it, it smelled like I was sniffing a bottle of almond extract, but without the sharp alcohol that you get from that.

The best way I can describe this scent is if you got a whiff of almond extract in your kitchen after making vanilla shortbread cookies 6 hours ago. You really get more of that gourmand 'almond cookie' smell in the air, while you get a hint of the star anise if you smell this directly off of your hand or wherever you applied it (I always apply on the back of my hand the first time I try a perfume).

This to me is the definition of gourmand and I'm now realizing is one of the only "true gourmands" that I've ever tried. I can literally almost taste it. Beautiful stuff, if you like almond cookies or the smell of almond extract you will LOVE this. I don't think it's overly sweet at all but that's purely subjective and up to personal preference and sweetness tolerance, of course. Having purchased a 5oz bottle with about 4.25oz remaining for $50 off marketplace, I'm a very happy man. For the money I paid, this is an insane deal but even for the money Jomashop is charging for the full 5oz bottle, it's still an amazing price IMO.

Projection is STRONG for the first half hour to an hour. One spray on the back of my hand completely filled my space (I was in the car at the time, which probably contributed, since my hand was closer in proximity to my face than it usually would be just walking around), and surrounded me in a delicious scent cloud on my drive home. After that first hour, it mellows out and has probably a half foot of projection but like I said, you will continue to get whiffs of it in the air. Even though the perfume itself is not super strong on my skin after two hours, I'm still smelling it in the air which to me is a positive sign. Great for going out for errands, maybe even for wearing to sleep or just around the house.

I know low longevity is viewed as a negative by most of the community, who want something that will last all day, but it becomes irritating for me at times. A lot of the time, I want to be able to spray something in the morning and apply something else entirely in the evening depending on how I'm feeling then. Super strong perfumery makes this difficult and while I love a long-lasting perfume, I'm starting to find a lot of joy in perfumes like this that light up your world and give you the smell you're craving for a couple hours and then allow you to move on.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Mandorlo di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content: Very similar to the sadly discontinued Jo Malone Vanilla & Anise. Delicious, mouth watering almond cookie with the slightest hint of black licorice/anise. I love how soft and delicate this fragrance is. I think it's impossible to overspray.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Mandorlo di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content:
This smells like an adult version of a rootbeer float. Light, effervescent, playful. Something you might enjoy on a small yacht off the coast of Amalfi. Small batch soda with less sugar and more anise, vanilla bean gelato, blazing hot sun but a cool oceanic breeze ruffling your big sun hat. The most dominant notes are certainly the vanilla, green almond and anise - but are followed closely by the Ylang Ylang, peach and something warm and a little bitter/earthy grounding it all … probably the tolu balsam.

I also get black jujube from this. I love it! A unique summer gourmand.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Mandorlo di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content: Pretty exotic cologne to wear if you're a guy. I love it! I get why some other dudes wouldn't wear this, but I do because it fits my personality. It's really hard to pull off a gourmand fragrance for the summer, but this one gets the job done. Performance is lackluster on my skin, so I recommend you to get a bigger bottle (150 ml) so you can reapply it during the day. I would buy it again because it smells so unique and natural, like creamy vanilla and green almonds.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Mandorlo di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I blind bought a 150ml. I know. That was dumb.
It got such good reviews though, except for the longevity which I can overlook because I bought such a large bottle and I really wanted a nice quality vanilla in my newly forming collection.
On first spray I thought, this smells like wintergreen, which in my mind the only thing that smells like wintergreen is Pepto Bismol.
Then I re-read some reviews that said it smelled like rootbeer. Now I'm thinking, yes, I can get that.
Then I saw one that says it is like a creamy rootbeer float. Now, yes, I can get that too.
So weird.
I'm not mad that it doesn't last that long.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Mandorlo di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content: One of my favourite scents... but it only lasts for a fleeting moment. Such a shame.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Mandorlo di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content: very lovely scent

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Mandorlo di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I really don't understand what is being sold here. This is so weak, i just smell nothing.
By far the weakest perfume i have ever had.
Vanilla smells like playdough......

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Mandorlo di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content: This smell like a creamy root beer float to me, I love it! It lasts about 6 hours on me and it’s available at lots of discounters. I blind bought a 30ml and I’m going to get a bigger bottle.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Mandorlo di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Sweet summer scent without being cloying.
My fiancé is crazy for it and thinks it smells like Kinder Bueno😀
This is a perfume I would wear strolling around the streets of Italy with a flattering summer dress 👗

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Mandorlo di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content: It's such a soft and sweet scent ! People are saying it smells like rootbeer and it's so true. I'm excited to wear it next summer, it's not to cloying and perfect for hot days. At first I was a bit scared because of the anise note, but I don't smell it that much in the opening.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Mandorlo di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content: This is very nice and pretty unique. Powdery, sweet, vanillic, a bit floral. Star anise and almond make it a very nice vanilla scent. Cute, pretty but not childish blend. I would not crave for it but it is still enjoyable to wear. Haven't tried anything like it before.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Mandorlo di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content: Smells like rootbeer, has that strange aspartame almost scent, like what a diet coke tastes like that's what this smells like lol that's the only way I can describe it. Mukhallat has a similar quality about it. I do like this scent but it is strange on the skin at first.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Mandorlo di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content: This has to be one of those scents that just doesn’t agree with my skin…. Sickly vanilla and a strange medicinal scent… It’s a no from me 🙃

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Mandorlo di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content: This smells just like a freshly opened root beer soda from start to finish. The dry down has a bit of a playdough vanilla quality to it.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Mandorlo di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content: this is heaven. An almond pastry with vanilla and a peach filling. Its so soft and quiet like a petite little white mouse that belongs to a princess sleeping on a small satin pillow.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Mandorlo di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content: definitely smells like root beer to me

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Mandorlo di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content: Smells like a girl I'd want to date. I got it in a trade thinking it was more gender neutral. It's definitely feminine. But it does smell really good. In my opinion, I'd rather smell this on a woman than Baccarat Rouge.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Mandorlo di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content:
My son's favorite fragrance of all time (he's almost 10🤭)
💕

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Mandorlo di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content: Impossible to detect - smelled multiple different samples in so any differnet stores, on skin and on paper, many times, throughout a whole day, with many sprays. This smells like nothing. Not once have I been able to smell the scent of this no matter how or where I spray it, very saddening

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Mandorlo di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content:
توی حراج از فروشگاهی در وزرا تابستان امسال خریدم-همراه چندین کار دیگه- و بعد به خودم گفتم ببین دهها سال عطربازی میکنی و صدها و صدها عطر خریدی و اکوا دی پارما برند محبوب ات خاصه لدر که حداقل چهارپنج بار 180 میلش از قیمت 500تومن پرفیوم شاپینگ و بعد 700نوبهار تا آخرین بار دوتا 180 میل همراه عود همین برند از نوبهار گرفتم و قبلش هم دوبار از شقایق و همگی حدود 3200 بودن- اما حالا یکدفعه مزخرفترین کار این برند را فقط چون پنجاه درصد آف داشت خریدی و خاک بر سرت واقعا
کیفیت کار خوب مثل بقیه کارای اکوا دی پارما خوب اما ماهیت کار چی؟ اعوجاج محض و سردرگمی ناب و بوی بادامی که همیشه هست اما ابدا لذتی نداره-درحالیکه من از بوی بادام تو مجدا بکالی تولایتولو خوشم میاد و عاشق بادام در تمام کارهای گرلن ایدل هستم خاصه ایدل کولون که عطر خنک تابستانه محبوب من و بیش از عطرهای چهارصدپانصددلاری خنک ازش فیدبک گرفتم-حال اینکه رفتار من گونه ای هست که طرف عاشق بوی عطرم باشه روش نمیشه بپرسه چی زدی اما هرجا رفتم علیرغم میلم ازم درباب ایدل کولون گرلن پرسیدن که همان سال اول ورودش از عباسی پرفیوم شاپینگ گرفته بودم 200تومن یا کمی کمتر- اما این اکوا دی پارما مسئله اش تنها بادامی که بوی بیمارستان و روغن بادام های چیپ میده نیست-بادام اینکار شبیه یکی از مزخرف ترین عطرهای مزخرف ترین برند گمنام نیش ایتالیایی کوکیلت است که اسمش سولمونا و من از شقایق گرفتم زیر پانصدتومن پارسال درحالیکه قیمت جهانی اش نزدیک 200دلار و بعد فهمیدم ده دلار هم نمی ارزه گرچه کیفیت نت ها و وضوح شان بد نیست- نکته افتضاح کار ترکیب بادام و وانیل که در پودری-میوه ای و کمی فلورال و البته با حضوری مزبوحانه از سرک کشیدن نت های مرکباتی که میخواد کارو خنک نشون بده وضعیت مضحکی پدید آورده که همان تست اول به خودت میگی این کار قراره کجا بپوشم و چرا بپوشم و اصلا چی هست؟ خنک اما شیرین همراه با گرمایی بالزامیکی مانند و تلخی بادامی و گرم اما نه اونطور که امیدوار باشی یه روز خنک بهاری یا پاییزی خودی نشون بده. تو تابستون هم قطعا اگر از بی هویتی اش سردرنیاری و با بوی چندش بادام-وانیل-میوه ای اش مشکلی نداشته باشی بازم از سردردی که گرما و تلخی نچسب بادام چیپ و وانیلی که مرزش با مشک و..مثل مرزهای نظام ما با زندگی خصوصی بهم ریخته است, خودت و دیگران را فراری میده
به باور من مفت گرون و هرچی نوشتم دربرابر این جمله دو کلمه ای زیاده گویی و اطناب روده درازانه بود.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Mandorlo di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content: Smells a lot like LIRA to me. Does not have quite as much citrus on the opening but dry down is very similar, powdery, sweet, vanilla and almond. I am considering buying this but already have a bottle of LIRA and don’t find them different enough to justify it.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Mandorlo di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content: This was magical upon first spray. Sweet, almond, vanilla, smelt like baking cookies. However, this fizzy cookie smell disappeared within seconds. Now it smells like sweetened Dr. Pepper on my skin

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Mandorlo di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content: Delicious, just like cantuccini. Sweet almond vanilla. Lasts quite a while and is a warm and comforting high quality perfume.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Mandorlo di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content:
The least interesting fragrance ever made by the Acqua di Parma house.
Unimpressive.
A feminine super-sweet bomb that's linear from beginning to end and it's cloying like hell.
There are literally other 3 dozen fragrances with the same scent profile one can buy, even by a cheaper price.
A huge pass.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Mandorlo di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content: Smells just like bubble gum in entry a very sweet feminine like fragrance recommend for office

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Mandorlo di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content: Very weak and sweet. It does smell like root beer, and there is nothing appealing or distinctive about this fragrance except that it's inoffensive and easy to wear. Maybe I don't get the Acqua di Parma vibe as I don't think I have liked anything I've smelled from the house.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Mandorlo di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content: Love this - yummy, spicy, almondy, almost root beer scent. It feels like a summer version of the roasted cinnamon almonds at German Christmas markets. I am going to have to sample a few more times, as it might be a bit too sweet and gave me a headache with extended wear.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Mandorlo di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content:
This is a bright, fizzy root beer on my skin and I'm IN LOVE. It's exactly as I hoped it would be and is so different to anything I've liked and owned. I'm putting it on my Christmas wishlist and hope to wear it all next spring and summer, because even though it doesn't last very long I'm happy to respray and get another fresh hit of it.

Disclaimer: All my reviews are my personal scent opinion only, please take them with a grain of salt!

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Mandorlo di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content:
A sweet, creamy gourmand but it’s light rather than dense so it’s great for spring/summer. I hate liquorice/aniseed and was worried the star anise would lean that way but it doesn’t at all it’s just a hint of spice/aromatic nuances.

it’s an edt so it’s not in your face but you get little wafts through out the day.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Mandorlo di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content:
The root beer (or for non-U.S folks like myself, dandelion and burdock or sarsparilla soda) vibe sitting atop a sweet and creamy almond and vanilla, is unique in such a summery perfume. It’s sweet and light and undeniably pretty, but the medicinal feel of the spices are definitely an acquired taste. I like it, but probably not enough to invest in a full bottle.

I’ve had Dragée from the Notes Gourmand range by Reminiscence and that one isn’t as interesting as this and it’s sweeter and more powdery. I don’t think this really smells like Green Lover by Lolita Lempicka as that’s fresher and more zingy. The unusual scent in that one is less root beer and more gin and tonic…. It’s got a bitter tannin bite rather than an antiseptic one. It’s Root Beer mixed with Cream Soda like @N|ne said!

I feel like this is closest over all to Dior’s Hypnotic Poison, in that it’s sweet and almondy but has that root beer-like scent that persists throughout the wear. Mandorlo di Sicilia seems like the perfect summer perfume for anybody who loves HP in colder weather!

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Mandorlo di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content: It’s a lovely vanilla, almond scent. Yes it smells like root beer but I’m good with that. It smells delicious and is subtle enough for everyday I feel as well. It’s a comfy, cozy scent. I love that it means almonds from Sicily because my family is Sicilian. Basically why I bought the fragrance 😩😂 but it smells amazing too!

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Mandorlo di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content: Hyperrealistic cream soda - vanilla and almond with anise. Very soft skin scent. Drydown is powdery with a touch of peach skin and citrus but very light. Really loved the notes listed for this scent but the anise just takes over.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Mandorlo di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content: #166 in my "Tour de Fragrance" Root beer float with vanilla ice cream topped with sliced almonds, and maybe a dash of some sort of berry flavored Kool-Aid? Hard to identify specifically. Could be strawberry or cherry. Can't really tell. It's different. I'll give them that. That super-sweet, powdered drink mix scent is a bridge too far for me. But I give AdP a "C' for creativity on this one.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Mandorlo di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content: Too feminine for me. But I like how it smells.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Mandorlo di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content: I really like this scent. With the almond, anise and vanilla combined, it reminds me of a freshly baked cupcake, even more than other perfumes that are purposely trying to be cupcake-like.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Mandorlo di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I fell for this one hard after a friend gave me a decant, and now I have several bottles.

It’s a strong vanilla almond on me with star anise as a supporting player. I have no idea why this gives off a root beer or soda scent but it does and I’m here for it. It’s more than that of course, but I love the entirety of it. It doesn’t remind me of any (so far) in the “reminds me of” section. It’s so unique to me.

In my California Mediterranean climate and on my normal to dry skin, I get wonderful strong sillage, and it lasts on my skin almost 24 hours, until I take my next shower. Sure it’s a skin scent by then, but it’s still a strong skin scent. Before that I get 3-6 feet of sillage. I hope they never stop making this!

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Mandorlo di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content: Spring, Fall Scent: 4,5/10 Sweet, Almondy and a bit minty in the opening. The scent is sweet and too feminin and cloying for me. It smells nice but I think there are better, less sweet scents out there. The most noticeable note in the drydown is without a doubt the almond. Great for the spring without a doubt. Silage 6/10 Longevity 7/10

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Mandorlo di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content: The opening was wonderful with light almond mixed with a hint of mandarin. The vanilla which came later was also light. Rather soft a fragrance. Too soft for my liking but then again I can always add more sprays.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Mandorlo di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I’m in my third day of sampling this perfume along with the rest of the Blu Mediterraneo line.

I was immediately drawn to this because to my nose it is HIGHLY reminiscent of Diptyque Eau Duelle which I adore. Same sweet but dry vanilla smell that permeates the entire wear.

Outside of the initial spritz, I don’t get much citrus but I’m continuing to test as it could just be nose fatigue. It’s sweet and definitely feels like a gourmand to me, but it’s not heavy at all. Feels especially great for the late days of spring/early days of summer where there’s sun but still cooler temps. I’m excited to test in the heat. It wears close to the skin and is inviting.

It’s also the longest wearing of the BM group. That’s not necessarily saying much, but it leaves a much longer impression than the other scents so far, particularly Fico di Amalfi and Arancia di Capri.

So far I’m enjoying this a lot but am not sure if it’s full bottle worthy. I just can’t tell if I love this on myself as much as I love to smell it around me.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Mandorlo di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content: Starts out smelling of sweet almond extract on my skin, dries down to fizzy cream soda w a splash of root beer. Very pleasant very sweet. I was thinking it was very feminine but then it reminded me of a sweet yet masc frag my dear father used to have and wear occasionally called Cigar, remy lateur (sp?). So I can see the unisex factor.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Mandorlo di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content: Very sweet for a cologne. Performance on me was sub par unfortunately - done in 20 minutes.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Mandorlo di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content: very pretty scent but it doesn't last long. nice powdery and sweet !

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Mandorlo di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Since I think most of the citrus powered summer fragrances smell like lemon scented toilet air fresheners, this is definitely a nice light sweet alternative to use.
Vanilla and powdery notes is all it projects for me, but in a unique way.
Unfortunately do not last long for me, but till it does its a warm experience.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Mandorlo di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Star anise is the strongest note I can pick out. The vanilla makes it quite creamy. This is definitely a gourmand, so don’t expect any freshness from the citrus notes. It’s not there. I can’t pick out the floral notes, either.

Edit: as this developed, I could smell some similarities with Map of the Heart V7. Not a dupe, but similar enough to make me notice. Map of the heart is medicinal, though. I don’t believe this fragrance is.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Mandorlo di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content: such a nice scent!!! but does not last!!!!!!

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Mandorlo di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content: I got this to use as my new summer scent. I loved it in the store and it lasted about 10 hours on my wrist, but after using it the day after, it only lasted about 4 hours, and my friend said you could barely smell it when she hugged me. I wanted to use this fragrance as my signature summer scent, but I'm not going to as the performance is too disappointing.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Mandorlo di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Not for me...
Sickly sweet and headache inducing.
I don't follow into the zeitgeist of the "gourmand" trending, everything is so cloying and obnoxious.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Mandorlo di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content: Sometimes I spray this and it's lovely and soft and sweet and I really like it. On the other hand, the almond can come through as very synthetic and screechy and throws everything off balance. On me, it see-saws between the two.I don't think I'd splash out on a full bottle of this because I don't love it, but if realistic gourmands are your thing, this would be a lovely scent to wear in the sunshine. It's very light and airy but as an EDT, don't expect it to stick around too long.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Mandorlo di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Just the perfect, balanced, elegant almond scent. I absolutely adore this perfume and wear it a lot, especially in summer and as a go to bed scent. It is unique: cozy, warm and fresh at the same time, sweet but not cloying, gourmand without smelling like food.
In the wintertime I layer it with Eclats d'Amande by CSP to amp up the almond vibe. In summer it can be combined with the Arancia di Capri from the same range or any other citrus fragrance.
10/10, a masterpiece.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Mandorlo di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content: This smells like a Vanilla Coke added to a root beer float. Yum!

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Mandorlo di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content: I does indeed smell like root beer! Initial spray is a little medicinal, but then turns into sweet root beer. After a few hours lovely spicy vanilla almond.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Mandorlo di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content: The scent is nice but it is so faint and weak, I can barely smell it!! 0 Projection so I don't see the point. Also the almond is pretty weak, its mainly creamy vanilla.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Mandorlo di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content: Strong almond vanilla scent. Feminine. I read some other comment about it being similar to 1 million and I agree. I tried it from a tester at the Malaga airport. Sillage is powerful, longevity impressive.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Mandorlo di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content: This smells like a creamy root beer. It has a sweet drydown but I would say it’s light enough that it is suitable for summer. My only gripe about these fragrances from Acqua di Parma is that they are EDT and don’t last too long on skin.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Mandorlo di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content:
2024 Update: After having experienced how it behaves on fabric and skin in the summer heat…I started loving it. I also regularly layer it w L’Occitane Eau de Baux, which works really well.

2023: When a friend who lost interest in it gave me his 30 ml, I really wanted to love it. But so far I get associations with 1970’s suntan and other cosmetics. Somehow it feels like it never knows what the right time or place is for itself :/

Still winter here so I haven’t tried it in warm weather yet; maybe it becomes really sexy when all you need to wear is a T-shirt, I’m hoping that’s the case.

Either way this is not a comfortable transporting easy almond/vanill to me (like my beloved Etro Heliotrope is); something feels off. So interesting how differently we perceive these things.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Mandorlo di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Honestly the perfume parlour dupe of this is even better
Just wish it was more accessible for me

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Mandorlo di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content: Based on the notes I thought I’d love this, but sadly, it’s not for me. I don’t get any almond (which is my favourite note). It opens with super strong alcohol, probably the strongest in my collection, and it lasts about 5 mins. The vanilla is pretty strong for the first half hour on me, and then the star anise just takes over and for the rest of the wear it’s liquorice and cedar. This makes me headachey and feel sick. The wear time on my skin was very good, 8hrs and then skin scent for the next 2hrs. Overall, not for me and not what I was expecting. If you like liquorice then I think you’ll love this.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Mandorlo di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content: Root beer, Jordan almonds, then unfortunately almost instantly disappears on me, and I can’t smell a thing. Gave it to my mum and for whatever reason I can smell it on her, and it’s lovely.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Mandorlo di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content: Rootbeer Float! This is what I get from Mandorlo di Sicilia. IMHO this scent lean feminine, but I can still wear this one. Almondy, Anisey, sweet Vanille, and balsamic. It's unique, but still easy to understand. The performance is good, it last around 7-8 hours with moderate projection. My wife also wear it for her daily rotation, but the opposite from her opinion this is lean to masculine. So it's still quite subjective, this leaning to feminine or masculine. Love it!

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Mandorlo di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content: Delicious sweet Italian almond dessert. Longevity and projection is really poor, which is just tragic because this could be my signature. It’s a unique gourmand because it’s cold and sweet like a toothache with all the smooth creaminess of the almond.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Mandorlo di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Smells great - like a dessert.
What surprises me is that it is not that heavy, it is rather airy and fresh despite the almond and the vanilla.
Probably the most feminine-leaning fragrance that I have smelt from the Blu Mediterraneo line.
It is a nice subtle and intimate scent, but nothing extremely special. 6,5/10.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Mandorlo di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content: Smells like a Dentist clinic

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Mandorlo di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content: Got a sample yesterday and sprang for the full bottle today. Smells like creamy root beer at first and dries down to a sweet comforting skin scent with a vanilla note. It’s unique and I have never smelled anything like it. So far Acqua di Parma hasn’t disappointed me ! Can’t wait to try the rest of the blue line

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Mandorlo di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Lovely gourmand without being immature or cheap smelling. I wore this on my wedding day back in 2012, it was between this or Chanel Cristalle eau Verte and I chose this in the end. I love layering this with Arancia di Capri for a stunning summery creamsicle scent.
I can’t think of any fragrance I’d compare this to, which is a compliment.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Mandorlo di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content: Heavy almond like Pegasus but ....light...a timeless classic

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Mandorlo di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Imagine taking a stroll through a Christmas market in Central Europe - the scent of warm roasted almonds coated in powdered sugar mingles with the aroma of vanilla chimney cakes and anise cookies. For the past 8 years Mandorlo di Sicilia has been my scent of choice for the Advent season - warm, cozy and delicious. This is a true gourmand without a trace of synthetics. Lasts for about 6 hours and stays close to the skin but I don't mind reapplying.
I've worn it in summer too but it felt out of season. It is at Christmas when it is truly beautiful. A great day scent to wear while gift shopping and baking the traditional Czech almond vanilla rolls and the other 20+ kinds of cookies.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Mandorlo di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content: If I were told this only had 3 notes, I'd believe it... the almond, star anise, and vanilla are the major notes. This is an easy reach scent. Inoffensive & appropriate for most weather and occasions. It wears close to the skin and is practically impossible to overspray. After 2 hours it's only a skin scent, but continues to linger about 6 hours. I agree with the comparisons to Rouge Smoking due to the "soda" vibe of this scent, but Rouge's sillage is much better (as it should be for the price). You could also picture Jean Paul Gaultier Classique having a baby with Kilian Love Don't Be Shy. Overall, it's a pleasant, spicy almond scent to throw on when you're not trying to make a statement.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Mandorlo di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content:
It can be a little difficult to find yummy, cozy gourmands that work really well in the heat of summer. Mandorlo di Sicilia is one that smells amazing in the summer. It is airy and fresh and smells like a cross between and almond cookie and a fizzy rootbeer.

The opening is fizzy rootbeer for me. It is sweet, spicy and effervescent. As it dries on the skin the effervescence goes away and I start to smell the almond and it transitions from fizzy rootbeer to spiced almond cookie. Sometimes the scent transitions fairly quickly, within an hour. Other times the rootbeer stage last 2-3 hours. I love both phases, so I am happy to enjoy both of them

I wear this most often in the summer, but it's beautiful all year and it usually makes it into the rotation in cooler weather as well. It is a pretty unisex fragrance, but does lean a little more to the feminine side
The first time I smelled this fragrance I was transported back to my childhood. There must have been a hair/skin/body care product that share a similar profile, because this is how my grandpa smelled on Sunday morning going to church. My grandpa has been gone a long time, so everytime I wear this I am reminded of one of the kindest, gentlest, funny men I ever knew. I'm sure at least part of my love for this fragrance comes from that.

The performance of this fragrance is so much better than I expected. The Blu Mediterraneo line is not known for it's performance, but Mandorlo di Sicilia lasts all day and has a deceptively strong projection. I have been complimented wearing this most times I wear it. Even when everyone was wearing masks I was complimented by a cashier behind plexiglass, wearing a mask. I can smell it all around myself most of the day when I am wearing it, at leats 8-10 hours.

I have a couple other fragrances that share some similarities with this one, but Mandorlo di Sicilia is my favourite.
Lolita Lempicka Green Lover is a bit similar, but it is a bit heavier and leans more green. It is also a bit more masculine. It may be an good choice for anyone that finds this one a bit too feminine, but want something similar. The drydown of Nishane Ani is also similar, but it is the deeper, heavier version.

The ADP Blu Mediterraneo bottles are a beautiful cobalt blue. The bottle has a generous sprayer and I only need to apply 3-4 sprays for excellent performance.
The retail price of this line is pretty steep, but Mandorlo di Sicilia is an excellent fragrance with solid performance and attractive packaging. Tester bottles are often available for a steal and are an excellent choice for anyone on a bit of a budget.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Mandorlo di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content:
This smells like how some bubble gum tastes....but in a good way.

You get a fresh medicinal smell and maybe that's why some people think it smells like root beer.

Anyways, it smells great and you won't smell like Macy's or Sephora

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Mandorlo di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content: Smells like a vanilla icecream mixed with candied almonds. Imma get this as my signature scent!!! 10/10 love this one

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Mandorlo di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content: The opening smells like pure root beer. After 15 minutes or so, it dries down to a sweet vanilla. It lingers as a soft skin scent. Definitely for gourmand lovers.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Mandorlo di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content: Smells just like root beer!!! Kind of too sweet even though I do like sweet perfumes this is a bit much for me.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Mandorlo di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content: I bought this on a whim a few years back and turned off it very quickly, found it a bit sickly. Fast forward and I’m trying out Love by Kilian due to the beautiful bottle and the hype, found it a little too sweet and it reminded me of something. then it hit me , My unloved Aqua Di Parma Mandorlo. This would be a good substitute for Love, longevity is not the best.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Mandorlo di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content: its a beautiful, rich, yet airy gourmand fragrance. However i had to declutter it because the longevity and sillage was very minimal on my skin.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Mandorlo di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Oh my goodness! This is beautiful! Warm and inviting and not overly sweet. This is wonderful!!
This was a blind buy because I purchased the big 5 oz. bottle on sale and I am thrilled to say it is a hit!!

Masterfully blended, the notes are working together to create a warm and cozy feeling. I personally think that this would work all year long regardless of the seasons, of course, this is only my humble opinion. There is florals, fruits, vanilla and woods and it works perfectly well on my skin (I cannot tell you how happy that makes me ✨😆✨)!!

All in all, an excellent purchase, a wonderful scent and a happy me!!

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Mandorlo di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content: I agree with this being described as "fresh" and find it to be a fresh woody gourmand. It's almost like vanilla mint ice cream, or a root beer float, from the start and develops into a cedar-balsam based Jordan almond scent after a while. Sort of collectively reminds me of teaberry, which is a Pennsylvania-centric flavor made from a wintergreen plant, thus has a bit of a minty flavor, and is often an ice cream flavor at PA ice cream parlors (and where I'm from). At the same time, I do sense the anise and almond and see how that translates to a sort of minty-herbal sort of smell. Reminds me a tad of candy-coated fennel seeds as well (fennel seeds and anise give off a similar vibe in my opinion, although less licoricey in fennel seeds). It is largely a vanilla scent when all is said and done with hints of the aforementioned. Not a rich or heavy vanilla, but a chilled vanilla that is not at all overpowering on even the hottest of days. I used up an 8 mL travel spray of it and found it to be quite long lasting on my oily-leaning skin, especially in the summer. It made me feel yummy smelling, yet clean, and sort of classy while also wearable for work and the outdoors. Maybe I'm partial to this scent also because my grandparents on my dad's side are from Sicily and Calabria and feel a sort of connection to it in that way also. I want to get a full bottle of this at some point!

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Mandorlo di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I don’t really understand the hype about this one, I assume it’s because many people enjoy powdery sweet nutty vanilla scents, but to me all I get with this one is a heavily sweetened almond flour with a good amount of icing sugar and vanilla powder and some fruity notes and a bit of woods.
Not bad, I would wear it if it was given to me but really not something I would personally buy.
I was really hoping for some amaretto or almond granita, but there is none of that dark bitterness here, just a bright gourmand powdery vibe, perhaps even slightly cloying at times.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Mandorlo di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content: This is guaranteed natural sweet delicious granita memories of holidays in Sicily. So glad to have a big bottle. Absolutely gorgeous. Not sickly. Fresh, uplifting, comforting. Great to wear when you plan to have a delightful day. Feels like sitting in a town square in the sun wearing a nice floaty dress eating almond granite and brioche giggling with your best pal.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Mandorlo di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content: Was looking for a scent that would give me Dior hypnotic poison vibes but for daytime and high heat. Love how carbonated the opening feels but unsure if it turns into too much of a plain vanilla. I wish the root-beer scent lasted longer.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Mandorlo di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content: A soft and inoffensive gourmand - it does have a component of the Dr. Pepper note but I'm into it. It's like a Dr. Pepper, soft sweet almond. I would call this full bottle worthy if it was stronger and with better performance - for me it lasts about 1 hour and then I need to reapply.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Mandorlo di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content: I had this perfume and I decided to give away. It’s more feminine than musculine, so my husband wouldn’t wear it. It’s not long lasting and doesn’t project that well. I think Diptyque Eau Delle is a bit similar.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Mandorlo di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content: love it but I wish it lasted longer on me

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Mandorlo di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content: Absolutely love this gorgeously elegant green almond beauty. The anise at the beginning makes it wonderully unusual. (It also makes this smell like root beer to many at the start; anise fades away within 15-20 mins, and the almond tree because the star.) Blends well with everything from boozy Angel's Share for a date night, to any citrus MFK or a soft peach (eg Peche Cardinal) for a hot summer day. Much less sweet than some of my other favorite nut/vanillas, like Xerjoff's Italica. This is a classic and a crowd-pleaser for such good reason. You can wear it anytime, to anywhere; it is unlikely to offend, and highly likely to snag a compliment.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Mandorlo di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content: I cannot get over the fact that it smells like Dr. Pepper :(

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Mandorlo di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content: Smells like ice cream, cookies, pie, archangels! Essentially an anti-perfume and just a fantastic smell. Suitable for all weather and occasions. Never cloying, not masc or fem, just perfecto. The almond comes off green (mandorlo means almond tree) which keeps it in perfect balance with the vanilla, not becoming too sweet. Projection is enough for it be noticeable yet inoffensive. And longevity is great especially on clothes. I can't get enough of it. 5oz bottle worthy.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Mandorlo di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Probably my fav from the entire house.

It's a well-balanced gourmand, not cloying as the usual ADP style. It opens with an orange, kinda play-doughy. But it gets better as it drys down. I mostly pick up was vanilla, lots of vanilla - soft, creamy and adds a hint of sweetness. It reminds me of BDK Rouge Smoking a lot. The vanilla is well blended in the almond, which is the same type I find in Rose D'amalfi. This is more wearable than D'amalfi as that one is too dense and can choke the wearer sometimes.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Mandorlo di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content: I’ve been sampling different almond scents. For the first 30 minutes this smells exactly like root beer on me! Then after that it settles to just a nice vanilla. It surprised me with how long it lasted on me, like 10 hours as a skin scent. I might consider buying a full bottle but honestly I think it would serve the same purpose for me as Kayali Vanilla 28 which I already have. For a more recognizable Almond, I’m also sampling Comptoire Sud Pacifique Eclats d’Amande which gives me something more distinguishable from pure vanilla. I’ll probably end up buying that.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Mandorlo di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content:
incredibly smooth, sweet, inviting and powdery blend.

the peach adds a backbone to this profile that is just unmistakably good. in terms of niche summer perfumery, this is very underrated, especially for the price

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Mandorlo di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content: The opening and first half hour smell like I am eating vanilla pudding. Which is great! This scent is perfect to layer with other scents, the vanilla and almond notes are the perfect sweet base for some more orange or citrus like perfumes on top, for example hermes scents.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Mandorlo di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content: You know those tea cookies that smell SO good, but then they taste like sawdust? This is that. And I absolutely mean that in a good way-- it smells delicious without being very sweet, it's amazing. I mostly get the almond and the anise, and I have to search a little for the other notes-- but those two are so great together, they're creamy and slightly warm without being stifling, and they mix so well together but you can still smell both. I was a little scared of this perfume because I don't like licorice, but this doesn't smell like licorice, it smells like fresh anise, with that deep, slight fruitiness that's so smooth but sharp enough to be noticed.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Mandorlo di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content: I spent a week in August 2021 by the pool in a small Bulgarian village nestled among the mountains. This eau de toilette, though rich in the kind of notes that heat can turn sickening, was an incredibly light companion to those languorous summer days. Doused in it after going to the pool, the balsam cooled my chlorinated, sunburnt skin. Mingling with cigarette smoke as we whiled away the nights at long dinners. Picking up the glass cola bottles from the night before and saving the caps. Eating ice cream on slow, humid hikes up the leafy, dewy mountainous forests.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Mandorlo di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
