review_content: To me this smells exactly like creamy, vanilla-y root beer. It smelled pretty linear in that respect from start to finish, but I loved it so I don't mind that about it. It's so delicious and truly unisex. Longevity isn't great given that this is an EDT, but it looks like you can get a big bottle from Jomashop for a good price, so I wouldn't mind overspraying. I'd wear this all year round.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Mandorlo di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content: Root beer float! I just love the first few sprays of this scent - I can practically hear the fizz from the root beer as the scoop of vanilla ice cream drops into the glass. It's so bright and fizzy and delicious! After it settles, the root beer becomes quiet and it turns into a sunny almond-vanilla that - while gourmand - is definitely wearable in the heat of summer. I do wish it lasted longer, but reapply and there comes the root beer again, which to me is not a bad thing. This is unique, I don't own another gourmand that I love wearing in the summer.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Mandorlo di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content: This is outstanding! I find this scent to be very unique and beautiful. It kind of smells like a dessert to me, I wanna eat whatever cake this smell comes from. It lasts a fair bit and projection is pretty good for me. It certainly does not smell cheap to me at all. I think it’s very sophisticated. Totally unisex in my opinion. It’s just a beautiful smell as opposed to male or female. I highly recommend adding to your collection.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Mandorlo di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content: Opening is definitely vanilla root beer to my nose with a sorbitol (a synthetic sweetner) quality. Not pleasant. Disgusting actually. Gratefully it disappears completely within 30 minutes on me. Definitely do not recommend, not even for a gourmand fan.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Mandorlo di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content: In the perfume's defense, as someone stated below: maybe it does not smell too expensive but it definitely doesn't smell cheap.The cloud around you when wearing it is far from being the cloud of a cheap perfume. perfect for gourmand lovers in search for an appropriate gourmand for summer. I've just received my 150 ml bottle since it's juust perfect for everyday use. That's how much I love it! Totally agree with Catmo below. light, airy and delicious

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Mandorlo di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Lovely,sweet bubble gummy summer scent . On my skin very long lasting and it projects like crazy. After 1 hour it turns into pink hard candy like smelling perfume . Doesn't smell expensive (which is ok with me as isn't expensive) and it is your typical holiday vibe perfume.
I will buy it for sure as it is a gourmand lover must have during summer season .

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Mandorlo di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content: I'm not getting any of that almond gourmand scent. What I am getting is a reminder of the vanilla body spray from the body shop girls at my school used to wear that I found too sweet and weirdly alcoholic. Really sad because this was a decant I had to look hard for because I really was so excited for this perfume. Will pass it onto a relative. Hopefully it works with their chemistry better than mine.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Mandorlo di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Orange-Almonde
(It does reminds me of Root Beer)
This is the perfect holiday scent, I wore it to the beaches in Thailand.
Although I think it'd be perfect for Venice summer holiday, drinking Aperol Spritz In the sun.
It's sad that it doesnt last on me at all so I ended up never getting a full bottle of it.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Mandorlo di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content: This is hands down one of the most mouth watering fragrances I’ve probably ever tried. Smells like a vanilla and almond cake with orange zest on top. I’m kind of obsessed now. It’s similar to Lira & Ex Idolo Love & Crime but I think this one is my favorite of the three. Just because it’s so light and airy but still delicious.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Mandorlo di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content: First couple minutes is straight up Root Beer…. But the dry down, the DRYDOWN is absolutely delicious. The drydown reminds me of a Mancera fragrance because of the longevity and sillage. The vanilla isn’t too sweet, but sits wonderfully with the almond creating this almost powdery masterpiece. I usually don’t wear vanilla in the summer, but this is such a summer scent!

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Mandorlo di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content:
This is a soft, powdery & not too sweet gourmand scent, that can be worn all year round. Anise & citrus notes in the opening add a bit of freshness; almond & vanilla create a fluffy, delicious cloud, that is very addictive...
I usually wear my gourmands in autumn & winter, but Mandorlo di Sicilia is so light that I can enjoy it also in warm weather. And in winter I like to layer it with other vanilla fragrances.

List of notes from the official website:
TOP: Star Anise, Italian Bergamot, Italian Orange
HEART: Green Almond, Ylang Ylang
BASE: Madagascar Vanilla , Lebanese Cedarwood, Tolu Balsam, Musk

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Mandorlo di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I was searching for the perfect almond gourmand scent for summer which has sicilian summer vibe, and takes me back into my favourite holyday memory. And this is it!♡ Stunningly fluffy, cloud light almond desserts + freshly picked , juicy velvety soft peaches and the aromatic balmy south italian citrus scent in the air. And the composition is twisted by some anise, which makes the aromatic and fresh vibe more potent so makes the whole fragrance wearable for summer.( at least for a gourmand lover like me)
Love love love ♡

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Mandorlo di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content: Finally, I've found the scent I've been searching for to end what feels like my never ending pursuit. This is one of the few, the very few fragrances that had my heart from the moment I sprayed it until it wore off. So often a fragrance I enjoy just doesn't work with my body chemistry or I absolutely love the opening and it turns on me later on. I'm also a fan of vanilla fragrances but wanted something I could wear throughout the summer that wasn't too heavy and this was it. The almond, the anise, the vanilla, it's exceptional and I'm sold. It wears pretty close to me and has decent longevity, but because I can't get enough, of course I wish it was stronger, however I have zero issues spraying this all day. In my top 3 fragrances of all time.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Mandorlo di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content: Very sweet, vanilla ice cream. Nothing more, nothing less.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Mandorlo di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content:
A *light* almond cake, dominated by the fizzy cream soda in which it's doused.
Cute, but too sweet for me.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Mandorlo di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Folks don't let you be scared off by mk6699,
This is NOT WEAK.
Although the fragrances in the Blue Mediterraneo line are no heavy performers, unlike mk6699 is claiming, Mandorlo is a fairly good performer. Only Ginepro in the line performs better. You should get 5-6 hours out of it. This is not a skin scent either.
Unlike the rest of the line, I don't find Mandorlo a Summer fragrance. It is a bit too sweet for that. More Spring. It is though the most versatile of the line. You can wear it all year round. That was the reason I bought it as one of the first in this line.
At that time I owned and loved the Colonia line, of which I owned 3, now 4. I also had the Bergamotto di Calabria. They are all Summer/Spring fragrances.
But in the end I just don't like the combination of Almond & Citrus. I prefer Guerlain Homme Ideal Parfum kind of Almond. Real sweet and winter cozy.
It also is quite similar to HM Hanae Mori for man.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Mandorlo di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I have 5 fragrances on me currently for a mass testing, and this one is sticking out amongst the rest. That almond/vanilla cake vibe is mouth watering and is making me excited to try this in higher heat to see how it performs.


Side note:

This was totally unexpected from this line, and I highly recommend sampling this. It may be FBW.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Mandorlo di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content: It is sweet but refreshing, like a creamy almond icecream. Im getting creamed vanilla sugar, butter, almond flour baked goods with a hint of that anise spicyness. And in contrast to that is the Ylang-Ylang and Jasmine keeping it lighter and a bit more modest, preventing it from being a boring sugary mess. Its PERFECT for warm summer nights but I think you could realistically wear this any time of the year.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Mandorlo di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content: A mix between creamy rootbeer as a previous reviewer said, and sweettarts. Sweet, powdery, creamy, playful. Really great.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Mandorlo di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Recommended for those who like vanilla.
The soft sweetness of almonds also enhances the delicious aroma of vanilla.
It's a sweets perfume. Those who like the sweet scent will surely be fascinated.
Similar to the scent of parlumore guimov.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Mandorlo di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content: This is THE BEST almond fragrance ever (and I've tried every almond frag I can get my hands on)! I get a tiny bit of citrus in the opening but not much. It then it dries down to the most gorgeous almond/vanilla scent with a touch of anise (I don't usually like anise but it's beautiful in this). It smells a bit like brown cream soda. Performance is good. Projection is moderate but it lasts so long, I can put this on before bed and still smell it the next morning. Stunning gorgeous comforting gourmand for any season. In my top 3 favourite frags of all time!

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Mandorlo di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content:
‘Almond Tree from Sicily’ - A perfect and genuine gourmand!

It’s like pure sugar vanilla cookies, it really is gorgeous. It’s not overbearing or sickening. It’s still light and fresh and for an EDT lasts a long time on me (10hrs) although it has minimal projection but I can still smell it on myself here and there. A perfect summer vanilla. Almond note is brief, alongside the anise which is in the background. Very well blended, very addictive. Also excellent presentation. I bought the 30ml but I would definitely consider the larger sizes. This would go great with a coconut/vanilla body lotion. I would consider this a safe blind buy if this is your preferred scent profile.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Mandorlo di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Very medicinal smell; mint, anise and almond mixed in a way that reminds of an old wood drawer where cough drops had been kept for years.
A hard dislike for my nose. Try before buying.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Mandorlo di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Was smelling Acqua di Parma in a store with a friend and honestly not paying too much attention, until I put my nose on this. WHY HAVE I NEVER HEARD ABOUT THIS BEFORE?!

I've been looking for a gourmand-ish summer scent, and I believe THIS. IS. IT.

First thing I get is root beer with some star anise. In the best way possible.
I pick up the citruses and peach, but never get much of the florals. To me, that's a good thing ;)
Drydown is much more almond/vanilla, but in a kind of dry way. Sweet, but not sticky and very natural smelling.
Very pleasant and comforting. Great to wear to bed.

Great now in springtime, but I think it'll work all year round, and I can't wait to try it in the summertime. Think it'll be great for hot summer nights.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Mandorlo di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content:
This reminds me of ricciarelli (chewy almond meringue cookies with orange zest) and a root beer.

At first sniff I get the star anise, vanilla and almond but also some bergamot in the background. It does give off a bit of a medicinal root beer smell in the beginning and I do get why people call it minty, it's the star anise I think but it's not a cold strong mint but more of a sweet mint.

As the star anise calms down a bit the vanilla and orange begins to take over. Someone said orange tic tacs and I think that's pretty accurate. The peach hangs out a bit in the background but it is not the star of the show here. The ylang ylang is there too but very discreet. As the cedar and musk arrives the scent is basically gone.

Almond can sometimes be a hit or miss for me in fragrances but I think they really nailed it in this one, it's beautiful.

I do really love it and I have nothing like it in my collection but the projection and longevity leaves a lot to be desired and it's basically gone after 1-2 hours. I have a sample but I might get a bottle if I find a good deal on it, I don't know if I think it's really worth it for full price.

Update: So i've worn this to bed for a couple of nights now and it's just so beautiful, I love it! And I've realized that the longevity is better than I previously thought, nothing crazy but it's pretty good and lasts around 6-7 hours on my skin but it wears very close to the skin. Well, I couldn't help myself and managed to pick up a small bottle of this for a good price. Can't wait for it to arrive, it's such a unique and lovely scent.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Mandorlo di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content: Whoever is saying this is minty needs to wipe the Vicks off their upper lip. There is zero mint in this.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Mandorlo di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content: Really nice! It is perfect for summer with a mix of vanilla, anis, almonds and mandarin/orange. It reminds me bit of comptoir sud pacifique vanille iconique with anis, but more complex and less synthetic. Delicious!

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Mandorlo di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content: I've been wondering what this reminds me of and now that I've seen cortadohalo's review, it dawned on me that this smells like rootbeer. I usually like gourmands, but this isnt my cup of tea. It just smells plasticky and generally unpleasant to me.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Mandorlo di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content: A sweet wintergreen-forward rootbeer scent. The sillage is quiet, but the scent stayed present on me for several hours. Worth a try if you like sweet, gourmand, vanallic scents.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Mandorlo di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content: Minty almond vanilla. Smells like kids toothpaste. Sillage is nonexisting. Don't recommend this at all.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Mandorlo di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content:
This is one of my top favourite perfumes sweet soft & delicious, to me it smells like lemon, almond and vanilla

Cons: doesn’t last. 😭😭😭

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Mandorlo di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content: This is such a powerful sweet fragrance. Upon first spray I instantly felt like I was in a room full of birthday cake. It's definitely one of those fragrances that would be described as sickeningly sweet but I love it. It has Pink Sugar (which I don't like) vibes but with a bunch of hidden little gem notes in there. It's got a lot of depth and lasts until the next day. Even after a shower, I can faintly smell it on my skin.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Mandorlo di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content: Great scent! Reminds me a little of some kind of bubblegum! I like it but its very sweet!

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Mandorlo di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content: Such an amazing gourmand!.creamy, nutty, bright, sexy and delicious 😋. May not have great performance but this is truely q summer/springtime gourmand!😍

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Mandorlo di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content: The smell I can most liken to this is those orange flavour Tic-tac mints. Performance isn't great but works nicely as an evening scent when holidaying somewhere hot. Completely unisex in my opinion

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Mandorlo di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content:
So delicious!

Smells much like creamy root beer float.

Love it!

✨

product_name: Mandarino di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content: Underrated. Underrated. Underrated.

product_name: Mandarino di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content: This is the ugly thuggish brother of arancia Di capri. It’s weighed down with bitterness from the various zests and the musk makes it too heavy and cloying. Really not a fan at all.

product_name: Mandarino di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content: Very fresh and little bit sugary i liked it. But i am really mad ADP they atopped selling Leather how could they. Best leather parfum in world. What is happening to you ADP ?

product_name: Mandarino di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content: I can understand why people like this scent, but its not one of my favorites from the house. Its fresh, with a watery mandarin orange citrus profile, but that and the spearmint are actually quite intense. Its scent profile just doesn't strike me as pleasant as my house favorites - Ginepro di Sardegna, Arancia di Capri, Fico di Amalfi, OG Colonia, Colonia Essenza, Cedro di Taormina, Mirto di Panarea, and Chinotto di Liguria.

product_name: Mandarino di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content: Alright, I picked up a bit too much aquatyciness on the blotter, needs further checking.

product_name: Mandarino di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content: Amazing sweet and soft mandarine scent with tender yet tart spices. Love that it’s not too zesty or soapy, but rather musky and comforting. I think I need a bottle..

product_name: Mandarino di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content: I feel basil and mint here so much! Nice and veryy green.

product_name: Mandarino di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content:
This fragrance is truly unisex; both men and women will enjoy the scent after applying it. It has a vibrant aroma reminiscent of organic mandarin in 4K, which alone can lift your spirits. However, you will need to reapply it every couple of hours. While this may seem inconvenient, the appealing scent makes it worthwhile, as it's quite addictive during its opening, even though it has a short half-life.

I wouldn't recommend purchasing this if your collection fits on a single shelf. This fragrance is ideal for avid fragrance enthusiasts looking to add something unique to their collection, but its cost doesn't match its longevity. Personally, I love it, being a fragrance junkie myself, so take my opinion for what it’s worth.

✌️😎

product_name: Mandarino di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content: Initial spray is sweeter than I expected; mostly candied mandarin and lemon. Honestly smells a bit like bathroom cleaner to me. Some spearmint as it settles. Very musky base with woody undertones. Not as clean/refreshing as I was hoping.

product_name: Mandarino di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content: Love the opening, green fresh with a litlle bit sweet from the mandarin. The drydown still good but it smells more herbal so its not as refreshing and turns to a resort or hotel smell.

product_name: Mandarino di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content: the best photorealistic mandarine peel smelling fragrance.

product_name: Mandarino di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Big disappointment, do not worrh $ 10.

Smells like a toilet cleaner and cheap.

Last 15 min

1/10

product_name: Mandarino di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content: It's none other than reincarnation of the long gone Bvlgari Aqva Amara! Photorealistic mandarine peel unfrotunately fades away after 10 or 15 minutes and then it goes straight into salty, screechy and bitter citruses. Longevity and sillage are both far above average for this category, but the scent itself is not so pleasant as you might imagine, when you read its pyramid. Not for me.

product_name: Mandarino di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content:
This is such a fresh, bright, and sparkly clean citrus fragrance with little minty, green and woody undertones that give it a little base without taking away from its bright uplifting nature. The biggest surprise is how natural and photorealistic it smells for the price.

Can be worn anywhere however it feels like wearing this to work would be doing it a disservice as this fragrance evokes feelings of happiness, carefree freedom and fun while being out and about on sunny warm days. This aspect mixed with its affordability gives something like this a chance to stand out even in more expensive collections.

You can save your more expensive stuff for work, dates, and more serious outings and feel free spraying away with this on your off day daytime runs to the store or mall or just being out and about while enjoying a sunny day.

Looking forward to trying more from this house.

product_name: Mandarino di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content: Not really my style, but it's a fairly pleasant citrus fragrance with good performance.

product_name: Mandarino di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content: As someone who has Mandarins at work every day, I can confirm this is the smell of Mandarin's peel.

product_name: Mandarino di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content: The drydown of this is a bit masculine, in my opinion. I normally don't have a problem wearing citrus frags with petitgrain or mint, so I think it's the patchouli. I prefer the Mandarino di Sicilia by Perris Monte Carlo or Guerlain's Mandarine Basilic for a much more photorealistic and solidly unisex orange experience.

product_name: Mandarino di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I blind bought this because I had smelled Tom Ford’s Mandarino di Amalfi in-store and completely fell for it—but it was just too overpriced for what it was. When I heard Acqua di Parma released Mandarino di Sicilia, I figured it could scratch that same itch, and honestly… it kinda does.

The opening is super bright and sharp in a good way—like that feeling when you eat pineapple and it almost stings your tongue. It’s this punchy mix of green mandarin and bitter orange that feels so alive and fresh, like sun hitting citrus peel. There’s also this clean minty coolness underneath (spearmint, I think) that adds this breezy effect without smelling like toothpaste.

Compared to Amalfi, this one is definitely more linear and more citrus-focused. No florals or deeper base. And yeah, it doesn’t last that long on skin—maybe 3-5 hours max unless you go heavy or spray on clothes. But honestly? It smells really clean, natural, and expensive in a way that a lot of citrus scents don’t.

If you’re expecting it to be a 1:1 dupe of Tom Ford’s version, it’s not. But if you just want that bright, luxe citrus energy without dropping €250, this is a really solid summer daily driver. I’ll definitely keep wearing it in warm weather.

product_name: Mandarino di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content:
The scent and the quality are magnificent as always from Acqua di Parma and the performance is awful as usual.
Sharp mix of orange/mandaring and orange peels with a lurking hint of mint and green herbs at the back.
even with overspraying it wont do much sadly.

product_name: Mandarino di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content: Very sharp photorealistic citrus. It softens in the drydown but not enough to overshadow the citrus. It’s super fresh and lovely, a refreshing hot summer staple.

product_name: Mandarino di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content: What is the point of smelling like a sour peel of mandarin ? bought it and thankfully returned it. Hard pass.

product_name: Mandarino di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content: Went into a store to test this on skin a few times and loved it. The wafts of mandarin you get as it sits on your neck is insane. I fell in love with it over any of the others from the blu line. I wish I tested it a bit more however. Unfortunately I got some negative reactions from some family members, they couldn't understand the Italian summer aesthetic that this fragrance gives (which is ironic because my family is Italian). They said it smells like cleaning product, which, I can slightly see now. Its slightly off putting, I wish it had a more musky vibe to it. Either way when i'm in the blazing heat I know I wont regret buying. I don't think this deserves a 4.3 rating but still very good.

product_name: Mandarino di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content: It's really smells like tangerine on Christmas, but after hour it's smells half like toothpaste. Not everyone around me liked it when I wore it

product_name: Mandarino di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content: Green mandarine, mint and petitgrain are the main notes here. The Mandarine and petitgrain give it a green herbaceous feel while the mint gives it a cooling effect. The musk rests in the background and as it drysdown a very nice aromatic musk comes out. Highly realistic smelling scent (as accustomed to AdP) and it leans masculine to my nose.

product_name: Mandarino di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content: Acqua di Parma serves the best natural perfumery with the greatest quality. This is everything about a sicilian summer in a beautiful blue bottle. Great longevity for a citrus fragrance, and very realistic, no synthetic funk at all. Absolute masterpiece as always from Acqua di Parma.

product_name: Mandarino di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content: It literally smells like freshly peeled mandarine with load of spearmint. It is very fresh and lasts quite a long time. Highly recommended!

product_name: Mandarino di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content: Reminds me a lot of pacific chill. Got this super nice minty citrus. Beautiful underrated gem

product_name: Mandarino di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content:
This delighted me so much. I normally steer clear from linear, citrus fragrances- but the smell of a mandarin peel was so visceral on my skin that it made me chuckle a little. I truly enjoy this, very fresh and uplifting! I don’t get a lot of mint on my skin, but that’s fine. The juicy mandarine is super strong!

I was pleasantly surprised with the sillage and longevity too, very few fresh fragrances last more than 5+ hours on me. Beautiful and refreshing.

I am in love!

product_name: Mandarino di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content: Hidden gem of a fragrance. It’s got this fresh and realistic minty citrus that is clean and uplifting. No need to gatekeep as basically nobody knows about this.

product_name: Mandarino di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content: l love this fragrance, it captures the very realistic smell of a mandarin being peeled, with bursts of mint, spice, and overall freshness. Despite being a fruit fragrance, it stays wearable and isn’t overly sweet like other fruity scents. It has a powerful opening and strong initial projection, but the longevity is short. It is what it is with those summery, citric EDTs, especially from ADP.

product_name: Mandarino di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content: Coming back to it a few weeks later, and it’s just great. I’m about to buy a 30ml upgrading from the teeny tiny bit I have left from my sample. The aqua di Parma line (besides Fico di amalfi) are pretty under the radar; this one especially. It’s fresh, minty, aromatic, and that Aqua Di Parma photorealistic citrus.

product_name: Mandarino di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Moderate longevity but good projection. Very natural Mandarine with some spearmint that unfortunately doesn’t last that long as usual but the whole composition is very loud for a couple of hours and then calms down for a decent 4-5 hours of performance. I get some neroli and a lot of petigraine. The drydown still has this orange mandarine peel and powdery remains. 7.5/10

Nevermind, the mint lasts..

product_name: Mandarino di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content: This fragrance perfectly recreates the aroma of a freshly-peeled mandarin- quite delicious. The mint appears soon after. I'm not sure what to make of it but it is very interesting. Unfortunately, I couldn't investigate this perfume too much as it started to give me headaches...

product_name: Mandarino di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content: It’s a very minty fragrance, with a bit of citrus. Dont get me wrong, it smells quite nice, but it sits very close to my skin apon testing it. I could definitely see this as a great day-summer scent that isn’t too offensive. The only setback I would give it is that it’s just a little reminiscent of cleaning products.

product_name: Mandarino di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content: On paper smells ok on my skin completely changed in a bad way.

product_name: Mandarino di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content: A chilled blast of green mandarin, quickly pursued by a crunch of spearmint and petit grain. The spearmint stays in a halo of cool freshness balanced by orange for a couple hours after which it calms to a mild cedar musk. Needs reapplication after 4-5 hours. A worthy fragrance for summer. Never had such a unique fresh combination as this.

product_name: Mandarino di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content: very sharp,crisp and green fragrance. dont except any sweetness. its like peeling an orange when having a picnic at the grasses.

product_name: Mandarino di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content:
This is a very accurate rendition of the mandarin orange imo. Smells like I'm smelling the real thing. They managed to make it perform good (for a citrus) without making it smell like chemical fixatives (looking at you arancia la spugnatura flanker). I love this brand but their releases such as the newest Colonia Club have been absolute garbage, and not befitting of a brand with this heritage and pedigree.

I mean come on, Cary Grant and Audrey Hepbern wore ADP and you release this new club that smells like a worse made copy of Armani Code?
But I digress, this one is more befitting of the quality I expect from the house. If you like Arancia but hate that it only lasts 20 minutes, give this a try. If you are obsessed with performance get the arancia flanker or don't wear citrus dominant fragrances because you'll always be disappointed. You cannot have natural and strong performance in this category, you pick one or the other. Here, you'll get 6ish hours which is very good for a natural smelling citrus.
-----------------------------------------------------
Scent 88/100
Performance 50/100

product_name: Mandarino di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content: It's surpringsingly green for a frangrance with the word "mandarino" in the name. It's almost more minty than citrusy. The fragrance is good though, I'm working trough my third sample. Nice, fresh summer scent with good longevity.

product_name: Mandarino di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content: Very surprised how long it lasts for an edit .

product_name: Mandarino di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content: Refrescante y veraniega. Resalta la mandarina chispeante en la salida para dar paso a la menta verde. No tiene más acordes para destacar pero en el verano se agradece lo refrescante. La siento más unisex o masculina, deja un halo de frescor a tu alrededor. Para llevar de día e ir aplicando a menudo en verano.

product_name: Mandarino di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content: It’s OK but smells like it can’t make up its mind whether it wants to smell citrusy or green: opens up very ‘sharp & green’ accented by lots of bitter blood orange without ever really smelling of citrus… dries down into a smooth, musky bitter-green fragrance.

product_name: Mandarino di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content: Tried the entire Blu Mediterraneo line at the airport yesterday, this one was my favourite. I like the bittersweet smell of mandarins.

product_name: Mandarino di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content: A strange fragrance, halfway between Chinotto di Liguria and Arancia di Capri in terms of Acqua di Parma's orange fragrances, without particularly smelling like either. This certainly seems to take some of the dull, watery, cool and woody patchouli from Chinotto that makes up a bulk of that fragrance. It doesn't have the same engulfing effect as Chinotto, however, and is nicely balanced by the green freshness of the cedar. This smells mostly like a mids and base-heavy fragrance to me, with little in the way of a true top note - where is the mandarin? Where is the citrus? It's a good question. There's certainly sweetness, and a dash of spice, which at times conjures the bitter zest of citrus peel. The citric accord is something closer to a cordial or maybe even something like Sunny D - a slightly viscous, synthetic, but evocative and undoubtedly also familiar kind of citric smell that nestles on top of the bed of cool, watery, woody greenery. To be honest, this comes across as a woody fragrance to me - particularly cedar, but also broadly coniferous in a general sense. It's not bad at all in that regard, and reminds me of the fresh smell of new growth cedar needles when you crush them between your fingers - the smell can be almost lemon-like, slightly camphorous, sharp, bitter, along with the pencil shaving or wood chip type aroma that comes with the note. I think it works well. It lacks the cloying and monotonous use of petitgrain that Arancia di Capri suffers from, and although it's less immediate and perhaps even less pleasant than the sweet and juicy note of Arancia, I suspect in the long term this may be a more rewarding wear. This doesn't seem like a crowd pleaser, though. This is cool, confident, not a mass pleaser, and surprisingly niche in its approach. At times, more of a citrus feel comes out when smelled at a distance, and the impression of mandarin or bitter orange is more apparent. The mint, which had played its part in adding the camphorous quality to the green woodyness, starts to become more aromatic and obvious over time as well. It seems quite lovely, and less challenging, when this happens. Plenty of white, slightly shrieky musk and synthetic fabric-likearomachemicals prop up the fragrance, which is only obvious when digging your nose in closely after it has settled. This is the most interesting fragrance Acqua di Parma have made for a while. I wonder who will wear this, who will love it? As I say, it is a strange fragrance, but that is by no means a bad thing. Lovers of Annick Goutal and perhaps some of the older niche houses ought to try this. It lacks some of the complexity and development of the earlier niche fragrances but seems to be doing something stylistically similar. Overall, I'd call this a success.

product_name: Mandarino di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content:
More convincing than Arancia di Capri (but still close), the illusion of the whole tangerin is prolongated with the woody/musky background and some spiciness (cardamom ?). I don't get any mint in this one. Doesn't feel as synthetic as Arancia La Spugnatura.
Longevity is quite good.
I would have preferred a more juicy vivid opening (like bergamotto, chinotto or bergamotto la spugnatura) but i find it technically very well done.

product_name: Mandarino di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content: I really don't understand why ADP refuses to release anything outside of its Colonia, Blu Mediterraneo, or Signatures of the Sun lines. Why not FINALLY create an all new, standalone fragrance? Something that performs well and might actually catch interest in the fragrance community and bring ADP to the forefront. Right now, they're known as the "pleasant, eau de cologne Italian company that makes hotel scents". Where's the showstopper?

product_name: Mandarino di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Spearmint gum laced orange popsicle . And a sprig of petitgrain (lemony leaves/twigs) . Like perhaps a mint-forward interpretation of Eau de Rochas Homme replacing the basil.

This is quite effervescent in the opening, and a bit more dated in its greenness and sweetness (late 80’s / early 90’s) - think more Aramis New West for Him and Escape, as opposed to say Versace Eros.

Ironically enough, my mind also went to A*Men Ultra Zest and Tauer’s Orange Star as more “contemporary” fragrances - this never going too thick nor heavy nor too sweet. And perhaps a nod to a more “natural” Cedro di Diamante .

Very orange, very green, slightly sweet, slightly off-putting, slightly entrancing . Better than Futura? For me, yes - a perhaps slight return-to-form.

*update: wife purchased this for me after finding a t-shirt in the hamper that kept the fragrance for a few days - asked me what it was, and immediately went online. Very happy summer ahead!

As an aside:

Tomlaf188 (below) notes coriander - to me, fresh coriander is better represented in Aqua Media; however, I will concede this ADP does hint at the cilantro vibe of Live Jazz - sweetness and all. So 188’s impression is quite apt.

As an aside #2:
heracles (above) references Annick Goutal fragrances in relation to this fragrance and I wholeheartedly agree - and appreciate hercales opening my eyes to that correlation. Certainly there is a bit of a nod to the tip-of-the-tongue Eau d’Hadrien EDP, but also to the lesser-referenced Un Matin d’Orage EDP in its water-drenched opening. Very eye-opening citrus. Very apt correlation, indeed, especially to Goutal’s creaminess found specifically in the EDP blends (compared to the EDT blends)

product_name: Mandarino di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Me and my mates tried this, smells absolutely awful. Had a handful of about 30 testers and this was the only one i could smell. Smells like coriander and is extremely strong and sickening.
If you dont like coriander, don't even bother smelling this.

product_name: Mandarino di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content: Unfortunately I really dislike the opening on this one. Nice dry down, but becomes to similar to Arancia La Spugnatura which I already own, as well as Manarino Di Amalfi which I also own. But that opening, just totally off-putting. I thought I would love this, the notes sound right up my street, but the opening ruined it for me. It was almost urine-like on my skin, something very strange about it which overpowers the mint. Made me very disappointed because I thought it would be an instant buy.

product_name: Mandarino di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content: its a gyatt fragerence!!

product_name: Mandarino di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content: It's petitgrain and spearmint forward. Green mandarin is unripe but manages to provide some fruitiness to it. Among ADP's greenest fragrances, alongside Cipresso and Ginepro. This one is a brighter, fresher green than those two. At first, I wasn't a fan but it's grown on me in the last 20 minutes. Becomes a bit more creamy and rounder as time goes on, but not by much. The opening is too green and soapy for my taste, so I wish they rounded it out a little more in the dry down. Although, overall, I like smelling this, the way I might like looking at a piece of art, I can't imagine ever wanting to smell LIKE this. However, I will say that this is so much more interesting and commendable than what ADP has been putting out for the past couple of years. They haven't released a memorable fragrance in years, and nothing that's catching any interest in the fragrance community. Doubt this will either.

product_name: Mandarino di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content: I like it - smells like a mix between arancia di capri and Tom ford mandarino di amalfi. Agree that the spearmint is very prominent.

product_name: Mandarino di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content: There is a lot more going on here than I expected. It opens with mandarin peel but the spearmint is also very noticeable (almost dominant). It’s all happening on top of the earthy patchouli in the background and it’s really quite enjoyable. As it develops, the fragrance becomes thicker and somewhat ‘pulpier’ if that’s a word. To me, it actually becomes slightly creamy with the mandarin taking centre stage again (accompanied by the blood orange). Overall, I really enjoy the opening but not sure about the drydown. I also agree with a previous reviewer who said this could almost be a little too dense for the summer. In terms of sillage, this seems to sit quite close to the skin, however, it definitely has better longevity than other fragrances in the line such as Arancia di Capri.

product_name: Mandarino di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content: Meh, not a massive fan myself. It's quite a herbal orangey scent, with a little bit of earthiness in the background. It's ok.

product_name: Mandarino di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content: If Herba Fresca and Arancia di Capri had a Baby.

product_name: Mandarino di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content: Pretty good! I like the mint in this and the herbs with some green zest. I smell crushed green mandarin leaves in the opening which I personally really like. The whole thing is like an unripe mandarine still on a tree in a small garden full of sweet and bitter herbs. There is unmistakable AdP dna in this with an interesting herbal mandarin. Very nice overall but not significantly different to other AdP fragrances to stand out on its own. Solid cologne choice for summer.

product_name: Mandarino di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content:
It’s just ok IMO
It remains me of Arancia but this one has more green edge to it which I did not enjoy that much.
At one moment it reminded me of parsley smell😄

Anyway I prefer Arancia over this one

product_name: Mandarino di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content: Really want to sample this one. The whole collection is easy to like.

product_name: Mandarino di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Wow, I can’t wait to try this!!!
I saw a documentary about this brand and they show how they extract the oils from their citruses and flowers .
This brand has top notch ingredients in their parfumes 👍

product_name: Mandarino di Sicilia Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Really looking forward to this release! A big fan of the Blu Mediterraneo line and it’s about time a new release was unveiled. Although fairly linear, the line is perfect for the Summer.

ADP does spearmint very well, with Colonia Club (now discontinued) being a testament to their capabilities with this note. I wonder how this will come across in this release.

product_name: Colonia Assoluta In Villa Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Colonia Assoluta In Villa is a really lovely perfume. It projects moderately for a few hours before becoming a skin scent some two or three hours after application. It opens with woody notes, citruses and spices as per the notes. The citruses are on the orange and lemon part of the citrus family. There's some cypress in the woods and so it gives the perfume a hint of a beautiful furniture polish (in a very good way). The feel is indeed that of walking around a well designed garden of a country house but with an extra flowery touch that the notes don't immediately suggest. Colonia Assoluta In Villa is perfectly named.

Some two hours later the decline in strength begins. The scent is fairly stable, fairly linear, and remains so throughout. Another two hours later the decline in strength is more notable. Eight hours in and there's just a tiny bit left. By nine hours after application it's all gone.

I don't see a particularly strong link to Colonia Assoluta here so if you're looking for a version of that you've come to the wrong place. However, I think this would work during the day at any time of year. Whilst spring is the most obvious time for this one, I would assert that summer and early autumn would work well, and that if you were inside, why not the rest of the year?

Given its rarity (only 26 Fragranticans have it, according to the database, at the time of writing) I don't expect to get my hands on any more, certainly not a full bottle. I shall enjoy this fleeting elegant creation and bid it a fond farewell when my supply runs out fairly soon.

EDIT: Coming back to this a week later, the same amount of sprays in the same places from the same distance has yielded a longevity of about 15 hours on the left arm and almost 24 hours on the right arm! A very welcome surprise!

product_name: Colonia Assoluta In Villa Acqua di Parma
review_content: nothing more than EXCELLENT!

product_name: Colonia Assoluta In Villa Acqua di Parma
review_content: I purchased this one thinking it had the same fragrance of colonia assoluta,but it is a different smell,colonia assoluta is fresh-floral-woody and colonia assoluta is very classy old-fashioned fragrance,yet a delicious smell,but i prefer colonia assoluta in spite of colonia assoluta in villa.

product_name: Colonia Assoluta In Villa Acqua di Parma
review_content: I originally got it for myself, but despite all the freshness of Colonia Assoluta this is very strong on cypress. Unfortunately, I cannot stand it, it gives me headache, and makes me sick. Gave it to my husband though, and on him even the cypress is becoming palatable , plus he loves the giant bottle with pretty old fashioned bulb. Spraying himself all over with it has become his new morning ritual, and a very enjoyable one. Very, very classy.

product_name: Mirto Di Panarea Summer Edition Acqua di Parma
review_content: Make this the SIXTH ITERATION OF THIS FRAGRANCE. How many times is ADP going to re-release the same fragrance??

product_name: Mirto Di Panarea Summer Edition Acqua di Parma
review_content: Same juice different presentation?

product_name: Mirto Di Panarea Summer Edition Acqua di Parma
review_content: Francois Demachy is back!!!

product_name: Colonia Club Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Man nobody doesn't citrus like ADP.
For a modern take on classic herbal-citrusy freshness, it's pretty timeless.

Somewhere between a golf course, chanel platinum egoiste and barbershops.
Classic elegant spring-summer old money vibes.

product_name: Colonia Club Acqua di Parma
review_content:
This is for those who want a side by side comparison between C.L.U.B. and the OG.
Both are beautiful fragrances, the kind you'd smell at a country club. Scent-wise, the vintage version is dryer, more mature, and perhaps commanding more respect. The reinterpretation is sweeter, softer and more modern. Think of it this way. You go to a country club and there's a fine gentleman in his 50s, and his 25 years old son. Both are dressed for their age. The more seasoned gentleman if wearing the vintage CLUB, while his son is wearing C.L.U.B.
If you can get your hands on the old version, get it. And add the new one to your collection as well. They don't exclude each other, neither do they complete each other. They're simply two very beautiful fragrances that should be in any modern gentleman's collection.

product_name: Colonia Club Acqua di Parma
review_content: voor mij een van de beste van Acqua di Parma

product_name: Colonia Club Acqua di Parma
review_content: Fresh, citrussy G-R-E-E-N barbershop classic. In love with this

product_name: Colonia Club Acqua di Parma
review_content: the best citrusy smell I have ever smelled .

product_name: Colonia Club Acqua di Parma
review_content: Smells like a very polished man who goes to country clubs. Very fresh, green and zesty... like it a lot.

product_name: Colonia Club Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Started as 8/10 fresh aromatic after shavey perfume
but with an ambery under tone when I first bought it. However, after leaving it in my closet for 2 weeks it developed this harsh and unpleasant and pungent “black lime” (sun dried lime) spicy note mixed with brown sugar that is present all around like something fermented within it. The same thing happened with my blu de Chanel

2/10

product_name: Colonia Club Acqua di Parma
review_content: smells like playing tennis at a nice country club, very relaxing and has that old money feel as well

product_name: Colonia Club Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I don't agree that this is "very minty". There is definitely mint in it, but it's well blended into the composition. There's nothing mentholated or toothpaste-like about it. As someone else stated, it's not quite a fougere, but sort of a fresh/modern version of one. I think it's successful as a crowd-pleaser while giving something unique. Sort of like Diptyque's Eau de Minthé, which is also a "neo-fougere" replacing lavender with rose, Colonia Club adds mint and tones down the lavender.
Looks like AdP is releasing Buongiorno next week, which looks to have similar notes. Looking forward to trying it.

product_name: Colonia Club Acqua di Parma
review_content:
This was one of my first full bottles. I haven’t worn it in many months because at some point, after getting deep into vintage and niche, some of my early stuff started feeling jarring. Now that I have a more experienced nose and a better vocabulary, I can pinpoint what had put me off. And I can also go back to and rediscover these early loves; maybe even fall for them all over again.

Colonia Club was clearly a departure from the citrus eau de cologne style that characterized most of AdP’s variations of the original Colonia. This one seems like an homage to a certain kind of sporty green Italian masculine of the Pino Silvestre/Acqua di Selva variety, though it doesn’t quite reach fougère territory (some claim that it contains a dose of coumarin in the base, in which case it could qualify).

The proposal is straightforward: a super bracing, woody aromatic composition with MINT (in all caps) at the center. This thing is so invigoratingly cooling that the opening actually stings, sort of like the icy half of Icy Hot, in a manner not dissimilar to the sensation of aftershave slapped on open pores (think Kevin in Home Alone). I personally love this. What follows is green, aromatic, slightly citrusy, and somewhat floral, featuring neroli, geranium, and, of course, lavender.

The galbanum (Galbanol) makes its presence felt throughout. In the drydown, the vetiver and a salty “ambergris” accord (some kind of woody amber) come to the fore, rendering a pseudo-aquatic (as in marine) impression. I guess this is what put me off for a while, giving it what I felt was a “mainstream”, “boring”, “synthetic” feel. But I’ve come around (almost) full circle. I can appreciate this kind of composition, a modernized riff on a classic, more than before. I can now see the trajectory much more clearly. And I dig it!

Colonia Club feels balanced, elegant, and modern. Frequently compared to Green Irish Tweed (for a fraction of the price) and Cool Water (though more robust and less synthetic), it’s a simple affair that gets the job done. And it’s just right for a crisp, sunny day, under a pressed shirt and a blazer, like today.

product_name: Colonia Club Acqua di Parma
review_content: your classic green aftershave in perfume form.

product_name: Colonia Club Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I will preface this by saying that I’m not entirely sure that my decant from Fragrancenet is this version or the C.L.U.B. version as it mixes the two together on the same page on the size-selection bar, however, the image used for the travel spray decant shows this original Club.

This is a very minty, green fragrance that approaches things a bit differently than I was expecting. With mint, I usually expect a brisk, airy mint smell—if I were to describe it as a color it would be white—that’s somewhat dry. However, Colonia Club is a much thicker, darker, and slightly sweet mint, akin to the thick mint note of Versace Eros. It’s very green and heavy, like a sweet mint bubblegum in a way. That being said, it’s a gentlemanly scent that brings to mind the image of a soft-spoken older man who dresses sharply, even when casual.

It’s a pleasant scent in general, but sadly it was not what I am looking for for a minty spring—or especially summer—scent. Too dense, dark green, and heavy for warmer weather in my opinion. The neroli, lavender, and geranium don’t help, only lending a floral haziness to the whole composition. With only a couple sprays of a travel atomizer, I found it a bit cloying and overwhelming during just temperate weather. It’s nice on its own, but I didn’t really enjoy actually wearing it, sadly.

product_name: Colonia Club Acqua di Parma
review_content: Ambroxan or real Ambergris, who actually cares, because this original is..guess what? DISCONTINUED!!! These today's houses, old school houses, every and each of them dare not ask a permission for legal euthanasia! Pls, just do commit it, stop teasing us with your "new flankers" without any chains! In other words; go F.U.C.K yourselves!

product_name: Colonia Club Acqua di Parma
review_content: Middle of the mall mentholated, citric greenery.

product_name: Colonia Club Acqua di Parma
review_content:
عطر با رایحه سبز و مرکباتی و از همه بیشتر برگاموت شروع میشه که بلافاصله لوندر رو هم داخل اش حس می کنید؛یعنی یه جورایی از همون ابتدا وجه صابونی _ماسکی عطر خودش رو نشون میده و بوی تمیزی ازش دریافت می کنید

تا چند دقیقه اول،مرکبات یکی در میان به نمایش در میان و بوی لیمو از بقیه ضعیف تر حس میشه تا جایی که مرکبات پَر می کشند و بازی لوندر و مُشک شروع میشه و صحنه گردانی می کنند

شمعدانی کاملا در احاطه اُسطوخدوس هست و این برای من خیلی خوشایند بود که رایحه شمعدانی غالب نیست
در بین رفت و آمد نُت های سبز و آروماتیک و صابونی،رَگه های چوبی ضعیف ای هم حس میشه

شباهت هایی به گرین آیریش داره و تا حدودی میشه این عطر رو نسخه کلون گرین آیریش دونست با پیچیدگی کمتر
******************
scent:7/10
longevity:6/10
sillage:6/10
purchase value:4/10
*******
overall:5.8/10

product_name: Colonia Club Acqua di Parma
review_content: creme de menthe. 9/10

product_name: Colonia Club Acqua di Parma
review_content: Very minty, refreshing fragrance with pretty good performance. Opening is excellent, with the dry down being a bit disappointing. I kinda get the old man vibes, but they're not too off-putting for me.

product_name: Colonia Club Acqua di Parma
review_content: More minty and herbal than others in it's class. More green than citrus. It's well made and I'm enjoying it, but I wouldn't purchase a full bottle.

product_name: Colonia Club Acqua di Parma
review_content: Old man aftershave vibes for sure. Not a bad thing, but not my favorite.

product_name: Colonia Club Acqua di Parma
review_content: positive and pleasant, seems well traveled and sophisticated while remaining casual

product_name: Colonia Club Acqua di Parma
review_content: this is a bright, refreshing minty frag, with some lavender in the background. it was my first niche buy, and I did it blindly so as long as mint is alright with you, go for it

product_name: Colonia Club Acqua di Parma
review_content: This is so so minty! You have to love the mint in the opening. After that it get's more smoother and creamier. It is so refreshing to put this on your skin, when outside is like hot summer! It gives you a FRESH VIBE!!! Give it a try!

product_name: Colonia Club Acqua di Parma
review_content: Pleasant opening but it does smell like an inexpensive shower gel as it dries down. This could have been something interesting had they cut back on the Ambroxan. Final drydown is pure Ambroxan.

product_name: Colonia Club Acqua di Parma
review_content: Colonia Club smells fresh and minty for 5 minutes, and then turns super green, and is not suitable for warmer weather. Discontinued for a reason.

product_name: Colonia Club Acqua di Parma
review_content: As mentioned, this fragrance is discontinued and the geniuses at Acqua di Parma decided to release a different fragrance with a similar name (new=C.L.U.B. vs. old=CLUB). Yes, the bottles are different (new=clear vs. old=dark green). Unfortunately, online discounters and ebay sellers continue to show a picture of the old, dark green bottle when they are really selling the new version and use the escape clause "product may not be as pictured or may be repackaged." One online discounter's listing shows the dark green bottle for one size and the clear bottle for a different size. The point is, it's not a repackaging of the same fragrance but two different fragrances. Buyer beware.

product_name: Colonia Club Acqua di Parma
review_content: Super refreshing, pleasant clean scent. Top five in my collection of probably 80+ fragrances. Performance is not stellar, but as long as it lasts it is excellent?

product_name: Colonia Club Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Very refreshing for the spring. Love the mint. It has a cooling effect on skin. As with most ADP's and most frags in general, I just decant and respray when I'm going out. As other reviewers have mentioned, there is a creamyness to it. I don't think it would be that off-putting in hotter weather, although there are probably better options for the high heat. Definitely ideal for casual spring wear. Discontinued, so get it while you can.

I've recently started using the Irish Spring shower gel and deodorant stick. Club blends quite well with that scent profile. I always feel clean and confident wearing this juice.

product_name: Colonia Club Acqua di Parma
review_content: Great citrusy fresh fragrance that develops into a smooth, vetiver base with a touch of lavendar. Musky/powdery aspect is minimal. Smells good quality - no jarring or screechy scents. Right now, it's still cold by me with the air being dry inside which impacts the performance. Still, got about a good 4 hours before it became a skin scent. For sure, the performance will be amped up on hot days. Looking forward to using Colonia Club this coming summer and warmer spring days.

product_name: Colonia Club Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Beautiful fresh fragrance. Very natural smelling and high quality. This is a megadose of mint and bergamot and neroli. I don’t get much lavender. This is a very bracing and green citrus, a classic Italian barbershop fragrance. Much less powdery than French barbershop stuff like Brut and not as mossy compared to US classics like Pinaud Clubman.
Lasts 6hours, longer with several sprays.
Great for spring and summer daytime wear.

product_name: Colonia Club Acqua di Parma
review_content: Love the citrusy opening and top notes. Drys down to a bit of a green spicy but creamy scent. Brings images of country club and putting on the green on a dewy spring morning. Personally if I smell it too much, it does give me a bit of a headache though. But overall, it's a nice addition to my collection, not an everyday scent for me but an occasional wear.

product_name: Colonia Club Acqua di Parma
review_content: I have a full tester bottle for sale if interested message me. (CONUS only)

product_name: Colonia Club Acqua di Parma
review_content:
If you've experienced, Jaguar For Men and Loewe Esencia and thought, nah, not exactly what I want, try this!
Its also similar to, Van Cleef & Arpels Tsar but the 'Fougere/barbershop' accord is different and doesn't have the chocolatey woodiness.

Its of that mid-80's - early 90's period in style.

Minty barbershop Fougere with ambiguous green aromatics and trees. Overall, synthetic but pleasant.

There's an ingredient that gave me a burning sensation. Not really an issue, for me.

product_name: Colonia Club Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I am astonished nobody has made the connection to Egoiste Platinum !
They are very similar.

product_name: Colonia Club Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I recently discovered a new, affordable perfume that has quickly become my go to choice for the gym. Encre Noire Sport by Lalique had been a long-standing favorite, but this new scent has managed to take its place. This fragrance, is reminiscent of the refreshing, clean scent barbers apply after a haircut, making it perfect for post or pre gym freshness.

The standout feature of this perfume is the mint note, which immediately commands your attention. It's invigorating and fresh, akin to the revitalizing feeling you get after a shower. The mint sets the stage for a dynamic olfactory experience.

As the mint gradually subsides, the scent transitions to lavender, which imparts a distinct sense of cleanliness. The lavender note here is well crafted and doesn't come across as overpowering or synthetic. It's more like a subtle, aromatic touch that elevates the entire composition.

What makes this fragrance unique is the presence of a blended cream note. This creaminess complements the lavender beautifully, adding depth and richness to the scent profile. The combination of mint (which is going to be over powering note), lavender, and cream is harmonious and feels like a well thought out formula. One could totally see themselves out in Italy, by the beach, wearing this. Reminds me of the talented Mr. Ripley or The Hand of God where they were out by Italian beach.

Overall, I'd recommend this fragrance, especially if you're a fan of mint-based scents. It's a great, affordable option that captures freshness and the subtle elegance of a barbershop aroma. I've found it to be a suitable replacement for my gym scent Encre Noire Sport and wouldn't hesitate to consider it a worthwhile blind buy for mint enthusiasts.

product_name: Colonia Club Acqua di Parma
review_content: This is super fresh… I adore it! The mint and bergamot just sweetens the lavender and gives that straight out the cool summer shower scent. Divine. Love when my man wears this. It’s like the feeling when you have just brushed your teeth and exfoliated your face. Sounds strange but that’s how clean it is.

product_name: Colonia Club Acqua di Parma
review_content: Shower. Gel.

product_name: Colonia Club Acqua di Parma
review_content: Smells almost exactly like a greenhouse/nursery full of damp soil, petunias, and other flowers and herbs people like to put in and around their house. Lasts a few hours.

product_name: Colonia Club Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I have yet to experience something from the house of Acqua Di Parma that I dislike. I find, on average, the blends are consistently at a level where I'm not detecting bright individual notes (maybe my nose just sucks). Colonia Club is no exception, a neroli, citrus and mint burst. However, unlike the OG Colonia, it's immediately creamy and seductive in nature. Freshness of the variety that's perfect for summer, however, creamy and smooth enough that it's a great scent for any season really.

This fragrance is lovely, it's not screaming for attention or pushing any boundaries, it's just nice. Average projection and sillage (like many AdPs), but you'll get a decent 8 hours longevity on clothes.

product_name: Colonia Club Acqua di Parma
review_content:
This definitely had to be one of my favourite summer fragrances! The opening freshness of the mint is superb but not overpowering. I am a fan of Acqua Di Parma in general but do find some of their summer fragrances can be quite weak and there is barely any longevity. This however will last me a good few hours. Have had a few compliments from wearing Colonia Club.

For those wondering why recent batches have been much more pungent (the original Colonia Club which came out in 2015 has been discontinued). Acqua Di Parma now do Colonia C.L.U.B which I am assuming is based on the same fragrance but has been reformulated.

product_name: Colonia Club Acqua di Parma
review_content: I was looking for something fresh, minty and green - and this is it, up to a point. Reminds me of 90's fougeres my dad used to wear, but it's way more classy than that. Dies off quickly in the summer, I wear it mostly in spring when it reminds me of golf clubs, fresh cut grass and Easter. Masculine and slighly mature, I doubt that guys under 27 can pull this off.

product_name: Colonia Club Acqua di Parma
review_content: This is an odd combination to me of mint, neroli, vetiver, ambergris, musk, and something sort of peppery I can't identify. It projects much more than most AdP colognes, but it's kind of scratchy and unpleasant to my nose. I just have not very good luck with this house.

product_name: Colonia Club Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Reminds me of my freshly shaven dad getting ready for work in the morning when i was a child.

Like a breath of fresh air, after using the sweet gourmand scents over and over again.

When you want to feel clean, and go out in a white shirt on a warm but not hot sunny afternoon, this is definitely the one.

Longevity wise not the best, but smells incredible for yourself and the people really close to you, after it gets sprayed on the neck, my eyes can also feel the mint in it.

Not a neckbreaker, but its incredible in a smooth subtle way.

product_name: Colonia Club Acqua di Parma
review_content: I feel the mint, but I am not impressed. Feels too synthetic to me. Has typical ADP DNA, but is far from the best scents from this house. Cannot recommend it.

product_name: Colonia Club Acqua di Parma
review_content: I pursued this fragrance for the mint and it is there but maybe more muddled than I was hoping for. The lavender then takes over. It’s not bad but it feels more on the mature side to me. Would work for the office, I wouldn’t recommend if someone is hoping to be noticed.

product_name: Colonia Club Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I would describe it if I could smell it; so weak.
In just a few words: no personality, lost, middle of the road.
It's not a lavender scent, not a citrus , not a green and not woody/smokey; it's all of them together. Late dry down reminded me of Terre Eau Intense Vetiver.
I wonder if I will ever like anything fron AdP!

product_name: Colonia Club Acqua di Parma
review_content: I think this was produced in an attempt to capture some of the mass-market fragrance buyers with a more modern, 'designer' scent. It's very pleasant, and perhaps a good choice for those who feel like they've outgrown Sauvage or Dylan Blue. But for me, it's stuck in the no man's land between classic and modern. It's lost the traditional, classic feel of the original Colonia, but also isn't as mass-appealing as the popular designer fresh frangraces of today. It certainly doesn't perform as well, with distinctly average projection and longevity. At the premium designer price point, I'd give this a miss.

product_name: Colonia Club Acqua di Parma
review_content: This is really good. I've smelled it on my arm for most of today and what I can conclude based on it is that it isn't a weak performer nor a great performer, and that I really enjoy the scent. It reminds me of the general style of green barbershop fougeres, and in particular it definitely does remind me of Proraso Green which I loved and was part of what made me want to get this, so I'll definitely pair the two together. I also think it reminds me slightly of Rive Gauche. It's greener and sharper than Rive Gauche, which is so smooth that you could almost think it was just a molecule (which is why I think it's so special), but the body of the fragrance reminds me of it because there's a little bit of a shaving cream vibe (perhaps another reason why it's such a dead ringer for Proraso Green).

product_name: Colonia Club Acqua di Parma
review_content:
On the hunt for the perfect mint fragrance, I tried this.
This is a lovely, well balanced fresh scent.
The mint on paper is lovely however once on skin it disappeared within 5 minutes.
Lavender and musk combine for a soft powdery finish.

product_name: Colonia Club Acqua di Parma
review_content: This is a very pleasant, masculine, mature Spring and Summer fragrance. It's refreshing, confident and uplifting. It won't offend. One of the strongest projecting/lasting in the ADP line. It's best worn during Summer evenings. It's a shame that it has been discontinued and the prices have doubled.

product_name: Colonia Club Acqua di Parma
review_content: Colonia Club Acqua di Parma is becoming one of my favorite Spring time scents. I'm sad it took me so long to get my nose of this fragrance. The herbal touches are reminiscent of Ralph Lauren Polo Green or Creed's Green Irish Tweed, but this is much more modern while still maintaining class. The scent is not as deep or as much of a "powerhouse" as the 1980's fougeres. I guess it could be worn by women, but this leans a bit more masculine to me. It's a cooling somewhat mentholated green herbal masterpiece. The mint is so authentic. Reminds me of smelling a fresh mint leaf picked from a garden, minus the dirt.

product_name: Colonia Club Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I’ve bought & sold it 3x times. The first was a 8ml decant, 2nd was new 20ml bottle, third was new 50ml.
My first two purchases were fantastic.. the fragrance had a very soft, welcoming, calming, almost diluted barber shop vibe. I sold them cause the projection was weak.
I ended up missing that soft, clean pleasant smell & decided to get a new 50ml. It was a 2021 batch code 0971X.. mannn this shit was pungent, lasted allll day & extremely spicy herbal, nothing like my 2 previous experience’s. I wonder what happened 🤷🏾?? I’m about to purchase again & I pray it’s the softer batch 🙏🏽
Edit: the spicy batch was the all green bottle & not the newer c.l.u.b. Matt1987

product_name: Colonia Club Acqua di Parma
review_content: Mint and eucalyptus. Smells very similar to Proraso green aftershave but it’s deeper. Extremely refreshing.

product_name: Colonia Club Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Solid fragrance even if it is pretty far gone departure from the Colonia DNA. That initial burst of mint and citrus is accompanied on a bed of lavender dominated herbs (reminiscent of a Platinum Egoiste (I can see where the GIT comparison comes in) theme) giving it a bit of sweetness in a nice mint julep type of a feel with a pretty high grade of ambroxan that can totally pass as a ambergris. Why more designers don’t go this route for their ambroxan boggles my mind.

For those lamenting the discontinuation of this fragrance, Polo Cologne Intense in my mind is a more than suitable replacement for this. Materials are a bit lower quality (niche vs designer) and the prominent mint note is backed by a fresh airy violet leaf dominant herbs rather than fresh sweet lavender dominant herbs in CLUB. Overall not entirely dissimilar, even though they are 6 years part.

Wouldn’t surprise me if Carlos Benaim took inspiration for Polo Cologne Intense with CLUB

product_name: Colonia Club Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Once, as a treat for myself, I splurged on an AdP bath set, because I used to love the smell of Colonia Intensa, and I thought that it would make a nice post-shower scent (which it absolutely does, those soaps are lovely). Around the same time, one of the various discounters I use was selling some re-discovered bottles of Abercrombie & Fitch Fierce Intense, and I scooped up a pair of bottles before they vanished again (as one does with discontinued fragrances at bargain prices).

The end result of this is that one day, I happened to have showered with my AdP Colonia soap, and afterwards, sprayed on Fierce Intense. At first, it felt kind of clashy, since the A&F is even louder in "Intense" concentration than the original (which historically stunk out entire malls), but as the two started to balance, it became a rather intriguing sort of scent, wavering back-and-forth between a gentlemanly classic, and its douchebag equivalent. Anyway, long story short, the admix of those scent profiles is about 95% of what I get from AdP Colonia Club - that remaining 5% being made up of minty grassiness - and honestly, it kinda works.

Contrary to what many have said, I'm not getting anything like Green Irish Tweed vibes from this, so I'm not sure where that comparison is coming from - I even sprayed a bit of GIT on my shirt to compare, and, at least to me, it's just not there.

In the end, to my nose, this is AdP Colonia soap + A&F Fierce Intense + Mint and Grass, but the blending somehow manages to mute the harsh parts - and accentuate the nice ones - in such a way that it's actually rather pleasant to smell. It's probably not a safe blind-buy, though, since that profile is not for everyone. But, I like it well enough, and will likely be adding it to my spring/summer rotation

8.5/10

product_name: Colonia Club Acqua di Parma
review_content: I wanted to like this, I really did, and I was excited to add it to my small ADP collection. But it remains the only fragrance I’ve ever sold before finishing the bottle. In fact I probably only ever had 30 sprays. It’s high quality, as you’d expect from ADP, but is so pungent that I couldn’t stand being near myself, and actually amongst the high quality notes there’s a strong, overpowering smell of really cheap shaving gel. The smell of rough, low grade shaving gel, wafting in your face all day. Wasn’t for me.

product_name: Colonia Club Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Tremendously green, minty and fresh. Almost mentholated but in that note specific quality that ADP has. Has an almost blue fragrance style drydown but maintains the realistic green minty herbal notes.

In the vein of polo green, etc. But quality is far higher.

8.25 rating

product_name: Colonia Club Acqua di Parma
review_content:
VERY green, herbal, mint (but not at all "toothpaste mint") fragrance. It is done so well. The first 15-30 seconds are strong but as it settles quick. It is a modern take of a 90's frag. Maybe it's Green Irish Tweed/Cool Water that it's reminding me of but it really isn't close to either. Regardless, it's a stellar Springtime frag.
Performance is good. Slightly above average in longevity and projection. If you can get this one on sale, it's a heck of a deal.

product_name: Colonia Club Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Read reviews before buying a fragrance, but take them with a grain of salt. Everyone has their own opinion regarding smells. Some people love it. Some people hate it. My advice is for you to get a sample of ANY fragrance before you ever buy it. That way, you can assess it yourself and have your thoughts, rather than strictly going off someone else's thoughts and opinions.

A fresh, minty, "green irish", classy, casual, soapy, daytime fragrance. Usually, when people hear "green Irish" or shower gel, they think of "gym" or "bro" fragrances like Green Irish Tweed. Personally, I WOULD NOT say that Colonia Club is a "gym" or "bro" fragrance, but it takes out of that DNA--I just think this is a refined, gentlemanly, classy fresh fragrance. I love it.

product_name: Colonia Club Acqua di Parma
review_content: As a woman, don't get me wrong, this is a lovely scent to smell on a guy, but it's overpriced unless you can get it for a deal.

product_name: Colonia Club Acqua di Parma
review_content: Not special

product_name: Colonia Club Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Three things not mentioned often enough about Colonia Club, after wearing this over a dozen times:

1. It's a bit sweet early on - in fact too sweet for hot summer days IMO.

2. That mint note is the most realistic I've encountered. Almost inappropriately realistic: more like a green leaf of mint picked from a herb garden than perfume. More herbal than fresh. (I think the freshness here comes more from the lavender et al.) Makes this distinct and recognizable.

3. It has a really lovely ambergris accord in the base. It's not your typical cheap amberwood/ambroxan, but smells mature manly and good quality.

product_name: Colonia Club Acqua di Parma
review_content: Excellent fresh and minty fragrance. It has this strange cooking effect that I love. Seriously, if you've ever used Gold Bond, you know what I mean. Performance is surprisingly solid. If you like mint, you'll probably love this

product_name: Colonia Club Acqua di Parma
review_content: I really like this fragrance. Goes on cool with a nice minty opening. Give it a try you might like it!

product_name: Colonia Club Acqua di Parma
review_content: I love this stuff. Lasts 4ever. It's like a 90's green fragrance with a modern twist. GREAT! Perfect for Florida's hot weather. Acts like a parfum instead of a colonia in the heat.

product_name: Colonia Club Acqua di Parma
review_content:
To paraphrase Dickens, in the case of ADP Colonia, there is definitely a best of "Clubs" and a worst of "C.L.U.B.s". This one is the good one. The recent reformulation with the full stops in the name--not so much.
I like the way the traditional opening of Colonia is accented by mint in this flanker. The mid notes, with the emphasis on geranium carry on the fresh, cooling mintyness and make this fragrance a fine choice for really hot days. Sure, the base is an ambroxan-heavy mess that, in spite of a quality vetiver element, is indistinguishable from hundreds of other scents on the market today, but that opening is well blended, smells of quality ingredients and, since this fragrance fades rapidly to a skin scent isn't enough to put me off this version of the club.
But beware the recently released C.L.U.B. variant. I mistakenly bought it in a rush through a duty free shop on my way at to a hot weather destination where I have a residence thinking it was this product. What a colossal waste of money that decision turned out to be. But that story is best saved for the Fragrantica page for the new release.
This "Club," particularly at the low prices at which I have seen it offered at various online sellers, is well worth trying if you want a fine hot weather scent. It is not as generic as some of the foregoing reviews suggest. Not is it remarkably unique. But the quality is here and the mint note is great. Oh, I guess I need to mention that I am an old guy, just so folks know that this fragrance isn't just for 20-something guys. Recommended, but not overly enthusiastically.

product_name: Colonia Club Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Why do I continue to believe that a new fragrance will be good. Ugh. Found this at Von Maur for $43. The original soapy Acqua Di Parma is a classic, so I thought why not. Even watched a few videos on this Colonia Club juuuuuuiiice- those young fellas loooooooved this. Ugh. This. Smells. Like. Nearly. Everything. At. The. Fragrance. Counter. At. A. Department. Store.

Off to eBay it goes. I need a time machine to go back to the 1980s and buy up all those spectacular power house masculine fragrances.

Put this is one of the myriad YSL bottles and you’d never be able to tell the difference.

Pass me some ibuprofen for my headache…

Edit….well, the night I sprayed this I got three separate compliments- go figure . I’ll keep this. I still think this smells like a lot of “department store” fragrances…but I’ll try it again.

product_name: Colonia Club Acqua di Parma
review_content: This is the perfect example of how to make a classy, masculine, mature fragrance without smelling dated. I’m in my late 20’s and get compliments on this every time I wear it. It really is a herbaceous and uplifting fragrance without relying ultra heavily on citrus. When I think of a country club or polo, horseshoes, tennis, insert any other old moneyesque sport this fragrance fits the bill. Does it have mega eternal lasting power?
