No. But who buys an sports car and complains about gas mileage. Know what you’re purchasing and why you purchase it. This is a 9/10 for me.

product_name: Colonia Club Acqua di Parma
review_content: I normally don't write reviews. But I absolutely adore the way this feels cool while it sits on my skin. Layering it with a bit of ambroxan puts the finishing touch to a 10/10 frag

product_name: Colonia Club Acqua di Parma
review_content: I think this is great. Very manly, and the mint is deep and green, much like GIT invokes the thought of cut grass. But this is more barbershop and "sharp". Fresh and minty. Classically masculine, smart casual. Recommend.

product_name: Colonia Club Acqua di Parma
review_content: What this reminds me of is Prada Luna Rosa Sport

product_name: Colonia Club Acqua di Parma
review_content:
It's a good scent but not great or stellar in my opinion. Most reviews here brand it to be the greatest thing since the internet but that's not what I feel. This is basically Gillette shaving cream/foam in a spray bottle. It's classic/manly and robust. It is very green but more of the deep kind. Opening is fresh and brash but settles for a more reserved kind of green scent.
If you want more of a diverse green then go for Paco Rabanne Pour Homme. This is a more serious kind of barbershop scent. Performance is stellar for me. I wear it to my clinic at 8 in the morning and I can still smell it at 6 in the evening.

product_name: Colonia Club Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Country club gentlemen in a true sense!! I would say this is the perfect green scent having a pinch of mint and is such a fresh fragrance.
Totally impressive, manly, professional, bold, and classy one. This scent has good longevity and silage is a compliment getter for sure. I just love it! Precious!
Top notes: Mint, Bergamot, Neroli, Lemon, Petitgrain, and Mandarin Orange.
Middle notes: Lavender, Geranium, and Galbanum.
Base notes: Haitian Vetiver, Ambergris, and Musk.

product_name: Colonia Club Acqua di Parma
review_content: This is one of my favourite fragrances- it is an utter shame that they have discontinued this and replaced it with something else with a similar name. Green fresh and cooling is what this fragrance does. Projection is average, its minty vibe is very invigorating, especially in warm weather. I don't know what I can compare it to as I would love to find a fragrance that shares similarities with once this becomes scarce.

product_name: Colonia Club Acqua di Parma
review_content: Mature, but still fresh, minty green as said by many before, and very versatile. Wears well for nearly all situations. Especially good for the office and can be nice in summer evening events for a cooling experience. I can see how this could come across as more bland to a nose accustom to more niche fragrances but I think AdP always strikes a good balance with mass appeal and a refined profile. Blind bought a bottle and have no regrets.

product_name: Colonia Club Acqua di Parma
review_content: Minty, green, adventurous. Great for summer.

product_name: Colonia Club Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Gorgeous fresh minty fragrance! Absolutely love this fragrance for summer! Excellent price too!

10/10

product_name: Colonia Club Acqua di Parma
review_content: This smells exactly like crushed mint leaves with a touch of bergamot/lemon juice. If you have ever muddled mint leaves for a drink or simply rolled/crushed a mint leaf in your hand, you will immediately recognize the very natural smelling mint in Colonia Club. The smell of crushed mint leaves is super realistic- needless to say you must enjoy mint to appreciate this fragrance as there really isn’t much else to it. Longevity 4-5 hrs. 10/10 fragrance imo.

product_name: Colonia Club Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Blind bought a bottle of this I see still available at $60 per 3.4oz. Either I will love it as I love Colonia and Essenza or will sell on later now that it’s discontinued. Will update soon.

Update: from the first sprays I can understand why they discontinued this. The opening smells strange and does not lend itself to sampling in stores and driving purchases. Because for The first 30 minutes or so this is a muddled stinky mess.

I first smell that classy colonia citrus blend in the background but it is quickly overpowered by a Discordant herbal note that somehow is minty but not. It is so herbaceous it is almost like when pulling out nettley stubborn weeds that are bitter, sappy, and pungent. Some reviewers call it spearmint rather than peppermint but either way it is not a clear fresh mintiness. It is mint mixed with some kind of bitter musty green or almost pine smell that just does not smell nice.

Once that recedes this smells fine but nothing special or memorable. It takes an hour to get there and it’s not worth it.

I feel like they really missed an opportunity here. Taking that classy breezy movie star Mediterranean Vibe of Colonia and crafting it into something sporty and evocative of old money equestrian pursuits could be a smash hit of a fragrance. Kind of showing Polo Ralph Lauren how it’s done. But instead this is an obvious embarrassment, so obvious it had to be quickly discontinued.

product_name: Colonia Club Acqua di Parma
review_content:
If you like GIT then you will love this!
It does remind me in initial opening of GIT but that fades away after a couple of minutes.
This is miles better and more modern than GIT which i really like and this one just takes it to the next level.
You get lots of citrus and mint so you must like green fragrances to like this one...
I will be definitely reaching for this one instead of GIT.
If you can find a bottle of this buy it immediately!!

product_name: Colonia Club Acqua di Parma
review_content: If you like the original Prorasso after-shave and are looking for its long lasting spray version then get this!

product_name: Colonia Club Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I think I have the new formula, but I really don't think it's bad!
It leans very masculine, so I don't think I can pull this off but I really like it.

product_name: Colonia Club Acqua di Parma
review_content: The best of ADP now discontinued & replaced by a very average release called also ADP Colonia c.l.u.b.? Why they discontinued the original version? A very weird & tricky policy by LVMH👎 we want the original version back!🤔

product_name: Colonia Club Acqua di Parma
review_content: @phosgene I agree it's a damn sham! It's my favorite from the house. Nothing is more refreshing in my collection than Colonia Club. Love lo

product_name: Colonia Club Acqua di Parma
review_content:
It was staying unused on my shelf for a long time, as I could not find any occasion to use it. Colonia Club is not typical summer fragrance, does not fit to the gym or office environment, but it fits well to skiing or mountain climbing. Every sniff now reminds me of beautiful Pyrenees mountains of Andorra which I visited this year. I am glad that I finally found the use for Colonia Club. Very natural, green, minty, refreshing and long lasting fragrance.

4/5 from me

product_name: Colonia Club Acqua di Parma
review_content: Get yourself a bottle while you can. ADP discontinuing this formula is a crime because the new one is nothing like this.

product_name: Colonia Club Acqua di Parma
review_content: @phosgene I believe it's discontinued but could be wrong. It was always hard to get in U.S.

product_name: Colonia Club Acqua di Parma
review_content:
This is such a lovely green, citrusy and minty scent! Why haven't I discover it sooner. Didn't know it will be discontinued this year and I am so glad to have gotten a bottle of it. The mint note is definitely very prominent in this one and it also gives that cooling sensation to the skin. I also get the more herbal bitter middle note with the mint still lingering around. Really wish this portion of the scent will last forever.

Smells really, really good. If you are still able to grab one of this, please don't procrastinate... get it!

product_name: Colonia Club Acqua di Parma
review_content:
You better really like mint to buy this. It is very heavy in this note for first couple of hours.

Above average fresh green DNA that bucks the trend of citrus freshies. As already stated, this is the heaviest I’ve experienced the mint note. I’ve grown to appreciate it much more after wearing it a number of times,…but, initially found it jarring and abrasive. The mint note tames on dry down…but it retains its minty freshness throughout. It blends with the lavender/geranium/vetiver trio. Although I would wear Le Male Fraiche before this on most days, I’m happy I purchased this.

Longevity and projection are average overall. Although best for spring, one could actually wear this year round by varying sprays.

As always, sample before purchase…I think it nice but not a masterpiece. Also need to be a big fan of mint to enjoy this one.

product_name: Colonia Club Acqua di Parma
review_content: 10/10 discontinued masterpiece

product_name: Colonia Club Acqua di Parma
review_content: So sad this is discontinued. It's an original composition, gentlemanly and fresh. The more I wear it, the more violet leaf I get from it. I don't really get the listed lavender note. It's almost a minty Fahrenheit, without the petrol.

product_name: Colonia Club Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Heads up!

Acqua Di Parma have just replaced this fragrance with one in a different bottle (clear), with a similar but different name (C.L.U.B.) and with different notes.

I messaged Acqua Di Parma directly and they confirmed that it is an entirely different scent and the original Colonia Club is now discontinued. Grab it whilst you can.

P.s. This is an amazing scent, super under-rated, and one of the best from ADP in my opinion. I’m so glad I got a bottle of this whilst I could. Minty, green, aquatic, gentlemanly goodness. Real shame to see it go.

product_name: Colonia Club Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Opens with a sharp mint. Give it about 30sec-1min, and you start to pick up the bergamot and citrus notes. Mint becomes more of a green fresh scent that blends well with the citrus. In the background, you have a masculine barbershop-fougère backbone. Not sure why it’s labeled unisex. I get over an hour of good projection. I get about another hour of elbow length projection and another 2 hours of a skin scent. This is great for spring, summer, and fall outdoor activities. Overall, I love this fragrance and too bad it’s been discontinued

Scent: 7
Longevity: 6
Silage:6
Versatility:6

product_name: Colonia Club Acqua di Parma
review_content: On my skin it lasts 12+ hours, and has quite a powerful silage, especially the first few hours; thereafter the silage becomes much more intimate, but very much noticeable. I would agree with "FragDood" that it looks exactly like it smells...very nice in my opinion.

product_name: Colonia Club Acqua di Parma
review_content:
This literally has everything I want in a fragrance. Be careful where you apply this, it will bite you ;)
It last pretty much all day on me, 6 A.M. to 5 P.M. when I'm at the gym. It looks exactly how it smells in my opinion. If you're not a fan of mint then this may not be for you.

10/10

product_name: Colonia Club Acqua di Parma
review_content: Love it's minty green freshness just wish the performance was better..it's gone within an hour

product_name: Colonia Club Acqua di Parma
review_content: This is one scent that immediately brings an image of a vast lush green Golf course on a bright sunny day, in my mind, the vibes of being focussed and just being in a relaxed state of mind at the same time, away from all the clutter and stress in your head. Therapeutic freshness. To me this associates with the golf clubs, golf balls, bags, golf carts, caddies, just scenic greenery all around. This is fresh, airy, soapy, a great scent for a quick vacation IMO. Captures that essence quite beautifully, one of my favourite freshies up there, and a top release from Acqua Di Parma.

product_name: Colonia Club Acqua di Parma
review_content: If any fragrance can be described as barbershoppish it is this one. It is fresh, pleasant and makes you feel clean but it's also a bit boring.

product_name: Colonia Club Acqua di Parma
review_content: Strong opening but dries down to pine needles and mint - a very green scent

product_name: Colonia Club Acqua di Parma
review_content: Was told by a SA yesterday that this one is to be discontinued from 2022. Grab it whilst you can.

product_name: Colonia Club Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I just bought a bottle on a discount, very fresh and nice scent, but i don´t get the comments saying it is somehow close to Green Irish Tweed... since GIT is my signature scent, i can tell you Colonia Club does not have anything in common with Green Irish Tweed in my opinion...
I really like the freshness Colonia Club offers, and the longevity and projection are very nice. If it had a little less lavender and a little more vetiver i would give it a 5 out of 5, but since the lavender is a little too strong, i will give it a 4 out of 5.

product_name: Colonia Club Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Colonia Club from Acqua di Parma is one of my biggest fragrance discoveries in 2021. One of a kind masterpiece, and still a hidden gem.

The genius inclusion of Ambergris in the old-school green scent genre from the 1970s is what takes Colonia Club on a whole new level, and makes it contemporary, unlike the original 1916 edition.

To my nose, mint dominates the fragrance, and that salty note is to die for. Thankfully, the saltiness is not amplified as in for example Profumum Roma Acqua di Sale and is closer to something we have already seen in Giorgio Armani's Acqua di Gio Profumo or Tom Ford's Costa Azzurra.

Read the full review on scentgrail.com

product_name: Colonia Club Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Opening is reminiscent to GIT - that eventually fades and you get a green, blue scent if that makes sense? Mass appealing and fresh.

If only the colonia line lasted a little longer. Imagine a Colonia Intensa EDP? They'd make a killing!

product_name: Colonia Club Acqua di Parma
review_content: smells expensive and rich, a bit minty and green notes of petit leaves in orange field in the opening, afterwhile it dries down to aromatic lavender and herbal galbanum that gives it woody and greenish earthy vibes and finally at the end you get musk like a vintage 80. 90s feel kind of barbarshop. all in all i cant get enough of this perfume and keep sniffing after while.

product_name: Colonia Club Acqua di Parma
review_content: The notes blend well with those of Aventus and it's clones... just spray each side by side on each arm, overlapping sprays about 1 inch.

product_name: Colonia Club Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Right off the bat, this is a beautiful cologne...it's sophisticated, relaxing and comforting. I can't help but being reminded of Lilt ... there is a definite "totally tropical" quality to it and I detect pineapple (even though it does not appear listed). It makes me think of colonial times.
That being sad... longevity is not great (as with most of colognes out there) and it loses its magic in the dry-down, where it becomes a generic (think all saints' sunset riot) synthetic citrusy skin scent.

product_name: Colonia Club Acqua di Parma
review_content: I can confirm @waldoseye's account on the burning sensation. For me it was my left inner elbow and a little on my neck where I applied. Not sure what is causing it but it left a dark sensitive spot on my elbow. This was from a tester. Smells good for what it is, not something I would reach for often. Can see the similarities to Carven L'eau Intense but with a less "plastic" smell which makes Club better in my opinion.

product_name: Colonia Club Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I have already reviewed and given mentholated fragrance stellar marks but I wanted to warn you all to not apply too much of this fragrance on a single spot on your skin. The mint will give you cooling feeling which actually becomes painful.

For some reason I decided to spray 5x on each inside elbow and for the next hour it was a burning painful cold. I just tolerated it because it smelled so damn good. Honestly I might have struggled to drive with such pain, it was not a mere tingle, be careful!

product_name: Colonia Club Acqua di Parma
review_content:
It’s colonia the original and colonia pura with a little green notes
Not a good one unfortunately
If I tested it I wouldn’t have bought it
But that’s the tax of blind buying

product_name: Colonia Club Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I love this fragrance! It’s a fresh barbershop fragrance for people who don’t like old time associations of that type of fragrance. It never overtly smells of barbershop. Even Sedley with its modern mass appeal twist is more traditional than this one. I wore this once on a night out and had close to 10 compliments! This is not to say this is a “clubbing” scent, but it is to highlight just how versatile this is; yes it’s fresh and uplifting, but it’s not a wispy citrus and it always gives you a cool confident aura. It carries the confidence and respect of something traditional while maintaining a modern sleek allure- hmmm seems like it captures young Italian fashion.

Anyways I must disagree with the note pyramid. I totally understand why people speak so much of the mint, because of a sharp green feeling at the top mixing with the citrus. But I do not detect mint as strongly as others- there is nothing here that can remind you of toothpaste, not herbal, not mint candy, the cooling effect is present but not dominant. Rather I would want to say this is dominated at the top by petit grain, zesty lemon, and behind this is the mint- definitely detectable but only used to “cool” down the sharpness of the top. This can be summed up saying this is not a mint dominant fragrance but if you don’t like mint you won’t like this.

The zesty character of lemon is slowly replaced by a more mellow bergamot coupled with a mildly sweet lavender. Wow I love the levels of lavender- not enough to be prominent but it smooths the fragrance oh so nicely. It is still green and uplifting with a touch of citrus for many hours, the top is not too fleeting.

From about 30 minutes in I can detect ambergris holding the whole fragrance together. It has a salty waxy cloudy feeling. If you look for it you will smell it distinctly, but I think for most people it’s a more that tends to “hide”. Even if it’s prominent it’s not the type note the nose identifies easily, it just adds a bit of flavor. It’s like eating a salted chocolate chip cookie- the salt is crucial and prominent but most mouth focus in on the sweetness and richness of the cookie rather than the salt.

I must say to my nose this is ambroxan. Forgive me if this is actual ambergris but to me this has the smell of ambroxan. Do not for a second think it’s an ambroxan bomb or a “blue” fragrance. Here the ambroxan serves its role beautifully, here it is really mimicking ambergris.

Any age can pull this off but I think this has a special appeal to 25-40yrs old. It feels like a really cool put together guy with a bit of traditional masculinity walked into a house of LA influencers. His character seems exceptionally weighty in this environment. At once both the most reserved and yet the one with the largest character and personality.

product_name: Colonia Club Acqua di Parma
review_content: This is a very fresh and green scent. If you don't like mint in fragrances you will not like Colonia Club at all. This is a spring scent for me as the greeness suits the season well. It makes me think of a cloudy spring day after heavy rain. It has some punch and character which makes it a bit of a mature scent. This fragrance is not for everyone which is one of the reasons I like it.

product_name: Colonia Club Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I love mint in fragrances , I have nearly run out of my PDM Sedley so ive been looking for a possible replacement. As Sedley is hard to find here in the UK for a reasonable price, it smells great but not £200 great!

I tested colonia club side by side with essenza. The minty greenness in club is just perfection. Essenza would be ideal for a guy abit older who possibly wears suits to the office, I usually dress more smart casual. Anyway I put Colonia club on for a daytime date and the women I met couldn't stop sniffing me and while outside she kept trying to catch whiffs in the wind. She said it was the best scent she has ever smelt on a man !

Considering Colonia Club flies under the radar and is not spoke about much on youtube, it can be found at discounters at a great price. I can get like 2-3 bottles of club for the same price as 1 bottle of Sedley, I actually think Club smells of slightly higher quality.

I think I have found my new minty signature scent 10/10

product_name: Colonia Club Acqua di Parma
review_content: This is in my humble opinion and much to my regret not a good one from one of my favorite perfume houses, Acqua di Parma. Colonia Club opens up in a bitter mint and pine blast. It can be a refreshing wake up scent in very hot weather, but there are many more pleasant and better green fresh day starters for those hot days. Fortunately the first dry down is a little more pleasant. But still the bitter mint and pine keeps on bothering the more pleasant ingredients that are waiting to come out. There is neroli, lavender, mandarin, musk and vetiver in the dry down but the damage is already done and ruins the whole proces. This has fortunately some ADP quality in the final dry down that withholds this fragrance from becoming a cheap and bad Pino Silvestre clone. And if you like bitter piney fragrances in the line of Polo than this could be something worthwhile checking out, but for me it's a pass. I"ll rather grab my Colonia Essenza that I like so much in it's brilliant elegance and sublime freshness.

product_name: Colonia Club Acqua di Parma
review_content:
What's for breakfast ? MINT
What's for lunch ? MINT
What's the late night movie ? THE MINTRIX. It starts right after MINT she wrote.
I like mint but not when it's used in place of a death ray.

Still, you know, Parma quality, can't really hate it.

product_name: Colonia Club Acqua di Parma
review_content: Very uplifting fragrance one of the most fresh fragrances you will ever experience when you apply to your body it’s maybe the menthol note you will feel a little burn but in a good and relaxing way.

product_name: Colonia Club Acqua di Parma
review_content:
At first, this one is very green and minty, somewhat earthy. As it dries, it becomes more citrusy and slightly floral. It’s very fresh and pleasant to wear on hot days.

The longevity is okay, approx. 3 hours on me. The sillage is moderate. Price is alright, could be better but could be worse. It is fairly masculine, but not enough to not be considered unisex.

7/10. It is nice and green, and citrusy. I just wished it lasted longer.

product_name: Colonia Club Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Strong mint then green. Decent performance. For me sits behind others such as GIT (lemon/violet) or CW (fresh/ozonic). Other barbershop fragrances have a lightness, or sweeter feel, which lifts the experience. Beau de Jour, for example? The green here is a bit like rubbed leaves on fingers, not my cup of tea sadly.
2/5

product_name: Colonia Club Acqua di Parma
review_content: Colonia Club opens with a burst of refreshing spearmint and slowly dries down into a classic barbershop fragrance. On paper this fragrance isn't outstanding but upon purchasing/smelling it, it has been something I have worn back to back now for weeks. At the rate I'm using this at, I will need another bottle in a few months but I am happy to do so as I feel great when wearing Colonia Club.

product_name: Colonia Club Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I partially agree with the reviewer below me. This opens like Green Irish Tweed. Not really cool water so much, cool water is synthetic sweet-ish with a bit of a laundry vibe.

To me this fragrance smells like if you mixed GIT, MMM At The Barber's and Drakaar Noir.
You could even throw a little bit of Creed Original Vetiver into that mix.

Nice fragrance with vintage vibe and good performance for an ADP.

product_name: Colonia Club Acqua di Parma
review_content:
This shares the same style as Green Irish Tweed/Cool Water. A bit mature, green, sporty and fresh. But i prefer this one as it doesn't get as a dry as Green Irish tweed when the violet kicks in. Colonia Club stays fresh for hours and hours.

Ok im not biased towards AdP at all, but i don't think you can go wrong if Intensa, Futura and Club were the only 3 fragrances a man needs. They are done in such a way that it's impossible to dislike them because of how soft and clean they are that can be worn at any occasion. Manly, but doesn't try to scream masculinity. Just confident clean masculinity.
This trio just screams my personality and how i want to smell.

product_name: Colonia Club Acqua di Parma
review_content: More masculine than most of their product. Lasts longer. The mint is nearly absent on my skin. What's left reminds me of Intenza, Assoluta, and Essenza. All three of which are great

product_name: Colonia Club Acqua di Parma
review_content: It has so much similarities to Creed’s Green Irish Tweed but the lavender adds a classic vibe to it. The performance is not great but the scent is nice and would be suitable for an older gentleman.

product_name: Colonia Club Acqua di Parma
review_content: This is hands down the best of the ADP Colonia family. I can’t get enough of that fresh mint and the cooling menthol zing on my skin. Classy, uniquely green, and refreshing like tart lemon sorbet. Combine all this with the renown ADP top quality ingredients and it equals a must have Colonia flanker! My signature scent for spring & summer.

product_name: Colonia Club Acqua di Parma
review_content: This an outstanding fragrance. It is what you see. All its notes reflect "green". It drys splendid. I used it, and I recommend it for hot days and for outdoors activities. For activities such as golfing, being at the beach (Cabo) or just next to the pool with a fresh mojito.

product_name: Colonia Club Acqua di Parma
review_content: A mature but fun but chic, minty barbershop fragrance for a man with throwaway money. While it references classic fragrance, the perfumer employs molecules that keep Colonial Club contemporary. A successful and quite Italian style with their flair for minimal and elegant design that is completely up to date yet incorporates "timeless classic". I mention throwaway money because the perfect packaging of this gem would be a BIG splash bottle, over 200ml, priced about 40 bucks. Though it doesn't smell at all like Royal Bain de Caron, it would be the perfect compliment scent. A big bottle of cologne one leaves in a guest bathroom.

product_name: Colonia Club Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Mint
White Florals
Citrus

All done right and executed to perfection for a very pleasant uplifting modern gentleman scent. Longevity, especially from ADP, is better than most of their offerings

9.5/10 Overall

product_name: Colonia Club Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Fresh vibrant aromatic herbal with an vintage vibe 🌿
Surprisingly, this works well with my skin performance wise and this stuck to my frag eating skin for a good while.
This is a throwback to herbal powerhouse fragrances from the past but doesn't feel to dated. However, this might be better suited for an older gentleman.

product_name: Colonia Club Acqua di Parma
review_content: Beautiful clean, green and minty fresh fragrance. Casual spring-time scent, very classy and elegant. Not amazing performance like most ADP but lovely quality all the same. Probably best suited to more mature wearers

product_name: Colonia Club Acqua di Parma
review_content: Fantastic modern take on an old school fresh/green scent. Mint/Citrus opening that's bright and sharp, then dries down to a green, musky, and clean scent that I can't get enough of. Beautifully blended and high quality. No headache from this fresh greenie. A softer more modern GIT is a reasonable comparison, and though you can never mistake one for the other, it's true that the vibes are somewhat similar. Very versatile. Wife LOVES it which is a nice bonus. Got 100 mL for 49$ after sampling, well worth it! Will definitely be in my rotation this spring/summer/fall.

product_name: Colonia Club Acqua di Parma
review_content: blind purchase. I am a fan of ADP but the floral aspect of this scent reminds me of iris and violet - which aren’t in any descriptions - but I dislike both of those - prefer rose - the mint is more a wintergreen that a peppermint. Quality fragrance but doesn’t suite my taste

product_name: Colonia Club Acqua di Parma
review_content: I love mint in fragrances but find it quite a difficult note to pull off well. It either evaporates within minutes or smells like chewing gum. ADP got as close as possible to a really great mint/green fragrance with this one. There is something a bit dewy, redolent of the new greenness of spring, that is captured here. I understand the GIT references- Colonia Club definitely draws inspiration from that classic, but it is miles better than the cheapie clones like Aspen, Tres Nuit, etc. This one avoid the chemical mess that those two eventually devolve into. Strange that ADP labels this as unisex. It is definitely based on a classic and well-known masculine fragrance DNA, but whatever. With the moderate price this goes for on discounter sites, its a great spring/summer option. A modernized take on a classic scent profile, it may skew a bit mature but it just smells nice and fresh with a bit of mellow haziness underneath.

product_name: Colonia Club Acqua di Parma
review_content: This is without a doubt a rich, complex fragrance best suited for the warmer months, or cooler evenings. The citrus notes come out right away as in all ADP scents. But the mint along with the Musk and Ambergris in the background were quite hard for my brain to compute. I did not really enjoy it. The vetiver balances it all out with a refined woodiness. But unfortunately after 3 hours on my skin this unique product was almost completely gone. Not just a skin scent, but gone? This is a non linear scent that will take you on a wonderful adventure. Unfortunately for me that journey was too short lived. Put it on your body and go for a walk if you can first to see how it develops. For the price I do not see it as a wise blind buy unless you are familiar with wearing ADP products.

product_name: Colonia Club Acqua di Parma
review_content:
This is a fresh , timeless classic fragrance for the stylish modern gentleman. It opens up with like fresh citrusy soapy then dry down is musky.
This perfume is perfect for the spring, summer and fall. I like Colonia Club Acqua Di Parma.
Rating : 7 / 10

product_name: Colonia Club Acqua di Parma
review_content:
a modern masterpiece, if you own this you will be the worthy son of a father who rocked GIT by Creed. modern, fresh citrus mint vetiver and absolute class.
10/10

product_name: Colonia Club Acqua di Parma
review_content:
This is a beautiful but (as is often the case with Acqua di Parma freshies) a slightly short lived old school green fragrance. I also have noticed that the amount of mint varies slightly by batch. I have a 50ml bottle and a 180ml (I really love this fragrance :) )and there is noticeably more mint in the 50ml unfortunately (as that bottle won't last me for too much longer).

It opens with a gorgeously refreshing blast of natural smelling fresh mint which leaves a palpable tingling sensation on the skin. I love mint in fragrances but it can often smell very synthetic (Versace Eros) or be lost within the other notes (Chanel Allure Homme Sport Eau Extreme). Not here though. It's front an center and smells incredible for about 30 mins

As it moves to the mid and dry-down the mint pulls back but is still noticeable, and the ADP Colonia DNA comes to the fore. Now citruses, petitigrain and lavender are blending in to make a really classy and sophisticated barbershop fougere. It probably works better in it's intended environment of coastal Mediterranean rather than colder northern climates TBH. You do get a bit of the ambergris and musk in the drydown but after 3 hours this has lost most of it's potency and is a fresh and clean skin scent.

I'm in my 30s and on a cool spring day in a shirt and shades by the coast this fragrance makes me feel like a million dollars. It's classy and sophisticated and one I'll have in my collection forever.

product_name: Colonia Club Acqua di Parma
review_content: wow! how heavy the brand name is. For me Davidoff Cool Water Night Dive is 2 times better and 3 times cheaper !!!

product_name: Colonia Club Acqua di Parma
review_content:
A MINTY CITRUS FLORAL

Beautiful sparkling opening. Fresh and elegant. I'm usually not a fan of lavender, but this was blended perfectly.

The dry down is a disappointment. well, for me. I just don't enjoy ambergris.

Although this won't join my fragrance wardrobe, it was a worthwhile sampling.

product_name: Colonia Club Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Synthetic crap with a lot of ambroxan (not declarated) in the drydown.

The opening is like Prorraso after shave. Lots of mint and green notes, with ice effect.

Maybe for 20$.

product_name: Colonia Club Acqua di Parma
review_content:
A beautiful barbershop frag - fresh mint and creamy shaving soap - the mint dominates!

not synthetic at all!

I have smelled products in shaving that smell identical to this one!

A nice cool smell to wear and guaranteed compliments!

ideally winter and autumn, Spring - believe me summer does not compliment this one

product_name: Colonia Club Acqua di Parma
review_content: Colonia Club is a classic, old school fragrance, but that's not a bad thing. On the contrary, in my mind, it's a good thing when you're feeling nostalgic and want to feel fresh and clean, like on a Sunday after a shower when you're going to lay around the house watching TV. This reminds me of those manly scents I grew up smelling on my father and grandfather, which I loved. The opening is very cold and minty, with bergamot and petitgrain. It definitely is cooling on your skin, which is great in the tropical climate I live in. The tingling lingers for quite a while. The notes of lavender, ambergris, musk, galbanum, and vetiver combine to smell like wet, green plants and cold, clean wood floors. I'm not exactly sure how this works, but it is very pleasing in my hot and humid climate. It makes me imagine sitting in room with cool teak wood floors and a ceiling fan on high, watching the heavy rain fall on the tropical plants outside, causing steam to rise of the earth. Longevity is moderate at about 5 hours for me, with moderate projection. It's a very refreshing scent.

product_name: Colonia Club Acqua di Parma
review_content: AdP Colonia with a minty green twist. Clean, fresh and elegant. Quality ingredients excellently blended. Sillage surprisingly good. Longevity so-so (as expected for a freshie). Really nice warm weather option. Not a ground breaker, but I don't think it was intended to be.....

product_name: Colonia Club Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Big LOVE for me
i'm 31 and I love this stuff
it's green,it's fresh
wearing this is making a statement

it smells luxury and class
if you look at the top of this page you'll see people riding horses/playing polo...that's that kind of vibe
green fresh luxurious forest vibe

I thing I could wear this indoors but outdoors is where it becomes magnificent

gives you a nice scent bubble and a nice silage when the catches it

longevity in high heat humid sunny day is around 3h
guess it will be more in temperatures below 38C

definitely not for every one
sample first
8/10

This and Armani eau de cedre are my favorite ''forest'' vibe but the Armani is a beast going in a totally different path

product_name: Colonia Club Acqua di Parma
review_content: I just got this fragrance. It's my second foray into the house of ADP. Colonia Club is nice but I was expecting a bit more (especially after owning Essenza). I get the comparison with Cool Water but only in the opening. On my skin, it opens up with a clean, fresh, herbaceous, natural smelling fresh mint and dries down to a slightly sweet mint and lavender combination. I think the lavender dry down makes it more of a mature scent however it's by no means an 'old man's smell'. Other notes I get are ambroxan which is present in the opening giving an ever so slightly salty/aquatic/shower gel vibe and citrus both of which aren't as dominant as the mint and lavender to me. That's pretty much all I get as far as the notes go for now. Overall, this is a clean, pleasant, inoffensive, herbaceous easy to wear fragrance suitable for any occasion.

product_name: Colonia Club Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I’ve tried a couple of the AdP Colonia bit can’t wrap my head around their popularity.

This one kind a reminds me of Ralph Lauren Polo Sport.
So it’s like a cheap shower gel kind a scent to it.
It’s definitely fresh but it’s nothing special or interesting about it.

product_name: Colonia Club Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Acqua Di Parma Colonia club opens with a moderate projection of neroli, mint, bergamot, and petitgrain. The petitgrain is a prominent note and it feels green with a citrus touch, a tone similar to pine mixed with vetiver; the neroli is also citrusy but bitter and sharp and mixes well the lemon and bergamot. The mint adds its green, fresh and aromatic accord to the blend. The opening notes are a citrusy sharp and vibrant green. In just a moment, the lavender adds its floral clean-like aroma, but it is just a touch. The vetiver joins the blend bringing its strong, sharp, green, freshly cut grass-like accord. Both, the ambergris and musk start developing their accords boosting the green accords more than the citrus accords. The ambergris has a faint mineral and animalic accord. At this point, the citrus accords have subsided a bit leaving the green accords to dominate the fragrance. The most important change from the opening to the dry-down is the change from citrus and green, to a green and citrus fragrance and the development of a noticeable musky accord. The color of the bottle could not tell more effectively the type of fragrance that is in it. Once Acqua Di Parma Colonia Club has reached its full dry-down, it can be summarized as a moderate projection, sharp green (vetiver, petitgrain, mint), citrus (bergamot, lemon) fragrance with noticeable slightly animalic musk and soft lavender accords. The fragrance feels classy, cold, earthy, exotic, grassy, herbaceous, mature, rich, sharp, unisex, and mildly pleasant.

BATCH REVIEWED: 2020.
WOW RATING: 9/10. The strong green and musky accords are impressive.
DISLIKE RATING: 5/10. Some people will find offensive the strong green and slightly animalic but prominent musky accords.
UNIQUENESS: 9/10. The combination of green accords makes this fragrance very unique.
MASS APPEAL: 1/10. Strong green and musky fragrances are not mass-appeal. Its green and musky nature give it a classy and old school vibe that younger men will find unpleasant.
PROJECTION: 3/10. Moderate, about 3 feet around the wearer.
SILLAGE: 4/10. Moderate, about 4 feet behind the wearer.
APPLICATION: Four atomizations will suffice.
LONGEVITY: 4/10. Moderate, about 4 hours with 1 hour of good projection.
SEASONS: Spring, summer, and fall.
OCCASIONS: Formal events, outdoor gatherings, office, casual, clubbing. In moderation, this is an office-friendly fragrance.
VERSATILITY: 6/10. Relatively versatility, it can be worn for many occasions including the office.
GENDER: Unisex. The green and musk accords are neutral.
AGES: 40 and up. Green and musky fragrances are better suited for mature wearers.
RECOMMENDATION: Enjoying this fragrance requires a well-defined appreciation for green and musky accords and fragrances for mature wearers. If that is the case, then this is a good buy. Others may want to consider alternatives.
BLIND-BUY: No, sample it first, the musky accord is peculiar.
SIMILAR: Acqua Di Parma Men Colonia Essenza EDP is another very musky fragrance that combines citrus, fresh spicy, white floral, woody, and musk accords.
SUMMARY: A moderate projection, sharp green (vetiver, petitgrain, mint), citrus (bergamot, lemon) fragrance with noticeable slightly animalic musk and soft lavender accords. The fragrance feels classy, cold, earthy, exotic, grassy, herbaceous, mature, rich, sharp, unisex, and mildly pleasant.

product_name: Colonia Club Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Got myself a decant of this. Wore it twice to get an idea. It has a very nice citrus opening - very pleasant & uplifting.

It also has that icy hot cooling effect of eucalyptus or menthol on my skin. There is a minty effect going on but it's not sinus clearing.

It dries down to an aromatic woody scent for me. Nicely blended, a tiny bit ozonic which makes it feel a little "designer" to me but still not a bad scent.

4 sprays - light to medium projection.

product_name: Colonia Club Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I know it’s released before Mr Burberry indigo but
This one AdP colonia club is a bit of Davidoff Cool Water especially in the opening and Mr Burberry indigo in the dry down

Smells good and fresh but the price i got 100ml for 95$ after discount

product_name: Colonia Club Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Update after a few months: i am half through the bottle as i love it so much.
i have close to 100 fragrances btw so i rarely wear the same thing twice in a row.
It is fresh, minty, a bit citrusy, classy, sporty, long lasting

One of my favorites from Acqua di Parma and one of the best masculine minty based scents.
Incredibly fresh, pleasing, smooth.
A classic and ageless scent.

product_name: Colonia Club Acqua di Parma
review_content:
It blasted my sinus away with mint. Quickly my mood ‘transported’ into a high end golf course somewhere in a southeast asian country during summer and colonia club keeps my skin cool and feeling refreshed from the citruses.

It literally cool & refresh your skin.

Scent: 4/5 refreshing colonia dna with doses of mint
Projection: 4/5 during early phase and 2/5 for the mid and drydown
Longevity: 2/5

product_name: Colonia Club Acqua di Parma
review_content: I'm very impressed with Colonia Club, it's right up there with Essenza as my favorites from the house at the moment. A very green, herbal, fresh scent. Evocative of walking through a meadow in spring like Creed Green Irish Tweed is supposed to be.

product_name: Colonia Club Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Got a bottle of this.. another blind buy (nearly all of my purchases are and because I bought essenza a few weeks ago and I really like it) ... and I’ve gotta say that, although I only applied it 10 minutes ago for the first time, I really like it. Fresh, green, cooling Citrus and mint.. and yes, as others have pointed out it really does have a cooling effect on your skin.

I have Essenza as well and I really like that too, and I’m surprised to say it, but I think even in this early stage, I like Club equally if not more than essenza... it’s got a really nice zing to it.

It’s funny.... A few weeks ago after purchasing essenza I sprayed it a couple of times on my neck/collar area and then a few minutes later put a couple of pieces of peppermint chewing gum in my mouth and started chewing.. the mint from the chewing gum mixed with the essenza in my throat/nasal passages and it smelt like a really minty fresh boosted mix of essenza and I thought “they should add mint to this essenza stuff”... well now I know that with Club they already have!..

Can’t stop smelling my wrist and I’m looking forward to seeing what the dry down is like and how long it lasts on my skin.. hopefully as long/or even longer than essenza...

product_name: Colonia Club Acqua di Parma
review_content: Super Green Smell with surprising lasting power. I can smell it on my clothes and my blankets for days after wearing it. The smell is fresh and clean. I get Mint, citrus, and Ambergris. I think this smell is really a spring time smell but its winter and i love it just the same. This stuff is beautiful and I am surprised that there is not more love for this scent.

product_name: Colonia Club Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Gotta write again...

Just wore my fave t shirt. It has been washed twice in three days - it’s also chlorine soaked as I’ve worn it to the pool and back.

Three days ago I sprayed CC and the shirt still smells lol.

Again as I keep saying - though it’s an EDC it is amazing quality.

The smooth creamy lime and mint powers through the day. Not at a loud ‘look at me!’ Volume but rather akin to playing good music at a low volume through a Bose sound system - it sounds good and better than playing it loud on something else...

product_name: Colonia Club Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Scent: 6/10

Quality: 5/10

Originality: 4/10

Sillage: 6/10

Projection: 5/10

Longevity: 6/10

Price VS Size: 4/10

product_name: Colonia Club Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I've spent a lot of time with my decant of this fragrance. At first, I didn't get good performance with it. But the more I wear it, the longer it seems to last on my skin. I think that has more to do with my nose than it does the fragrance or my skin. Anyway, it's a beautiful fragrance and the most spring-oriented fragrance in the AdP line up, in my opinion.

It's very modern and classy. My girlfriend thinks it smells like something a young person would wear, and I think she meant it smells sporty and fresh. I think anyone over the age of 20 can wear this one.

Yes, it's comparable to GIT, but I think this is better and more unique, due to the refined mint accord. I think I'm gonna buy a full bottle.

product_name: Colonia Club Acqua di Parma
review_content: It's the most plasticy mint I've ever smelled. A product that costs hundreds of euros but it should be on supermarket shelves.No polo club here. One of the worst Acqua di parma.

product_name: Colonia Club Acqua di Parma
review_content:
When first sprayed, it actually has a cooling effect on the skin! It perfectly compliments the smell. This is country club gentleman all the way. It's fresh without trying to be fresh, if that makes sense. Not in-your-face fresh.

It's my favorite "green" scent. There's a hint of mint, too. Others here describe it well. Easily office friendly, very professional. No one could flat out hate it!

It's one of the few fragrances out there that I smelled in the store and thought about for months how I really wanted it, sparingly spraying my tiny sample and feeling as giddy about it each time as I did the first. Finally saw it half-off from an authorized retailer, and I pulled the trigger; should've bought the 100 mL. I should add that I own over 50 fragrances, including from high-end heavy-hitters Tom Ford, Creed, Clive Christian, Giorgio Armani Prive, By Kilian, etc.... And if I'm being honest, few of them blew me away the first time like this does and still does.

Longevity is better for me than people here. 7-12 hours. 5 hours if I'm getting really hot. Perfectly acceptable for a fresh fragrance that isn't even an EDP.

10/10 scent, 9.5/10 longveity, 10/10 sillage and performance. Highly recommend, blind buy worthy.

product_name: Colonia Club Acqua di Parma
review_content:
One look at the bottle will basically tell you what this fragrance smells like. Colonia Club has the basic AdP Colonia line DNA, but it goes in a greener direction.
The primary note is a multifaceted take on mint. It's earthy, as though it is still in the ground, and is slightly pungent. It lacks the coldness of peppermint or spearmint oil, and smells more like you just crushed some fresh mint in your hand. Lavender begins to rear its head as the scent dries down, and rings true to the smell of pure lavender oil. The neroli is not as prominent as I was expecting, but it's still there, and the lemon is more forward than the voted main notes would indicate.

Performance is moderate, but that's to be expected. I get maybe 6 hours from it, and it's a skin scent by the end of the first hour.

product_name: Colonia Club Acqua di Parma
review_content: I expect to get people mad at this but really nice yet kind of reminds me of a cleaner more balanced Invictus Aqua with a green note & slightly ozonic dry down.

product_name: Colonia Club Acqua di Parma
review_content: I like this, but I read it as a fougere. Like Paco Rabanne DNA. And I don't smell any mint. BUT - I had my sinuses operated on last week and my sense of smell is all messed up and comes and goes! I wonder if I'll like this in a few months when I heal up? I bet I'll smell the mint then, and won't like it. Generally, mint-based frags remind me too much of toothpaste and dentistry.

product_name: Colonia Club Acqua di Parma
review_content: Really enjoying this, the big burst of citrus stops this from smelling too mature and dated. Very classy mint based colonia

product_name: Colonia Club Acqua di Parma
review_content: I invariably use AdP colonias very rapidly, this was no exception, 100ml got used up in no time at all. Well-blended, green, I get mint, a very rounded vetiver and a dash of AdP citrus DNA. There also seems to be a touch of geranium in there too. Used, enjoyed, did not really move me as such, currently no plans to re-purchase as a result of that. Nice bottle, nice advertising campaign. A solid 7 out of 10.

product_name: Colonia Club Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Over the 5 flankers of the original Colonia , it's the only one that can really be called a flanker, and not just a "copy with a twist".

That said, for currently $90 online, I expect more from a fragrance than other frags that do the same job (Dunhill Icon Racing $45, Cartier Roadster $25), and sometimes in more modern way (Carven L'Eau Intense $30).

I have to echo other reviewers in that it's good in quality, but poor in orginality, and targets younger crowds: just another drop into the sea of fresh green and sweet fragrances. That said, if you don't already own any, it may be worth it. Just keep in mind that without the AdP label, it would probably retail for half its price. A pass for me.

Spring/Summer days, 40+

product_name: Colonia Club Acqua di Parma
review_content: EDC Really? Colonia Club definitely has original Colonia ADN plus neroli and subtle mint and lavender. IMO is not a light scent but fresh, manly not unisex IMO, nothing original but a really nice green twist to classical Colonia. Recommended 100% for Spring and summer as well. Performance surprised me, Assoluta uses to last 3-4 hours on my skin, Essenza 6-8 hours, Colonia Club lasted +12hrs (6 sprays, spring, 20ºC).

product_name: Colonia Club Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Love it. Aromatic Citrusy Fougere vibe. More refined, modern, and wearable than cheaper or louder Fougeres. Slight bits of Drakkar Noir, Polo, Brut...but in a very refined and different way. Moderate performance. Scent: 9, Performance: 6, Overall: 7.5

UPDATE: Bought a full bottle and wore extensively. Noticing more of the cooling mint scent and feel. Also the soapy vibe, like Essenza but less pronounced and definitely less tangy. Very versatile, but wish it lasted longer. Maybe 4-6 hrs, mostly as a skin scent after 2 hrs. Still love it but seems less unique now that I've worn it so much.

product_name: Colonia Club Acqua di Parma
review_content: Opens up with a calm blast of bergamot, neroli, lavender, fresh mint and green notes. The mint is superb but becomes subtle and light within minutes.Very herbal and refreshing. Overall it is well rounded, refined, and non-offensive. There's no Aspen, no GIT, and definitely no Rive Gauche resemblance whatsoever though. This fragrance has its own thing going on. Great stuff for the heat.

product_name: Colonia Club Acqua di Parma
review_content:
The opening of Colonia Club is very reminiscent of Issey Miyake’s original L’eau d’Issey - lots of old school bright citrus notes, nice on their own - but AdP’s offering really comes into its own when the mint leaves come forward - really well crafted, crisp and green and fresh - that is backed up by a lovely smooth vetiver just at ‘the back of the room.’

I can see this being applied post-sauna at a clubhouse, just before Cocktail Hour. It has decent projection, even in colder weather - my girlfriend could smell it at arms length even in a sharp wind - so drinks on the veranda on a cold evening won’t kill it. A few sprays lasted close to 6 hours on my skin on a cold January day/evening.

Colonia Club is definitely one of the better of Acqua di Parma's more recent offerings.

product_name: Colonia Club Acqua di Parma
review_content: Definitely it's not lineal. I prefer the dry down. I find it divine with the creamy and bright vetiver. It's green but not as green irish tweed by creed. It projects well and it lasts for a freshy

product_name: Colonia Club Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I'm impressed! Colonia Club is essentially Aqua Di Parma's answer to Yves Saint Laurent's take on Barbasol shaving cream - Rive Gauche. This is the Italian version, inspired by Proraso. Super fresh and masculine and dare I say a little sexy. Colonia Club shares that magic with Rive Gauche where it smells very fresh but also slightly dirty and macho at the same time.

High quality too, and that mint top note... probably the best mint note I've smelled in a fragrance to date and the fragrance evolves nicely from there, definitely no boring linear scent here.

If you like Rive Gauche or similar fresh fragrances like Green Irish Tweed, you'll almost certainly like this. If you also like Italian scents in general, I can pretty much guarantee it.

product_name: Colonia Club Acqua di Parma
review_content: Just bought this today and I have to say it smells amazing. Smells refreshing clean and crisp. Perfect for a beautiful spring/summer day. You can really smell the quality in the juice. Colonial Club also has a lot of staying power, you don't need much to make it last. Great job Acqua di Parma.

product_name: Colonia Club Acqua di Parma
review_content: Nah, this is too old school and green. My 60 year old uncle wood love this. Maybe a lighter version of 1978 Polo Green

product_name: Colonia Club Acqua di Parma
review_content:
08/13/2018

Descent into Acqua Di Parma Episode 2: Yes I used Descent because it has "scent" in it.

Today I tried a sample of Acqua Di Parma Colonia Club. I sprayed on more than I usually spray this brand. I initially smelled a citrus with a strong lemon smell. After 15 minutes or so I think it smells as if its a higher class Tommy Hilfiger's Tommy fragrance. I'm new to a lot of Fragrances and that is the closest thing I can think of it Colonia Club. I like it a lot. If I had to only wear one brand of fragrance Acqua Di Parma would probably be it.

product_name: Colonia Club Acqua di Parma
review_content: I love the packaging. It's a very lovely shade of green. I just wish it didn't smell like stinky, awful, tangy trash.

product_name: Colonia Club Acqua di Parma
review_content:
This is a beautiful green fougiere fragrance that is to Acqua di Parma what Green Irish Tweed is to Creed (although the two do not smell similar at all, and I prefer the Colonia Club). As for the scent, it's in the same genre as Amouage's Beach Hut Man and Coty's Aspen to my nose but different than both. It opens with a very beautiful fresh green accord of very natural smelling spearmint leaves (the mint in this is as natural as YSL's Live Jazz and Lush's Dirty, and is noticeably spearmint rather than peppermint). The mint is so prominent in fact that it produces a noticeable cooling effect on your skin (just as is the case with Lush's Dirty). But the mint is not the only thing there, and is united by notes of to my nose galbanum (which smells like grass), petitgrain, neroli, vetiver, lemon, and a very strong green bergamot accord that almost smells like limes. It's very green, very cooling, and very fresh. It also smells both modern yet refined and sophisticated at the same time to me, like they took the classic fougiere (fern-like) cologne formula, made it modern but also of natural-smelling ingredients so it smells high-class. It definitely leans masculine; it smells like what a gentleman in a tuxedo or someone on a golf course would be wearing. On the drydown I smell a small hint of seawater and ambergris accord that makes it sort of aquatic in nature, but in a good way. It's as if you were walking in a lush green forest with fields of spearmint and it started raining. The scent overall is pretty linear from opening to the end however. Sillage is moderate (as is the case with all Acqua di Parmas in my experience), while longevity is also moderate at about 5 hours (better than most Acqua di Parmas though, except for Colonia Oud and Leather). Overall, this is my favourite fragrance from the historic Italian Acqua di Parma house, followed by Colonia Oud and Fico di Amalfi. In fact it's one of my favourite fragrances overall of all time.

5/5

product_name: Colonia Club Acqua di Parma
review_content: Not sure how this comparison hasn't been mentioned, but this stuff is 80%+ similar to pre-reformulation Armani Code Sport (circa 2011). The mint is a lot stronger in the opening of this one, but the drydown is extremely similar. This one is deeper with a wider variety of woody/floral notes, so it definitely comes across as Sport's Italian older brother

product_name: Colonia Club Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Here I am at last - reviewing my signature!

Reading some reviews comparing it to Green Irish Tweed and Cool Water are a wee stretch for me (sorry - I own all three and I still use Cool Water today after 20 years). Especially in contrast to what Lo-fi said. They are at best somewhat similar.

Keeping it simple, to me GIT is like honeyed lemon verbena with some flowers, and thats it nothing else.

CW again in simple terms is Fresh Aquatic, Lemon (not even in its pyramid), Lavender with SPEARMINT not mint in the back ground with a pinch of tobacco and coriander.

Colonia Club is like a Sweet Lime Soda in a can with a pinch of tobaccy and lavender and a little musk straw to sip it with a clean mint always present in the back ground!

Alternatively amazingly its also a dead ringer for Guerlain L'Homme Ideal EDT if you replace the cherry with lime/bergamot (not EDP which has less musk more cherry). I know this is almond and tonka bean in Ideal but this is what it smells like to me from a non technical point - I also own them.

CC is an EDC so only has a small percentage of oil compared to CW which is an EDT or GIT which is an EDP hence higher oil content. Ironically I think it is reverse world!!! I find GIT to reek of quality but have a low to moderate silage and reasonable longevity and CW to smell cheap in construction (at least the last one i bought - infact it smells vinegary on first spray) and to have a decent longevity.

CC on the other hand... after dry down (admittedly I do spray a lot) it smells of sweet lime (not bergamot) mixed with a layer of lavender, coriander, maybe cedar, amber and mint over the top after 15 minutes a bit of powdery musk presents itself . The mint does cool you but 50cm away its the only fragrance I know that just smells of all the combined. Its very textured and even though its a cologne the ingredient quality basically means that it lasts 6-12 hours for me AND its completely linear - I'm not sure that it changes. Its not an in your face perfume yet I can smell it more easily from a distance than most - I don't know why. AND this is coming from someone whom doesn't really like musk or powdery scents (not that they are dominant).

Its kind of a mature scent for smart casual dressed guys in their 30's and above (imagine Panerai watch, polo top and chinos) or someone confident in a Tom Ford or Brioni like Daniel Craig, George Clooney or Alec Baldwin as Jack Donaghy as the CEO of GE in 30 Rock would wear - not loud but a mix of warm, cool, formal, casual.

So I love this scent because I can wear it in winter as the musk lavender and amber are somewhat warming and the mint and lime keeps it fresh like I just got out of a shower in a waterfall with naked women (actually it reminds me of Norsca maybe lol).

I recently bought Jacques Fath Green Water as someone somewhere mentioned it was like Colonia Club dialled up to 11 - he was spot on except its simpler - just Lavender Mint and Lime.

I sprayed each hand before I started typing this 60 minutes ago with distractions with CC and CW. CW has already faded noticeably and changed whilst CC is still powering on at the same level with the same presentation...

I have to stop myself wearing this everyday... that and L'Homme Ideal when I feel like Cherry instead...

product_name: Colonia Club Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Colonia club IMO is One of the best and most elegant fresh fragrances you can get.

Extremely high quality, beautiful and pleasant. Beautiful citrus with ultra cooling green mint backbone. Very cooling, masculine and refreshing.

You will get Creed GIT vibe in the opening with a hint of modern minty/shower-gel freshness vibe in the classsical Italian colonia background.

I love almost all ADP line and this one is no exception.

product_name: Colonia Club Acqua di Parma
review_content: Got a spray at Niemans the other day. Definitely agree that this smells like GIT at first but with a slight menthol and mint overtone which makes it a little more harsh. There were a few times in the first hour that it sort of reminded me of a urinal cake. It wasn't too off-putting and didn't last long, but I definitely had that moment where you go, i recognize that smell, I wonder what it is... oh, now I remember. After dry down, it was too powdery for me and my wife hated it, so it's a no-go but it was close. I liked the forst 2/3, but the base lost me. Could see wearing it if spending a lot of time outdoors though.

product_name: Colonia Club Acqua di Parma
review_content: There are a lot of good reviews for this, and I think this has its place, maybe on a cool spring morning, playing golf or something on grass. But to me it is mostly a menthol/eucalyptus/camphor kind of vibe that reminds me of super fancy vicks vapor rub. Originally I liked it, but after a few warings it became overpowering and annoying.

product_name: Colonia Club Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Absolutely the best spring fragrance I have ever experienced. This is Acqua di Parma's answer to Green Irish Tweed and it kicks A**.

The opening might be a bit off putting. It definitely can give off a dated vibe. However, if you give it a chance, it quickly becomes something you'll fall in love with. The dated vibe falls away and you're left with the cleanest, freshest, classiest fragrance you could put on for Spring or Summer. BUY IT.

product_name: Colonia Club Acqua di Parma
review_content: Smells very similar to good old Polo Sport, but with much higher quality ingrediences.

product_name: Colonia Club Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Very intesresting fragrance from Acqua di Parma!. Very green and citrusy one. First, I got a blast of vetiver, lavender, mint of geranium. Then, it evolves with the bergamot and mandarin that shine in the background. The mint gives a cooling vibe!
I consider a mature fragrance when the vetiver is creeping behind all these notes
Got good longevity 8hrs+ with nice projection
Spring and summer for sure
Days and nights
Very versatile, Casual, office and dates nights
7.5/10
A fragrance that it worth trying at least!

product_name: Colonia Club Acqua di Parma
review_content: My favorite from the house, highly underrated! It is beautifully fresh, sporty, and masculine all at once.. Great for the office or for outdoors in the springtime. The mint is soft, not sharp, perfectly balanced to my nose. I was shocked by its performance on my skin; applying once at 7am, the scent was still present when I returned at 8 in the evening. 9/10, always need this in my collection.

product_name: Colonia Club Acqua di Parma
review_content:
This is the third one I own from the ADP house and ...
Absolutely elegant and Classy!
For a reall gentleman.
Must be how a billionaire should smell.
Superlative elegance in a bottle.
If you wear a Brioni suit then this is the missing piece to fit into the puzzle.
i just can’t stop sniffing my wrist.
And this comes from someone who owns Tom Ford, Serge Lutens, Creed, Mancera, Hermes, Comme des Garcons, Atelier Cologne, Penhaligon`s, Montale, etc.
Very underrated.

10/10

product_name: Colonia Club Acqua di Parma
review_content: My perfumery store gave me several samples of this to try. My impression was that is was very very similar to New West by Aramis which I wore during my university days.

product_name: Colonia Club Acqua di Parma
review_content: I got this as a 1.2ml sample. It's unisex but struck me as being more masculine than feminine. It starts with a sort of mossy/mouldy mint fragrance - not a particularly fresh mint. It also produces the "cooling effect" sensation described by others - akin to having toothpaste wiped on you - not pleasant - and lasts about 45 mins. This belongs in the 'sport' class of fragrances to me. Next a quite pleasant vetiver scent appears and persists to the end, becoming muskier with time. Lasts a good 8hrs, sillage is soft to moderate. A reasonable, sporty, scent for men in my opinion. Not for me.

product_name: Colonia Club Acqua di Parma
review_content: The scent is wonderful, sophisticated / high class barber shop, a manly, warm weather fragrance. Love the mint and neroli, very refreshing, I really like this one.

product_name: Colonia Club Acqua di Parma
review_content:
This was a blind buy, and boy am I glad! It's a beautiful blend of mint, citrus, and floral notes. The star of the show is definitely the mint, it hits you front-and-center and stays with you all the way until it settles into vetiver and a bit of musk.

I get good longevity and sillage with this, and receive compliments every time I wear it. I personally prefer it as an evening fragrance, but that may be just me.

I've read some reviews below that compare it with Proraso and other old-school barber scents, but I don't see it. Those are more eucalyptus/menthol, while this is mint all the way (and then some!).

product_name: Colonia Club Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I am just about to visit Rome, which I love and miss a lot, so this is going to be my next purchase.
Me and my husband are going to share it and I bet we will have a great Valentine's Day in a great country.
Italian scents are really fantastic, somehow different than the big French bestsellers. I am a real fan of Bottega Veneta, Acqua di Parma Colonia and di Parma Essenza and now this. Perhaps it is better for summer, but I can't wait :)
Although at heart I am a channel girl, so you see.

product_name: Colonia Club Acqua di Parma
review_content: I love the cooling sensation on the skin after spraying! Maybe the top scent for summer days,and nights.....

product_name: Colonia Club Acqua di Parma
review_content: Love it! It's the perfect scent to wear in the summertime in Brazil which is where I live. Fresh, invigorating and masculine. Simple and elegant. I will certainly buy it again.

product_name: Colonia Club Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Green with Envy..!! Certainly the mantra of this beautiful creation from Acqua di Parma… I preface this review stating I am a huge fan of the Acqua di Parma line, housing several in my stable of fragrances. The Colonia Club edition is a blend of mint, citrus, and floral notes where the end product is a nicely done fragrance that I find intriguing and appealing. Acknowledging some of the negative reviews, this fragrance is not for everyone. Sample it prior to purchasing the bottle – AdP has historically been quite generous providing samples to inquiring minds (and noses..). I would offer that Colonia Club tends to have more of a masculine vibe, but for those that like a feminine fragrance, but daring to try something out of the comfort zone – go for it..!! You may like it..!! Additionally, I would suggest CC may appeal to a more mature audience. When wearing this gem today, I was reminded of more dated and distinguished fragrances from yesteryears gone by. Oh, to reminisce… (where did all the years go? – but I digress..)

My final tally for Colonia Club is 4.2 stars out of 5. I am a fan of Acqua di Parma. That said, while Colonia Club is not my favorite in this line, it does offer something different which I like. It is very appealing, distinguished, and worthy of a test drive… For those who are “Green with Envy”, definitely recommend adding to your collection.

Enjoy your day and Happy Fragrance Hunting…

product_name: Colonia Club Acqua di Parma
Colonia Club Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Colonia Club is my favorite among the Colonia line.

It opens with bright fresh strong mint and some 30 minutes later settles with lavendar, musk, almost tobacco-like. It stays for 7-9 hours.

The only thing that bothers me is the cooling sensation on the skin (like those body wash and shampoo with cooling effect). However you won't really notice it unless you overspray.

Not all bad I guess.. it only means the mint is a real deal. This is hands down the minty-est mint of all mint perfumes I have ever tried.

-AB-

product_name: Colonia Club Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I mostly notice the mint when i reapply the fragrance a 2nd or 3rd time after the initial wearing.

For eau de cologne, this is a great performer! However for the price, i kinda wish it was eau de toilette and lasted a bit longer.

This is my first Acqua Di Parma, and i will absolutely be trying more! I'm barely disappointed with the longevity, but elated with literally everything else about this cologne. This is an easy 8 out of 10 for me.

product_name: Colonia Club Acqua di Parma
review_content:
با سلام
در همان نگاه اول و دیدن رنگ آمبولانژ آن شما متوجه خواهید شد که با رایحه ای سبز روبرو خواهید شد و دقیقا هم همینطور است
رایحه ای دلچسب و عالی دارد
در بین ادکلن هایی که نت های آنها از این دسته روایح استفاده می شود به نظرم کار قابل قبولی است
ممکن است ادکلن هایی همچون پینو یا ته بویی از بروت را برای شما تداعی سازد
جذابیت رایحه آن به مراتب از بروت و پینو بالاتر است
این ادکلن شما را به دنیایی از طراوت و طبیعت سبز فرا می خواند
با احترام
گالری عطر مهرداد

product_name: Colonia Club Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Profonda delusione! Intendiamoci non è poi malaccio ma è di una banalità disarmante. Una fragranza indubbaimente fresca e moderna, ma già sentita e risentita... e a che costo poi!

Voto personale: 6/10

product_name: Colonia Club Acqua di Parma
review_content: To me it smells exactly like bleu de Chanel. Good in terms of perfmance.

product_name: Colonia Club Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Got a sample of this from AdP.

It's not a bad fragrance but it's simply a generic "green" cologne. There's nothing special here and I can't see buying a bottle, especially with the price they're asking for it.

product_name: Colonia Club Acqua di Parma
review_content:
در اولين نگاه ، شيشه اين ادكلن بنده رو به ياد سبزي و خنكي انداخت و ميشه گفت از اين نظر ، طراح شيشه در كارش موفق بوده .
به نظرم رايحه اش اصلا پيچيده نيست و داراي شروعي بسيار شاداب و با طراوت مركباتي به همراه حسي گياهي اسطوخودوس و يك عالمه نعناع و مقداري گلي هست . رايحه نعنايي در ابتدا بسيار قوي است . طوري كه حس ميكني مخاط بيني ات و منافذ سينوسهات حسابي خنك و باز شده اند . صرفنظر از رايحه زيبا و قشنگش ، تقريبا همون حسي رو داره كه وقتي لوله ويكس رو توي بيني مون ميكنيم و نفس ميكشيم .
پس از اين مرحله رايحه شمعداني در زمينه اي قوي از مركبات و در مرحله پاياني هم رايحه وتيور رو داريم .
به همين سادگي .
اين مسير رايحه پراكني رو در خيلي از ادكلنها ديديم و چيز جديدي محسوب نميشه . ولي از يك موضوع نميشه گذشت و اون اينكه ، حسي كه بعد از يك روز كاري گرم و پر فعاليت و بعدش يك دوش گرفتن و بعدش اسپري كردن اين ادكلن ، به آدم دست ميده ، واقعا جالب و دوست داشتني و مفرح و زندگي بخش هست . مخصوصا اينكه پس از اسپري اين ادكلن ، در محل اسپري شده ، حس خنكي زيادي بوجود مياره . درست مثل حسي است كه بعد از مسواك زدن ، خمير دندان روي پوست بوجود مياره .
به نظرم قيمت بالاي اين ادكلن ، با توجه به خاص نبودن اون و همچنين وجود ادكلنهاي با رايحه هاي مشابه ديگر، اصلا توجيهي نداره.
موندگاري اين ادكلن متوسط و پخش رايحه اش فقط در دقايق اول خوب است.

product_name: Colonia Club Acqua di Parma
review_content: I love this and I'm a girl. I feel ready for outdoor pursuits :) My favourite from the Colonia range. Excluding the leather concentrate, that's my favourite from the brand.

product_name: Colonia Futura Acqua di Parma
review_content: The vetiver is there right from the very beginning, well blended with the citruses. But I would call this aromatic much more than a citrus composition. It's one the balanced side of vetiver fragrances, yet it requires a very mature owner. Perhaps when you're in your 70s it's a good idea to smell like this as a gentleman. Otherwise I would keep this only as an experimental fragrance, and would never become a daily wear.

product_name: Colonia Futura Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Having just reviewed the venerable original Acqua di Parma Colonia yesterday, it felt entirely fitting that today I turn my attention to Colonia Futura. While I truly appreciated the classic essence of Colonia—indeed, it presented perhaps one of the finest representations of a traditional barbershop men's fragrance I've ever encountered—I simply couldn't overlook its disappointing performance. With Futura, I'm keen to observe how this iconic DNA is reinterpreted for a modern sensibility, and more importantly, if it manages to resolve the longevity issues that plagued its predecessor. Let's get into it and find out.


Opening:
The opening is a striking fusion of aromatic freshness, bright citrus, and robust woodiness. The primary notes that immediately announce themselves are lavender, vetiver, lemon, and bergamot. Lavender and vetiver are the dominant forces here. The lavender first greets my nose with a familiar, softly powdery, and subtly spicy aromatic accord. It shares the essence of the lavender used in the original Colonia, yet it's not quite as assertive. This is because the vetiver steps forward with equal intensity, bringing an intensely green, almost bracingly sour woodiness. While I've encountered my fair share of vetiver notes previously, this particular iteration stands out as remarkably astringent. Next, the lemon and bergamot contribute their citrusy accents. As expected from two citrus notes, they share a common bright character, yet they are distinguishable: the lemon offers its characteristic juiciness, while the bergamot provides its underlying aromatic and spicy undertones.


Dry Down:
The dry down largely mirrors the opening, remaining steadfastly citrusy, assertively woody, and distinctly aromatic. The primary notes I continue to discern are lavender, vetiver, lemon, and bergamot, with lavender and vetiver still holding their prominent positions. In fact, the dry down is essentially identical to the opening, with the only discernible difference being a gentle fading of the lemon and bergamot. As such, I would characterize this fragrance as fairly linear in its progression.


Performance:
The initial projection is moderate to strong, extending its presence about three to five feet. Sillage mirrors this, leaving a noticeable but controlled scent trail. After just a few hours, the projection had softened considerably, becoming very light and sitting closer than arm's length. The scent trail, by this point, was only faintly perceptible, to the extent that I would essentially classify it as a skin scent.


When to Wear:
Colonia Futura is undeniably a spring and summer fragrance, ideally suited for daytime wear. Unlike the original Colonia, this interpretation leans more distinctly into the warm-weather category. However, it retains the same commendable usability as its predecessor, proving versatile enough for virtually any occasion, whether casual, formal, or for a professional setting in the office.


Blind Buy:
I wouldn't necessarily label this a safe blind buy simply because of its pronounced vetiver character. To truly appreciate this fragrance, one needs a genuine affinity for vetiver. However, if you enjoy the original Colonia and have a strong appreciation for vetiver, this could be worth exploring.


Final Verdict:
I can certainly recognize Acqua di Parma's intention with this particular fragrance. They aimed to modernize their original Colonia DNA by weaving in a substantial amount of vetiver. While I can appreciate the creative effort behind this endeavor, vetiver is simply not a note I typically gravitate towards, especially not to this degree. As I noted, the vetiver used here was exceptionally strong and rather astringent, to the point where it largely overshadowed the other notes in the composition. Furthermore, the performance for Colonia Futura offered only a marginal improvement over the original and still fell significantly short of what I would deem acceptable for its price point. Colonia Futura currently stands as, and will likely remain, my least favorite Acqua di Parma fragrance I've experienced. I have one more Acqua di Parma to try tomorrow, and I'm earnestly hoping we can conclude this series on a more positive note.


Scent: 5/10
Longevity: 5/10
Sillage: 5/10
Versatility: High
Mass Appeal: Average
Gender: Masculine
Value: Way overpriced

product_name: Colonia Futura Acqua di Parma
review_content: Obviously synthetic — not that bad this time. The green notes, the synthetic sharpness came out in a way that, luckily, feels defiant. But compared to the competition, it doesn’t stand a chance.

product_name: Colonia Futura Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Hermosa actualización de la colonia clásica con una lavanda maravillosa y trabajada para dar un aire muy maduro.

Fresca, seria y elegante. No es para compra a ciegas, no es unisex, no es un cítrico limpio y con Tonka o almizcle que le brinde toques más dulzones o vibra de perfume comercial. Es un aroma casi fougere intenso y para hombres de 35-40 en adelante en mi opinión. Yo ya casi tengo 40 años y la disfruto muchísimo. Para el día a día con un toque semi formal o hasta una ocasión elegante o reunión formal en verano o primavera siento que va perfecta para alejarse de los típicos polo blue, Acqua di gio, Versace pour homme y más perfumes cítricos/acuáticos/marinos de estas épocas. Aclaro que tengo y disfruto esos perfumes pero esto va un poco más allá. Muy recomendable. Prueben antes de comprar. Esto puede decepcionar a algunos si buscan vibras de perfume cítrico muy comercial y compran a ciegas.

product_name: Colonia Futura Acqua di Parma
review_content: I can't say I've ever smelled anything like this before. That's not a good thing in this case. Must be a combination of the strong vetiver and sage. Does not smell fresh, clean, or youthful. I don't enjoy this one at all.

product_name: Colonia Futura Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Took me a good while to appreciate this Colonia release as I was comparing it to the original. Finally I started to understand what this was all about. It’s such a fresh clean scent which I understand for some maybe traditional in its scent profile but aren’t all ADP’s? Opening is crisp and the naturals used in this are really well put together. I get lively Grapefruit and lemon not a huge deal of spice but something in there pops.
