ADP Osmanthus smells like high-end hotel shampoo. I don't usually go for fragrances in this genre, but I really do enjoy Osmanthus, especially that lovely dry-down! This is florals done very well & the patchouli in the base isn't harsh, it actually blends quite nicely.

Osmanthus is a perfect everyday fragrance, especially in spring. This isn't a big statement grabber so she's definitely an appropriate perfume for the office or any type of environment where you don't want to offend anyone.

product_name: Osmanthus Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content:
this fragrance is stereotypically more feminine because it's a sweet white floral, which i feel like most people associate with feminine scents, but i could totally see a guy rocking this during the summer heat and just smelling so refreshing.

to my nose, i'm first and foremost hit with tart, juicy mandarin, and it's tied down by the white florals, which help give it a powderiness as well.

it's a beautiful scent, very simple and easy to digest. i could totally see this being someone's signature summer scent. but i just can't see myself buying a full bottle of a citrusy floral for $300.

product_name: Osmanthus Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Understanding the house Aqua di Parma for what it is, I really do love Osmanthus. I've owned and loved Magnolia Nobile, as well as a few other Acqua di Parma fragrances, so I know this house's signature notes and I know what to expect. Typical for this "line" of perfumes, as well as most of the Aqua di Parma fragrances, Osmanthus does not disappoint because its notes are simple, high end, expertly executed and well defined.

Osmanthus is no exception with definable top notes that are citrusy & spritzy neroli and green mandarin orange. These opening notes beautifully blend with middle floral notes of peony, other gentle white florals & ambrette (musk mallow). Something that tickles the nose, which I assume is pink pepper makes an appearance. And all of these lovely fragrances & ingredients perfectly land with Osmanthus, more musk and slight patchouli.

Now, I'm reminded by some folks that this Osmanthus doesn't approach the fragrance of the real thing. And I'm not quite sure I've ever experienced fresh, true Osmanthus. But whatever it is, Osmanthus is a lovely, ethereal, soft & delightful perfume fragrance, surely not offensive in any way.

I would never define this fragrance as unisex, as it reads completely feminine to my tastes. Unfortunately like many Aqua di Parma perfumes, longevity isn't great @3-4 hours, silage is moderate.

I love Osmanthus a whole lot. Just not sure if it is full bottle worthy ONLY because of the price point and because of my history with Aqua di Parma fragrances. Sometimes, I just need a brief departure.

In general, this perfume is a 9/10.

product_name: Osmanthus Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content: I do not like white floral scents in general, but this white floral scent is tolerable, not powdery or overtly sweet. It does not smell like real osmanthus, however.

product_name: Osmanthus Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content:
This is a really good one. I agree it's waayy overpriced but damn it smells so good! Will probably get an FB for the scent alone. I saw this being compared to Inle so I checked its notes and the moment I saw jasmine note, I'm out. I won't even bother comparing both scents since jasmine note is headache inducing to me.

I adore Osmanthus the way other people adore and repurchase Jo Malone's Wood Sage & Seasalt despite the performance lol. Will probably have to douse myself in this to last long on me lol.

product_name: Osmanthus Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content: The top note is fresh with mandarin and the osmanthus comes out after a while. I like it and it is my daily perfume for working. It is not aggressive at all. I would decribe it like a gentle and kind lady who is innocent and smart. However, this wont last long and it is so intimate

product_name: Osmanthus Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content:
A pleasant, traditional, summery floral EDP that's more on the fresh/summery side, certainly not something anyone could object to.

For me it smells like an imagined traditionalist wealthy woman. Not quite my usual personal vibe but by no means a bad way to smell.

product_name: Osmanthus Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content: Half osmanthus and half neroli. The neroli here is more like orange blossom, dainty white florals without the greeness or woodiness. The osmanthus is the same as the one in Inle (but without the bitter mate tea), or Osmanthus Yunan (without the leather). The scent profile is quite nice, but the sillage and longevity are poor.

product_name: Osmanthus Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Leans too feminine to my nose and "perfumy".
Would be good on a woman but not for me.

product_name: Osmanthus Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content:
This is a soft white floral and fresh scent. Its main notes are osmanthus and neroli. That's about as much as there is to say about it. It is nice, however, as the simplicity of it is pleasant.

The performance is decent too. It felt very intimate on me, I couldn't really notice any sillage. It lasted for about 4-5 hrs at most on my skin. It is quite overpriced imo, and not worth it, unless if you have a lot of spending money.

6.5/10. The scent was nice but wasn't necessarily special. The performance wasn't more than average.

product_name: Osmanthus Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content:
First thing first, as an Asian I can safely say that this is a Western perfumer's interpretation of osmanthus, and not a true recreation of the osmanthus scent. That said, I do think it's a pleasant one. This perfume has really strong projection and lasting power, so a word of caution to people who have sensitive noses: spray sparingly.

When I first wore it, I sprayed it on my collarbone and was greeted with the most overpowering, cloying scent of cheap jasmine essential oils. The longevity was good so unfortunately it gave me a headache the whole day.

Thankfully I gave it a second chance. This time I sprayed less and chose to spray it on my inner elbow instead of collar bone. That did wonders! I still think it smells more like a mixture of jasmine and magnolias, but it's pleasant and very feminine. However, it is on the expensive side, and I wouldn't pay full price for a bottle of it. (I had staff discount at the airport duty free, so it was heavily discounted.)

product_name: Osmanthus Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content: Won't go into the nitty gritty of the things but this straight up is a heavenly aroma. Absolutely beautiful composition that smells otherworldly and ethereal.

product_name: Osmanthus Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Smells like a vintage lipstick or toilet air freshener to me… I really wanted to love this, but I’ll have to let it go.
Osmanthus works for me only when it is paired up with tobacco like Amouage Sunshine and PDM Herod.

product_name: Osmanthus Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content: The osmanthus is a little shapeshifter in this EDP: at times I detect the leathery nuances of osmanthus absolute, at other times the apricot side. However, the osmanthus is always hidden behind sharper citrus and floral notes, and as I prefer the warmer and sweeter side of osmanthus, I did not find what I was looking for in this fragrance. All in all it is a nice fragrance if you are looking for something refreshing with citrusy and floral aspects, but I would not recommend it if you are looking for an osmanthus-centric fragrance.

product_name: Osmanthus Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content: This smells so good when you first spray it, nothing like the top notes shown here but more like sugary sweet bubblegum osmanthus (not like the pink bubblegum, more like that really hard rubber-y gum that loses its taste in about 30 secs). As soon as it changes, it's disastrous. You know when you catch a cab on a hot summer day and the air freshener hanging off the rearview mirror has this like synthetic, loud smell that ends up giving you a headache? If you want that experience in a bottle, you can spend a whole lot of money on this perfume. The dry-down gives you some more osmanthus again and that's pleasant but you can tell it's still perfume-y in all the wrong ways. In short: generic, synthetic, overblended, smells much cheaper than it really is. If you're an osmanthus lover like me, I'd look elsewhere.

product_name: Osmanthus Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content:
If you know how real osmanthus flowers smell and you are looking specifically for that in this perfume, you will probably be disappointed. The osmanthus scent here is more fruity than floral - it has an apricot character and is not too sweet or dense. Combined with the mandarin note, this perfume is a pleasant fruity floral and is easy to wear for spring and summer, but it does smell a bit synthetic (which I am okay with. )

HOWEVER, in my opinion, a scent that is very close to real osmanthus flowers (such as Serge Lutens Nuit de Cellophane) is probably more suitable as a room scent than a personal fragrance, because the sweet and dense (almost a little bit dusty) character can easily get cloying as a personal fragrance.

product_name: Osmanthus Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content: On tester paper this smelled like peach/apricot tea. On my skin this pulled weirdly medicinal. I went about my day and through my mask my wrist smelled a little like osmanthus jelly - one of my favourite desserts - but mask-off it smells like any old generic powdery/soapy body lotion. The medicinal feeling never faded through my day's wear of it. It's not bad by any means, but it wasn't what I was looking for after all.

product_name: Osmanthus Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content: Finally i find a true fragrance that i can call an "osmanthus fragrance". Any other osmanthus fragrances out there are more twisted into other directions or bring an osmanthus "feeling", or just have a note of osmanthus with many other things, but this one i would say, is a TRUE osmanthus soliflore fragrance.

product_name: Osmanthus Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content: One of the nicest Neroli fragrances I ever smelled. Doesn't smell like something old but not very youthful either. Very good projection. I like it as much as petite matin. For me it is a mix between petit matin and Escentric 5.

product_name: Osmanthus Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content: An easy-to-wear, proper osmanthus fragrance that has the typical floral shampoo-y vibe and hence feels soft and feminine.

product_name: Osmanthus Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Being a fragrance review novice, I am still intimidated by all of you but I will give this a shot. I received this fragrance blind from a subscription service. When I read the notes before receiving it, I thought I was not going to like it because I generally do not like floral fragrances. But I was so pleasantly surprised! To me, this is a "fizzy" floral; fresh and clean with the floral notes thinly veiled in the citrus and pink pepper. My only complaint is that it disappears after a couple of hours on my skin.
One other thought: To me, this is a VERY feminine fragrance and I would have a hard time envisioning it for a man. Thank you!

product_name: Osmanthus Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content:
This stuff is mind blowing. It swoons and develops it's way into a charming sweet succulent floral scent with creamy indolic and sweet undertones.

It's fresh and invigorating but very pristine with the sweetness and all of this is contained in a sap of musky indolic mysterious sexiness.

Gorgeous stuff! 9/10

product_name: Osmanthus Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content:
This is a lovely floral perfume that is recognizable as Acqua di Parma right away. It’s a little aldehyde-fizzy in that 1948 way, and has a nicely balanced fruity-floral character.

I am not really blown away by the Osmanthus note, but it does show itself prettily as it dries down. I was looking specificallly for Osmanthus fragrance, and this one does not quite scratch that itch for me. If you’re into Osmanthus, I recommend Perris Monte Carlo as a good, accessible, satisfying interpretation. However, if you are into the Acqua di Parma style, and want to see how they do Osmanthus, this is it.

product_name: Osmanthus Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I blind bought this perfume a couple of weeks ago. I read that it was reminiscent of Gucci Flora, which is my go to favorite, plus my husband loves Acqua Di Parma and I have been looking for a fragrance from that company that I like.

I could not be happier. It is delightful. Indeed, reminiscent of Gucci Flora, but more sophisticated, sexy. Perfect for summer, bright, happy, exuberant. Got an amazing price on it too, which is all the better.

product_name: Osmanthus Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I’ve always had a goal of finding fragrances that remind me of my travels. Acqua di Parma’s Osmanthus is the Christmas that I spent in New Orleans. If you stroll through the Garden District in December, you will frequently get wafts of the blooms of the sweet olive trees - AKA osmanthus.

And this is as natural smelling as you’re going to find. Truly an archetype for accurate note representation. Sublime.

That being said, I wouldn’t blind buy this if you aren’t already familiar with the osmanthus flower. I do think I may have written this one off as being too intensely floral for my tastes had I not made the NOLA association and sought this out. But the human mind is a fickle force, and this is one of my loves and my only true travel association fragrance success story to date.

product_name: Osmanthus Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content:
what an absolutely beautiful fragrance.now this is impressive. its gonna be a buy for me
10/10 guys

product_name: Osmanthus Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content: Very nice, soft and smooth floral with noticable neroli and osmanthus. Stays close to skin, however remains on clothes the next day.

product_name: Osmanthus Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content: Best 2020 blind buy so far. Smooth, classic, clean, fresh, happy go fragrance, totally genderless, inoffensive, all year round perfume and got it for less than 100US. LOVE

product_name: Osmanthus Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Osmanthas starts of so lovely and bright. With a profusion of Neroli, orange blossom and Osmanthas; but it does very, quickly disaappear on my skin, which is quite shocking really for the price.

I need to test again on clothing to see if the performance improves, which I remain hopeful about as this is stunning and I would definitely wear it in warmer weather.

product_name: Osmanthus Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content:
It's a beautiful sparkling scent that's for sure. I get the neroli, orange and osmanthus up front. It's tragic that it fades so quickly. I had to remind myself that it was an edp.
To be fair these are all top notes so they were never gping to hang around long.
It doesn't evolve much.
I admit it smells very classy and natural like all the fragrances from this house.
I certainly wouldn't pay the sums they are asking for. Below average sillage and longevity.

product_name: Osmanthus Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content:
monotonous

Francis Kurkdjian “Petit Matin” is more textured

product_name: Osmanthus Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Beautiful fresh and floral perfume, gloomy packaging for such a radiant perfume!
I completely was not expecting such a fresh perfume!.
The Green Mandarine is most dominant and makes it fresh and also open to unisex.
The pink pepper adds this depth and warmth, and you can wear this in the spring and fall. They should have marketed it differently.
I love it!

product_name: Osmanthus Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Tested this today in John Lewis (UK)
Very fruity and feminine, tough for a guy (like me) to pull off.
Weirdly, I kept sniffing it as if compelled to, yet didn’t really like it.

product_name: Note di Colonia II Acqua di Parma
review_content: All I can smell is dill pickle which comes from sandalwood. Similar to Santal 33. The retail price for a 5oz bottle is over $700.

product_name: Note di Colonia II Acqua di Parma
review_content:
The basil note in this perfume is very similar to the one in Amouage Interlude.

Don’t get me wrong. The perfume is a nice freshie and does not smell like interlude but it mesmerised me how similar the basil note here to the one in the opening of interlude!

product_name: Note di Colonia II Acqua di Parma
review_content: A beautiful scent. It uses simple yet high quality notes. A compliment getter, I don't wear my frags for compliments, but this always does the trick. It's excellent. One of the best from the line.

product_name: Note di Colonia II Acqua di Parma
review_content: This is my least favorite of the line. Reminds me of a non descript blind buy I made at Ross. Smells of generic mens cologne to my nose. III is my favorite. IV is also very nice but leans feminine. Still need to try V. Sample first.

product_name: Note di Colonia II Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Just stopping by to say that this scent is the best of the best for me. An absolutely masterful wearing experience. Mostly linear (no white musk in here), masculine, projects nicely, last long and it seemed like almost everyone likes it even though it is a niche scent that is somewhat unique. This is very very close to perfection. For such a natural citrus fragrance that has strength and prestige it is actually priced good compared to some of its peers due to the large bottle (price per ml). If this scent was an element, it would be smokeless fire.
I tip my hat to you Aqua di Parma.

product_name: Note di Colonia II Acqua di Parma
review_content: It reminds me of Santal 33 but with no pickle nuance (violet leaf (cucumber) with spices (cardamom, etc)), but more woody, especially Guaiacwood. There is no chemical-musky nuance here and a more natural feeling from the natural citruses and bitterness of Basil.

product_name: Note di Colonia II Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I swooned the first time I wore this. I also made my husband wear it and YES it works for both of us. My teenagers also love it. If only I could afford a full bottle I could perfume the whole family! I had to restrain myself from sprinkling some on the cats.

It conjures an Italian barber shop/salon and the crisp, put together feeling of wearing linen and walking down old cobblestone streets. This fragrance is expertly blended and just beautiful.

product_name: Note di Colonia II Acqua di Parma
review_content: Note di colonia ii is a nice offering from acqua di Parma. The cardamom and Guiac wood here work well. This is a natural smelling fragrance that would work well in most weather. No real citrus to be found after it dries on skin the initial citrus notes just pull this into the air upon application and are gone leaving the wearer with an airy smooth wood effect. The basil in here adds a touch of contrast which works well here as it’s not completely photorealistic basil but just adds a mild green touch and connects whatever citrus present in the initial opening to its woody dry down. This scent is very close to skin and projection is faint. This is after all an EDC concentration. People may not notice this any more then they would the smell of soap on a person after a shower. It is however of superior quality compared to 90 % of things in my collection. This was a blind buy for me as I found it at a great price on Black Friday. I would never purchase this at full retail with that said the scent is wonderful and the bottle is stunning. I’d say this is more for collectors not the casual enthusiast. I’d say the closest thing I’d compare this to for reference is Ormonde man. Not the same scent but one could easily replace the other. Spring /summer smart casual or daytime dressed. The bottle though!!!!!!

product_name: Note di Colonia II Acqua di Parma
review_content:
This is really very special, but the notes in the perfume pyramid are a little deceptive. You would assume (particularly given that this is an ADP release) that this is essentially a citrus-heavy fragrance that, once those citrus notes have gone, evolves to a woodsy dry-down, as is the tried and tested formula for hundreds (at least) of other fragrances. In fact, aside from an opening 60-second burst of bergamot, I get very little citrus from Note di Colonia II which instead arrives almost straight from the bottle with a full-on Guaiac experience pushing straight through that citric top-line.

The Guaiac here is dense and dry but also super-smooth with none of the rubber/tarmac notes that can plague that note - it's a clever conjuring act, in fact, to present Guaiac as full-on and rich as this without it lurching into harshness. Nestling behind this is a clear herbal element coming from the interplay of basil and cardamon (I pick up hints of thyme, too?) which adds a depth and dimensionality that is perhaps serving to harness the Guaiac.

Slowly a creamy, almost coconutty sandalwood joins the party to partner the Guaiac and the interplay between these two kinds of wood is just beautiful and, for me, the absolute highlight of Colonia II. The quality of ingredients and sophistication of the blend is clear throughout.

Highly recommended for lovers of pure, natural (or at least natural, non-synthetic smelling) wood fragrances.

product_name: Note di Colonia II Acqua di Parma
review_content: No idea why but I a PDM pegasus vibe with this ?? Could be the Sandalwood

product_name: Note di Colonia II Acqua di Parma
review_content: This isn't a fragrance I would've picked out for myself but I was given a free sample and I fell in love. To me, this is the perfect unisex fragrance. I haven't smelt any of the others in the range but this really stands out to me. It's woody but sparkling. Not sure if it's worth the price for a full bottle but definitely going to try get more samples lol

product_name: Note di Colonia II Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Note II begins with a somewhat stingy, bitter leathery nuance. It is considerably brute, but sadly lacks attraction. I find it very gloomy. The fragrance is imbued by bitter botanicals to give it this effect. There are some resinoid notes in the backdrop that add an almost hazy, abrasive undertone. It combines with the woodsy and spicy accents to create a deep, brooding anti-ambiance, if I could describe it.

The citrus element isn't incredibly dominant. It's more of a fixative application, but you can certainly tell it's the bitters of orange stirring at the center. It makes the oversoul even more heady, and dare I say, off-putting.

I hate to use that word, but for what it would suggestively be attempting to accomplish (being a brute fragrance)—it is a vulgar, crude blend that I can't find any style in at all. It's like you're wearing a fine fragrance; and you finish using the bathroom; and you slip and fall, and your arm dunks inside the bowl leaving you with this.

In my initial impressions of Note II, it had a striking similarity I couldn't quite recall, and then it came to me looking at the notes: It strongly resembles a cross between Fan di Fendi Pour Homme & Fan di Fendi Acqua.

I wasn't really big on either of those, but to each their own. More importantly, I don't feel that Acqua di Parma really did anything significant to improve upon, or improvise these formulas. It doesn't seem to have any Acqua di Parma bespoke touch in any noticeable fashion.

The most enjoyable aspect of the fragrance was when it died down rather quickly. Something in the style of an Eau Fraiche. Let's be empathetic though—that's not a good thing to be celebrated at all. And certainly for the honor suggested of this line—a blatant lie.

A terrible demerit on the Note di Colonia line.

product_name: Note di Colonia II Acqua di Parma
review_content:
From the 4 that I tried this one leans more toward masculinity, feels like old days scents gets a bit modernized, herbaceous woody and fresh with a bit of depth, the old style gentleman cologne, the scents are elegant and very nice and enjoyable, nothing ground breaking but nice to enjoy the modernized classic type of scents and to put your self in aura of simplicity elegance and class.
Acqua di Parma quality. Very good, moderate L & S Imo.

product_name: Note di Colonia II Acqua di Parma
review_content: i find this scent joyful and sophisticated. i like pretty mucha ll the adp colognes and this is one of my faves - it improves my mood and even posture!

product_name: Note di Colonia II Acqua di Parma
review_content:
This (along with Note di Colonia I) was love at first sniff. In fact, the whole collection is superbly done. Shop around, the Note Collection be purchased at prices that mere mortals can afford. I hunted it down like a bloodhound, I was a little obsessed!

I have been a fan of AdP Essenza, a classic eau de cologne that epitomizes tuxedoed elegance, but other AdPs, while nice, never really excited me.

So I wasn't expecting the beauty of Note di Colonia II. Dry, sparkling, woody and slightly herbal aromatic that radiates class and sophistication without smelling nostalgic. Appropriate for all occasions, anytime, but I imagine it's cool dry citrus and woods would excel in heat. Not listed in the notes, but I think might be there, are pepper and something bitter, perhaps tomoato leaf, so so perfectly blended that no one note stands out. Nothing about this feels synthetic (although longevity suggests otherwise).

I get decent longevity, not a beast mode scent. This is better for night out at a concert, or a lovely dinner alfresco, than for a night out clubbing.

product_name: Note di Colonia II Acqua di Parma
review_content:
One can feel that this one is a step up in terms of quality compared to their regular line.

While it is a very nice blend, the current retail price ($470) is simply ridiculous for that juice. One can have MUCH more interesting fragrances for that price.
Should you really want that one, eBay is the way to go (currently $170), but still, I would wait until it goes under the $100 bar. Then it will really be worth it.

product_name: Note di Colonia II Acqua di Parma
review_content: this is an interesting, spicy/green fragrance. i would say it is a good scent for the beginning of autumn. i like the hint of sandalwood. i might buy a big bottle

product_name: Note di Colonia II Acqua di Parma
review_content:
This is my preferred one of the 3 and I bought the 150 ml bottle while still testing samples of #3 and 1 at home in various conditions, I'll buy them probably, too. BTW I don't understand how it is possible to write a review on a niche frag without having a significant sample at home - not even enough for me to write a review - or the full bottle: then only I can write about it. But maybe I'm still having much to learn ...

The opening is a magic combination between a set of citruses and an association between a soft cardamon and basil. Basil plays an original role as it adds a deeper and somewhat heavier effect to the citruses which are therefore difficult to individualize.
The Guaiac wood is present from the very opening with a definitely nuancing effect, just like the soft muscs' effects and a never invading sandalwood & vetiver. The citrus notes disappear only after several hours as magically as they opened, but in this composition everything is smooth, soft, and progressive, leaving no surprises. Even after 8 or 10 hours, the delicious skin scent is very close to the opening and its soft and peaceful evolution.

The longevity is impressive, and this is definitely not a Cologne in the common sense. The quality of ingredients and probably their concentration place this frag at least at the level of an EdP.

I don't quite agree with the sequential 3-act analysis of these scents symbolized by Puccini's opera Turando as presented by AdP: I rather feel that this example of modern parfumery plays with variations around a very original theme, maybe reflected by the central theme of Puccini's composition at the time.

Though I usually prefer floral scents, this is a true masterpiece as its softness and first class combination of non floral ingredients combines modernism with classicism in a very very original way. Great job for a first niche line, thanks AdP !

product_name: Note di Colonia II Acqua di Parma
review_content:
FIRST SNIFF: I was introduced to this part of the line by the ADP SA who was tending the perfume bar downstairs at the Houston Neiman's store. She laid out the three scents in this grouping and had me smell each in order. I was informed prior to smelling them that each one is stronger and more full bodied than the last. So the first in the series would be the lightest and most understated.

Like the first in the group, it immediately obvious that this is a well crafted, well-made scent. BUT, I'm immediately reminded of (at minimum) a dozen other scents made between 1998 and 2008 that had the word "Sport" or "Black" preceding or following the name. Apart from the fact it is well made and elegant, there are a few redeeming elements that give it an edge of sophistication and intrigue. For example, there is a hint of guaiac and an interesting musk that give it a bit of cleverness.

THE PICTURE IT PAINTS: This scent would be the crown jewel of a trust fund kid, whose taste in fragrance was informed exclusively by his tastes and exposure in HS and college. Only now, he wants something NO ONE else has (...but accidently he has made himself smell like everyone else did/does , just in a much more expensive and exlcusive manner.

IN THE BRAND FAMILY: Because the bottle is Lalique and it is so limited it may be worthy of a collector's cabinet. Or in the guest bathroom of your country club -- But if you are a niche lover this is not the star of the line. Niche lovers should reach for the dark brown colored ADP bottles IMO which hold the ingredient collection.

Full Bottle worthy? - NO
Sample worthy? - NO

PARTING THOUGHTS: Like an unbelievably well-made Crew paddle. The wood is expensive, rare and perfect, the craftsmanship is masterful with tedious attention to detail and the end product is awe inspiring, but the utility and need for such a piece, non-existant. It should have been left affixed to the wall of your bedroom or country club. In terms of the stereotypical sport scent of the 90' and 00's this is a masterful and undeniable specimen.

This scent could easily be any mistaken for the exclusive collection of any designer scent line. Biggest passssss of the three.

product_name: Note di Colonia II Acqua di Parma
review_content: I thought this was the least special of the 3

product_name: Quercia Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content: @Burning_meme have some respect

product_name: Quercia Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content: To me it's the product you use when you do a smelly n°2 in the toilets

product_name: Quercia Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Sometimes opinions change over time, and that has certainly happened with Quercia. My previous review was based on a decant that could have been reformulated since. At any rate: What I found a bit annoying and synthetic a year or two ago has changed to the extent that I bought a full bottle and I am very happy about it.

Quercia is a modern fougère in EDP concentration that strikes a balance between oakmoss and coumarin that I absolutely love. While my decant from a few years ago had a somewhat plasticky connotation that got too much over a few hours wear, it is not present in my current bottle.
Very “safe” choice for most people I would believe. Year around, all occasions. Not a “Come hither” choice for the club scene, though. Excellent performance.

product_name: Quercia Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content: This is my fave ADP and my go to scent for a night out. It’s masculine and sexy and very distinctive. For me it’s all about the cedar, it’s been executed perfectly. There’s also a background sweetness. I can’t compare it to anything I’ve smelled. I have a 100ml and 180ml I hope they never discontinue it! Performance is strong.

product_name: Quercia Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content:
This is my all time new favorite fragrance. This is perfect. Something a sexy well dressed man would walk around in italy with. It's insanely attractive scent. I showered 6 hours ago, and still smell it well on my arm, performance is ridicilous. JUST BUY IT. 10/10. Simple great scent.

It feels the same as when you hear a new song you feel like you've heard before because it's just so good.

product_name: Quercia Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Today, my Acqua di Parma journey continues with another offering from the "Signatures of the Sun" collection: Quercia. As its Italian name translates to "Oak," I'm stepping into this experience anticipating a robust, unequivocally masculine woody fragrance. While yesterday's review for Yuzu left me wanting more due to its surprising feminine lean and delicate performance, I imagine Quercia will be its bold and assertive opposite. Let's delve in and see if my assumptions hold.

Opening:
The opening is citrusy, spicy, and aromatic. The primary notes that announce themselves are lemon, Calabrian bergamot, cardamom, and pink pepper. Cardamom and Calabrian bergamot are the immediate stars. The cardamom is what my senses first register, with a powerful blast of warm spiciness, elegantly accompanied by an underlying aromatic quality. This isn't the tempered, designer-friendly cardamom found in fragrances like D&G The One; this is a far more assertive, confident expression of the note, with a heavy emphasis on its spicy and warm facets. Trailing behind this is the Calabrian bergamot, which provides a healthy dose of luminous citrus, infused with the characteristic aromatic and fresh spiciness for which bergamot is known. Next, the lemon and pink pepper join the chorus. The lemon builds upon the bergamot's citrus foundation, adding a brighter, more tart accord than the bergamot could supply alone. Lastly, the pink pepper contributes an additional layer of fresh spiciness in the background, a subtle, tantalizing prickle that comes close to tickling the nose, but never quite does.

Dry Down:
The dry down is spicy, warm, and sweet. The primary notes I now discern are cardamom, tonka bean, moss, and cedar. Cardamom and tonka bean become the most prominent players. The cardamom remains a highlighted note, carrying the same warm, spicy, and aromatic accord from the opening. However, it is now met with equal force by the tonka bean, which unfurls a blanket of sweet warmth, effectively tempering the cardamom's tenacious nature. This harmonious duo is then complemented by the subtle contributions of moss and cedar. The moss manifests as a nuanced, earthy woodiness, adding a layer of depth to the predominantly spicy and sweet accords. Lastly, the cedar provides an additional woody texture, with just a delicate touch of that "pencil-shaving" accord that is so characteristic of the note.

Performance:
The initial projection is strong, reaching a distance of around six feet. Sillage mirrors this strength, leaving an easily noticeable scent trail. After approximately three to four hours, this robust projection held steady at about four to six feet, and the scent trail remained distinctly perceptible. At the seven to eight-hour mark, the projection had settled to about arm's length, and while the scent trail was fainter, it was still present. The fragrance eventually receded into a skin scent around the nine to ten-hour mark, demonstrating a respectable longevity. It is worth noting that this does seem to be a fragrance that one could go nose-blind to, as evidenced by the fact that I felt like it wasn't performing at all after a few hours, but my wife confirmed that it indeed was.

When to Wear:
Quercia is an archetypal fall/winter fragrance, versatile enough to be worn in both the daytime and evening. The scent profile of Quercia is remarkably adaptable, and I could envision it working effortlessly for casual outings, formal events, or special occasions. The only environment where I feel it wouldn't quite fit is an office setting, simply because its projection and character are a bit too assertive.

Blind Buy:
I find myself without a direct comparison in my collection that could adequately capture this fragrance's essence. However, if you are drawn to sweet and spicy scent profiles with a confident, assertive nature, Quercia would be well worth your consideration.

Final Verdict:
Quercia turned out to be a rather confusing experience, for a couple of distinct reasons. The first: its name literally translates to "Oak," yet there is no discernible, dedicated oak note. While oakmoss is present, it never truly takes the spotlight, manifesting more as an earthy undertone rather than a primary woody accord. The second reason: the fragrance itself never struck me as particularly woody. From the opening and extending well into the dry down, it was a profound expression of warm spiciness, with cardamom serving as the undeniable highlight. In the dry down, it inherited a beautiful sweetness from the tonka bean and a mere touch of woodiness from the oakmoss and cedar, yet the overall impression remained predominantly spicy and warm. Moving on to performance, Quercia was entirely on par with what I experienced from Oud & Spice. It delivered a strong projection and a noticeable scent trail for at least the first few hours, and its tenacity continued until around the nine-hour mark, where it gracefully settled into a skin scent. In terms of usability, Quercia proved to be far more versatile than I had initially assumed. While it is undoubtedly a fragrance for cooler weather, it is adaptable enough for virtually any occasion outside of an office environment. Quercia isn't what I would call a mass-appealing fragrance destined to solicit an enormous amount of compliments, but I also don't believe anyone would perceive it as "bad" or challenging either. To conclude, Quercia is my favorite Acqua Di Parma I have reviewed thus far, yet it still didn't quite wow me enough to warrant the purchase of a full bottle. I have plenty more ADP fragrances to explore, so here's hoping at least one of them leaves an indelible impression on me.

Scent: 7/10
Longevity: 7/10
Sillage: 8/10
Gender: Male
Value: Overpriced

product_name: Quercia Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content:
This is one of those that the main accords breakdown actually gets really accurate. Everything everyone else is saying is accurate for this too.
This is not a strong cedar, patchouli fragrance FYI. It is slight citrus spicy aromatic and for sure reminds me of a better version of a body spray I wore when I was 16-20. I was not into fragrances at that time and admittedly did not have the best concept of personal hygiene. I was clean, but these days I take pimp showers, exfoliating and cleansing my whole body, then lotion and fragrance. Even though I was a scrub back in the day, I wore stuff that smelled like this and got mad ass fr. Don't dog the body spray. However, those body sprays don't last but a couple hours and this is a great 5-7 hour fragrance. Explosive at first, but tones down to a nice scent bubble of 3 ft. I have a bunch by Acqua di Parma and this is probably top 5 for sure. This is definitely a man's scent 30 and up. I really think they would have a difficult time cloning this.

product_name: Quercia Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content: I went to aqua di parma section and tried every one of them this one is literally banger. Edp but you can wear in summer or winter. Feels like live in florance summer dinner out feelings. Longevity not great 5 hours I guess. And price is high

product_name: Quercia Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content: Quercia was the surprise scent from batch of samples I got. Woody fragrances rarely wow me, Quercia is one of those. It smells well blended, expensive and ever so slightly medicinal, yet very sensual. Too bad it seems to be discontinued, I have only a miniature which I'll have to wear very sparingly.

product_name: Quercia Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content: At first, it was interesting and pleasant, though too masculine and not me. Sort of intriguingly herbal, with a gently sweet undercurrent that comes out more in the drydown. But after wearing it for a bit, I quickly started to hate it. It kind of smells like a men's deodorant or body wash to me, and it's pretty strong. There's also a weird, sharp, chemical smell in it that I'm struggling to put my finger on. I got the same strange, harsh smell when I tried on Blue Moon Ginger Dash by Kilian. It almost smells like I've been out partying all night, or like I used a bunch of cleaning chemicals and now there's a smell on my skin that won't wash off.

product_name: Quercia Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I've worn ADP fragrances for years and have owned most of them, and tested all of them. Most people sleep on this one, but it's low key pretty good. You must like tart (pink pepper, lemon, bergamot) fragrances to enjoy this. This is a modern ADP and not the classic variety, which are even better and are being discontinued 🫤. It's got some base ambrox but it's not dosed into the stratosphere.

Oakmoss (evernyl), Geranium (very slight mint) and petigrain give it an another reserved green layer, and a little patch give it some depth, but still suitable for the heat. My only beef is the tonka sweetness in base. I could do without it. It's a cousin to the extremely expensive Mousse De Chen and easier for most people to wear. Sometimes I'll combine it with oakmoss absolute and it's even better.

product_name: Quercia Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content: Opens harsh synthetic generic masculine, a lot of ambroxan/iso-e super, and a bit of sweetness in the dry down.

product_name: Quercia Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content: Quercia is marketed as unisex, but actually it smells like a typical masculine fougere. Citruses, warm spices, some sharp petitgrain, geranium, moss and patchouli. After a few hours I can detect some sweetish tonka in the base, but overall this is a scent for a man’s man. Performance and longevity could be better.

product_name: Quercia Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content: This is an absolute delight on my skin! I mostly get the flowery and borderline vanillic tonka notes in the dry down with a mossy backdrop. Putting this on the list for next autumn!

product_name: Quercia Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content: Quercia has nothing that reminds me of an oak tree and resulted in a strong dislike. Opening has an offensive plastic type of smell which does become milder to a point but still hangs around for the life of the scent. Better description would be a mixture of plastic and spices. Moderate performance and pricey for what it is. Hard pass.

product_name: Quercia Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Leathery warm spice petitgrain fougere

Quercia is much more than I expect. Having sampled most of AdP in a period of 2 weeks, I remember arriving at a point where almost all AdP fougeres (the OG Colonia aside) smelling near identical, dry fresh and then green woody and stark with a bland vintage evocation in the background desperately trying to convince me it would make me smell like a character pulled out of the golden age of Italian cinema.

Then I got to Quercia. Confused by the name, as my Italian doesn’t encompass the name of individual trees (oak in this case), I knocked me out of the redundant fougere trance and made me pause for a second.

First of all, let me begin by saying Quercia doesn’t smell at all like the oakmoss it promises to be, or rather minimally so. My father still wear numerous vintage fougeres and I can confidently say it is not an effective replica of the real thing.

However Quercia is nonetheless lovely. From the start I get a bitter green herbal essence, petitgrain mixing with warm spices mixing with the leathery patchouli faux-oakmoss that remind me a bit of the last few hours of Aventus. This is contrasted beautifully with an intense tonka/coumarin creamy sweet softness, the end result sitting somewhere between Endymion Concentree and Trumper Spanish leather. Tastefully vintage, substantial but not overbearing. Excellent.

product_name: Quercia Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content: A bit of an enigma is Quercia. While the sillage is divine, up close it just smells like melted plastic with lemon zest and black pepper sprinkled on. My friends and family will follow me around saying how great I smell, but recoil when they come in for a hug and smell the Quercia up close. Torn and confused in the Land Downunder.

product_name: Quercia Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content:
High quality materials
Attractive scent
But short.

product_name: Quercia Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content: I tried on a tester and I loved it. This is a great fragrance for the office. It is not common and it's not offensive at all. It's an amazing all-rounder.

product_name: Quercia Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content:
OK… so I’ll admit I was wrong: smelling this black bottle Quercia for the first time after the brown bottle I was extremely disappointed because it lacked the complexity, subtlety, and depth - especially that ‘sitting next to someone who is drinking hot chocolate in a café on a winters day’ accord - BUT this black bottle version does have a ‘cleaner’ and ‘more focused’ smell that doesn’t suffer from the brown bottle’s slightly musty tail-end of fragrance.

HOWEVER, I agree with sentiment in reviews below: whilst cleaner and more focused, black bottle Quercia doesn’t smell like a high-end fragrance deserving of its 260€ price tag.

TL;DR: it’s nice, but not worth the price.

product_name: Quercia Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content: Pleasant enough opening, but sadly there is Ambroxan in the base. Ruins it. Disappointing for this brand.

product_name: Quercia Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content: Mid-range, borderline quality here. Not bad, but doesn't do it for me. Lacking that certain je ne sai qua. Typical citrics mixed with something I don't like, which is pepper. Black pepper. That's why I don't like it. I'm biased against that particular black pepper spiciness.. Otherwise, objectively alright.

product_name: Quercia Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content: The initial sniff piqued my curiosity, but the dry-down is unconvincing. This is a shame because I like all the ingredients, but I am not crazy about how they work together. Unfortunately this one will be relegated to my growing "pass" collection.

product_name: Quercia Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Quercia by Acqua di Parma:
I like it, its not mind-blowing but it's nice. It's suitable for all seasons, and I'm pretty certain any age could pull it off. It's long-lasting as far as AdPs go and the sillage is ok but not great. It reminds me subtly of Dior Homme Intense in the beginning but dries down to something like a grown-up Eros due to the cedar, geranium and tonka but without the sweet vanilla.

Top notes: Petitgrain, pink pepper, lemon
Middle notes: Cedar, geranium, tonka, some cardamom
Base notes: Moss, cedar, tonka, patchouli

3.5/5

product_name: Quercia Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content: I like it, very high quality juice, but the cardamom sweetness puts this in the winter/fall/nighttime category for me.

product_name: Quercia Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content: Love it!

product_name: Quercia Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Other reviews here just about cover all the important bits, but I'll add that this one fills a nice niche within the Colonia range and ADP range in general.

There's the two Colonias and Fico and a handful of others for general daytime-y fresh Italian scents. There's leathers and ouds and sandlewoods and all kinds of citruses and florals for more specific scents/occasions. There's my all time favorite, escenza, for when you want to smell like you're freshly out of top tier old Italian barbershop....

But until this one I'd argue that their wasn't a good more generalist relatively masculine "cocktail hour and later" option from ADP. They have very different scent DNA,
but in overall vibe and application it kinda strikes me as an Italian take on what you'd use YSL LNDLH for.

product_name: Quercia Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content:
"Oak." A heaping dose of oakmoss popping with pink pepper, cardamom, and fresh citruses. Rich mossy and woody scent speckled with fresh aromatics, warm spices, and lightly sweetened. Dries down to spiced wood. Moderately strong projection for 3-4hr lingers as a modest scent bubble for 5-6hr, longevity 12hr+.

A classically masculine spicy woody scent. Dunno why it's called Oak when it's mostly moss and the only wood note advertised is cedar, but nonetheless it smells pretty great. An EDP with performance that blows most of this house's fragrances out of the water.

product_name: Quercia Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content:
"Quercia takes you on a walk through a forest of oak trees where the mysterious green scent in the air inspires a fresh and earthy sensation". Well, I am rather taken on a walk through an airport circa 1993 either near the duty free or alongside business men aged 40-55 (at the time). This is maybe unfair, because Acqua di Parma has tried to modernise an otherwise well tried style. But to me, there is simply too much Cool Water and Wunderbaum car perfume, connotations that were way too common for me to fall in love with this.

To begin with, I become very curious as I take in the first impressions, because I used to love the good ones of this category. But the drydown is a dissapointment. Where in my memory the good ones must have had sandalwood or something to support the moss (oakmoss needs to grow on something solid after all), what I get here is a recurring synthetic baseline – ambroxan I suppose. It is exactly what finally made me sell my Dior Sauvage Eau de Parfum, and that connotation is vividly present here as well.

If you are younger, >45 and lack the airport experience of yore, I suggest you give it a try if you have the money, because many will love this. The oakmoss dupe is quite nicely executed, but the supporting acts takes too much of my own attention, alas.

product_name: Quercia Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Quercia is an aromatic woody scent with citrus and spices throughout. It is also an oakmoss-dominant scent, a rarity among modern mass-market perfumes. It is an underrated gem in my opinion, a masculine scent that despite being safe and familiar, is set apart by its quality.

Quercia opens with a tart, even slightly sharp citrus accord led by acidic lemon. Soft spicy notes follow quickly, adding a nice counterpoint. Petitgrain adds fresh green woodiness, bringing things to aromatic territory and paving the way to the rich woody-mossy base. Peppery geranium adds to the herbal greenness.

The oakmoss is clean rather than earthy, reminiscent of fancy hotel soap bars. Sometimes mossy chypres remind me in part of soap like so, but rarely so overtly. The woodiness of the base too is cleaner and more refined than scents of a similar profile. Restrained patchouli adds some earthiness, and The tonka bean keeps things very smooth and refined. It is very aromatic here, somewhat Sauvage-like, but much less synthetic. It fades to a woody, slightly musky skin scent. Sillage and longevity are moderate. It is a transeasonal everyday scent.

Quercia is masculine-leaning in my opinion, reminiscent of popular designer scents, but better quality and more natural-smelling, despite its cleanness. Very nicely composed and pleasant throughout, I would enjoy this on a man. 4/5.

product_name: Quercia Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content: All I get is a Oak Moss BomB. Nothing else it starts fresh slightly Sweet for 2 minutes and then Boom! Oak Moss. I do love it though.

product_name: Quercia Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content: I had high hopes for this one. Don't get me wrong, it's a nice fragrance, and you can smell the quality of this juice. However, there is something about the lemon note in this composition that is stopping me from pulling the trigger on a full bottle.

product_name: Quercia Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content: Fragrance that opens supreme on imposing green, aromatic notes, lively fresh spicy notes, imbued with inebriating citrus scents of rare purity. The olfactory evolution brings out the freshness of Petitgrain and cardamom on the citrus triumph, framed by the faint and reassuring musky fragrance and the mystical sensuality of patchouli and Tonka bean. Fragrance with surprising olfactory evolution.

product_name: Quercia Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content: Fresh out the shower, white shirt, good shoes, this stuff is magic

product_name: Quercia Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content: A completely unisex fragrance. It's a very pleasant scent that everyone will like. No one can say they don't like this. Quercia is really well done. I think this could even be a hidden gem. I highly recommend anyone to try this fragrance. I give it a solid 8/10.

product_name: Quercia Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Warning, this is the best oakmoss scent on the market!

The scent is really well done. Although not listed in the notes, I smell some leather. The oak moss is tame, that's what makes it so special! This fragrance is unisex. A little masterpiece! Acqua di Parma makes very natural, high quality fragrances!

product_name: Quercia Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content:
This is so good. Opens up as a very classic men's scent, aromatic, woody, with a cola note.Quite strong but very pleasant.

The dry down is a distantly smoky, mossy, woody, like there was an charred oak log near by but the fire was put out a good while ago.

Lasting power is 12hrs+ on me.

product_name: Quercia Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content: I think this perfume starts out quite masc, but after time it settles into a nice unisex woody, mossy, mysterious scent.

product_name: Quercia Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content:
This is one of the less interesting offerings of Acqua di Parma to me.

Don't get me wrong, it's a really nice and classic, high-quality men's cologne. Mossy, woody, peppery with Acqua di Parma's signature lemon base. I feel this would be a risk-free likable gift for a gentleman aged min 30 to 40 and above. Perfect everyday scent for office or daytime weekend outings.

I want to believe any scent can be unisex, but the only way to pull this one off as a woman to me would be if you're rocking a bit of a gender-bender formal to semi-formal style imo. But I can't see it fitting, say, with a summer dress, people will just think some of your significant other's fragrance transferred to you when you hugged him.

To me this is a bit of a dad's birthday gift or fathers' day gift kind of scent, but a really nice high-quality one.

product_name: Quercia Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content: This is a polarizing scent. My friend loves it but I find it kinda boring. It's mostly oakmoss (quercia = oak) and some warm spices after the classic aromatic citrus opening that acqua di parma does well. This is probably the only acqua di parma scent that let me down.

product_name: Quercia Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content: I bought this as part of a sampling set, whilst the fragrance is described as unisex I would say it’s very masculine to me. I can just about pull it off as a woman but it definitely smells like a very expensive men’s scent. The ADP description describes walking in a forest but I honestly get “well groomed, handsome stranger who walks by leaving an intoxicating scent behind that you can’t stop thinking about for days after”.

product_name: Quercia Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content: Reminds me of a fresh night spent in the forest, with oakmoss undertone and casual sweet whiffs of fresh herbs. I find it very pleasant, alluring and quite inoffensive. The quality is top notch you can tell immediately that is packed with natural ingredient. It sits in the same category of Lalique Equus for me. These kind of fragrances that you put on and you are immediately taken back in time, when you were in the nature... Is not a blind buy safe kind of fragrance though especially full retail. With a nice offer at discounters might be blind-buy worthy

product_name: Quercia Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I bought this at duty-free (about half of my collection is from there at this point) about three months ago as a gift for someone else, but upon smelling it a second time and realizing the person I was going to give this to probably wouldn't appreciate this vibe, I thought, screw it, I'm keeping this myself. And so began my first experience owning an Acqua di Parma cologne. My impressions? A luxurious office-safe fragrance. Almost reminds me of one of the Dior Homme fragrances, ever-so-slightly, as it evokes a similar vibe, but Quercia is darker and richer. There's something intriguing about the drydown. It's indulgent. You can tell the elements used to concoct this are of superb quality.
I will say though that despite being marketed as unisex, to my nose the scent profile is almost exclusively masculine. However, if you feel confident that you can pull it off, regardless of gender, then you probably will.

Honestly, if I were a hotshot CEO, I'd wear this every day. Right now, as a college student, I'm saving it for important deadlines like final reviews/presentations or internship interviews, especially those around this time of year (mid-to-late autumn). I find that the scent can be on the mature side, but if you're young but a more serious type person, or are just professionally active or highly involved in your industry, then consider making this your scent.

This was my first Acqua di Parma fragrance (though I have tried the shampoo and conditioners at hotels: they're a MUST BUY), and I definitely wasn't disappointed. Given the niche prices, I came to expect this quality of a scent, but this definitely has a certain edge, a nice universally-safe feel to it, a quality that perhaps other niche fragrances don't possess. In my opinion, everything The One by Dolce and Gabbana should've been (I might be too soon to speak since I haven't tested any of its flankers). If you need something that's pleasant to every nose, opt for this.

SCORE: 91%

product_name: Quercia Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content: This is my favorite of the Signatures of the sun line. A classic. Smells Ultra good and always get compliments. This is a mature scent, not for teenagers for sure. I believe a mid 20s guy can pull it off, its smell so good. Powerful, thick, luxurious and natural. It’s a mixture of modern/old-school vibe. This version is more woody and spicy than the original which I have currently. I can picture this as a more powerful, natural, updated version of the original Chanel Allure pour homme scent. ADP always delivers in there scents. Mancera, Acqua Di Parma, Bottega Veneta and Bvlgari are my top brands I buy . So I always look at these brands first for new releases. Highly recommend this for the casual or formal man.

product_name: Quercia Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I retested this and now suspect either the tester bottle I used last time had gone south or they've reformulated this. Last time it smelled like a dirty old incel. But now, it wasn't nearly as bad. In fact it's not bad at all. I get a fresh green opening and a lovely patchouli drydown.

Darn, I need to re-retest this.

product_name: Quercia Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content:
This opens up with excellent tangy and tart citruses which ADP does really well, but the drydown is the best part if you love oakmoss, albeit, synthetic. This has a nice hit of oakmoss along with tonka sweetened creamy woods. Reminds me of 19-69 L'air Barbes oakmoss but Quercia is longer lasting.

Perfect with a white dress shirt siping a gin and tonic or a mojito in the sun.

Scent 9/10
Performance 7/10

product_name: Quercia Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Been comparing Quercia vs Oud vs Sandalo. They're all very very nice for brisk fall and winter weather. Quercia is the freshest and the most citrusy of the bunch. Not as creamy, woody, or dark as the others, but has those elements as well.

Citrus opening drying down to a dry, warm, woody backbone with a hint of leather and sweetness. Very nice. Not as creamy and sweet as Sandalo. Not as oudy and woody as Oud. Has shades of both, but entirely different and maybe my favorite. Weaker and less sillage than those as well tho.

Scent: 8.5 / Sillage: 7.5 / Longevity: 7.5 (3/4/2022)

UPDATE (11/29/2023)
Revisiting and comparing to Oud and Leather. Leather is a smooth luxury black leather, dry and stark. Oud is a smooth clean oud that dries down to a slight bit of funk. Both have a lot of similarities. Quercia is an outlier as I remembered...brighter, more citrus, more traditional lavender and oakmoss vibes. Only the slightest hints of the Oud and Leather vibes. While it's the easiest to wear...it might be the least unique and special.

I'm a bit torn bc I'd like to get some more of this, but I have many others that fit this mandate. Oud might be the best one to double up on since I don't have many Ouds and dark woody frags.

Scent: 8 / Sillage: 7.5 / Longevity

product_name: Quercia Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Very good! Great smell and performance!
10

product_name: Quercia Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content: Sweet and masculine. Very nice, decently radiant. Evening out type of fragrance with close friends or family. Good for office as well.

product_name: Quercia Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I have since retried this remake of AdP Quercia (Ingredient Collection) and to be honest, for me and on my skin, it’s lost all the charm of the original. Black-Bottle Quercia is definitely more unisex and ‘cleaner’ but to my nose it smells more artificial and has lost both the complexity and that ‘dark mossy’ masculinity of the original Quercia… shame, really.

I fear the Ingredient Collection has also been discontinued as it has disappeared from the AdP website.

product_name: Quercia Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content:
My wife has the black bottle. A candied, spicy opening drying to wood and tonka. Decent performance. Autumnal? To me this is a very good, classy, sexy fragrance well worth owning, suitable for special occasions. Very few others will be wearing it I suspect.
4/5

product_name: Quercia Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content:
This fragrance is different when wet and dry. It smells very pleasant, a vanilla and moss once you spray it, but after 30 minutes, it smells more of patchouly and cedar to me. It’s very warm and spicy, perfect for colder days.

The longevity is alright, around 5 hours. The sillage is moderate at first, but more intimate as it dries. The scent is more masculine, but it is still nice to wear as a unisex fragrance. It is though in my opinion overpriced.

6.5/10. I like it, but there are better ones in this collection.

product_name: Quercia Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Acqua-di-Parma/Quercia-Eau-de-Parfum .. Is a complex masterclass


Personal score
======
Scent - 9.2/10
Sillage (scent trail) - 8.6/10
Projection - 7.2/10
Longevity - 8.8/10
Compliment factor - 8.9/10
Female approval factor - 8.2/10
Versatility - 7.8/10

Overall rating - 9/10


Review
======
Bought this fragrance recently after going into a high end department store in the UK (twice) to smell the Acqua-di-Parma signature range, Quercia-Eau-de-Parfum was by far the best smelling to me out of the range even more than the popular Oud EDP, its taken me a week to finally commit to purchasing Acqua-di-Parma Quercia given its high price tag for 180ml, but i just couldn't get this fragrance out of my head, i have quite a large collection now, not as big as some but bigger than most, I found this fragrance to be a revelation in the opening which is far superior to many expensive fragrances i have smelled, Quercia has a dynamic and complex dry down owed to the fact that this uses a lot of natural ingredients and you can absolutely smell the difference, the longevity of Quercia EDP is fantastic lasts all day on me and is a skin scent 24+ hours after, the projection is also excellent giving me 2+ hours of a 4-6 feet bubble to 1 feet after the 3-4 hour period.

This fragrance just screams class and sophistication with a modern twist, you can wear this fragrance dressed up or dressed down its not limited in that regard, when wearing this fragrance you will not smell like everyone else it may share similarities with some fragrances but you can just smell a lot of naturals in this from beginning to end, Quercia EDP is like going from smelling in standard definition to high definition is the best way i can describe it, you pick up on more nuances in the fragrance from start to finish, people who understand quality will recognise this fragrance as being such and compliment accordingly, i would say this is a safe fragrance for 28+ age group.

This fragrance should be on your radar when next you go shopping, i know its a little pricey but its a fantastic offering from Acqua-di-Parma in my opinion one of their best in the Signature line and one of the best i have smelled in a long time and I'm now a happy owner.


Scent break down
======
Naturally Fresh Opening, Slightly Spicy/Woody Heart Notes, with a Earthy/Sweet/Mossy dry down.

product_name: Quercia Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Its a strange one. Splits me right down the center. The opening is amazing, stunning infact. The dry down isn't quite as nice and then it starts getting irritating.

Most of us buy a fragrance for the top notes...and thats when this is at its best

product_name: Quercia Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content: The opening to this is so good. Dry down not so much. It actually repulsed me which is surprising considering how much I love the opening. Will update after more wearings if necessary.

product_name: Quercia Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I've been wearing this for a month now, in Dec/Jan, and the weather has been both humid and dry and cold to cool, (28°F to 58°F). Its character changed somewhat according to the temp and humidity. On my skin, I've gotten 8-10 hours of performance. It starts out smelling spicy and sweet, then moves into this very rich, creamy, vanilla/almond phase. It enters into Gormand territory, and I love it. Compliments have been "good", "have you been baking?", "what smells so delicious!". Sillage seems to be about 5-6 feet. When the base notes take over, it has an earthy character grounding it. When I started doing some physical exertion, it really came to life, and that's when it really started to shine.

For me, this is well worth the price.

product_name: Quercia Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I bought a sample pack of the whole 'Signatures of the Sun' line and I'm slowly making my way through it. I already purchased a full bottle of the Oud, which is by far my favourite. The leather seems quite popular too.

Generally speaking, AdP fragrances are very natural smelling. This seems like the youngest offering, which they may have achieved by adding a few more synthetics (ambroxan?). It still feels very refined, quite bold and sharp with a few rough edges, which is generally a profile that appeals to me but the scent still feels like it's missing something. I think this would work very well for casual daywear or to the office but for the price you can definitely do better. Longevity on my skin is very good, I got 8 hours from it.

product_name: Quercia Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content: Terrible reformulation. I own the original (brown bottle) which I think is the best from the series, it's lovely and dense and performs well. This one is so light, didn't even recognise it.

product_name: Quercia Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I made a review on Quercia in the Colonia range.
Does anyone see or notice a difference with this one?

product_name: Quercia Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content:
A LOT OF CHARACTER!
___________________________________________________________


I completely disagree with 'Aguirre' - this fragrance is a lot of things, but "dull, unremarkable, and has no character" it is definitely not!

Today I got the opportunity to try some of the new Acqua di Parma-Fragrances. At the counter 'Osmantus' and 'Vaniglia' were the ones, which stood out for me, but the sales person insisted that 'Quercia' was the most outstanding of them all. So I tried it. It starts with a powerful note of cardamon, which turns into oak and bergamot.

However the real face of this fragrance is being revealed later on - the Cedar, Patchouli and pepper take over and form a very well blended and captivating fragrance - quite unique and mesmerizing. Like a magnet it pulls you into it's sphere and doesn't let go.

Longevity: - 8/10
Sillage: - 8/10

All in all: 10 subjective points -> because it is a unique cedar fragrance (in my opinion). It is stronger than you might expect.

product_name: Quercia Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Forget the oak moss. Quercia falls in the generic pool of citrusy, fresh, ambroxan-y, sweet, artificial, woody cocktails of nowadays' mainstream perfumery.

It's dull, unremarkable, and has no character. Pass.

product_name: Rosa Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content: To me, it smells like the steam of a scalding bath that completely fills a lavish room overflowing with pink roses: rich, enveloping, and soft. Not fresh or dewy, but a haze of extremely hot rose mist: soothing, pristine, and effortlessly feminine. I like to use it after a warm, evening shower, just before going to bed. For daytime I layer it with Luce di Rosa.

product_name: Rosa Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content: I did a side by side test with this and Diptyque Eau Rose samples, to see how long they last. It was only about 4 hours on my skin. They are very similar rose fragrances, not much difference in them. But Rosa Nobile is slightly softer and light. There is something to enjoy with both of these interpretations and I am finding it hard to choose which one to buy - they are both on sale. Rosa Nobile has a light, airy feel about it, more girly. Eau Rose is slightly more mature? I wish that both lasted at least 6 hours on my skin but they don't. Does anyone else have this problem?

product_name: Rosa Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Dew-kissed roses in full bloom, their petals carrying a sweet, airy fragrance that lingers in the cool breeze. I love rose fragrances and this is certainly in my top 3. Longevity and projection is moderate.

If I had to compare this to another rose perfume this perfume is more fresh than Jo Malone Red Roses. Both perfumes are 10/10 in terms of photorealistic rose perfumes.

product_name: Rosa Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content: If you really, really like old-fashioned, powdery, green rose scents this might be your bag. If you're lukewarm on them this will probably just smell like your grandma's fancy rose-scented soap bar that she keeps in a paper box that you're not allowed to use.

product_name: Rosa Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content: A very fresh and aquatic rose scent. I find this continues to stay fresh on me, where other fragrances can start to take on that pheromonal musk. Maintains its floral integrity, and lasts at least half the day on me.

product_name: Rosa Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content: A fresh, almost aquatic rose scent. Has minimal sillage and lasts about 4 hours. Reminds me a bit of Mugler Angel Nova. Saw people compare this to Chloe, but I find Chloe much sharper and not as fresh.

product_name: Rosa Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content:
This opens with a lot of citrus. But it’s not sharp. You get rose right off the bat it’s beautiful.
Drying down you get the peony And Lily of the valley. Still all the Rose citrus coming through.
In the dry down at the very bottom, you get the cedar And the rose is still going, and the citrus fades a little, and you can smell the powdery violet I think that’s why people think this smells masculine. And absolutely a man could wear it.
As those are traditional, male notes, cedar violet citrus. But I’m still getting the rose and it’s a sweet rose not a masculine rose. This is so well blended that anyone could wear it. It’s so gorgeous. I don’t know why people think this is weak or A simple rose, perfume. It is certainly not.
It’s one of those fragrances that you can feel what the nose was doing every step of the way and it flows. It still has that aqua di Parma DNA with the citrus.
Just lovely I’m surprised by how much I like this.
The middle is my favorite part citrus peony rose a little cedar. The mix of the rose and the lily of the valley gives you a little white floral vibe, but not too much if you don’t like white florals this is not that. It’s just enough.
I think anyone can wear this of any age. This is for a woman in her prime, confident, feminine Sophisticated.

product_name: Rosa Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content: Beautiful rose fragrance. I wish it lasted longer than five minutes. Literally I had to sniff my wrist to see if I can smell anything. Nothing. I asked others too. Nothing. I’m glad I bought 20ml size, because I’m not going to purchase this. Disappointed ☹️💔💔💔

product_name: Rosa Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content: 예쁜 향이지만 어디선가 맡아 본 것만 같은..

product_name: Rosa Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content: This is probably one of the most realistic rose scent--to me it smells like crushed rose petals: I get a slightly bitter, slightly salty (perhaps the ambergris?), and slightly earthy florals. I would say this is a more mature rose scent, its a more sophisticated take on rose compared to others such as Bvlgari rose goldea & lancome idole which tends to be on the sweeter side. This is more powdery, and I would say this is more classy than girly. Sadly the longevity isn't the best, probably around 4 hours on my skin.

product_name: Rosa Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content: do not blind buy this perfume. i bought it because an idol said this is her favorite and smells pretty. turned out it smells so average and make me headache :’( and it just an average rose scent that you probably could find on another brand

product_name: Rosa Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content: This one is so good, I rarely buy second bottles of anything but this one always gets me. The peony version is neck and neck with this. Perfect California weather scent. I don’t know that I’ve ever worn it in true heat Because I don’t live in that type of climate, but I really enjoy it, to me it is fresh, classy, like what I smell and Santa Barbara at the Bacara. It’s interesting that somebody said that it could be masculine, maybe it is the freshness and the cleaness? Definitely not masculine to my nose, just the most classy beautiful woman scent. I just turned 40 but started wearing this about 5 years ago. I don’t think it smells mature, I think of chanel no 5 as mature but still good. Longevity is just OK but good enough for me.

product_name: Rosa Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content: I got a card sample and I was surprised by how masculine leaning this is when sprayed on my skin and how feminine it smells on my sister's skin. I think the right body chemistry is the key to this. On paper, it smells like fresh roses decorated around the room on a summer twilight. I'm just sad that this is very expensive but I would buy this if I have the extra cash.

product_name: Rosa Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content: This is a gorgeous, fresh, sophisticated orange-y rose. I love it. Someone below mentioned that it's a sunny rose, and I'd agree. Perfect for spring/summer. However, it triggers headaches every time I wear it so sadly, not for me.

product_name: Rosa Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content: I am an ardent rose lover so I had to try this one out. It's not my favorite rose, but I like it. For me, because of the peppery top note and musky/woody base, this may be more of a fall/winter scent. It's not heavy and perfectly fine to wear in the summer, but I tend to reserve citrus and white flower situations for summer.

product_name: Rosa Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I enjoy the beautiful scent, but I love many rose perfumes, and this reminds me of A La Rose MFK but better. Demachy is in my top five noses with MFK. So love their take on rose one with French and the other with Italian Roses for the houses brand. This is more classic with a warmth.
Great for Summer nights for a wow factor. Also wonderful layered with Molecule 01.
Not granny or old but there is a regal nature to this scent.

product_name: Rosa Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Rosa Nobile is a pretty, realistic, fresh yet sweet rose scent, best worn in warm weather. Classic feminine elegance aside, it scores bonus points for me as it evokes childhood memories.

RN is rose-dominant from initial spray, light, fresh and natural-smelling, like rosewater in perfume form. There is some citric freshness up top, complementing the rose. Bright yet well-rounded, the rose here is lovely.

As it develops, the sweet orange note becomes prominent, forming an irresistible sweet accord with the increasingly jammy rose - it reminds me of a sweet treat/cake from childhood, but frustratingly I cannot put my finger on it. Nothing encourages me to buy perfume as much as such scent memories do!

It becomes powdery as it develops, with some violet emerging. A nice hint of greenness is evident in the background too. It becomes musky as it dries down, with soft, warm amber-vanilla evident as it fades. Sillage and longevity are moderate.

A beautiful sweet yet lightweight rose scent, this is elegant, feminine and beautifully balanced. Bonus points for the Proustian factor, but a really good spring/summer rose scent. 4.5/5.

product_name: Rosa Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Full Bottle for Sale!!
I inherited this fragrance from my cousin. She was an avid perfume collector. I personally do not like violet or violet leaf in fragrances. But if uou love this feel free to DM me.

Again, DM me for photos and pricing!

product_name: Rosa Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content: I get a splash of rose and peony in the first 3 seconds, and then it’s all just baby powder smell to me…

product_name: Rosa Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Pompous, big, pink, fresh rose with peony backgroud.
The flower here is full of bounce and water, the scent decidedly floral. Not too sweet.
The rose is obvious, first in line, in your face ;) but natural which makes me feel comfortable.
A rose scent for the ones who want to go big with it.
For the ones who want to feel it all the time without anything cheap or silly in the composition.
Great hot weather scent - it's refreshing like rose water mist.

product_name: Rosa Nobile Acqua di Parma
