review_content: This fragrance makes me so happy. I'm disappointed that this is being discontinued. It feels like AdP is getting rid of their more feminine leaning fragrances. This one is beautiful and blooms as it should. It is appropriate for all seasons and, as my favorites do, it lingers. The scent says that I can go to a meeting,

product_name: Rosa Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content: Oh this is so simple and lovely! A beautiful, fresh and zesty mandarin rose. Perfect for a hot summer, not strong enough to be headache inducing and refreshingly citrusy. Nothing extravagant, exactly what it says on the tin, but wonderful nonetheless. The sillage and projection are sadly very weak, though. Would require re-application throughout the day.

product_name: Rosa Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content:
A lovely, modern peony-rose. Smells very quality. I am not usually able to wear a strong peony note, owing to the aquatic presentation of most of these. Calone, methinks. Even so, a good floral if you like this category of scent. My personal favorite would be Paul Smith Rose, with it's mild-mannered peony and pink rose and detergent-style musk. It is perhaps even a trifle less 'realistic' rose even than Rosa Nobile, but as a modern peony-rose interpretation it never goes aquatic or sour or nasty in any way and lasts, with powerful projection. Win-win.

I must add, however, that applying Rosa Nobile at bedtime rendered a clean, perfume dry down next AM. So I think longevity is rather good, always a nice thing to have. She has my respect, if not my love. Rose scents with lasting power are, after all, hard to find!

product_name: Rosa Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content: This is almost a dupe (for me) of Chloe eau de parfum. It's a little bit better quality but it still has that laundry detergent smell (although a nice one) to it that makes it unwearable for me. I was hoping Rosa Nobile was going to be a replacement for my beloved and discontinued Crabtree and Evelyn Rosewater, but it is not to be. This is closer to Chloe eau de parfum than CE Rosewater. This is also quite aquatic as well. Roses in nature do not smell like this. I grew up around all kinds of roses. Heirloom roses, wild roses, tea roses. None of them have an aquatic tone in the way they smell and that synthetic quality ruins this fragrance for me.

product_name: Rosa Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content: Really nice sweet rose scent, very fresh and slightly aquatic. Not grandma-like. Too expensive to justify purchasing though.

product_name: Rosa Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content: This scent is really amazing. Super natural smelling and as a man, simply lovely to wear. High-class, fresh, refined and perfect for all occasions, dressed up or dressed down. The peony-rose combo in here is photorealistic to say the least and the only thing that prevents this from becoming my everyday go-to scent is the unfortunate non existing sillage and the fact that it barely lasts 30 minutes on my skin. Really impressed and let down at the same time, but still, superb fragrance for men and women alike.

product_name: Rosa Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content: I really wanted to love this perfume. It's what many people have described below (simple, fresh rose scent suitable for daily wear) but mine doesn't last long on clothes and skin at all. And to make it worse, the atomizer doesn't work well so I have to press down many times to get 1 spritz ☹ .

product_name: Rosa Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I have been layering this with ysl black opium. You really need something super sexy layered with this perfume. Then it's beautiful and sexy!!

Layering brings out the woody and green qualities. The superfruitiness of Black Opium is gone and replaced with something more sophisticated and mature. The boring fuddy duddiness of Rosa Nobile is gone!

Can also layer RN with pheromones or skanky musk.

product_name: Rosa Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content:
If anyone is looking for a simple, modern rose this is it(you all know this scent). Peony and violet are there. Fresh perfume, slightly sweet.
This is a pink rose with a lot of petals, rich in scent, but light and modern. I love it because its simplicity is refreshing to my soul and brain.
Longevity is moderate, which is nice for this type of light perfume.
It is so beautiful now in the winter.

product_name: Rosa Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content: Fresh, natural slightly soapy rose, tiny bit of sweetness. Too nice for it's own good, smells like someone who gets patted on the head n called 'dear', patronised into oblivion.

product_name: Rosa Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content:
This is not a fresh rose.
It is a vintage one like pot pouri.
It is dry and unique.
Thank you Fragrantica for gifted it to me!!

5/5

product_name: Rosa Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content:
There’s nothing ‘nobile’ (noble) about this perfume. The name ‘rosa nobile’ leads you to think this is a pure and fresh rose fragrance, however, from the first spritz you’re slapped on the face.
This is a pungent synthetic juice, a chemistry experiment that went wrong.
I suggest you try before you buy.

product_name: Rosa Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content:
흔한 백화점 장미향.
머리가 아플까말까 경계에 있는 파우더리함.

product_name: Rosa Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content: Absolutely beautiful for the rose lovers. If you can grab this for a deal I would say go for it. I like a dark rose but sometimes I need a daytime rose for running around. My toddler loves this on me, so I’m grabbing all the bottles! 😉

product_name: Rosa Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content: I’ve enjoyed the regular citrussy refreshing cologne from Acqua di Parma, but its taking me years to get through this bottle of their rose scented version. I’m partial to rose fragrances - I grow many varieties of damask roses - so I’m fussy about how rose aroma is captured in fragrances. This fragrance is just too sweet for me, the rose scent seems unnatural, lacking the refreshing qualities of cologne. Fair quality, just not for me.

product_name: Rosa Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content:
It’s a fairly pedestrian rose scent. For some reason it makes my skin burn slightly on the sprayed sites.
Nothing remarkable and to me it’s not like A la Rose by MFK which I adore. This one is a bit colder and peppery and smells quite common. A la Rose is much more creamy, nuanced, and more luxurious.

An hour after I sprayed this, I started to get a headache.
My hubby thinks it smells like rose scented air freshener. 😞

product_name: Rosa Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content: On first spray this made me think of something from the Dior rose lineup. I can't remember which one, but it also has that mandarin/rose/pepper combination opening going on. Anyway, coming here I see that Demachy created it, so no wonder it reminds me of a Dior fragrance, since he created the fragrances there. His style is clearly exhibited here too - initially. But after it dries down completely I agree with RainbowGirl 100%. It smells like Paul Smith's Rose on me too, and performs about the same. Honestly, I couldn't get past that association, especially considering the massive price difference. You can pick up a bottle of Paul Smith Rose for $25 on Fragnet, or you could pay the $90 being asked for essentially the same fragrance. For me, it's a no brainer.

product_name: Rosa Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I own a travel spray of this fragrance, and although it is a beautiful rose perfume, I never purchased a full bottle.

The opening is fantastic. A beautiful orangy rose, with a hint of pepper, to make it feel classy. A very simular opening to Penhaligon's The Coveted Duchess Rose.

I love orange mixed with rose. It makes the rose smell fresh and light. Like smelling an authentic fresh rose in a garden.

When this settles, it reminds me of Paul Smith's Rose (which I may review next, to compare.) The rose is mixed with peony, which makes it stay a fresh rose, even after the citruses have faded. I get a hint of the violet, and a hint of greeness from the lily of the Valley, but very light. Supporting roles. Just enough to make you feel you are in a garden.

At this stage, nose to skin, it reminds me of something... like a HINT of watermelon rind? Maybe the white fleshy part of the watermelon? But still rose dominated. Zero soapy. Zero potpourri smelling. Super fresh, and a little green.

The projection is okay, but not great. I can smell it around me, but lightly, and it doesn't last very long. Maybe two hours on my skin. Which is why I never purchased a full bottle. I also own a full bottle of Paul Smith Rose, which is super affordable, and also a beautiful fresh rose.

If you love a fresh garden rose, and you have your heart set on owning an Acqua Di Parma scent, this will be a great addition to your collection, and a safe blind buy.

product_name: Rosa Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content:
It's like Bvlgari's Rose Goldea without the musty smell.
I find it quite peppery and spicy when I wear it. I don't like it because it makes my nose itchy.

product_name: Rosa Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Beautiful fresh roses.
Very similar to MFK a la rose. With half the price!
Performance is very good too.
It lasts 6-8 hours on my skin in summer. But the sillage is good in first 2 hours, then it sits as skinscent.

product_name: Rosa Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content: All I can smell is rose & lily... Nothing offensive or controversial, but nothing special or memorable neither.

product_name: Rosa Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Gmaster's review was hilarious and perfect. This is an old lady rose, not a delicious "fresh wet sunlit rose" like Diptyque Eau Capitale or a resinous Tauer Rose Flash. Has more than a little green to it and becomes increasingly tart during the drydown, which isn't optimal. Quite linear. ADP has better options in the stable.

Grade: C-
Quick take: green Sweettart rose for very conservative & repressed real estate lady

product_name: Rosa Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Some time ago I decided that I needed to get rid of this perfume. I'm so glad I didn't. Apparently I needed time to love it, to grow it. At the moment I feel a beautiful, fresh rose. I also liked A la rose, which reminds me a lot of this one, but I still feel enough differences to justify its purchase.
Sometimes we need time to feel and mature to a specific scent. This is what happened to me and this creation and I am glad that I still gave it a chance.

product_name: Rosa Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content: Fresh roses. Botanical, uncomplicated. It is perfect for romantic ladies that love rose scent. Maybe too simplistic, but a good rose scent to keep in your collection. I prefer Magnolia Nobile and Peonia Nobile. It could be a signature for a young woman. Good persistence and sillage. Sometimes is refreshing going back to basics. For rose lovers. 3/5

product_name: Rosa Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content: Of roses came in lilac color they would smell like this. A rose - fresh, recognisable and a bit powdery. Definitely a soliflore.

product_name: Rosa Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content: It's a rose. Rosy rose. Good shampoo kind of clean rose, nice soap kind of fresh rose. Not my cup of rose but I can imagine that many will enjoy it in spring and summer. It's just too soft, too easy and too girly for me.

product_name: Rosa Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content: I enjoy the smell - fresh roses and that is it really. Not a complicated perfume, the perfume name and look are basically what you see is what you get - as someone mentioned below as well :) The problem for me is the sillage and longevity, I consider it very weak. I see people here think it is moderate, I would consider both as weak. I don't think it's worth the higher price tag for that reason.

product_name: Rosa Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content: The kind of rose that really doesn’t smell like a rose but more like the idea of what a rose should smell like. It’s usually how rosy rose perfumes smell, and it’s not bad but it makes my head tired. Very rosy. Seems well put together. Not much fun to it.

product_name: Rosa Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content: Simply lovely, and just what I was looking for. I have a bar of soap from several years ago that smelled of roses and I was never able to find a rose perfume that smelled similar to it, until I got my nose on this. To me, this smells like a very traditional rose. Pretty, powdery, and realistic. Not sugary or gourmand. The longevity on this lasts 6+ hours. Recommend!

product_name: Rosa Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I blind bought this based on the reviews. What a mistake.
This perfume gave me a headache and I returned it. To me, it is nothing like a "soft ballerina" as other reviewers have mentioned. It is a strong in-your-face older Madam wearing red lipstick (some on her teeth) that speaks to you a little too close to your face and is wearing a purple fur coat. She loves calling everyone "dear" and "darling".
All in all, I couldn't distinguish the notes that disturbed me but it sure wasn't what I was looking for: a rose solifore.
(I am currently wearing Roses de Chloe and this is what I wanted.)

product_name: Rosa Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content:
This is such a pretty rose. Its like natural pink roses mixed with the sweetness of rose scented cosmetic products (not ones loaded with essential oils). It’s sweet and dewy smelling on my skin. Often, I find that simple rose fragrances can go sour like stale dried up rose petals. I get that with fragrances like The Perfumers Workshop Tea Rose and Aerin Rose De Grasse.

So I’ve been trying fruitier and sweeter roses to compensate the sourness. That not what I wanted but was a way for me to handle rose in perfume.

Rosa Nobile is softly sweet and slightly powdery. It smells so delicate and feminine. I honestly thought I was going to hate it and prefer Magnolia Nobile. This is my type of rose. It’s simple but I guess like simple.

product_name: Rosa Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content:
For a moment at the start there is a great natural rose note surrounded by some green, and other soft floral. But at the center is that sweet, fresh, just stuck your nose in a rose, genuine smell.

But the delicate fresh scents fade within minutes and what's left just smells like a generic soft floral. Like a quality bar of soap.

Nice for the guest bathroom soap, but not tempted to wear it.

product_name: Rosa Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content: This is an ultra feminine lovely fragrance. The rosey opening is gorgeous and I wish it maintained more of that personality in the the Drydown, where it loses much of its character. This perfume is like a soft ballerina fragrance yet really projects, probably at least an arm’s length.I just wish it had a little something in the Drydown, more of a depth or edge, that makes this not smell as generic and synthetic as it does compared to the magnificent opening. I would buy this if I could find an affordable bottle but it’s quite expensive for what it is. I much prefer this over magnolia nobile which is kind of mature and stuffy.

product_name: Rosa Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content: unfortunately I'm not a fan. I love rose perfumes in general but this doesn't work for me. I can tell there is a nice rose in there somewhere but the opening is too sharp and green and there is too much pepper and the dry down is too musky for me. I didn't really get a proper hit of rose at any point, I felt like I was searching for it amongst the other notes. It smells almost masculine to me. I've tried most of the ADP nobile range now and the only one I really enjoy is the Gelsomino.

product_name: Rosa Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content: I have a lot of Rose scented fragrances , some with oud , some with fruit , a few with a green note , and even more that are just rose & other floral notes , patchouli & musk too , none , and I mean none come close to this "stunner " . I got from first spritz a fresh cut rose vibe , such a surprise , it went straight into a rose scentual without any alcohol detected . I did get a hint of bergamot and orange . She is lovely , and I'm impressed . Some of my Rose scents are middle of the road price point , a few are high end with rose being the predominant note Lancôme: Peut Etre from 2008 , 500 years from ELO , Bvlgari : Rose Essential ~ This has now become a must have , she will always be in my wardrobe . I thank the reviewers that are in the same mind frame on this one as I am . I was wearing Valentino Donna Rosa Verde and I spritzed one on top , amazing , I don't usually layer, I have a few times , but with what this turned into I might just turn into a " layering " addict ~ ///=^} ~

product_name: Rosa Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content:
This is a perfect rose scent in my nose, it smells absolutely wonderful on my skin!!

I got the rose foremost and than the peony. Is there any musk and pepper in the background?? Naaaa...

I also have some other rose perfumes that I love dearly, but, they are at my large storage on the other side of the country, so, I only have this little beauty with me now.

And, I love it, and, I think it is perfect for everybody!

I am very allergic to some kind of perfumes, but this one I can dig my nose as deep as I can into my skin, and, I don't got any allergic reaction from it, or either the astma.

It last for many hours on my skin, so it's def a solid 10/10 !!

product_name: Rosa Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I tried this for the first time today. I am a big fan of three of the other "Nobiles" - Magnolia, Gelsomino, and Iris, so I expected good things from the rollerball I purchased. My very first reaction after I applied it was "No!! Another super sharp rose!!". Absolutely not to my taste! But of course I waited, and within 15 minutes, it all softened into a pretty, pink, somewhat fluffy rose fragrance that I find charming. It doesn't feel old fashioned to me, as I don't find it powdery. The citrus sort of lifts it up and the lily of the valley provides a touch of green freshness that is not the least bit bitter. It fits well within the collection. The only one left to try is Peony.
EDIT - I now own Peonia also.

The question I must ask myself now is do I want or need a full bottle? I would love to have it to add to the collection but I'm not sure I am willing to spend that much on it. A gift would be nice, and if I find a bargain, I might be tempted, but for now I am happy with my travel size.

Silage and longevity are moderate.

5/15/20 - found a very good deal on line and purchased a full bottle. I have a suspicion that this will be even more lovely as a spray rather than a roller.

product_name: Rosa Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Pink roses and peonies in a garden shortly after a spring rain.
Fresh and pleasant, easy-going and not overwhelming, I would even call it delicate and as it names suggests, purely noble.
But...
It would be a great perfume if, at least on me, its duration was not so disappointingly short.
After three, maximum four hours, it just disappears from my skin. Also, this really beautiful first impression of a soft rose changes somewhere in the middle of its life and becomes something like a synthetic rose smell, which I truly hate.
If it had kept its first notes character, and despite its short duration I would call it great and I would rate it differently.
Not for me.

product_name: Rosa Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Wow, rose a beautiful rose!
This is so beautiful! its rally very strong and peaceful, something that I feel that even if you are not a perfume lover is so realistic it just has this Rose garden vibe!
Its got a green stem and beautiful fresh bloomed rose!
I have never had a rose perfume like this, but it really is a (happy pleasant perfume) mood arousing of the winter!
It makes you feel happy!

product_name: Rosa Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content: Simple, linear rose scent. Not as fresh or as happy as others may be. Nothing special, especially not for the price.

product_name: Rosa Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content: it smells like a worn out fragrance that you have applied yesterday or the day before.

product_name: Rosa Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Acqua di Parma Rosa Nobile is not a unique rose scent, but with that being said, it doesn't need to be. Easy to wear and love, this fragrance has everything that you could ever want. I would go so far to challenge those that usually detest rose fragrances to try and turn up their noses at this little beauty.

Rosa Nobile is a beautifully balanced blend of pink, delicate roses and tart peony. It starts as a fresh, dew-kissed floral before drying down into a powdery, cedar base.

I think Acqua di Parma does an excellent job with their soliflores. The perfumers don't over complicate things, which is one aspect I appreciate. Rosa Nobile takes this fragrance house to new heights with an extremely wearable and inoffensive offering. It is the epitome of Spring to my nose.

This fragrance has quite a following, and it's easy to see why. Many describe Rosa Nobile as pretty, beautiful, delicate, modern and luxurious. These are my thoughts exactly. It does deserve the hype and I would love to smell this fragrance on more passers-by. I think it's a much prettier rose when compared to the infamous Chloe Eau de Parfum.

Men seem to love Rosa Nobile on my skin which is another tick in the box for this masterful scent. I did try a number of fragrances from this house at the start of my perfume journey, but for some unbeknownst reason I put Acqua di Parma on the back-burner for a while. I am keen to start exploring this line again, especially now that I have experienced first-hand how wonderful Rosa Nobile turned out.

product_name: Rosa Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I have not smelled a rose like this before! It is spicy and sexy but somehow still a bit subtle and mysterious.

I am unsure about the longevity/projection but I do know that when I sprayed it on my wrist, I could NOT stop sniffing my wrist.

A very unique rose for those scared of rose scents smelling too mature or old fashioned. Def a beauty and a keeper.

product_name: Rosa Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content: Starts out as a spicy rose that reminds me of Solstice Scents Rose Cardamom Sugar.

product_name: Rosa Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I was searching for a rose similar to Maison Francis Kurkdijan A La Rose. My reason being the sillage on MFK is so so light and I couldn't justify spending that much on something that disappears within the hour.

So I bought a tester of Rose Nobile on a whim not expecting it to match up to the gorgeous MFK scent. But it actually does! It is surprisingly close bar a few subtle differences. The citrus in Rose Nobile is definitely more orangey whereas MFK is more lemony. Both a fresh crisp roses which is exactly what I was looking for.

The main difference is the better sillage and longevity with Rose Nobile. And of course, a cheaper price tag. Although a piece of me is slightly gutted to not be buying the MFK, I am so pleasantly surprised with how beautiful Rose Nobile is. Very pretty for spring and a rose for those who don't like them dark and sugary.

product_name: Rosa Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content: A pale pink ballet rose, great layered with its twin scent Evelyn Rose from Crabtree. That is, because they are twins you’ll get more longevity and sillage by adding this grasse rose to the Crabtree hand and body creams. Hope this helps prolong the enjoyment of this summer stunner. Just lovely.

product_name: Rosa Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content: For some reason it didn’t work for me as I thought it would. I do smell strong rose, maybe just too strong and nothing else if anyone wants it send me a message.

product_name: Rosa Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Gorgeous pink rose that hits just the right spot between classic and contemporary, powdery and fresh. Pure joy in a bottle! Lovely for layering too -- I especially like it over original Stella to supercharge the rose.

Sillage is good on me for the first half hour, then drops dramatically. Longevity is poor to average but so far the best of this style of rose I've yet found. :)

Editing to add that after wearing for a week or so, I'm able to detect the lovely green/naturalistic/garden-y notes throughout this. It's really interesting -- at first it seems like a simple rose soliflore, but slowly you start to perceive the rest of the garden around the roses.

product_name: Rosa Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Oh how I love the opening of this. It's a gorgeous, complex, fresh rose. The rose smells real, but there are other flowers and scents supporting it in just the most lovely way. I could inhale it for hours.

Except I can't. It doesn't have a scent progression so much as pieces just start falling away, exposing a base of fake, detergent-smelling rose.

If someone can recommend something that holds onto the opening of this or has a more pleasant progression, I'd appreciate it. Especially before June 2019 (I'd like to wear it for my wedding).

product_name: Rosa Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content: This smells like rain in a rose garden. Simply lovely. I see why these kinds of perfumes get more “likes” than “loves” here, because maybe they’re not that original, but not everything has to have an edge to it. This is just beautiful. I would pick this over famous beasts like Alien, Angel, Hypnotic Poison and the likes, any day.

product_name: Rosa Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Much, much better than MFK, which I had such high hopes for. This is a real rose-focused perfume where the rose is restrained but persistent even into the drydown, which is uncommon for modern rose scents e.g. Chloe's.

This reminds me of a fine French rose scented soap, like Rance's. Someone else called it "sunny", and I'd agree with that too. I couldn't take the fruity sharpness and fuzzy modern musk drydown of MFK's. This one is perfect. And I say that as someone who's been unimpressed with the other Iris Nobile flankers.

product_name: Rosa Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Rose Nobile is Another floral in a Nobile series. (My favorite from this line is by far Magnolia). It is a stream of pink rose and peony for the first hour or so, which melts into a nice floral bouquette heart and base notes.

Decent sillage and projection, you definitely get noticed by a nice trail of flowers. It might not be the best office scent though.

I am not a big fan of rose, so a pass for me, but highly recommend for rose lovers.

product_name: Rosa Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Beautiful fragrance. Nicely done Rose fragrance.
I wear this only for special occasions and during the summer.
I see that it's being compared to a la rose, I prefer this to a la rose. It's a little softer.

product_name: Rosa Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content:
the happiest citrusy zingy rose. i am a rose fragrance collector with a lot of (probably too many) rose scents.

and yet when i tried this one i knew i needed a full bottle immediately. it evokes sipping a citrusy drink during a stroll in a sunny rose garden.

this fills the niche of "sunny rose" among my others (powdery rose, makeup rose, jammy rose, melancholy rose, synthetic powerhouse rose, among others). happy to have it as part of my collection.

i see a lot of people find this similar to Kurkdjian's A La Rose, which I also have, but I like this one better frankly.

product_name: Rosa Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content: Rosa Nobile is a pretty and pink rose scent, the main notes are rose, peony, and musk. The rose is a fresh, natural tea-rose in this fragrance, and thanks God, it is not a fruity-candy rose, nor a grandma-type dusty rose. Just beautiful soft roses, like a cascade of silky pink petals. Reminds me of Diptyque Eau Rose, but without thats overly sweet litchi-note.

product_name: Rosa Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content: Beautiful and sophisticated, similar to another great rose creation by L'Artisan, drôle de rose. Good sillage and longlasting.

product_name: Rosa Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content: This is my definition of a rose perfume.

product_name: Rosa Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content: So, so, so, beautiful…..This is such a delicate composition. “What perfume are you wearing? You smell like a bouquet of flowers,” says one. “You always smell so good,” says another. A woman who is allergic to fragrance actually takes a deep inhale of me, asks me for the name, and says, “I think I can wear this.” With numerous admirers, I’ve shared my Travalo refillable perfume sprayer. On various scraps of paper, I’ve written the words ‘Acqua di Parma, Rosa Nobile’ over and over again, for those who want to purchase it for themselves. I spray this in my hair, and on my clothes, arms and legs. Although sillage and longevity fall in the average range, this is fast becoming my signature.

product_name: Rosa Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content: Pleasant and fresh, less depth and interesting than Rose Essentielle by Bvlgari that has something more intense in its body. poor sillage

product_name: Rosa Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content: Soapy citrusy and rosy, very pleasant. Average longevity.

product_name: Rosa Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content: This is one of those perfumes that smells exactly like the sum of its parts. I can detect every single note without effort, there are no magic accords creating something ineffable here, it's a very straightforward composition. A lovely pink rose.

product_name: Rosa Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Very rosy, flowery and sparkling in opening. But leave it like half hour to settle, and it turns out it does not work with my skin. It gets a bit sour, a bit old-lady smell (something like your grandmothers beauty rose-scented soap bar). It disappears in total 4-5 hours.
Luckily, i bought just a sample, as this is not my cup of tea :(

product_name: Rosa Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Weak ("shy" as another reviewer put it - yes.
Shy.). I don't like it. Cheap smelling! Peace

product_name: Rosa Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content: I had this as a sample, it was Full Bottle worthy by the end of the day and decided I deserved it, I love the strong but faint smell of roses. It dries down rather quickly, but lasts for a good 8 hours. I allowed my 13 year old niece a quick spray before school, she loved it and said her friends and teachers described her as smelling like a "rose garden"! Price wise it's not teen girl worthy but I liked that she said I didn't smell like a old lady (47).

product_name: Rosa Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content: I think this fragrance is feminine and shy. I like it. I have a 50 ml bottle and I'm looking forward for spring here in Chile to start wearing it.

product_name: Rosa Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content: On me this is an incredubly peppery rose. Really astonishingly peppery. Then it fades to just rose. Longevity very poor. I definitely wouldn't spend £110 on this stuff.

product_name: Rosa Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content: I think this is an ideal rose lovers perfume. It's essentially pure rose, there is little to no powder. Only the faintest hint of citrus. And just enough musk and wood to propel the rose up ward. It's pleasantly simple, and well made. I have no strong inclinations towards rose, but I understand the appeal the flower has for many. It's a lovely, pretty perfume. 7/10

product_name: Rosa Nobile Acqua di Parma
Rosa Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content: Rosa Nobile smells very much like THAIS Feeling (the one with a pink cap) by Antonio Puig, an inexpensive perfume which I used to wear in my late teenage years. How could I dislike Rosa Nobile? But I just can't justify the price point...

product_name: Rosa Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content: On me it just didn't work. I expected a different type of rose actually. The drydown was more like a grandma's smell.

product_name: Rosa Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content:
This is such a peculiar perfume.
Pure rose, it reminds me about perfumes like Chanel 19 or Paris (YSL): there's this masculine/musky note (cedar,musk, bergamot) that exalts rose in such an elegant way.

product_name: Rosa Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content: Such a DIVINE ROSE!!! Oh I swoon when I smell this! It's fabulous! A beautifully pretty rose. So rosey. So delicious. A real darling. A real rose - fresh and sparkling. Like being in a rose garden, in the middle of the day in spring, with all the lovely sweet fresh roses exuding their glorious perfumes into the air. Absolutely gorgeous!

product_name: Rosa Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content: What a perfect rose! Oh truly, a true, fresh growing intoxicating rose. The best rose perfume I have ever had. It's so lovely. And the bottle says it all. Perfection, beauty, femininity, elegance and class.

product_name: Rosa Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content: i bought this blindly based on the reviews here on Fragrantica.. i wanted a rose scent for my mom as she loves the flower so much.. before this, she's been wearing Bvlgari Rose Essentielle which is very nice.. AdP Rosa Nobile is a great rose scent and my mom loves it as well! It smells so natural and i don't see anyone disliking it.. it's my mom's new favorite!

product_name: Rosa Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content:
The best rose parfume i had ever smellt. Like original rose. Fresh (not citrus)living rose. thumbs up.
10/10

product_name: Rosa Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content:
OMG!!! I cant believe it!!! Very very veeeeery nice scent, very soft, clean, yummy rose!!
Unfortunately longladting on me is moderate. But i still looooooooove this perfume <3

product_name: Rosa Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content:
it's hard to describe how much I love this one
I am a rose lover and this is one of the most beautiful rose dominated fragrances that I ever tested
here,rose is very soft,very natural and there is no sharpness here,even in the opening part..there is nothing overdone here,nothing to cover rose's natural beauty,no citrus,no woods,no green notes,no spices,no powdery notes,not even sweetness,there are all hear but the slightest amount of them
this is all about a delicate,subtle rose with a hint of soft musk..I can't detect other notes and I don't want to,I just want to douse myself in this lovely pretty rose,but for sure there are other notes here,adding freshness,a touch of clean powderyness and giving unnoticable spice,taste and a delicate silky sweetness to the overall combination
I can just say I loooovvve it,love,love..very lovely to wear during springs but it's also wearable in summers and falls..it stays on my skin pretty long with moderat sillage
my only sadness is about my small,miniature size bottle,I don't want this gorgeous rosey dream to end,never ever
this is a must try for rose lovers

product_name: Rosa Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content: This rose takes its time to bloom. At first I got absolutely nothing but after a few squirts and may be an hour or so later, I started to get a subtle rose. It is lovely and delicate. Not sure if it is worth the price tag though.

product_name: Rosa Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content: Rosa Nobile by Acqua di Parma is a Floral Perfume with a lot of Rose and a bit Citrus and Musk Scent. It is a fragrance that is suitable for Spring and Summer the most. Since it is EDP the longevity is significant and the projection is moderate. This a superb perfume for daily usage in any occasion but not for outdoor activities.

product_name: Rosa Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content:
What a beautiful rose perfume! It is absolutely gorgeous. I have been searching for the perfect rose scent for a while. I have tried a lof of perfumes from Red Roses to Lipstock Rose, from Serge Luten's roses to Diptyque Eau Rose, Stella and Paris. In my opinion none of them smelled even close to fresh living roses. There is a beautiful period house across the street from my apartment. Every summer, in the front-yard of this building there grow the most beautiful roses I have ever seen. They are large, warm, fresh, lively, flirting, inviting and colourful. Whenever I walk pass I stop and smell those beautiful roses which to me are the most precious jewels of our neighborhood. Now we are in the middle of the winter. The rose bushes are tucked away under the glittery quilt of snow. I spray my Rosa Nobile once and see and feel the delicate rose petals open up slowly and let their beautiful scent warm the cold air.

I know that it is not possible to create a perfume that smells exactly like fresh roses, but Acqua Di Parma seems to have captured the beautiful spirit of a young living rose and put it in a bottle. I liked this perfume when I sampled it but to be honest I did not think I would fall in love with it. Now I have my own bottle and feel I am madly in love. Like all the lovers in all the beautiful and promising love affairs I genuinely hope ours will last forever and ever and ever.

product_name: Rosa Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content: I love this. All in all I love rose scents and we can see that there is enormous amount of rose fragrances nowadays, but i can tell that only few of them are really beautiful and very special. This is undoubtedly one of them. Very noble, suitable for all ages, long lasting, sexy....even i can tell for all seasons. This is special one..It can be warm and cosy..and in hot weather its like you're calm in the garden with somebody or smith that you really love. I would say that this scent harmonies me. Recommend

product_name: Rosa Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content:
After a brief citrus opening, the first two hours of Acqua di Parma Rosa Nobile are dominated by a combo of pink rose and pepper. The pepper is quite strong on me, rendering the rose dry and kind of masculine, which is quite unexpected, and I find it very intriguing.

However, after the pepper fades, Rosa Nobile then turns into an aqueous concoction of limpid rose, peony and salty musk with an occasional whiff of citrus. Pretty and approachable, but not as compelling as the first two hours to me. The rose becomes slightly more jammy in the late dry down and the aqueous characteristic also wanes a bit, but overall, the fragrance stays linear throughout.

The sillage is relatively soft and the longevity is around 10 hours. I was positively surprised by the more unisex combo of rose and pepper during the opening. However, while the later stage of modern rose is no doubt very pretty and versatile, I'm not sure it stands out among other similar and more affordable dewy rose fragrances out there to warrant the price.

product_name: Rosa Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content: tested this one...not my cup of tea ;-) I think it's the ambergris at the end.

product_name: Rosa Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Lovely modern, not 'borrowed from granny' scent at all, but not exactly what I expected. I don't get any of the pepper or spicy notes. On me it's more of a balsamic rosewood with nice citruses in the background.
I like that it's not too heady-floral (these kind of scents gives me hedaches!). Nice, contemporary rose without being soapy. I like the rose not being artificial, it's very soft and natural but again, more of a rosewood than dewy rosebud opening up on a sunny morning.
I would consider it a transition time perfume - wouldn't use it in the height of the summer or on very cold frosty winter days, but it's very lovely in late spring and autumn.
My only complaint is that it lasts on the skin for 5-6 hours but when applied very quickly goes from citrusy opening to rosewood-y drydown.
Not offensive in any way, nice everyday scent if you work with people (office, reception, front of house, retail etc.). More of a daytime than evening/going out fragrance.
***
After trying three diferent EDPs from the Nobile Range - Iris, Magnolia and Rosa I can say that Iris is my fave (own a 50ml bottle and would definitely repurchase when run out), Rosa second favourite (would be happy to get more samples or get a bottle as a present) and Magnolia is the one I like the least and wouldn't care for a sample or a full size bottle. That should tell you all about my taste when it comes to Acqua di Parma inventions :-)

product_name: Rosa Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content:
If you are on the fence with this one- wear it several times in different weather. I really love this in 80 degree weather. I adore rose, and this is the queen of my rose scents. If you are looking for realistic rose with a hint of citrus supported by gorgeous jasmine and musk, look no further.

This is, in my opinion, top-shelf, high quality eau de parfum. I can tell because of the way the fragrance develops- it has a gorgeous natural rose and citrus smell for the first hour, fades a bit into the other supporting flowers (jasmine, violet, peony) the second hour, and in the remaining hours you are left with the most beautiful rosey skin musk ever.

While wearing this, I get a feeling of royalty and nobleness- like it could have been worn in the 1800's by the feminine royalty of that time. I should have chosen this as my wedding scent 3 years ago (instead of Bvlgari Rose Essentielle). The longevity on my skin is easily 8-10 hours.

product_name: Rosa Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content: Firstly I have to point out I'm very ' fickle' on perfume, whats my ' perfume forever' one week, will be cast to the bottom of a drawer the week after....and secondly I never buy ' rose' scented perfumes, I simply do not gravitate towards rose, so I cannot understand why I am so besotted with ' rosa', I disagree with previous reviews which state its to ' simple' on the contrary on first blast I get rose, not so artificial it repels, rather soft, mixed in with a rather expensive ' powder smell' , over 30 years ago my dear grandmother would let me play with her make up bag, it smelt of ' vintage cosmetics' my grandmother has been gone a long time so I guess Acqua di parma Rosa, reminds me of this subconsciously, ' 1950s, make up, all powdery and cream smelling', the rose smell has a mere hint of ' spice', and a waft of ' green freshness', it lasts a long time on my skin, its comforting, warm, like walking through a park in summertime, roses, grass, a gentle hit of sun on your skin, you can smell its quality, I really still can't grasp I'm enthralled with a ' rose' fragrance but there you go!! Some how I think this may just keep my interest up longer than expected, I'm also shallow enough to be totally impressed with the bottle, elegant , almost retro, hint of pink liquid, and to the point gold label, my fav perfume bottle of recent years ( just edging out Tom Fords bottles' ) worth a try especially if you are a ' rose' lover or indeed not as the case may be :)

product_name: Rosa Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content: This is the best rose based scent that I have ever worn..It is also spicy, has a beautiful fresh citrus scent.The rose scent is beautiful without the sickly sweetness, that can come through. It reminds me a little of the Rose Musk perfume the Body Shop used to make, which I loved...I even prefer it to the Iris Nobile.

product_name: Rosa Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content: This is a lovely gentle fragrance-I found the rose less prominent than the other notes though, to me this was a sweet and almost gourmand fruity citrus. The sillage is minimal and the longevity poor though, I expected this to be deeper and more 'solid', and its not, its a light delicate wisp of a scent. The musk didn't really come out at all. On me this was very light and more of a summer or spring fragrance. I love rose notes, but I think others have done them better than than this (although this is still lovely). I prefer L'Occitane Rose 4 Reines or Van Cleef & Arpels Rose Velours for a more defined rose note.

product_name: Rosa Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content: so beautiful, feminine, and tender. love it, its like a living, breathing human flesh rose.

product_name: Rosa Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content: Oh my, this is very light, nice discreet rose scent, that vanishes real fast...too expensive for what it is really, fancy name and bottle, but simplistic rose scent, Yves Rocher did better!!! No depth or development...

product_name: Rosa Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Can I dare and say I'm a little bit bored with the term "nobile" here?
I wanted to try this Rosa Nobile anyway. I saw the beautiful bottle at a counter and couldn't help spritzing.
I like their Magnolia, don't care much for the other ones in the line. All in all a tiring line.
Rosa Nobile makes no exception.
It opens with a very subtle yet present rose smell, quite close to natural and lovely. Peony is also there and the tiniest amount of pepper. The first fruity notes last the time of a blink, which is not wrong in a rose scent.
It smells lovely for a while, let's say 1 hour, no more, not too intense but present. Then it fades and fades and never seems to come to a more substancial drydown. It's all about rose from start to end and it would be a nice thing if only it was a somptuous rose. Instead it's so faint that it could be taken for you average rosy scent from drugstore, only a little more elegant.
Not a great deal for that price.

product_name: Rosa Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Rosa Nobile I is a pretty fragrance,very well done, but it is different from what I was expecting. Rosa Nobile opens with prominent bergamot and mandarin, a sunny Italian prelude, followed by a swath of sharp pepper.

After the pepper a lovely soft rose enters that is just divine. I wish this phase of the scent lasted forever, but the rose note gets a bit overwhelmed by peony, lily of the valley and violet during the mid-phase of the development. The musk in the drydown makes this very long lasting on my skin and a bit powdery as well. The cedar is there as a balancing note but it is not prominent for me like it is for some others.

This citrusy floral mix with musk and cedar lasts and lasts on my skin for over 12 hours. It has good sillage for a few hours and then moves to a skin scent. It is a pretty fragrance and worthy of the Acqua di Parma name. At first I thought the rose disappeared in the drydown, but actually it does not, it's just very soft. This fragrance seems to be a crowd-pleaser. I have had 2 people ask me "what is that wonderful perfume you are wearing today?" when I have on Rosa Nobile so it must have more sillage than one may think!

product_name: Rosa Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content: Very longlasting, A little too powerful for me but perfect for someone who is looking for a heavier, more intense rose for the cooler season.

product_name: Rosa Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content: Unfortunately this is simply roses and nothing else ;( not complexed enough for me ,way to simple !

product_name: Rosa Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Purchased this today. I was very excited to smell it as I'm a huge fan of Magnolia Nobile and rose is actually one of my all time favourite scents so, when I heard Acqua di Parma had made a rose fragrance in the Nobile range I was beyond eager to try it.

I am not disappointed it at all. It's a deeper, muskier rose than perhaps I was expecting but this actually means it has greater scent payoff and longevity, or at least it did on me, still getting wafts of it 5 hours on.

It does remind me a little of Serge Luten's La Fille de Berlin in that it has a heady, jammy note to the rose, it's quite delicious. This isn't a powdery or green rose, it's a deep, plush, velvety rose with warm tones that remind me of a huge, billowy rose bush on a midsummer's night in Sorrento - you get the jist!

I don't think this will replace Magnolia Nobile as my signature scent, I just feel Magnolia Nobile is more of an all-rounder, possibly more elegant, suitable for any occasion fragrance, whereas I'd save Rosa Nobile for evening or Autumn / Winter wear personally.

product_name: Rosa Nobile Acqua di Parma
review_content: Lovely rose scent with a "Acqua di Parma vibe". Stylish, but maybe not as stylish as Iris Nobile, Magnolia Nobile and Gelsomino Nobile. I rated this to a like-category now. I may have try this again.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Cipresso di Toscana Acqua di Parma
review_content: This is best for spring and fall. This is a very good value. It smells high quality and natural. If you love evergreen fragrances or conifir, this is top notch.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Cipresso di Toscana Acqua di Parma
review_content: Not quite, but I don’t know whether it’s just a matter of the artificiality of the brand, or of cypress itself.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Cipresso di Toscana Acqua di Parma
review_content: I'm not sure if this is a summer scent or a balmy fall scent. Why not both, I suppose. It sort of lacks the cooling effect one would want during the summer to balm the skin and soul of oppressive heat, but it is still very fresh and invigorating. Monsieur Duchaufour has done a masterful job of creating a cypress accord that lasts quite a long time, throughout most of the life of the fragrance - a tricky feat for sure since cypress and pine notes have a tendency to disappear quite quickly. He accomplishes this by showing the different facets of cypress through each evolutionary step of the perfume. In the opening notes there is a beautiful mélange of herbs - notably rosemary, basil, and sage - combined with grapefruit that together delivers the very green herbal and also somewhat astringent and sulfuric qualities of cypress. After these dry down, which happens quite quickly, we're onto a more floral and spicy heart of jasmine and white florals, lavender, and coriander and cardamom, which together deliver the softer and drier side of cypress; the indolic jasmine and white florals give a smooth and fragrant feel, the lavender an aromatic and herbaceous lift, and the coriander and cardamom the spicy and resinous qualities. Just superb. By the time you are able to pick out what is going on in the heart, the base ingredients pick up their instruments and begin playing their notes of real cypress and pine oils, spicy cedar, and bright and earthy patchouli, oakmoss, and vetiver - the real deals in what would and should be a cypress/pine-forward perfume. High quality materials in the deft hands of a technical master is very nearly always a sure thing for a great perfume, and CdT is no exception. It gives this tremendous and evocative feeling that I've spent an entire day in a Tuscan cypress forest condensed to a matter of a few hours. The beautiful, cool, and dew-soaked morning when the sun first starts to evaporate the water from the cypress trees and the air, the wet herbs and earth taking their last big drink of the day, and the light begins coaxing the trees to life; the warm afternoon when the growing heat of the day encourages the cypress trees and wildflowers to begin releasing their oils; and finally the beginning of the evening, after the heat has been its most oppressive, the aromatics of the hot trees and the warmed earth have given all that they have to give and all start winding down to the cool evening preparing to do it all again tomorrow. Maybe I'm aggrandizing this perfume a bit; I've always had a big soft spot for green perfumes centering around cypress, pine or the like - so a beautifully executed perfume like CdT is going to be an easy win for me. I can live with my bias, and I can certainly live the rest of my days with this perfume.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Cipresso di Toscana Acqua di Parma
review_content:
The Acqua di Parma line is new to me, having only recently sampled some of the cologne and EDT/EDP offerings, and overall it does feel like the ingredients are natural and high quality. Cipresso di Toscana is probably my favorite in the AdP lineup (I've still to sample the entire range). I liked Mirto di Panarea as well, which was my top choice from this house until today when I sampled CdT. CdT to my nose, has a dark/smoky tinge probably from the pine or cypress (not sure which, some other pine scents don't have the same smokiness) that reminds me of Mon Vetiver by Essential Parfums.
Overall, the scent is a 9/10, but the longevity and projection do fall short, which being an EDC, might not surprise anyone but I do kind of expect better performance if the prices are more like EDTs and EDPs.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Cipresso di Toscana Acqua di Parma
review_content:
On my person:
Opens very generic typical fresh shave aroma 🪒. 20min in it resembles a deodorant. 1hr in & it’s turning perfume’y.
I get absolutely Zero cypress, maybe a dash of pine in the opening seconds. Lavender is the main player here.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Cipresso di Toscana Acqua di Parma
review_content: Interesting opening.. initially I get hit with a blast of coriander seeds and cardamom.. this isn’t my favourite part of the scent journey. Get past this and the scent settles down to a stunning light summer fresh fragrance. Well blended and very natural smelling. I love this after about 20 min on the skin but my only issue is its performance. Definitely one for the wearer.. it’s sophisticated and will transport you to the Mediterranean coast. I imagine myself in an open shirt and linen shorts sipping on a Gin on Tonic whenever I wear it. One I’m glad to have in my collection even if I don’t gravitate to it as often as I should.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Cipresso di Toscana Acqua di Parma
review_content: the best of the line, and of course, that is why it is discontinued...

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Cipresso di Toscana Acqua di Parma
review_content: Nice woody scent, a bit citrusy and green also fresh. Very nice spring scent but not really for very hot weather it's more for 25° C. Great woody scent I like this but you have to let it macerate.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Cipresso di Toscana Acqua di Parma
review_content: Polo MR lite

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Cipresso di Toscana Acqua di Parma
review_content: This scent is absolutely divine! It's so fresh and herbal, with a really lovely woody undertone. I love the citrusy opening – it's bright and uplifting. It lasts all day on me too, which is a bonus.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Cipresso di Toscana Acqua di Parma
review_content:
This is 90% Alfred Sung Homme.

I have both, sprayed one on my left and the other on my right wrist, you won't be able to tell a difference.

Alfred Sung might be a little bit more soapy and heavy in the drydown than Acqua di Parma Cipresso di Toscana, that's why Acqua di Parma can be worn in the summer as it's lighter than ASH.

For longevity and sillage, well, Acqua di Parma is weak and intimate, where Alfred Sung Homme is an old money powerhouse fragrance.

Price - unfrotunately AdP is overpriced as hell for what is provides, you can find ASH $20 for 100ml, go figure...

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Cipresso di Toscana Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Green trees and Italian freshness. Not much needs to be said. If this sounds like your thing, give it a sample. I slightly agree with Polo Green and Halston Z14 comparisons.
7.9/10

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Cipresso di Toscana Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I have to say, I am quite disappointed with this one. Not a bad smell per se, but reminds me of the pharmacy bargain shelf shower gels etc. It’s generic and synthetic smelling. It’s not as complex as the listed notes would have you believe. I am sure maestro Duchaufour had a plan but the execution is sub par. Possibly poor quality ingredients. Or perhaps it just doesn’t like my skin… 3/10

I would happily trade the bottle I have (60ml remaining) for Jaipur EDP or something vintage

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Cipresso di Toscana Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Wow, not what I was expecting at all. This was the last in the Blu Mediterraneo line I sampled. That patchouli combined with the woods and cypress is just heavenly. I don't think anyone will agree with me, but the first thing I thought of when I smelled it was: 'Wow, this smells like Tom Ford's Tobacco Oud!'.

I find this not a summer fragrance at all, but man is it good. I kind of understand why this was discontinued as it doesn't fit the line at all, but I've always loved fragrances like this. It's very rough and surprises you with that blast of woods and green notes.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Cipresso di Toscana Acqua di Parma
review_content: On a sun-drenched morning in Tuscany, you walk through a quiet, winding path lined with tall cypress trees. The air is crisp and fresh, filled with the bright scent of orange and star anise, as the sunlight filters through the leaves. As the day warms, the earthy aromas of lavender and cypress rise from the trees, mixing with the soft breeze. By evening, as you rest near a rustic wooden bench, the grounding scent of pine and cashmere wood fills the air, capturing the essence of the tranquil countryside around you.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Cipresso di Toscana Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Described in one word: Crispy. I'm a big fan of fresh, summer ready fragrances that achieve light, invigorating profiles without relying heavily on the usual notes. Think citrus, colone, ambroxan, aquatic notes etc.

Cipresso di Toscana achieves freshness using tricks from the past, while managing to stay current enough. Freshness in the classical sense. Herbs, conifers, flowers, a freshness that is inspired by nature. I think this almost certainly features aromachemicals, but the overall feel and impression is a natural one. Seems like Acqua di Parma pulls this off pretty well across their line.

While it opens up with a piercing barbershop sharpness similar to Cerruti 1881, it quickly settles into a crispy green and invigorating heart that smooths out quickly. The cypress is there along with some other snappy green nuances, a little spice, and very blended floral lightness that exists without my nose picking up any obvious jasmine, lavender, or lily of the valley that's listed. If you despise flowers in your fragrance, the floral notes here shouldn't be a problem. I think they just provide a little lift and give an impression of "fresh air through the trees".

As it further dries down Cipresso reveals some of the slightly warmer base notes which maintain the natural theme. It does have a very slight hint of shaving cream, barbershop vibe in the base as well, but nothing like Azzaro PH or Drakkar. Also much sharper, and lighter in feeling than something like Z-14, which I like but reminds me of wood panel office parks in the 70s/80s. My gripe with some of older classic is they can feel muddy or dark brown in color, but Cipresso maintains a uplifting green presence. It doesn't scream 80's or Dad's aftershave to me, but then again I am a dad to-be in my 30s. So, take that with a grain of salt.

The base is very long lasting and warms up and darkens slightly, and sticks around as a closer to skin scent for a good 12 hours. The heart notes stick around too if you get some on fabric or your shirt collar. I think performance gripes here are a bit overstated, if you can make peace with the low to medium projecting scent. This is one of those weird ones that seems to wax and wane throughout the day, and almost gain strength as it sits on skin. I'll lose the scent sitting in place, but catch whiffs as I move through spaces or get active. I think any addition of fixatives would change this scent, and I'd much rather have this light and crisp profile than to have it end up a chemical mess on dry down.

In summary, I highly recommend this for fans of classic men's fragrances with a more natural and (slightly) updated feel. Cipresso is a bit more sober and serious. Yet the coniferous, gently spicy, and green notes give it a casual side that lends to evening and weekend wear as well. More versatile than some purely summer fragrances for these notes and the warmer/darker base notes that mix in. I'll be mixing this one into rotation throughout the year for when I want something mature and crisp, but not too conservative.

Did I mention it's crisp?

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Cipresso di Toscana Acqua di Parma
review_content: Discontinued for a good reason. This is a much "lesser" interpretation of the Italian cypress, compared to Tom Ford's Italian Cypress. The approach is similar yet the notes here are much less smoothly blended, a rough mix of pine needles and bitter herbs on a soapy base. Somehow the whole thing feels old-fashioned freshie but not in a good way, unlike the rest of the Blu line.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Cipresso di Toscana Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Cipresso di Parma by Acqua Di Parma was a fragrance I had to give a chance as I am a huge fan of the Blu Mediterraneo line and a discontinued fragrance from this collection piqued my interest. However, I feel like this fragrance while an odd one out from the line doesn't really smell as great as the others and I can understand why this fragrance was discontinued. This smells like walking through a forest and passing by different types of leaves and trees which some people may like but again I wouldn't prefer it to the others in the line. The lavender from this fragrance is what makes this fragrance stand out and is what makes this smell good overall but I feel as if the other notes feel artificial so it can be a 50/50 for some people when smelling it. You could also say that when you smell this fragrance it may smell like a grassy and empty field that reminds you of memories from visiting the park or garden from the instant combination of different greenery in this fragrance. Just like the other Blu Mediterraneo fragrance the price is pretty modest for a niche fragrance as I was able to get this for around $150 so it's a good intro to unique fragrances.

The longevity is a bit surprising as a summer EDT fragrance which usually doesn't last long however this fragrance lasts around 5 hours on my clothes and skin which is way more than what I expected from the start. The sillage is however very weak and I can only really smell this fragrance at a very close distance so nothing really surprising for its sillage. Overall this is an average fragrance with a hint of uniqueness with strong green notes and is a great introduction to new fragrance enthusiasts.

Scent: 6/10
Performance: 5/10
Longevity: 5/10
Sillage: 3/10
Price: 8/10
Blind Buy Safe: 6/10
Overall: 5/10

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Cipresso di Toscana Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I recently discovered this lovely gem.

It reminds me of scents like Halston Z-14 and Ralph Lauren Polo (Green). To me, there's something very nostalgic about it. I guess, the men around me when I was a child, back in the early 80's, smelled similar. Thus, this is my perception of what a real man is supposed to smell like and I love it. I feel, I gravitate more and more towards these old school type of fragrances.

I don't understand the criticism about the longevity. I've worn it a couple of times now and it lasts, especially on clothes. I sprayed it around 19 hours ago now and I can still smell it prominently on my shirt. The other day I sprayed it on my arm and also got a good 8 hours of a nice whiff now and again.

Such a shame that it's discontinued. You can still find it, but it's going and soon it'll just be another memory of how men used to smell...

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Cipresso di Toscana Acqua di Parma
review_content: Very nice, fresh green scent that is different. Unfortunately, the performance is very weak. Turned into a skin scent after about 15 minutes. Longevity was about 2 hours and it was gone. What's the point? I don't have any use for a perfume that's this weak. Perhaps useful as an aftershave, that's about it, or to freshen up your bed, pillow or linen closet. A shame because the scent itself is really nice.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Cipresso di Toscana Acqua di Parma
review_content: This should be called Basílico di Toscana because the basil is really prominent in this fragrance. I love the smell of basil but if you don’t like that smell I would suggest you sample it first

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Cipresso di Toscana Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I bought this since it was on sale.

I feel this like a modern interpretation of a barber shop and I wish we had more similar to this, because this is really good.
Longevity is in the ball park of 6-7 hours for me.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Cipresso di Toscana Acqua di Parma
review_content: Good for summertime casual wear, although the sillage is not so strong. I still love it though and always keep a bottle around.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Cipresso di Toscana Acqua di Parma
review_content: Discontinued!

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Cipresso di Toscana Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I remember when I first started collecting. I always liked cypress and pine as favorite notes. This was discontinued. Glad it's back!
It was a blind buy. I heard it had a lot of anise, which is often too sharp and bitter for my taste. I was glad at first impression, I got the anise, but it's perfectly blended with the citrus. It felt a bit peppery, like the Blenheim Bouquet structure of citrus, pepper, lavender, conifer.
A lot of cheepos have poor synthetic cypress. But the cypress and pine are quite good and recognizable. The cypress took some time to be really noticable, around the mid.
It's fresh and spicy in an Italian way perhaps.
Love the conifer base.
Will be best in Summer, but has good enough projection to be enjoyable in Winter.

Just a side note: Clive Christian Cypress, is the best quality, realistic cypress I have found.

PS: Just put it as my signature for Summer. It takes 15 minutes to settle to a harmonious fragrance of spicy, green, conifer fougere.
Fresh yet has warm spicy touches.

Rating: 8.25/10

God bless. John 3:16

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Cipresso di Toscana Acqua di Parma
review_content: @kristoferiskariot I'm guessing that the anisic note is the AdP basil. I love it.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Cipresso di Toscana Acqua di Parma
review_content: Very nice and clean piney scent. Performance is solid for an EDT. I got three sprays about 6 hours ago and is still going strong. I don't really get why people whine so much about ADP's performance. I have 7 and only one of them I would consider it "weak".

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Cipresso di Toscana Acqua di Parma
review_content: Big AdP fan normally, so was excited to get my sample in of this one, but someone in the comments here made the perfect association I couldn't quite put my finger on - there's strong Cool Water vibes from this one.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Cipresso di Toscana Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Cipresso di Toscana is an aromatic fougère, masculine and barbershop-like, but underwhelming. The green woody goodness I was expecting fades fast, leaving in its wake a generic, soapy aftershave.

CdT has a promising green opening, with a realistic pine accord and a strong lavender note - so far, so fougère. It is quite herbal here, and as it develops, a peppery undertone becomes evident, complementing the greenness and keeping things aromatic. Woody notes follow, a natural progression from the green opening.

However, this all happens very quickly, and after about half an hour, it fades to a musky, soapy, barely-there skin scent that isn't even that pleasant. Sillage is intimate and longevity is weak.

An aromatic, masculine-leaning freshie for hot weather, CdT shows promise initially but ultimately falls flat. Disappointing and definitely overpriced. 2/5.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Cipresso di Toscana Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Because it is 1 hour of bliss bathing in natural ingredients.
GET CLOSER TO THIS COMPANY.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Cipresso di Toscana Acqua di Parma
review_content: Why would you want to wear something like that when the longevity is 1 hour? It's a shame. STAY AWAY FROM THIS COMPANY.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Cipresso di Toscana Acqua di Parma
review_content: A beautiful green scent!

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Cipresso di Toscana Acqua di Parma
review_content: A beautiful fresh, green fragrance - the cypress note is obviously dominant, but it's not one dimensional or piney. The florals and citruses balance it out a bit so it's not too mature or barbershop-like, but still leans heavily masculine. It's more alpine forest to my nose than Tuscany, and if oversprayed perhaps a bit too heavy for summer, but looks like my next spring/autumn choice.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Cipresso di Toscana Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I have tested Acqua di Parma Cipresso di Toscana for a second time on paper, yesterday.
At the same time I tested Chanel Paris-Edimbourg, another Cipress based fragrance.

Curious thing: If I smell first Cipresso di Toscana and then Paris- Edimbourg, I am not able to smell the Chanel. If I smell
Paris- Edimbourg first, I still can smell the Acqua di Parma, which is stronger to my nose.
I have been on the fence with Cipresso di Toscana simply because the ratings on Fragrantica are lower but on paper it does pretty well. It's stronger than the Chanel and I also enjoy the scent more.
Furhermore the price for the Chanel has been increased this year from 83€ to 98€ for 50 ML.
Makes it an easy choice.

It will be my 15th Acqua di Parma. Just as many as I own from Chanel. Although I have finish and not replaced a 16th Chanel, being Bleu De Chanel EDP. So Chanel stays in pole position.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Cipresso di Toscana Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Highly disappointed. I was expecting a green/citrus freshie and what I got was soap, aftershave, old man DNA fougere. Not a bad fragrance, objectively, just definitely fits a certain demographic of man and that's not me.
The opening is sharp, piney, and VERY aftershavey; the dry down is more mellow oakmoss. The barbershop comparisons are apt; although "barbershop" can mean different things to different people. Bad blind buy unless you are an older gent and well acquainted with this type of genre. It's not a blue scent, and not something I think would have great sex appeal.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Cipresso di Toscana Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Different from the other ADP Blu lines...more woody, less citrusy. Instead of a refreshing citrus scent walking along the mediterranean coast, this is like that same area but further in walking amongst the cypress trees. Invigorating, brisk, and refreshing. I'd say it's more of a test before buy ADP Blu line than the others, but it's still very pleasant.

Very natural and high quality which is what i love about ADP Blu...ok longevity and modest sillage. A great pick me up before heading out for a nice walk through the woods.

Scent: 8 / Longevity: 7 / Sillage: 7

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Cipresso di Toscana Acqua di Parma
review_content: Holy Star Anise!!! Why is this note not listed? This is the most dominate note, and it’s beautful with the cypress. Beautiful fragrance, very well blended and reminiscent of Tuscany.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Cipresso di Toscana Acqua di Parma
review_content: This is a beautiful scent, but I think it is more appreciable if you've ever spent any time in Tuscany, and I say this for a reason. AdPs Blu Mediterraneo line first came out while I was living in a small town in Tuscany. As a fan of this house, I immediately investigated the new line at a local boutique, and Tuscan Cypress resonated with me greatly. It was EXACTLY the scent of the town I'd been living in and what I loved so much about the "air" and atmosphere around me. I purchased two bottles right away, and over the years, it became harder to find. I have a few from this collection, but CdT is my favorite. During my time in Italy, I traveled to many regions and towns throughout the country, and Blu Mediterraneo does an excellent job in capturing the "essence" and vibe of each of the locations in its lineup both through using extraits indigenous to those regions and in transporting you there, yourself. Magical.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Cipresso di Toscana Acqua di Parma
review_content: My fave blue bottle from AdP. Love this.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Cipresso di Toscana Acqua di Parma
review_content: I wasn’t a huge fan of this one. It reminded me a lot of Montblanc Presence actually. Presence smells good but not really my cup of tea (very shaving foam-like, nice smell but not as a frag) so I didn’t wear it much. Smelling side by side though, Presence actually smells better. They are quite similar but the Acqua di Parma was a little on the harsh side, and Presence more smooth. It lasted a very long time on clothes though, so if you like this ADP you’ll be happy with the performance.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Cipresso di Toscana Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Acqua di Parma Cipresso di Toscana...


...is my journey from Salsomaggiore Terme to Firenze in scent form.
It reflects the hilly italian countryside perfectly with all it's herbal green and woody whafts of goodness with the mediterranean see poking through with some blue freshness every now and then.
It is a very natural interpretation of a good herbal and woody scent.
I personally don't understand how some people label this as dated because time and scents are impossible to combine.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Cipresso di Toscana Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Cypress is definitely a misrepresented note, fragrances like Encre Noire, Chanel Sycomore (both of which I love) have equated dry rooty earthy vetiver with cypress which it really doesn’t even remotely smell like.

Smelling the natural extract it smells intensely aromatic, not dark but rather dry, cold, and green, not even remotely similar to vetiver.
This is one of the few cypress fragrances which portray cypress spot on.
The base is distinctly barbershop though which may limit your enjoyment.
In terms of authenticity it is stellar, overall though it is a bit mature and old school. Nonetheless one of the good offerings from the house

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Cipresso di Toscana Acqua di Parma
review_content: A fougere that drys down to a green coolwater. Strangely, also has Dior Elixir vibes (old school barber shop fougere).

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Cipresso di Toscana Acqua di Parma
review_content: I blind bought that one thinking it would be fresh and deep. Instead, the notes together make me sick. I tried few times on my skin and on my husband s skin and I feel nauseous anytime. Not for me at all. I have a full bottle to give away.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Cipresso di Toscana Acqua di Parma
review_content: This fragrance and its name evoke the magnificence of the Sienese countryside that I love so much, with its gentle hills, the exterminating well-tended, very green countryside, its magnificent and luxuriant fragrant gardens. This masterful triumph of aromatic assonances of sage and rosemary, combined with the lively notes of petitgrain and star anise that the olfactory pyramid of fragrantica does not report, but is felt very well. The herbaceous freshness, the vivid citrus notes of grapefruit, the boise base, an intensely balsamic allure of cypress and pine. A fresh, restorative, balsamic, relaxing fragrance. Rightly unisex.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Cipresso di Toscana Acqua di Parma
review_content:
This fragrance is a bit of a departure from most of the other ADP Blue offerings (almost all of which I have really enjoyed). I've worn it several times now and every time I spray it I have an initial blast of piney loveliness followed by a perfectly pleasant but very familiar lasting aromatic, sweet, woody smell which gives me strong flashbacks to teenage changing rooms in the '90s. To me this smells very similar indeed to a Lynx (or Axe for those outside the UK/Oz/NZ) body spray, it's been too long for me to put my finger on precisely which one, possibly Java? Tempest? Nevada? Mirage? Maybe Apollo? it's 100% one those old ones from the '90s. I searched to see if anyone else has made this connection but it seems to just be me so take all of this with a pinch of salt but I swear it's very similar.

This is not really a criticism, the smell is nice, especially after a few hours when it's settled down but the familiarity for me is so strong that it feels positively retro whenever I wear it and I worry that if I ran into an old school-friend they'd think I'd been hoarding discontinued Lynx products all these years.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Cipresso di Toscana Acqua di Parma
review_content: Incarnation of cacharel pour homme. I paid 10e for cacharel pH, i don't think i overpaid. When i smelled the dry down of this ADP CDT i realized i got a bargain in cacharel.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Cipresso di Toscana Acqua di Parma
review_content: What a disappointment for me. That dreadful anise note combined with pine upsets my stomach to a point that makes me sick. Prefer the Bergamotto di Calabria much much better.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Cipresso di Toscana Acqua di Parma
review_content: I have a small sample, rather old, 2011 or around. When I tested it then, I found it too strong, very piney and a bit harsh and put it away. I picked it up again now and the strong piney beginning is softer, topnotes softened or partly vanished because of age maybe? The drydown is fabulous and I know why I find it so. It is the oakmoss. Oh my, soo good. I wonder if it is still there in current wersion?

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Cipresso di Toscana Acqua di Parma
review_content: Just another ADP scent that smells like barbershop.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Cipresso di Toscana Acqua di Parma
review_content: It would have been the perfect woody fresh scent, but the cardamom ruins it for me. Gave to my husband, and the cardamom doesn't bother me as much when I smell it on him. Lesson learnt though-don't buy anything with cardamom listed as a note.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Cipresso di Toscana Acqua di Parma
review_content:
My absolute favourite from entire AdP.
While im lying on hammock, the smells of thick pines and cypress comes thru the wind.
Deeply aromatic, powdery, clean and manly.
Somehow classic, but not in the old school way.
Perfect all arounder.
Hands down mr.Duchaufour.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Cipresso di Toscana Acqua di Parma
review_content: Green herbs and pine, very masculine.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Cipresso di Toscana Acqua di Parma
