review_content: I really like this one. I can't help but to compare this to Suavage Elixir--the dry down has a very similar vibe. I think it's the combination of the anise/anethole and the other green notes.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Cipresso di Toscana Acqua di Parma
review_content: Most of this line are great value solely due to the quality of materials. Phot realistic and mouth watering. Not usually projectors or long lived, but if you got the dough, these are worth it.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Cipresso di Toscana Acqua di Parma
review_content: i blind bought it because of the blue bottle. I thought it would be aquatic fresh perfume. Alas, it is a green, spicy perfume that is not to my taste. however, i give it to my man who suited this kind of scent and he love it.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Cipresso di Toscana Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Acqua di Parma Cipress di Toscana has a very sharp and penetrating opening with a strong initial sillage. The opening gives you pine, cypress, petitgrain, a hint of lavender, a greenish tinge that feels close to sage, and something a little spicier as well as a hint of citrus that feels half way between orange and lemon and grapefruit. The petitgrain and pine combination can be a little headachy for me, but then petitgrain and I tend not to get on very well together. The licorice note (star anise) gradually comes through very gently but with increasing presence in the first hour. There's a sort of thin lemon incense feel in the first hour which I presume is the elemi in the background. In the opening hour Cipresso di Toscana feels like a much sharper, much more aggressive version of Tom Ford's Italian Cypress.

Two hours in and Cipresso di Toscana has settled down into a nicer blend, softer, more subtle, and with a correspondingly reduced sillage. There's not a massive development from this point onwards. By five and a half hours in the petitgrain headaches have gone and the scent is a little softer again but it feels more of an okay than a like to me. It's perfectly fine in that there's nothing wrong with it but it's just not good enough to dislodge the likes of similar perfumes (Tom Ford's Italian Cypress, Floris 1962, Acqua di Parma's Chinotto di Liguria) from my preferences among aromatic scents, especially those with leading themes of cypress or pine. By this stage it's just a skin scent but it really sticks to my shirt sleeves.

Six and half hours in the perfume has become a little sweeter. The lavender is more prominent and there's something else green and something a touch sweeter. The fading process is well underway but it really hangs in there - I get about twelve hours from it so if you want durability you certainly get it here by the bucket load!

I think Cipresso di Toscana is one of those perfumes that works at any time of the year but I'd favour it during the early autumn and spring with the cool morning air that warms up. Despite my disagreement with the petitgrain I can appreciate it's an elegant scent. But I think there are one or two which do the cypress - pine - aromatic better.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Cipresso di Toscana Acqua di Parma
review_content: If you crush cypress needles between your fingers and smell them, that's exactly what this smells like. You get no more and no less. Would work great as an everyday scent if you're just feeling casual and cool but won't be a compliment machine, IMO.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Cipresso di Toscana Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Brilliant stuff from ADP. A clean, piney top with the characteristic soapiness in the drydown.
I have no idea where fragrantica got their fictional note list from. According to ADP’s website, the notes for this fragrance are:

Top: orange, elemi, star anise
Mid: lavandin, clary sage, petit grain
Base: cypress, pine needles, fir balsam

The longevity is solid with this one, more so than others in the Blu Mediterrano line. Cipresso's piny qualities are quite different than other masculine pines like Polo, Quorum, One Man Show, etc. Do not be quick to dismiss it if you haven't cared for piney scents before-this is all done with debonair nonchalance, as if the fragrance is carried to you on the breeze rather than condensing thick in a murky miasma in a coniferous bog. A perfect summer woody scent.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Cipresso di Toscana Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Imagine being high in the Alps, in a pine forest surrounded by wildflowers. This is what it smells like! Pine, cypress, with notes of lavender and jasmine. It’s a little citrusy but it’s very light.

Like all other fragrances from the Blu Mediteraneo collection, the sillage is too intimate and the longevity is at most of 3 hours. It’s a much more masculine scent but I believe the flowers and citrus make it unisex.

7/10, that’s my rating for it!

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Cipresso di Toscana Acqua di Parma
review_content: Have a tester/ sample of this. I tend to really like ADP and I also enjoy cypress and pine notes. I think this is classy and not attention seeking. Would definitely wear this in Summer

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Cipresso di Toscana Acqua di Parma
review_content:
What a disappointment this is, smells like a cheap and mainstream aftershave that can be found at every supermarket. Or just imagine what a locker room would smell like.
I would say don't even bother trying it. Annoyingly mediocre and completely dull. There is also a headache inducing note.

5/10

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Cipresso di Toscana Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Mature, elegant, old-school classy.

Im Italian irl and this smells Italian, but not sure in the best way. This scent is before the 1970's boozy era of frags, so im getting a classy semi-wealthy enjoying life as a financially free man of the 1960's.

Its good, buuuuuut, it's not going to garner you any compliments in 2020, it smells like an older gents skin DNA, you know when a guy wears a cologne for decades and it just melds with his natural body scent (like my dad...lol may he rip). It gives off a light yet rich barbershop/soapy scent + a lil dry small florals in the mid notes.

I think you'd need to be in the right situation to wear this, im thinking while on vacation in Italy, driving a convertible from town to town with your sunglasses on and the wind blowing through your hair vibe. It's dated, yet, kindly beautiful. I'd recommend 'Sedley' from PDM as a superior frag in this genre.

*Edit: End Dry-off has a soft bugspray scent from one or some of the natural ingredients. Id say this is a 'no-buy!'

2/5 Woofs

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Cipresso di Toscana Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Currently making my way through my first batch of fragrance discovery sets and I also got Blu Mediterraneo samples intrigued by a couple of influencers... Safe to say I'll be bying a full size of at least three of the scents.

Cipresso Di Toscana was one of the first I tried and it was not an immediate love. The first time I sprayed it on it was on a very hot day and the scent simply didn't stick well with my skin. The next time it was a totally different story. While I couldn't smell much of the citrus, the cypress was obvious from the get-go. As time went by, a smoky note came through and stayed for the rest of the wear. This is one of the most long-lasting in the line, a good 3-4 hours.

It's a beautiful autumn-winter scent for me. Not too dark, but serious and deep.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Cipresso di Toscana Acqua di Parma
review_content: So, unfortunatly, I don't really get any cypress. I was hopping for a more mature Gucci Sport, but have received a less sharp Platinum Egoiste. Still a nice scent, but nothing to Dow ith cypress, at least on me :(

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Cipresso di Toscana Acqua di Parma
review_content:
This unisex scent leans very masculine on me. It's spicy and sharp with conifer notes. This scent is dark green.

There is something very calming and serene about this fragrance that reminds me of cloud-soft over-sized hoodies, holding a cup of coffee or hot tea with both hands, and reading a book by the fireplace in winter (though I think this fragrance can work in any season).

I really like it a lot, but would like it so much more on a man. If I smelled a man wearing this, I would be very attracted to the fragrance and I might even start a conversation with him. It would definitely be catching for me.

Unfortunately, silage for me is very soft. I ended up spraying it on my shirt to correct this and it projected much better. Longevity is moderate.

Definitely a safe blind buy for men unless one wants to test the silage first. Try before you buy for women.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Cipresso di Toscana Acqua di Parma
review_content: Went to buy Mirto Di Panarea (and I did), also sprayed Cipresso di Toscana on paper. It smelled nice, so got this one too. But after wearing it couple of times, I'm kinda disappointed. It's somehow very weak on my skin. I feel heavy liquid on the skin, the smell is there, but it's somehow subdued, faint. Doesn't seem to project at all. Or my nose is broken, one or the other.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Cipresso di Toscana Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Blind-bought a 30ml bottle after everything i've heard about it. It's a safe blind buy for men. It smells simple and green. Doesn't smell like a fragrance. Just green cypress plain and simple that doesn't develope at all. Is the type that you you don't need to like, but it's impossible to dislike it. Quite boring, but that's what i was after. Have a scent in Your Collection that is completely safe and just smells refreshing like the smell of a forrest breeze where you can smell the moss and leaves from the trees. That is exactly what this is. The refreshing, yet the dry, slightly powdery nature of the forrest.

A dumb reach that's easy to wear everywhere at any time.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Cipresso di Toscana Acqua di Parma
review_content: A beautiful aromatic fougere-style fragrance that reminds me strongly of the sorely missed Insensé, maybe due to the deft marriage of citrus, floral and conifer notes. Great balance, performance and quality. Sb's mentioned similarity to Platinum Egoiste and I can definitely see it too, especially in the modern and slightly metallic barbershop opening, though Cipresso, to me, sits closer to nature. And I like it a lot.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Cipresso di Toscana Acqua di Parma
review_content: I have no idea why, but all I really got was soap, soap, and more soap. Had to wash this off after an hour, cuz it never really morphed into anything I could remotely like.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Cipresso di Toscana Acqua di Parma
review_content: The best of the Blu line, ever. So happy to see it re-released!

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Cipresso di Toscana Acqua di Parma
review_content: I've had a bottle of the post-relaunch perfume for about 2 weeks now, and I'm very satisfied. It's still the same Cipresso di Toscana, and it's beautiful. Some friends of mine describe it as a barbershop fragrance, and there are certainly people who think it's nothing special; yes, it's an aromatic fougere and it smells like the 1980s. However, it's everything people wished they had back then. I think Bertrand Duchaufour took an old style and created something that would have been the envy of his colleagues back in 1985. When I smell Cool Water, it's dull, but Cipresso di Toscana is happiness. It has elements of the sea and the pines lining the coast. It's inspired by Italy, but it reminds me of the beaches of Virginia, where I'd go every summer as a boy. Pines grow on the barrier islands, so pine naturally goes with marine notes to create a seashore complex. This fragrance transports me back to that time in my life.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Cipresso di Toscana Acqua di Parma
review_content:
They must have released this again. I have a cool little sample (1.2ml/0.04oz). I was only going to wear this during winter, as the smell is kind of dense. But after reading other reviews I think I'll save a bit to try in the summer. I'll add it to my review if I ever do that.

This is the description on the sample card:
An intense and aromatic scent. Fresh notes of sage and rosemary embrace the lively scents of star anise and petit-grain, together with a balsamic cypress and pine base.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Cipresso di Toscana Acqua di Parma
review_content:
So I hear they are re releasing the best of the line, with ADP ginepro right beside it. Im sorry this stuff blows the whole line out of the water as a man speaking. Its indescrible if your trying to compared this to another scent. Its that unique. A balance of every scent, Citrus-Flower-spice and woods.

What site is this on, as of 5/2019???

Straight masculine to my nose, not unisex. I remember where I first sprayed this scent on at Neiman Marcus back in the early 2000s, I then walk in Macys and Dillards an ask the sales women to sniff my arm. They look they had on there face was priceless. " Whoa What is that, we definately dont sale that kind of fragrance here"???!! The perfumer Bertand D was in a category of his on with this one. A Masterpiece. Try or buy it

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Cipresso di Toscana Acqua di Parma
review_content: This has been relaunched now... still smells like before and it's my favorite from the blue bottles line.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Cipresso di Toscana Acqua di Parma
review_content: One statement " CLASSIC, Cant stop sniffing it and Head turner", Man this stuff is awesome and intoxicating, forget it being unisex, this is MASCULINE at its best. even after 13 years since the release. I came back to review this because it reminds me of colognes I just got this year 2018, ADP Ginepro and Tom Ford Fougere Argent. How the hell did they discontinue this??? If you can find a sample or the original buy it you'll see what im talking about. Acqua Di parma masters of perfumery

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Cipresso di Toscana Acqua di Parma
review_content:
To me, as a women, Cipresso di Toscana feels like an olfactory equivalent of boyfriend jeans (which are no favorite of mine, but that's not the point I want to make).
This is unisex and has notes that are typically used in male fragrances. But they're blended into something smooth, light and slightly sweet that would never feel like I've doused myself in my boyfriend's cologne. It feels soothing and natural. So, it's easy to wear even for women who don't usually like masculine scents, but I could imagine that it also smells very nice on men.

This has nice aromatic notes. A coniferous opening, lavender, fresh herbs and spices. Later in the drydown it's a bit woody. I'm kind of surprised there is not a single sweeter note listed, maybe it's just my skin, but on me the base definitely smells a bit vanillic and warm besides the refreshing and herbal notes.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Cipresso di Toscana Acqua di Parma
review_content: This has NOTHING to do with Chanel Egoiste Plat. Please. Wonderful fragrance and It will be re-launched soon as per ADP sales associate. Good news !

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Cipresso di Toscana Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Perfect fresh and masculen scent. Its kind of chanel egoist platinum but Toscana is more natural. Cypress and levander top and bottom notes. There are not many examples similar scent like this. Therefore if you want to fresh and everyone likes, you can buy this absolutely. Longevity quite poor unfortunately.
If you want more longevity you selection must be chanel egoist platinum.


Scent: 9/10
Long: 6/10
Sillage: 7/10

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Cipresso di Toscana Acqua di Parma
review_content: This was my first Acqua di Parma, and still the only one I own a full bottle. I remember that first I wished it could be a bit less bold on aplication, but I don't mind it anymore, the scent isn't actually heavy in anyway. I like the green tone of it, feels natural to me and with a good balance of those green notes, which are of my liking. Unfortunatelly, has an average longevity, around 4 hs and then becomes essentially a skin scent. No doubt is the most masculine Blue Mediterraneo I know. Discontinued by now ":¬/.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Cipresso di Toscana Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I've tried the majority of the Blu Mediterraneo line by now, and so far there hasn't been a single one I didn't at least like. Cipresso di Toscana is no exception: it's great, very natural-smellig, more aromatic and herbal than woody, even a bit spicy as it dries down. Actually quite succesful in evoking a hot summer's day in a coniferous forest full of herbs!

There's only one problem, which isn't really a problem since it's been discontinued, more like a relief: it's not quite unisex enough for my taste. Of course there's no gender to smells, and I only really dislike uber-masculine fragrances with their macho in-your-face vibe, which this one definitely isn't guilty of: it's rather subtle, and very nice. But it is does lean more towards the clasically masculine, which means I think I'd appreciate this more on somebody else than on myself.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Cipresso di Toscana Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Smell 8/10
Longevity 2/10
Sillage 2/10
Overall 4/10

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Cipresso di Toscana Acqua di Parma
review_content: I recall this being very weak, but I wanted to give it a fair shake again. Initially, I'm getting a lot of coniferous notes, but it's been sweetened and tamed by the addition of fruity notes that seem all too reminiscent of men's designer fruit fragrances. Even a bit of the old dreaded melon is here, and our old friend the Curve ass-leather note, all over synthetic woods. This is very disappointing, and to me seems very uncharacteristic of a respected niche line like AdP (not that any of their others have impressed me very much!). As the base approaches, I'm presented with the same cheap cherry/wood scent as the new version of Dunhill, which to me just feels like an easy cop-out. The sweetness isn't strong, but it's too full of fruits and honey, and ends up being no better than what you'd find in a run-of-the-mill designer scent. It has a bit of the "moneyed" vibe that their Colonia Intensa has, and that helps a bit, but overall I just don't find it to be worth the niche price or the niche brand. Geir does it better, and stronger. Looks like I better move on to their Fig one!

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Cipresso di Toscana Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Having sprayed it first, it really smells masculine, but in a beautiful fresh just-out-of shower way. I detect pine, citrus and rosemary, and yes, perhaps the very first impression is shaving foam.H However, after just a few minutes it transforms into a cloud that can be described as aromatic awesomeness of herbs and salty seawater with a bit of a barber vibe.

Although pine and cypress are still there, they form the canvas instead of dominating. I detect lavender and rosemary, sage, perhaps a little coriander, but no cardamom or flowers. CdT is on the juicy side, I wouldn't say its a dry pine scent. and it is very aromatic, warm and smooth, hides under your skin and blends with your natural skin scent.

When its settles further, i detect more cypress as well as vetiver and patchouli base, so it does tick all the boxes for me. At the same time I admit, CdT leans more masculine. Stays close to the skin, but staying power is good for summer EdT,4 h aromatic bliss.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Cipresso di Toscana Acqua di Parma
review_content: Complex and simple at the same time. Beautifully composed mix of intoxicating cypress, citrus & dry herbs. This fragrance has natural, earthy feel to it. I think it is more on a masculine side though. Love it!

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Cipresso di Toscana Acqua di Parma
review_content: I heard it's discontinued. Really difficult to understand. What a pity.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Cipresso di Toscana Acqua di Parma
review_content: It's hard to believe that this has been discontinued. I saw a few bottles for sale about 6 months ago, and now I wish I had taken action and bought one then. This perfume reminds me of growing up in the late 80s and early 90s. I was still a boy, my olfactory receptors were brand new, and everything smelled interesting. I typically hate these sporty, soapy fragrances, but there's something special about this one. May the house of Acqua di Parma be destroyed for discontinuing it! Bastards!

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Cipresso di Toscana Acqua di Parma
review_content: Definitely on the masculine side of unisex. I think I'd like it on a man, but it's a little too coniferous for me.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Cipresso di Toscana Acqua di Parma
review_content:
This was my favourite in the Blu Mediterraneo line, but by the looks of it, it's discontinued?

Great, great summer scent.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Cipresso di Toscana Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Fantastic cypress smell with herbs. I've been grown up in a country where cypress is very common and indeed, the smell of this fragrance gives this smell of air passing through cypress.
I consider it a very nice and natural smelling perfume. The longevity is so and so according to others but i'm not in a position to determine this now. Definitely, a perfume for summer first and all year round for those who do not like heavy artilery perfumes.
I cant see a woman wearing this as the odour of cypress is more or less, masculine...and this is it! it is a masculine perfume for men that reminds pino sylvestre somehow but CDT is much more quality fragrance. These that wear pino sylvestre, should try this, it goes in the same way.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Cipresso di Toscana Acqua di Parma
review_content: This is one of my favorites. Complex, yet fresh, invigorating and a bit sporty. I have not seen it in the shelves anymore, the design of the bottles of the "blue line" has changed. Is this really discontinued? What a shame if it is!

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Cipresso di Toscana Acqua di Parma
review_content: CIPRESSO DI TOSCANA its the best one from the blu line !! a sophisticated an masculine cologne that goes perfect for the fall an winter seasons it makes you feel like your standing in the mountains of tuscany feeling the breeze of grapefruit notes blended with pine cypress an lavender this is a cologne that makes you stand out from the rest an will get you compliments,,one of the top ones in my list.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Cipresso di Toscana Acqua di Parma
review_content: Very sharp cypress/pine/conifer scent. Doesn't last very long, but if you love pine smells, then this is even pinier than Pino Silvestre. As for me, I'm very finicky about coniferous fragrances unless they're done a certain way, so this one doesn't really work for me. It's not terrible, though.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Cipresso di Toscana Acqua di Parma
review_content: I have heard that this is being discontinued. Please, someone, tell me this isn't true as it is one of my signature scents - or tell me where I can still get it!

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Cipresso di Toscana Acqua di Parma
review_content: I like this scent because it smells so natural and so real. It smells just like cypress trees, and if you really inhale deeply into your skin, you should be able to smell some soft florals and aromatics, but they are disguised so well that this easily passes as a unisex fragrance. My concern with it is that trees sometimes give off a faint scent that reminds me of body odor. Like I said, this fragrance smells very natural...maybe a tad too much for me...but I'm debating it and want to test it again.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Cipresso di Toscana Acqua di Parma
review_content: This is a nice citrusy scent that seems genuine. For me citrus isn't the right thing but this scent at least is really nice. It's not like a house cleaner or toilet spray but really like you expect a scent with cypress to smell.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Cipresso di Toscana Acqua di Parma
review_content: This does not smell very impressive in the bottle but amazing on. Like a freshly showered well-groomed man who has just brushed his teeth. It's classy, refined, complex, minty, and clean. Yum.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Cipresso di Toscana Acqua di Parma
review_content:
This is not one of the best Duchafour's creations but I like it anyway. The opening is tremendously green and crispy, in a very good way to my nose. Invigorating, fresh and almost intoxicating. It evolves right away into a very clean and tonic summer/day fragrance with basil, musc and pine. I live in Tuscany where we have Cypress as our regional Tree and I can say TC evocates perfectly the countryside landscapes of my region. I agree with some other reviewers who says it gets a bit "perfumery" in the drydown, but nothing disturbing or changing the idea I have about TC. A gentle, clean scent and a good alternative to anonimous aquas.

Rating: 7.5-8/10

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Cipresso di Toscana Acqua di Parma
review_content:
This is the least favourite of Acqua di Parma. I agree with sf2explus that it smells like shaving foam.
I think that its more suitable for men than women. It is not offensive and I am not dying to scrub it off, but it just doesn't get me excited.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Cipresso di Toscana Acqua di Parma
review_content:
When in search of a Summer scent, the contents of these sea-blue bottles seem to be just what you've been looking for.

I almost wrote off Cipresso di Toscana based upon the opening, which to my nose was a typical citrusy lemon and grapefruit fragrance with not much depth. However once settled, this fragrance transformed into something in which its beauty is difficult to describe.

The scent is warm, somewhat herbaceous, sweet, soothing and woodsy. The citruses vanish in a matter of seconds when applied to the skin, making way for a beautiful blend of lavender, pine, jasmine, cypress and patchouli.

Cipresso di Toscana is distinctively unisex, there is enough versatility for this to wear well on both men and women. Some say that this fragrance reminds them of nature and the Mediterranean. I've personally never ventured there, however I do feel as if this fragrance transports me to a picturesque island covered in pine trees, exotic flora and surrounded by clear, sparkling blue seas.

I find this fragrance to be very complex, hence the reason why I enjoy it so much. The absence of harsh citrus and strong fruity accords, places this fragrance in a unique category for a Summer scent.

This fragrance lasted a great while on my skin, and not for one second did I consider this fragrance too masculine for my tastes.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Cipresso di Toscana Acqua di Parma
review_content: I have the image of greek summer by smelling this stuff.Passing through the beautiful pine trees with the car and smelling the divine aromas coming from the forrest along with the beautiful sea breeze.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Cipresso di Toscana Acqua di Parma
review_content: Have read many reviews that complain about the longevity of the Blu Mediterraneo line (not here though)... and my own experience is that I keep forgetting I'm wearing it until I move and then the scent floats up and reminds me... gently, as though it had to catch up to me and nudge me. Makes me smile and lasts a good long while (the entire work day for me.)

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Cipresso di Toscana Acqua di Parma
review_content: Sea water..the first sensation at very first sprinkle is of sea water! I love how Acuqa di Parma has such natural tendencies ( in the only 2 that I have tested). Another enjoyeable facet of this perfume is that the florals are just enough, never too forward or sweet, and there are so many individually distinguishable notes-and so many perfectly blended and meshed combinations of scents here. I do love unisex perfumes, this one leans towards masculine. I think it is the lavender, sage, petit grain, all combining together, and then, the added zing of pine and sometimes cypress, that makes it so manly. However, the cardamon here is not so strong, neither the patchouli. The sillage is medium to high, the lasting power is long and excellent. (The spicy notes last forever during the dry down). Highly enjoyable, leafy, herbal, fresh, a bit of a voyage in a bottle.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Cipresso di Toscana Acqua di Parma
review_content: This is a fresh, herbal unisex fragrance and was gentler than I expected. The cypress scent is subtle, and while first, that disappointed me (love the in your face cypress of Tom Ford's new cypress), the lovely basil and trace of jasmine won me over. This would probably be a great shower gel too.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Cipresso di Toscana Acqua di Parma
review_content: This is very nice soft cologne. At first it's very like shaving foam kinda smell (more masculine) on me (Very nice and refreshing). But it changes fast and leaves aroma of definitely pines with some flowers and weeds. It makes me think of beach at first. Later it reminds me of park in a small city where cypresses grow. After 2 hours I can detect lavender pretty good. It's refreshing and calming. In dry down I also feel cypress (We have those around here, I remember I used to rub and smell it) there with pines. Lasting power is awesome for edt. Bottle color and look is absolutely one of my favs. I was craving to try those, but didn't know we had them in store. We have, but unfortunately only this one.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Cipresso di Toscana Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Green and fresh fragance in which I get the notes of pinetree, lavender, cypress, vetiver and cedar.
This is a good scent for women and men, but I think there is something traditionally masculine in it.
Given that I enjoy woody fragances a lot, I could wear it easily in spring and summer, but I don't decide it it's full bottle worthy or if I could pass with some samples.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Cipresso di Toscana Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Blue Mediterraneo collection from AdP is a collection where the ingredients are a combination between "essences and emotions, awaking a pleasant feeling of well-being."

Recently added to my collection, Cipresso di Toscana is a fragrance that is invigorating to the scenses.

This is a beautiful blend of green notes: clary sage, basil, pine w/floral notes of lavender & jasmine. As this fragrance warms down, the cypress, pine & cedar notes develope nicely.

If this is what the gentle rolling hills of Tuscany smell like, I will need to plan my next escape there (in time).

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Cipresso di Toscana Acqua di Parma
review_content:
To me this is the essence of nature, or at least a essence of the forrest. I have not had the luck to go to Toscana to smell the Cypress, but you can find some of these plants in the Norwegian flora too, that's why I think of the forrest (in summertime). With all aromas from treas and flowers floating in the air..

I would love to wear this one, but even more I would love to smell it on a man. Is a wonderful fragrance, with only natural notes.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Cipresso di Toscana Acqua di Parma
review_content: what a beautiful fragrance...at first spritz i thought definetly more of a masculine smell but then as it dried down a very comforting warm fragrance. quite lovely and sophisticated.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Blu Mediterraneo - Cipresso di Toscana Acqua di Parma
review_content: When I put this fragrance on, my partner and I were trying to figure out what two fragrances this reminded us of. It is a perfect blend of Prada: Infusion d'Iris + Acqua Di Parma Colonia Absoluta. If I did not already own those two, this fragrance would be one I would be purchasing.

product_name: Sakura Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Definitely more masculine leaning.
All I get hit with initially is pepper . I don't detect any citrus at all.
Initially = a pepper bomb
Dry down = very floral with pepper undertones
The cherry blossom is strong in the dry down.

Longevity is poor and siliage is almost non existent

product_name: Sakura Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content: It smells sharp and rotten fish

product_name: Sakura Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content:
An Italian scooper going down the road, the wind blows in your face.


Pros: Sakura flowers note recreated in a soft way and a little Citrus. Two thumbs up.

product_name: Sakura Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I really enjoy this. Some cherry blossoms can skew too fruity and reminiscent of "body spray" and thus unsophisticated. This leans much more floral and "perfumey" and musk (the very clean variety) rounds it out and fortifies the other notes; that is, it doesn't overtake, rather it does a solid job as a base note. There is prominent bergamot too - a note I love - it lends an optimistic yet elegantly bright facet to this predominantly cherry blossom fragrance while the jasmine is subtly noticeable as it settles into the skin.

It's very bright and uplifting with a definitive spring vibe, but it is neither a freshie not a fleeting floral: there is substance to it. However, like many of this range, it's neither a powerhouse nor does it stick around for more than a few hours (I wonder if it comes in travel spray form). While it's here though, it's lovely and makes for a perfect spring scent that I'd love wearing for lunch dates with friends or during daytime on a mini-break. 4/5.

product_name: Sakura Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content: Last week at an airport, right after purchasing Jo Malone's Wood Sage & Sea Salt, I smelled Sakura Eau de Parfum and instantly fell in love. I am not usually very into floral fragrances but this triggered something in my memory... it felt like home. It is a very comforting scent and very unisex in my opinion. The bergamot and mandarin blend beautifully with the cherry blossom, and don't even get me started with the musk. I found it irresistible. After my initial purchase at Jo Malone, I was given a 15% discount in any other product I wanted so I didn't think twice and bought Sakura. I've been wearing both together every day and truly feel more myself than with any other fragrance I've owned. I've read some people say it doesn't last very long on them and for me this is not the case. It is definitely not a beast projector, but it stays on my skin all day. It leaves a nice trail as well, very inoffensive but will have people following you. 3 people at my office complimented me and my dad who is usually into very masculine fragrances said I smelled amazing. I look forward to spritzing myself with this masterpiece every morning.

product_name: Sakura Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content: LANVIN ECLAT D’ARPEGE??? Very light, girly and innocent . Heavy bottle with black elements is very confusing. It should be yellow and pink with rhinestones :))

product_name: Sakura Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content: Lost Cherry by Tom Ford with less cherry and more flowers. More in the line of a classic feminie floral perfume . Good sillage and longevity. Beautiful light sweetness.

product_name: Sakura Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content: I'm a dude and love this #dudeflowerpower

product_name: Sakura Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Sakura Eau de Parfum by Acqua di Parma is a beautiful fragrance inspired by the delicate cherry blossom. It captures the essence of spring with its fresh and floral notes.

Sakura Eau de Parfum by Acqua di Parma is like a breath of fresh air with its vibrant and uplifting scent. The fragrance opens with the zesty and citrusy notes of Bergamot and Mandarin Orange, which instantly invigorates the senses. Then, the delicate and floral aroma of Cherry Blossom takes center stage, creating a soft and romantic atmosphere. The fragrance is further enhanced by the subtle sweetness of jasmine, adding a touch of elegance. Finally, it settles into a cozy and comforting base of musk. Overall, it's a beautiful composition that embodies the beauty and grace of Cherry Blossoms in bloom.

It's suitable for everyday wear! Its fresh and floral notes make it a perfect choice for any occasion. Whether you're going to work, meeting friends, or just running errands, this fragrance will add a touch of elegance to your day. The longevity is around 5 hours with moderate projection and you may need to reapply it but the fragrance is so soothing and calming it's worth taking that extra hassle.

If you're looking for a subtle elegant floral fragrance for everyday wear then Sakura Eau de Parfum by Acqua di Parma is the perfect choice for you. Also, if you're looking for a fragrance that won't trigger Migraine or any other discomfort, then you must try Sakura Eau de Parfum by Acqua di Parma.

#sotn #review #sakura

product_name: Sakura Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content: I absolutely adore this fragrance. I think this is what Japanese women would smell like. I love it.

product_name: Sakura Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content: incredibly boring scent and oh so meh. I loove cherry blossom scents and would recommend everyone Rituals line of stuff. Im incredibly dissapointed by this by di parma, theyre usually so much better. overpriced.

product_name: Sakura Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content: Beautiful scent, makes me feel relaxing. Disappointing longevity despite the lovely scent. Also, it's a skin scent.

product_name: Sakura Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content: Smells like men's shaving cream

product_name: Sakura Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content: Such a beautiful, bright floral perfume. It has just the right amount of sweetness. Sakura would be lovely in the spring and summer, as it’s light and airy. Sillage was moderate, garnering several compliments. It only lasted about 2 hours, which is its downfall, but I very much enjoyed wearing it during that time. I’m going to keep my eyes open for sales on this one.

product_name: Sakura Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content: I was a fan of this one until I started noticing the longevity issues. I was looking for its dupe and I read somewhere online that Japanese Blossom by Dua fragrances stays like for 8 to 10 hours. That is crazy man!! I managed to get my hands on this only in $33. But this price offers way more, the scent is amazing and longevity is SUPERB!!!

product_name: Sakura Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content: So beautiful but lasts about 45 minutes before completely disappearing even when oversprayed. Really sad.

product_name: Sakura Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content: "The cherry blossom is the symbol of the ephemeral. It opens overnight, blooms for a few days and then disappears forever. This short show cannot be stopped or slowed down ”Japanese quote. Sakura Eau de Parfum by Acqua di Parma is a widely citrus-flavored juste pulvérisé fragrance, when dry the floral accords bring out the scent of very delicate cherry blossom petals, harmonious in a very feminine bland. Pleasant floral sillage.

product_name: Sakura Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content: I just realized I love cherry blossom! Will have to explore this note more, it's a dewy fresh spring floral, citrussy a bit, sweet, but really fresh. Something I would love in the springtime.

product_name: Sakura Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Excellent citrus opening that morphs into florals and grassy vetiver on my skin. The drydown I get a lot of cherry blossom. Very nice perfume, unisex and underatted IMO. Decent projection but longevity is the weak link.

I would pick this up if I can find a tester for cheap.
This and quercia are hidden gems in the Acqua di Parma signature line.

Scent 7/10
Performance 4/10

product_name: Sakura Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content: This smells soap which doesn't sound all that great but I really enjoyed sampling it. Clean, fresh, light floral. Am I making it sound boring? It isn't boring but it is inoffensive. The cherry blossom does come through especially amid the top notes though it doesn't fully stand out from the soapy background. It's true that it doesn't project nor does it last long but then again, these kinds of scents never do. I might get another sample and come back to this review, I can't get over that opening but I don't see myself purchasing a full size simply because I'm not in love. It's really, really pleasant but I don't see this being the star of anyone's collection. This is the perfume always a bridesmaid, never the bride.

product_name: Sakura Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Beginning is really refreshing, citrus-flowery, but then it takes unexpected turn:
feminine, musky, a bit retro.
I got whiffs from Obsession, female fragrance.

It is targeted more for female audience.

product_name: Sakura Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I got a sample of this to test out. I haven't found many fragrances with cherry blossom and jasmine but I think I should from now on. It's a very soft, beautiful, delicate scent that reminds you of spring. Unfortunately I can't really smell it on myself after an hour which is disappointing. Very poor longevity and sillage. If anyone knows a similar perfume with better performance please message me!

For something that is on the pricy side, this simply isn't worth it.

product_name: Sakura Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content:
This is… lovely? It’s not what I expected, which was something very sweet and floral. The musk is surprisingly a major player here, and I think the way the citruses mingle with it creates this almost wet mineral accord. Ultimately it smells like I’m walking thru a cherry blossom garden on a stone path after a light summer rain. This isn’t an attention grabber. This isn’t something you wear to make a statement. This is something you wear when you want to feel a certain way. There’s an air of contentment in Sakura.

It just is.

product_name: Sakura Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content:
It smells fantastic! One of my favorite scents for sure. It smells strongly of cherry blossom with notes of jasmine.

It smells for a few hours, but no more than 6 hours. The sillage is moderate at first but become more intimate after an hour or two.

Just like the Yuzu, I want to give it a perfect rating, but the longevity and sillage make it a 8/10 atmost.

product_name: Sakura Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content: Smelt like the old apple flavoured hubba bubba chewing gum to me - in a good way. I rather enjoy it

product_name: Sakura Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Several users have mentioned weak longevity before me and unfortunately it's true.
It's a nice fragrance, but if you can afford it, you should find somthing else to purchase.

It's a cherry-blossom-nothing-out-of-the-ordinary-fragrance with a weak sillage and longevity - not worth the price tag.

product_name: Sakura Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Despite being labelled an eau de parfum, this behaves more like a cologne. I sprayed myself very liberally (8 sprays), and the scent was barely detectable an hour later, not even on my clothing. This would probably work well for fans of Juliette Has A Gun or other popular 'skin scent' lines.

The notes are pleasant enough, but the juice is not worth the price in my opinion. Cherry blossom and jasmine actually work quite well with citrus top notes and a musky base, but I have seen all of these notes done much, much better for way less money. It's not disappointing, but it's also not worth it.

product_name: Sakura Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content:
While it is a floral fragrance, it's not a dreamy, lyrical Jo Malone type floral. It can confidently be worn by both sexes mostly because of the jasmine and musky kick.

Elegantly achieved in the ADP tradition.

product_name: Sakura Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content: A nice and indistinct floralcy hovering over clean white musk. It doesn't exactly evoke "pink" or sakura, but still pretty close to the idea of pastel color and purity. It smells like green soapy neroli (jasmine sambac and other "clean white flower" chemicals) with a hint of powdered lilac.

product_name: Sakura Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content:
This is very beautiful.
I feel more on the feminine side.
It is fresh floral and very subtle dry down is adorable! I have worn this out and its liner, very much a skin scent.

product_name: Sakura Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content:
What you expect from AdP is outstanding citrus opening and Sakura has that, with a watery, juicy, nearly green effect (I often associate with fig) but it's heavily perfumed with a dominant cherry blossom right from the get go, I actually didn't realise just how much so on first spritz, but then this is laden with fresh cherry blossom. Very nice just a bit femme and a little too 'norm' and reminscent of air fresheners for me. This speaks more to the skill and quality of air freshner formulation that it does about this being a poor fragrance because it isn't. There's Nothing wrong with a functional fragrance and the floral musk and jasmine sambac (which isn't particularly prominent) just add to what is a very pleasant and good quality, light, summer floral.
I'm wearing it at the height of Autumn and it's bringing a little sunshine to an otherwise miserable day.

product_name: Sakura Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Bubble Gum

For the first 20 Minutes all I got was bubble gum, as if the fragrance had been meant for very young girls.

After that the sweetness goes somehow away and we get the cherry blossom. It's a nice fragrance, but doesn't justify the price tag.

product_name: Sakura Eau de Parfum Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Just tried this in John Lewis on Oxford Street (London) 20 minutes ago, and my first impressions are that it's very nice indeed.

It could well be the unisex floral fragrance I’ve been looking for. I’ve been hunting high and low through feminine white florals and the floral end of male fragrance, with limited results. I've just got bored of all the same old notes of so-called 'male' fragrance but I'm still limited by my own preconceptions and olfactory expectations so am reluctant to bite the bullet and wear J'Adore, for example.

Anyway, Sakura...The combined floral notes of the cherry blossom and the jasmine aren’t too overwhelming or overly feminine that would put men off. I think the musk might also keep it 'grounded'.

It's not a big projector though, and I can't see it lasting ages either, but today is a very hot and sweaty day so I'm sure that might reduce both. I would very much like to try this again to double-check.

I wouldn't have called this a 'citrus' fragrance though - it's a floral through and though. Just because it has some fleeting citrus in the opening does not a citrus make.

The other observation is that it's quite linear - once the ubiquitous citruses are out the way anyway. I don't know whether this is a good or a bad thing. I do like the middle/end hybrid, but who knows what could have come?

product_name: Colonia Quercia Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I realy like this house and own a lot of bottles.
This one....After 10 minutes-all i can smell is the base =sweet & synthetic.
Very disappointing.

product_name: Colonia Quercia Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Awesome fragrance. For a mature man with confidence, rather than teenager-unisex scent that's for sure. So powerful, rich, dense and masculine.
It starts fresh with lemon signature AdP and petitgrain, moves to a spicy heart of cardamom and geranium, and settles into a warm, woody base of cedarwood and oakmoss.

product_name: Colonia Quercia Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Blind buy, was lucky to find 100ml of this discontinued offering, along with a 5ml miniature for under £50 (meaning I could resell at a good price if I didn't like it, with no real risk of loss). First day of wearing.

Love that initial fresh blast like all other AdP.

Shortly after the opening it felt quite familiar to me. I detect some strong overlaps with Armani Code, Dior Sauvage, and Moncler Sunrise due to the peppery notes, and likely the unmentioned ambroxan.

I'd say this is woodier, warmer, more masculine, mature, and reserved than those. It's quieter than Code and Sauvage, but stronger than Sunrise in my experience of testing all three.

I suspect I'll hang on to this one, will make for a particularly good Autumn scent but is versatile enough for other seasons and casual, outgoing or formal occasions.

product_name: Colonia Quercia Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Aromatic goodness with nice spicy accords and lots of soft mossy! Green, refreshing and great. Lovely fragrance for summer days.

Follow me on IG: scent.guide

product_name: Colonia Quercia Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Im an oakmoss freak. I also like AdP fragrances generally very much. This might as well be a sauvage flanker. Its garbage and theres no real oakmoss nor is this anything worth even half what it costs. Super generic fake fuzz "moss", no performance. Smells like colonia on first spray, then in 30 mins smells like a modern amberwood s***show.

If you want oakmoss, i urge you to look elsewhere. Crazy how nuclear, high quality and natural the Colonia Ambra or Colonia Leather smells compared to this and its the same line somehow.

product_name: Colonia Quercia Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Acqua di Parma Colonia Quercia is a perfume made for a manly man, someone who wears crisp white office shirts—think a Private Equity professional. It’s strong, sophisticated, and unmistakably masculine.

I wore it to delve into this manly world and, although it didn’t quite suit me, I totally indulged in its rich scent. It starts fresh with lemon and petitgrain, moves to a spicy heart of cardamom and geranium, and settles into a warm, woody base of cedarwood and oakmoss.

This fragrance didn’t mesh with my feminine essence, but it was a delightful experience nonetheless. My friend and I explored it in the store and were so taken that I ended up buying a bottle. Years later, we still reminisce about that day and the powerful, masculine scent of Colonia Quercia.

product_name: Colonia Quercia Acqua di Parma
review_content: Drydown smells rotten to me. One of the worst ones I've ever experienced. I may have gotten a bad sample, but for isn't a blind buy.

product_name: Colonia Quercia Acqua di Parma
review_content: This comes across to me as balsamic as the elemi-laced Dior Eau Sauvage Parfum (2017), which Colonia Quercia reminds me of. But no resinous notes listed here, nor in other similar fragrances such as Chanel Pour Monsieur or Bon Viveur by Naughton & Wilson. The oakmoss doesn't manifest as is it typically does to my nose. think I like this more than Eau Sauvage Parfum. This is pretty good. Not the best AdP but good. Not as good (of course) as Chanel Pour Monsieur, but good.

product_name: Colonia Quercia Acqua di Parma
review_content: I find this a bit cloying. The oak moss pulls this fragrance back to the 1960's for me. I'd rather wear Dior Eau Sauvage Cologne, which is slightly sweeter and less mossy.

product_name: Colonia Quercia Acqua di Parma
review_content:
mix between eau sauvage parfum and new york intense, really good!
]

product_name: Colonia Quercia Acqua di Parma
review_content:
A fresh scent - but not green (ie Azzaro-y) or blue or airy (Issey Miyazaki-y). I dislike those green/blue/airy scents, and this has more of a sense of purity and specificity than scents in that ball park.

There’s oakmoss, wood, some cardamom and lime zest. It is masculine.

It’s simple and doesn’t evolve much (not a criticism). It reminds me a lot of Valiant by Boadacia the Victorious, but I doubt that will help people! They share a lot of he accords, although few of the same notes.

I’d also say that there are some genes in here from La Terre d’Hermes.

product_name: Colonia Quercia Acqua di Parma
Colonia Quercia Acqua di Parma
review_content: This is the absolute best in this collection. Awesome fragrance. Masculine, this is not teenager-unisex scent that's for sure. I keep thinking this would be an alternate better quality version of the original Chanel Allure Homme 1999. A mature woman magnet. So powerful, rich, dense and masculine. Top 5 oak scents of the market. This house never disappoints, every thing they sign off on is platinum.

product_name: Colonia Quercia Acqua di Parma
review_content: This reminds me of the strength of tom ford's oud wood but instead of wood it has a sweeter cherry undertone. And I absolutely love it. Only downside is that it's bloody expensive stuff

product_name: Colonia Quercia Acqua di Parma
review_content: I don't care if this is masculine. I think I'm going to get it.

product_name: Colonia Quercia Acqua di Parma
review_content: Has this fragrance been discontinued? Can only find the EdP, non-colonia, variant in most stores.

product_name: Colonia Quercia Acqua di Parma
review_content: Smells like children's orange Tylenol but as a Creamsicle. Awful.

product_name: Colonia Quercia Acqua di Parma
review_content: Old school dna but with a modern touch,unique smell and you will definitely enjoy the oak moss note in the dry down it gives a fresh touch and in the combination with the patchouli it smells pretty amazing,very good longevity, good sillage for the first 1.5 hour

product_name: Colonia Quercia Acqua di Parma
review_content:
This one sneaked up and surprised me. I liked the opening but wasn't sure if I was unique and special. When it dried down, I could almost visually see the hidden subtle creamy wafts of tonka and cardamon mix under a layer of woods and citrus. Tickles me with delight.

Opening: ADP vibe of natural, citrusy, fresh opening, but deeper and darker than my usual Colonia or Blu Mediterraneo ADPs. Bit of my Colonia Club green and mint but with added amber and a hint of leather. Pleasant and likable...do I love it? TBD

Drydown: Creamy tonka and cardamon becomes more prominent and layers beautifully with the woods. Love it.

Scent: 8.5 / Longevity: 7 / Sillage: 6

product_name: Colonia Quercia Acqua di Parma
review_content: This fragrance is a Masterpiece the opening is powerful ..... it’s as manly as it gets with great performance

product_name: Colonia Quercia Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Quercia ... ohh ... <3 I love it ... my top 5 ... most of compliments i got from my girlfriend only because of this scent heheheheh ... my girlfriend love it so much

all year around , opens fresh Bergamot, Petitgrain, Lemon, Pink pepper then dry down with beautiful Tonkabean , Patchouli and Oakmoss

longevity is awesome 8 hours with 2 hours good projection & sillage

for me it's very unique scent and very perfect dry down scent

product_name: Colonia Quercia Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Acqua Di Parma Men Colonia Quercia opens with a moderate projection of citrus, floral, spicy and woody accords. The petitgrain is the most noticeable opening note, it comes as sharp, and green; the bergamot is by its, sharp citrusy, the cardamon and cedarwood mix their notes producing a smooth fresh, vibrant woody-spicy and very aromatic scent, unique and characteristic of this fragrance. The geranium adds a floral touch but it is not as prominent as the combination of cardamon and cedarwood, also, the pink pepper is a soft touch. As the fragrance commences to dry down, the oakmoss becomes noticeable supporting the woody notes; the patchouli is just a pinch and adds a faint green touch; finally, the tonka bean adds its enveloping aroma and sweetens all notes. The most noticeable opening to dry-down changes are, the sharp citrus accords and the greenness of the petitgrain is noticeable during the opening, however, towards the dry-down, it partially fades away and softens; the bergamot is short-lived and confined to the opening; the tonka is more prominent towards the dry-down and smooths the fragrance with a soft powdery-like accord. Once Acqua Di Parma Men Colonia Quercia has reached its full dry-down, it can be summarized as a moderate projection, sweet, cardamon, and cedarwood fragrance with some green, citrus and floral accords. The fragrance feels aromatic, elegant, exotic, high-quality, masculine, mature, modern, nicely-blended, playful, slightly powdery (especially once the tonka has fully set in), rare, rich, sweet, unique, versatile, warm, woody, and very pleasant.

BATCH REVIEWED: 2019 (#2478Y))
WOW RATING: 9/10. Colonia Quercia is a very pleasant woody-spicy fragrance.
DISLIKE RATING: 1/10. The factor is very low, the woody and spicy accords are well blended.
UNIQUENESS: 10/10. Although wood tones are common, Colonia Quercia combines them fantastically creating a very unique and distinguishable fragrance.
MASS APPEAL: 7/10. This is a sweet woody and spicy fragrance that will please most people.
PROJECTION: 3/10. Moderate to low, about 3 feet around the wearer.
SILLAGE: 4/10. Moderate to low, about 4 feet behind the wearer.
APPLICATION: 4 atomizations will suffice.
LONGEVITY: 4/10. About 4 hours with 2 of moderate projection.
SEASONS: Fall, spring, winter, colder days, and climate-controlled environments.
OCCASIONS: Formal events, outdoor gatherings, office, business, casual, holidays, romantic, dating, clubbing. This is an office-friendly fragrance.
VERSATILITY: 8/10. Very good, this is a versatile fragrance.
GENDER: Masculine. The wood and spicy tones incline this fragrance to the masculine side.
AGES: 30 and above.
RECOMMENDATION: Highly unique, very good mass appeal and versatile. This fragrance can be found discounted for about $75. As such it is a great buy.
BLIND-BUY: No. The woody and spicy combination is unique.
SIMILAR: These are examples of similar fragrances. Bvlgari Man (no the Black version) EDT includes softwood and fruity notes; Cuba Gold Men EDT is an affordable woody, floral and spicy fragrance; Guerlain L'Homme Ideal EDP By Guerlain includes softwoods, almond, and other notes; Hugo Boss - Boss The Scent Absolute EDP features woody, ginger, and rum notes; Terre D'hermes EDT Spray, is orange and grapefruit based but it contains soft/sweet wood tones as well; Prada Luna Rossa Black Men EDP is a mostly peppery and woody fragrance; Tom Ford Oud Wood is a very pleasant, soft woody fragrance, however, very pricy; Acqua di Parma Men Colonia Quercia is a great woody, and spicy fragrance; Pasha de Cartier Edition Noire is an elegant and versatile, slightly sweet, ambery, aquatic, and woody fragrance; Mr. Burberry EDP is a spicy and woody fragrance, pleasant but very weak.
SUMMARY: A moderate projection, sweet, cardamon, and cedarwood fragrance with some green, citrus and floral accords. The fragrance feels aromatic, elegant, exotic, high-quality, masculine, mature, modern, nicely-blended, playful, slightly powdery (especially once the tonka as fully set in), rare, rich, sweet, unique, versatile, warm, woody, and very pleasant.

product_name: Colonia Quercia Acqua di Parma
review_content:
This fragrance does go to amouage sunshine man territory with hints of memoir man because of the anise/absinthe effect it seems to be giving off due to the bergamot.

If you're looking for oakmoss to be the star player, this isn't it.

One other significant reason why I tie this with sunshine man is because while quercia is an eau de cologne, It's loud like sunshine man.

I would say it's more wearable than sunshine man, but since I have sunshine man, I don't need a bottle of this.

Very good fragrance tho.

product_name: Colonia Quercia Acqua di Parma
review_content:
وقتی بوش میمونه برای یه ساعتی، عالی میشه 🤤

Oh the Drydown... The Drydown is heavenly...

product_name: Colonia Quercia Acqua di Parma
review_content: I might be pretty simple in my explanations, but I judge basically all tree fragrances by the smell of fresh-cut trees. Fresh-cut trunks smell quite pungent and harsh, not overly sweet, but also somewhat cold, that many may perceive as a metallic smell. Trees smell in this way rather straight forward, so I would not expect this fragrance to change very much, and it doesn't. This perfume stands out as it does kind of remind you of everything and nothing at the same time.Now that may be because either it is a blend to reminiscent an mature fresh-cut oak or it actually samples heavily the accord that does not have this much prominence in perfumes. I can smell some spices and flowers, but I guess it is for the balsamic feel of it. It is really a solid fragrance with good longevity and performance. What you get here is really an oak (oakmoss), and it is heavy. Forget lightness of flowery and fruit notes. Forget a galore of spices, no, this is a tree. I would actually expect it to be harsher, moister, earthier, but it doesn't go there. It is wearable to an extent and any solemn occasion will do, like theatre, fancier restaurant, cinema, celebrations, funeral, wedding, even for some jobs, and also for hiking or walking in the park, but surely not for clubbing or partying. I would not recommend this perfume to teenagers, but from mid 20's and upwards will do just fine.

product_name: Colonia Quercia Acqua di Parma
review_content: Who does see or notice a difference with the new bottle of Quercia they launched last year 2019?

product_name: Colonia Quercia Acqua di Parma
review_content: A masterpiece of a cologne!! It reminds me with Prada Carbon. They are not identical, but indeed of the same family. Both have that nice metallic-soapy theme, but this one is a bit darker and has a hint of creamy tonka, making it the better choice for office and formal setups. Elegance in a bottle.

product_name: Colonia Quercia Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Amongst the AdP Colonia series (not the newest black but the brown bottles) this is now my 2nd favorite after Sandalo. While Sandalo is a full-on barbershop sandalwood masterpiece one might link it to men over 30+, Quercia has amazing versatility not just on age but also season/occasion.

Another highlight that it's the least linear fragrance of the series IMO. Upon first spray I immediately thought another "mature crowd" thing, bergamot, oakmoss and geranium combo - very classy. Within the hour though it changed face into a generic masculine scent in a very good way, generic because it will remind you of some iconic fragrances.

Performance, it just does the trick and lasts, projects but doesn't disturb.

BUT, the price... I think it's way too expensive for what it is but can be found discounted so then it's a great deal.

IG: @talkaboutscents

product_name: Colonia Quercia Acqua di Parma
review_content: I would be interested in acquiring this one via trade from another member. Please see my inventory available in my profile and let me know if interested. Thank you.

product_name: Colonia Quercia Acqua di Parma
review_content:
This elegant fragrance blends citrus with light florals and traces of wood and spices to elicit a remarkably fresh take on gentlemen’s colognes. It’s for those who are bored with the standard spring, summer, fall fare, who want a fragrance with more body and complexity while still retaining a light and airy effervescence. It’s a blast of fresh air that uplifts and energizes, a scent that in the last eight months has quickly become one of my top spring/summer/fall picks. It’s not intrusive, it doesn’t demand attention, it’s not a beast, it just exudes suave sophistication and modernity—a prefect office or everywhere daytime scent.

On the negative, longevity is not what I would optimally prefer. I overspray in two spots on my neck and apply lightly to my shirt to get 5-7 hour projection. Still, I like it so much I bought a 180ml backup bottle.

product_name: Colonia Quercia Acqua di Parma
review_content:
The opening is soft/bitter/citrusy from the Bergamot, after it smoothly goes into a oakmoss/woody realm.

Full of depth and complexity, a really masculine fragrance.

It gives me the sensation of walking in the woods after the storm, with a clean woody air.

I think is one of the best perfumes from this house.

product_name: Colonia Quercia Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Quercia means oak in Italian.

All I could smell is oakmoss and geranium. While the "oak impression" has, imho, failed here, it remains a nice fragrance in itself. This Colonia is without any doubt on the feminine side.

Again, nice, but far from being my favourite from this line.

product_name: Colonia Quercia Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Oh, Quercia, how I long to wear you. 12 hours later and you're a little gem, delightful concoction of aged booze, leather, blackcurrant, honey and tobacco (to remind some of the notes which are not listed, because in this perfume you find another dominant note with each hour), getting better with age, as with all fine things in this world. But keeping your manly approach, as you should, nevertheless...

signed,
a woman

product_name: Colonia Quercia Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Sophistication is what comes to mind with this one..

Its not cheap, and might not be to everyones taste, so do have a sniff in store before forking out your hard earned cash on this one.

Clearly, anyone who can operate a spray pump has the right to wear this, but I suspect it would appeal more to gents 25+, or indeed any ladies who like this style of fragrance.

I think I'm a lil' bit in love with this one.

product_name: Colonia Quercia Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Fresh, modern with very pleasant citrus/semi-sweet shower-gelly opening.

There is ton of citrus/tonka in this fragrance with woody background. I dont get the oakmoss.

Complements factor is good, projection and longevity are very good.

Is it worth the price? Yes if found discounted not more than 100 USD for the 100 ml.

product_name: Colonia Quercia Acqua di Parma
review_content: Got a 2 ml sample from Neiman's. Love the citrus opening but on me it quickly turns into a tonka bomb that gets very cloying and obtrusive. Every time I wear it, after two hours I find myself anticipating my next shower. Also, nothing about it conjures the sensation of sitting under an oak tree. A pass for me.

product_name: Colonia Quercia Acqua di Parma
review_content: Fantastic and sensational creation of Acqua di Parma. It is a fragrance suitable for winter, spring and autumn. For true Mediterranean gentlemen. The agreement Moss of oak and bergamot is nothing short of Divine. On a friend of mine it lasts 6 hours, on me it takes 3 hours therefore it depends on the PH. The bottle recalls a very large oak trunk, just like the greatness of this sublime masterpiece. Great!

product_name: Colonia Quercia Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Citrus, oakmoss. Maybe cardamom and petitgrain. There's something artificial and metallic that gives me a headache. Looking at the other reviews it makes me wonder if I'm smelling a different fragrance all together but I was given this carded sample by the Neiman Marcus rep.

This is for warmer weather. Quercia's projection and sillage were nice; lasted six hours before becoming soft.. Unisex maybe slightly masculine. The metallic artificial bit makes it smell too modern and like many other designer scents. The composition is a little plain but it performs well. It's not bad but I don't care for this one.

product_name: Colonia Quercia Acqua di Parma
review_content: Another excellent blend. You'll get noticed for sure. The Best in the Ingredient Collection Line in my opinion. ADP brings nothing but good stuff. Sophisticated, Rich, and Deep. To pull this one off, dress casual, formal or maybe even a certain sporty attire. A powerful aromatic scent.

product_name: Colonia Quercia Acqua di Parma
review_content: The opening isn't anything special but the drydown is exquisite. Oakmoss and tonka bean are a heck of a combination. My favorite of the Colonia line (although Colonia Oud is pretty good too).

product_name: Colonia Quercia Acqua di Parma
review_content: I Love this fragrance! An exceptional masterpiece that excudes a presence of sophistication and confidence. The Citrus pairing with the Oakmoss is unique and balanced amazingly with the tonka adding a rounded smoothness to its character. Exceptional all year around fragrance that has garnered myself many compliments.

product_name: Colonia Quercia Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Colonia Quercia is a very interesting fragrance... in warmer weather it reminds me of bright green moss in a humid forest with a hint of pollen in the air - in colder weather, the Tonka Beans almost smell like a chocolat chaud in a Parisian café.

Decent sillage - it will dominate other fragrances in the room for the first few hours - lacks the longevity of Colonia Oud - but still remains present for a good 6-8 hours on the skin.

product_name: Colonia Quercia Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I've found my summer scent! Quercia opens with a delicious burst of citrus, cardamom and geranium, smoothed over by a sweet vanillic tonka bean. The oakmoss gives a brittle, sparkly quality in the beginning which, overlaid with the sweet, hesperidic top notes, calls to mind vanilla ice-cream floating in a glass of lemonade.

As the top notes retreat, the cedar and oakmoss push to the fore and it becomes less citric-sweet and more starchy-powdery, but still with a hint of that soft, balmy citrus in the background. It stays like this at close range for several hours, and I'm enticed to sniff my wrist once in a while to find the lovely cardamom and bergamot still hiding behind the thin veil of earthy moss.

People have compared it to "Russian Leather" by Memo -and I can see why, they both have a similar powdery, brackish quality- but Quercia is a good deal lighter and more delicate, making it more appropriate for warm weather.

The price point is the only negative to me. At €175 for 100ml, it is massively over-priced compared to other Colonia scents, which typically retail at €108. Obviously it's marketed as part of an 'exclusive' range, but the ingredients, while nicely blended, don't strike me as that costly to produce. Perhaps the quality of the oakmoss extract used is particularly high? Anyway, I'm on the hunt for a bottle, at a fairer price, if anyone wants to sell.

product_name: Colonia Quercia Acqua di Parma
review_content: Pleasant enough woody-freshy but a little too far on the masculine side to be wearable to me (female woody niche fan) - just a few steps too far into straight and slightly harsh aftershave-y-ness to truly enjoy. The moss is strong in this one. Bit synthetic at the edges and not quite warm enough for my taste either, though it does soften and sweeten considerably after a couple of hours. Wouldn't object to it on anyone else but it's not right for me, but I was probably barking up the wrong tree (hah!) hoping this might be an oak-centric wood temple like Lutens Chene which just happened to be hiding in plain sight among the mass-market men's EdC category. No such luck, but no harm, no foul - glad to have tried it but it wasn't the left-field genius I thought it might be.

product_name: Colonia Quercia Acqua di Parma
review_content:
My Go to Summer Scent ....performance is not Loud but a pleasing scent.
starting to like this house more and more..

product_name: Colonia Quercia Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Scent: 8/10
Projection: 7/10
Longevity: 8/10

product_name: Colonia Quercia Acqua di Parma
review_content: Does anybody knows who is the nose behind this fragrance?

product_name: Colonia Quercia Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Nice classy and mature...basically this should be called "bergamot moss " and not "quercia" as the these are the prominent notes which stay until the end and smell like lime for me. Very nice indeed, fresh and not common.
The tonka beens are noticable only at the very very end. It lasts all day with a good sillage and I really enjoy it. It makes you feel respected and macho so you dont need heavy woods and insence achieve this. Classy wealthy and confident is a man to wear this

product_name: Colonia Quercia Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Cards on the table, right off the bat for Quercia....This is a really, really good fragrance. Not only does it adhere to tried and tested ideas but it has some suprising extra depth and quality to elevate it that bit further.
Opens with a signature AdP freshness, petitgrain/citrus/verbena but immediately let’s you know that this is a woody fragrance, with earthy tones and plenty of oakmoss, lending a wonderful masculinity. So far so straight forward but the quality of the woody base really does keep giving throughout, those lime top notes lasting well into the drydown and at the heart of this fragrance there’s cardamom and geranium, all giving a kind of Italian vibe. The most surprising thing for me is the very deep drydown after many hours...there’s the soft vanilla notes which I’m assuming is from Tonka Bean. Faceted, brilliant, strong and long lasting but not invasive...I’m pretty sold on this superb Chypre type fragrance, Bravo Acqua Di Parma.

product_name: Colonia Quercia Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Class, elegant, uniq, l love too much I got a lot of compliments moreover it’s long lasting

9.8/10

product_name: Colonia Quercia Acqua di Parma
review_content:
A class fragrance with 10 hours staying power. It’s not synthetic whatsoever...it’s blended well and smells majestic.
A big unsolicited complement getter - both men and women love it. Occasionally you find a good one that hasn’t been hyped - this is it.

product_name: Colonia Quercia Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Quality: 5 out of 5 – It’s a rare masterpiece – LOVE! It reminds me of the wow-factor when I initially smelt Terre d'Hermes Parfum or Xeryus Rouge.

Originality: 4 out of 5 – It’s very original but has some lovely notes in it which then ironically reminds me of some of my favourite fragrances!

Projection (Sillage): 3.5 out of 5 – moderate-to-heavy; people in your vicinity can smell your scent.

Versatility: 4 out of 5 – This scent is very versatile; it works well for either day or night, all seasons, ‘dressed-up’ occasions, for men around 25+.

Value: 2.5 out of 5 – This is a huge splurge for me at £135 for 100ml but I cannot stop smelling my hand! To treat myself on a birthday or anniversary, I’d pay this for the unique factor! But, if you’re going to spend money like this, you might as well go into John Lewis and get the whole ‘experience’ being told the notes and getting a lovely branded bag with a ribbon! 

Compliment Frequency: 3 out of 5 – Unsolicited compliments on the scent were not received. However, I asked two people I know what they thought (I was over-excited by this scent) and both loved it!

Packaging (Bottling): 4 out of 5 – Much thought seems to have gone into the packaging; it’s attractive and highly functional.

Overall Rating: 5 out of 5 – Amazing – This fragrance is not only flaw free, but is a true masterpiece. It surpassed my expectations and should be on a collectors list.

Recommendations: Try before you buy as it’s not cheap but I love it.

product_name: Colonia Quercia Acqua di Parma
review_content:
By itself this fragrance is an upbeat and elegant petitgrain, citrus with a counter-intuitive complex earthy drop.
The pairing of Autumn earthiness of cardamom, petitgrain, tonka bean, patchouli, cedar with sharp citruses seems odd, but makes for a pleasant year round day time scent.
To me, this fragrance has year round appeal for daytime, but by itself is not remarkable. The utility for this fragrance is kind of similar to La Labo's Rose 33 -- but a lot sunnier and earthier smelling.
It smells clean, pleasant, finely constructed and upbeat -- but not really earthy in very alluring way.

I like to layer fragrances, so for me this fragrance served to both fortify and add needed gravitas and dimensionality to Tom Ford's Azure Lime.
Laying these 2 fragrances together kind of liberated each of them into a new arena of sunny mystique, hearty gravitas with approachable spice.

Quercia by Acqua di Parma + Azure Lime by Tom Ford ✔️
Try it yourself.

product_name: Colonia Quercia Acqua di Parma
review_content: Awful fragrance. It smells cheap and synthetic

product_name: Colonia Quercia Acqua di Parma
review_content: One of the best in adp range. Good lasting with medium sillage. Little pricey but nice.

product_name: Colonia Quercia Acqua di Parma
review_content: Just got a sample from this. If AdP has an answer to Aventus or Sauvage, it would absolutely be this one..but I would lean more towards Sauvage in terms of what this resembles..unfortunately as it's been done so much that also leaves it in an increasingly generic category. I don't get as much of the ambroxan that Sauvage has so much of, and I'd say this is a more refined scent to my nose, coming across as less of a single 'fresh laundry' note and easier to identify some others. I get a sharp lime note up front that is remniscent of Tom Ford Azure Lime and then the cedar, oakmoss and leather trio are likely what gives me a very slight Aventus vibe that I detect immediately afterwards. It's a great scent and I love this house, but I wouldn't pay their asking price for this one.

product_name: Colonia Quercia Acqua di Parma
review_content: so energetic and also complex, at the same time luxurious . .

product_name: Colonia Quercia Acqua di Parma
review_content: Do you remember the 'Green' feeling you got from those mythic 'Oak Moss Bombs' of yore; Paco Rabanne and Polo? The images that evoked pop-culture references such as films like Southern Comfort and Death Wish and you imagined lumberjack shirted icons of 70's Hollywoood films wore such scents to the point where you knew you couldn't possibly wear those same scents in 2017; lest it be in the privacy of your own home for fear of being seen as absurd? Well rest easy my friend; the Oak Moss-focussed men's fragrance has been well and truly rehabilitated and brought into the 21st century. I tested this fragrance with one spray to my left hand and my female colleagues commented very positively on it. I was at first a tad bit lukewarm, but soon found myself wanting to sniff my hand again and again. Bravo Acquai di Parma - a very sophisticated and impressive achievement.

product_name: Colonia Quercia Acqua di Parma
review_content:
با سلام و احترام
رایحه ای با پایه مرکبات و فرش دارد
وجود نت هایی که در مورد آن ذکر شده است و بالانس آنها کاری خوشبو و مورد توجه به وجود آورده است

همانند عطر عالی و خوب لدر از این برند
در کل کار خوبی است و از داشتن آن حتما لذت خواهید برد
