گالری عطر مهرداد

product_name: Colonia Quercia Acqua di Parma
review_content: Am let this last night... immediate love at first sniff, such a likable scent. Similar to dylan blue but better performance. 20hrs on and after a gym session and can still smell this faintly on my arm. Words fail me to describe how badly I want this, I have sniffed my arm more times than I can remember. I'm a niche man at heart and love daring scents but this blew me away I need it now

product_name: Colonia Quercia Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Yes, when i first smelled this perfume i was astonished.
This is a good and well balanced perfume with class.
If you are used to the more common popular perfumes you have to get used to it. If yr used to the more nice well balanced perfumes and the colonia series you also need to adapt to it.
It opens with a woody/citric note with that deep classic smell that is typical for colonia.
Then comes the very anise-like note generated by cardamom and tonka beans. The woody note is prominent along the dry down until the end. The patchouli is very noticeable in the end and I think it is the note that other reviewers here mark as synthetic.
But in the whole run a good well balanced perfume just in the dry-down patchouli is too prominent and tends to make it a bit common or even in the realm of cheap/soapy-like perfume that isn't the case but it tends to it.
This perfume has some good class and is for a gentleman who wants to show his elegance without being too prominent.
When to wear fall/winter.

product_name: Colonia Quercia Acqua di Parma
review_content: Poor show from ADP, smells synthetic and generic. Reminds me of Versace Pour Homme Dylan Blue and dries down to a Sauvage ambroxan base. This stuff is nasty.

product_name: Colonia Quercia Acqua di Parma
Colonia Quercia Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Fragrance based on a legend of Piedmont is about an immense oak, so Quercia Colonia deals with the scent that represents this vital and long-lived oak.

The central core is an agreement oak moss that during the game is very nice with the company citrus and aromatic touches, but as it evolves and disappear citrus and floral crops out an acid character to imitate oak moss, but it neither comes close (too synthetic and unbalanced).

The fragrance has good durability and moderate wake, but that lacks proper drying qualities (disservice he has done that Acqua di Parma oak Piedmont :))

Rating: 3

product_name: Colonia Quercia Acqua di Parma
review_content: If you like this perfume, I would recommend buying Rituals Roi d'orient, the opening is a bit different- probably because of the oak moss, but other than that it is pretty much the same thing. It is a bit sweeter and more of a fall/winter fragrance, but comes at a fraction of the price and performs much better.

product_name: Colonia Quercia Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Smells like Amouage Sunshine Man. I like

Edit: Smells like Amouage Sunshine Man but, dare I say..., better!

Edit 7/22/2016: This is very nice but can get a little cloying. I don't have a bottle or a sample but every time I come across it, I spray it and like it a lot. This time I was at Bloomies and did like 4 sprays and that may have been one too many.. anyway, I hope to get a sample to try it out a few more times but based on a couple of interactions I really like this one.

product_name: Colonia Quercia Acqua di Parma
review_content:
This is my fav in the colonia range. Been wearing it for a week.
Gives me a good 8-10 hours longevity with great projection for the first 4 hours.
This is definitely an office safe fragrance which veers towards the mature men.
Very very crowd pleasing and blind buy worthy

product_name: Colonia Quercia Acqua di Parma
review_content: Fresh and leathery. Different but not unique. VERY similar to Paloma Picasso Minoteur from 1992 which is far more interesting.

product_name: Colonia Quercia Acqua di Parma
review_content: Nothing too out of the box or original, but it's a nicely balanced concoction (tart lime balances warm woods, patchouli and tonka) and it smells good. I would like it more if they hadn't added that touch of "generic men's cologne scent" to the base, which always smells kinda like lavender to me.

product_name: Colonia Quercia Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I just recieved and sprayed a sample of this so here goes!

Quercia opens up wih a strong lime note accompanied by some sweetness (from the tonka?). pretty soon the lime settles down. Now the geranium takes the lead and the cedar, patchouly and oakmoss gets more noticable. Also there is a slight hint of cardamom.

All in all, Quercia is a mature and fresh scent and its very different from the other offerings in the so called "ingredient collection". Personally, i think it would have been better att home in the Blue Mediterraneo lineup. It has kind of the same balance between fresh and woody/spicey as Ginepro di Sardegna.

Comparisions. It has kind of the same lime opening as Creeds Virgin Island Water. There are also some similarities to Penhaligon's Quercus - probably because they share the citrus, cardamom and oakmoss notes.

Final rating: 7/10 Good but not great.

product_name: Colonia Intensa Acqua di Parma
review_content: Ahmed you are just the worst. When I read your words, it makes me wish I didn’t have to live on the same planet as people like you. Have a nice day ya filthy animal.

product_name: Colonia Intensa Acqua di Parma
review_content:
In the cobblestone streets of Rome, where the scent of history mingles with the breath of the sea, Colonia Intensa emerged from the house of Acqua di Parma, embodying a unique essence of Italian elegance.

It is more than just a fragrance; it is a journey that begins with the first spray and continues until it becomes part of your memories.

The scent opens with a radiant burst of ripe citrus: orange, bathed in the Mediterranean sun, and lemon, sparkling with the clarity of morning light. This is accompanied by the warm hint of ginger and the exotic allure of cardamom.

This fragrance represents an extraordinary freshness, akin to the invigorating first breath of mountain air on a clear summer day.

As the minutes pass, the heart of the fragrance draws you deeper. White neroli blossoms, reminiscent of orange flowers in their prime, are surrounded by the fresh touch of artemisia and wild myrtle, evoking a Mediterranean garden at midday, where the leaves sway gently in the breeze.

Here, brightness melds with sweetness, as the fragrance gracefully transitions from the light of day to the warmth of evening.

When the sun sets, the base reveals the fragrance's eternal identity: luxurious leather, akin to an old armchair in an aristocratic library, meeting the noble richness of patchouli, complemented by the honeyed warmth of benzoin, and wrapped in a soft layer of musk, much like a winter shawl draped over your shoulders.

It is this finale that gives Colonia Intensa its unmistakable character—a depth and intimacy that lingers long after the noise has faded.

The sensory experience is like a masterful oil painting: its colors shift with the light, and its details are revealed slowly.

This fragrance does not shout for attention; it leaves a subtle, elegant impression. As one connoisseur put it, "A Rolls-Royce in the world of fragrances, not a Lamborghini."

Its virtues lie in the union of classical freshness and modern depth, making it a composition well-suited for the man who appreciates understated elegance.

However, it is not for everyone; some admirers lament its modest performance and projection, which linger close to the skin and diminish sooner than desired. Yet, others find this restraint to be the refinement that prevents it from overwhelming the senses.

In terms of longevity, it usually accompanies its wearer for six to eight hours, then settles into a soft, leathery shadow, as if the fragrance itself were whispering, "I was here… and I still am."

Colonia Intensa strikes a balance between morning sun and evening shade, between the sparkle of citrus and the warmth of leather, and between modernity and classical roots.

It is a fragrance that does not need to raise its voice to be heard, for it speaks in whispers and etches itself into memory without noise.

It is the choice of those who understand that true luxury lies in the details, and that the most beautiful impression is often the one that lingers long after we are gone.

Ahmed hadi - Baghdad - IRAQ

product_name: Colonia Intensa Acqua di Parma
review_content:
It's so sad, that I bought that thing of Acqua di Parma.That product remains me the soviet eau de cologne by Novaya Zarya, Moscow, Russia ( Troynoy odekolon,NZ, Moscow).
Я просто в шоке от этого произведения,на 3й день использования я вспомнил,что это же Тройной одеколон от Новой зари( Москва, Советский союз).

product_name: Colonia Intensa Acqua di Parma
review_content: I kind of like something something about it but it always reminds of a 70 year old man.

product_name: Colonia Intensa Acqua di Parma
review_content: I think I tested it right after the regular Colonia, and it didn’t sit right with me — a bit more of something, which also means a bit more synthetic.

product_name: Colonia Intensa Acqua di Parma
review_content: Amazing scent but just don’t wear it in very hot and humid weather. It’ll vanish within 10 minutes.

product_name: Colonia Intensa Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Nothing but good things to say about this. Got a 6 OZ bottle for 90 bucks and honestly, that is a steal. This scent is incredibly sophisticated, and has a masculine powdery, fresh, old money type of vibe to it. Men of all ages can wear it, and I'm sure some women might find it appealing for their skin and interests as well. Considering I have a large supply of this, and the appeal it has on the nose, this is very likely to be my signature scent for the foreseeable future. This is a scent that almost anyone should be able to enjoy, for it is simple yet flawlessly executed. Not sure why this doesn't get more attention, but this is a legit fragrance from a legit brand that is a legit bargain from online retailers. Go get yours before the price goes up even more (sitting at about 100 dollars for 6 OZ at the time of posting)

Incredible scent, don't really need to say more. Go buy it. Seriously.

product_name: Colonia Intensa Acqua di Parma
review_content: Not fresh and uplifting. Definitely not youthful either. Smells strange. It must be the myrtle which I am not familiar with. I've tried but, I can't get into ADP.

product_name: Colonia Intensa Acqua di Parma
review_content: This is super manly - wear Colonia Essenza during the day - unless is baking hot then go for Fico di Amalfi - then crack on Colonia Intensa at night. Life will be forever simple after this........promise.

product_name: Colonia Intensa Acqua di Parma
review_content: Very nice, probably excellent. I'm no Mediterranean playboy but to me this does not smell like any kind of cocktail or fizzy soft drink. Often when I smell citrus with ambery resins, it makes me think of candied citrus peels, and so it does here, but this is also fairly sour or tangy, with a little herbaceous bitterness too, and in the opening at least, it has quite a blearily balsamic aspect, like a nice hand cream. As others have noted, it probably would not be the ideal choice for the hottest days, but has the makings of a versatile fragrance for much of the rest of the year. The neroli is prominent and, especially early on, quite indolic. It has a sexy kind of mushroomy overtone that I associate more with jasmine and gardenia. Mainly because of the neroli, this makes me think of another Morillas creation, Bvlgari Man Wood Neroli. In some ways, this is almost what MWN might have been if MWN didn't smell quite so much like lemon furniture polish. Sillage is suitably moderate, longevity moderate to--probably--good.

product_name: Colonia Intensa Acqua di Parma
review_content: My wife immediately thought this was an old school perfume. It does give off an aged barbershop smell which I quite like. It's not overpowering but sits close for all but the first 30 minutes in which it projects. I definitely pick up on the neroli giving it the flowery vibe throughout. The leather and cedar combo while I can't pick out individual notes with it, do provide a nice base to let you know that this leans masculine. If it lasted longer I'd like it better.

product_name: Colonia Intensa Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Having testing it for a bit i can say that it really has some depth, its very very classy and elegant! If you really like aromatic woodiness with hints of sweetness and spiciness that are not overpowering its a great choice. projects the first 2 to 3 hours and becomes a skin scent for around 4 more hours. Its very well blended and smooth. I dont feel its a big complement getter especially for young people.

In conclusion if you want to smell rich with a vintage vibe go for it!

product_name: Colonia Intensa Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Having bought Acqua di Parma’s excellent Fico di Amalfi earlier this year, I’m hoping to find more from the house that suit my tastes. I tried Colonia Futura, but sadly it’s not quite right for me, which is why Colonia Intensa came onto my radar. Just as with Futura, there is a definite Colonia thread running through Intensa, but comparatively, it is more of a classic old-school fragrance — and for me, it’s better for it.

Intensa opens with a flash of lemon and bergamot that, on my skin, vanishes within seconds and is replaced by a warm, soft cardamom note. Not so immediately obvious is the ginger, which lingers subtly at the back of the nose when one is not smelling the fragrance directly. It’s a great addition and makes Intensa far more interesting to me than it otherwise would be. Then, in hardly any time at all, this cardamom-ginger combination is joined by naturally sweet, aromatic notes that, to my nose, come across as slightly floral. This spicy, aromatic, floral vibe is somewhat powdery at the outset, but after a while it evolves into a full on power house of musk and leather, which on me lasts eight hours plus.

All in all, I prefer Intensa to Futura. It strikes me as smoother, more rounded, and more versatile.

Tested: 1ml decant.
Seasons / Occasions: Could be worn all year round. Suitable for most occasions.
Key thoughts: Spicy, floral early stages give way to musky leather, then turns powdery.
Overall rating: 7/10.
Buy full bottle: Undecided

product_name: Colonia Intensa Acqua di Parma
review_content: Just like Futura, this is very similar to another old school frag, Chanel's Pour Monsieur...although not as smooth. Put this is same bag as above mentioned PM, Eau Sauvage, and Givenchy MdG, cannot go wrong with any of them.

product_name: Colonia Intensa Acqua di Parma
review_content: This reminds me of an Aramis fragrance my dad used to wear - either Devin or 900, not sure which.

product_name: Colonia Intensa Acqua di Parma
review_content: Very nice scent, one of my favorite leather scents. The leather is not too offensive and blends in well. The base even smells a bit sweet like cola and it makes an unique and good scent. Sample it before buying though, might not be to everyone’s taste.

product_name: Colonia Intensa Acqua di Parma
review_content: This is my go-to cologne for any occasion. It's fresh and citrusy at first, then warms up to a beautiful leather and wood scent. I always get compliments when I wear it!

product_name: Colonia Intensa Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Lemon and ginger are the most prominent top notes, while cardamom eventually comes through as well. These sort of stays on top of a classic Italian cologne base. Otherwise I get a very decent English barbershop feel over it. While the ginger is a bit too strong for my personal taste, anyone who are into classic colognes should give it a try. You will find a lot more warm spice here, when compared to most of the colonia line, but I personally think it is approaching the fougère genre a bit. The leather aspect is discreet, and the citruses blend into the whole in a way that sets it apart from the hespéridés/citrus cologne style.

Otherwise I am a bit surprised over the performance on my skin. I own a handful of ADP’s but Intensa seems to behave more as an EDP initially, but only for an hour or so. After that I get a pretty average ADP performance, if you are a professional you should not wear stronger scents than this for the
workplace. The warm spices make it suitable the year around for indoor wear in my view.
Discounted, you can get 180ml for 110 €.

product_name: Colonia Intensa Acqua di Parma
review_content: A modernized, mature, elegant, and very well executed, version of the classic Citrus/Neroli Eau de Cologne, with a hint of Spicy, Green and Resinous accords. It has moderate longevity and projection, so you may want to apply and reapply generously (It performs well on clothes). Perfect for hot weather, and office-safe.

product_name: Colonia Intensa Acqua di Parma
review_content:
To my nose, this fragrance has a very heavy after shave vibe with an artificial citrus note. Like someone dropped a lemon Jolly Rancher in a bottle of Pinaud Clubman. The first time I wore it solo my wife said I smell like an old man.

That said, it's not a total loss. I'm a big fan of Tom Ford Tobacco Vanille, but I live in Florida. Tobacco Vanille is too heavy a scent for most of the year down here. I find that it benefits greatly when layered with something that can provide a fresh, citrusy note and Colonia Intensa does just the trick!

product_name: Colonia Intensa Acqua di Parma
review_content: There's something I like about Intensa but I've grown tired of it. It's way too screechy for me and gives me headaches. Not smooth and soapy like some of the other Colonia's. It reminds me of what old ladies smelled like back in the 80's. I wish it had more of a woody base or something to cut the sharpness. I find it overwhelming.

product_name: Colonia Intensa Acqua di Parma
review_content: I like this. Simultaneously masculine and sophisticated. Just wish it performed a bit better.

product_name: Colonia Intensa Acqua di Parma
review_content: I’ve always overlooked and never tried this one until one random walk through the perfumer, and wow - I was surprised at how much I liked it. I’ve been wearing a wide range of this brand for many years. This is a very low key great scent. Somewhat mature but feels very good. Kind of like a lighter version of Tom Ford’s Ebony Fume. Like a mix between Colonia and that, but even nicer. Very surprised.

product_name: Colonia Intensa Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Smells really good hint of leather with the citrus is nice and longevity is about 5 hours or maybe 4
Projection 2 hours moderate

product_name: Colonia Intensa Acqua di Parma
review_content: Lasts about 10 minutes on the skin. Disgraceful these modern fragrances. Thank God Vintages are still around

product_name: Colonia Intensa Acqua di Parma
review_content: A wonderfully put together and incredibly great smelling perfume. My wife and I were on one of our walks at a beautiful park near us. We passed a group of ladies on our way to our favorite destination and on passing them once again while heading the other way on our return trip a woman told me "you smell incredibly nice".

product_name: Colonia Intensa Acqua di Parma
review_content: Spicy and fresh, first adp so I can't comment on how it compares with others. I'm definitely going to check out more from this house! Need to fill up travel sprayer , really doesn't last long.

product_name: Colonia Intensa Acqua di Parma
review_content: Nice fragance.. at the bottom of the manly box, almost unisex… Very subtle Barber Shop smell. Longevity is 5h aprox with 1 ft sillage.. not full price worth it

product_name: Colonia Intensa Acqua di Parma
review_content: Best from "colonia" series!

product_name: Colonia Intensa Acqua di Parma
review_content: Think of Daniel Day Lewis in Phantom Thread. This would be his fragrance. Elegant, classy, mature. Beautiful.

product_name: Colonia Intensa Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Mixed feelings about this one. Regarding longevity, I was quite surprised. Got a solid 8 hours out of it. After 12 hours, it was still a subtle skin scent. I rated it "long lasting" but its longevity is actually phenomenal, considering Intensa (as is the entire Colonia collection) is an eau de cologne. However, sillage and projection were "intimate" after about the first hour.

This is definitely not a soapy cologne. For me, it's a smooth woody-leather scent after the dry down. If there is any soapiness, it is quite subtle to almost nonexistent. In general terms, the scent from start to finish is polished, classy, masculine and smooth without any synthetic harshness. Typical AdP quality.

Despite all the positives above, for me it's only "OK". The overall experience is too subtle for me. I prefer fragrances that make more of a statement. Intensa is too introverted for me. However, I can see for a guy who wants something more subtle, especially for a professional environment, Intensa would be good for warmer and hot days in spring, summer and fall.

product_name: Colonia Intensa Acqua di Parma
review_content:
For the last 3 reviewers:
Danilo etc: Colonia Intensa lasts around 8 hours on me. Out of the 15 Acqua di Parma colognes I have, only the 4 Concentrees (Brown bottles) last longer than Colonia Intensa.
My son wore it on a New Years Eve a few years ago. Out on a Penthouse Roof Garden watching the Fireworks I could smell it on him 2 meters away. It was windy as usual in the Netherlands.

Uhistincky: and I prefer Tuscan leather over OG Colonia. Or Steak over Tomatoes.

Shishibr: Smells like Cola?????
I must have woke up in a parallel World.

This fragrance is smoky. Indeed not soapy as you expect from Acqua di Parma fragrances.

About 5 years ago I gave gift sets of Essenza in the black box and Intensa in the yellow box to a few of my clients and to my 2 sons as Christmas gifts.
The Essenza is clearly a Summer Fragrance, while Intensa is more appropriate for the evenings. First I was convinced the later would be a Spring-Summer type but after I smelled it on my son on New Years Eve, I knew it would works all year long.
It's by far the most sophisticated of all AdP fragrances I have. (15)

product_name: Colonia Intensa Acqua di Parma
review_content:
It would probably be my favorite in the entire line if it weren't for its longevity, which is by far the worst. In fact, among the Colognes, only Intensa lives up to AdP's stereotype of very short longevity on my skin.

This perfume has, perhaps, the best ginger note I've ever smelled, along with the freshest cardamom I know. It smells 100% natural, and to my nose, the leather is not present. It's even less musky than the original and Essenza, and certainly much less soapy (Essenza is by far the soapiest). It actually seems even more unisex than those two. It's not as citrusy and sharp as Futura and not as floral as Pura, sitting in a middle ground with a light woody base that doesn't detract from the freshness at all.

Its opening fragrance, with its ginger and neroli, is one of the most pleasant I've ever encountered. As mentioned, it smells 100% natural, like Dior Homme Cologne (one of the best citruses I know), but certainly less minimalist than that, with woods, musk, a more diverse citrus blend, and even some incense, without losing its freshness and brightness. However, like Dior Homme Cologne, its longevity is poor.

To me, it's the central "scent" of the entire line, modernizing the original and making it less soapy, which is no small feat, as this is one of the most incredible lines in perfumery. For an even more modernized version, and by far the most citrusy and long-lasting on the skin, I suggest trying Futura. For a lighter, aquatic, and unisex option, Pura is great, and for a timeless barbershop scent, the Original is the way to go.

product_name: Colonia Intensa Acqua di Parma
review_content: Not a fan. I’ll take the OG Colonia over this any day.

product_name: Colonia Intensa Acqua di Parma
review_content: Smells like cola, bloody amazing and not necessary a summer fragrence really more of a deep woody cola smell

product_name: Colonia Intensa Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Strange that rose and geranium are not listed in the notes. Especially the classic, pink rose note is so significant, it's beyond limits of disregard. With that said, it's a very classic take on the original which I find the better choice still due my very subjective leniency on the original.

Intensa smells more old fashioned to me than the original or perhaps my impression of rose note giving that vibe to me. Nevertheless Intensa still holds those complex aromatics much better than the average niche/designer, there is probably a lot of natural oils in trace amounts (classic Morillas style) that it creates a simple-to-the-nose yet complex-in-reality blend. Dry down is again Morillas' favorite musks, that human-skin powdery Muscenone, Habanolide type (Mugler Cologne-ish drydown) with some woody ambers (luckily not in unsophisticated amounts that we find in many so-called niche today). I wish for days to come that these type of perfumes will be “it” instead of the gourmands and woody ambers that one can’t escape nowadays.

product_name: Colonia Intensa Acqua di Parma
review_content: This is my way to go perfume! I love it so so much. It is so refreshing, so vibrating, so good!! Whenever i put this perfume on my skin, it always put a smile on my face and it gives me confidence. The longevity is pretty good, at least 6-7 hours, and also the sillage is good. I think that if you are 30+ you will enjoy this much more than a younger person. But...i don't know, at least give it a try!!!

product_name: Colonia Intensa Acqua di Parma
review_content: Yikes. Sprayed 40 times (not joking) and couldn't smell it 10 minutes later.

product_name: Colonia Intensa Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Stumbled on this at Plume et Palettein in Epcot years ago. Mid-summer….90+ degrees. For an Eau de Cologne, it lasted a long time. Picked it up cheap when I traveled home. Definitely spring/summer worthy and could easily be a signature fragrance in the warmer months.

My girls and wife love this and always tell me I smell clean and fresh when I wear it.

Like Snifflord said below, “come back when your balls dropped”. Couldn’t have said it better myself! Very mature and loads of gravitas with this one!

Cheers!

product_name: Colonia Intensa Acqua di Parma
review_content: Not for little boyz with wispy goatees who say "Bruh", wear beaded wristbands and indulge in the awkward, shoulder-bump style of hugs. This is mature, classy, worldly stuff for men with gravitas and some life experience... so please come back when your balls have dropped. Thank you! 🤗

product_name: Colonia Intensa Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Was somewhat expecting a stronger Colonia - my favourite classic mens cologne - and boy was I wrong. TLDR this is a case of attempting a major notes swap while retaining the original vibe, but off the mark in case of Colonia Intensa.

As expected from Colonia, It opens very Cistrusy, juicy and zingy - stronger even than OG - excellent! But then the freshness disappears in just about 15 minutes, completely switching the fragrance. A bait and switch if you will. This was my favourite part of the fragrance too.

Fragrance moves into a Green Spicy and Aromatic direction, completely dropping any hints of Citrus it had. Biggest notes to pick out are Cardamom and Patchouli, latter being particularly strong, and some other Greens, all wrapped in a bit of White Floral soapiness. Almost Fougere territory. Base adds strong Leather with added Woods, and is very Musky, but the green-fougery-spicy middle remains. At this point fragrance becomes very old school and mature.

The scent is Peppery-Spicy, Green, strong Leathery, and Musky. It's very mature and kind of the opposite of your typical summer freshie by the Italian coast. I'd go as far as saying this can easily be a Winter fragrance and not a Summer one.

In some way it paints a similar picture of a gentleman on a coast that radiates freshness, class, and confidence, but in a more serious, contemporary way. Except it takes a completely different angle on it.

Would this have been another fragrance line, the perception would be different, but for Colonia - especially Intensa - it just doesn't cut it for me. And while I do love when fragrances have a major note switch but somewhat retain the vibe of the original (Gentleman EDT Intense), this isn't the case for me unfortunately.

It's smooth and well-blended, good and complex enough to find people who would genuinely appreciate it, but the scent profile makes me want to reach for Bogart for some reason, and as for Fresh fragrances - there's a much wider and better choice out there.

Not bad but isn't worth the price.

product_name: Colonia Intensa Acqua di Parma
review_content:
First impressions:
Fresh lemon, then something weird but pleasant hits you, I think that's the cardamom/ginger.
Then there's a deeper realistic lemon citrus aroma with a lots of herbs, exposing the warm base to come a little bit.
Then the lemon dissapates, leaving the herbs with sweet soapiness. The patchouli comes out very loud at this point.
Then the animalic leather, and a little bit of musk.
Yeah and that's it. Obviously the lemon top note is very fleeting, so the perfume comes down to sweet herbal soapiness -> warm leather+patchouli, with the sweetness not being an obnoxious one, but a pleasant "car fragrance" one coming from the benzoin. Actually very nice. There's no bitterness or anything. The patchouli gives it a little bit of dryness, but that's it, other than that it's very smooth and at the beginning, when there's still the realistic juicy lemon in the air it smells amazing. But yeah, it ain't worth 100$ in my opinion. Bought a tester and i'm happy with it.

product_name: Colonia Intensa Acqua di Parma
review_content: Yes, @SOS1980, search up fragrance 'maceration,' although, in reality the process is actually called 'maturation,' but most people call it 'maceration' anyways.

product_name: Colonia Intensa Acqua di Parma
review_content: Classy, business-ready scent in a near fougere/aftershave style. Good projection for about an hour then becomes a pretty intimate scent after that which will last several hours. My girlfriend really loves the drydown on this but can only smell it when she's up close and personal. For an Eau de Cologne I think it's great.

product_name: Colonia Intensa Acqua di Parma
review_content: This juice is very classy and beautifully blended. However, on my skin it doesn’t last more than 2 hours. I blindly bought it and I’m not disappointed except with longevity at least on my me! Any advice to improve its performance?

product_name: Colonia Intensa Acqua di Parma
review_content: To the reviewer below - I will say I can see where the other reviewer comes from when he says this is a smoother/drier Cedrat Boise. This is not only similar to it, it’s much, much better and masterfully done. Classier. Infinitely more natural. In fact, there is no comparison - AdPCI is a masterpiece.

product_name: Colonia Intensa Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Acqua di Parma Colonia Intensa is a classically soapy Italian-style fragrance. It's marketed as a "woody-leather" fragrance, but that doesn't really mesh with the impression that it gives - if anything, I'd say it's closer to a fougere (more on that later).

The top notes hit with a very sharp, almost bitter, pithy citrus. It's not "rindy" like D&G Light Blue Forever, nor is it sweet like so many other citruses. It smells like the white gunk in between the rind and the fruit - sharp, acidic, and a little abrasive.

Fortunately, that impression fades pretty quickly (although the citrus does remain), but it's almost immediately replaced by old-school brown cake soap - the kind your grandad may have used. It's thoroughly masculine and smells delightfully clean, but again, it's not a "modern" soapiness, like how the Prada l'Homme line is "soapy" and "clean". This is a "hairy-chested '70s Italian man, fresh out of the shower, reaching for his bottle of original Paco Rabanne Pour Homme", kind of soapy.

The odd thing is, there really isn't a proper "dry down" here. This "vaguely citrusy, old-school soapy" scent profile just rides out for the next several hours (upwards of 6 so far, today), without any real evolution. There's a minimal sort of warm woodiness that reminds me of the scent of the library at my grandfather's house - old woods and a touch of spice, married to extreme cleanliness - which does bring a bit of sweetness to it, but it's a pretty consistently sharp scent throughout.

Performance-wise, it's got pretty minimal sillage (someone 3–4 feet away from me says he can't smell it, and I went *quite* heavy on the trigger), but it nevertheless has a pretty solid duration - it just sits close to the skin.

Within its genre, I would say this is a pretty middle-of-the-road fragrance. When you consider that it's often *quite* pricey, honestly, I have a hard time recommending it. If you can grab it for around $50-$60, it's a pretty good deal, but any more than that, and there are better options available, in my opinion. If you're curious, I've listed a few below:

- Acqua Essenziale Colonia from Salvatore Ferragamo hits almost the exact same notes, but with a wonderful sweet bergamot and orange blossom accord cutting the sharpness off the top. It was also created by Alberto Morillas, one of the two noses behind AdPCI.

- Dior Eau Sauvage (*Eau* Sauvage, not the Johnny Depp Sauvage) gives the same general impression with much more smoothness - and the parfum version is a true love of mine. The Parfum was also created by François Demachy, the other nose behind this scent.

- And finally, if you want to shell out the money, something like Terralba or Sleight of Fern from Masque Milano will fill that same role in your line-up, while taking that sharpness in far more interesting directions. And yes, if you were wondering, Sleight of Fern IS a fougere - to be frank, AdPCI has more in common with them, scent profile-wise, than it does with other "woody leather" fragrances.

(Aside: Looking through other reviews, I was very taken aback by someone calling it a "smoother/drier Cedrat Boise"... this is incredibly wrong, and will absolutely ruin this fragrance for you if you go into it expecting anything in that wheelhouse.)

All-in-all, it's a pretty solid day-time, warmer-weather fragrance that will offend no-one by virtue of its sillage, but also offers very little in the way of evolution or modernity. I like it well enough, but I'm also in my mid-30s, and it hits me pretty hard in the nostalgia.

7.5/10. If you can find it for a good price, get it. If not, there are other things that can do the same general "thing", arguably better.

product_name: Colonia Intensa Acqua di Parma
review_content: Huge fan of the original Colonia and really wanted to like Intensa but I honestly cannot. To me, it smells way too "old man" like. Like something a grandfather might wear. Do not blind buy this one IMO

product_name: Colonia Intensa Acqua di Parma
review_content: Classy Italian cologne- the cardamom and ginger give it that extra warmth and oomph and make it more refined than the OG! The ever so slight hint of leather in the drydown also ensures better longevity than the OG. The best of the Colonia line, in my opinion!

product_name: Colonia Intensa Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I sprayed this on test blotter first, before looking at the notes, and wondered if there was a geranium note. There isn't of course but the lemon, ginger, cardomom, and mid of neroli, artemisia, and myrtle seems to impart a strong quasi-geranium facet. It wears differently than on blotter, with the substantial base notes really coming out. The mid seems subdued and supportive. It's one of the most subdued neroli notes I've encountered. And I think the ginger note is more prominent and significant in this composition than it gets credit for. It really gives a strong, longlived fresh zingyness and zest. With the citrus, it seems to almost mimic a breezy incense note. The ginger brings to mind my ginger oriented fragrances, most notably for me Serge Lutens 5 O'Clock au Gingembre. And with the breezy freshness and cedar in the base it almost seems a bit like a Houbigant Bois Mystique with ginger! I'm very surprised the ginger gets little mention. This is full bottle worthy for me and will be grouped with my ginger scents. Very nice.
Update 9/6/24: Wearing today, 30ish sprays and very little performance. Not like the first few times. Don't know what's wrong.

product_name: Colonia Intensa Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Colonia Intensa took a while for me to appreciate, and I suspect it's because one of the first times I wore it was on the train from Bologna to Verona in the sweltering mid-July summer heat, while this fragrance evokes imagery of riding down the Amalfi coast on a vespa while wearing a crisp white linen shirt and a cooling sea breeze running through your hair.

Nevertheless, it has surpassed the original Colonia for me. The citrus blast in the opening so typical for colognes has been tempered by the zesty warm ginger and sweet spicy cardamom, foreshadowing the woody and leathery drydown. While I found there's no risk in overspraying a little, don't expect this to fill up the room like your average 20 sprays of CDNIM would; the magic lies in its subtlety and discretion, this is a fragrance of good taste.

I see where people are coming from calling it a mature fragrance. There's something I find rejuvenating about it though. Your grandfather wore the original Colonia; you wear Colonia Intensa.

product_name: Colonia Intensa Acqua di Parma
review_content: The opening is very barbershop-ish, almost too mature for me, but then it starts to develop into a more fresh, rich, woody-citrusy fragrance. A date night fragrance, but office safe. For the price you can find it at a discounter, a steal. Also the longevity is far better than other ADP's.

product_name: Colonia Intensa Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I got this after trying Mickey Lee Soapworks Colonia Di Agrumi shave soap which is supposed to be cloned from this scent profile. But when I got the cologne I realized although similar it’s very different. The soap smells more like the opener of this scent only. Once the cologne hits the drydown it gets a little brash for me. Something in the mids makes me nauseous.. maybe the neroli idk ..
But all in all I do like the scent. I just wish I could buy a more simple version of this with just that opening. Maybe Pura or Essentia would be closer?! But I will keep this still because I can see myself liking it more and more as I get older. It’s very mature even for me and I like mature scents. I’m 32. I rate this for now as a 6.5/10. I will edit as it e goes on. Stay blessed guys. Much love.

product_name: Colonia Intensa Acqua di Parma
review_content:
No question this is quality stuff from my all-time favorite house of Acqua di Parma. But it is quite dry/sour in the base. There's no real sweetness or levity to the composition once the top notes dissipate. That's probably what makes it feel dated to some.

I used to really enjoy wearing this in Boston in the humid afternoons of late summer and early fall. But now, out here in the Las Vegas desert, I just can't pull it off. Instead, I find myself reaching for "wetter" alternatives such as Creed Viking or even Colonia Futura.

Update 02/10/24: Took my bottle on a recent trip to the Dominican Republic, and I can confirm that Intensa performs much better in a humid environment. Some moisture in the air brings out a smooth earthiness that's lacking when worn in a dry climate.

product_name: Colonia Intensa Acqua di Parma
review_content: I love this scent as my partner wears it and it is pleasant enough for me to wear as a unisex fragrance too. Bright, uplifting, and intoxicating.

product_name: Colonia Intensa Acqua di Parma
review_content: Really like it. Tradional colone, as the name implies, but it's far from dated. I find it very well-balanced and believe its at a fair price-point. Also it lasts.

product_name: Colonia Intensa Acqua di Parma
review_content: It's interesting when I first got it the Neroli citrus combo just didn't sit with me. I really liked the scent, but didn't identify with it. Fast forward a year, and half of the bottle is gone. Such an easy scent to wear. When I'm struggling to choose what to wear, this one is an easy no-brainer.

product_name: Colonia Intensa Acqua di Parma
review_content:
It was not love at first sniff, but Intensa has worked its magic on me over time and I really enjoy this fragrance now. Even though I probably like the smell of Essenza slightly more, Intensa is much more versitile which is why I use it more often than Essenza.

Intensa opens with a woody citrus blast but after a short while I can hardly smell any citrus and what I get for most of the duration is a dry spicy wood with some dark patchouli underneath. The scent is farily linear and has an impressive performance on my skin.

I think this fragrance is a bit too thick to be used in the summer heat. I enjoy it more during early autumn and as an evening scent. I have used it with success on dates and even got a compliment from a guy in a bar when I used it. Very masculine and mature scent without being old fashioned.

product_name: Colonia Intensa Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Some time ago, I received a sample of Mirto de Panarea from the Blu Mediterraneo line, which drew my attention to Acqua di Parma perfumes. Looking hard, you can find it for a very reasonable price (especially testers). I bought a bottle of Mirto de Panarea and I was so enchanted, and heard so many good things about the brand's other perfumes, that I decided to blind buy this one, Colonia Intensa. For the notes and reviews, youtube videos, etc. I didn't seem to have much error. I was then imagining the naturalness I felt in the only perfume I had known from them so far, in the structure of a modernized and smoky cologne.

Well... when the perfume arrived, already in the spray bottle I realized that I had already smelled that smell. I sprayed it on my skin and it felt a little different but still familiar. I noticed that it reminded me a lot in the drydown, another perfume I had that was fresh with a smoky touch: Acqua di Giò Profumo. It looked like a very diluted Profumo. This perfume is officially an EDC but in practice, it has the performance of a medium EDT (3 to 4 hours). It is quite close to the skin. Despite not being listed, I can smell the lavender note, which made me solve the riddle of the scent I smelled in the spray bottle: Believe it or not, it reminded me of Seiva de Alfazema, an old and cheap lavender cologne from Brazil. It is not identical to any of the mentioned perfumes, but for me, among the perfumes I know, it is the memory it brings. It doesn't have a bright citrus and is quite spicy too.

Although not a bad scent, I honestly didn't like it. I think that between it and Mirto de Panarea, there are miles in terms of perceived quality. Listen, perceived quality, because I know that it must have a lot of quality in the raw materials, but that's not what the final smell gives me. I think there is an exaggeration of those who report 7 or 8 hours of fixation. I was quite disappointed, because, despite liking AdG Profumo, it's a perfume that I've used a lot and had its time for me, I don't miss it and I would have zero desire to wear a perfume that looks like a watered down version of it (yes, I know that this one was released before Profumo, so I'd say AdG was an improved version of that). It really has a mature perfume vibe, but when I want that vibe, I prefer to use Terre d'Hermes, which I like better and performs much better.

I didn't do the proper homework before buying (meaning, test before) because unfortunately, in Brazil, we don't have the same access to perfumes of this type, with the inviting prices that we find out in Europe or the US. If I was to find a decant, order it and wait for it to arrive, this perfume would probably have already been sold and who knows when (or if) it would be available again.

Finally, in my opinion, neither this nor this nor Mirto de Panarea (which I loved) are worth the full price charged in Brazil (in 2023, more than US$200 per 100ml). At that price, I think it's better to buy 2 or 3 designer fragrances of similar proposals. And I don't recommend doing what I did: buying without testing (and from now on, I'll try to follow my own recommendation).

product_name: Colonia Intensa Acqua di Parma
review_content: It's a bit synthetic once the citruses are gone.

product_name: Colonia Intensa Acqua di Parma
review_content: This is in the same ballpark as Dior Eau Sauvage EDT. It's less classy and with less performance. Half of the notes are just for support. My nose which is not really trained to identify notes can only smell citruses, cardamom, musk, patchouli. I find not leather, ginger etc. Having said that. It's still a far better, classier fragrance than most of the modern summer fragrances. I can name at least 20 fragrances that are selling like crazy that I would not buy against AdP Colonia Intensa. Do I love it? No, not as much as Dior Eau Sauvage but this will make you smell different for sure. I see a lot of people saying that it should not be worn by young men. Not true, I don't smell this dated, it's more like classy & timeless. This is a great buy if you get it around $60-$65 which is what I paid for a 100ml tester.

product_name: Colonia Intensa Acqua di Parma
review_content: Awesome old man fragrance.. one for my future self. It's lovely, just hard to imagine the mood or mode for someone my age. I think for the right man, this would be a spot on gift and it is a wholeheartedly appealing smell.

product_name: Colonia Intensa Acqua di Parma
review_content: Great scent. I bought a bottle for my collection. The Ginger, Myrrh and Neroli blend just keeps me coming back to it more than the orginal. This is a mature scent more depth and spice to the original fresh colonia.

product_name: Colonia Intensa Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I don’t really understand many of the reviews here. On me this is an outright gorgeous warm musky incense from start to finish. It starts out a little lighter and airy - but still incensed - then as it progresses the base comes up a bit more and the musky incense gets a bit deeper, slightly darker but not too heavy. I don’t really get any citrus, ginger or even what I normally perceive as cardamom. I don’t detect much of the mid notes either except for the slightly lighter feel the incensed effect generates. It’s mostly about the base notes but even then not in the balance popularity shows. Overall I find it very musky in fact. Absolutely stunning scent that I genuinely can’t understand why anybody would box this into an older age bracket, or any age bracket for that matter! Certainly on my skin this feels throughly modern and entirely ageless, very versatile and also completely unisex. Maybe it’s just my skin chemistry? I think maybe so because I only see one other person in the reviews having a similar incensed skin response. It almost reminds me of ‘smokers’ which is a kind of musky slightly warm lightly cinnamon like candy we have in my country.
I feel a bit weird for reviewing it like this for the fact that I can’t see any obviously similar reviews, and I know my juice is the real deal because it’s a proper Acqua di Parma mini I got in a properly boxed and branded 3 piece set from a thoroughly reputable perfume store. I guess the one thing that does stand out is how very differently this scent seems to respond on different peoples skins, so that may account for something. But either way I’ll be getting my hands on a full 6oz as soon as humanly possible! Awesome top shelf juice!

product_name: Colonia Intensa Acqua di Parma
review_content:
On my skin, the opening is all cardamom and virtually no citrus. It then slowly grows in to this intensely bitter aroma that I can almost taste as I smell it. The dry down is harsh a cedar. Traces of leather are there but insufficient to mellow out the acrid feeling. Still looking for the benzoin, and musk comes out a little bit only if I rinse it off. All around leafy green/woody bitter aroma on me.

On paper, this is a not unpleasant, if only quite an «old man», scent. But, although I’m pushing 40, I’m no grandpa yet so it’s a big disappointment for me. If it agrees with your skin chemistry, this could possibly be a good cologne. Although it reacts badly on my skin, the different notes on paper are very natural, organic smelling to me.

Get a good sampler and try it multiple times to see if it fits. I would definitely not recommend this as a blind buy!

product_name: Colonia Intensa Acqua di Parma
review_content: At the age of 43 I feel way too young for this. It may work for me 27 years later. I'll wait.... this should be called Toxic Masculinity Extrait

product_name: Colonia Intensa Acqua di Parma
review_content:
At the time of my last "review" of this, I think that my sentiments was that this was a very good, but not great cologne style fragrance that came across as slightly dated, and while I do still think this is an old school fragrance that you could easily wear in a different time, I appreciate it so much more and actually my younger female co-workers have complimented me when I've worn this more than any other fragrance I've worn with the exception of Dior Sauvage Elixir, probably because that one projects like such a monster. However, in order to not get sidetracked, I just have to say that this is a GORGEOUS scent and I've always thought that, but it's grown on me a lot. This can be worn in almost any situation, I feel like it only really fits if you're wearing a nice shirt like a polo, a button-down shirt, something like that because I feel like this would be a little odd coming from a guy wearing a band t-shirt or something along those lines. Not to be judgy, but I think that fragrances should fit what you're wearing and this one fits a slightly dressier but still perfectly casual look. I think this could also work formally, but it's perfect for business casual style I think. It also has that extra oomph to cut through the cold that other Acqua Di Parma fragrances don't often have, it has this resinous and slightly darker edge to it in the base while still being bright off the top and airy in a way that's suitable for the summer. Performs well for an EDC, it lasts for 6-7 hours and it pushes pretty decent in the beginning, people around you especially in a closed space will notice you when you wear this and I've gotten compliments.

I don't think kids would like this fragrance, this is for 30 and up in my view, and a lot of 30 year olds might not be into stuff like this even. This is a little bit more advanced than your typical designer fragrances, I feel like Acqua di Parma is actually an ideal transitioning phase between designers and getting into indie and niche because they're somewhere in between the two, and quality and sophistication that you get from their fragrances are slightly better than most designers. This is my favorite of the ones I've smelled so far, although I've yet to try the Assoluta and Club versions which I think I would like a lot. This is near perfection for me, and probably the best EDC in my collection so far, I hope to find the Assoluta version at a decent price, and also add the Essenza and Club versions soon.

product_name: Colonia Intensa Acqua di Parma
review_content:
This is such a fantastic fragrance, probably the best of the colonia line. The name is right on point, it's like a more intense version of the original. The smell is similar, but punchier and less airy.

In my opinion, it's one of the few that don't change a ton from opening to drydown. A nice, gentleman scent. Unlike the original, this can be a year round scent rather than just a summer scent.

product_name: Colonia Intensa Acqua di Parma
review_content: Very much reminiscent of a barbershop fragrance. The sort of scent for those in the 50+ club. Not my favorite, but I appreciate it.

product_name: Colonia Intensa Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I definitely sense the DNA of the original, I think mostly because of the type of citrus used, but this one has its own profile for sure. I really like it! You can hardly beat the OG; however, this one is correctly named in my opinion. I don’t mean that it’s just a stronger version, I just mean the added notes are more intense while still getting a subtle background of the original.

Like others have said, the dry-down is great, although I do like the opening as well. It has a good progression of note changes. It’s darker and spicier, and does have that leather element that’s perfect with the other notes. It’s less fresh and sparkling, even with the citrus, but that is a good thing for what this is.

Nice projection for a couple hours on me. Performance is mid-moderate for me, similar to the OG. I feel it’s safe to overspray this one a bit. I would say this is good for any season, but wouldn’t be surprised if better with heat, which I’ll eventually find out for certain.

product_name: Colonia Intensa Acqua di Parma
review_content: Very gentlemanly fragrance it’s like connecting the Colonia smell with how will smell nowadays but something in between.

product_name: Colonia Intensa Acqua di Parma
review_content: This will always have a place in my collection. It’s big and robust, but in a polite, gentlemanly way, and I reach for it so often it, that I would be lost without it. I wear Intensa year-round and receive many compliments when I do. A real keeper.

product_name: Colonia Intensa Acqua di Parma
review_content: I stay in the tropics, and yet I keep getting wif's of this fragrance 12 hours after wearing it. Its never over the top, this is my best Aqua fragrance in the market. this perfume is really soooo cool, the projection is great, it can be worn all year round, and its a EDC, the price was also really really a still about 100$. After being disappointed by several niche houses with prices 3 to four times this product, I think I will keep this for a long time to come.

product_name: Colonia Intensa Acqua di Parma
review_content: It smells ok but the aromachemicals used for the musks in this give me a headache. For the money I prefer Terre d'Hermes EdP or for a bit more Amouage Beach Hut Man.

product_name: Colonia Intensa Acqua di Parma
review_content: The opening of this is basically what Jagermeister smells like. Almost threw up when smelled it. I imagine this evolves into something quite different after a while However, I just had to wash it off my skin as quickly as possible due to the Jagermeister smell.

product_name: Colonia Intensa Acqua di Parma
review_content: The opening is okay but the woody dry down smells is too old smelling, same thing ADG profumo actually.

product_name: Colonia Intensa Acqua di Parma
review_content: This is class, starts off with expensive citrus and cardamom scent for 20 minutes until it settles with a warmer sweet scent but still has that neroli lingering in top of it

product_name: Colonia Intensa Acqua di Parma
review_content: Not for me. Wears too old and the dry down comes too quickly. I also only get cedar at the base. Unpleasant; reminds me of going to the store with grandpa.

product_name: Colonia Intensa Acqua di Parma
review_content: Wow. BY FAR my favorite ADP fragrance I've tried yet, and most of them are solid options (Club and Essenza in particular are great). This is gorgeous, masculine, inoffensive, a bit barbershop. Bright citrusy, but also deep and warm/spicy. I've found it hard to find a summer heat fragrance that James Bond would wear, but for sure this is it. This is gray blazer while driving around Italy in an old convertible. It might not be the absolute best choice for sweaty summer days, but this is like a soapy clean citrusy smell with tons of suave and introverted character. Strongly reminds me of Dior Eau Sauvage Parfum in terms of masculine character, but without that tart elemi/citron combo that is unbearable in heat. Replace the elemi and citron with neroli and spicy lemon/bergamot, so it comes across as less "scented shaving foam clean (barbershop)" and more "clean shaven and soapy in summer heat". Very versatile. Signature worthy. Doesn't last very long though. Highly recommend.

product_name: Colonia Intensa Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I think Colonia Intensa is a masterpiece. A very classy masculine 24/7/365 signature worthy scent, unique in a world of citrus freshies. How did Morillas and Demarchy succeed with making a citrus freshie that ends so fluently with leather and benzoin? You go to a garden party wearing a lovely citrus, and when the day turns to night, you're already wearing an evening scent. Two scents in one.

That ginger is fantastic. The leather note has the same lovely bitterness as Bottega Veneta Pour Homme, but I like Intensa better.

If it's a masterpiece, why not rate it a Love? For me it's the myrtle. It works well, adds a unique, white fresh chalky floral to the mid, but I'm just not a fan of myrtle. It is more pronounced than current Fragrantica votes will have you believe, since the note was only added in the databank here in the winter of 2021-22.

product_name: Colonia Intensa Acqua di Parma
review_content: Masculine citrus opening, almost immediately turns into a soapy scent and dries down to a pleasant musk. I wasn't blown away by this scent when I initially bought it about 5 months ago, I thought it was mediocre, however after 5 months it seems to have become more complex and pleasant. If you like citrus barbershop scents then it's a winner.

product_name: Colonia Intensa Acqua di Parma
review_content: My signature scent, smells divine, have received so many compliments when wearing it, if you want a classy masculine fragrance that you can wear all year round this is it. Pure perfection in a bottle!

product_name: Colonia Intensa Acqua di Parma
review_content: Not bad. But it's definitely not the traditional cologne one might think. It leans a lot to the mature side. I would not recommend people younger than 30 years old to wear this.

product_name: Colonia Intensa Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Lacks the citrus punch of OG…more spices/warm opening blended w/bergamot vs the magical citrus openings I’ve come to love w/ADP.

Dries down to a classic gentlemanly vibe of neroli, leather and woods. Extremely pleasant DNA suitable for all occasions…although younger crowd might not consider it a “fun” fragrance.

Longevity and projection are average. It goes on super wet…so you kind of know it’s not going to last that long. One can certainly pull this off year round by varying the sprays. In the line…I actually think this is more suitable to colder days…allowing the cardamom and leather to warm you up a bit.

For the entire line of ADP, it’s not in my top 5…but I’m still happy to have it. Grab a sample of it before buying full bottle.

product_name: Colonia Intensa Acqua di Parma
review_content: This is absolute spring/summer perfection! A classy, masculine, citrus with good performance. The citrus/ginger/cardamom opening paired with that leather/cedar base is all I could ever want in a masculine summer fragrance. “Bergamot Ginger Ale” is the best way I can describe this opening to this scent. After about 15-20 minutes, the leather, cedar and patchouli just take this fragrance to another level, giving it a masculine sophistication that is atypical of normal summer citruses. There is a sexiness about the dry down just screams “grown man w/his shit together”. 10/10 - buy this now!

product_name: Colonia Intensa Acqua di Parma
review_content: I applaud the brand for making a fragrance targeted to men with a deep masculine vibe. Nowadays it's a no-no to create art (fragrance) targeted to a certain gender. Nonetheless, Colonia Intensa is one of the classiest Spring/Summer scents made in a long time. Sure, women (is that okay to say) can wear it. But make no mistake, Alberto Morillas created this with a gentleman in mind. Too bad if that pops your cherry... no pun intended.

product_name: Colonia Intensa Acqua di Parma
review_content: WHAT A GREAT LONGLASTING COLOGNE, I WAS SCEPTICAL AT FIRST BUT I GOT 10 HOURS ON MY SKIN, .OVE THE WOOY DRYDOWN.

product_name: Colonia Intensa Acqua di Parma
review_content: Super Solid if you like classic male fragrances. Opening is my favorite. Dry down is less interesting. I’m happy I have a bottle. Anytime anywhere fragrance 37+ IMO

product_name: Colonia Intensa Acqua di Parma
review_content:
One might imagine an Italian gentlemen, mature but aging gracefully, his Negroni on the table in front of him on a table at an outdoor bar. His crisp white shirt shows not a single wrinkle, and a dark blue sweater is wrapped around his neck by its sleeves. He is contemplative; he is lost in his thoughts when the beautiful young waitress asks if he would like another drink. He finally looks up and smiles as he answers in the affirmative.

The bright opening of the citruses draw one in, but there is so much more than just the cheery opening. The myrtle, artemisia, neroli, cedar and Guaiac wood make this more complex than just any scent drifting across the promenade on a warm day. The leather is there, but it is not prominent. It a hint of leather, a strap wrapped around his wrist.

This scent could stay with you through the evening. When night falls, this man will have had yet another drink with the beautiful companion that will ultimately join him. She pauses as she puts her second kiss beside his cheek as he greets her. She inhales and wishes she could know this scent forever. But by morning, it will be only a faint remembrance of the night before.

I really love this scent. This is a scent for a well-made drink in a beautiful place.

product_name: Colonia Intensa Acqua di Parma
review_content: This is a nice cologne, but it's pretty old school i.e. in the style of classic Italian style EDCs. A little bit different, I can't say I get the resins and all of that, but I still have only had it for a day and haven't given it a full wearing that it's due before I send in my final thoughts.

product_name: Colonia Intensa Acqua di Parma
review_content:
مرکباتی رسمی با وجوه کاملا مردانه
به نسبت سبک مرکباتی کاری خاص و ارزشمند است و البته اصلا همه پسند نیست
-----------
Scent & Quality: 8/10
Longevity: 7/10
Sillage: 6/10
Creativity & Uniqueness: 7/10
Affordability: 5/10
-----------
Overall: 6.6/10

product_name: Colonia Intensa Acqua di Parma
Colonia Intensa Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Acqua di Parma Colonia Intensa is clean, fresh, citrusy, with a great lightly leathery and musky dry down. This is masculine, elegant, classy and complex.
On my skin Colonia Intensa lasts about 7h (longer than other AdP; last night I sprayed some on the back of my hand, and there was still a faint trace of it this morning), with great projection in the first hour or so, and then becoming a nice skin scent.
This is beautifully blended. Acqua di Parma never disappoints.

product_name: Colonia Intensa Acqua di Parma
review_content: aqua di parma does not want its customers to stink and to walk around smelling like teenagers who pounced on the perfume shelf. With this masterpiece you will smell like a refined gentleman who knows how to lives his life and who consumes everything in moderation. And that is called aristocracy...

product_name: Colonia Intensa Acqua di Parma
review_content: only if it had a good projection ...... it only lasted 3 - 4 hours on me

product_name: Colonia Intensa Acqua di Parma
review_content: Opening is a fresh citrus and neroli. Very clean and refreshing soap. After about 5-10 minutes, a slightly animalic leather rises, smells very warm. After 3-4 hours on my skin, a very light musk appears. I don't expect to smell this on anyone under 40.

product_name: Colonia Intensa Acqua di Parma
review_content:
The brands description of this is truly accurate. "Colonia Intensa is masculine, intensive, noble and classical." Absolutely stunning fragrance. I haven't come across anything like this one. I own Colonia, Colonia Club and Colonia Pura. This one is not like any of the others.
Intensa comes across very expensive and rich. This is clean, charming, self assured, masculinity at its finest. Expertly blended. This conveys sophistication and someone in complete control of his mind. It also has a welcoming and calming vibe perfect for short encounters where you want to exude brilliance and confidence.
The longevity is poor, but the 1-2 hrs you receive are worth your money. I think given it's quality the performance can be forgiven, but not entirely.

Scent 5/5
Performance 3/5
Versatility 4/5
Compliments 3/5
Uniqueness 5/5

Rating 4/5

product_name: Colonia Intensa Acqua di Parma
review_content: I found the opening was a bit coarse, but it settled down to something more mellow and warm within minutes. I would have to describe this as a "traditional old man's fragrance." Although I enjoy the smell, I find it to be uninteresting. I prefer something a bit more challenging and creative. The dry-down is clean and soapy, which I do enjoy. When it comes to clean and soapy fragrances, however, I tend to prefer the greener varieties, such as Mugler Cologne. For its price, this is a good value, high-quality spring-summer-fall fragrance for its intended target audience.

product_name: Colonia Intensa Acqua di Parma
review_content:
عطر صيفي أقمر بهيّ الطّلعة . مكوناته بنقاء مبين لا يخطئه أنف ، و تركيبته بسيطة و غير معقدة و في ذلك يكمن جماله و يتجلى ما يتمتع به المصمم من براعة و حرفية عالية في الجمع بين نوتات دارجة و تقديمها في ثوب مليح أغرّ .

نفحات تجسد بشكل حرفي أناقة كلاسيكية من الطراز الإيطالي الأصيل 🇮🇹

توازن مثالي و سلس بين الحمضيات ، التوابل الطازجة و أخشاب طريّة غضّة ؛ يستمر كذلك في إفتتاحية تدوم لفترة من الزمن حتى تلتحق بالركب تلميحات جلدية و القليل من دفقات صمغية راتنجية متمثلة في المر و الجاوي ، فتكسب العطر عمقاً و دفئاً و تزيده وضاءة و إشراقاً .

إنحاز للجانب الذكوري بالكلية ، و لفئة عمرية تخطت حاجز الأربعين سنة ؛ كما يمكن إستعماله في جميع الأوقات و المناسبات .

product_name: Colonia Intensa Acqua di Parma
review_content: This GEM is made to elevate your mood and makes you haaapy.such a stunnig perfume

product_name: Colonia Intensa Acqua di Parma
review_content: I'm not someone who gets a kick out of criticising fragrances for the sake of it on here. But having blind bought a 50ml bottle I must say the performance of this fragrance is very substandard. Not what you would expect from something claiming to be 'intensa'. Next to no projection or longevity from 6 sprays. Will have to double that to 12 to get anything out of it. Definitely try before you buy.

product_name: Colonia Intensa Acqua di Parma
review_content: Having worn this more, it smells like Creeds spice and wood.

product_name: Colonia Intensa Acqua di Parma
review_content: A go to for me when i want to be fresh.

product_name: Colonia Intensa Acqua di Parma
review_content: This one is so frustrating because it smells amazing. Almost a modernised version of the original colonia with some subtle smoky, leather elements to it. I say it's frustrating because it doesn't project at all. It's very thin but smells amazing. If this had a more power behind it, I'd only ever buy this fragrance.

product_name: Colonia Intensa Acqua di Parma
review_content:
This is a nice soapy smell which doesn’t smell dated, it is fairly light, projection and longevity wise! This smells like Lalique L'Insoumis’ dry down, which is like half of the price of Intensa (off discounters) and around 1/4th the market price!
Slightly disappointed not gonna lie! But it smells good and it made me appreciate L'insoumis more than I did before (silver lining)


Do check the profile of person and their perfume choices before taking their opinion seriously.

product_name: Colonia Intensa Acqua di Parma
review_content: One of the most beautiful citrus fragrances, and even tho i usually dont care for overly summerly citrus, this is probably my favorite, but man, the performance is dreadful on this one, what a shame for such a gorgeous, natural smelling scent. But if i ever go in Italy for summer vacation, i know what bottle to bring with me

product_name: Colonia Intensa Acqua di Parma
review_content: Beautifully classy scent, last a good while too although projection is muted (which it should be for this style). Good value if obtained through a discounter.

product_name: Colonia Intensa Acqua di Parma
review_content: Myrhh, leather, and benzoine in a summer fragrance? You bet and in the hot humid triple digit summer days in Houston, Tx. this shines! 2 sprays on my clothes lasts me the whole work day. What a gorgeous gentlemanly scent in fact it is so gorgeous that I am officially making ADP Colonia Intensa my signature scent as of today dethroning Dunhill Icon. This is also my first full bottle niche fragrance. Nice creation by the dream team, this a gem. I look forward to wearing ADP Colonia Leather also in the fall and winter.

product_name: Colonia Intensa Acqua di Parma
review_content: Subtle and nuanced warm weather fragrance. Opens with a foamy lemon and warm cardamom. Not much projection, but it leaves a pleasant scent of sweet woods and neroli on my skin.

product_name: Colonia Intensa Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Time for another Italian fragrance. Opens up with a cozy accord of Swedish mulled wine a k a glögg. It's probably the cardamom and bergamot. It's really pleasant but who cares about top notes? They're gone in minutes. Call me boring and uncultured but I'm just being pragmatic here, ok?

Ok. So, I get soapy tanginess with a faint hint of bitterness from the wormwood. Mostly soap though. Later on there's some musk but I don't feel the promised patchouli. The leather is what Colonia Intensa is all about in the end though. A great, mature and perhaps woody leather.

This is a complex fragrance with a lot of subtetly. You can tell the duo of perfumers know what they're doing. It's also an EdC so it's sadly subtle in itself. Once the leather develops it's limited to my skin. But what a nice leather!

Anyway, this is a businesslike and sophisticated fragrance without strictness and rigidity. Maturity without machismo. I'm just a measly warehouse worker and this isn't the forklift-operating scent for me. But it sure is a nice one. And that could be the problem; it's nice but not much more.

Birger Karlsson the middle sized middle manager on a middle sized IT company in a middle sized city sprays Colonia Intensa on his neck and what's left of his hair. He pops a couple of prescription opiates to deal with his old hockey injury. Entering his surprisingly large Volvo he curses his PE teacher for recommending sports as an investment in long-term health. Birger puts some live recordings of Pink Floyd on the stereo (despite working with IT he has no idea how to use streaming services) and reminisces about when he was young, had a full head of hair, a budding hockey career, a shy redhead girlfriend, and a ticket to his favorite band. A ticket to grand things. An exciting future. But at least he smells nice on his way from the suburb this dreary Monday morning.

tl;dr – 7 out of 10 shy redhead girlfriends

product_name: Colonia Intensa Acqua di Parma
review_content:
One of my favorite summer go to fragrances. Composed by the dream team perfumers of Alberto Morilla and Francois Demachy. Citrus, woody, fresh spicy with a woody drydown. My wife loves this fragrance on me and always compliments me which always amazes me as I own over 46 bottles of niche perfumes. Yes, believe it or not, I am a frag head!

My 3 P's
- Projection 7/10
- Performance 8/10
- Price 8/10

product_name: Colonia Intensa Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Now this is lovely. Citrus, herbal, soapy feel but lifted by spice which wafts around beautifully in the drydown. Sadly moderate performance, else would have been a top ten for me.
4/5

product_name: Colonia Intensa Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Clean, creamy, citrus scent. Smells like a bath soap. Inoffensive, and very casual. I did not even know that there’s a leather accord in this until I read it here in Fragrantica. All I can smell is the floral citrus. A more natural version of Kenneth Cole Reaction. Has the same poor longevity and weak sillage as well.

No projection even right after spraying. You would have to bury your nose where you spray it in order to catch a whiff of it. And I was very generous with the spray. I would recommend getting the Colonia Essenza instead. That one smells similar, but stays on for far longer and has decent projection. This is not a scent that you’d want to wear if you want to catch attention. This is for more intimate settings where people are standing close enough to smell.

Blind-bought a full bottle and regretting it. I am not happy with this one.

product_name: Colonia Intensa Acqua di Parma
review_content:
A very spicy and citrusy perfume with notes of leather, ginger, and wood. It starts off strong but quickly tone down. At first, I didn’t like it much, but after an hour I warmed up to it. This is a very masculine scent that is perfect for any occasions: Business meetings, dates, hanging around the house, etc. Perfect for any warm (not hot) days and nights.

The longevity is not that great, lasting about four hours before being barely noticeable. The sillage is pretty good though. 15 minutes after I put it on, I walked by my partner and they instantly were able to smell it. The price is pretty high: 175 USD for 100ml, which would be worth it in the longevity was longer.

Overall, this is a 7.5/10.

product_name: Colonia Intensa Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I received this fragrance as a gift I never smelled it before but I have smelled the Colonia but I Did not like the Colonia, but I really liked this one because it had a more masculine scent to it. I really began to like the fragrance witch is unique because I don't really like the colognes because they are weaker than. other fragrances in terms of sillage and longitivtiy.

this fragrance is quite a superstar its just the Colonia but it can be good for spring and fall time but I wont really recommend it for the winter, it still is good in the winter time but the silage wont be as good in the summer. anyways this fragrance is fresh and has a bit of spice and its extremely versatile for any occasion and at any age can a man wear this fragrance. it smells exactly like a business man. I personally rate it a 8/10

product_name: Colonia Intensa Acqua di Parma
review_content:
This is an interesting take on the original Acqua di Parma Colonia, but with a twist: Acqua di Parma Colonia Intensa adds leather, ginger and guaiac wood to a traditional citrus cologne, and thus makes it more mature, masculine and business like.

This is a very solid, good and reliable all rounder, suitable day and night, for formal and casual settings, all four seasons. A very versatile fragrance. Possibly the only citrus fragrance I've tried that is suitably for all four seasons.

But, at the same time, it lacks a soul, a heart and a character. It reminds me of a standardized, well equipped, luxurious, ultra modern hotel room that is well equipped with all possible amenities.
The problem is: It's not your home, and the hotel room has no character of its own. It's well built and efficient, but it isn't yours. It's a standardized venue and locale with no permanent dwellers.

That's how I feel about Acqua di Parma Colonia Intensa. Materialistic, efficient and well built for its purpose, but lacks a soul and a character.

The DNA and quality of Acqua di Parma are undeniably visible and present in Intensa. 

Final score: 7/10.

product_name: Colonia Intensa Acqua di Parma
review_content:
This is quite a lot of things for a cologne: it starts off with the light citrus being very prominent, and then the woods taking over, but with the leather always there (but never heavy). I can spot artemisia a mile off, and I can sense its bitterness as a minor note in here: normally, I hate anything bitter, but this with the guaiac works to give a slight edginess to what might otherwise be too soft.

I can see why younger people in particular might like this, given its interesting combination of being definitely present and yet oddly light simultaneously. This would be a nice warm-weather and daytime scent.

product_name: Colonia Intensa Acqua di Parma
review_content:
حين يجتمع إثنين من العطارين الأساطير في تاريخ العطور، حتماً النتيجة تكون في روعة هذا العطر، العطر يحمل طبع وDNA اكوا دي بارما، ولكن بلمسات مختلفة نوعاً ما، صحيح ان العطر من خط الكولونيا لكن اراه مختلف عن كونه كولونيا تقليدية، واذا اعتبرناه كولونيا فهو كولونيا بصورة فاخرة جداً..

حقيقة العطر تركيبته ورائحته شدتني من أول تجربة، وبعد عدة تجارب تأكدت انه يستحق أن يكون في مجموعتي، عطر جميل مختلف رجولي بامتياز، قد لا يعجب الكثيرين، أراه سيعجب من هم على حدود الـ ٣٠ فما فوق، الرجل الكلاسيكي سيحب هذا العطر، عطر يجمع الكلاسيكية والحداثة..

أداء العطر كعادة عطور اكوا دي بارما متوسط، ممكن ثبات ٤-٥ ساعات مو أكثر من كذا، والاحظ فوحانه اكثر خصوصاً مع شدة الحر، احس العطر حولي فعلاً واشم رائحته كل ما تحركت، وانا راضي تمام الرضا عن ادائه، لكن لا تتوقع اداء وحشي على كل حال..

بالمناسبة كلمة بسيطة، كل ما تتعمق في مجال العطور أكثر واكثر، تكتشف أن الثبات والأداء شيء مساعد، الأساس دائماً وأبداً رائحة العطر، اتفهم أن كل واحد منّا يتمنى عطره يثبت ساعات وساعات ولكن إسأل نفسك ليه نشتري عطور؟ الأساس دائماً لطيب الرائحة وجمالها، فمثلاً أنا شخصياً أفضّل عطر جميل جداً كرائحة ثباته ٣-٤ ساعات على عطر ثباته ١٠ ساعات ولكن رائحته عادية جداً، لست بحاجة لاضافة عطور عادية لمجموعتي..

يستحق التجربة والشراء ولكن لابد من التجربة أولاً، وأنبّه على نقطة، هذا العطر كلاسيكي وحديث في نفس الوقت، يحمل طبع العطور القديمة ولكن ما تحسه قديم، هل وصلت الفكرة؟ وبالتالي قد لا يعجب الكثيرين وقد لا يناسب البعض، التجربة ضرورية قبل الشراء..

product_name: Colonia Intensa Acqua di Parma
review_content: Beautifully orchestrated and perfectly balanced. If you want to smell amazing in the hot summer days you shall try this. It has Aqua Di Parma’s DNA and it works beautifully with the added soft leather notes. Somehow I can get a huge resemblance to Hermes Bel Ami Veriver. It has something like a coke vibe about it. The longevity is ok but the projection is lacking. But in overall its a solid release which reminds you that you dont have to smell like shower gel or citruses at all times in summer mornings.

product_name: Colonia Intensa Acqua di Parma
review_content: To my nose this is the most soapy of the ADP Colonia flankers. Reading the reviews below I may be the odd one out in saying that. A little spicier than the OG which I’m not sure on its own is enough of a reason for it to exist? Essenza and Club have more of a fresh, unique, and intriguing identity. As always with Acqua di Parma it’s a sophisticated and quality scent, but a solid like and not quite a love for me.

product_name: Colonia Intensa Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I've sampled several formulations of their Colonia. Each shares a common quality that says respectable. I love every one I've tried but it's like wearing a halo. I also wish they were less unisex. Less neutering. But still, I just love their work and keep ordering more samples.
