This is the most masculine so far. It's possibly got more depth. It's kind of spicy in a manly way. Lasts longer on me than most of the others. If I was forced to choose only one ADP for life- I'd probably opt for this for it's versatility and relatively assertive quality. It would be a painful decision: So I'd tarnish my unwanted halo by smuggling in their Oud for winter. There're a lot of flankers I've still to try though.

product_name: Colonia Intensa Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Signature Worthy for a Classy Gent

If Colonia has survived over 100yrs then this modern facelift should boost the nostalgia factor by 1,000.

Blended perfectly
Citrus
Ceder
Leather
Resins
White Florals

A Real Mans Masterpiece 10/10

product_name: Colonia Intensa Acqua di Parma
review_content: This is one of the best fragrances out of my 150+ collection. It is so versatile. You can wear this any season at any occasion. You can easily make this a signature scent and wear this for 25 years. You wouldn't be bored at all. Its spicy, fresh and clean. Great for office. It even gets me compliments of people below 25 years. I see that people are voting this for spring and summer, but this works very well in cold weather too. Just try it.

product_name: Colonia Intensa Acqua di Parma
review_content: Beautiful fresh, clean, sunny, bright, refreshing citrus right out the gate. Lasts a good while on skin. I’ve been putting it on even before bed just because I enjoy it so much. Dries down to a elegant ginger soft light musk. I can still detect it in the morning. Perfect for Spring. Versatile. Energising and happy. Recommend.

product_name: Colonia Intensa Acqua di Parma
review_content:
A very nice twist on the original, that opens with citruses (like the original), followed by a prominent myrrh and a bit of neroli and benzoin, to finally drydown to a nice (but thin) artemisia/leather combo.
Despite being my favourite of this line, it's only a big like for me (that gives you an idea of my impression of the rest of this line) as it doesn't bring anything new, and his a bit 'thin bodied'. For a more full bodied take on the same theme, one might want to go towards Note di Colonia III, assuming one is ok for the ultra-vanillic myrrh drydown (instead of green leather), and also with the price.
Spring/Fall, 30+

product_name: Colonia Intensa Acqua di Parma
review_content: Nothing to write home about in terms of performance, but as a scent, this is great. I love the bright burst of citrus that gives way to deep woods and a warm, slightly spicy finish.

product_name: Colonia Intensa Acqua di Parma
review_content:
batch 2699x

i am not sure why this would be relegated to summer or just warm weather. new year day in sofia bulgaria, not cold, but not warm either. intensa shines.

it is clean and "classy" with a hint of darkness. the mid and base contrast nicely with the sunny top notes.

there are times when straightforward decent fragrance works. new year day under covid restrictions fits the bill. hopefulness, strength, and quiet happiness.

product_name: Colonia Intensa Acqua di Parma
review_content: Its a bit lesser soapy than the old original and can actually be used year around daytime as eves and I like it! So does the ladies.

product_name: Colonia Intensa Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I know that I’m going against the grain here. This is a great scents but dreadful performance. I have bought from 3 different reputable sources, including some official samples and all have “performed” for an hour to an hour and a half before becoming a weary cedar base.
I have tried it side by side with Essenza and several other great scents that blow 5his out of the water.
I so wanted to enjoy the same experience as when a colleague let me try his bottle a few years ago, but alas, it wasn’t to be. Maybe it’s my skin?

product_name: Colonia Intensa Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Wow probably the best from Acqua di Parma! I like the original Colonia abut Intensa takes it to a new level. More sophisticated, less soapy, masculine, exotic, pleasant.

The leather is not strong at all and is a very good combination with the citrus notes.

Like all the Colonia not a huge projection but is classy and elegant. A Colonia doesn't have to be too loud to be good. Elegance is subtle.

If you are looking for a masculine, and special Italian fragrance this is it.

product_name: Colonia Intensa Acqua di Parma
review_content: wooow .. it really works on a coat in a colder autumn weather around 16°C evening airy temperature .. just testing it! perfect (not dusty but bringing a hint of late summer vibe)

product_name: Colonia Intensa Acqua di Parma
review_content: This is my favourite ADP. Classy, fresh and sophisticated scent without the old man vibes. It starts sparkling citrus (the ginger really adds to the bite) and evolves into a slightly warm spicy scent. The classy woody and musky dry-down is the highlight for me. Overall, a clean, fresh and elegant scent that has many layers blended smoothly with perfection. I think it can be a signature day scent primarily for office. To me, a 10/10 and blind buy worthy.

product_name: Colonia Intensa Acqua di Parma
review_content:
As soon as I smelled this, I knew it was perfect for one of my brothers. It’s clean and manly without smelling like axe grooming products. This is not as soapy as Colonia, Essenza or Assoluta.

I really can’t tell you what I’m smelling besides something clean, fresh and manly. Lol. It also lacks any sweetness on my skin.

product_name: Colonia Intensa Acqua di Parma
review_content: My favorite from the line , this smells very very rich, clean , Fresh, citrusy, fresh spicy. The mix between citruces and the fresh spices makes this one very lovley very masculine my signature scent for summer and spring. Love it 😍

product_name: Colonia Intensa Acqua di Parma
review_content:
This is the first pungent freshie I ever stumble upon.

Not very nice.

product_name: Colonia Intensa Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Maaan, gorgeous, gorgeous, gorgeous.... I´m so glad i bought whole package .. I totally love it!!! So classy, sooo gentlemanish, soooo italian, sooo updated compared to original Colonia.

I´m sooo glad for it!!!! such a italian classiness!!!!
Office friedly

product_name: Colonia Intensa Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Rooty, sharp, masculine.

Citrus, dry woody, a spicy aldehyde feel.

Very classical, mature scent. I like it.

product_name: Colonia Intensa Acqua di Parma
review_content:
if you wanna feel like an italian gentleman ... Well here you go


Regarding the performance the ADP house doesn't have that much ...



For the smell its spicy and mild darkness ..

Projection softly...

Regards

product_name: Colonia Intensa Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Its late July and you just left the sunbed on the pool of your fav 5 star Italian hotel heading to your hotel room for a rest, now its 8 PM you took a cold shower and wore your linen oatmeal shirt, put on your watch and heavily sprayed Acqua di Parma - Colonia Intensa heading for your evening dinner at the terrace.

9/10 a masterpiece almost!

product_name: Colonia Intensa Acqua di Parma
review_content: Sound track . The Heart of Saturday Night .

product_name: Colonia Intensa Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Having worn most of the standard aftershave from using my dads old Spice and the getting a job I could upgrade to fragrances like Jazz and Kouros, many aftershaves later I was treated to this product and it changed the way I buy and wear men’s and uni sex fragrances. This is by far my favourite summer fragrance it’s just amazing. .......
Down side it stopped projecting its self after a couple of hours and I just can’t come to terms spending this much on a product that leaves my shirts smelling amazing but hardly any on me. Still worth a try as different skins and body oil’s deals with fragrances on different levels.

product_name: Colonia Intensa Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Typical and classical Cologne like Nenuco or 4171. Citric and bit spicy opening with a soft leathery and bit balsámic and woody dry down. Innthe middle the neroli, protagonist of many if this kind of fragances, being also very similar to other perfumes like neroli portofino by Tom Ford, basul & neroli by jo Malone or Cologne indelebile by frederick Malle. I had the colonia intensa body milk and It has even better performance than the fragance. Smells good but the performance is a.bit weak and the price a bit high for what It is. Unisex and for everyday use.

Scent: 7.5
Longevity: 6
Sillage: 5
Quality/price: 4
Versatility: 9
Originality: 5
Global: 6.5

product_name: Colonia Intensa Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Opening smells of bitter orange peel mixed with a heavy dose of ginger. Drydown basically smells of a very intoxicating, dry Hot Tamale candy. But it works. Not sure how or why how this works so well but AdP figured out how to create a strangely magnetic cologne. I’d compare this to a much less sweet, much spicier version of Carolina Herrera CH Men Privé. 6-8hrs longevity with solid projection.

9.3/10 I love this stuff

product_name: Colonia Intensa Acqua di Parma
review_content: Sophisticated man-fresh. This would be the luxurious soap (shower gel...?) you'd find in an Italian pensione familiare in a small village, off the beaten tourist path- nothing you'd encounter in a mainstream store or hotel. Intensa has a beautiful depth about it, a mild richness combined with the typical fresh and clean top notes. It also retains that desirable combination of good longevity and polite sillage. It is subtle but extremely interesting. ADP has done a fine job with this one.

product_name: Colonia Intensa Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I never cared for flankers as i've had pretty neutral feelings towards them but the colonia flankers are the best from this house, hands down.
This is not the typical peppery citrus AdP is known for that comes off as mature. This is a more rounded scent where the myrhh and leather gives it a masculine touch, but doesn't take anything away from it being a citrus scent, just that it tones down the citrus from being zesty. Like a mandarin citrusy and not lemon citrusy.
Best worn in spring/autumn. During summer it turns more musky.

Impossible to overspray too. This is one of those that's very soft on the nose and you won't offend anyone. Blended in a way that nothing jumps out trying to clash with the other accords. Overall just very pleasant and crowd pleasing. And yeah, definitely not mature like some people would say about the rest in the colonia line.

product_name: Colonia Intensa Acqua di Parma
review_content: One simple comment. This perfume works really well. Unobtrusive, fresh, inviting, solid, classy, all-rounder. A citrusy combo with little bit of wood and little bit of spices and little bit of flowers, and such a good blend. A+ from me.

product_name: Colonia Intensa Acqua di Parma
review_content:
If you want Zegna's Essenza Di Zegna - well here it is!

It even has a little freshier top and a little more freshness and not As strong, but it's 95% there!

Look no further guys!

product_name: Colonia Intensa Acqua di Parma
review_content:
In my opinion the regular colonia is best when you're wearing linen clothing on a scorching hot summer day and you just want to smell fresh and sophisticated, like you're just out of the shower. This one on the other hand, is a lukewarm summer evening when you're going out to meet friends and the ground is still a bit warm.
The spices gives it a lot of depth and it's definitely not as soapy as the regular colonia; in fact, if I would've smelled this and the regular colonia blind, I probably wouldn't have even connected them.

Highly recommend everyone to smell this for an interesting spicy summer perfume instead of the citrus blasts that most people think of when they talk about summer perfumes.

product_name: Colonia Intensa Acqua di Parma
review_content: A Strong like. But I do wonder why Myrrh is not ranked higher here as it is very dominating on my skin. This is a very well composed, very elegant, very bright and classy chypre. Starts off spicy, citrusy and a bit herbal - the Parma DNA is here again but then the leather comes in along with the myrrh adding a layer of depth and sophistication to the entire thing. It becomes a bit smoky due to the Myrrh. Eau de Sauvage Parfum came to mind at first sniff, so there's similarities here somewhere. This might even be better than the latest Dior formulation - which in my opinion is quite disastrous. Anyhow, I applaud Mr Morillas for this delicate offering. Quite excellent with a solid price tag.

product_name: Colonia Intensa Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Bought this fragrance by mere chance. I was actually looking out for a summer fragrance and after several testings I saw the Acqua di Parma booth. I hesitated to try since I know they are expensive, but gave it a try and ended up picking this one.

I love it! Some will find this one to barbershop like, but that's its very appeal.

Sun dried citrus, Italian herbs, patchouli, musk and leather will envelop you rapidly and for a long time, so don't over spray. This is a perfect all around office fragrance that will set you as a classy, clean, manly man.

Beau de jour is for me the closest to what this smells like with the additional heavy creamy leather and aromatic herbs instead of flowers.

Make sure to get it at discount prices tough, it's like 80 some on fragancenet or less.

Smell: 8/10
Performance:8/10
Sillage:8/10
Proyection:7/10

product_name: Colonia Intensa Acqua di Parma
review_content:
My nose finds difficulties defining whether this is a citrus aromatic, citrus woody, woody aromatic, woody leather, leather spicy.....you get the point. I love when fragrances develop and change, but it's not the case here. This one does smell nice and somewhat balanced for about 15 minutes, before it becomes confused and undecided, and dissipates into directions too many to count, neither of which I want to follow.
I see many people liking this. Good for them. Each to their own, mine is not the AdP way.
**(***)

product_name: Colonia Intensa Acqua di Parma
review_content: This a spicy and zingy citrus. It's the best in the Colonia line in my opinion. What makes this different is that it gets rid of the soapy clean, neroli, fabric softener vibe, and adds ginger and cardamon instead. It's warmer and softer than most citruses and doesn't have such a cold dry down. Unfortunately it's very light because it's only an eau de cologne. There is a body spray deodorant version of this that is basically the same strength. I wish it came in a higher concentration.

product_name: Colonia Intensa Acqua di Parma
review_content: I went through the whole of the confusingly named Acqua di Parma Colonia variations at a department store in Milan, but on testing strips or cotton pads I just didn't get any of it. However, I'd already ordered a few samples and they work much, much better on skin. This one was my favourite, compared to Colonia and Colonia Essenza. The sparkling lime/ginger note just lasted so much better and kept me feeling good all day. I'll be buying a bottle of this as a daily wear.

product_name: Colonia Intensa Acqua di Parma
review_content: Mamma mia, the best citrus I've tried! Fresh, classy and clean, but with a creamier, darker and sexier base that makes it more complex than a lot of straightforward citrus colognes. I imagine Marcello Mastroianni would wear this, but Monica Vitti would rock it too (i.e., easily worn by swanky persons of whatever gender).

product_name: Colonia Intensa Acqua di Parma
review_content:
For me Acqua di Parma Intensa is one of the best fragrance I ever have. This is one of the most balanced and blended fragrance I ever smell.
I love a citrucy fragrance but Inhate to feel a strong citrus, what You will get with Intensa is a balanced citrus thanks to the beautiful spicy smell and the warmess You will feel by the woody notes. Thus is a beautiful, new classical fragrance that won't make U feel dated and it will give you the confidence with it elegance presence.

product_name: Colonia Intensa Acqua di Parma
review_content:
After a nice shaving (using the same shaving cream from Alvarez Gomez)I use Alvaro Dominguez as an aftershave then afterwards as the sent of the day Acqua di Parma - Colonia Intensa.

It stays as a skin scent during the whole day. If you are looking for projection you have to use it on your clothes and even with that, won't have a large cloud.

I say it is more a personal scent for yourself to enjoy rather than the others.

product_name: Colonia Intensa Acqua di Parma
review_content: I noticed that when you splash this on, you get more of the botanical aspects, and dare I say, a more feminine presentation out of the fragrance opposed to what you get when spraying it on (that being more of the masculine woods and spices). Italian cologne is most desired to be splashed on (and not sprayed on such as like a perfume for women)—so this is quite an awkward compromise that it would force one to make.

product_name: Colonia Intensa Acqua di Parma
review_content:
The original Colonia is just to weak for my taste.
So I have the Intensa, Essensa and Assoluta EDT and Deo sprays.

Unlike the Original, the Assoluta and even the Essenza, this one is not a Summer's day citrusy freshy. It is woodier and smokier than the other Colonias. More mature and classy.
I prefer this one for the evenings although it can be used in day time if in Spring or even Fall.
Out of the 3 this also has the best projection and Sillage. It last about as long as the Essenza,(5-6 hours) which has been my favourite from the line from day one. However the Intensa is a more introvert beauty. Sophisticated. And therefore, slowly but gradually, gaining my love more and more.
Having Intensa, Essensa and Assoluta for over 2 years, All gift sets and additional Deo Sprays, this is how I see them:

Assoluta is the Summer beach day time favourite.
Essenza, for overall Summer application, day and night.
Intensa, the more formal evening dress code mysterious companion.
They really suit different purposes. They will stay in my collection forever.

I just found a few great gift sets offerings. Problem is my 100 ML bottles are still for 60% full.
But these are simply very hard to ignore offers: 68€/ Intensa and 77 € for the Essenza 100ML + Aftershave and Showergel.

product_name: Colonia Intensa Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Scent: 7/10

Quality: 7/10

Originality: 5/10

Sillage: 6/10

Projection: 5/10

Longevity: 6/10

Price VS Size: 6/10

product_name: Colonia Intensa Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Colonia Intensa is a masculine aromatic. This fragrance does away with the original Colonia DNA entirely, and replaces it with ensemble of woody-spicy masculine aromatics that would pass even the strictest Italian standards.

The opening spray is fresh—but very dry and slightly bitter. It can be invigorating, or it can catch you off guard, but I think the bite adds a great artistic flare to the masculine nature of the fragrance.

The fragrance then develops with a rush of complex masculine aromatics. The woody and spicy elements are fiery and abrasive! They create a very strict presence together. An accord of botanicals beneath this reinforces the fragrance's bitterness—further grounding its masculine composure.

And among the complex are exotic accents (such as green coffee)—which has a bold, pungent, yet invigorating aroma to it. It compliments the wood and spices perfectly, and greatly accentuates the masculinity and sophistication of the fragrance.

For all its qualities, Intensa is easily my favorite Colonia in the flagship line. Since my very first impression of it however, I've always said that it is also easily too masculine even for some men. The accents are very strong and stingy—and could be hard to take-in for anyone overly-sensitive to them. 

Intensa is a real man's fragrance—but for such a man—extremely versatile. Many might argue that it's more formal, but I could literally wear this anytime, to anywhere. It has formal grounding, but is just as equally stylish and sporty.

Everything I wished the original Colonia would be—and overjoyed for the dignity of the brand that it found its way into representing the honor of Acqua di Parma.

product_name: Colonia Intensa Acqua di Parma
review_content:
My hands-down favourite from the AdP Colonia line: a beautiful, true modern cologne but very frustratingly, has woeful longevity & projection. Whilst the original Colonia has fairly decent longevity, this just falls well below par and when I wear it, I always expect more than it has to give, which drives me to despair!

From some of the listed notes - cardamom, myrrh, leather, ginger, patchouli ..... you’d expect something more in terms of staying power but it just doesn’t have the chops; not on me anyway, with it becoming a skin scent in under an hour. As has been mentioned in earlier reviews, it definitely has the intonations of earlier classics, like Armani Eau pour Homme, Eau Sauvage and even YSL Pour Homme but at least those earlier classics had a decent slug of Oakmoss to prop them up a few rounds, whereas this....... well....!!
Despite this being green, citrus and slightly white floral, which screams summer freshie, I find this actually performs better in mild spring & autumn months because full on heat just seems to kill it stone dead. I’m reminded of Zegna’s Acqua Di Bergamotto actually: a beautiful modern citrus cologne that has zero longevity too.

I’m coming towards the end of my 100ml now and I’m really on the fence as to whether I buy another bottle or not. One minute I think ....”why bother, it doesn’t perform “ and the next minute, I’m thinking...”you can’t do without it, it’s lovely.” Very, very frustrating!! It’s definitely unisex without a shadow of a doubt, much more so than the Assoluta flanker and smells beautiful on a woman!

Much more delicate than my second favourite; AdP Colonia Essenza but I just wished it performed as well in the summer months. I’d recommend trying a sample or two first, rather than blind-buying this one, not for the fragrance because there really isn’t much not to like but just so you can test the performance on your skin type. If you find you get over 3+ hours then just buy it & you won’t be disappointed!

product_name: Colonia Intensa Acqua di Parma
review_content: Amazing.... for summer 100 %

product_name: Colonia Intensa Acqua di Parma
review_content: The bastard son of the original AdP cologne and Creed’s Tabarome. I had this in the travel sizes with the original leather case with the magnetic flip top. Very annoying that format is discontinued. This stuff I love, if you want something similar but cheaper then try Alvarez Gomez Barberia. The trade off is performance, obviously.

product_name: Colonia Intensa Acqua di Parma
review_content: This is my first time for this brand. Just first minuet, I had fall in love this perfume. It's very mature and high class. Nice to blind buy this one.

product_name: Colonia Intensa Acqua di Parma
review_content:
An excellent cologne. Soft, fresh, calming. I smell roses in the dry-down, or maybe I'm just losing it. It reminds me of a beautiful house in the mediterranean with a lemon tree in the garden and some fresh clothes drying outside. Lovely. It reminds me actually of Rose 31 by Le Labo.
It's very soft on my skin though and fades away quickly unfortunately.
EDIT: Just saw the reviews below, and I am so prouid of myself for thinking it reminds me of Rose 31 like others have written!

product_name: Colonia Intensa Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Update Review (5/6/21): Bought a full bottle so obviously I love it. I now love the dry, smoky vibe, which also has a hint of sweetness and classy barbershop feel. I love it so much that it's one of favorites and backup bottle worthy. Scent: 9, Performance: 7, Overall: 8.5.

Original Review (4/3/19): Starts fresh and citrusy. Dries down to a drier, smokier feel. Nice but don't love it. Scent: 7, Performance: 6, Overall: 6.5

product_name: Colonia Intensa Acqua di Parma
review_content: The classical colonia dna with spicy and resinous elements. This is actually more balsamic than its fresh, especially in the drydown. I like it very much.

product_name: Colonia Intensa Acqua di Parma
review_content:
@andythefrenchy. Why would you consider owning a 'useless flanker'? Seems slightly odd to me, especially when whatever these 'flankers' share in DNA with the original Colonia, they share it in complex and manifestly different ways. For me Intensa, Assoluta, Club, and Essenza all offer something very distinctive over the original: greener, more floral, woodier, some with deeper notes some not so...

Don't get me wrong, the original Colonia is a lovely fragrance; I have a bottle as a summer staple, especially if I am spending the summer months somewhere hot. But it's not so wonderful that it deserves to be left alone ad infinitum, with no tweaks to its make up.

product_name: Colonia Intensa Acqua di Parma
review_content:
A more complex citrus than I'm used to, yet still very familiar in its approach, the difference being, the resins, the ginger, the cardamom, and the leather. The resins remind me of something Andrier of Prada might do, Prada Infusion d'Homme, specifically.

Don't have much to say about this one, but it's a welcome addition for the Summer and competes for air time against Arancia di Capri of the same house, TF's Mandarino di Amalfi, EZ's Acqua di Bergamotto, and Bright Neroli. None are quite as complex as Colonia Intensa, but it's hardly the pinnacle of citrus, as one can imagine more exquisite, better performing scents, easily.

Upon fifteen to twenty minutes of spraying, was not getting the intensity I wanted, sprayed again and I can say the sillage is already not perfectly promising, unless I'm experiencing olfactory fatigue already. Fret not, however, the price, I believe, is accessible, and going harder on the trigger should offset this somewhat glaring issue. One should also note the potential dynamic with extremely high heat situations, or direct sunlight, in order to get a full idea of what this fragrance is capable of.

product_name: Colonia Intensa Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Meh..

Not bad but the original AdP Colonia remains unequaled. Again a useless flanker. That said, over all the useless flankers, this is the only one I may consider having.

AdP Colonia's flankers are not bad, just too close to the original to justify owning one if you already own the original.

product_name: Colonia Intensa Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Ultra class and sophistication.

This is the "dark" colonia in the Acqua di Parma colonia lineup. Yet, it is way more pleasant and fresh compared to similar style fragrances like declaration or tere d'hermes.

Still a Classic Citrus but with solid woodsy/leathery/spicy backbone. Similar to colonia oud but replace the oud with spices.

Excellent performance and Smells original with high quality.

The Gentlemen scent.

product_name: Colonia Intensa Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Received it as a present over Xmas
Batch 1578X

Very nice citrus smell, with woody/leathery undertones...
Very uplifting...
Total class...
Intoxicating...

...and this is where the praise ends...

Scent 10/10
Performance 0/10 (total joke given it costs £100 for 100 ml)

Pass

product_name: Colonia Intensa Acqua di Parma
review_content:
On my skin, on a cold wintry day, Colonia Intensa opens up rather cardamom and ginger forward with the citruses in the background to keep things on the 'fresh side of fresh' and not too spicy.

From the second hour onwards the ginger remains over a 'green woody' fragrance that holds up well in winter but as for projection, Colonia Intensa retreats to a skin scent within a few hours although it remains as a very present skin scent even 8 hours later... in the same room Colonia Assoluta will dominate in terms of projection and sillage.

TL;DR - my girlfriends says it's, 'Fresh but masculine.'

product_name: Colonia Intensa Acqua di Parma
review_content: I have lusted after this fragrance for years but the price put me off, today I was in TK Max and I saw it on the shelf...1 solitary box! I could not believe it, it was half the price that it was in the big department store around the corner...plus I got shower gel and shampoo with it....Christmas has come early! I just love it so much..and yes I am a woman, but I think it is so similar to my ultimate favourite (Sisley Eau de Soir) that I reckon I can get away with it....I am actually wearing both right now as I am comparing them. The acqua di Parma smells cleaner somehow, more definite. Love it:)

product_name: Colonia Intensa Acqua di Parma
review_content:
LOL did people actually vote moderate longevity on this one? It's not as long lasting as Essenza but Intensa easily lasts a full workday on me.

As for the scent, it's an interesting mixture of citrus, florals, and woods but I like wearing this during the cooler months.

Classy, sophisticated, and professional. Another winner from Acqua di Parma!

product_name: Colonia Intensa Acqua di Parma
review_content: The best Acqua di Parma.Created by two of the best noses on the planet (and personally among my favorites): Morillas and Demachy. This colony is different from the others. It does not go unnoticed. An elegant citrus and spicy at the right point. Great!

product_name: Colonia Intensa Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Imagine sitting somewhere at an old wooden table at a winery in Toscana, Italy. The sun is shining, it has 30°C (for my American friends: 86°F) outside. Around the area there are dozens of orange and olive trees and cypresses. You're enjoying life at its fullest.
The Italian family living there serves you some bruschetta and antipasti with red wine from their own cellar, which was built 250 years ago. The best crafted food you'll ever have.
The father of this beloved Italian family makes his way to Rome in his Italian suit, driving in his old Italian Alfa Romeo, with leather interior, because he needs to check if everything goes well at his little store which produces hand made leather shoes.

That's how this fragrance smells.
(Am I exaggerating? Yes, but who cares?)

product_name: Colonia Intensa Acqua di Parma
review_content: This is a classic an all year around scent, It has the best of all worlds citrus, flower, spice, wood, and musk. Very freshly done. A light masculine scent that will get you noticed. Go try it

product_name: Colonia Intensa Acqua di Parma
review_content: I think this is day 7 of my sampling of Aqcua di Parma. Today I tried Colonia Intensa. It smelled good. An hour in I could smell a nice powder smell that I think is the leather. After a few hours I could smell the vetiver. The thing taht surprises me is that it was for marked for Men not Men and Women. Overall a nice smell but, like other of the Colonia brand expansions its not a good as the original.

product_name: Colonia Intensa Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I have the Tonico Dopobarba, but I've tried the Colonia on perhaps three times as well.

Firstly, the Tonico has considerably less citrus in the opening, almost none. It more smells like a Martini Bianco mixed with a barber's tonic of sorts. The Colonia has the usual very nice citrus blast, and settling towards a similar drydown with it's barber brother. (If you're interested how much the Tonico lasts it's every time 4h and maybe on the collar another 4) TD has ever so slightly oily consistency, so probably has some quality oils there. And Myrtle water, nice. The tonico is the most elegant aftershave I've ever used. Read: maybe not the best or most masculine smelling, but a more elegant one is hard to find.

A cocktail comparison with another Colonia of similar qualities: Alvaréz Goméz Agua de Colonia Concentrada Barberia.
Ginger is at the top, opening the scent with a Campari-like bitter orange, and that opening very much reminded me of Acqua di Parma's Colonia Intensa - at first. So that one is Campari & Soda with orange slice to AdP Intensa's Martini Bianco & Lemon slice (that would be because of the Artemisia found in both AdP and Vermouth). This reminiscence and analogy comes to mind only in their respective openings, their hearts take a different path. For one AdP will become more creamy at that point I suppose..

product_name: Colonia Intensa Acqua di Parma
review_content:
So I just recently re-acquired Colonia Intensa after selling it off a year or so ago. Maybe I was at another stage in my fragrance journey at that point, but when I recently testing it out again, I was impressed enough to get it back in my collection.

What I get out of this from the top is a blast a citruses with some subtle spiciness, I don't get any neroli in this even though it's listed as one of the notes. The top does not last long and it pretty much morphs into the base rather quickly. After maybe 30 min or so, I get a pretty linear ginger/cedar/leather base that hums along until the end, in my case around 8 hours or so, although it's pretty much a skin scent at that point.

This is certainly not a "loud" or "Beastly" fragrance by any stretch of the imagination, but that's not a knock on it either. To me this a a perfect warm weather work scent that won't offend anyone. I certainly am glad to have it back in my collection!

product_name: Colonia Intensa Acqua di Parma
review_content:
While the original colonia, essenza and assoluta are similar, the intensa is a different story. The citruses and flowers are present the first minutes, but after that the cedar and resins are what this scent is all about on my skin.

I personally prefer the brighter colognes, but intensa is a good quality scent for those who like darker notes. But dont expect a typical cologne with this one. Its closer to a woody/resin scent.

product_name: Colonia Intensa Acqua di Parma
review_content: If I had the budget, I would bathe in this.

product_name: Colonia Intensa Acqua di Parma
review_content: If you love acqua di gio profumo, you will like it. If you love Chanel Pour Monsieur you will like it. It's less citrus then Pour Monsieur, it's less spicier then profumo. It in between of those two.

product_name: Colonia Intensa Acqua di Parma
review_content: This is the classic Le Labo Rose 31 but more aromatic and with more olfactory complexity.

product_name: Colonia Intensa Acqua di Parma
review_content: The citrus opening is all it shares with it's elder siblings Colonia and Colonia Abssoluta. Dense, rich, warm, comforting, spicy, woody, musky, amber. If you fancy a citrus during the colder months this is the one to grab! Delicious and addictive, incredible value for money, smells like it's made from the highest quality ingredients.

product_name: Colonia Intensa Acqua di Parma
review_content: Leathery spicy and rich. I have the little travel bottles and I always reach for this on a night out. Lasts for hours. Unisex in my opinion.

product_name: Colonia Intensa Acqua di Parma
review_content:
One of my favourites from the Acqua di Parma range. This scent oozes class and elegance. I feel a huge luxurious vibe when wearing this scent, I'm instantly transported to a world of marble pillars, marble floors and chandeliers. Ideal for any night time formal occasion. I also think this could be comfortably worn by a woman.

The citrus opening is upfront and shines, which combined with neroli, spice, wood and leather creates a beautiful luxurious scent

Timeless elegant masterpiece... check it for sure.

9/10

product_name: Colonia Intensa Acqua di Parma
review_content: This is up there in my top 3 scents iv ever come across. A very refined masculine scent thats easy to wear and versatile. Definitely signature scent worthy. Dont be put off by the opening that at first i thought might be too mature, the heart and base are amazing! The leather and smoky-sweet musk is incredible. kind of reminds me of a more luxurious issey L'Eau D'Issey which i have loved and worn for years, but maybe outgrown or overdone over the years, colonia intensa is an obvious progression. nice bottle as well.

product_name: Colonia Intensa Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Citrus leather & cardamom twist.

This one is kind of better than "Essenza di Colonia", it has that cardamom twist and ginger sting that made the whole juice differs from being original cologne.

It remains the citrus, Russian leather kind of fragrance but i think it's kind of upgraded a bit as the myrrh and artemisia changes the blend direction on the drydown beside the musk and the patchouli.

It reminds me of one of my cousins fragrance as he is the kind of an unsecured guy, don't care about a fragrance unless it's like other fragrance and people won't talk but ok to compliment.

Extremely safe, and to those cologne fragrance lovers, you need to sample it before taking it if you are into colognes.

product_name: Colonia Intensa Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Despite being unmistakably modern and distinct, Colonia Intensa manages to hold on to that old world elegance of its storied predecessor.

Ginger, woods, pepper (a lot, almost to the point it'll make you sneeze), cardamom and leather to smooth it out. Very well blended.

Mid sillage, stays close to the body

5-7 hours longevity but remains detectable throughout the day

All seasons but perhaps best for the milder temperatures of Spring/Autumn

Smart casual to formal

I think the person who would enjoy this is someone who can appreciate the finer things. Dressed simply but well. More Bottega Veneta than Dolce & Gabbana.

product_name: Colonia Intensa Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Best in the line..as far as smelt....in my opinion.
Classy clean! Fresh!

product_name: Colonia Intensa Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Very formal, classy, and mature perfume.
Think joop and 1 million, this is the opposite, thank God for that.

I love it and it is the classic of colognes, intense and fresh.

The notes I can mainly detect are citruses, bergamot, lemon... with a bit of floral sweetness maybe the neroli, and background leather and woods, the last 2 join the notes together and form the base of this perfume.

I'm also glad the patchouli is weak, otherwise it will ruin it for me

Excellent mature masculine fragrance, I'm glad to have in my collection.

If you hate the cloying sweet teen fragrances (like me), try this one.

product_name: Colonia Intensa Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I bought a 50ml bottle 2 years ago from john lewis and it lasted about 1hr, bought the same 2 days ago from john lewis and it lasts about 10+ hours. Not sure if it was fake the 1st time or its been reformulated. The scent also seems stronger than before.

Overall I find the scent very classy and I will buying it regularly

product_name: Colonia Intensa Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Typical eau de toilette very classic Italian, very good composition, complex and made with high quality half-court.

It could be a skin scent or fragrance of intimate character (point against for many) since after the first initial burst of citrus dismally low projection and is pegadita to skin.

The combination of citrus ginger and cardamom matifican citrus and neroli brings a rainbow full of light and joy (my favorite part), part of which unfortunately it does not last long.

Drying wood and balms is complex and well measured, anticipating a soft white musk drying, lightweight, which makes hold a couple of hours and then reapplied again (point against).
The fragrance has a certain quality, citrus scent that remains for most of the evolution of the fragrance and if you like this kind of intimate, classic and fresh Italian flavors then you'll love this.

Calling himself "Intense" I personally find somewhat lacking in projection and duration for the quality we are trying and especially paying.

Rating: 5

product_name: Colonia Intensa Acqua di Parma
review_content:
An interesting take on the house theme, this is a bigger departure from the classic EdC structure that you see in something like Essenza. House purists knock it for this reason, but I love the darker facets introduced by the leather, patchouli. Im also a sucker for sharp aromatics, so cardamom and cedar are always a win for me.

The opening is the straightforward citrus-woody fare you would expect from any competent gentlemans fragrance. The citrus and neroli components of the EdC style are here, but the neroli is not amped to the buttery, near white-floral pitch you get in some hard core EdCs (especially the ones formulated strong enough to last 8+ hours). Instead, the neroli melts into the green, herbaceous structure of the cardamom, cedar, and artemesia. Ginger is not particularly prominent to my nose, perhaps being lost in the myrrh and benzoin resins. This is a citrus-woody-leather, in that order.

The leather here is a soft, brown note (not like the hard black leather of the AdP Leather flanker). It wraps around the patchouli and myrrh. To be honest, I might not have placed it by name without reading the pyramid, but I am used to strong, forward-leaning leathers, and that doesnt meant that it is a weak note in this fragrance. I would say it is in the middle, under the citrus, cardamom, and cedar, but above the ginger and resins.

Closer to the drydown the fragrance becomes softer and a bit powdery; here the benzoin, musk, and myrrh come out to play. It is not a strong shift towards the oriental ingredients; rather, a gradual coziness that comes on as the composition comes to rest.

Overall this is a top-shelf choice for a year round signature with performance: 8-10 hours with four sprays. Perhaps not the most unique, but it smells quality, stands out from your average designer detergent fare, and can be worn year round and in all situations.

product_name: Colonia Intensa Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Parte bene ma si rovina già a metà corsa. Troppo sintetico e pungente, soprattutto per quello che costa.

Voto personale: 6.5/10

product_name: Colonia Intensa Acqua di Parma
review_content:
وقتی اسم آکوا دی پارما رو میشونیم معمولا یاد عطرهای خنک اش میافتیم . واقعا آکوا دی پارما تبحر خاصی در این زمینه داره بگذریم که چند تا کار گرم هم تولید کرده و به حق اون ها هم عالی بودند .

شما زمانی که سراغ تست کردن عطرای این برند خوش نام میرید 3 تا فاکتور اساسی رو در کاراش مشاهده و احساس میکنید : کیفیت و آمبولاژ بسیار تر و تمیز شیشه
دوم کیفیت بسیار خوب عطراش و نهایتا ترکیب شدن خارق العاده نُت های به کار رفته در عطراش
یکی از مشکلات عجیبی که در بسته بندی عطرای این برند میشه متوجه شد که واقعا رو اعصابم هست، برچسب اصلی عطر هست که روی شیشه نصب میشه و اکثرا هم بی سلیقه چسبیده میشه که معمولا هم حباب توش هست و برچسب عطر از یه طرف پُف میکنه

به هر حال زمانی که شروع کنید به تست کردن عطر، جز 30 ثانیه اول که رایحه ای ترش، تلخ و شادابی رو تجربه خواهید کرد که دهنتون آب میوفته، دیگه نمیتونید در طول عمر عطر این حالت رو حس کنید .

خیلی زود روایح اسپایسی و کمی چوبی به عطر اضافه میشه که عطر رو کاملا تحت الشعاع خودشون قرار میدند و شما یه مدتی رو مهمان این آکورد جذاب در کنار مرکباتی که با خودتون اوردید خواهید بود. یه حسی مثل اینکه شما دارید عطر رو به صورت ممتد و مستمر استشمام میکنید و رایحه شاداب لیمو رو حس میکنید ولی در آخر رایحه های چوبی و اسپایسی خاتمه دهنده این وضعیت میشند . یا اصطلاحا
drydown
عطر چوبی و اسپایسی هست .

رایحه چوبی و اسپایسی خیلی ملایم و بسیار خوب ترکیب شده
فکر نکنید دمای عطر رو بالا میبرند . نه این طور نیست
این عناصر عطر رو از حالت روزانه بودن در میارند و یه عطر نیمه رسمی و رسمی رو به شما هدیه میدند .


تا اینجا بوی آکورد های چوبی و اسپایسی به نُت های مرکباتی، میچربه

بعد از مدتی دوباره روایح مرکباتی یا بهتره بگم لیمو، جان دوباره ای میگیره
خیلی از تندی اولیه عطر کاسته میشه
نُت های چوبی و اسپایسی کم رنگ تر میشند و شما یه رایحه ترش و تلخ مرکباتی رو حس خواهید کرد که بر خلاف شروع عطر، اینبار حالتی خشک داره

در ادامه، نُت های مرکباتی هم ضعیف میشند و شما یه آکورد قر و قاطی ضعیف شده از تمام عناصر سازنده عطر رو خواهید داشت که رایحه اش بسیار همه پسند و خوشبو هست .


در کل وقتی عطری بسیار شاداب، ترش وتلخ و آبدار مد نظرتونه، پیشنهاد من، بی تردید سری مدیترانه این برند عطرسازی هست ولی وقتی یه عطر کم تر تکراری، کمپلکس، رسمی و خنک و تلخ میخواهید، این عطر جزو گزینه هایی هست که میره به لیست تست های آینده شما

کیفیت عطر = 8.5
طراحی شیشه= درسته زیباست، ولی به زیبایی سری های مدیترانه و کولونیا نمیرسه پس 7 بهش میدم
رایحه = 8
پخش بو = متوسط شاید تا 1 متر
ماندگاری = رضایت بخش. حدودا بالای 6 ساعت دوام داره رو پوست من
ارزش خرید = 8
نمره کل = 7.8

product_name: Colonia Intensa Acqua di Parma
review_content:
A strikingly modern, enhanced rendition of the classic Colonia. On my first test, after a bitter citrusy opening, the scent was dominated by artemisia. Actually, I barely noticed other notes. Now I wear this juice regularly (once a week), just enough to learn it quite well. It's pleasantly dry, rich (plenty of wood, herbs and neroli) and invigorating. Makes you feel fresh and energetic all day long. Longevity and sillage are moderate. After 5 hours, it turns into a skin scent - still noticeable to you only, woody and bitter.
Better try before you buy - I like it a lot, but for many of us it can be a love-or-hate story ;)

product_name: Colonia Intensa Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Just received a sample of this after trying the original Colonia.
I have to admit that I didn't like Colonia the first couple times i tried it, I felt it had an "old man" smell. I'm glad I stuck with it though because I love it, very summery. Although it doesn't last long as everyone else says, which brings me to trying Intensa.

Right out the gate its not Colonia, although it has some similarities. The dry down isn't anything like it, maybe it's just me but it completely reminds me of Polo blue. Glad I just tried a sample because it's not for me.

product_name: Mirto Di Panarea Forte Special Edition Eau De Toilette Acqua di Parma
review_content: I have a 100ml bottle 85% full for sale in Europe. PM me if interested.

product_name: Mirto Di Panarea Forte Special Edition Eau De Toilette Acqua di Parma
review_content:
My first experience with Aqua di Parma was a successful one. Was in the mood for something refreshing so I knew this would be the perfect brand to go to!

I probably had sampled over the years some of their fragrances but nothing stood out to me until yesterday when I was recommended by the sales associate in store in Noto this limited edition of Mirto di Panarra! And we clicked instantly, both visually and olfactory.
The beautiful turquoise bottle with medium blue details plus the butterfly design definitely captured my attention and interest. So I decided to give it a couple of sprays on my wrist and it was instant love.

Mirto di Panarea pulls very citrusy sweet on me. It’s such a bright and happy scent, very natural smelling EDT like nothing else in my collection. I have some other green, citrusy, aquatic scents already but nothing quite like this. And it’s such a simple scent…Myrtle, basil, lemon, bergamot, some light flowers and herbs plus some woods.

It smells great but it doesn’t last long. The only thing that made me reluctant to get it right away. But going to the store again today and trying it again made me realise that maybe not all my fragrances need to last a long time. Mandarin Basilic is another similar scent to Mirto di Panarea that I really love despite being so fleeting.

So, I decided to make an exception to my usual rule and get Mirto di Panarea. It’s so refreshing and realistic smelling that I can’t pass it, especially that it’s a limited edition packaging. Which speaks to my soul!

The price is right but also a bit steep in the same time because of the poor performance! I bought this knowing that I will only use this in the high heat, when I don’t want a heavy fragrance anyway.

product_name: Mirto Di Panarea Forte Special Edition Eau De Toilette Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Somehow a little better than the original to my nose, but maybe I’m just misremembering. This one seems a little greener/more herbal with something like a mint note.
Gives me a similar vibe to You or someone like you by ELDO, but way less minty and more subtle.

product_name: Mirto Di Panarea Forte Special Edition Eau De Toilette Acqua di Parma
review_content: This transports me to a lawn full herbs, not necessary by the sea, maybe in the mountains or so. It is so calming and a very happy scent!

product_name: Mirto Di Panarea Forte Special Edition Eau De Toilette Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I tried this and I didn't detect much difference from the original Mirto De Panarea (which is an awesome fragrance).

The opening feels very classy with citrus herbal vibe and moves into florals, juniper and woods.

The myrtle is there giving it a beach vibe. The final drydown is myrtle and mastic which gives you many hours of a clean, soapy, beach feeling. 🏖️

Scent 8/10
Performance 6.5/10

product_name: Mirto Di Panarea Forte Special Edition Eau De Toilette Acqua di Parma
review_content: The same fragrance, just a special edition bottle designed by forte_forte, an Italian women's fashion house. One of my favorite Acqua di Parma scents.

product_name: Mirto Di Panarea Forte Special Edition Eau De Toilette Acqua di Parma
review_content: What a gourgeous refreshing scent! You can really smell the herbs in it, the basil in the opening is so pleasant. The special edition bottle is adorable. Just wish it was more than EDT for the price tag.

product_name: Mirto Di Panarea Forte Special Edition Eau De Toilette Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Wowweeee— this is an awesome summer fragrance.. it seems so good and fresh ! Such a bright happy fragrance. The packaging is a 10/10 so adorable. This would be a great gift for a spring/summer birthday. To me it leans femme and it is heartbreaking that it isn’t a long lasting scent. It makes me think of eating fresh fruit Al fresco by the ocean.

This was a blind buy and I highly recommend.

product_name: Mirto Di Panarea Forte Special Edition Eau De Toilette Acqua di Parma
review_content: My brother purchased this for me in Parma. It is definitely unisex, with just a slight feminine edge, citrusy in the top with a slightly powdery, herbal dry down and with the woody and aquatic notes in the background throughout. It smells amazing when sprayed on hair! Believe it or not, this is my first Acqua Di Parma fragrance, so I have not smelled the original. It is absolutely Italian in style and it will be the perfect fragrance to wear to the pool and beach this summer. I’m happy to have this in my collection! And I actually like the bottle. I find it to be very whimsical. The usual Acqua Di Parma bottles are classy, though somewhat boring.

product_name: Mirto Di Panarea Forte Special Edition Eau De Toilette Acqua di Parma
review_content: I loved the original Mirto di Panarea for summer. This Forte edition is really "Forte". Very good performance for a fresh fragrance, however, the price is "forte" as well comparing to the original one. I don't comment the bottle. It's just funny. Anyway I'm very happy with this purchase.

product_name: Mirto Di Panarea Forte Special Edition Eau De Toilette Acqua di Parma
review_content: A bottle that looks like that deserves to be smelled.

product_name: Mirto Di Panarea Forte Special Edition Eau De Toilette Acqua di Parma
review_content: I really like the original AdP bottles, but I find their special edition bottles extremely unattractive. This looks like a cheap Christmas wrapping paper. Maybe that’s what is special? It’s the same with Bergamotto di Calabria La Spugnatura.

product_name: Magnolia Nobile Special Edition Acqua di Parma
review_content: Since this was a special edition, I doubt I'll ever be able to obtain it, at least at a price that doesn't involve selling a kidney! But that's okay. I still have my OG Magnolia, and will purchase a backup soon, since they've already discontinued my favorite Iris Nobile and the beautiful Gelsomino Nobile. I just don't want to risk it!

product_name: Magnolia Nobile Special Edition Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Oh, I'm about to say one red-hot thing.... guys, this is ... J'adore! Only softer and calmer, but J'adore. Jador Jadorovich Jadorovitch Jadorov as he is.
All the way I drove I remembered what it reminded me so painfully. I remembered and was horrified - yes, yes this trio - magnolia-jasmine-tuberose. No, of course, the fragrance is pleasant, but it makes no sense to buy the same fragrance for a lot of money.

product_name: Luce di Rosa Acqua di Parma
review_content: Lovely fresh fragrance though very hard to justify the price. It’s a very inoffensive scent, very light. For the price, it is a bit underwhelming but a very nice floral fragrance all round. Only ‘worth’ it on sale, can’t justify the full price.

product_name: Luce di Rosa Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Fresh green peppery rose undertone.
Beautiful.

product_name: Luce di Rosa Acqua di Parma
review_content:
good rose perfume for men.
Ok for female. It's unisex.

It's roses with hard stems. rose bush.

product_name: Luce di Rosa Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Nice rose fragrance with an interesting light woody base. Citruses and pepper (pink and black) are present with the signature ADP citruses fizzing from the top. Not a powerful rose scent, this is more fresh and light. Can be pulled off in high heat or cooler temperatures, so it's very functional. Should be fine for office use.

I don't think it's as beautiful as POAL, Rose De Jamal, or Kilian RO so if you're looking for the best of the best, give those a shot first. However, if you're a rose aficionado who wants to wear it in the heat of the summer, I'd say this is a fairly safe option, along with perhaps MFK's rose, which offers some versatility as well. Don't pay retail. This will be resold at bargain prices.
------------------------------------------------------
Scent 72/100

product_name: Luce di Rosa Acqua di Parma
review_content: If I had never tried LOmbre Dans L’eau- maybe I would have fallen for this. The citrus is a short lived front for the same high frequency, squirt of chemical rose. Eternal, and regrettable.

product_name: Luce di Rosa Acqua di Parma
review_content: This is a must try on skin, testing on paper was overwhelmingly peppery for me. On skin you get the green, rose and woody notes really shining through.

product_name: Luce di Rosa Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Testing Luce di Rosa from a 1.5 ml Aqua di Parma official sample.

This perfume is true to its name at least in longevity: it’s a soft spicy, citrusy, aromatic rose focused scent with a strong geranium presence all through its life. Almost equal parts of rose and geranium. It’s not necessarily the lightest, luminous rose forward fragrance on the market but it’s not the deepest/darker either.

Unlike some other niche brands creations centred around rose I have tried recently, Aqua di Parma took Luce di Rosa in a more complex, nuanced direction, made it less sweet, not powdery but still kept it light. This is not a heavy rose scent but has some depth and contrast. The woods from the base notes are prominent once the juice dries down. Also, it has decent performance. It’s still overpriced for what it is in my opinion and it’s not the one for me, but it’s a bit more interesting. Different than other 2025 rose focused perfumes.

Up to this day, I couldn’t find a better rose scent than Atomic Rose by Initio. Afternoon trying quite a few of newer releases, I need to acknowledge what a masterpiece of perfume Atomic Rose is!!

Sorry Aqua di Parma, I usually love your releases but Luce di Rosa is a pass…

product_name: Luce di Rosa Acqua di Parma
review_content: Luce di Rosa is the exaltation of a Bulgarian rose, modern and magically fused in citrus Mediterranean notes, bright, clear and shining, joyfully lively and sparkling with black and pink pepper. Temporal olfactory evolution turns towards strong notes of fresh vetiver and enveloping and reassuring notes of precious woods and voluptuous musks. Undoubtedly a fragrance that embodies the brightness and freshness of the summer.

product_name: Luce di Rosa Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Quite sour, bright, and slightly spicy with a hint of wood. ADP’s website references Longoza Oil as a top note - not familiar with the scent of Longoza; however, I am naively keen to attribute the spiced carnation vibe of the scent to it. Very vibrant as a scent, almost grapefruit vibe similar to Pompelmo by L.O. (Perhaps the citrus with the Vetiver in the base?) - up close it makes me want to wince.

After being awestruck with Mandarino di Sicilia, this was quite a let down . Very thin in comparison, and, to me, not worth the price tag. Comparing to the other Signatures of the Sun line, I would say in a way most similar in vein to Magnolia Infinita and perhaps Osmanthus … pre-reformation.

product_name: Luce di Rosa Acqua di Parma
review_content: I personally dislike the opening notes; they’re too bright and pungent. However, after the dry-down, the heart notes are absolutely beautiful and well-balanced. I've worn this perfume on colder days, and it's a good choice. The scent lingers on clothes for days afterward.

product_name: Luce di Rosa Acqua di Parma
review_content: This is a very fresh, fruity floral scent that can be used as a daily freshie. Long lasting on the skin and very hard to get off fabric. Definitely a 5/5.

product_name: Luce di Rosa Acqua di Parma
review_content:
There can be no more appropriate name for this fragrance: Luce di Rosa is a bright, light, crisp fragrance, with a slightly sour rose exalted in this side by the mandarin, which I feel is very strongly present along with the spices.
Full of light, carefree, almost like a fresh early spring day.
‘Spring in Bloom’ painted by Giuseppe Faraone.

product_name: Luce di Rosa Acqua di Parma
review_content: Firstly no rose, fresh vegetable scent. The drydown of Hermes (Jardin sur la Nil)

product_name: Luce di Rosa Acqua di Parma
review_content:
@jonsalter so we can't make statements about the industry, brands, direction? We are strictly limited to "reviews" of the scents of individual fragrances? Is that your rule or Fragrantica's? Go check the number of comments the average ADP release gets. Look at the mentions it gets in the community (FB, IG, TT, YT, blogs, etc.). Obviously when I say "no one is asking for this," it's hyperbole. But it expresses the point, which you've chosen to be obtuse about, that hardly anyone is talking about these and they won't talk about this one.

ADP is my favorite house. I've tried almost every single one of their offerings. They've tried this floral direction for years and I've literally never seen any interest in the community. The florals are boring, conventional, and push no boundaries. My comment is a tiny attempt at pushing them to do something more creative because I want to see them succeed. You don't need to be upset because I have an opinion that you don't agree with. Just leave your review on the fragrance since that's what you believe the review section is strictly for.

product_name: Luce di Rosa Acqua di Parma
review_content: high quality rose ..boring

product_name: Luce di Rosa Acqua di Parma
review_content:
It is a Cassis-Rose (Geranium) again. It reminds me of Kelly Caleche by Hermès, and also Rose & Cuir by Frédéric Malle (not much as a "grape juice" as it is).
It's not in the notes here, but there's a certain amount of cassis in there, and there's a little bit of a leathery woody nuance, like the residue of guaiac wood.
It is a subtle and harmonious scent like other AdF perfumes but not interesting.

product_name: Luce di Rosa Acqua di Parma
review_content: Beautiful floral scent. I love it

product_name: Luce di Rosa Acqua di Parma
review_content:
@agonzony - you've epitomised what this site has become.
1) You comment in the "review" section without reviewing the fragrance
2) "No one is asking for" - Where is your market research showing this? How many fragrance houses release fragrances that "people are asking for?"
3) The ADP brand is built nearly ENTIRELY on single-ingredient fragrances. Such a strange comment to make, you clearly dont understand their brand offerings.
4) The number of Noteworthy single ingredient fragrances by ADP is huge. Im not even going to list them here because they have more noteworthy ones that poor ones

Anyway, as for the fragrance....

It's a well executed citrus/rose. The rose is very "clean". I describe many oud/rose combos as having a dirty rose note (not in a bad way - just a descriptive term - maybe "heavy" is a better term) but this is a pure and clean rose. The "clean" element is probably helped by cedar and musk
The pepper and cardamom adds the spice on the top that stops it being a pure Floral. This means it may appeal to men more than the "rose based fragrance" description would imply.

Performance for a citrus is well above average.

product_name: Acqua di Parma Colonia Designer Edition Acqua di Parma
review_content: Same fragrance as Acqua di parma Colonia, but in a different bottle. Classic, signatur worthy, masculine cologne scent. Love this design more, gives the owner a more luxourius feeling. Tingles all the senses

product_name: Acqua di Parma Colonia Designer Edition Acqua di Parma
review_content: Incredible bottle, nice smell and luxury brand <3

product_name: Gelsomino A Freddo Acqua di Parma
review_content: This is a wonderfully well done fragrance. It's an aromatic sweet, woody, spicy, floral that's very unisex. I love the jasmine and patchouli in the dry down with a touch of woods. It projects nicely, smelling it frequently for 5-6 hrs and then it becomes a skin scent but lasts about 8-9hrs.

product_name: Gelsomino A Freddo Acqua di Parma
Gelsomino A Freddo Acqua di Parma
review_content: Super light Jasmine

product_name: Gelsomino A Freddo Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I don't normally like this house at all. However, in my city, all of my favourite sales people and people who seem to know their stuff, work for ADP. There have been some fragrances that interested me but it's always the same story - I always hate the dry down. Amouage suffers the same way for me.

So the sales person made me a sample of this one and I've just put it on. Sometimes I think it's hard to judge a quality fragrance out of a plastic 2ml atomizer that has hit the air. On the first spray, it's a very light jasmine but there's enough underneath going on that it's not just jasmine and definitely holds the unisex line perfectly. It invokes a nice feeling and imagery, it's very nice so far.

It's not a huge performer but again, is that the fragrance, or is that the way we sample fragrances? In the store it seemed stronger. However, it's a nice bubble, not overpowering, you have to search for it but it's there.

The test now will be to see what happens in the dry down. If I end up liking it, it will be the first ADP in my collection. I'm kind of hoping I don't as man, ADP is crazy expensive. I'll edit later and update.

Edit: Well, I can't complain about the dry down, it's beautiful. However, it's extremely close to "Oud Gardenia" by Eric Buterbaugh - close enough for me that I don't need both. If you loved Oud Gardenia and are looking for something to replace it, since EB is discontinued, this is worth checking out.

product_name: Gelsomino A Freddo Acqua di Parma
review_content: Most noxious use of Jasmine I've smelled recently. I'm no stranger to or hater of Jasmine. I grew up in Southern California and love the scent of Jasmine wafting as you walk down the block BUT this is horrid. This fragrance is mixed all wrong. It's straight up Jasmine Milk Tea at 100 percent sweetness. I get none of the other notes. Just over pitched Jasmine on top a limp tea. Reminds me of a worse version of Bond's Greenwich Village.

product_name: Gelsomino A Freddo Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Ohhhh cut the crap masteryoda!
3 days longevity?? Really? It's like my 6 years old daughter have said that 🤣🤣🤣

If you are into perfumes you should know that you measure longevity on SKIN not papers.

Or when going out you spray perfume on paper and take it with you? 🤔

product_name: Gelsomino A Freddo Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I tested, it is really good. I mean not like ADP’s signuture parfums oud or leather but much better then zafferano, Sandalo and others. Longevity is better then expected, 3 day and still smell in test paper. Beside I am very sorry for ADP, i think they have enemy inside, iris nobile or leather was incredable parfums, extremly good and dna level smells. Still they stopped their sell, no more leather.
What is wrong ???

product_name: Gelsomino A Freddo Acqua di Parma
review_content:
The so-called fragrance connoisseurs will, once again, attempt to bury this gem- perhaps by lamenting its performance while forgetting that true artistry, in the realm of perfumery, is a rare occurrence...

Here we encounter the very quintessence of the feminine: a pure and crystalline jasmine that gleams upon the skin like a necklace of pearls. In the drydown, a flawlessly poised woody accord emerges, completing the composition with grace. This is a fragrance that restores Acqua di Parma to the spotlight: Gelsomino a Freddo is the emblem of elegance, beauty and radiance.

product_name: Gelsomino A Freddo Acqua di Parma
review_content: Beautiful unisex fragrance! It’s like jasmine tea was combined with a zingy/ sweet lemonade in the early stages. The artemisia adds a herbaceous edge and pink pepper really opens up the nostrils. These notes tone down rather quickly and the stunning jasmine really comes out. It is so smooth and sweet with no perceptible indoles to my nose. Smells like a very natural flower with a gentle bubblegum faucet. The fragrance becomes increasingly sweet at dry down with the woods really stepping forward. To my delight, the patchouli becomes more assertive and smells fantastic mixed with the jasmine tea. If you love woody, spicy florals that really highlight a single flower I highly recommend a sniff. Love it!

product_name: Gelsomino A Freddo Acqua di Parma
review_content: Beautiful jasmine, tea, iris and patchouli mix. Floral, earthy, powdery, amber. Pretty much everything I love. Reminds me of Note Di Colonia IV. Good longevity as well, definitely need a full bottle of this!

product_name: Gelsomino A Freddo Acqua di Parma
review_content: I really enjoy this fragrance. I’ll get it once it hits discounters. ADP is on fire lately with these new releases: Buongiorno and now this. This smells classy and timeless. A truly gentleman fragrance. A give it a 10/10.

product_name: Gelsomino A Freddo Acqua di Parma
review_content:
The opening is a sweet citus with some spiciness as an undertone. The spiciness of the opening dissipates about 15 min in and some of the Iris and Black Tea notes starting to present themselves. The heart of the fragrance presents the white florals which become prominent and turns the fragrance quite sweet. At this point I still I get a powdery scent from the Iris. At full dry-down, the fragrance remains quite sweet which is more than likely coming from the Guiaic wood. The scent has a vanilla sweetness with an earthy undertone.

Performance on this fragrance is good as it projects quite well at the opening and is providing a good 5 to 6 hours of longevity. To me this is what I expect from a fresh fragrance.

This fragrance is quite addictive. I continued smelling my wrist throughout the day just to get a whiff of the scent.

product_name: Colonia Ambra Acqua di Parma
review_content:
So ive reviewed this in the past, and love it. But a wee bit ago i got a vintage bottle of cool water from the early 90s. Suprisingly one of the things i was impressed by is how actually excellent the ambergris accord is considering its age and its reputation as nothing special...maybe one of my top favorite ambergris approximations. This actually has a similar ambergris accord, but perfected. It is definetely higher quality than cool water, dont worry lol. The rosy leather vibe is amazing also in this.

Tl;dr is that this has one of the best ambergris accords around. The marketing when this was released claimed an unspecified
amount of real ambergris...but who knows

product_name: Colonia Ambra Acqua di Parma
review_content: This cologne is something else! It's definitely a more mature scent, warm and slightly musky with this interesting salty note that I wasn't expecting. Lasts all day too which is a huge plus.

product_name: Colonia Ambra Acqua di Parma
review_content: I smell leather but it's too sharp

product_name: Colonia Ambra Acqua di Parma
review_content: Just to reinforce Kylix's point below - there's a lot of leather in this too. Lovely.

product_name: Colonia Ambra Acqua di Parma
review_content: یه کهربای خوب و راحت

product_name: Colonia Ambra Acqua di Parma
review_content: Beautiful and magic.

product_name: Colonia Ambra Acqua di Parma
review_content: For an affordable designer brand it is nice. Lasts a long time and nice sillage but you gotta be ready of it's heady dose of Ambergris.

product_name: Colonia Ambra Acqua di Parma
review_content: Leather bomb

product_name: Colonia Ambra Acqua di Parma
review_content: This has the IFF’s ambergris ollifac substitutive in good quantity. It’s kinda breath-like skanky, the same way we can perceive it in Afrika Olifant. It has a floral heart and what seems to be some kind of white musk at the base along with the ambergris accord. Good and friendly animalic. Resinous, as well. Acqua di Parma, as always, giving us the best we can find. Terrific!

product_name: Colonia Ambra Acqua di Parma
review_content: P.s. someone mentioned rose...to be honest i never thought of rose or smelled it originally, but now that you mentioned it i cant un-notice what you mean haha. You could even say the vibe is rose-leather in a sense, but its not the whole of the fragrance to me, i get alot of marine and ambergris

product_name: Colonia Ambra Acqua di Parma
review_content: If you want to get the (decently) natural ambergris bomb experience as opposed to the ambroxan bomb experience, this may be your best bet going. But dont wait, its going for about twice the price i paid a year ago. Imagine if acqua di gio profumo was made in the 80s....im kind of serious. It doesnt smell like kouros or polo green but it has this extreme classiness like most adp fragrances. I love this stuff straight up, but if marine and ambergris is something you avoid, act accordingly because this is both, more so the latter. I think even the latest prices are a steal for this fragrance considering how it performs (beastmode, legitimately) and the quality of the ingredients. I also feel like this is an easy signature scent for all weather.

product_name: Colonia Ambra Acqua di Parma
review_content: I really rate this ADP Brown bottle Ambra. It is my third in this line after the legendary OUD and equally fantastic LEATHER, and I warrant this example different enough to justify having all three. This is Musky, rich and luxuriant, a mature and classy fragrance, and one that I personally found instantly accessible, a real love at first scent (albeit I already had a relationship with two of Ambra's cousins!

product_name: Colonia Ambra Acqua di Parma
review_content: My husband is wearing this, and it is gorgeous!! I smell ROSE🌹. Why isn't it listed? There is a load of dark rose here. Rose and animalic notes. Swoon! So good!!

product_name: Colonia Ambra Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Warning, scent lovers! This is amber, as in ambergris, not amber as in amber. This is NOT an 'amber-coloured' scent.

Thankfully I don't get much 'blue' in this, despite its 'marine' quality. I mean the blue that smells airy and maritime, and which dominated scents in the 90s/00s. I don't like those scents. So if you're into 'blue' scents, or 'freshies' as they're sometimes called here, then this is not the one for you. That said, this is remarkably fresh - but it's not that airy Issey Miyake or Cool Water type of thing.

It's fresh, animalic but not Kouros-y. It feels "rooted, " masculine, and honest, and I really like it. It's a straightforward, masculine scent, linear (not a criticism). Suits all occasions and seasons including work/car journeys, but going well beyond being just one more "generic designer work scent."

It's very distinctive and unique, without being 'wacky' or 'challenging.'

I like to think of scents in colours - I like amber scents. But this isn't an 'amber' scent like, say, Gucci Pour Homme original, or Lagerfeld Classic. It's not 'warm and spicy' as many amber scents are. It's fresh, dynamic and open, but yet very 'grounded' and 'tied to nature'. It's 'amber' because it's based on ambergris, not because it's amber coloured.

Perfume Parlour also do an amazingly good knock-off for a tenner.

product_name: Colonia Ambra Acqua di Parma
review_content:
It is very mature profile with good performance.
Safe office scent for me.

product_name: Colonia Ambra Acqua di Parma
review_content:
So I just received my bottle in the mail today, upon the first application it was reminiscent of something I own but I couldn't quite put my finger on it... An hour later, it hit me like a ton of bricks💡Breath Of God!🤦🏾♂️

This smells to me like a more refined take on Breath Of God by Lush, of course this is missing the citrusy and incense note, but the opening does share some similarities.

product_name: Colonia Ambra Acqua di Parma
review_content: I am very surprised that this doesn’t smell animalic at all. Instead, this reminds me of some gentle herbs.

product_name: Colonia Ambra Acqua di Parma
review_content: Wasn’t a fan at first. Like the previous reviewer it just smelled strange to me. Nothing conventional about it at the start. Not even the citrusy opening. But the mid and dry down is where this fragrance shines. Can’t even describe the fragrance but to me there is something extremely comforting about it. Total opposite to the oud or leather which those can be loud and sharp. Not this. Ambra is musky, fresh, smooth and original.

product_name: Colonia Ambra Acqua di Parma
review_content: Something in this smells weird. I'm not sure what but it smells almost fishy. So far, the only likes I have from the brown collection are leather and sandalo, on the fence with vaniglia

product_name: Colonia Ambra Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Leather, dark, smoky, hints of cozy amber sweetness. Not typically my type of scent, it's too strong, smoky, and leathery...I prefer a lighter, brighter scent along the lines of the original ADP Colonia or Mediterraneao lines. Very good quality tho, smells natural and comforting.

Scent: 7 / Sillage: 8.5 / Longevity: 9

product_name: Colonia Ambra Acqua di Parma
review_content: For the first two hours, the salty and animalic "ambergris" note conflicts with the gorgeous musk base in a somewhat unpleasant way that folks have been comparing to the smell of an ancient oil painting. But in the drydown on a hot day, the notes ultimately blend into a rich, almost gourmand musk. I have a sample and will not be purchasing a FB, but for those who find the opening off-putting, I do suggest giving this a little time before scrubbing. The drydown is phenomenal.

product_name: Colonia Ambra Acqua di Parma
review_content: A blind buy at a great price for this quality. I tossed up between the oud and Ambra and glad I chose the latter. It is so aquatic but not in an ocean water kind of way. It is like the shell of 60 yo tortoise covered in sea barnacles. Clean seaweed floats nearby in large amounts and over this the ocean breeze carries musk. Ambergris is special and such is this. I have the 150ml and just love to lather it all over my clothes and body. For those who don't like it, I win by getting more personal space. Often I find some people become obsessed unable to pinpoint who or what it is. I actually think this can be worn day or night in any season. It sits beautifully over leather clothes.

product_name: Colonia Ambra Acqua di Parma
review_content: Acqua Di Parma is one of my favorite brands and I have nearly 15 of them including all from the brown line. I didn't mind this one at first and thought it was decent but never wore it. I tried it again yesterday for the first time in 3 months or so and had to whipe it off. It's not good at all and by far the worst AdP I've smelled. I've smelled them all and can honestly say there isn't one I don't like until now. This smells like an old woman and isn't masculine at all. It's very cloying and kind of sweet. If you're looking for a darker Acqua Di Parma definitely get Sandalo. By far the best one out of this line. I would take Mirra or Ebano over this as well.

product_name: Colonia Ambra Acqua di Parma
review_content: Over all, a disappointment. This is Colonia Mirra and Colonia Oud mixed together and toned way way down. It's my least favorite of the three, with Oud in second and the discontinued Mirra (unfortunately) in first. This leans feminine and simply does not perform. I would recommend this to an older woman who likes the women's offerings from Creed. If you are a man and you find Mirra, GET IT.

product_name: Colonia Ambra Acqua di Parma
review_content:
This is stunningly good! Definitley for a mature man (45+).
When I get old I'll be wearing this lol.

product_name: Colonia Ambra Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I think I'll have to buck the trend on this one, as I'm a big fan. This is one of those fragrances which garners polar opposites of opinion, some dislike it, whilst other love it.
It's a little sweet, I like it in cooler temperatures when I want a change from leathers and ouds.
I'm getting rose, cedarwood and sandalwood. Having smelt real ambergris, I can't say I'm getting that, but I'm getting a very pleasing fragrance either way.
It lasts a good 8 hours on my skin and that's in cooler weather.

product_name: Colonia Ambra Acqua di Parma
review_content: Laura Palmer: "-What about this, James?"

product_name: Colonia Ambra Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Ambroxan Overdose (Francois Demachy, 2015)

Scentrack: The Chemical Brothers - Dissolve

As a part of Acqua di Parma Ingredient Collection Colonia Ambra is supposed to be dedicated to precious materials of amber or ambergris. Ambergris is very rare whale vomit, which under the influence of the sea and sun is transformed to the beautiful musky and salty odor. Of course, there is not enough of real ambergris to meet the demand of the perfume industry, and the synthetic molecules are used instead. Although it is marketed as the celebration of the most precious and luxurious ingredient, Colonia Ambra is an ode to Ambroxan, a synthetic ambergris molecule. All I can sense on my skin is strong synthetic musky, salty and fresh odor. Nothing natural or rare, just one-dimensional musky odor with shady woody and oudy nuances. Like a slight, airy evolution of older Colonia Oud. I was really shocked that Acqua di Parma released their own version of Dolce & Gabbana Intenso. I expected some lighter, ambery gentleman's cologne. Colonia Ambra is one of my biggest fragrance disappointing. Simply, not recommended synthetic entity.

Rating: 3/10

product_name: Colonia Ambra Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Interesting. There are multiple perspectives you can take on this fragrance but let us talk about smell first:

SMELL
-opening can be off-putting; if you are the type that needs to have a pleasing opening to your fragrances, you may not like this
-to my nose, opening smells like a mix of dried paint and fish oil; it's not as bad as it sounds but it's definitely unusual
