product_name: Essenza di Colonia Acqua di Parma
review_content: Beautiful Scent. Smells like luxury soap. Not something i’d personally wear though as I think it smells quite old fashioned.

product_name: Essenza di Colonia Acqua di Parma
review_content: This is so good, such a perfect year round signature, in fact that's the role this scent will play for me. Reminds me somewhat of a mix between the original Armani Eau Pour Homme, and Tom Ford Neroli Portofino.

product_name: Essenza di Colonia Acqua di Parma
review_content: It smells like expensive citrus soap. High quality. When I smell it, I think of a well respected wealthy man (not a rich boi). I wish Don Vito Corleone had lived long enough to use this during the summer. Longevity is long lasting but sillage is not that good. Maybe moderate sillage.

product_name: Essenza di Colonia Acqua di Parma
review_content:
As would be expected from AdP, Essenza starts with high quality citruses. As it dries down the citruses share the stage with a subtle vetiver musky scent that is very soapy. The soapy smell dominates as time progresses, in fact for most of Essenza's life. Performance is average/moderate. Overall a very classy, masculine fragrance that would shine especially on hot summer days and nights.

After all the superlatives, why have I rated it only an 'OK' and will not be getting a FB for myself? Because of the poor price/value ratio. I already have very soapy type fragrances - an aspect I like very much - but for a whole lot less cost. To put it another way, Essenza doesn't offer a whole lot more than cheaper soapy colognes.

product_name: Essenza di Colonia Acqua di Parma
review_content: It's exactly like the original, but much more soapy, a bit more musky, and less fresh. It feels like the same fragrance, just in a bar of soap. I wouldn't trade the original, but I understand the appeal of this one (more "serious" and with better performance). To have the original updated with incredible citrus fragrances, I suggest taking a look at Intensa and Futura.

product_name: Essenza di Colonia Acqua di Parma
review_content: Smells like herby shower gel. not for me but i can see the appeal

product_name: Essenza di Colonia Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Definitely isn’t dated, but does pay homage to classic perfumes eg. 4711.

Very bright fresh citrusy opening that quickly dries down into white soapy florals. It does have a certain depth due to the green spiciness in the base which comes out in the dry down.

Performance is how it should be in my opinion - sits close to the skin and lasts just as long as it should.

Soft, comforting, natural, soapy, clean, elegant, masculine scent.

product_name: Essenza di Colonia Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Smells good, like a rich man above the age of 35. It doesn't smell jerky, and this definitely wouldn't come to my mind if someone said "Old Money Fragrance" because this isn't old money, this just smells like an old man.

Now, this may sound like a bad thing, but it isn't. My ex's mom bought this for me, it came with a deodorant and shampoo. I gave them all to my dad, and he loved it. This smells clean, soapy, rich and somewhat reminiscent of babywipes.

Performance is the definition of mid, it doesn't project much but it isn't a skin scent, it doesn't fade away instantly but it also doesn't last long. Mid.

Scent is heavenly if you are above 35 though.

product_name: Essenza di Colonia Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I sprayed this on paper, smelled it, thought it had a really nice masculine clean scent to it. Came back 15 minutes later and smelled the paper again. It hit me. This smells almost EXACTLY like dryer sheets. You know those things you use after your clothes come out of the washer, and you put a dryer sheet in with your clothes in the dryer? That. I pressed "ctrl + f" on my keyboard to see if anyone else got that and apparently, I'm the only person in the world that smells it. lol.

Is that a bad thing? No! It smells very clean. "Fresh linens" is the way I'd describe it. Just a really fresh, clean, yet masculine fragrance. I think I'd prefer this over Creed's Green Irish Tweed. Both are going for a similar end goal of fresh/clean.

This would go perfect with formal clothing. Wearing this with a suit I imagine is a perfect combination. The fragrance does NOT seem to last very long. It is a "cologne", so that does make sense since it is not as concentrated as an edt. It seems to be a "skin scent" very quickly.

product_name: Essenza di Colonia Acqua di Parma
review_content: After testing this fragrance today, my immediate reaction was an exuberant outburst in the store. Its captivating scent evoked a rush of fond memories, tinged with subtle hints of spice that infused sheer happiness into my being. Friends couldn't help but notice my sudden elation, prompting inquiries about the source of my joy. Describing the fragrance, it's akin to James Bond impeccably clad in his suit, exuding sophistication while engaging in high-stakes poker at the Casino Royale – a blend of soapy citrus notes intertwined with delicate floral accents.

product_name: Essenza di Colonia Acqua di Parma
review_content: Me personally I like it but it may smell old fashioned or too soapy when I smell it I imagine a sunny day in Spain or Italy and you are having a bubble bath with a window open to gardens full of lemon trees. It is good for everyday wear but probably isn’t something people would compliment or notice

product_name: Essenza di Colonia Acqua di Parma
review_content: i had kidna high hopes for this fragrance but you wanna know what i think it smells like. toilet cleaner. specifically duck toilet cleaner idk if yall have it in your country but thats exactly what is smells like. not recommended tbf.

product_name: Essenza di Colonia Acqua di Parma
review_content: You are chilling in a bathtub with soap bubbles all around your head. There is an open window to a garden full of citrus trees and a rich flowerbed. Suddenly a warm summer breeze brings all the outdoor scents in and they merge with the indoor scents into one. It feels so clean and comforting...

product_name: Essenza di Colonia Acqua di Parma
review_content: It's a solid fragrance. Old fashioned citrus type scent. It's too strong for my taste and doesn't suit my personality.

product_name: Essenza di Colonia Acqua di Parma
review_content: This scent is forever certified balling tier. A modern classic timless scent that embodies everything one looks for in Italian style perfumery. I find this scent is more centered around the neroli and aromatics. I do pick up on some citruses but its not a sharp or bright and zesty citrus to my nose. This scent is beautiful, classy and masculine. It does have that old school vibe but that makes it even better to me. However, it doesn't smell dated or like an old man at all. It's just a modern take on an old school classic DNA. In an age of modern men's fragrances that often lack authenticity Colonia Essenza stands out among the crowd. Timeless, authentic and refined. In my opinion, despite the note breakdown, I find this scent somewhat simplistic. It has a simple goal and that is to smell fantastic. For an EDC it has good performance. I never like commenting on performance since everyones skin will treat scents differently. For me it performs well. This will forever be in my collection. It seems most here are in agreement, this scent is balling.

product_name: Essenza di Colonia Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Love this fragrance. This is quickly becoming my signature scent for spring & summer, possibly even suitable year-round. Takes the DNA of the original ADP Colonia and amplifies it by adding additional spices such as clove, herbs like rosemary and sage are cranked up which results in a soapy scent. It smells so good it makes my eyes roll back in my head. Simply can't get enough of this stuff.

The downside is that it is quite expensive for being an EdC concentration. However, I love the scent and its high quality so that is a price I'm willing to pay. An eternal 10/10 from Acqua di Parma.

EDIT: Soapy, fresh, aromatic greatness. Classic cologne DNA with added soapy notes and a healthy dose of rose. Great longevity for an EDC. Atomizer is fantastic on this, sprays like a firehose.

product_name: Essenza di Colonia Acqua di Parma
review_content: This reminded me of Versace L'Homme. The same thick lemon dishwasher scent. Not my style. I cannot stand it.

product_name: Essenza di Colonia Acqua di Parma
review_content: This smells nothing like the note breakdown, it is straight aloe-vera-shaving-cream-car-freshener and I really dislike it. I wanted to get it off of my wrist as soon as I sprayed a sample.

product_name: Essenza di Colonia Acqua di Parma
review_content:
The original Colonia is an absolute love of mine. Essenza turns it up to 11. I love anything that smells like soap. This is the scent of an old-fashioned soap. I still prefer the original for the high heat and during the day, but with the added clove, rose and more herbal character, Essenza makes a great counterpart for the evening and cooler weather. One of my favorites to wear to bed. Opening is gorgeous. Like, eyes roll back with a big moan gorgeous. Quite possibly the best opening I've ever smelled out of about 500 frags.

If you're interested, watch A.C.'s (Smells Good) review on youtube. He explains it very clearly. Cheers!


The more I wear this the more I love it.

Expensive soap vibe after the citrus top notes? Hell yes!

Not for those who prefer modern citrus fragrances? Tell me more!

May feel dated to some? I prefer "Timeless"..

11/10.

product_name: Essenza di Colonia Acqua di Parma
review_content: I have to come back and write more. Hadn't worn this for a while. Goddamn this is good! Sprayed some on and was instantly hit with the most delicious citrus. Just beautiful. After that it's a great luxurious creamy neroli that follows you around for a long time. Put some on and your mood wil instantly lift :)

product_name: Essenza di Colonia Acqua di Parma
review_content: This is lowkey beast mode. Truly a male cologne, not those unisex stuff that smells like fruit and candy

product_name: Essenza di Colonia Acqua di Parma
review_content: Tries way too hard compared to the original IMHO

product_name: Essenza di Colonia Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Essenza di Colonia by Acqua di Parma:
This is a citrusy and aromatic, somewhat soapy fragrance that revolves around white floral notes-namely neroli and because of this focus on bergamot, grapefruit and neroli, Essenza smells similar to Neroli Portofino by Tom Ford though without the slight saltiness that NP has, replacing it with the classic soap smell of the original Colonia. Perfect for hot spring/summer days this is essentially a Neroli Portofino opening followed by a Colonia drydown.

Top notes: Neroli, bergamot, grapefruit
Middle notes: Neroli, rosemary, sage
Base notes: Musk, vetiver, amber, neroli

3/5

product_name: Essenza di Colonia Acqua di Parma
review_content: @Sergio4 what? 🤣

product_name: Essenza di Colonia Acqua di Parma
review_content: I think one of best dior ever . powerful scent

product_name: Essenza di Colonia Acqua di Parma
review_content: Starts out very much like the original ADPC but with a soapy clean vibe similar to Prada Amber. The opening notes are heavily citrus in the same style as 4711, Alvarez Gómez, Florida Water, etc. It truly smells like a higher quality version of Florida Water because of the clove, which is actually a good thing. As for the price though I feel this is far too expensive for what you get out of it. Longevity is decent with multiple sprays but it doesn't project after about an hour or two and is heavily a skin scent. At that point it's identical to Prada Amber, but I adore Prada Amber so it's fine by me. But having a bottle of that already makes Essenza kind of redundant, I'll still enjoy using it though because of the difference in the opening. If it were a bit cheaper then it'd be far better of a purchase but the prices keep going up on all of the ADP offerings to the point they're practically double what they were pre 2020. Essenza would be an optimal choice for more intimate occasions where you don't want to wear a loud or bold fragrance but still want to smell elegant and nice when up close with others. If you're the type who prefers clubbing or youthful scents like Ultra Male, Luna Rossa, or Sauvage then keep looking because this is more for the gentleman or refined style minded individuals.

product_name: Essenza di Colonia Acqua di Parma
review_content: The smell of a refined Italian gentleman is the best way to describe it. Has quite sharp citrus layered over a very aromatic, expensive bar of soap sort of vibe. First few times I smelt it I really didn't love it as it reminded me of talcum powder and while it still does have the soapy, powdery sort of vibe there's a lot more complexity to it from the citrus and aromatics. A very mature and refined scent

product_name: Essenza di Colonia Acqua di Parma
review_content: Just a richer, deeper Colonia: "A zingy and somewhat bitter citrus opening plus herbal aromatics. Fresh with a smidge of spicy pizzazz, it has a clean soapy undertone that lends it the aesthetic of an old-fashioned gentleman. The woody base and a soft powdery rose gently peek through as it dries down." I find the citrus and herbal notes more prominent here in Essenza, with the spices and rose toned down. Moderately soft projection for 2-3hr -- a little stronger than the original -- longevity 6-8hr.

product_name: Essenza di Colonia Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Essenza di Colonia by Acqua di Parma: A Dry and Sharp Citrus
⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐

Essenza di Colonia by Acqua di Parma is a perfume that captivated me with its dry and sharp citrus. It reminded me of Hermes Orange Verte, but with a much better performance. It had a complex and sophisticated citrus blend, which was probably made with synthetic ingredients, but still smelled natural and authentic. It was paired with oakmoss and green notes, which gave it a dry and earthy character.

The perfume was soapy and clean, but not in a boring or generic way. The soapy term and quality depends on where you live and what kind of soaps you were used to, but in my country, this perfume smelled like a high-quality detergent, which I personally liked. It smelled like the Italian mafia, sharp and well-dressed, but not someone to mess with. It had a strong and confident presence, and it lasted for a long time on my skin. I had a decant from many years ago, which had a nuclear performance. It might have been because of the older batch or the maceration, but I was very happy with it.

Acqua di Parma is my top favorite niche brand, and I think they make amazing perfumes. Essenza di Colonia is one of their best creations, and it is not very popular or hyped, which makes it more special and unique. It is probably the least crowd pleasing one among the other colonia flankers, but I don’t care about that. I love it for its dry and sharp citrus, which is elegant and refined. The closest one to it is the assoluta flanker, but that one is more floral creamy and less dry. Essenza di Colonia is a masterpiece, and I give it 5 stars.

I loved this perfume so much that I bought a 100ml bottle after I tried the decant. It was a great investment, and I enjoy wearing it every time.

product_name: Essenza di Colonia Acqua di Parma
review_content: Yuck! Old man fragrance... Citrusy fougere/barbershop type scent... A mix of eau sauvage and roja vetiver... I hate oakmoss and this has plenty of it. It's a pass from me

product_name: Essenza di Colonia Acqua di Parma
review_content: I loved this scent with it clean and fresh feel. Went through a 100ml bottle and went out and bought a 180ml straight after. As soon as I bought it however I regretted the buy somewhat. The atomizer has changed to give a long, and I mean really long spray. Longest I've come across on a fragrance. Also the longevity seems to have taken a hit. Perhaps it's just me but I spray it and after and hour or so can't smell more than a skin scent. Previously I used to catch a whiff of it every now and again. Maybe it's just my nose playing up.

product_name: Essenza di Colonia Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I had to add a second review to this, since I own a small bottle and I have been doing my best to fall in love with it for a while now. I do love the opening and the first half hour. I would say 4.5, there is only a tad too much soap for my preferences (please note 4.5 is nearly a top score).
The drydown is, however, underwhelming. If only it had been linear, but it is not, it is rather a curve of simplification. All the lovely details that together make up the grand opening fades away, leaving only soap behind. If it smells, as some say, luxury soap to begin with, it smells almost green Palmolive soap after 90 minutes after a slow decline. That is not quite fair perhaps, but you get the idea. Now I hold this to be a technical issue that they could have resolved at the manufacturers. Better performance is basically what I am asking here, a formulation from 2010 should have a higher quality.

product_name: Essenza di Colonia Acqua di Parma
review_content: My favorite Neroli fragrance. I think more masculine then Neroli Portofino, which I love, but find not masculine enough for my liking. Overall, a fresh, clean, soapy, mature summer spring and probably fine for those nicer early-into fall days fragrance that is fine for most occasions. I think it is fine for night time but are more options on the market that are more night time friendly for warmer days. Last 7-8 hours and projects fine. Nothing too strong, not too weak in my opinion. Solid 8.5/10 in my opinion.

product_name: Essenza di Colonia Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Smells like a lemon scented body wash soap from a hotel I stayed at in Lima. The citrus notes are bracing and smell like a functional perfumery generic citrus (lemon / orange) akin to a citrus kitchen cleaner - not a realistic grapefruit note. For me the soapiness and functional lemon smell are a non starter.

My favorite summery citrus fragrances are: Mugler's Fly Away for a delicious juicy grapefruit note and Xerjoff's Nio for a fresh citrus that hints at a clean soapiness (not overwhelmingly soapy like Essenza).

product_name: Essenza di Colonia Acqua di Parma
review_content:
The best Aqua di Parma cologne.
Clove, Rosemary and citruses are the basic structure.
Great floral touches, all blended to perfection. Italian spiciness.

product_name: Essenza di Colonia Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I have a small bottle of Essenza di Colonia that I sometimes need to smell. It is an elegant, nuanced sent, with some vague nods to leathery, citrusy barbershop colognes, neroli notes and some green, light touches of classic fougères. But alas it is impossible for me to wear! The soapiness is too overwhelming, like the original Colonia from AdP turned up to 11. Between 30 and 60 minutes into the dry down, it develops into something cloyingly soapy on my skin, starting to ressemble the smell of the lavatory of my childhood friend's grandparents. Funnily enough, this urinal note is one that I also get from Eau Sauvage EDT (not the EDP which I own and use). It is also strange: As with ES EDT, I do love the top notes of Essenza and many of the mid notes. It is a lovely smell apart from this strange soapiness, and even so, I really don't mind it on other men. Let us just say I am fortunate that I have no problem keeping my distance from them over time, however. It is fascinating how individual some scents are, and I think that it is a chemical reaction when two substances meet that causes this.

I can mention that I love cilantro/coriander leafs, but I once had an aniseed-rich Pernod for aperitif as I prepared some Mexican Pico de gallo salsa and immediately got a taste in my mouth that I was reminded about with Essenza. Very unpleasant, I speculate that this is how cilantro actually taste for those genetically disposed to dislike it (proven to be approximately 15% of any population). But go ahead and try! It is a quality product, just not for me.

product_name: Essenza di Colonia Acqua di Parma
review_content:
A beautiful soapy citrus fragrance. It kinda smells like a very expensive soap, which i was very happy about. It is also very classy and elegant, and i dont understand how people say that the fragrance is dated. I am 14 and i love wearing it.
Luxury...

product_name: Essenza di Colonia Acqua di Parma
review_content: This is how 50 year old man smells, i tried wearing this and lady's are telling me i smell like an old man....not buying this!

product_name: Essenza di Colonia Acqua di Parma
review_content:
EVERYTHING about this perfumes scent profile is AMAZING and i usually dont like citrus bright perfumes.
The opening, the drydown everything is a masterpiece.
The opening is citrus based, but amazing almost photorealistic grapefruit, its so amazing. BUT on my skin the longevity isnt good. It lasts 4 hours max.

Its bright and fruity. I think i smell a bit of lavender but i might be wrong and that might be the other ingredients in the perfume that i dont know how they smell individually. If it is lavender it isnt the laundry detergent smelling kind, it just smells great. Nothing but love for the smell.
The longevity as i said isnt good. That might just be for me and i mightve gotten a bad batch or something.
Either way the scent alone is great.

product_name: Essenza di Colonia Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Very smooth, complex, Musk heavy (it seems to my nose), so well blended, classic perfumery. Different Musks or at least view of them give a thick texture, layers to the formula. It feels, that naturals were selected beautifully. Very sophisticated and elegant perfume. People who love classic perfumery, orange blossoms and Fougéres - I think, you will appreciate this. Thick, soft, clean, soap like, aromatic, with multiple nuances, natural smelling, sophisticated and elegant. I definitely pick up high concentrations of Orange blossom (Neroli) - both synthetics and essential oil. It seems to be built especially upon high concentrations of Evernyl (oakmoss), Calone, Citrus naturals, Neroli, Musks like Galaxolide, Ambrettolide, Muscone. Liliestralis, Magnolan and other (Lily of the Valley raw materials), Salicylates (especially Amyl Salicylate), which support creamy, thick and clean qualities of the formula even more. This is a masterclass of perfumery, it's too complex to my nose to say something more. Everything is blended in harmony. Perfume doesn't have any sharp edges. It smells finished, complete and reserve. Eugenol (Cloves), a traditional, very strong raw material, can support the spicy quality of the fragrance. I have no doubts, that Patchouli naturals improve the substantialness of the fragrance and Rose accord can also do a great job here.

I am 21 and I love it. Many people will not gravitate to it, what I absolutely understand. Classic perfumery in its finest. I think, it is just perfect for professional environment and special occasions. I very appreciate it for perfumers' craftsmanship.

product_name: Essenza di Colonia Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Lovely scent, I get soap and citrus, very refined.
However, I simply do not get neroli at all, and I know what it smells like.
I just don’t get all the comparisons to neroli dominant scents like TFNP etc.
Just because neroli is listed everyone starts comparing it to other neroli fragrances regardless of the actual smell.
Each to their own I suppose.
Great scent though.

product_name: Essenza di Colonia Acqua di Parma
review_content: old fashioned fresh scent, definitely more suited towards an older folk

product_name: Essenza di Colonia Acqua di Parma
review_content: Does it smell like soap? Yes. Does it smell good? ABSOLUTLY YES! Citrus and clean, this is a uplifting and timeless fragrance. There is nothing to hate here, it is nothing new but you won't find any house doing this kind of scent better than AdP. A must have in my opinion.

product_name: Essenza di Colonia Acqua di Parma
review_content: One of the best classic colognes, in my top 3 right after Tom Ford Neroli Portofino Forte and Colognise Nishane.

product_name: Essenza di Colonia Acqua di Parma
review_content:
A very toned-down neroli-petitgrain. Powdery and soapy. It's surprisingly soft and gentle. It's not bright at all. Despite a lot of opinions, for me, this is not really in the veins of summer. This has a more mellow energy. A citrus for the first days of autumn. When you realise summer has passed.

It definitely has a timeless quality to it. It's beautiful. Very subtle, refined and elegant. By far my Acqua di Parma favourite yet.

product_name: Essenza di Colonia Acqua di Parma
review_content: The barbershop reloaded, intensified, and doubled down. Too intense to wear comfortably, too much of an old barbershop scent to wear confidently in any 'modern' setting. Perhaps something nice to wear as one sits in a remote Italian village during a late summer evening while sipping some Fernet Branca. I could not confidently pull this off in a modern office setting.

product_name: Essenza di Colonia Acqua di Parma
review_content: This cologne just screams Italian summer I can’t just put my finger on it but this is just a must buy. This is super underrated. I don’t think I’ve smelled something cleaner. The performance isn’t the best but what do you expect from a fresh fragrance. Pull the damn trigger and buy it off some discounter. If I wasn’t going to college and needed to save money I would make this my signature fragrance.

product_name: Essenza di Colonia Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Classic and elegant, it's the ideal fragrance for a gentleman on vacation in the Mediterranean.
The DNA of the original Colonia blends really well with a darker, woodier base.

product_name: Essenza di Colonia Acqua di Parma
review_content: Fantastic cologne that blossoms in the heat. The only drawback is the price but you can find deals online if you're patient. The array of citrus in the top is sublime and lasts a long time, in the heat, that is. Before you sell yourself something from the admirable Blu Mediterraneo line, try this.

product_name: Essenza di Colonia Acqua di Parma
review_content: Classic and familiar smelling (this is a revamp of the 1916 Colonia, after all) Essenza is a light, very clean, feelgood, soapy masculine fragrance that smacks of refinement and Italian chic. "Refreshing" and "luxury" are words that spring to mind and spring/summer are the seasons where it will shine, but I believe it could be worn all year round. Longevity and projection are not stellar, though being a "colonia" one can't expect beast mode performance. That said, Essenza di Colonia is office-friendly and a must for old school enthusiasts; so much so that it is currently my signature scent. Yes, it is that good, though I actually like to reserve it for nights out. Shame the bottle is opaque, so you can't see how much you have left, unlike the original.

product_name: Essenza di Colonia Acqua di Parma
review_content: Very clean and somewhat soapy scent for me. I like the scent on its own but i also like to use it as a base for laying other scents that are more citrus forward. I find it can sometimes take the edge off of more harsh citrus notes

product_name: Essenza di Colonia Acqua di Parma
review_content: Smells so refreshing and invigorating!! Clean white florals and that bright orange blossom and neroli takes the cake for me! A banger for summers!

product_name: Essenza di Colonia Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I like almost all of the AdP Colonias (Futura the least I think), and I had a really hard time picking out which one to buy. In the end longevity was the deciding factor between Essenza and the original Colonia. Essenza lasted better on me when testing side by side with some of the other Colonias, that is not saying that it is beast mode, it is still a cologne and disappears in a few hours.

Essenza is focused orange blossom and neroli. It is fresh and warm at the same time. It has that Italian beach vibe and really smells like summer in a bottle. I wonder if there is not a little bit of lavender in it too?

product_name: Essenza di Colonia Acqua di Parma
review_content: Fantastic refreshing, clean scent; almost like spraying a shower on yourself it's that clean. As usual with fresh scents longevity is an issue but for a few hours, on me at least, it's a great scent.

product_name: Essenza di Colonia Acqua di Parma
review_content: Clean white soap feeling. Good for when you want to feel fresh, but I wouldn’t pay to smell like suds when I can get the same job done just by washing my hands.

product_name: Essenza di Colonia Acqua di Parma
review_content:
One thing I quickly learned while trying Colonia and its various flankers is that my preferences are very different to the majority. For me this is more modern, lighter and soapier iteration of Colonia that ends up smelling very clean and perhaps a tiny bit artificial? If you're after a modernised Colonia I would personally recommend Pura before this one though.

Now for the really peculiar take: There is something in here where the light "clean" scents interact that inexplicably reminds me of the smell of a Nike outlet store in the summer, I don't think anybody else is making this connection so it's probably just me but I swear it's there.

product_name: Essenza di Colonia Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I like this and extremely safe. It’s very strong on the citrus up top. It mellows slightly as the musks come through but tbh I mainly get citrus throughout.

longevity - I wonder whether some people just get a bit nose blind to it perhaps. For me, it’s still going a good 4-5 hours later. It isn’t going to last much longer than that with this scent profile. I
Projection average for this kind of scent as well but obviously not going to compete with something heavier.

The only reason this is a “like” for me instead of a “love” is that I don’t like it quite as much as Colonia original or Colonia Pura. I do feel like this would be better if I lived somewhere more exotic- on a really hot day this would probably be better than either of those two I mention as this is more citrus and lacks the floral and musk of the other two. In the UK though this would probably only excel about three days a year! That said it’s still very versatile and very office safe - just that when it isn’t extremely warm, it doesn’t sparkle quite the same.

I haven’t tried the shampoo/shower gel/grooming but I think I might prefer this scent in those forms over the other colonias.

product_name: Essenza di Colonia Acqua di Parma
review_content: I like it a lot, very sophisticated. Smells very clean. Neroli overpowers the other notes by quite a bit but as it dries down i pick up some musk and vetiver. Reasonable price as well.

product_name: Essenza di Colonia Acqua di Parma
review_content: I see a lot of fragrances described as 'soapy' but for me THIS is the one that comes to mind when that adjective is used. It literally smells like a bar of hotel soap in the best way possible- stunning fragrance

product_name: Essenza di Colonia Acqua di Parma
review_content: Smells like a cologne done right. Fresh, sophisticated - manly. But the performance on my skin was dreadful, disappear in less than 4h.

product_name: Essenza di Colonia Acqua di Parma
review_content: Absolutely amazing scent, smells like neroli and citrus on a breezy spring day. No downsides.

product_name: Essenza di Colonia Acqua di Parma
review_content: Finally found 4711 that dosent go away immediately. Is classy and sophisticated and can be worn any time any occasion. Beautiful neroli fragrance.

product_name: Essenza di Colonia Acqua di Parma
review_content: Very similar to TF neroli portofino, but the aromatic notes are more accentuated (which is a good thing imo). Plus, the price is reasonable and the performance is good in comparison to the newer batches of neroli portofino.

product_name: Essenza di Colonia Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Veeeeery nice, the opening is a bit harsh but wait a few minutes, and it's fantastic.
Would love to wear it as a signature summer scent, BUT ! Clearly overpriced. Its a wonderful cologne, but... It's a cologne. It has more complexity to the usual cheap cologne you get for a couple of €, but its still in the same DNA, just a bit more of longevity and complexity, for 10X the price.
At 50€ for 100ml I would bath in it.
But now, I pass.

product_name: Essenza di Colonia Acqua di Parma
review_content: I find it so hard to write reviews for the fragrances that I love and wear the most. This is my favourite from all of AdP, apart from the now discontinued Colonia Assoluta. They seem to have struck the perfect balance between classic and modern with this bottle, it stays true to the original DNA but packs a heftier neroli punch. Musk, vetiver, oakmoss, patchouli and amber are all very long lasting notes so I understand why some people are getting good longevity out of this, especially if you're using 15+ sprays of a morning (like I do). My current bottle won't even last me till mid-year but I'm fine with that, I understand that this is a citrus cologne and I love it for the fleeting beauty that it is. Perfect for the Aussie summer.

product_name: Essenza di Colonia Acqua di Parma
review_content: A pleasant summer scent that's uplifting and elegant. Intensa is my favourite from the line as I just think it's more interesting and fitter for the UK where it's seldom super hot, but when it is indeed that warm, Essenza is a good reach. The citrus opening mellows and gets a bit chalky almost, ending with a nice musk. Longevity is OK at about 6 hours, which is pretty fair for a citrus-dominant fragrance.

product_name: Essenza di Colonia Acqua di Parma
review_content:
A classic, oldschool, elegant, clean and fresh scent. Italian gentleman vibes. Even though the original formulation is over 100 years old, this doesn't smell dated at all — in fact it's one of those few timeless fragrances. Master parfumeur Michel Almairac has done an incredible job modernising this scent.

I don't really understand how people claim to have this performing for over 12 hours, it's simply not made to perform like that. It has a modest projection for maybe an hour and then it becomes a skin scent for 3 hours. That's the beauty and intimacy of these type of elegantly constructed fragrances.

Don't buy this expecting you're going to fill up rooms. However if you're looking for a subtle oldschool yet modern barbershop scent, this is the one to get.

product_name: Essenza di Colonia Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I ordered a sample and the first thing my wife said when I wore it was "you smell like an old man" and that was not good. I didn't like it either, to oldschool, to sharp, gave me a headache, didn't like the scent. It's a grandpa scent, totally dated. Go get Guerlain - Heritage edt instead, it's cheaper, better scent, lasts longer and it's blended to perfection.

The only good thing with this fragrance is its long-lasting.

product_name: Essenza di Colonia Acqua di Parma
review_content: A fantastic citrus aromatic for the 21st century that updates Acqua Di Parma’s original Colonia beautifully. Smells like an elegant and genteel Italian man with impeccable taste. The man lives in a handsome stuccoed penthouse apartment and buys fresh herbs from a local farmer’s market.

product_name: Essenza di Colonia Acqua di Parma
review_content: In my country, we offer cologne concentrations to guests. They use it on their hands and sometimes face, for a quick refreshment. This smells like those colognes you would get for about a dollar from the deli. If you are into that, who am I to judge? Just do remember, you can save a lot of money buying those instead of spending 130 dollars.

product_name: Essenza di Colonia Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Very fresh, crisp, invigorating, soapy, classy. Adp essenza is a safe yet refined summer fragrance. Very well-made composition of neroli, mandarin, Jasmin, sage, petitgrain, a soft vetiver ..the smell is so nice like clean sheets, it evokes a mourning in a hotel next to the sea during Summertime. Relaxing, conforting, never pushy but not weak, adp essenza is a great choice for the warm seasons, better for people over 30, fits for all occasions because nobody can say it smells bad or offensive. It's easy to find for a good price, so dont overlook on it!
Colonia essenza è una fragranza garbata, pulita, fresca, a tratti saponosa, raffinata ma non seriosa. Sa di pulito, di una mattina in un hotel dove ti affacci e ci sono gli alberi, le piante e più in là il mare. Per l'uomo over 30 in vacanza con un minimo di stile. È facile trovarlo ad un buon prezzo, tenetelo in considerazione. Magari non griderete al miracolo ma è impossibile trovarlo fastidioso o cattivo.

Scent: 8,5
Longevity-7,5
Sillage-7
Versatility-9
Uniqueness-8
Presentation- 6,5
Compliment factor-8
Backup bottle? Maybe

My vote - 8,5

Alternative - Ferrari bright neroli, original acqua di Parma Colonia, prada luna rossa, prada amber pour homme...

product_name: Essenza di Colonia Acqua di Parma
review_content:
ADP Colonia Essenza in 2023.

My goodness... What a beautiful scent, the freshest most citrus fragrance you just might ever smell. You will not regret purchasing this, I don't need to go in-depth with this one. It smells like a barbershop, like fresh acidic fruits, blissful.

10/10

product_name: Essenza di Colonia Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I have had the Colonia Assoluta for a while. Sometimes it feels like it has to much Ylang ylang and feels a bit too feminine.
I think this is a little better than the original Colonia.

I just purchased a 50 ml at a great price, going on memory from trying it a few years ago.
It's a simple Eau de Cologne, but it has an Italian vib or spiciness which I like. It makes it stand out from Dior Eau Savage from 1965, also good and similar.

Rating: 8/10

God bless you. John 3:16

product_name: Essenza di Colonia Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Straight up Neroli-Bergamot-Vetiver, green fragrance which smells pleasing but not anything special.
Very spring-centered scent

product_name: Essenza di Colonia Acqua di Parma
review_content: Missing all the the brightness and fun of the original. Sets right into a high end soap smell and just lingers there for a few hours. Definitely not bad, just wish they'd have retained a little more of the DNA of Colonia.

product_name: Essenza di Colonia Acqua di Parma
review_content: Too old school for my nose. But it’s nice for what it is.

product_name: Essenza di Colonia Acqua di Parma
review_content: Timeless, luxurious, natural soapy clean. Formal or casual. Non offensive and unisex. All seasons. Use anytime . . . dumb reach.

product_name: Essenza di Colonia Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Very nice green, soapy, wet white floral and lightly unsweetened spiced fresh, sharp masculine ADP.

This is one of my favorites from the brand.

Wearable in all seasons in all conditions, although likely better in spring and summer.

Performs well for an edc.

Super bright, super green, super realistic. Tremendously clean smelling.

8.5 rating

product_name: Essenza di Colonia Acqua di Parma
review_content: Opens green, pine rosemary, sage. Quickly gets soapy, with a hint of powder and neroli. Jasmine, and citrus rind. Is it green or is it blue now? Settles into citrus, clove and vetiver. High class without putting on too much effort. Clean. You walk into an expensive soap store just off the beach in a tiny Sicilian town. This is what it smells like.

product_name: Essenza di Colonia Acqua di Parma
review_content: This fragrance is perfect for me. I'll agree with many of the reviewers here and say it smells like luxurious soap that you may find in an expensive European hotel. I actually don't like many men's fragrances - especially over masculine or fresh fragrances and I also don't like fragrances on the other end of the scale like Dior Homme Intense that are too floral for me. This really doesn't smell like a typical fragrance at all. It just smells like citrus but there's something else there that makes it very addictive. Every time I walk past my wardrobe, I have to stop and sniff the nozzle. It seems to last a long time and when it dries down, it smells the same, unlike some fragrances that smell totally different after an hour. On a negative note, I haven't received any compliments but I will admit that I do not drench myself in fragrance. I like it and that's what matters.

product_name: Essenza di Colonia Acqua di Parma
review_content: This smells very very nice. The neroli in it does indeed smell very clean and sophisticated. Unfortunately, as others have noted, the longevity on this obviously isn't great. I also did not realize it was an EDC, so maybe I had too high expectations going into it. If you go heavy on the sprays, it'll project for about the first hour. After that it becomes a skin scent (though it does linger as a skin scent for about 5 hours or so).

product_name: Essenza di Colonia Acqua di Parma
review_content: Just two words... Italian class!

product_name: Essenza di Colonia Acqua di Parma
review_content: My favourite from the brand. Old school (but not dated), classy (but not heavy), easy to reach for (but has complexity and is suave). Has history and is priced well. I think this can be someone’s signature fragrance.

product_name: Essenza di Colonia Acqua di Parma
review_content:
In one word- PERFECT.
Yes, it does not last long. But it is soooo good that i forgive it:-)

product_name: Essenza di Colonia Acqua di Parma
review_content: Not as good as the original colonia. It's missing the nice soft powderyness that the OG colonia has and comes across more sharp. I personally wouldn't get this over the OG.

product_name: Essenza di Colonia Acqua di Parma
review_content: Lovely scent of white flower powder and delectable citrus. I just can’t believe how little time it lingers for me maybe 2 hours tops, to be fair I didn’t realize this was a EDC when I bought it and I’m sure that explains the poor performance. You’re better off going for a edt or edp from aqua di Parma imo. Sometimes I just spray this in my sheets and snuggle up because the scent is really great

product_name: Essenza di Colonia Acqua di Parma
review_content:
It's an aftershave scent , not a perfume for a party or occasion . It's appropriate for those who are going to work in the spring and late summer at morning and after their beard is being shaved.
هذا العطر مناسب للرجل الناضج البالغ الذي يعتاد على ان يحلق لحيته في الصباح ليضع هذا العطر المنعطش في الربيع او اواخر الصيف و الخريف، لا اظن انه يناسب الشباب و لا اظن مناسب لاي حفلة ..عطر حمضيات و فيه نكهة الفيتيفير و الباتشولي بعد ساعة او ساعتين من استعماله

product_name: Essenza di Colonia Acqua di Parma
review_content:
An aftershave. Brut may be? It's been so long I don't remember. May be hair gel? It's soo familiar.

Feels like something I smelled in a barbershop, Barbicide maybe?

Juicy, sharp citrus. Silage is not too great. It's the kind of smell I associate with old men, but I guess dressed up this could work for younger people too.

product_name: Essenza di Colonia Acqua di Parma
review_content:
I wanted something from the house of Acqua di Parma, and upon researching, it seemed that this one had the best longevity.

Quick review: A beautiful citrus "barbershop" scent!

First spray/top notes are a burst of Lemon, Bergamot, Grapefruit - well-blended citrus mix, hard lemon candy.
Heart and Base notes are a Creamy Neroli, Soapy, Sudsy, slightly Spicy-Warm, slightly Sweet.

The scent is clean, sharp, fresh and uplifting. It's like a high quality lemon-scented soap bar at a five-star hotel.
Works well in the day, hot weather, summer, professional office settings.
Not too unique or standout, but subtle yet interesting.

Sillage/Projection: Quickly becomes a skin scent (as with most fresh fragrances, not a strong projector for long, though body heat helps to emanate)

Longevity: lasts quite a long time, at least half a day, as a skin scent/slight aura

product_name: Essenza di Colonia Acqua di Parma
review_content: Citrus (bergamot?). Green notes. Not as tart as assoluta. It has something fresh minty in the dry down, probably mint, patchouli or eucalyptus/camphor. I like it but my favourite in this line is Intensa.

product_name: Essenza di Colonia Acqua di Parma
review_content:
This is perfumery at its best, this is unique, high quality, artistic, and yet mass pleasing. If it wasn't too classy and sophisticated for me this would be my signature. I guess I'll have to wait a few years for that.
You do have to like floral fragrances though and especially neroli / orange blossom.

product_name: Essenza di Colonia Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Have it smells like soap I use it after the shower basically
Y

product_name: Essenza di Colonia Acqua di Parma
review_content: Incredible in hot weather - the oakmoss really works and is definitely a different scent to original Colonia. I find Colonia a much easier wear, this has a lingering harshness that i find difficult to move past any time other than in summer. Other people seem to really love it on me, but i can't shake that harshness sometimes.

product_name: Essenza di Colonia Acqua di Parma
review_content:
White Bar of Soap, period.

You gotta smell like a bar of soap. You'll be a walking soap. If that's not clean enough then i'm afraid you have to smell like germs killing liquid in hospital LOL.

I get the idea of smelling sophisticated like how it's marketed. Imagine a well put together man freshly showered and groomed ready to go to work, that's how it makes me feel when wear this fragrance. Nothing fancy, nothing too modern, nothing too flashy, just simple cleanliness.

product_name: Essenza di Colonia Acqua di Parma
review_content:
What is going on with Acqua di Parma?

Once my favorite house, I feel like they're totally dropping the ball the past few years. They're really doubling down on their endless string of fragrances showcasing a single dominating note, particularly floral notes as of late. Don't forget their exclusive Harrod's fragrance, Zafferano, that no one else gets to experience. Look at the very few reviews of these recent offerings. Hardly anyone is interested in them. They just aren't impressive. Next, spend some time on their social media. They have spent months marketing a special edition Mirto di Panarea that has been on the market for YEARS. It's a fine fragrance, I own the original, but it's not particularly interesting. It's not like the fragrance community talks about it much. Why spend months marketing a years-old fragrance that was simply repackaged in a gimmicky, new bottle? Finally, examine HOW they market their fragrances. They're constantly throwing these swanky brunches with fancy table arrangements which only the smallest percentage of the wealthy class will ever attend. Is that the target audience? Unfortunately, it seems like it. They price their fragrances exorbitantly high but you'll see them on resale websites for a TINY fraction of their retail price. $300 for Lily of the Valley? Are you out of your mind? In what world is that a $300 fragrance? People are having difficulty reselling it online for $50-60. The average person just isn't interested in AdP and won't spend much to obtain one.

I'm not sure that this will ever be read by someone at AdP, but, if so, please know that I love many AdP offerings. I own seven. Colonia is one of my favorite of my entire collection. The brand has such potential, I wish AdP would do more to tap into that potential. Please stop with the "ingredients" fragrances and build a modern successor to the legendary Colonia. Not a Colonia FLANKER, put that line to rest. Create the next iconic Italian magnum opus in perfumery for the 21st century. A new fragrance. Something that is high-quality, mass appealing, and UNIQUE. It should set trends in the fragrance world. Finally, the NUMBER ONE complaint about AdP fragrances is that they have serious performance issues. Pull out all the stops. Retain the best perfumer in the world and create a halo fragrance that silences the critics: make it project and make it last. AdP was once at the top of the fragrance world; it has all the potential to be there once again if it's willing to adapt with the times, and focus less on marketing the frills of wealth and status, and more on the perfumery itself.

product_name: Essenza di Colonia Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Smells so good, but so weak. A great throw on freshy. It's worth the money at discounters or trusted sellers on Ebay. Great throw on for 2-3 hrs. Skin scent after that. Easy to wash off.
Quality and smell: 10
Performance: 3
I am buying a bottle for $60. 3.3oz. on a discounter sight

product_name: Essenza di Colonia Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Excellent performance in the +90° summer heat of Los Angeles. For under $90 for a 3.4oz bottle you can't lose having this in your summer rotation.

Very fresh, citrus, soapy overall and will keep you smelling freshly showered thru the hot day.

I'm not a fan of neroli and I dislike the smell of rose. That being said, I can instantly pick up the rose (soapy) in here but it is balanced very well with the other florals and citruses and I think that attributes to the freshly showered affect.

For those of you complaining about performance, keep in mind this is an eau de cologne concentration. It performs better than many $400 niche parfums and puts designer summer frags to shame.

+8hrs easy (8-10 sprays) you will smell this on your clothes after 24hrs. Feel free to be trigger happy @ $90/3.4oz bottle.🥂

Anyone working outdoors in the heat would appreciate the cooling and freshly clean affect this has. Construction workers, roofers, gardeners etc Essenza will keep you fresh throughout your day.

The reviewer below mentioned his personal Tom Ford Neroli Portafino head to head battle with Essenza and I would agree with his results.

Essenza stays up several hours past Tom Ford's bedtime and for the price Tom should be ashamed.

Essenza outlasts TF's Oud Wood, Lost Cherry and many other $400 frags but you get the point...

Just buy Essenza before summer ends and enjoy!

product_name: Essenza di Colonia Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Am i the only women here who thinks it’s more of a feminine sence🧐🙂.
Either way, i love love love love this perfume. Now going for the 180ml bottles only:-)
The one downside - it doesn’t last on me for long.
Yet, one of my favorite perfumes ever!

product_name: Essenza di Colonia Acqua di Parma
review_content: My first ever bottle of Acqua Di Parma and no regrets here! This is an amazing neroli fragrance. The opening boasts one of the most organic citrus combos I've ever had. It's tarty and smells like you're peeling them in front of you. Then for the middle notes its this musky neroli combo. Classic and indeed very italian gentleman. On the drydown theres a subtle rose smell, a very pleasant surprise. All in all, a 9/10. I wish to get my hands on the original Colonia sooner or later!

product_name: Essenza di Colonia Acqua di Parma
review_content: This fragrance is amazing, very clean, classy and fresh. The performances are good with an important longevity and a discrete but yet present sillage. The notes are not really divided in the classic order (opening, core and back notes), they almost appear at the same time and evolve in their own way. There are therefore differences between the spray and the dry down, but you will find a very similar scent even hours later. It is not a blind buy however. Despite being very masculine, it has nothing to do with common male fragrances that suit everyone; you have to try it to know if you love it. Colonia Essenza is worth its price (with regard to the accepted prices in the fragrance world), but it is too expansive to buy it blindly.

product_name: Essenza di Colonia Acqua di Parma
review_content: Acqua di Parma Colonia goes Miyake. This is what an Italian husband-to-be should wear at his wedding alongside a tuxedo.

product_name: Essenza di Colonia Acqua di Parma
review_content: Beautiful scent. Poor longevity (3-4h).

product_name: Essenza di Colonia Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Today's scent experiment. Wore Tom Ford Nerolia Portofino on one hand and Colonia Essenza on the other. While both are Neroli fresh scents they do not smell that much alike. The TFNP has a softer more floral opening of neroli where CE has more of the lemon and brighter opening. TFNP I think stays very linear but projectes for maybe an hour and quickly becomes a skin scent lasting maybe 5 hours max. CE projected a bit more loudly and I can still smell it as a stronger skin scent 6 hours later. The drydowns are different. TFNP is more floral again very linear and almost leaning a tad to the femine side although no issues with guys wearing this. CE I see as more masculine leaning. CE has a bit more barbershop feel as it drys down and I think the vetiver is more pronounced.
Overall - I think CE is a great smelling cologne and for the price is outstanding. TFNP is also great smelling but waaaay overpriced for a summer freshie. CE I think can be worn year round.

product_name: Essenza di Colonia Acqua di Parma
review_content:
The fragrance which blew me away the first time I smelled it. It's the fragrance which makes my eyes roll in my head when I sniff the atomizer. It's the fragrance that paints a picture in my head, a picture of spring, childhood, fresh linen, hapiness. For me it's a smell of nostalgia. It smells very familiar, like something I smelled in the past butI can't point my finger on what it was.

It's a very fresh, citrusy, uplifting scent. It smells quite elegant but I don't care. I weare it with jeans and t-shirt. It's too beautiful of a scent for me not to wear it, but i'm not going to dress up for it.

I am very much satisfied with the performance of Essenza. I wear it to the office, it last on me 8 hours easily. I think it's a perfect fit for spring. In the summer it needs to cut back on the number of sprays. Otherwise it becomes an annoying, headache inducing scent with a vibe of an insect repellant.

product_name: Essenza di Colonia Acqua di Parma
review_content: One of the few scents that smells incredibly different on my skin. Acceptably pleasant on tester strips and clothing, but after dry down on my skin it begins to give off a mysterious odor I can only describe as old lady-ish...

product_name: Essenza di Colonia Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Right- time to get down to it.

This - For the gents hanging out- pubs, lunches, a wedding, a meeting - unbeatable.
I would describe it as old school barbershop turned up to 11!

The citrus opening is so natrual and fresh it's just TOO much for some modern noses to handle- I simply don't understand how everyone seems to prefer the synthetic smelling lemon these days- beggars belief.

It turns into a herby soapy smell which lingers for a while but this is a simple day time cologne - I usually spray the hell out of this to make it last longer - it's not a bright and fleeting as the original Colonia though and is more musky for sure. Just love the stuff.

My absolute favourite smell I've come across so far.

For the Ladies? Antiquated for the most part - but if you're wearing it for them you are doing the wrong thing- maybe some tasteful ladies will like it, however this is not a 'sexy man' smell compared to others- it's a grown man's smell. proper vintage cologne style. Ideal if you like wearing a mackkintosh jacket - blazers, you like italian coffee shops, restaurants and a decent bottle of red.

This smell is for godfather dons only! Needless to say it's classy as hell- shamelessly confident.
Italian masters roll up.

10/10 Genius.

product_name: Essenza di Colonia Acqua di Parma
review_content: Summer Kouros. Beautiful but an old person smell. Even more than Kouros.

product_name: Essenza di Colonia Acqua di Parma
review_content:
Colonia Essenza is complexly layered with many aromatic notes, and with white florals over the citrus. This is the rare fragrance where the dryness of neroli (rarely one of my favorite notes) is beautifully balanced with enough juicier notes (bergamot , orange, grapefruit and petitgrain) that it doesn't seem too parched.

There's a kind of density in this I'm unable to explain entirely--it's a darker fragrance than the note pyramid would suggest. This is an especially sophisticated and oddly masculine summer scent.

UPDATE 9/20/22: I liked this so much when I tried it in Stockholm this last summer I bought a split of it online--it is so lovely! This is much more mature and elegant than most other citrus summer scents I use. This really makes me feel special, and when the split is used up I'll buy a full bottle. It is THAT good!

product_name: Essenza di Colonia Acqua di Parma
review_content: Wow. After searching for a replacement for the fragrance of my childhood, my fathers bottle of original Armani Eau Pour Homme, and being disappointed by the intense warm orange of the reformulation, this is it. Opening up this is an almost unbearable punch of citrus, which will burn your nosehairs for about 20 seconds. After that it becomes just the most beautiful, aromatic, flowery citrus summer scent ive ever smelt. The neroli and bergamot are an unmatched combination. This is unfortunately plagued with a lack of performance. Still, a must have for any citrus lover.
